column1: 1&When choosing a place to live, what do you consider most important: location, size, style, number of rooms, type of rooms, or other features. Use reasons and specific examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>When choosing a place to live, there are a number of factors which is considered to be important, among them, I think it is most critical to evaluate the location, size and payment when choosing a place to live.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, It is important to have suitable location.</MI1> <SI1>Bad locations such as having a loud neighbors will certainly make my life unpleasure, and also, having a long commutes to my workplave will probably make me feel irritable day by day.</SI1></BO1> <BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, It is important to have adequate size of the place.</MI2> <SI2>A shortage in having a space to put my necessities will surely cause waste of time. also, with a small space I can;t feel comfortable when taking a rest.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Finally,</TR> It is important to have an affordable rent pay.</MI3> <SI3><EX3><TR> For example</TR>, If my income is 2,000 dollars a month, it is such a nightmare for me to pay 800 dollars for rent per month.</EX3></SI3></BO3><CO>In conclusion, Although ther are a number of factors to be considered important, when choosing a place to live, <TR>however</TR>, most important factors for me is a suitable location, adequate size and an affordable payment.</CO>
column23: This is a great start. Your essay is very well organized and your main ideas are good. Now you just need to add more to your supporting arguments and your introduction. Keep in mind that a paragraph is generally 4-7 sentences altogether.

column1: 2&What are some of the qualities of a good parent? Use specific details and examples to explain your answer.
column23: Your thesis statement needs to be stronger, and you should delete your third "paragraph" - you don't need it. You should add a lot more to your two main paragraphs. Can you give more examples and support to your ideas? Finally, I think you mean "give birth to a baby."

column1: 3&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Television has destroyed communication among friends and family. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>Today, people spent their rest time for watching TV that shows many interesting programs, such as a comedy show, drama and game show. <TS>It is normally accepted that television interrupts the communication between family. I also assent with that opinion, since the time that family can talk with each other is limited, but they spent it by watching TV. Another bad effect of television on communication is that it can make people passive.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>In a research, people watch TV for 2 or more hours a day, and it reduces the time to speak with family.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>In my case</TR>, I go to school in the early morning, and come back home at 7 p.m. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I can talk with family for only 3 or 4 hours a day. <TR>Of course</TR>, the TV program is fun and interesting. So they concentrate on TV without saying any word. After watching TV, it is time to go to bed. If I didn¡¯t watch TV, I could speak with my family.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2>Some people say that the television is the foolish box. <MI2>It doesn¡¯t let people think when they watch TV.</MI2> <SI1>The meaning of communication is to speak his own mind and understand other¡¯s one. <TR>However</TR>, it is easy to get a information from television, so it disturbs people to think what is the important thing. They just obtain the information from television and follow. <TR>Finally</TR>, watching TV is helpless to communicate with family.</SI2></BO2><CO>I think that watching TV interrupt the communication between family with these two reasons; reducing the time to talk with family and making people passive. There is nothing that is more efficient than communication for knowing how I am loved and understanding other¡¯s mind. <TR>Therefore</TR>, we must release the time for watching TV and increase one for speaking with family.</CO>
column23: You are on the right track. You need to shorten your thesis statement into one strong sentence. Your main paragraphs could use a little more content. Finally, your second main paragraph is missing a main point. I think I found it in the thesis statement.

column1: 4&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Attending a live performance (for example, a play, concert, or sporting event) is more enjoyable than watching the same event on television. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>On weekend, many people watch TV for showing a baseball game, a basket ball game or a concert. Someone prefers playing sports or singing by himself to staying indoors. <TS>Both doing by myself and watching TV can reduce our stress, but It is more interesting to do a live performance than watch it on television. </TS>From now on, I would like to explain why I think so.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, playing something can enjoy with others who play or prepare it with me.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>For example,</TR> when I was a freshman, I did a play. I and my friends prepared for two months, and, during preparing the play, made deeper relationship. After finishing the play, I could feel that we were all of one mind. It cannot feel by watching a play on television.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, I can enjoy the feeling that I did something by myself.</MI2> <SI2>As I watch on TV that someone climbs a mountain, it is not my own experience or work. As he stands up on the top of the mountain, I sit down on a chair. Doing by myself is another important factor for enjoying my life.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>At the conclusion</TR>, I prefer doing a live performance to watching it on television, because attending something can share the enjoyment with others and I can feel that I achieve it by myself. Although, I am not good at playing any sports, I can enjoy the good feeling with a sweat.</CO>
column23: This essay is supposed to be about going to a concert or a play rather than watching on on televsion, not about doing other activities instead. Think about this and try again. Would you rather go to a concert or watch one on TV?

column1: 5&Neighbors are the people who live near us. In your opinion, what are the qualities of a good neighbor? Use specific details and examples in your answer.
column3: <IN>We meet many people every day. Among them, neighbors are very special because they live near the place where we live. So it is worthwhile to think of the qualities of good neighbors. <TS>I think good neighbors are those who are not only as comfortable as friends but also those who can support necessary things to others like a family.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, good neighbors are those who are very comfortable as friends.</MI1> <SI1>Although we all have friends, it is not easy to have friends live near us. If we can make our neighbors friends, we might have many friends near us. Then we will be able to gain concerns and helps if needed.</SI1> </BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, good neighbors are those who can support each other as a family.</MI2> <SI2>Because our families are nuclear families nowadays, it is not easy go get the love of grandchildren in the case of grandparents and vice versa. <TR>Furthermore</TR>, because both father and mother usually go out and work nowadays, children lack the love of parents. Good neighbors can compensate these needs of love because they might support each other as a family.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, good neighbors are those who are not only as comfortable as friends but also those who can support necessary things of others like a family. Because many people live in cities and move so frequently, it is not even easy to know the face of our neighbors. So we all have to remind the meaning of good neighbors.</CO>
column23: You have a good essay here. You can make it better by adding examples and research to your two main paragraphs.

column1: 6&What do you consider to be the most important room in a house? Why is this room more important to you than any other room? Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>There are kind of rooms in a house, such as a bath room, a living room. <TS><TR>In my opinion</TR>, a dining room is the most important room out of them. I have some reasons to support my idea.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, a dining room is a place where family members can talk each other and relax having a great time.</MI1> <SI1>Because family usually comes together in a dining room which has a sofa, a television, etc. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, my family usually spend a lot time in a dining room when we are at home, especially after mealtime. Through this time, we are able to understand each other more deeply and make a family atmosphere.</EX> I would like to mention that the most important function of room which is in a house is how much it can help to improve relations between family members. Because a house is where family lives together.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, a dining room is where I can enjoy watching a television and exercise.</MI2> <SI2><EX> In my house, most of household utensils are in the dining room such as TV, running machine, a video tape recorder.</EX> So to me, a dining room is the most important room to have a fun time in the house.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>As I have mentioned above</TR>, a dining room is more important than any other room. Because I can not only have a great time with my family but also use some goods for fun. I want to make the dining room more conveniently and nicely.</CO>
column23: This is a pretty good essay, but I think in your case you could call it the main room. Usually a dining room doesn't have a sofa in it, so it was confusing to read that... I'm guessing that your living room and dining room are the same place? In that case, it will be clearer if you just call it a main room.

column1: 7&Some people eat at home while others eat at restaurants. Where you would eat and why?
column3: <IN>Modern ear trains the people's life style which is the job and food to change it more rapidly and variously than before. The most change is the people's food style. Some people prefer to eat at food stands or resraurants, and other people prefer to prepare and eat food at home. <TS>Although both food styles have advantages and disadvantages for saving time. In my case, I prefer tp eat at outside.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>When having a meal at home, I can eat good food, clean and health, more than eating food at outside.</MI1> <SI1>In spit of thesepoints, this food style has a week point, spending too much time. besides, this way is inconvenience. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, I have to buy food stuff and cook of my own doing, before having a meal.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>However</TR>, When eating food at food stands or reataurants, I can save time.</MI2> <SI2>This food style does not needed to waste time; I can use much time to do my work. <TR>In addition</TR> to, I can conveniently eat the wide ranges of foods.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3>The other point is that I can reserve and take out food at these places.</MI2> <SI2>These mothods are really helped to save the invaluable time, when I am busy doing my business. </SI2></BO3><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, eating food at outside has the advantage whis I mentioned. It goes without saying that I can save much more time than having a meal at home. Though home made food has a strong point, clean foods and health, I prefer to eat at outside for savig time.</CO>
column23: You need to do some work on this essay. Some of it does not make sense (what do you mean by modern ear?) and there are some simple grammatical errors that a little editing would easily fix. You need to add a LOT more to your main essays, especially the second and third main paragraphs. Your first main paragraph is confusing. Are you arguing for or against eating at home? Reorganize this essay and try again.

column1: 8&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use spesfic reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Some people say that parents are most influnced people to their children. In some case, it is right but that does not mean parents are the best teachers. <TS>I know that parents are important but they are ones of instrucuors in life same as other ones: friends, school teacher, mascom and so on. I will reveal some reasons.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>At first</TR>, parents are more sensitive to their children than any other people.</MI1> <SI1>Because they love their children so much, in many cases they seemed to act by emotion not by reason. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, parents apt to talk to their children to study hard because almost parents want their children to get a better life.</EX> <TR>However</TR> sometimes it is not good for children to find their right way. Because every human has their own gift, it is most important thing to consultant right.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, people can learn many things from others.</MI2> <SI2>Many friends, teachers and mass-communication help young people get useful information and tips. Because of the age gap between parents and children, daughter and son maybe lost something like new technology, fashion and so on. <TR>Also</TR>, there are abvious limit to get many things only from parents in this morden and broden world.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I belive that any parents can not the best teachers to their children. Parents would have exaggereated emotion to their children and they also can not cover all things to teach. Even though parents have full affect and trust to their children, it is not enough to be a reasonable teatcher to their little students. In these reason, it would be not good to belive parents are the best teachers.</CO>
column23: This essay is all right. I think you could use more examples. Your main argument needs to be strengthened a bit.

column1: 9&Many people visit the museums when they travel to new places Why do you think people visit museum? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>We can find museums whenever we take a trip to a new place. When people find a museum, most of them don't go pass through it. <TR>In other words</TR>, many peplo plan to go to famous museums in a city where they travel. Maybe people has many indivisual reasons to visit a museum. <TS>I think it is because that museums have valuable works and colletions and we have opportunity to experience different culture.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>FIrst</TR>, generally we know a museum is a place to collect a variety of valuable records, which are, <TR>for example</TR>, very famous pictures, sculptures, fossils and so on.</MI1> <SI1>We can enjoy seeing them directly and feel more impressive than only in photos. <EX.<TR>For example</TR>, When I traveled to France, I visited Rouvre Mseum in Paris. I was very excited to see very famous works to have learned in pictures of textbooks. Whem I standed in front of the Monariza, I cannnot help amazing and was stuck dump. It is much bigger than photo and lots of more magnificent. I can't experience the sympathy through a photo.</EX> Like that, real works allow us to feel more vivid and lively. I think people visit museums to experience this feeling when they take a trip to new place.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, all meseums don't have only very famous collections.</MI2> <SI2>A lot of museums own collections to indicate characteristic of their city. When we visit a city of foreign countries, we notice that they are very different from our country. <TR>In general</TR>, we say it is exotic. <EX>Last year, I visited Darwin, which is a city in Australia and remain Aborigins, native Ausrailians. First day, when I saw one native Austrilan, I was afraid of him and I didn't understand their feature. <TR>However</TR>, I had a chance to go to museum about Aboriginals in the city, and I could understand their features and was interested their cultures though the way of their living was different from ours. I still remember my special experience with them in Darwin.</EX></SI2> </BO2><CO><TR>In the conclusion</TR>, It is very imprtant and essential to visit museum when we travel to other countrys. It is because that pople can appreciate valuable arts and colletion directly and experience different culteres. I think these encourage peple to visit museum in other cities.</CO>
column23: A very good essay! Make sure to check the English spelling of things (ex. Louvre, Mona Lisa).

column1: 10&Do you agree or disagree with following statement? Universities should give same amount of money to their students¡¯ sports activities as they give to their university libraries. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>Many people seems to believe that Universities should give same amount of money to their students¡¯ sports activities as they give to their university libraries. The common belief, <TR>however</TR>, has several critical flaws. <TS>In this essay, I will demonstrate why supporting ¡°Universities should give more amount of money to their university libraries than sports activities¡± is acceptable and should be praised for two following reasons. ; first, students spending more time at the library ; the limit of students in the sport department</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, university students spend more time in studying at the library than in doing sports activities.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>For example</TR> when I was a university student, I mostly prepared for a career to get a good job at the library. But I rarely used sports activity facilities. Because job market was very competitive in South Korea, there was no time to enjoy sports activities.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, the student involved in the athletic department are limited.</MI2> <SI2>Only qualifying students get on a sports team in my university and they always occupied a gymnasium. Therefore I didn¡¯t benefit from the money given to the sports program. Libraries, on the other hand, are a resource that can be enjoyed by all students.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, today most students are very busy in increasing their knowledge and only talented students make a team to use sports facilities. Thus universities should invest more amount of money in their university libraries than they invest in their students¡¯ sports activities</CO>
column23: You have the start of a very good essay here. Your main ideas are excellent! Can you add some more to your supporting ideas?

column1: 11&Some people prefer to eat at food stands or restaurants. Other people prefer to prepare and eat food at home. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Recently, I read the news about going out to eat. The article says that 40 % of middle-class family eat at restaurants three times ore more a week. Eating out is comfortable and provides us various kinds of food. Therefore some people like to eat at food stands or restaurants. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I like to prepare food and eat at home, because the meal which I prepare at home is more economical and clean.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>First, eating at home is more economical than going out to eat.</MI1> <SI1>The food in a restaurant is more expensive than the meal prepared at home. <EX>Three weeks ago, I went to the restaurant near my house, because of a power failure. I ordered a boiled rice with assorted mixtures. It cost 3,500 won (about $3). I can make the same dish in my house at about 1,500 won (about $1.25) or less. The difference between two prices is about $1.75. It is a big money to students like me.</EX> <TR>Moreover</TR>, I can eat at home quickly. I have to study a lot, I do not have enough time to go to eat out. It is required about 60 minutes to eat at restaurant, because there in no nice restaurant near my house. I can save the money and time by eating at home.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Second, preparing the meal at home is sanitary.</MI2> <SI2>I can cook food very clean. In some restaurant, chef prepare sometimes the meal unclean and the tables, dishes and spoons are dirty. <EX>When I was sick, I went to the restaurant near my university. I startle at my food, because there is a cockroach in it. After seeing it, I never go to that restaurant.</EX> <TR>However,</TR> at home, the meal which I prepare is for me. <TR>Therefore</TR> I have no choice but to make it clean.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>As I mentioned above</TR>, eating and preparing food at home is more economical and sanitary than eating at food stands or restaurants. It cost little money, takes short time, and is clean. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I like to prepare and eat food at home.</CO>
column23: A very good essay! I think you can make the first main paragraph into two paragraphs because you are discussing two ideas (1. Eating at home is cheaper; 2. Eating at home is faster). Take the "however" out of your thesis statement and it will be perfect!

column1: 12&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>I think that teaching is a guidance and real guidance comes from experinces in a life and knowledge about someone. <TS><TR>For this reason</TR>, <TR>in my case</TR>, I agree that my parents are the best teachers for me because I want to be guided by a person who have valuable experiences of their life and have exact knowlege of my life. Only my parents can do the right job.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Above all</TR>, my parents have valuable experiences of their life than I have.</MI1> <SI1>I want to get the core value of my parents' experiences because there might be a treasure that I have never catched. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, when I was a soldier, I really aware that real valuable experiences can be given only to the people who endure some difficulities and endeaver to find the right answer for that. Although the service was only one valuable experience that I have ever had, my parents passed through so much painful time as difficult as my time.</EX> <TR>To clarify</TR>, I belive that there will be the treasure. <TR>Thus</TR>, if I cannot hear about my parents' experiences, I would lost the treasure and be disturbed by finding right answer for my difficulties all my life.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Next</TR>, my parents have exact knowledge of my life than others have.</MI2> <SI2><TR>On the whole</TR>, most of people spend so much time with family. <TR>Particularly</TR>, parents were the only people who share much time with them from birth to right now. So, parents know about their sons and doughters better than others. <EX>In the case of my parents, they see what I want to do and where I want to go at any time. <TR>In addition</TR>, my parents would give me the best direction that they can figure, when I don't know what is right way. <TR>For instance</TR>, I used to smoke heavy in my school life and stop it. In that time, my parents suggest to abstain the habit because they know what would be happen to me after long time and I followed the guidance.</EX> <TR>As like this</TR>, I want to get right direction of my parent who know me exactly. <TR>Consequently</TR>, if I cannot walk with my parents' proper help based on the exact knowledge of me, I might always be on a wrong way.</BO2> <CO><TR>As a conclusion</TR>, I think that my parents are the best people who can teach me because of their experiences and knowledge. There was always the best way for me whenever I had been directed by my parents. So, I believe that they will be my right guidance during my whole life without any doubt.</CO>
column23: Your essay would be stronger if you removed some transitions. You are using them too often, especially in your thesis statement. Your main points are ok, but your support needs to be more on-topic. Your first example about being a soldier doesn't really have anything to do with your parents. Tell me about a time you heard a story about your parents' life and used it in your life. Your second main paragraph is better, but it doesn't really convince me. Anyone could tell you that smoking is bad for your health.

column1: 13&The twentieth century saw great change. In tour opinion, what is one change that should be remembered about the twentieth century? Use specific reasons and details to explain your choice.
column3: <IN>It is obvious that 20th century¡¯s changes greatly influence our lives. There can be diverse changes considered the most important. The opinion varies according to personal viewpoint. <TS><TR>But, in my view</TR>, I think computerizing is the most significant change. There are two reasons : saving time and effort.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Most of all</TR>, computers saves the time of many people.</MI1> <SI1><TR> As a matter of fact</TR>, It has been more faster to do the work since computer was firstly used to our lives. So, human beings obtain extra time to expend freely. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, I had to write a final paper last semester. But, I was supposed to look for a reference book because the topic of paper was very unacquainted for me. While I suffered to find reference book, my friend enjoyed playing computer game. He finished the paper by Internet searching. In this experience, I learned that using a computer help to save time.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, people decrease endeavor by utilizing computer.</MI2> <SI2><TR>In other words</TR>, it is easy that doing work by computer. <TR>Generally</TR>, computer accomplishes many tasks instead of human being in a lot of realm such as banking, administration, and so on. <TR>For instance</TR>, in case you have to do a gigantic amount of accounting, it spends very long time to complete the work by your hand whereas computer accomplishes the work for only some minutes. From this case, I think computer diminishes the time of doing a task.</SI2></BO2> <CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, everyone has different ideas. <TR>However</TR>, I believe computerizing is most considerable change. <TR>Firstly</TR>, people procure extra time to use computer. <TR>Besides</TR>, computer makes your task easy. <TR>Therefore</TR>, it is no exaggeration to say that computerizing is one of the twentieth most important changes having the biggest influence on our lives.</CO>
column23: This is a very good essay. Try not to use so many transitions, especially in your thesis statement. The thesis statement should be able to stand on its own.

column1: 14&Do you agree with the statement that Parents are best teachers?
column3: <IN>In asian countries, people believe that the attitudes of parents during pregnancy effect on the character of baby who will be born. So, many of fathers stop smoking and drinking when their wife is in pregnancy. I'm not sure that this belief is true but I agree that the basement of this belief that the attitudes of parents effect on their children. <TS>I think that parent is the most important teacher to their children.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>Most of characters of man is established when he is very young. So childrens in age of 0~10 have to be educated very carefully.</MI1> <SI1>As you know the children in age 0~7 can't enter the school and they usually spend most of their time at home with their parents. So, parents have the great responsibility to establish the characters of their children.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore</TR>, in school or kindergarten, child is taught with many of his colleague.</MI2> <SI2>Teacher can't give full concentration for one of his students. Only his parents take care of their child fully.</SI2></BO2><CO>I think that the impact of the teaching is highly related with the intensity of careness. <TR>So<TR/> I conclude that only parents can be the best teacher to their children.</CO>
column23: Everything about your essay is pretty good except the weakness of your argument. This is the most important part, so do not neglect it. Your main points are so general and your supporting arguments are so short that it makes your essay less than convincing. Come up with examples, research, and some more compelling things to say.

column1: 15&The twentieth century saw great change. In tour opinion, what is one change that should be remembered about the twentieth century? Use specific reasons and details to explain your choice.
column3: <IN>There are many great changes of our lives in the twentieth century. Some people get a idea of the revolutionary technology, others remember the breakdown of wars.<TS><TR> In my case</TR>, the invention of internet is the most marvelous thing, because we can get plenty of information and communicate with each other very quickly.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, the internet helps us to obtain lots of information and knowledge.</MI1> <SI1><EX>Seven years ago, I had to seek an encyclopedia to do my homework. It takes a lot of time. If the information of an encyclopedia is not sufficient, I had to search other books. <TR>However</TR>, nowadays, I only click the mouse to get information on the internet.</EX> Internet is very well developed for searching the information. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, I can see the picture of Statue of Liberty, have some knowledge of foreign language on internet.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, we can communicate to other people very quickly.</MI2> <SI2><EX>Before inventing the internet, I had two ways of communicating: by mail and telephone.</EX> Communicating by mail is required a few days or more than a month. It takes lots of money to contact by telephone. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, it cost one dollar to call from Korea to U.S.. <TR>However,</TR> I can communicate with internet to other country's people without any delaying time. I send a e-mail(electric mail) which is sorts of mail on internet and talk to foreign friends by tapping the keyboard.</EX> It is very easy and fast way to communicate with foreigners by using mail or telephone.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>As I mentioned above</TR>, we can get lots of information and communicate very quickly by using internet. There were many developments in the twentieth century. Among them I would like to pinpoint the developing and spreading of internet. It is a great change that should be remembered about the twentieth century.</CO>
column23: A very good essay! Nice work!

column1: 16&It is better for children to grow up in the countryside than in a big city. Do you agree or disagree? Use specific reasons and examples to develop your essay.
column3: <IN><TS>It is better for children to spend their time in a big city than in the countryside. I'm convinced that the advantages there will help the young enjoy better environments in a variety of phase. </TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, they are likey to catch more opportunities to appreciate cultural convenience.</MI1> <SI1 In a big city are various cultural places like theaters, museums and concert places. Children are able to learn and experience required things for the emotional process to an adult. All these will assist them to grow up as an emotionally complete adult. It is better known that this chance is more available in a big city than in the countryside.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, they can be given more educational competition.</MI2> <SI2>Most parents want their sons and daughters to have better education. This can be obtained in a big city because many of high-leveled schools and colleges are located there. <TR>In addtion</TR>, pupils are almost destined to get intense competition there with other excellent students. This must be easily found in a big city.</SI2></BO2> <BO3><MI3><TR>Finally</TR>, children can undergo various social styles.</MI3> <SI3>chldren may meet so many kinds of individuals in a large place. They have their own life style and our children can realize what are the advantages and disadvantages of each of them. These life instructions have the children get through wiser life based on them. The more children can learn, the wider the living place is.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>Therefore</TR>, It is a better choice to have our children to spend their time in a big city than in the countryside. There are more abundent opportunities for their education, social life and cultural life.</CO>
column23: An excellent essay! The only way it could be better would be to add some examples!

column1: 17&133. Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? A person¡¯s childhood years (the time from birth to twelve years of age) are the most important years of a person¡¯s life. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Some people believe that the most significantly important years of a person's life is adolescent time. Adolescence is the time that one grows up from a child to an adult. This is said that because people eventually think that adulthood is people's largest part of life and one person's adolescent time decides his rest of life time. <TS><TR>However</TR>, I strongly assert that one's childhood, especially the time from birth to twelve years of age is the most significant part of life in several aspects.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>One reason is that one's childhood years decide his basic ability which lasted permanently.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Particularly,</TR> this can be illustrated by his language skill. <EX>In 1993, one research which studies about human life showed that one can be native speaker until 12 years old.</EX> We can easily see some people who speaks English like native speakers because they lived in USA or England when they were under 12. Others can hardly speak like native speakers because they learned the language after 12 years, though. <TR>Also,</TR> as you know, today's world's motto is "globalization". <TR>Thus</TR>, we should be able to speak the world's language such as English and so on. If one starts to learn the world's language over 12 years, he cannot be a native speaker of that language. <TR>In addition</TR>, that will enable him not to be an international person. <TR>Therefore</TR>, he cannot succeed in the world largely.</SI2></BO1><BO2><MI2>Another reason that I claim one's childhood is the most important is because one's characteristic is strongly decided at that time.</MI2> <SI2>Some people may argue that human being's characteristic is changable through his life. But, I disagree with that opinion. "The habit of 3 years old lasted permanantly.". This is a believable probe in my country. This is true saying. <EX>The article that I read the day before yesterday said that one research demonstrated that one person's characteristic is decided when he is 3 years old. There are identical twins who were apart during the time from birth to 5 years of age. To my surprise, after 30 years from that time, they yet have totally different personality, although they have lived together for 25 years.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, I insist that one's childhood years are the most important part through his whole life because of not only his fundamental skill but also his character, lasted eternally. That is, one's childhood is the time that determine his entire life.<TR>However</TR>, while his childhood, he cannot recognize its importance. So, if you have under twelve-year-old children, you'd better take care of them more carefully than any other time. It will decide his whole life.</CO>
column23: An excellent and thorough essay!

column1: 18&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Television has destroyed communication among friends and family. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>Nowadays, television takes so much portion of our life. <TR>Furthermore</TR>, many people anxious about the disadvantage of the television and the representative of that might be a destroy of communication with our people; friends and family. <TS><TR>However,</TR> television also can do a good effect on our life, such as providing many subject for communication and providing a chance for participation with our people.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Above all</TR>, television provides many subjects among our interests.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR> For instance</TR>, among the people that I know, there could be a person who like sad romance drama or who like knowledge-based documentary program. If I make a conversation with these people, they would share their own emotion for the drama or thought for the documentary program. <TR>Consequently</TR>, our conversation would be full of many interesting subjects of each other's. <TR>Thus</TR>, the time of our sharing would be full of real enjoyment.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Next</TR>, television also provides participation in something with our friends and family.</MI2> <SI2><EX><TR>For example</TR>, there is a program for making a nice cake that all of us want to eat, the time of the program can be full of a joyful conversation and cooking with our friends or family. Naturally, somebody would say that it is too difficult to do like that because of busy life. <TR>However</TR>, if you make the time for your own enjoyment with little more efforts than now, the television program surely could give unexpected delight to you.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO><TR>As a conclusion</TR>, you can make more enjoyable communication with your people, if you make an effort to find the possibility for more desirable television-life. <TR>To clarify</TR>, if you follow my suggestion, you must find the great delights in television.<TR>As a result</TR>, you can make a conversation with your people about a science program or a music program or etc. Once you imagine the time that we can always make a conversation and participation with never ending interesting things from television, can you see a destroy of communication? I cannot see that.</CO>
column23: This essay is all right. Try to use fewer transitions. I understand your points, but the first one is stronger than the second. Have you ever actually done this (watch a cooking show with people and make the dish)? Do you know many people who do?

column1: 19& Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Television has destroyed communication among friends and family. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>Now a days, TV does important role in man's life. <EX>Accordong to one article in newspaper, Koreans usually spend 2 hours a day to watch TV.</EX> <TS>Even though TV takes 2 of 24 in daylife, TV is valuable as catalyst of communication.</TS> <IN><BO1><MI1>Among family, TV make all members of famlily get together in living room.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Now a days</TR>, in industrial society eople are very busy and they have not enough time to talk to each other. TV serve the chance to meet the family. Sometimes they are in livingroom not for just seeing TV but for spending some hours with their family.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>And among friends, I think that TV give no impact on communication with friends.</MI2> <SI2>People usually see TV when they are at home. And they usually met the friends outside home. The time spended to see TV now is the time spended to read books and to hear the music at home before. The time spended outside home is not effected by TV.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Furthermore</TR> when I firstly meet someone who I've never met before, starting conversation with famous TV program related topic is helpful to icebreak.</MI3></BO3><CO><TR>As above reasons</TR>, I think that TV has NOT destroyed communication both with friends and with family and that TV makes good impacts on communication.</CO>
column23: Your essay needs some work. Your main ideas - especially your last one - need more support. You also need to write a clear thesis statement so the reader knows how you feel about the topic. You said in your introduction that TV is an important catalyst for communication, but then you talk about how it doesn't affect your relationships. Organize your thoughts a little more.

column1: 20&When people move to another country, some of them decide to follow the customs of the new country. Others prefer to keep their own customs. Compare these two choices. Which one do you prefer? Support your answer with specific details.
column3: <IN>From time to time we are forced to meet differnt social values and customes when we immigrate to another country or go abroad to study. At this time, some people acquire the new customes to have good human relationships while others do not because they emphasize on their own values. <TS><TR>In my case</TR>, I would rather follow new customs because I like to learn new customs more quickly and compare both of them to modify our ones.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, if I follow old customs in new place, I have few chances to learn new customs.</MI1> <SI1>If I keep my old cutoms, nobody want to keep in touch with me. That is why a native already has their friends and comes to know how to live in his or her society. <TR>Therefore</TR>, if I could not change my customes, I would be outcasted in the name of a strange, prejudiced person.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, my old values system is not always right.</MI2> <SI2>As a Korean, I have my traditional cutomes which have lasted for 5,000 years. <TR>However,</TR> I don't think they are right all the time. <EX>There are many problems in my society such as political corruption, sexual abuse to a young girl and superficial kindness to foreigners who came from rich countreis and severe ignorance to them who came from poor countries.</EX> If I get chance to live a foreign country, I would like to learn another country's good customes because I want to get an idea to change our bad customs.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I think that following new systems of other countries is not a shame, but it means you are a more adaptable, flexible person. Those are also helpful in that you can have more chances to obtain new customs, overcome your shortcoming of your home town. Then, I am sure that experiencing new social values and customes can make me a much more broad-minded person.</CO>
column23: A very thoughtful essay. Great job!

column1: 21&What do you consider to be the most important room in a house? Why is this room more important to you than any other room? Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>There are kind of rooms in a house, such as a bath room, a living room. <TS><TR>In my opinion</TR>, a dining room is the most important room out of them. I have some reasons to support my idea.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, a dining room is a place where family members can talk each other and relax having a great time.</MI1> <SI1>Because family usually comes together in a dining room which has a sofa, a television, etc. <TR>For example</TR>, my family usually spend a lot time in a dining room when we are at home, especially after mealtime. Through this time, we are able to understand each other more deeply and make a family atmosphere. I would like to mention that the most important function of room which is in a house is how much it can help to improve relations between family members. Because a house is where family lives together.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, a dining room is where I can enjoy watching a television and exercise.</MI2> <SI2><EX>In my house, most of household utensils are in the dining room such as TV, running machine, a video tape recorder.</EX> So to me, a dining room is the most important room to have a fun time in the house.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>As I have mentioned above</TR>, a dining room is more important than any other room. Because I can not only have a great time with my family but also use some goods for fun. I want to make the dining room more conveniently and nicely.</CO>
column23: This is a pretty good essay, but I think in your case you could call it the main room. Usually a dining room doesn't have a sofa in it, so it was confusing to read that... I'm guessing that your living room and dining room are the same place? In that case, it will be clearer if you just call it a main room.

column1: 22&Some people like doing work by hand. others prefer using machines. which do you prefer?
column3: <IN>people have a variety of preference the way to work. some people work by hand, while, others like using machines. the choice depends on individual taste. <TS><TR>however</TR>, I personally prefer to take machine's aid rather than working with my own's hand. I have two specific reasons for my choice : more being efficient and more being precise.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>above all</TR>, working with machine is more efficient.</MI1> <SI1><TR>in fact</TR>, repeated tasks make people exhausted , tired out, worn out. people save the time for doing task by using machine which do not get tired. <EX><TR>for example</TR>, when I go to middle school, I often send a letter to my class members. I have to type the many letters. if I had have copy machine, I would have saved the time without writing each letter by hand. from this experience, I found that the present age give people the way people need not work repeated desks.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>in addition</TR>. machine are very precise.</MI2> <SI2>they do not cut the wrong way and distract by surrounding environments. today, most tasks which is dangerous and repeated excel precision that people have, <EX><TR>for example</TR>, in the operation not allowing a slight of mistake in space, human beings can accomplish landing the moon, if human had not have many computer system and spaceship, we might not have seen vivid scene of the moon.</EX> <TR>therefore</TR>, it is no exaggeration that not using machine retreat our life quality.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>in conclusion</TR>, everyone has different choice for this problem. <TR>however</TR>, I would definitely choose to my preference for two reasons. <TR>firstly</TR>, machine help worker work other businesses which machines can not operate such as person to person affair, consultant <TR>secondly</TR>, it is possible to do more exact working. <TR>therefore</TR>, it is no exaggeration to say that the work method with machine is one of the most majors to improve our business, and life.</CO>
column23: You've written a very good essay. Try to use fewer transitions - your conclusion has a few too many. Also, you don't need to go over all your points again in your conclusion.

column1: 23&People attend college or university for many different reasons (for example, new experiences, career preparation, increased knowledge). Why do you think people attend college or university? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>As the society is getting more prosper, more people want to attend college or university. They choose different majors and have different reasons. <TS>There are some reasons.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, some students want to get job that they want.</MI1> <SI1>Every people have their dream in the future. To achieve it, they need to be educated from the specialized education system such as college and university. They can learn the knowledge which they need. In short they can prepare their career.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Next</TR>, other students want to study more.</MI2> <SI2>They try to investigate and develop some fields of studying such as physics, chemistry and literature and so on. They just desire to promote and discover new laws, so they want to leave at school.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Finally</TR>, a few people do not have any reason.</MI3> <SI3>They just attend college or university. Some of them might follow their parents' opinion. <EX>In our society many people think that the scholastic ability is a important part of person. Therefore that kind of people want to get the certification of college or university to show their ability to other people.</EX></SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, every people has different reasons of this question. We can not say which reason is the best because it is the free right of person. <TR>However</TR>, when we choose the college or university, we should think why we attend there. It is important and necessary in your choice.</CO>
column23: You have a good essay started here. You need to develop your ideas some more with examples and research. Also, your introduction needs a thesis statement!

column1: 24&Some people prefer to spend most of their time alone. Others like to be with friends most of the time. Do you prefer to spend your time alone or with friends? Use specific reasons to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Generally speaking, there are two types of methods how to spend our time. One is spending time alone. The other is doing with people. Some people prefer the former because they can more concentrate on their work alone while others would like to spend their time with other peole in that they can learn a lot of things from their friends. <TS><TR>In my case</TR>, I also enjoy spending my time with my friends because I can learn social skills as well as play sports with them.</TS></IN> <BO1><MI1>The first reason why I like to be with my friends is based on having opportunities to learn social skills.</MI1> <SI1>These are important for my future life. Although I am a student now and I don't need to make money, I will get into business world after graduation. At this time, I think the most improtant things to be sucessful in my life are social skills. That is because if I have good social skills, there will be more possibilities to have a lot of good friends and business partners.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover,</TR> I am favor of playing sports with frineds.</MI2> <SI2>As you know sports plays important roles of improve our health. Some people assert that you can walk and run for enhancing your health. <TR>However</TR>, I would rather play with my friends because I can be more exited when I match games with another team.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>For these reasons</TR>, I want to get along my frineds. Though, some people could say that I need to study harder than now. I think how to have good human relationship and good health are also important for my long term life.</CO>
column23: Your second main paragraph could use some work. It is a little off-topic. Could you rephrase it so that it is directly related to why you like to spend time with friends?

column1: 25&Music tells us something about a culture. What does the music of your country reveal about the culture of your country? Use reasons and specific examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>As you know, the music of a nation is different from other nations'. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, if you are an Asian and listen to a African music, you might be unfamiliar with the mood of the country's songs which are different from your country's.</EX> It is also true for all of them who listen to other country's music. The unfamilar mood largely comes from the difference between two countries' culture. <TR>Thus</TR>, it can be true that a music naturally contains cultural things of the nation. <TS><TR>Similarly,</TR> in the case of my country, Korea, musics reveal the cultural things of my country ; love, enjoyment and resistance.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>Among all of nations in the world, the main theme of music might be "love".</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>Similarly</TR>, my country also have a number of love songs. Once you count up the number of love songs in my country's current pops, you could find that one of three musics would sing for love. In addtion to current pops, there also have been a number of representative traditional love songs, like "Arirang", "Sarangga" and etc. Whether or not the mood of the songs is sad, the old songs have been sung by people popularly for a long time. <TR>Consequently</TR>, you can feel about the mood of love of the people who live in my country, if you listen to my country's music.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Futhermore,</TR> you can also feel the enjoyment of a life.</MI2> <SI2><TR>Traditionally</TR>, the people in my country have been thinking that the enjoyment of his/her life is the most important thing. The people's enjoyment have been commonly revealed by music and the words and rhythms of the song commonly show the thought; "Enjoy yourself in your life". <EX><TR>To illustrate</TR>, there have been a traditional song and the words of that means "Let's enjoy. let's enjoy when we are young. If you become old, you would not enjoy your life like now. So, let's enjoy. let's enjoy."</EX> As like this, you can feel about real enjoyment of life, if you listen to my country's music.</SI2></BO2><BO3>In the 1970's, our country is not a democratic nation. <MI3>The suppressive and autocratic governing make most people to resist government.</MI3> <SI3><EX>In that time, a great number of songs were sung , which were named as "Minjung Gayo", meant the songs about a desire of democracy. By the resistive chracteristic of the songs, government strongly inhibited some of those songs from people. </EX>After my country became a democratic government, the songs were releaved but are not commonly sing by people anymore. <TR>However,</TR> the underlying thought of current songs still contains the mood of resistance of the period.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>For an age</TR>, the people of my country have been revealing about love, enjoyment and resistance through musics. <TR>However</TR>, no matter what is the main theme of the songs, they congenitally like to sing a song in their daily life. <TR>Thus</TR>, it is rather natural for someone to feel the culture of my country after listening musics of that. Also can you feel about my country, once you listen to the music of my country.</CO>
column23: An excellent, insightful essay. Good work!

column1: 26&It has recently been announced that a new restaurant may be built in your neighborhood. Do you support or oppose this plan ? Why? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>I welcome it if new restaurant is built near my hometown. Because good restaurant gives a peculiar mood and enjoyment to us and I love it very much.</TS></IN><BO1>My home town have few restaurant. It has only apartment and dull road which give a feeling of boring. <SI1><EX>So I used to visit distant restaurant to have a special feeling. But, a famous and good restaurant is located distantly from my town and then I have trouble to visit it. It needs a lot of money and time to get there.</EX><TR>Thus</TR>, if it is built near, people in my hometown can use it more easily and more often. It means that people who can¡¯t often eat in restaurant because of time and inaccessibility can spend their time in restaurant more easily.</SI1><MI1>It will give many people in town enjoyment, refreshment and leisureness.</MI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>New built-in restaurants give a particular view of my town.</MI2> <SI2>Many restaurants have a nice appearance. In most case, they put their mascot in front of their front door to attract children or they give a romantic mood for lovers or they might give a comfortable or soft mood for family. Their appearance, interior and mood will change an atmosphere of my town. Is there anyone who live inside a square-shape buildings , apartments and parking lots?</SI2></BO2><CO>The more rapidly a society changes, The busier our life becomes. The view of town is also changing according to functional viewpoint, not aesthetic. We don¡¯t have a special place near for refreshing to be a source for more work later . If a restaurant is built near, town will be look more attractively and we have a good place for refreshing.</CO>
column23: Your essay has potential, but it needs to be reorganized. I found a thesis statement, but it is in the conclusion. Move it to your introduction. Also, in your main paragraphs your main idea should be stated first, not last. Work on this a little more and it will be a good essay.

column1: 27&People attend college or university for many different reasons (for example, new experiences, career preparation, increased knowledge). Why do you think people attend college or university? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>People who apply to college or university might have various reasons, such as career preparation for a job, new experience, etc. It is hard to say in a word which reason could explain this issue more detail. <TS><TR>However</TR>, it seems that increasing number of high-school student want to enter college or university to obtain a better job, <TR>actually</TR>.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, attending university is very expensive investment in terms of either time or money.</MI1> <SI1>If someone enters college or university for pure academic purpose, it will be very luxury time & money spending in this capitalistic economy. <EX><TR>According to my experience</TR>, only few students who have affluent parents or have very strong enthusiasm on academic study would enter college for that purpose.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, evaluating a college or university, most researchers regard percentage of employment as important standard of good school.</MI2> <SI2>That is to say, students tend to choose college by percentage of employment.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, some opponents argued that many students enter university with pure enthusiasm for academy. Their argument has a reliable reason. <TR>However</TR>, in capitalistic economy, there is no investment without returns. Most students could expect their better society position by investing money and time on their college education. That¡¯s why many students are attending college and university.</CO>
column23: Your conclusion is very well written, but the rest of your essay needs a lot of work. Your first main paragraph doesn't have anything to do with your thesis statement. You need to follow one line of thought. Your second main paragraph needs a LOT more explanation. Finally, you have a transition at each end of your thesis statement. You would do well to take them both out.

column1: 28&A friend of yours has received some money and plans to use all of it either to go on vacation or to buy a car. Your friend has asked you for advice. Compare your friend's two choices and explain which one you think your friend should choose. Use specific reasons and details to support your choice.
column3: <IN>If my friend asks me advice on which he would choose between to go on a vacation and to buy a car, I will weigh the advantages of each choice and we will discuss both cases. To go on a vacation will bring him great relaxation and new experiences, <TR>however</TR> to buy a car means that he will have a convenient transportation method and an economic value. <TS>I would recommend that he would go on vacation.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>On one hand</TR>, to go on vacation will give him refreshment and precious experience.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Nowadays,</TR> we are piled with tasks to do and daily life and take a rest. Going on vacation to escape from busy and harsh reality is one of the most preferred options for people. During vacation, he can have both physical and mental refreshment, and these relaxations will heal his tired body and mind. Being away from city life will also permit him to have better chances to change the way of thinking. He will review his past and current works, and future schedules from different points of view. It might lead him to new ways, conclusions, and plans that he has missed and wanted to find. In addition, during vacation, he may go many, probably new, places where he has wanted to go. In those places, he can feel and learn many things that he did not have yet and meet many people and make new friends. By enlarging his experiences, he can broaden the area of thinking. Though relaxation earned from vacation, he can return to his work with more enthusiasm. The new experiences will be great asset for his future.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI1></TR>On the other hand</TR>, having a car means that he can feel convenience to move and owns an economic value.</MI2> <SI2>To own a car will help him move quickly and easily. His new car will bring him any place where he wants to go with speed. <TR>In general</TR>, it takes much time to use public transportation system than to use his own car because he should wait and transit buses and/or subways. He might save some time that comes from speedy movement of his new car. He would make better use of these earned times to his work and leisure. Also, he would feel comfortable to use his own car. The public transportation system is generally overcrowded, and loud. When we use it, we may need to check its arrival and departure time, and wait for a while. His new car will take off these inconveniences. <TR>In addition</TR>, by possessing a car, he will have an economic value. If he would have a financial problem, he can make a lot of money to dispose his car.</S2></BO2><CO>To go on vacation will give him sweet refreshment and enlarge his experience. To have a new car will give him a convenient transportation method and commercial value. I would recommend that he would go on vacation because having and running own car needs additional expenses including taxes, gasoline, and insurance bills. He may, also, face the parking problem. I believe the refreshment and broad experience, especially in his youth, is the most precious thing.</CO>
column23: A really excellent essay! Good work!

column1: 29&Some people prefer to eat at food stands or restaurants. Other people prefer to prepare and eat food at home. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Even though there are some advantages to have a meal at home, many people would like to eat outside. <TS>I also prefer to eat in restaurant many times because of it`s effience, diversity, refreshing and convenience. I will demonstrate some reasons and couple of examples.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Most of all</TR>, I can save the time.</MI1> <SI1>Because each employe has their own position in restaurant, the all process of meal :making, surving, setting and washing is very fast. <TR>In contrast</TR>, because my mom make all process, it takes more times to have a meal at home than in restaurant.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, I can taste so many kinds of food.</MI2> <SI2>I can choose many foods even though it maybe come from India because there are so many kinds of restaurants from many countries. <TR>However</TR>, if my mom is very good at cook, I can not taste 100 kinds of cuisines.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Third</TR>, I can feel fresh.</MI3> <SI3>Everybody would be bored of everyday same thing and everyday familliar food. When the rutin is killing me, I eat new type of food then my condition is better than before.</SI3></BO3><BO4><MI4><TR>Finally</TR>, I can eat so convenient.</MI4> <SI4>Especially Korean meal is so complexed and needed so many kinds of skill in making. Therefore at some times like I fell so tired, I want to have a meal not using my hands. To eat in restaurant help me so conviently because I only go there, eat food and go out.</SI4></BO4> <CO><TR>Actually</TR>, there will be some good points in eating at home. <TR>However</TR>, when I have a meal outside, I can save my time, get some variaties about foods, refresh my condition and eat so efficiently. <TR>For these reasons</TR>, I prefer eating in restaurant to eating at home.</CO>
column23: Your essay is really well done! One note: in the third main paragraph, I think you mean that eating out makes you feel refreshed, not fresh.

column1: 30&Learning about the past has no value for those of us living in the present. Do you agree or disagree? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>I disagree with the proposition that the past has no value for those of us living in the present. History is the record of how our ancesters struggled to exsist through ages. <TR>Thus without knowing it</TR>, not only can't we identify what kind of people we actually are but can't predict what our future will be and how to prepare for it.</TS></IN><BO1><SI1><EX><TR>For example</TR>, it is difficult to understand and find the key to solution of ongoing conflict between Israel and its Islamic neighbor, Palestine, not knowing of World War ¥±. And the tragedy of division of the Korean Peninsula also can't be understood, if one is not well aware that two Koreas had weaved their ways as a single nation since 676 A.D.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><TR>In addition</TR>, It can be told that the democracy and the capitalism which we are enjoying nowadays are the products of human intelligence, endeavoring to overcome the oppression of tyrants and the inefficiency of feuderalism on the bases of the reflection of the past.</BO2><CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, History is a kind of mirror, which reflects what we are and what will our future be as well as what our past was. <TR>Thus</TR> without learning the past, we can't expect a better tomorrow of ourselves.</CO>
column23: You need to focus on making a clear argument in your essay. Your first main paragraph has good examples, but no main idea. You need to put the main idea first and then develop it with your examples. Your second main paragraph is nothing but a general statement. Instead of trying to sound smart, show you are smart by being clear.

column1: 31&A friend of yours has received some money and plans to use all of it either to go on vacation or to buy a car. Your friend has asked you for advice. Compare your friend's two choices and explain which one you think your friend should choose. Use specific reasons and details to support your choice.
column3: <IN>Any people might choose about using of money. Both to go on vacation and to buy a car is equally important these days. To go on vacation will give my friend relaxation and go several places during vacation. To buy a car will him convenient transportation method and swiftness. <TS>If my friend ask me about his or her money either to so on vacation or to buy a car, I will answer to buy a car.</TS></IN> <BO1><MI1><TR>On one hand</TR>, to go on vacation will be able to take a rest him and give refreshment.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Also</TR>, it will give a choice several experiences and meet new friends. These relaxations will heal his mind and body and encourage to do his job of work. And to go on vacation will give various experiences and new mates. Although he travel alone, he will see many things, places, and natural environments. And he will meet many people from place to place. These also will be amusements given by vacation. </SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, to buy a car will let my friend to give convenience and swiftness.</MI2> <SI2> If he have a car, he will be able to go shopping, go to the movie, and go his wishful places. And to buy a car will go fast his destination. Those save money and time him. And those are very important things to these people. So, I think equally important thing not only to go on vacation but also to buy a car. <TR>However</TR>, at modern life, to buy a car is more important than to go on vacation.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, if my friend has to decide to buy a car or to go on vacation, I will answer to buy a car, but two parts are equally in these days. To buy a car and to go on vacation have several advantages. <TR>However</TR>, If my friend ask me about the choice, I will answer to buy a car.</CO>
column23: A very good essay! My only comment is that your conclusion is a little repetitive. I would take the last sentence out. Good job!

column1: 32&A company has anounced that it wishes to buil a large factory near your community. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of this new infuence on your community. Do you support or oppose the factory? Explain your position.
column3: <IN>We can't avoid industrialization if we live in developing or developed country. But we can choose our living environment now a day. Some people think that it¡¯s better to live far away from industrial zone, and others maintain that to live near industrial zone is more beneficial. <TS><TR>Although</TR> both opinions are reasonable, I object to build a large factory near my community in terms of environmental pollution and traffic problem.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, environmental pollution is undisputedly important fatal factor of our life.</MI1> <SI1>If a large factory is built in or near my community, many people will suffer from dust, polluted water, destroying green zone, and so on because of pollution and we can know those fact from mass communication.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, traffic problem requires lots of our time, which could be useful if we do another thing except riding cars.</MI2> <SI2>I who live in urban could go to gym after moving from urban to rural village.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, to build a large factory makes a environmental pollution and traffic problem, therefore if we I can avoid to build a large factory near my community, I will.</CO>
column23: Where did your second main paragraph come from? What does going to the gym have to do with having a factory in your town? You need a main point stating that a factory would make traffic worse. In both main paragraphs you need to support your main ideas with more supporting ideas and examples.

column1: 33&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Universities should give the same amount of money to their students¡¯ sports activities as they give to their university libraries. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN><TS>I agree the idea that the same amout of money should go to sports activities as to libraries. <TR>Of couse</TR>, the investment to libraries is very important for university students, because they have to study and research. But, if universities would not give money to their sports facilities, the students can not have the chance to enjoy healthy and energetic life.</TS></IN><BO1><SI1>Someone can say that students can play basketball, baseball, and soccer or swim in the public services, which are city-founded or state-founded. It can be true.</SI1><MI1><TR> Nevetheless</TR>, the reason that students still need the universities' help on sports activities exists; they encourage students' participants in sports, which bring up their health, teamwork, and friendship.</MI1></BO1> <BO2>The first goal of students is to study. <MI2>Still do sports brings positive effect on studying hard by refreshing students.</MI2> <SI2>Though they really enjoy to read books and search papers, there can be stress. By playing basketball, swimming, and running, students can be free from stress. It is very important for students to keep going on their studies.</SI2></BO2><CO>Students at universities can get knowleges and experiences, when they can be healthy, energetic, and free from stress. They need not only well-organized libraries but also good sports facilities.</CO>
column23: Your essay needs some more organization. Your main idea should come first and give a summary of what your paragraph is going to talk about. Then you follow it with supporting examples, research and your opinion on the matter. Straighten out your main ideas and add a little more to your supporting ideas and you will have a good essay.

column1: 34&A friend of yours has received some money and plans to use all of it either to go on vacation or to buy a car. Your friend has asked you for advice. Compare your friend's two choices and explain which one you think your friend should choose. Use specific reasons and details to support your choice.
column3: <IN><TS>Provided that a friend of mine would asked his or her extra money, I would tell him or her to spend the money not for purchasing a car, but splendid vacation.</TS> The money, a friend of mine obtains by a chance, do not always come to her or his life. I¡¯ll describe to support my selection more detail in this essay. </IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, the car, my friend could buy, bring my friend numerous responsibilities.</MI1> <SI1><TR> In other word</TR>, my friend would pay for using cost of car, such as parking fee, oil cost, and washing cost of the car. This thing, which I above all, irritates my friend.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>More over</TR>, the chance of vacation about which my friend use a lot of money without worry, never come to the life of my friend, the vacation not only could release various of stress, which modern life causes. But also allow my friend myriad good memory about the excellent vacation, bringing my friend energy of my friend¡¯s restricted life.</MI2></BO2><CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, I believe that a friend of mine would be obligate to choose vacation to which my friend never regrets the selection. This is because, I mentioned above all, irritation and burdensome, which is caused by car, and the happiest moment obtained the wonderful vacation.</CO>
column23: Your basic ideas are very good. Your first main paragraph comes across well; your second main paragraph is just a very long main idea! You need to break it up into smaller sentences and say a little more about them.

column1: 35&Celebrities and Athletes earn lots of money in these days. Do you think Celebrities and Athletes deserve lots of money? Support your answer.)
column3: <IN>Some famous athletes, such as Ronaldo, earn million dollars every years. Some entertainers, too. These people make amazing money with their talents. <TS>Some people say that these famous people's income is too much, incredibly. But I think they are all deserved such high salaries. Because they have tremendous talent that most people can not imitate and they can entertain us pretty much.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, some famous athletes and entertainers have respectable ability that common people want to have.</MI1> <SI1><TR>For example</TR>, the Brazilian soccer player, Ronaldo's prominent talent in soccer is not made in a day. He has done his best for all his life. <TR>Consequently</TR>, he can be one of the best players in the world. In addtion to his whole effort, such his ability is the thing by nature. So some athletes and entertainers deserve their high income.</SI2></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, these people make us so enthusiastic in sports and cultural events.</MI2> <SI2>If we see their nice, spectacle activities when we are in sad or gloomy mood, then we, common people, could be happy and feel fantastically joyful. <TR>For example</TR>, from Michael Jackson-one of the famous entertainer-'s music videos or music albums, we can get plenty of joy and happiness.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, they would make so much money with their little labor if we thought in an opposite view. But these famous people deserve their high salaries from these two reasons above. <TR>Furthermore</TR>, since they can make the people of all over the world amused, they could make a lot of fortune.</CO>
column23: A very good essay! Your thesis statement can be combined into one sentence - I would do that.

column1: 36& You have been told that dormitory rooms at your university must be shared by two students. Would you rather have the university assign a student to share a room with you, or would you rather choose your own roommate? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
column3: <IN>Some students have the university assign their roommate. <TS>But I would like to choose my own roommate for my better dormitory. If I choose my own, I could learn about my academic weak points from him, and I could more comfortably live with someone who has similar character and life style to me.</TS></IN> <BO1><MI1>In the first place, if I select my own roommate, I could learn about something necessary for my school study.</MI1> <SI1><EX>I have an unpleasant memory when I think of my college years. I had gotten poor grades on the math-related subjects, although I was an engineering student. At that time, I had much difficulty in my campus life, because there were a lot of required courses that needed quite an advanced skill on mathematics. It was my primary stress during my college years. <TR>Therefore</TR>, if God might give me one more chance of studying in university, I would certainly like to choose my dormitory roommate who could help me with his excellent ability on mathematics. It might change my life into more exciting one.</EX><SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, I wish to choose my roommate in order to live with a person similar to myself in character and work schedule.</MI2> <SI2><EX>When I lived in college dormitory, I had to share the room with a roommate who did not turn off his lamp throughout the night and even smoked in the dormitory room. Because of my daily schedule, I had to sleep at twelve o'clock at latest. And I really disliked the smell of cigarette smoke in my room. In spite of my asking and warning, his ugly habits were not cured. This is my terrible memory of campus life. It is one of the reason why I want to choose my own roommate.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I would like to choose my own roommate for my dormitory life. This is because I could do better in my academic work if I select the one who is good at the subject I am poor, and because I could enjoy the dormitory life with someone who has similar character and life habits to me.</CO>
column23: A very good essay! Your thesis statement would be stronger if you shortened it a little.

column1: 37&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? A zoo has no useful purpose. Use specific reasons and examples to explain your answer.
column3: <IN>A zoo surely has meaning for everyone in some or other. Some people say that a zoo is less a matter of profitable necessity than of taste. When they think of a zoo, they may tend to think about only entertainments. <TS>I certainly think that a zoo today is profitablly functioned. For one thing children are taugth about animals and nature, and then all people would feel happy and comfortable, escaping from a modern society. </TS></IN><BO1><SI2><TR>First of all</TR>, it is important to know what we know now. When we think of environment, we tend to think about energy, pollution, conservation, etc. These have been taught from schools. A environment involves not only a human society but also nature. Without nature, a human society might not be existed. Therefore, it is needless to say that we have to know about nature, especially animals. Because we and they are symbiosis. From their behaviors, we will know about nature. Moreover, we will find way of keeping nature .<MI1>Today, a place in which our children learn about animals is only a zoo.</MI1> knowing about nature is believed to be conductive to a longer, healthier life.</SI2></BO1><BO2><MI2>Visiting a zoo help people relax.</MI2> <SI2>People of the 21th century are faced with rapid paced society with little room for error. They are always piled with tasks that need to be done yesterday. Although they do their best. the pile never seen to decrease. The tasks alse demand perfection. <TR>however</TR>, this perfection is often jeopardy because of limited time to perform the tasks. The end result is very stressed out.
