Many of the poulation seek measn to escape this reality and stress and visiting zoo is one of the solutions. It is a generally accepted truth that seeing animals help people get rid of stress.</SI2></BO2> <CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, taking all that into consideration, I think that a zoo certainly have valuable purposes. For one thing we learn about nature, and then a zoo give us relief. The nature is very important to our life. Where we will learn about this is a zoo either directly or indirectly. From these reasons, we have to consider about building more zoos</CO>
column23: Your essay is pretty good. Your second main paragraph is better than the first one because it is more organized. Organize your first main paragraph a little more and you will have a better essay.

column1: 38&How do movies or television influence people¡¯s behavior? Use reasons and specific examples to explain your answer.
column3: <IN>In these days, it is very hard for us to live without TV or movies. TV¡¯s are always around us and most people waste all the evening watching them. And also we tend to waste our free time watching movies rather than reading books nowadays. <TR>Therefore</TR>, we can¡¯t deny the great influence of TV and movies on our daily life and behavior, whether it is good sense or not. </IN><BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, we can list a lot of good influences of TV and movies.</MI1> <SI1><TR>For example</TR>, We not only get a lot of information from them but broaden our individual thinking through indirect experience they provide us. Documentaries : Newscasts, variety of educational programs and movies let us to know how people of other countries live and what happens all over the world. In addition to that, TV and movies alos make us get rid of our stress, thus implemeet our work more efficiently.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, we can¡¯t ignore the bad aspect of TV and movies either.</MI1> <SI1>Today TV programs and movies resort to sensationalism, comercialism and violence to attract audiences, which trends make people more violent and aggressive. I assert these trends of mass media have something significant to do with the rapid increase of sexual crime rates, juvenile delinquencies and recent gun-related accidents in high schools of Germany and USA. It is no surprise many murderers and gangsters admitted they had learned their crime on tv and movies.</SI1> </BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, as most of the modern conveniences usually do, TV and movies have both positive sides and negative sides. And whether they would be good servants providing us with valuable information and entertainment, or the evil which destroys human intelligence and moral basis of the society actually depend upon us, e.g., how much we watch, what we watch, and how we respond to what we watch</CO>
column23: This is a very good essay. Add a thesis statement that answers the question and it will be perfect!

column1: 39&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Television has destroyed communication among friends and family. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN><TS>I agree that Television will destroy communication among friends and family.</TS> There are some examples that I really experienced. Now, I will tell you my experiences. </IN><BO1><SI1><EX>After coming back in the evening, I say hello to my family and sit down on the coach and watch TV. During my wife prepares for dinner, we, two children and me, watch TV. She asks me some questions about things, which happened in the office. And I answer her very quickly. We have almost 100 channels and lots of things to watch, cartoons, movies, and sports, etc. Sometimes I imagine that if we don't have TV, I would help her preparing dinner and play with my children. I don't mean that I never play with our children and never help my wife, I just want you to know if we did not buy TV, I can allow more time than now. And most of the dinnertime we spend watching TV.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><SI2>I can remember some holidays which I did not do anything but watching TV. At that time, let¡¯s suppose we don't have TV, we should go out somewhere else to spend with our family. Our children are young now and they need more care than before, they need some motive to learn something, for example famous pictures, statue, scene, house, and play, and so on. Sometimes my wife and children don't care my requirements, they are watching TV at anyhow and I feel lonely. Actually we discharged TV a few years ago, and then she felt bored all day long. At that time our kid was very young, so he did not play with her. Finally we bought another TV to enjoy the modern life and go into the silent cave.</SI2></BO2><CO>To sum up all these things, TV prevents us to talk with our friends and family so I agree that Television has destroyed communication among friends and family.</CO>
column23: I think your essay is very good and heartfelt, but it needs a little structure. You need to start your main paragraphs with one main sentence that sums up the main idea of what you are going to say. I think your two paragraphs could be one paragraph, all under a main idea that is something like "It is easier to watch television than interact with family and friends."

column1: 40&Do you agree or dis agree with the follewing statement. People are never satisfied with what they have: they always want something more or something different. Use specifis reason to support your answer.
column3: <IN>The wish for change is a basic instinct of humans. As a rule, this strong ambition causes to develop our culture and society in advance steps. Though humans are not satisfied with existing their situation, it is not detrimental to them. <TR>On the contrary</TR>, this discontent derives humans to make advanced creation. <TS>So, I agree that people are never satisfied with what they have.</TS> Here is some hypothetical reason.</IN><BO1><MI1>One reason is the invention.</MI1> <SI1>People basically have desire of development. They don¡¯t stand uncomfortable thing surrounding our environment. To get over this problem, they may attempt to invent convenient creation removed of previous problems. This phenomenon is based on the desire of humans to satisfy with their life.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Second illustration is a challenge.</MI2> <SI2>For a long time, Human have fought with nature and challenged unknown world to acquire. <TR>For example</TR>, in 15th century, Columbus discovered the America continent when they short area to live and in 20th century, they set up the development of space. At last , they come true moon tour. As a results, we cultivate the space, so, these facts show that humans probably are eager to extend the territory where they live.</BO2><CO><TR>To conclude,</TR> human have ambitions to live advanced civilization and continuously improve their lives. Though some appear bad effect during the period of develop, they defeat these problems and create the culture. So, they are dissatisfied with present steps and they try to reach upper steps.</CO>
column23: Your essay has some interesting ideas! Now try to develop them a little more. Also, your second example jumps around a little too much. Try to finish one thought (Colombus) before going to another (space travel).

column1: 41&Some people believe that a college or university education should be available to all studens. Other believe that higher education should be availabe onlt to good students. Discuss these views. Which do you agree with? Explain why.
column3: <IN>Some people say that all students should attend a college or university. <TS><TR>In my opinion</TR>, <TR>however</TR>, the higher education should allow to competent students and have an interst on academic subject.</TS></IN><BO1><SI1>A college and university differ from previous schools, such as elimentery, middle, and high school. In these institution studens learn the basic knowlege neccessary for life. Otherwise the college and university have purpose on studying more intellectual field. Therefore it is hard to learn there. Due to this difficalty, <MI1>students could have ablity to handle their couse work.</MI1></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI1>People want do what they like. In schol days we have a variety of pupils.</MI1> <SI1>They have a good or bad grade and be interested in different things; reading books, enjoying sports, playing instruments. I believe that students who wish to study get into the higher education. In other words students who have no interest in study should find career avaliable for themselves.</SI1></BO2><CO>Though all of the stuents have opputunity to apply the college and university, they should have capacity and passion to study.</CO>
column23: You need to put your main ideas before your supporting ideas when you write an essay for a test. Also, you can remove the transitions from your thesis statement to make it stronger. Finally, add a little more support to your arguments.

column1: 42&Would you prefer to live in a traditional house or in a modern apartment building? Use specific reasons and details to suport your choice.
column3: <IN>Some people maintain that it is better to live in a traditional house. Others, meanwhile, prefer to live in a modern apartment building. Of course, it may true that no one sholuld understimate the benefits of a traditional house, I think.<TS><TR> But on the whole</TR>, I agree with those people who claim that living in a apartment is the best way for us.</TS> Now, the use of a couple of specific reasons and examples, I will demonstrate a basis of my assertion.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Foremost</TR>, an apartment is comfortable to menage.</MI1> <SI1>It has such a simple structure that we can clean it easy. Rooms are very close each other. So, we can clean them without big problems. <TR>Moreover</TR>, it is not only good to clean but also good for education. As you know, in many case, apartments are built in urban area, and those area has a lot of schools and institutes. <TR>Therefore</TR>, becuase most apartments is in big cities, if you live in the apartment, you will get these advantages.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addtion</TR>, seen from government perspective, there are one more elective advantage, land-saving.</MI2> <SI2>Especially, in my country, as the population has gone off since the 1980s, This phenomenon called the lack of the land for accomodating house. <TR>However,</TR> because many apartments are built in relatively small area; comparing the area used in a traditional house, this problem is solved. <TR>Thus</TR>, government should be going to build much more apartments, and most people will live in them.</SI2></BO2><BO3><SI3><TR>However,</TR> I can't deny the important of traditional houses as a beautiful landscape. In my country, these are used in tourist industry. <TR>Accordingly</TR>, we should not ignore this useful effect.</SI3></CO><CO>Clearly, living in a modern apartment building is comfortable to menage. <TR>Moreover,</TR> It solves indirectly the problem by increasing population. <TR>For these reasons</TR>, to live in a modern apartment building is best for mang purposes and should be preferred when possible.</CO>
column23: This essay is pretty good. You seem to veer a little from the subject in your first paragraph when you start talking about schools¡¦ just focus on the living quarters. Also, I would take out the paragraph about the advantages of the traditional home. It does not help your argument.

column1: 44&Do you agree or disagree with the folleowing statement?. A person's childhood years are the most important years of a person's life. Usespecific reasons asd exaples to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TR>Frankly speaking</TR>, I don't think that people's childhood years from infant to twelve years are the most important parts of their lives. These periods are so premature that they may not take shape and design their lives. <TR>On the other hand,</TR><TS> I think adolescence from twelve years to eighteen years before adulthood rather than childhood years provides people with basic factors which cause them to make the point of life.</TS> </IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Indeed</TR>, People can build the purpose of their life and make up their mind their whole life career during adolescence.</MI1> <SI1>There are some limits before twelve years when they determine the life by themselves. It is not childhood period but adolescence when they are able to find real gifts, because young adults have more experience and knowledge about life than child.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Likewise</TR>, the adolescent have much opportunity which enables them to learn sophisticated subjects in the school when comparing with childhood year.</MI2> <SI2>By learning considerable subjects and attending their several classes, they find abilities and gifts based on life employment. The adolescence dream for future help them to obey the school rule and keep standing their right position.</MI2></BO2><CO><TR>At last</TR>, <TR>considering all example</TR>, I think that adolescence years are more important than childhood years. People may be able to shape their lives and build background. So, they must not neglect these years and help young adults to design their lives.</CO>
column23: Your ideas are great. You explain them very well, but it makes me want to know more! Add a little more to your support. Also, try to avoid putting two transitions right next to each other. It isn't necessary.

column1: 46&Many people visit museums when they travel to new places. Why do you think people visit museums? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>People love to visit museums when traveling to new places. Because musuems tell many stories about the culture of those places. And sometimes there are special exhibitions, so that people don't need to go around to experience their culture. People can also meet kind guides, who can explain about those places.</IN><BO1><SI1>There are many ways to experience the culture of those places; see their movies, visit marketplaces, or listen to their own musics. Those ways are also good. <MI><TR>However</TR>, visiting museums, people can get informations about all of what they can get by those ways.</MI1></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Nowadays musuems do not only exhibit but also encourage people to participate in the culture shows.</MI2> <SI2>They use movies, musics, and concerts to attract and satisfy people. It makes people active to experience the culture.</SI2> </BO2><CO><TS>Travellers are likely to visit musuems, for the effectiveness, comfort, and satisfaction to get informations and learn about the culture of those places.</TS></CO>
column23: Your essay needs a lot of work. Your thesis statement needs to be in your introduction. You need to start your main paragraphs with a main idea - a sentence summarizing the point you are about to make. I am not sure what your point is in either of your main paragraphs. You will also need to add more information to your paragraphs.

column1: 47&Some people believe that the Earth is being harmed (damaged) by human activity. Others feel that human activity makes the Earth a better place to live. What is your opinion? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer
column3: <IN><TS>I agree with the view that the Earth is being harmed by human activity. There are some evidences. I will tell you two of them to support my opinion. One of them is that most animals are suffering from disease which didn't exists before and many animals have already disappeared. Another is the pollutions which come from the industries, cars and other machines.</TS></IN><BO1><SI1>Diseases have existed since the earth was created. But, animals have disappeared during the last century more than any other century. Human being is a kind of animal. This means all of us will be dead by various kinds of viruses, which are gendered by human activities.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>And, pollution is also such a dangerous factor that the earth will be the most ugly and most dirty planet in the solar system.</MI2><SI2> By industrialization the world, the earth is getting dirty. New crucial diseases come from water pollutions and air pollutions. They threaten human beings and other animals and drive our home world, the earth, to death.</SI2> </BO2><CO>Human activity, the attempt to make the world better to live in, is doing harm the earth. If we do not try to clean our home, we will all die someday.</CO>
column23: I can tell this is a subject that is important to you because your supporting statements are more emotional than informative. Even so, you need to support your main ideas with concrete examples and research. Can you find some statistics to support your statements? Also, each main paragraph should start with a main idea sentence - in other words, the reason you are about to talk about to support your thesis statement.

column1: 48&Some people like to travel with a companion. Other people prefer to travel alone. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your choice.
column3: <IN><TS>I like to travel with a companion more than alone.</TS> People travels to get knowledges of other cultures and see the beautiful world. In this view, to travel with a companion is the better, I think. Through descripting my own experience, I will demonstrate why a companions is helpful during travelling. </IN><BO1><SI1><EX>2 years ago, I traveled a city, which was the capital of an ancient country, alone. During the travel, there are so many situation to decide where to go, what to do, and when to do.<TR> Also</TR>, I needed someone to chat with when walked around. If there had been an companion, who would help me when I had to make decisions and chat with me, it could be a better travel. <MI1>To travel alone is very lonely.</MI1></EX></SI1></BO1><BO2>There are other reasons. <MI2>The cost to travel can be reduced when we travel with a friend.</MI2><SI1><TR> For example</TR>, when we take a taxi, we need to pay not for two but for one. <TR>Therefore</TR>, we can save money. </SI2></BO2><CO><TR>As mentioned above</TR>, to travel with a companion is better than alone. To be not alone as weel as to be able to save money are the merits.</CO>
column23: Make sure each main paragraph has a main idea sentence so the reader knows what you are going to talk about. You really need to add more to your main paragraphs. Can you give more examples or supporting evidence?

column1: 49&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Playing games teach us about life. Use specific reasons and example to support your answer.
column3: <IN>It is said that games should reflect our life. Games have several rules to follow and teach us considerable lessons to learn. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, some people consider games as only the entertainment they enjoy without learning. If all people only take games for the tool of entertainment, then there is no instruction by playing games. So, <TS>games provide us with instruction to learn in our lives as well as delight.</TS> Here are some reasons.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, games teach us about several rules to obey.</MI1> <SI1>If we violate the social rule when we live in our community, we will be penalized. Similarly games endow member consisting of them with committed rules. Though people are able to learn social rules they ought to observe, they don¡¯t neglect that they can learn many rules when they play games.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, it is important for group games such as football made up of eleven members to have leadership and cooperation.</MI2> <SI2>When people compete opposite team, well-equipped cooperation and leadership causes teams to a valuable victory. Through practicing games, they cooperate each other and follow their leader so that they may get to victory. Also better leadership help members to do their best and give them power not to give up when they meet the difficult moment.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To conclude</TR>, by playing games, people probable learn how to obey rules and show that they will cooperate each other to won the prize. It is necessary for leadership to practice games and we also augment them through games. This is some reason why I agree that games teach us about life.</CO>
column23: An excellent essay! You just need to strengthen your thesis statement a little more.

column1: 50&(Some think college students should not skip classes while others think they have to right to do so. What is your opinion?
column3: <IN>There are many university students. Some people think that these university students' going to classes should be optional, not obligatory. <TS><TR>In my opinion</TR>, <TR>however</TR>, most university students should attend classes in any case. Because attending to their university everyday is the measurement of someone's diligence, and, moreover, they pay too much tuition for their everyday's classes.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>In the first place</TR>, when we judge someone, his/her diligence is so important factor.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Therefore</TR> if you do not attend your daily classes, other people might think that you are so lazy or not diligent individual. Then you might be considered not-dutiful person. <TR>Consequently</TR>, this ill reputation for you would be a negative influence on your life.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, tuition for university is so expensive that not attending to your classes would mean a money-consuming behavior.</MI2> <SI2>You would pay so much money for university tuition. And this tuition is the payment for your just right to attend your a few classes. <TR>Therefore</TR> not attending to classes means that you abandon your right to be in lecture. <TR>Thus</TR> it is so valuable to attend everyday's lectures.</SI2></BO2><CO>other people would say that it is also their own right to cut their classes. However I strongly assert that going to classes is so significant part of your university life because of two reasons above: it is not only your own right, but also it is the measurement of someone's diligence.</CO>
column23: You have a good essay here. Try not to put two transitions together - it is unnecessary. Your points are pretty good, but I think you could add a little more information to your main paragraphs.

column1: 51&Some people think that governments should spend as much money as possible on developing or buying computer technology. Other people disagree and think that this money should be spent on more basic needs. Which one of these opinions do you agree with? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TR>Nowdays</TR>, whether developing or developed country, many countries have developed their own IT, Information Technology, industry. In Korea, all korean have their own ID number and their own database by electrical gaverment project. Ohterwise, many developed country do not have this.</IN> <BO1>Korea goverment have spent over 2 hundreds million dollars for electrical gaverment project. Otherwise, money for spending SOC is droped. </BO1><BO2><TR>First</TR>, govermemt has to increase tax and lessen life insurance. Person should give more tax . <TR>Second</TR>, for developing information and computer thnology, korea should import more computer components. most parts of computer are building abroad.</BO2><CO>As I have written above, goverment have to increase public welfare. Computer technology is the last problem we have. <TS>Increasing warefare is the most impotant thing gaoverment have to do.</TS></CO>
column23: When you write an essay for a test, you need to write a thesis statement answering the question in your introduction. Next, you should choose at least 2 reasons for your argument. Make these your main statements, the first sentence of each paragraph. Then you need at least 4 or 5 statements to support your main idea. This essay is off topic and not well-organized. It is very hard to understand what you want to say. I suggest reading some sample essays online and trying again.

column1: 52&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Universities should give the same amount of money to their stedent¡¯s sports activities as they give to their university libraries. Use a specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>The library is the heart of the unversity and becomes the level of estimation. Though well equipped sports facilities is necessary for students to maintain their good health, it is not ,what is called search for truth, main purpose of unversity. To develop university, the staff in unversity may well be concerned about the investment of library. <TS><TR>Therefore</TR>l support that the investment in university library is more important than this of sport activities.</TS></IN> <BO1><MI1><TR>In generally</TR>, most university have well-established sports facilities and struggle to advertize the university through variety of sports activity.</MI1> <SI1><TR>On the other hand</TR>, they considered the library as the most important equipment in the univetsity. To enlarge a library and purchase many special books and journals, the staff are likely to attract contributions from alumni. It is rumored that the more famous university ought to hold over one million books such as Hervard, MIT and GIT.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>A library provides students with place to study and allows them to lend books to need.</MI2> <SI2>It is important fot them to store their major knowledge. A library plays an important role as the place where they can seek their purpose. As a result, much of that imformation comes from the library.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To conclude</TR>, students are able to acquire knowledge from the library and the university is evaluated by it. This is reason why I suggest that library funding is more desirable than sports activity funding. It is in the library that profit is generated.</CO>
column23: I think your two main paragraphs should just be one paragraph since they are talking about the same thing, essentially. You need to come up with a stronger main idea statement. Otherwise, I think you've done well.

column1: 53&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>In agriculture society, we had lived all together, and parents and their children spent a lot of time together. <TR>As a result</TR> , parents were not only the best teachers but also best friends for their children at that time. But various factors like industrial evolution made the society change tremendously, and the roles of parents are also changed. <TS><TR>In my opinion</TR>, it is obvious that parents are the best teachers in the past , <TR>however</TR>, that is not always true nowadays.</TS></IN> <BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR> , parents can't spend lots of time with their children compared with the past.</MI1> <SI1>Ancestor could live, working at their lands or home , but people in these days have to go outside to work. Now most of them work in not lands but firms. thus parents can't have a lot of time with their children. Instead many things like schools, books. TV , substitute the past education role of their parents and these can teach children effectively instead of them.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR> except parents, there are many people who teach children effectively.</MI2> <SI2>Unlike children's expectation. parents can't know everything. but children can learn from those who have professional knowledge each part. and they are also trained in order to teach children. Therefore in the view of education, children can learn more knowledge from those people.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Lastly,</TR> parents could treat their children emotionally.</MI3> <SI3>Of course emotion is based on affection ,but emotional teaching can sometimes cause troubles. <TR>For example</TR> they may demand their children to achieve not what children want but what they want. and it can destroy their children's' active thoughts.</SI3></BO3><CO>I agree that parents have important role and great influence on their children too . but it is also true that not only parents but also many factor can have influence on them. Thus parents are not the best teachers , they are one of the best teachers.</CO>
column23: A very good essay! Nice work!

column1: 54& (Is zoo a useful and necessary place for people? why or whynot?
column3: <IN>It is needless to say that people benefits from a zoo in terms of education and commerce. Also, a zoo provides them with places in order to relax with exit from bored their life. It will be granted that people consider a zoo as the part of their life. So,<TS> I srongly disagree that a zoo has no useful purpose.</TS> Here are some hypothetical reasons.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>To illustrate</TR>, people are likely to find palces only for them to enjoy the life and want to rest without any obstacle.</MI1> <SI1>It is at the zoo that people would like to spend their time when they feel tired. In addition, a zoo allow them to enjoy valuable time with the family and escape their tired every day life. Because of this considerable benefiction they want to stay a zoo on everyday weekend.</SI1></BO1> <BO2><MI2>Another reason is that chlidren are able to learn about animals at the zoo.</MI2> <SI2>Parents and teachers instruct them about animals through indirective methods such as television,fairy books ,and textbooks. As they compare indirective methods ,according to above mention, with directive methods like visiting a zoo, the former have a limit. Children touch animals and see them to near dictance at the zoo.<TR>Therefore</TR>, it is posiible for them to acquire the definite infomation about animals by doing direct experience.</SI2></BO2><CO><MI3><TR>At last,</TR> If they construct the commercial board at the zoo, they will increse the econamic effects.</MI3> <SI3><TR>For example</TR>, the famous company competes another company for advertise their own products and strive to attract people to announce them at the zoo.</CO><CO><TR>To conclude</TR>, people benefits from a zoo in terms of education as well as economy. <TR>Also</TR>, a zoo offers them to place to refresh their life. So it is necessary to set up a zoo.</CO>
column23: You have written a very good essay! I think it would be stronger if you took out the economic part. It weakens your argument to say "Zoos are important IF they do this¡¦" Your other two points are strong enough - stick with them.

column1: 55&People have different ways of escaping the stress and difficulties of modern life. Some read; some exercise; others work in their gardens. What do you think are the best ways of reducing stress? Use specific details and examples in your answer.
column3: <IN>In modern society, people get much stress and each of them have their own way to get rid of stress. Some people go to a theater, while others go home, take shower and go to bed. <TS>I also have best ways to reduce stress; one way is to take a trip to mountains, seas, and rivers. And the other effective way to diminish stress is to go to a pub with my friends.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, I travel to somewhere else when I'm under pressure.</MI1> <SI1><EX>I had a hard time when I took a big test to enter a university. <TR>At that time</TR>, I was very anxious about my test result so I was under pressure. I needed to calm down and refresh my mind. So I decided to take a trip to Chun-cheon by train. Chun-cheon is famous in Korea for its river and the scenery. While taking a trip by train, I could see lots of trees, flowers, and different sights from the city where I live. I could get rid of worries and just enjoyed the scenery of Chun-cheon. <TR>Afterwards</TR>, I felt myself refreshed and could concentrate on other things.</EX> <TR>Therefore</TR>, I strongly recommend that taking a trip to rivers, seas, and mountains when you get stress.</SI1> </BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, I go to a pub with my friends to get rid of stress.</MI2> <SI2>There are lots of pubs and bars around my university. So I can choose lots of different pubs. When I feel depressed and got stress, I go to an exciting pub and drink beer. I can listen to rock musics and hip hops also. Sometimes I dance. While doing like this, I can forget about whole things that annoyed me. Listening to musics and drinking in a pub makes me relaxed and diminishes stress. So I usually do this when I got stress.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To conclude</TR>, I think traveling to mountains, seas, and rivers or going to a pub are the best methods to reduce stress. It doesn't matter which way you take to diminish stress. What matters is that you find your own way to get rid of stress. And I want to recommend you my method if you don't have one. Go out somewhere else where you've never been, then you'll feel better. And liberate yourself in a pub or a bar and just drink and talk with friends. It'll undoubtedly work!</CO>
column23: I like your essay very much. You've expressed your points well. I am concerned that if you submitted this as a test essay, though, that you would not get the grade you desire. When writing for a test, it is best to stick to one main line of thought - either the trip to the mountains or going to a pub with friends. Even so, this is a good essay. You need to strengthen your thesis statement.

column1: 56&Some people prefer to eat at food stands or restaurants. Other people prefer to prepare and eat food at home. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>You can see a number of stands as well as restaurants while walking on the street. It shows well how much important having a meal in our lives is and how many people prefer to eat outside. <TS>Like most people, I also prefer to eat at stands or restaurants, for there are several definite advantages in it.</TS> </IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, the biggest reason why people like to eat outdoor is that it is more convenient.</MI1> <SI1>They can save their time and need not to prepare a meal at all. In modern society, people are working so busy that they can't have a time to eat at home. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, I eat only a breakfast at home and almost meals at restaurants. Because I have to study and do other things until late in school. So there is no time to eat a meal at home.</EX> Furthermore, I don't need to go to the market to buy food materials so I can save my time doing other necessary jobs. Although we have to spend lots of money, as you know, time is more important than gold. </SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, I can enjoy the relationship with friends as well as a variety of foods at restaurants.</MI2> <SI2>The menu is so limited in houses and average people can never make such dishes as the TGIF's or the Bennigans's. So if I want special foods which I can't taste at home, I almost always go out to eat. And if I have an important meeting, I usually look for nice place in the internet club to eat something special. I think that great dishes with wonderful mood of restaurant make the relationship fresher. Eating is not just a chewing acting to live but a means of making our lives happier and abundant.</SI2></BO2> <CO><TR>Naturally</TR>, those places might have some disadvantages such as sanitary problems and spending much money. <TR>However</TR> I have an opinion that there are more benefits than drawbacks. <TR>As I said before</TR>, I cannot only save a time to do other helpful works but also taste various and special foods at restaurants and stands. <TR>Thus</TR> I prefer to have a meal at restaurants rather than home.</CO>
column23: A very good essay! Try not to use so many transitions (there are too many in the conclusion). Also, try to make your point about friends (or do you mean business partners?) a little clearer in your second main paragraph.

column1: 57&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? A zoo has no useful purpose. Use specific reasons and examples to explain your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>I disagree with the idea that a zoo has no useful purpose. Many people are interested in the animals from other coutnries. Especially, children loves to see various animals. In the zoo, young boys and girls can meet wild, beautiful and interesting animals. Now, let me explain why a zoo is needed.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, people can't see many kinds of animals in any places except zoos.</MI1> <SI1>To meet animals, which are not domestic, people have to go around the entire world. This is almost impossible for most people, because time as well as money do not permit them to do. Therefore zoos are needed for the desire of the people to contact animals.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, animals are helpful in the growth of children.</MI2> <SI2>To educate children more successfully, we had better teach them that there are so many kinds of creations in the world. In this case, books with the stories and pictures about animals can be helpful. <TR>However</TR>, the contact with the real animals will be more effective. So, zoos are very important for children to be well-educated.</SI2></BO2> <CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I didn't think there is no purpose of zoos. To meet the citizens' desire as well as to help children's growth, zoos are needed.</CO>
column23: A very good essay! Nice work!

column1: 58&Would you prefer to live in a traditional house or in a modern apartment building? Use specific reasons and details to support your choice.
column3: <IN>To live in a traditional house and in a modern apartment building has each of advantages and disadvantages. <TS><TR>In my case</TR>, I prefer to live in a modern apartment building due to the joy of living closely with people and the safety.</TS> Let me tell you more about it with specific examples.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR> I love to live in an apartment building, for the happiness from my neighbors.</MI1> <SI1>Though I have 5 people in my family, I live now by myself. Thus sometimes I feel lonely. But my neighbors living closely in my apartment building always take care of me. If they make some foods, they always give me some to taste. The happiness from my neighbors let me love to live in an apartment building, while living in a traditional house has no relationship with neighbors due to the long distance.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Next</TR>, it is more safety to live in a modern apartment than traditional house.</MI2> <SI2><EX>One of my friends who lived in a traditional house moves to a modern apartment after coming across bad guys in front of her house.</EX> Traditional houses, which most of all exist far from another, could be dangerous especially for women. But, in case of modern apartment buildings concentrate on their safeties with various ways such as taking camera in the elevators or hiring a safety guarder in front of the buildings. Thus to live in a modern apartment could be more safety.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>Summing up</TR>, I am sure to live in a modern apartment has more merits from the joy from neighbor and the safety. I think the most important thing to choose the living place, depends on the purpose after seriously considering about the happiness from living there and the safety.</CO>
column23: An excellent and thoughtful essay!

column1: 59&In general, people are living longer now. Discuss the causes of this phenomenon.
column3: <IN>Nowadays, human beings can live much longer than before. In the case of men, they can live about 72 years and women can live around 78. <TS>I think this phenomenon is caused by advance of medical technology and intake of good food.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, technical improvement in medical science allows people to live longer life.</MI1> <SI1>These days, most diseases can be cured by medical methods such as operations and medicine. Long time ago, there were few medicines which people could depend on. <TR>Therefore</TR>, if some people were sick they just had to be left alone. <TR>However,</TR> as some kinds of medicine, such as penicillin and aspirin, were discovered, these medicines could cure people who had some disorder thought to be incurable.</SI1></BO2><BO2><MI2>Another factor is increasing of intake good nutrition.</MI2> <SI2>Some efficient agricultural systems were developed such as greenhouse. This makes people to eat much fresh food regardless of season and makes few people who starve to death.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>For these reasons</TR>, humans can live longer life</CO>
column23: For the most part, this is a very good essay. It looks like you got tired of writing it halfway through, though - the paragraphs get shorter and then your conclusion is only one sentence. You need to make your conclusion longer and add a little more to your second main paragraph.

column1: 60&what do you consider to be the most important room in a house? why is this room more important to you than any other room? Use specific Use specific details and examples to explain your opinion.
column3: <IN>There are various rooms in people's house; each of which has a unique role satisfing people's basic requirement such as sleeping,eating,and study. Among these rooms,which one to be the most significant room in a house?. <TS>If given this choice I would say that studying room has to be the most impotant place in that it has vastly effect on our work result and can makes family more participate in learning activities.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, studying room make us more concentrate on our work.</MI1> <SI1>As it has a number of benefits; silent atmosphere, far from T.V set, and well composed light, we can have helpful state in this room. If there is no place to focus on studying, we may gain less outcome than that of we expect in spite of our strong will to accomplish certain goals.<EX><TR>For example</TR>,when I was a junior high school student, I did not have a studying room. Because my parents had not enough money to buy the house having sufficent rooms.So I could hardly concentrate on my work spending most time watching T.V or playing with friends out of house. Finally I became have poor score in school. After for years from then, I had my studying room after all and could have been interested in study owing to the proper conditions of the room as It was so cozy and calm to last reading and writing that I could not only acpuire good grade but also raising my volitoin for studying.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Also</TR>, studying room give family the effective place to participate in educational activity together.</MI2> <SI2>Nowadays most people have less time to talk with their family due to completely separated rooms differ from typical construction of past time in Korea. However we can relieve this disadvantagous situation by utilizing studying room . <EX>My uncle's house has one special room. Although it looks a shabby loft, his family made that the most valuable site in the house. They always share the opinions about trivial as well as important issues;relationships with friends,political scandals, and even homosexuality.<TR>Therefore</TR>, sometimes visiting his home, I was influenced the instructive atmosphere, prevailing in the house from studying room, so I would be participated in their casual meeting natually. and it gives me so varid infomation that I can expand the range of my thought.</EX></SI2> </BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I consider that studying room is the most important place in a house. Because it can makes us more concentrate upon certain works for our goals, and gives the oppotunities communicating with family members deeply. Therefore if we utilize the studying room well, our life will be more worthy and enjoyable.</CO>
column23: A very good essay!

column1: 61&Some people believe that university students should be required to attend classes. Others believe that going to classes should be optional for students. Which point of view do you agree with? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
column3: <IN>We know the many famous people who stop to study in class in university and do work they want. For example, Bill Gates , the president of Microsoft ,quitted to study in MIT because he wanted to make and sell DOS which he made. He succeeded and he is one of the most powerful man in the world now. Nobody scolds him of not being in class. Almost people envy him and they want to be like him. His success shows that attending in class is not forcefully required.</IN><BO1><MI1>I think the important function of university is to make students prepare for working in society later.</MI1> <SI1>In university, they should have more and specialized experience at his major and meet a various people in diverse field. But I think that university isn¡¯t the only method to fulfill that purpose. If they work in advance in his field, they might have a valuable experience which can¡¯t be acquired in class and meet so many kinds of people. We know the fact that the university is not the ultimate goal, but just one course for later success.</SI1></BO1><CO>I think university students are adult, not child. They get to have a lot of freedom and duty relating to it first. I think it is valuable that they get to know the using of freedom. It¡¯s not rather the function of university to force students to attend the class, because it ignores the ability to use their freedom and will. If they have a firm will and encouragements, I think that it is more helpful to do what they want.</CO>
column23: You have good ideas, but your essay needs structure. I think you should write a new introduction paragraph WITH a thesis statement and add your Bill Gates example to your main paragraph. I'm not sure what to do with your conclusion paragraph. It makes sense, but I don't know where to put it.

column1: 62&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Reading fiction (such as novels and short stories) is more enjoyable than watching movies. Use specific reasons and examples to explain your position.
column3: <IN>There are lots of opinions about the statements. <TS><TR>In my case</TR>, watching movies is more enjoyable than reading function.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>Watching movie is enjoyable.</MI1> <SI1>For watching movie, I can go to movie with my friend and have a lunch. column23: The ideas in your essay are good, but you need to work on your structure. When you are talking about the same topic, keep your sentences together in the same paragraph to keep from confusing the reader. I think you need to add some more support to your main ideas as well.

column1: 63&Think of the most interesting class you have ever taken. Why did you enjoy this class so much? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>The most interesting class I have ever taken is "an introduction to plasma physics" that I took in my undergraduate course.</TS> There are several reasons that I enjoyed this class the most.</IN><BO1><MI1>The first reason, though it seems to be strange somewhat, is that that class was one of the most difficult and challenging subject for most undergraduate students at that time.</MI1> <SI1>This point made the class much more attractive to me as I like to overcome and cope with something difficult and to feel satisfaction and confidence from the result I made through the struggle.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>The second reason that I enjoyed the plasma physics class is that this class has destined me to be engaged in this area as my career.</MI2> <SI2>When I was taking this class, studying hard for this abstruse subject and finally made quiet a good result, I made up my mind to study this area further. <TR>Since then</TR>, I have been working and studying something related to this subject as a graduate student, which I am really enjoying today. <TR>Moreover,</TR> I am thinking of studying abroad and getting a PhD degree on this subject.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Finally</TR>, I enjoyed attending that class because, in that class, I was able to help many friends of mine who were having a hard time in getting through the subject.</MI3> <SI3>By helping them with solving difficult problems, doing their homework, and preparing for the exam, I became somehow popular among my friends.</SI3></BO3><CO>Such reasons mentioned above made this physics class the most interesting and exciting one. The subject could have been a very annoying one if I had not had such an attitude that I posed at that time. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I thing that I have also attained an excellent lesson from taking this subject which could be helpful to me in my life outside campus.</CO>
column23: A very good essay! You need to write a little more in your first and third main paragraphs - you should have at least 3 supporting sentences.

column1: 64& (Do you think people should only read nonfiction books? why or whynot?)
column3: <IN>There are two kinds of world: imaginary world and real world. nonfictional works deal with the former while creative works deal with the latter.some people argue that to the contrary to nonfictions ,creative works do not have any advantages because of its imaginary aspects; others argue against the opinion and voice a countargument that fictional works are beneficial for us because of their creativity.these two opinions are make sense. <TS><TR>In my view</TR>, I believe that creative works have tremendous advantages in that creative works sometimes help us to understand world with a different view point and can develop reader's creativity.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, creative works allow us to see the way we look at this world better by showing author's creative ideas.</MI1> <SI1>Sometimes they use a satire to critisize something instead of direct criticism.<EX><TR>For example</TR>, Mr.swift, a famous writer in the 19th century in England reveals discrimination of society in Gulliver's Travel by describing an imaginary world where dwarfs as tall as his thumb were. Several events which Gullliver encountered there are very strange to us. but they are exactly twisted reflection of 19th England's severe discriminated, industrial society. The extreme contrast between Gulliver and other people such as dwarfs and giants, throw a guiding light about discrimination.</EX> Showing an imaginary world, the creative work helps its readers understand the real world much more effectively than through any form of nonfictional one.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, reading creative works is helpful to develop creativity.</MI2> <SI2>A number of well known painters, musicians, and writers got their insights through many prior creative works such as Greek-Roman legends.Vist a famous museum , then you will see about a thirds of the building would be filled with works motivated by myth. In addition to art, here is another example even for thechnology. <EX>A famous inventor, Thomas Edison is said to have got his ingenious ideas of some inventions including light bulb through Aesop's Fables that his mother had read for him.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO><TR>As mentioned above</TR>, although creative works describe imaginary world, they are useful to give us lessons about problems of our real society through imaginary examples. <TR>Moreover,</TR> seeing prior creative works provides motives of many famous works , and ideas of even practically helpful inventions were stimulated by some allegorys. Therefore I believe creative works provide diverse profits to people and thus reaing them should be made.</CO>
column23: The content of your essay is excellent, but your lack of attention to syntax (capitalization, spaces between sentences, etc.) is very distracting and takes away from your argument. Also, your example of Gulliver's Travels will be more effective if you use Johnathan Swift's full name.

column1: 65&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Reading fiction (such as novels and short stories) is more enjoyable than watching movies. Use specific reasons and examples to explain your position.
column3: <IN>Reading fiction and watching movies are both enjoyable and good stuff to enjoy oneself. <TS>If I have to choose one of them, I will go to the first one, reading fiction.</TS> Now I will mention the reasons I chose the former one.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, I don't need any other equipment but a book.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Accordingly</TR>, reading novels are not limited to any place. Books are easy to carry. You can enjoy reading fiction any place, even in a bus or a subway. Still you don't have to worry about to follow plots of a novel. Usually novels are interesting and easy to follow plots and contents.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, you can be more creative and imaginative by reading fiction.</MI2> <SI2> You can draw in your mind how characters act, how they feel, and the settings. You can make your own settings. You can be a director yourself. I still remember how I was heartbroken when Jane Yer had to leave her master even though she loved him so deeply in the novel [Jane Are]. I got the feeling as if I was Jane Are.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Last but not the least</TR>, watching movies need at least one and a half hours running time without stopping.</MI3> <SI3>As a housewife, who raising two little kids, it is hard to have that amount of quality time. Whenever my kids ask something to be done, I have to push a "play" button. Eventually, I will lose interest in the movie I would be watching. Reading fiction, <TR>on the other hand</TR>, doesn't need such a concentrated, quality time as waching movies does. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I have an easier access to reading fiction than watching movies.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I am favor of reading fiction. I can read anywhere and anytime. Plus I can be more imaginative by reading fiction.</CO>
column23: An excellent essay! Good work! One thing: make sure you look up the English spellings of your examples (ex. Jane Eyre)

column1: 66&Some people like doing work by hand. Others prefer using machines. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Usually people work by hand or machine. Of course, although the both methods have the adventages and disadventages, <TS>I think that using machines are more efficient than doing by hand because of the following reasons.</TS> </IN><BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, working by machine brings us to the mass production.</MI1> <SI1>Long time ago, our ancestors worked by hand. Because they did that, they just got a few goods. <TR>On the contrary</TR>, we can a lot of produsts by using machine. <TR>For example,</TR> it took at least one month that our ancestors made just a suit but now we can produce a host of suits in the plant which use machine.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>The second reason why I prefer using machines is that it enables us more wealthy.</MI2> <SI2>we can get many goods easily that we need during our lives. Because of the scarcity of the products during the ancient era, our father and mother had a cold very frequently due to the no clothes. but because of the mass production by using machines we can welcome the winter warmly.</SI2></BO2> <CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, working by using machines is helpful to us in many ways : mass produciton and offulence. If we have to return to the old ages, it would be very sirious situation. That`s why I like using machines.</CO>
column23: Your essay is all right, but it doesn't really answer the question. When you work, what do YOU prefer - using machines or working by hand?

column1: 67&(Some say games are important to grown ups. Do you agree withe the idea?)
column3: <IN>Some people say that games are mementous for the growth of children. I completely agree with these statements, for games stimulate children¡¯s brains and emotions. <TS><TR>However</TR>, I also believe that several kinds of games are necessary for adults. That is mainly because of the amusement and the mental health of adults.</TS> Through the use of several examples and specific explanation, I will demonstrate why games are so essential to them.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, games satisfy the basic desire for ¡°fun¡± of adults.</MI1> <SI1><TR> In my view</TR>, all the people have the desire for amusement regardless of age or sex. As this is fundamental and trinsic, people including adults try to search for exciting events. Glasser, a famous psychologist, maintained that human beings have five basic-want such as belonging, love and power etc. One of those is the desire for fun. <TR>For instance</TR>, we can observe everywhere old men who play chess on the side of roads. In spite of aged people, they also would satisfy their desire for fun. <TR>Therefore</TR>, games are indispensable for adults.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI1><TR>Second</TR>, games are helpful to improve the mental health of adults.</MI1> <SI1>Most of adults have a great deal of stress due to the money, the personal relations and the work. Accordingly, some of them get rid of stress by playing games such as computer games, chess, puzzle and so on. I¡¯ll take a company for instance. <EX>In a electronic company that I know, workers have a time for computer games instead of drinking in the bar after finishing their work. They say that computer games are more funny and useful in getting rid of their stress than other means.</EX> Adults often have mental help from games.</BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, games are valuable for adults as well as children because those make them mentally healthy and their strong craving for fun weaken. I propose that all workers in my country enjoy playing diverse games as a substitute for getting drunk.</CO>
column23: A very good essay! Nice work!

column1: 68& ( What is the puporse of studying abroad?)
column3: <IN>In Korea, many students go aboard mainly to study foreign languages. Because English is a very influential language in the world, more and more students try to learn it aboard. <TS><TR>However,</TR> apart from learning languages, there are more reasons why students study aboard: Thdy can learn subjects that are even more developed aboard than in Korea. Also, they can broaden their cultural expriences.</TS> </IN><BO1><MI1>To learn a subject more effectively and accurately, we need to go to the countries where the subject is highly developed.</MI1> <SI1><TR>For example</TR>, if we want to learn about spacecraft, it is better for us to go to Amercia. If we want to learn 'history of art', U.K is the proper place to learn. In short, we can study the subect that is not advanced in Korea in a good environment to study.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>When students go aboard, they can experience other culture directly.</MI2> <SI1>That is another merit of studying aboard. As they contact with different people, they will find out whatthe cultural variety is like. Eventually, students will get used to the term'globalization' and learn dirrerent culture not from the text books, but from their own expriences.</SI2></BO2><CO>Today, many students go aboard to study. If they are really to learn many things in there, they will bring back their own experience as well as the knowladge they learn. <TR>However,</TR> if students know much about their own culture, that will be helpful to understand other cultures.</CO>
column23: This is a very good essay! Your thesis statement could be stronger by making it a little shorter, and I think you need to add a little more information to your second main paragraph. Otherwise, you've done an excellent job!

column1: 69&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? A zoo has no useful purpose. Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN>I disagree with the statement that zoos have no useful purpose. <TR>On the contrary</TR>, <TS>zoos serve several important functions for people as well as for animals. </TS>Collecting animals from all over the world and placing them in zoos aids zoologists and veterinarians with their research of these animals. The people, especially children, who visit zoos are entertained and amused as they develop a greater appreciation for animals. </IN><BO1><MI1>Zoos are places we visit to see various animals but they are also frequently centers for animal research.</MI1> <SI1>Veterinarians engage in studies which help to preserve the lives of animals through a better understanding of parasites and diseases that plague animals. Medicines and vaccines are developed through this scientific research.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>The zoos of the world offer the visitor a pastoral environment to enjoy the beauty of nature which contrasts the urban areas surrounding the zoos.</MI2> <SI2>Children and adults alike spend a happy, peaceful day at the zoo as a welcomed vacation from city life. They can see and learn about strange and exotic animals not found in their homelands.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3>The animals and their natural environments benefit from the existence of zoos.</MI3> <SI3>In a zoo they escape the illegal poaching that causes the destruction of their species. The animals are bred in zoos to prevent their extinction and increase their population.</SI3></BO3><CO>Zoos have a valuable purpose in our modern would. They provide for animals a pleasant living environment which facilitates research to aid animals and expand human knowledge. The animals are cared for by the zoos' veterinarians and the species are protected against extinction. Visitors can relax and enjoy the beauty of nature not normally found in urban or suburban environments.</CO>
column23: A very good essay! If you take out the transition in your thesis statement, it will be perfect. I think your introduction and your conclusion are a little too similar - what can you do to make them different?

column1: 70&In the future, student may have the choice of studing at home by usinfg technology such as computer or television of at traditional schools. Which do you prefer? Use reasons and specific details to explain your choice.
column3: <IN>Up to dated facilities for education such as remote computer systems and multi-media enable students to study at home. These facilities have many advantages: they don¡¯t have to attend classes at school and acquire information as soon as possible. Though these convenient systems were introduced to educational fields, most student and teacher stick to traditional method like textbook and black board. Here are some examples to demonstrate. </IN><BO1><SI1>First, multi-media systems are possible to connect between student and teachers without meeting each other and enable student to study at home. <MI1>These systems have some disadvantages in that they are impossible for student to experience interactive action gained by school activity.</MI1> <TR> For example</TR>, they are able to make friend at school and through interactive activity they are easy to find self-image with comparing themselves with their friends. Most of all, education at school represented traditional studying method will prevent widely spread selfishness. Group study at school is aim at this.</SI1></BO1><BO2>Second, today society can be changed very fast when comparing the last. The evolution is not always good and follows the problem of adaptation. Now our up to dated education change so fast that students have difficulty adjusting to this system quickly. This fast change causes them to confuse their life and compel them to demand prompt adaptation to study. Also, both systems and know-how gained by past method are lasted very short time and are replaced with new systems. Eventually, new systems are enables them to fail to their school life unless students learn about new systems at school.</BO2><CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, though new technology like computer are introduced at educational fields, they will somewhat keep face with old method.</CO>
column23: I think you need to read the question again. It is asking which method you prefer, traditional or high-tech, and why. Your essay almost gets there but doesn't quite hit the mark. Try again. Make sure to have a thesis statement in your introduction and to start your main paragraphs with one main summarizing sentence.

column1: 71&What are some important qualities of a good supervisor(boss)? Use specific details and examples to explain why these qualities are important?
column3: <IN>I think it is the one of the most important to be a good boss. Because, the growth of a person is largely dependent on his workers and good workes tend to gather to good boss. The faith and the loyalty of his workers is the one of the most welthy things. <TS>So, which thing are important to be a good boss? I think that unbiasness and deep knowlege to his work is more important than any other thing.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>Indiferreness is very important to manager.</MI1> <SI1>Manager should evaluate his workers by only his ability and result, not by closeness, frendshipness and on on. If he is affected by such things, his workers would not work for him hard. Because, even though he works deligently, it would not be admited and prized by his boss. According to the survey in newspapers, most people are frustrated by their boss's biased determinations. We know that although Hansin(Chinese general) was the best general, he rebeled to his boss because kings doesn't admitted his ability and his victores by other general's abusement and jealousy.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>I think manager should be a expert in the field he is working.</MI2> <SI2>He should learn and learn in his field endless. Because he should sometimes take a important choose which might be followed by considerable result, he should be familiar with his field. If they have only little knowledge, his workers can't follow him easily and his results seem to be wrong.</SI2></BO2><CO>Is there anyone who want to work under different boss? What if gifted person is not prized and person which doesn't have ability is prized? What if your boss has lettle knowledge to work which you are involved in? Summing up, indiferrence and knowledge to his field is important to good boss.</CO>
column23: Your essay is good, but I would drop the theoretical questions. Turn your thesis statement into a full statement instead of a statement and a question and it will be much stronger. Remember, when you write an essay, you want to TELL your reader, not ASK.

column1: 72&Many students choose to attend schools or universities outside their home countries. Why do some students study abroad? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
column3: <IN><TR>Nowadays</TR> many students try to go schools or universities which are located abroad. Some people think that the main reason is that students want to learn other languages while others insist that the reason is that to study abroad can help students improve their insights. <TS><TR>In my opinion</TR>, many students study abroad because of two reasons : to experience new and various things and to study more deeply what they want to know.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, As studying abroad, students can experience and learn unique and various cultures.</MI1> <SI1>From my view point, this is the best benefit which students get from attending other countries' schools, for they can broaden their outlook. <EX><TR>To illustrate</TR>, I have a friend who have been studying in China. She not only speaks Chinese fluently but understnads Chinese culture and society so well. So, she sometimes tells me about differences between our country and China. That is, she has a much more wider outlook than me.</EX> Attending schools outside their home countries can be very beneficialy for students like my friend.</SI2></BO1> <BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, going abroad for study can be a good chance to learn many things more deeply for students who live in developing countries.</MI2> <SI2>I think that developed countries like U.S.A and Japan have better educational circumstances and much information in various fields. So, as attending shools ouside their home countries, students can develop their own abilities more efficiently.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> Many students choose to study abroad, for they can get many advantages. Good educational systems can make a student an eminent scholar. As much as that, studying abroad can be a very good way to study .</CO>
column23: I think you have written a very good essay; however, your two main points sort of sound like the same point. You should combine them to make one strong argument.

column1: 73&It is better for children to grow up in the countryside than a big city. Do you agree or disagree? Use specific reasons and details to develop your essay.
column3: <IN>Many parents move to big city rather than country side. The education for their children is main reason for them. This reflects that big city is suitable for the education for children. <TS>I think that because good school are located mainly in big city and they can easily use the education facilities such as library, museum, theater and so on, I disagree that coutryside is better.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>In most cases, schools in big city provide better education.</MI1> <SI1>You can know it by looking the case of Korea. In Koera, good schools for gifted students such as science school, artistic school are largely located in Seoul, the Capital of Korea. According to the survey, the case of big city is much higher than that of country side in the rate to enter the good University. Look at the powerful and famous people's school. You can discover that they are from the school of big city.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Big city provides many facilities for children.</MI2> <SI2>These facilies are built according to accessiblity, they are mainly constructed in big city.Children might visit the museum and they would learn about the history and culture. They might go to theater and it might help them develop their artistic sense. Libraries located in big city provide them many books and they will be the basic source for children's knowledge.</SI2></BO2><CO>I know the country side has their own merit - beautiful environment, leisure life and so on. But, children in big city can visit it weekend and learn about them. They don't need to live and get education there for 24 hours. Becuase their merit are small when compared by advantages of big city's education such as things I mentioned. I suggest you would think why parents immigrant to big city and even another country for their children.</CO>
column23: This is a great essay! Your thesis statement is worded a little oddly. Rephrase it and your essay will be perfect.

column1: 74&In your country, is there need for land to be left to be in its natural condition, or is there more need for land to be developed for housing and industry? Use specific resons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>As population increase recently, they utilize natural land to expand residential area and commercial area as keep pace with population. Though it is necessary for them to survive, they are likely to misuse land under development. On the other hand, undestroyed land ,what is called natural land, provide them with space to rest and habitat for animals. <TS>So, l agree that we preserve natural land rather than develop land for house and industry.</TS> Here are some examples to demonstrate.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, natural land ,so to speak country, give us space for rest.</MI1><SI1><TR> For instance,</TR> people tend to spend time on visiting not in the countryside but in the urban area on weekend because they want to escape tedious life, and can refresh their mind in the country. <TR>In addition</TR>, natural land allow them to breath fresh air deeply and help to maintain their healthy. If they use natural land for residence and industry without preserving it, they will lose this benefit. Once land was destroyed by human, it is difficult to recover as previous condition. <TR>Therefore</TR>, we may as well preserve natural land to enjoy benefit.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>SecondM/TR>, natural offer animals to habitat.</MI2> <SI2><TR>To illustrate</TR>, When humans have cultivated land which was used for agriculture and residence, <TR>on the other hand</TR>, development by them deprive animals of their habitat. Also unreasonable development cause to pollute ecosystem like river and mountain where animals live. Human don't survive any more, unless animals live in the earth. Eventually, Humans have a duty to preserve natural land.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, uncultivated land reward humans for space for rest and provide animals with habitat. This is reason why I strongly agree that humans have a responsibility to keep on natural land, and must preserve uncultivated land.</CO>
column23: Your essay is pretty good. Watch your transitions, because you are very close to using too many of them.

column1: 75&Would you prefer to live in a traditional house or in a modern apartment building? Use specific reasons and details to suport your choice.
column3: <IN>Some people maintain that it is better to live in a traditional house. Others, meanwhile, prefer to live in a modern apartment building. Of course, it may true that no one sholuld understimate the benefits of a traditional house, I think.<TS><TR> But on the whole</TR>, I agree with those people who claim that living in a apartment is the best way for us.</TS> Now, the use of a couple of specific reasons and examples, I will demonstrate a basis of my assertion. </IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Foremost</TR>, an apartment is comfortable to menage.</MI1> <SI1>It has such a simple structure that we can clean it easy. Rooms are very close each other. So, we can clean them without big problems. <TR>Moreover</TR>, it is not only good to clean but also good for education. As you know, in many case, apartments are built in urban area, and those area has a lot of schools and institutes. <TR>Therefore</TR>, becuase most apartments is in big cities, if you live in the apartment, you will get these advantages.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addtion</TR>, seen from government perspective, there are one more elective advantage, land-saving.</MI2> <SI2>Especially, in my country, as the population has gone off since the 1980s, This phenomenon called the lack of the land for accomodating house. <TR>However,</TR> because many apartments are built in relatively small area; comparing the area used in a traditional house, this problem is solved. <TR>Thus</TR>, government should be going to build much more apartments, and most people will live in them.</SI2></BO2><BO3><SI3><TR>However,</TR> I can't deny the important of traditional houses as a beautiful landscape. In my country, these are used in tourist industry. <TR>Accordingly</TR>, we should not ignore this useful effect.</SI3></CO><CO>Clearly, living in a modern apartment building is comfortable to menage. <TR>Moreover,</TR> It solves indirectly the problem by increasing population. <TR>For these reasons</TR>, to live in a modern apartment building is best for mang purposes and should be preferred when possible.</CO>
column23: This essay is pretty good. You seem to veer a little from the subject in your first paragraph when you start talking about schools¡¦ just focus on the living quarters. Also, I would take out the paragraph about the advantages of the traditional home. It does not help your argument.

column1: 76&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Universities should give the same amount of money to their students¡¯ sports activities as they give to their university libraries. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>Universities have many programs for teaching and training students. They are supported from government, a foundation, registration fee, and so on. Today, the leaders of university have to decide whether to give a same amount of money to their students¡¯ sports activity as their library or not.<TS> I don¡¯t agree with this opinion by some reasons.</TS> From now on, I will say those reasons.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, the main purpose of programs in university is studying, not being famous in sports activity.</MI1> <SI1>One of most important things for studying is having a good library. Many students can find books and use the Internet for getting information. I know several universities that are noted for the basketball teams, not for the teaching and researching programs. That is not on the original purpose of university.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, the students in sports teams are not as much as others, so it is unfair that university spends a same amount of money for a small number of students in sports teams.</MI2> <SI2>If they invest in their libraries, many students, even the students in sports teams, can use them.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Finally</TR>, the money needed for the sports activity can be obtained from the admission fee, performance fee in CF, and so on.</MI3> <SI3>If, however, I have to pay for entering a library, reading a book and using the Internet, I would not go to the library. <TR>Therefore</TR>, the only source of library for being supported is university.</SI3></BO3> <CO><TR>In conclusion</TR., I disagreed with the opinion of this problem by some reasons. The library of my university is not bad, but I want more books and computers for using the Internet. I hope that the library has so powerful system and many books that I can use it with pleasure.</CO>
column23: This is a great essay except for your thesis statement. You need to say WHAT you disagree with and briefly state your reasons. Your argument is great! I suggest adding more to your second main paragraph.

column1: 77&Some people prefer to eat at food stands or restaurants. Other people prefer to prepare and eat food at home. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>To eat well is one of basic instincts of human beings. Some people like having food at restaurants or food stands, and other people prefer to prepare food by themselves and eat at home. In my case, <TS>I prefer to go outside for eating, because of the time, cost and chance to eat many kinds of foods.</TS></IN> <BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, to eat at restaurants or food stands saves my time.</MI1> <SI1>I¡¯m a student, and want to spend time in studying as much as possible. If, <TR>however</TR>, I make and eat food by myself, I have to go to markets, cook foods and wash dishes. I don¡¯t want to spend time with doing these.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, to prepare food costs more than to eat at restaurants or food stands.</MI2> <SI2>In markets, they sell stuffs by a certain amount, but, sometimes, the volume is so big that I have to waste the remained foods because I live alone.</SI2></BO2> <BO3><MI3><TR>Most of all</TR>, I love having special, delicious and, sometimes, strange foods.</MI3> <SI3>In restaurants, there are many kinds of food, so I can try those. <EX><TR>For example</TR., on last weekends, I went a France restaurant, and eat a little bit expensive food whose name I can¡¯t remember. It was a great experience and this pleasure is one reason that I prefer to go to restaurants or food stands.</EX></SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I said why I like more eating at restaurants or food stands than preparing food by myself. In my thought, the best delicious food is one that a chef puts his whole mind to making it.</CO>
