Also, that kind of knowledge may be only superficially understood and may not be effective in influencing people's mentality.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>On the other hand,</TR> we can obtain profound knowledge directly from our own experience.</MI2> <SI2>That sort of knowledge could affect our way of thinking deeply and play a crucial guiding role in our lives. Also, such knowledge is not easily forgettable. But it is not easy to get vast knowledge through experience. That kind of knowledge may be accessible only to a limited extent. Despite some of these disadvantages to gaining knowledge through experience, such knowledge can give us more essential and precious lessons. Through direct experience we can change our standards of value and ways of thinking. Knowledge from experience could influence our lives more crucially than knowledge from books.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> I emphasize that knowledge acquired through experience plays a more important role in our lives than knowledge gained through reading books.</CO>
column23: The first body paragraph could have been organized a little better. Some of the stuff in that paragraph could have been in the intro paragraph. The second paragraph could have used an example.

column1: 217&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Universities should give the same amount of money to their students' sports activiries as they give to their university libraries. Use specific reasons and exemples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN><TS>I agree that Universities should give the same amount of money to their students' sports activiries as they give to their university libraries.</TS> I stress the importance of students activities because sports activities can improve our health, students learn sprit of cooperation through sports, and university can earn the reputation through sports.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> sports activities improve our health.</MI1> <SI1>Most people agree that a health is as important as studying, because a health is basement of study. <EX>In fact, when I had a cold in my midterm, I finally failed that exam.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> students learn spirit of cooperation through sports.</MI2> <SI2>When students enjoy sports together, they are closed each other, and have a good friendship. <EX>I got many friends from sports.</EX></SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Third,</TR> university can earn the reputation through sports team.</MI3> <SI3>In Korea, many sports teams enhance their university's name. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> Yonsei University is famous with baseball team, and Korea University is famous with soccer team.</EX></SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> Universities should give the same amount of money to their students' sports activiries as they give to their university libraries, because of improving students' health, learning sprit of cooperation, and earning the reputation.</CO>
column23: The supporting ideas could have been developed further. They were very short without much elaboration, especially the examples.

column1: 218&Some students prefer to study alone. Others prefer to study with a group of students. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Some student like studying alone; others prefer to study with group..Both sytle of study have disadvantage and advantages and the choice may defend on one's personality. <TS><TR>However</TR> I prefer to group-studying because it is more creative, effecient and fun than solo-studying.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> through group studying, we can study more creatively.</MI1> <SI1>Because if we study together, we can discuss and get more creative results or solutions on problems. Although if we couldn't get perfect result, many different persons' opinions will still show us the many diffenrent kind of views on problems and they will help us understand the problem more deeply.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> we can get more mental support through group studying.</MI2><SI2><EX><TR>In my experience,</TR> when I get tired, exhausted, or depressed by diapointing results, the study group members were the best people whom I could defend on. They could also provide me strong will and the power that made me study again.</EX> In additon, we can study and discuss with fun and eventualy can 'enjoy' it by group studying.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> group studyng is more effecient and creative. Furthermore, we can 'enjoy' studying because we can avoid getting tired or depressed by encourging each others in group studying.</CO>
column23: The first body paragraph could have benefitted from an example, showing how group studying ended up working out better than it would have alone. Otherwise this was a good essay.

column1: 219&If you had enough money to buy either a business or a home, which would you prefer to buy? Use specific reasons to explain your preference.
column3: <IN>People always do their best to get what they want, especially enough money. If people had enough money, some people would want to buy a business, while others would buy a home. <TS>If I had a chance to buy either a business or a home, I would prefer to buy a business because it can help me develop myself, and give me a chance to live more happily.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> I can have a chance to improve my abilities through a business.</MI1> <SI1>To run a business, many people are competing in various fields. So, if I had a business, I should work hard and always try to develop myself by studying more harder. Through these process, I will be able to make myself a better person than I am.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> I can participate in many good events and give some money for people.</MI2> <SI2>If I try to my business going on well, I will be able to earn much money. Then, I can hire many employees and provide many places and institutions where people can be educated and get amusements. And through these activities, I can get along with many people and live more happily.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> if I have enough money, I would like to buy a business, for I can be a person who I want and help many people. In my opinion, a life which help other people and develop oneself is better than a life which is just comfortable for oneself.</CO>
column23: Some grammar and semantic errors but overall this was a good essay.

column1: 220&In your country, is there more need for land to be left in its natural condition or is there more need for land to be developed for housing and industry? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>My country, S.Korea was famous for it's beatiful natural environment at past time. Chinese once called Korea 'a country of silk landscape'. <TS><TR>However,</TR> korea's natural resources being baldy destroyed nowadays due to planless develpment. Thus, I think we korean start to make effort on keeping our land in nature condition.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> there left little green areas in korea.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>For example,</TR> recently, people who live in Seoul can rarely see forest around Seoul and they still need green areas to rest and relax. However, In big citys like Seoul, the lack of 'green areas'is getting worse and worse due to the development for housing or industry. The planless development must be stopped because it is decreasing our quality of life.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> we need more land to be kept in nature condition for preserve our environment.</MI2> <SI2>Developing for housing and industry mostly means destroying green areas. And it will undoubtedly result to destoying our nature environment. <TR>Furthermore,</TR> the green areas minmize the effect of pollutions. If we won't keep land to be nature condition, we cannot get that benifits.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> Korea have to keep its land in nature codition, because we korean need to green area to increae our quality of life and minimize the effect of pollutions. I think it's time to think about how to keep our green area even better.</CO>
column23: The part of the first body paragraph that was transitioned into as an example is more of a supporting idea. An example would have been talking about a specific area of Korea where this was happening. Such an example would have helped both paragraphs.

column1: 221&Some highschool requires all students to wear school uniforms . Other high schools permit students to decide what to wear to school. Which of these two school policies do you think is better?
column3: <IN><TS>Almost every highschool encourages students to wear school uniforms in korea. by wearing uniforms, we can feel identity, equal and more concenturate on study.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> Wearing unifoms help us to notice our social status.</MI1> <SI1>Especially,students woudering around about their identity in their teenage,but by wearing the same way of clothing, we can feel sence of belongs and notice oneself in school of society.In addition, we can reduce any risks such as teenger crime rates.By wearing uniforms, they began to act like students because everybody can notice that she or he is a student furthermore whcich school they belong to. <EX><TR>For instance,</TR> there is no one smokes on the street wearing their school uniforms</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Also,</TR> we can be treated equally by wearing same clothes.</MI2> <SI2>people, no matter out-side school or inside-school, judges other person from their appearence such as clothing and treat them differently.As a matter of fact, it is true that rich people wears famous brand clothes and looks just great but poor person's outfit is so shabby.Uniforms prevents this phenomenom which is that students feel inferior of superior from thier clothes in school.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Lastly,</TR>This policy makes us to more concenturate on study which is we should do as a students.</MI3> <SI3>Since teenagers are sensible to their appearence to other person, sometimes, they even distinguish people from their outfit. if we take the policy that allowing students to wear what ever they want, almost every students will spend most of their morning time for worring what to wear in front of mirror and in even classroom they will spend time to talk about other's outfint instead of concenturate on study.On the another words, unforms make us less concern on the way of clothing.</SI3></BO3><CO>Some of the people may prefer to free-clothing in school because of its confortability and fasionable and charaters.However, wearing uniforms make us to realize social status and can be treated equally.So that we can concenturated on our duty.i'm sure that this policy should be continue in highschool</CO>
column23: There were many errors with grammar, punctuation, capitalization, etc. which made the essay difficult to read. There was no real thesis, because the subject is to take a stance on whether uniforms are better or not. The supporting information was not organized very well.

column1: 222&How do movies or television influence people¡¯s behavior? Use reasons and specific examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>People say that movies and television have much influence on people¡¯s behavior. Some people say that it isn¡¯t true. <TS>In my opinion, I think that it is possible to be influenced by movies, because we can see and feel emotions while watching a movie.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>In the first place,</TR> I think that when we are watching movies, everything is dark except the screen. Moreover, we have to concentrate on understanding the story. If we are impressed deeply, we can remember more clearly.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>For example,</TR> I can remember what Julia Roberts wore in the last scene in ¡°Pretty Woman.¡± After I watched this movie, I wanted to be Julia Roberts, so I wanted to buy clothes like her. I have some memories about another movie, which is ¡°Cocktail.¡± <TR>Also,</TR> when I watched the movie ¡°Cocktail,¡± I was very impressed. After that, when I drank a beer, I always ordered the Budweiser, because the Budweiser¡¯s neon sign remained in my memory.</EX> We are influenced by movies or television. Some people like to do similarly as a movie¡¯s hero or heroine, such as buying clothes like his or hers, or drinking the same soda as he or she had.</SI1></BO1><CO><TR>Therefore,</TR> movies and television do influence people¡¯s behavior. Because of this, we should be careful about what we watch. Movies and television are powerful. I believe that they influence people to buy clothes and special products that they might not need.</CO>
column23: There was only one body paragraph, so the transition wasn't appropriate. The examples were good, but the connection between the examples and the main idea was not very strong. A support idea that explains it would have helped.

column1: 223&Because of development in communication and transportation, countries are becoming more and more alike. How is your country becoming more similar to other places in the world? Use specific examples and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>Today the world is assimilating and countries are becoming more and more similar. The lifestyles of people in each country are becoming alike by modernization, as are ways of thinking between young generations regardless.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>Almost all countries have pursued modernization and this has caused similar styles of living.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>For example,</TR> about one hundred years ago, people¡¯s lives of South Korea were not like today. At that time many Koreans followed their own traditions and they didn¡¯t accept western culture. However, after Kap-O-Kyongjang in 1896, a kind of movement for westernization, the reformation under modernization has changed the lifestyle of many Koreans thoroughly. Today the Korean¡¯s including my own life pattern is totally different from that time because they are modernized. Everyday as soon as I get up, I push the start button of my IBM computer and begin to check my e-mail. I use the same programs as others: Windows and Internet Explorer. In addition I enjoy eating Macdonald¡¯s hamburger with a cup of Coke and wearing Levis¡¯ jeans.</EX> This pattern of my life is not unique but a typical one in modern society. I think that it is the result of most countries pursuing modernization.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition to</TR> the changing of outward lifestyles, the way of thinking between young generations is becoming similar.</MI2> <SI2><EX>I grew up mostly in Korea and I surely have specific features as a Korean affected by Confucianism, like revering an elderly person. However, two months ago when I came to the U.S., I did not have had difficult problems living in the U.S.. For instance, last weekend I had a small party with new friends in my school who were Asian and American. Although we came from different places, I found there were lots of common things among us. We pursue a more convenient and liberal lifestyle than an old generation has; sometimes I have more in common with an American friend than being with my family.</EX> By modernizations like using Internet and developing transportation, people between different countries correspond each other conveniently and can share their the ways of living and eventually this causes people to have a similar way of thinking.</SI2></BO2><CO>I believe that the world will become more and more alike; not only their lifestyles but also their ways of thinking are in common. Of course, it is important that each country has to keep its own unique culture because it has values precious to our society. However, I think that becoming one world and assimilating each culture is inevitable.</CO>
column23: The lack of transitions made changes in topic a little confusing at times. The support ideas were made almost entirely of examples; it would have benefitted from further explanations of what ideas the examples illustrate.

column1: 224&some young children spend a great amount of their time practicing sports. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of this. Use specific reasons and examples to support.
column3: <IN><TS>People may have different opinions about children¡¯s spending a great deal of time on sports. Some may suppose the opposite sides of sports like improvement of their health while others may worry about its negative effects on kids. Among advantages and disadvantages, I suggest that while exercising sports they can learn sociality like a spirit of cooperation yet too much of it might take too much time that can be used to learn other things or harm their health.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> sociality could be developed by practicing sports.</MI1> <SI1>Most sports games have their own rules which participants should obey and while playing children can learn many things about observance, living with other persons, etc. Additionally, doing with many sports game, they should cooperate with each other or others to achieve the goals. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> a baseball game have its regulation and a player who participate in the game should comply the rule. To get points one cannot get by oneself and one should cooperate with others. In this manner, children may learn observance of rules, cooperative mind in society.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> if children spend too much time practicing sports, they might lose their time to do other activities.</MI2> <SI2><TR>In addition,</TR> it may do harm to their health and cause unbalanced physical development. They have many things to learn and do like reading books or speaking with their parents; however, time may be not sufficient if it is spent mostly on spots. <TR>Moreover,</TR> sports games generally strengthen body and it might affect to children negatively. <EX><TR>To illustrate,</TR> in a squash game a player uses one arm much more than another arm and it may cause unbalanced growth of arms.</EX> As stated above, sports can deprive children of their time and undesirable health improvement.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> practicing sports have both positive and negative side in mental and physical aspects. <TR>However,</TR> if children play sports not exceedingly, sports games would help develop kids¡¯ characteristics in balance.</CO>
column23: Because the two paragraphs oppose each other, "First" and "Second" are not appropriate transitions as those imply that the thoughts are continuous. Transitions denoting a counter would have been better, like "On the one hand" and "On the other hand" or something to that extent. The first example could have benefitted with a follow-up sentence which sums up what the example illustrates.

column1: 225&People recognize a difference between children and adults. What events (experiences or ceremonies) make a person an adult? Use specific reasons and examples to explain your answer.
column3: <IN>People experience many events while they are growing up. <TS>As they experience events and think more and more, they became mentally mature adults gradually. Among these events, I can suggest some decisive events that affect greatly and noticeable: A marriage and an education in higher school like college.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>The most drastic changes are made through a marriage.</MI1> <SI1>Most people generally marry in the age of between 25 and 30. Before then, they depend mostly on their parents and they recognize responsibilities of their own lives just a little bit. However, after they married, they would come to know of the responsibilities regarding their partner and their kids. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> a friend of mine named Eu-taek feel such feelings much more after his marriage. He works harder than ever before and thinks more for his wife and his daughter.</EX> In this manner, a marriage would make people think about life and responsibility; therefore, it makes a grown up people adult.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Additionally,</TR> an education in higher school may influence people to become adults.</MI2> <SI2>While they study and play, perhaps work for a part time job, they generally think deeply and creatively than the previous time. Much debating with friends, pondering over things and working to earn money would make them mature. It is not only because of the education courses but also because of additional activities that what make people grow mentally. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> I just took courses in high school passively and spent most time on study. Years had passed but I was just a physically adult but in the university, I thought much by myself and worked to earn money and these made me a mentally adult.</EX> Therefore, I think that an education and additional activities lead people to a mentally mature status.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> as I mentioned above, a marriage and an education in higher school are main causes of becoming adults because they let people think over and know about responsibility. Much thoughts and awareness of responsibility from them would make people real grown-ups, adults.</CO>
column23: Some grammar and semantic issues, but otherwise this was a good essay.

column1: 226&Why do you think some people are attracted to dangerous sports or other dangerous activities? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>In recent times, there are many sports or activities. Almost people enjoy and play these sports. Although some of these are so dangerous, why people enjoy these sports?</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> dangerous sports give a challenge.</MI1> <SI1>That is addictive to people. <EX>Once I played ski, I fall and scrach my arms. But I decided I will be a good ski player. From then, I have practiced a lot.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> through a dangerous sports, people can learn how to take off the dangerous.</MI2> <SI2><EX>I was in a bind, I tried to think how to take off this moment. It is a worthwhile experience to me.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO><TR>For these reasons,</TR> people are attracted to dangerous sports or other dangerous activities. But we must pay attention to all times when we are doing dangerous things.</CO>
column23: There was no real thesis. The thesis should have summed up the ideas, but it only asked the same question as the prompt. The main and support ideas were too short and poorly developed, and grammar and spelling issues made the essay difficult to understand.

column1: 227&Some people think that children should begin their formal education at a very early age and should spend most of their time on school studies. Others believe that children should spend most of their time playing. Compare these two views. Which view do you agree with? Why?
column3: <IN>Many parents want to decide the ways about how to teach their children. <TS>Some people say that formal education at an early age can improve children¡¯s abilities; Others, let their children concentrate on playing. Two aspects both have advantages and disadvantages, so it is useful for us to inspect two ways of teaching, choose one method, and apply to our own children.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> let¡¯s think about the earlier education. This has some advantages, especially in respect of the capacities of children. It can make children versatile in their young age.</MI1> <SI1>When children become teenagers, they have a lot of things to do as their major or hobby. The Most important advantage is that earlier education can evoke their potential abilities, that otherwise could not be found. So children come to know what their talents are or what they cannot do well. But earlier education also have disadvantages such as slow growth of mental, physical abilities. They could become physically infirm or extremely rational that they cannot live in concord with other people.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second, I will inspect the details about letting children play. Children have a natural tendency to play on a large playground with their friends. So encouraging their natural tendency can uplift their mental, physical abilities, so they would be a sound teenagers.</MI2> <SI2>And it can help children learn cooperation with friends, become more social. But it has disadvantages. It is likely that children cannot know about their talent at their earlier age so they could not decide which major to choose in their teen. And compared with other children, they could have less abilities in respect to learning or studying.</SI2></BO2><CO>As has been previously stated, both ways have their own advantages. So I want to conclude that rather than singling out one way of teaching, we had better adopt an eclectic method: Let our children mainly study at their earlier ages to enhance their learning abilities, and make their studying keep pace with playing to strengthen their mental, physical health. This eclectic method needs a sensible time schedule of children and parent¡¯s careful exertion. But This can improve their children¡¯s mental, physical abilities and sociability equally, so their children will be an very good adults, who have a sound character.</CO>
column23: This kind of topic could have benefitted from some statistics. Each of the body paragraph really had two topics that probably should have been divided into two paragraphs.

column1: 228&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? All students should be required to study art and music in high school. Give specific reasons to support your opinion.
column3: <IN><TS>Teaching art and music to high school students is controversial. Someone insist that All high school students should learn art and music, since it is important subjects. Others argue that art and subject shuld not be mandetory in high school, since time is not sufficient to learn those to them. But I think it is quite important subjects to high school students.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> art and music is as important as other subjects, like math and science.</MI1> <SI1>For the entire life, art and music nurish our souls very much, though those do not make us become a wealthy man. Sometimes we need to relax and enjoy our life after hard working. With out art and music, that kinds of our relax could be very dry. </SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> for the most students who are not going to majore art or music in Unitversity, the high school is usually the last school which provide art and music class.</MI2> <SI2>Of course, there is no need to talk about the student who do not enter any university or any other institutions. <EX>I had a chance to learn some of well known Itanlian classic songs at my high school. I can still sing those song. But after gratuating high school, I can't have any chance to learn another classic songs.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO>From those reason, art and music have to be taught in high school. It could be very helpful for them to be a well-rounded personality. And high school is the very last place for the most of them to have any oppertunity to learn art and music.</CO>
column23: The first body paragraph would have benefitted from an example. The second paragraph communicated its ideas fine but there was no mention of why it would be important for people to know any music at all.

column1: 229&Decisions can be made quickly, or they can be made after careful thought. Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? The decisions that people make quickly are always wrong. Use reasons and specific examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>Lots of situations exist when a person wants to decide behaviors to resolve some problems. So he should take each step according to every situation. Some circumstances need a quick decision; Others, careful thought. <TS>In this essay, I will explain the details about two situations and which one is better step we should take.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> Let¡¯s think about quick decisions. We usually call the decision without careful meditation as quick decision.</MI1> <SI1>This has some defects such as the great possibility to make mistakes resulted from imprudent consideration. But there is a situation in which quick decision is necessary. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> when a company could face urgency that has to be resolved right now, the CEO should take quick measures. In this exigency, the most important factor that is prerequisite is the intuition from many experiences rather than a careful thought. Researches show that brilliant CEOs usually prefer intuition, in other words, quick decision to careful thought.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Now, how is a careful decision? This is based on the prudent deliberation.</MI2> <SI2>It also subsumes investigations from lots of data, charts and experiments, etc. It has shortcomings, that is, it requires time, and there is the possibility to ignore the intuition that is essential to decision-making. But it has a powerful merit that there is less possibility to make a mistake.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> I disagree with the statement that quick decision is always wrong. Because a quick decision as well as a careful decision has some advantages as has been previously stated. But quick decision must be followed by the follow-up measures, otherwise there will be collapses caused by indiscreet decisions and feeble foundations. The best way of take steps is to enhance our abilities to make a quick decision, namely, to discipline ourselves to grow up intuition that is based on our experiences because this method can provide us with a chance to avoid the emergency and to yield better consequences. </CO>
column23: The first body paragraph was fine, but the second one was much lacking in information in comparison, making it seem like it was purposefully being minimized.

column1: 230&In some countries, teeangers have jobs while they are still students, Do you think this is a good idea? (agree or disagree) Support your opinon by using specific reasons and details.
column3: <IN>It is true that having a job in your teens can help you become more indepent. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I think that teenagers having jobs while they are still students is a bad idea.</TS> Teenagers should enjoy themselves as teenagers and experince the things they can as adolesents, and invest their precious time and effort in self-develpment to become more valuable person.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> time is one of the most important things for everyone, especially for teenagers, so they have to spend it preciously.</MI1> <SI1>There are so many things to do while in school, such as studying, reading famous novels, participating in sports activities, and getting together with friends. There is not enough time for young students to devote themselves in jobs, so they should focus their time on other invaluable things. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> I worked in a cafeteria when I was in high school. I worked every night after school, so I did not have enough time to catch up with school, play with my friends nor do the homework. I could not do anything else properly except the work, so I quit the job and everything was back to normal. I could really enjoy myself as a teenaged school girl.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover,</TR> In many cases, adults who employ teenagers take advantage of their young employees.</MI2><SI2>Teenagers get payed much lesser money than the amount they should be payed for their works. It is beneficial for a teenager to invest time and effort not in a job but in developing himself/herself. Therefore, when he/she grows up, he/she can be treated more fairly , performing more skillfuls and respected things. <EX>My friend Susan, for instance, worked in a restaurant when she was in high school. She worked 5 hours a day for one month. She was supposed to receive W15,000 a day, but she only got payed the half amount. There was nothing she could do except complainig to the boss. She realized that complaining was useless, so she just gave up the job. She is working as an analyst thesedays, and she says that she studied hard in high school and university to get a more professional job thanks to the lesson she got from that experience.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO><TR>Consequently,</TR> working is not so favorable thing for teenagers , because it takes up their precious time and they are too young to be treated fairly. I assert that they should concentrate their spare time on reading books and participate in sports games. Furthermore, they should invest their time and effort in their self-development.</CO>
column23: The examples could have used a follow up to summarize the lesson that should be learned from them. There were some grammar and spelling errors, but otherwise this was a good essay.

column1: 231&In some countries, teenagers have jobs while they are still students, Do you think this is a good idea? Support your opinon by using specific reasons and details.
column3: <IN>It is known to be true that in some countries outside U.S teenagers have jobs while they are still students. Some people assert that students under twenty should concentrate on only studying, while others maintain that it is not undesirable to have jobs during school days. <TS>In my opinion, having jobs as a student is advantageous because it can help students not only to free from economic difficulties but also to be self-independent.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>In the first place,</TR> with the part-time job, students can manage school lives without economic difficulties.</MI1> <SI1>especially when it come to foreign students, there are not so many not to worry about tuition, purchasing of books, and so on. <EX>When I was exchange student three years ago, the price level of New york was so burdensome to me. Therefore I sought to get a part-time job at bakery nearby university. It helped to manage my school life more soundly.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>The other advantage that I want to emphasize is that earning money for myself can enhance self-independence.</MI2> <SI2>Most of the students would depend on parents' economic assistance. <TR>However,</TR> if someone makes money for himself, he is likely to realize the value of labor, and appreacite of parents' previous assistance. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> in high school I experienced the part-time in our school's snack bar. Even though my tuition was on parents, I could learn how to spend money, and how to consume economically.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> I do insist that students under 20 should have job even if they are still students. It helps students to be more affluent and to self-independence. It is the most vital element of managing their lives to realize the value of labor and to learn how to spend money.</CO>
column23: A number of grammar and spelling issues. The examples could have benefitted from follow up sentences that summarize the lesson.

column1: 232& Some say that the world would be a better place now if the automobile had never been invented. Do you agree or disagree with this statement? Use specific examples and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Automobile is known to be the harbinger of the modern society. It has saved time and money, which enabled many people to work on more productive tasks. This productivity growth led to the dawn of a modern world, a higher level of human civilization. <TS>Nevertheless, other than these convenience, there were many other unforeseen negative outcomes of the invention of the automobile.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>Although many are not aware of this, the automobile has changed people's character.</MI1> <SI1>This is because automobile had a great effect on the entire paradigm of a human life. People have turned more lazy. These days people show great hatred in walking more than several blocks, thus many people suffer from obesity. Not only are modern people lazy, but are also very quick-tempered. I have seen many disastrous traffic accidents that occurred due to the impatience of a driver.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Automobiles have also polluted our environment.</MI2> <SI2>especially the air, and used up much of the scarce resources. Air pollution has become so serious that most big cities in Asia and South America are literally killing their citizens with its dirty air. Oil and coal has turned a major concern of the superpowers. The war in Iraq is also said to be related with oil.</SI2></BO2><CO>As far as I am concerned, the invention of the automobile is nothing to be commemorated. I believe the automobile has made people seriously lazy and impatient, along with the pollution and waste of resources.</CO>
column23: Both body paragraphs would have benefitted from more specific examples. In the second body paragraph, the reference to the war in Iraq was out of place as that may be true, but has nothing to do with pollution.

column1: 233&do you agree or disagree with the following statement? parents are the best teachers.
column3: <IN>It is quite controversial considering whether the parents are the best teachers. <TS>Although it is true that there are many clever teachers who can educate children, as far as I concerned, the various advantageous facts that are gotten from parents are more significant for the better education.</TS> In this essay, I will show the reasons for my preference as follows.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>first,</TR> It goes without saying that the person who knows the best about their children is their parents.</MI1> <SI1><TR>furthermore,</TR> acknowledge about their children is the one of the priorities for efficient teaching. <EX><TR>In my case, for example,</TR> My character is so changeable that I cannot control myself sometimes when I got mad. In that situation, If someone try to correct me with strict way then it does not work out with me at all. My parents grasp(grip,catch hold of ,seize,understand) about that kind of my temperament so they can treat me and train me with efficient method. (efficient , effective, effectual , effectively, with effect.)</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>second,</TR> parents are able to educate (train, bring up) us for the longest period.</MI2> <SI2>there is no comparison between teachers and parents when It come to the length of the time that can be taught and teach. Most of the time , children cannot move out until they get married in korea. therefore, parents are the most intimate and close person who can share the life together and find out the bad habits that should be gotten rid of.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>finally,</TR> parents can offer not only the subject that is shown on the book but also the wisdom which is needed in the real life.</MI3> <SI3>We do not feel the fear from our parents when we confess our anxiety, even better, it is always possible that we make out the solution from our parents which is based on their real experiences earier.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>in conclusion,</TR> parents went though diverse conditions also there are a great deal of instructions which is helpful for us. Taking all I mentioned into the consideration, I am strongly conceived that the parents are the best teachers. Accordingly, We'd better have close relationship with our parents and a high regard for them.</CO>
column23: The first body paragraph was written well. However the second and especially the third were lacking. Specific examples, as used in the first, would have helped greatly. There were many grammar and spelling issues, such as capitalization.

column1: 234&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement ? All students should be required to study art and music in secondary school. Use specifis reasons to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>Basically, I agree with the position that all students must study art and music in their secondary school. As matter of fact, I belive art and music is needed to learn in school courses.</TS> There are two reasons to support this perspective. This is because art and music help students raise plenty emotion and undersand other cultures.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>The primary reason is</TR> that art and music give students opportunity to cultivate emotion.</MI1> <SI1>Generally speaking, music and art are abundant emotional products. Students cna feel comfortable when they are absorbed in music and art. In addition, through the courses such as music and art ,they can make atistic creations. Like these creative activities such as composition, carving and painting can develop student's emotional feeling. <EX><TR>When I was in high schools, for example,</TR> I like very much music and art classes. When I was listening to music, I felt comfortable. Also when I did about art, I could create my think to visible things.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>What's more,</TR> music and art help students know other cultures.</MI2> <SI2>Generally speaking, music and art contain various cultural characters. Such as folk songs affect people's feeling and thinkings at the time. Thus archeologists study acient music and art to konw acient cultures. <EX>In my univesity's chnese class, I learned Chinese song. Frnm since I larned easily Chinese culture. Besides I sometimes go art center to understand the other's culture.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO>As I stated above, I agreee with those who claim that all students should be required to study art and music in secondary school. There are two reasons for this: raising emotiomal feeling and understanding other cultures. Therefore it is impossible to overstate the importance of learning music and art.</CO>
column23: The first main idea was a little confusing as I'm not sure what "cultivating emotion" means. The examples were a little short and underdeveloped, and could have benefitted from follow up sentences that explained the lesson learned.

column1: 235&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Playing games teaches us about life. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>Some people say that playing games teaches about our lives. I also agree with that, because game contains a lot of factors that are similar to our real lives.</TS> Namely, playing game could be a miniature of leading a life, even though games do not have all about complex conditions that our lives have. In this essay, I will think about what characteristics our lives have in common with playing game and the reason why I agree with that statement.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> game has a turning point. That is, when playing games, we should decide what to do next or which ways to go right now.</MI1> <SI1>So do our real lives. If we could enhance our abilities to choose or decide in games, we also apply the skills to our real lives.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> playing game demands us to cooperate.</MI2> <SI2>And also, cooperation with spouse, friends or partners is essential to our lives. So the experiences from game could be examples that are also applicable to our lives.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Third,</TR> we should make plans when we play games.</MI3> <SI3>And our lives do, either. Games and lives both have goals, which are certainly not from fortuitous serendipities but from careful planning. To set up targets, run to them always needs plans that meet every situation of our daily lives. So we can learn from game the method to make plans and apply it to our lives.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> playing game has lots of similarities with our real lives such as having a turning point, and requiring cooperation and plan-making, etc. But playing game does not reflect every situation that our lives actually have. So we should not rely on games as a standard we live our lives with. We should keep it in mind that playing game is not a life itself, but only a good reference to our lives.</CO>
column23: Other than the third body paragraph, the supporting ideas were not very well-developed. The main ideas seemed to jump straight into the conclusions. Further explanations on how those principles apply to real life and examples would have helped.

column1: 236&Some young children spend a great amount of their time practicing sports. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of this. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>During childhood, children spend much time on playing various sports. It has both advantages and disadvantages such as, health promotion, encouragement of cooperation, possibility of being damaged, and retardation of studying.</TS> Through a couple of examples and explanation, I will demonstrate why I think above them.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> a good point of sport is health improvement and cooperation.</MI1> <SI1>Children need to improve of our health and learn of cooperation. Then sports can give them these benefits. <EX>When I was little girl and lived a apartment, I would play with neighbor friends. I was well running and playing, moreover I was very healthy and didn't go hospital. <TR>Furthermore, I frequently would play with many children. It made it possible for me to know importance of friends and harmony with them.</EX> In this manner, I think that during childhood advantages of sports are health improvement and cooperation.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> disadvantages of sports are to be vulnerable to damage and not to keep up with studying.</MI2> <SI2>Children like sports with many people and spend much time on sports. It contributes to be damage and to loss of studying time. <EX>One of my friends much liked playing football. Some day, he was playing for three day and was broken down his right leg. He didn't keep up with studying because of spending time of playing sports. <TR>Moreover</TR> this event made him worsen.</EX> Accordingly, sports have possibility of disadvantages such as them.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> sports of children have two traits; improvement of health, cooperation and possibility of to be harm, not to keep up with studying. Balance of these sports trait is important for healthy life of children.</CO>
column23: The thesis should have been better divided between the advantages and disadvantages. The transitions "First" and "Second" probably are not the way to go when the two main ideas are contrasting each other, rather than supporting the same idea.

column1: 237&In some countries, people are no longer allowed to smoke in many public places and office buildings. Do you think this is a good rule or a bad rule? Use specific reasons and details to support your position.
column3: <IN><TS>Many people enjoy smoking although it is harmful and may damage their health. They might be against a rule that prohibits public smoking, however, I agree with the rule in terms of indirect smoking and pollutions.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> indirect smoking may do harm to others who do not smoke.</MI1> <SI1>Several statistic surveys and investigations revealed that the health of non-smokers was much affected by the indirect smoking. It means that even if one does not smoke, he or she may have a possibility of being hurt by others¡¯ smoking. Actually it is reported that many non-smokers, especially a spouse of a smoker, already have diseases and even lung cancers. In this manner, due to undesirable effects of smoking, it should be prohibited by a rule.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Additionally,</TR> smoking in public area should be forbidden because smoke and wastes such as many small particles contaminate environment.</MI2> <SI2>While smoking, smoke and particles pollutes air and surroundings like wallpapers, curtains, other facilities in office and so forth. They are generally stained yellow by smoking. After smoking, many smokers litter wastes of cigarette on the road, and the wastes cause another pollution. Therefore, smoking should not be allowed indoors or in public places.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> to protect non-smoker¡¯s health and to maintain clean places, I am certainly in favor of the rule. With a careful consideration of smokers for non-smokers, we would enjoy healthy life in clean environment.</CO>
column23: Some grammar and semantic errors, but otherwise this was a good essay.

column1: 238& Imagine you had enough money to buy either a business or a home. Which would you prefer to buy? Use specific reasons to explain your preference.
column3: <IN>People often suppose and hope that they had enough money to buy or do something that they cannot do now. With enough money, some may want to buy a new car while others want to save or give in charity. <TS>In my case, if I should choose either to buy a business or to buy a home, I would buy a business to share money with a society and to get another achievement from it.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>The most important and desirable job to do with enough money is to share the money and contribute to the society.</MI1> <SI1>Much money must have been earned from the society and I think that some of them should be returned. To share money and contribute to the society, I might be able to donate a structure or give it to the poor. <TR>However,</TR> the most desirable method to return money would be to run a company and to hire many people. They will get a job to live on and earn money continually. In this manner, I could make and share more money; therefore, I prefer to buy a business.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Additionally,</TR> a business provide me with a chance to achieve more things than when I spend the money to buy a home.</MI2> <SI2>Buying a company does not mean just to own a business but it means to manage and arrange many things to run it properly. In modern society, there are many competitive companies with an able manager and workers. If I want to maintain my company and cope with other competitors in such a situation, I should be able to arrange and deal with many things. Through these activities I could learn much and improve myself and finally I would get a sence of achievement. That is why I want to choose a company.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> there is two main reason to buy a company; to redistribute the fortune and achievement while running a company. I think that to know how to spend money is more important than to know which to buy. Making more money and sharing it with others and achiving my job would give sound and happy lives to both me and others also.</CO>
column23: Some grammar and semantic errors but otherwise this was a good essay.

column1: 239&a company has announced that it wishes to build a large factory your community.Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of this nwe influence on your community.Do you support or oppose the factory?explain your position.
column3: <IN>Have you ever experienced that a factory had been built around your neighbor? <TS>Nevertherless we have to build factoty somewhere for industries, No one would like to have this building on their area.There are some aspect of disadvantages and advantages.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>Building factory around our neighbor can bring out economical growth for our city.</MI1><SI1>Once factory had been built, there are many jov oppportunities so that people , who is form other area, will move to this area where factory is located for thieir employment.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>As grwoing population , many other business will grow up, such as restrunt or movie theather etc.</MI2> <SI2>In addition, this mordernizationj of city will cause price rise of real estates.</SI2></BO2> <BO3><MI3><TR>However,</TR>Building this factory can cause many pollution problems such as air pollution and water.</MI3> <SI3>Some times, we even get serious ill by this substance. Not only did human beings are effectt by it , but also animals such as fish etc.</SI3></BO3><CO>After considering some aspect of two pjoint of view.i disagree to build factory around my distancedisposal of wast would be a big deal for city .Also, It may disturb me what i'm doing anytime from its noise, even sleeps. Also, this plane can cause fraffic jam especially during the rush hour day-workers. As a result, Although building factorise abrond my neighborhood will bring some advantes like economic growth and mordernization of city. this building bring us serious enviromental problems and disease.Furthermore,to builld factory, we shouls take a certain policies to make up this problems such as set up a system that purifies wastes.</CO>
column23: The format of this paragraph was really confusing. It was hard to tell where one section ended. The first and second main ideas were basically the same. The last two paragraphs really should have been combined into one conclusion.

column1: 240&Imagine you had enough money to buy either a business or a home. Which would you prefer to buy? Use specific reasons to explain your preference.
column3: <IN><TS>Everyone may have imagined to have enough money to do something he or she has really dreamed. If I am in this lucky situation, I would like to buy a business instead of buying a house, as it is more challenging, adds experience and contributes to a society.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>Ironically, buying a house is an easier and guaranteed investment than running a company in Korea, since the increase rate of houses has been much faster than bank interests. But, I would like to buy a business, because it is more challenging.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>For example,</TR> if I become an owner of a company, I will exert all my efforts to leverage the value of the company. It is not an easy job at all, however, If I success the task, I can buy more than one houses. What an excitement, it is? Besides, I can enjoy full process of running business.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Buying a business offers better chances to broaden experience about company management.</MI2> <SI2>This kind of experience is opened only for some people who have their own companies. <EX><TR>For brief example,</TR> if you are running a company by your own, you have a power to hire or fire them. You can decide to the marketing strategy for the company after studying and examining propositions you are submitted while many are stressed by routine jobs or annoyed by seniors in companies.</EX></SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>The last but most important point is</TR> an issue of social contribution.</MI3> <SI3>Believe or not, we have enjoyed a lot of social supports such as advanced education, culture, social welfare and so forth. I believe that we, a social human being, have to return these benefits to the society where we are belong to. If I buy a business, I can contribute to the society by hiring people and producing goods and services. <TR>Moreover,</TR> I can directly donate company profits to the poor, elderly and homeless.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In summarize,</TR> buying a business makes me excited, broadens managing experience and is a way to return the benefits I have enjoyed. It is obvious that both choices have many benefits in terms of productivity. However, buying a business is more beneficial, because I would like to enjoy both having big fortune and running my own company.</CO>
column23: The transitions were not very strong, which made the change in topics sometimes not very clear. The support ideas were not very strongly developed.

column1: 241&In your country, is there more need for land to be left in its natural condition or is there more need for land to be developed for housing and industry? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Generally there is some need for land to be developed for economic reasons. A development of land is essential not only for housing and industry but also for elementary infrastructures like railroads, water supplies, electronic lines, and etc. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I suggest that the natural condition of my country should be preserved in terms of its supplies and needed time to recover.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> nature gives us many important things like fresh air, water, wood, and so forth.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Additionally,</TR> nature could prevent many disasters. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> wood can retain much water that could cause floods and it provides the water to prevent a drought. In last summer, Koreans suffered a water problem brought about by unplanned, careless developments; however, if the land had stayed unchanged, the flood might have been avoided.</EX> So, I oppose the idea of development of land.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI1><TR>In addition,</TR> nature is hardly recovered when developed and it takes much time if possible.</MI2> <SI2>People generally cut a mountain, build a dam, and destroy forests to develop the land. Several changes are made through the activities and also cause extinctions of many animals. <TR>Moreover,</TR> houses and industry inevitably accompany much waste and pollution; once polluted, we should make much effort and time to recover polluted land and air. Therefore, nature should be reserved as it is.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> because nature helps to prevent natural disasters and is hard to recover, I want to stop the development. Nature is not given only to us and we have a responsibility to turn it over to descendants.</CO>
column23: The second body paragraph would have benefitted from an example like the first body paragraph, or some more researched data.

column1: 242&Neighbors are the people who live near us. In your opinion, what are the qualities of a good neighbor? Use specific details and examples in your answer.
column3: <IN>To meet a good neighbor is very lucky. However nice house we have, if we meet terrible neighbours, we can¡¯t be happy. Just imagine a gorgeous house with a luxurious pool and fantastic garden. But if people of the next door are really bothering? Maybe we need to consider moving out. <TS>Then, what are the qualities of a good neighbor? I¡¯d like to take these first.; to be quiet and to be friendly.</TS> Through several examples and specific explanation, I¡¯ll demonstrate why I chose those things.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly,</TR> I prefer a quiet neighbor to any other.</MI1> <SI1>Noise from next door masses up our everyday life. <EX>Once, I had a neighbor who had noisy parties every weekend. In addition, they watched movies with loud volume every night. The noise bothered not only sleep of my family but also ordinary life. My baby cried out all night, and my husbund should go to library for his mid-term paper even on weekends.</EX> After that experience, I got to consider a silent neighbor to be the best one.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>If I choose another quality of a good neighbor, I¡¯ll take ¡®friendly character¡¯.</MI2> <SI2>Cheerful interactions between neighbors are really joyable. <EX>Now, at my next door, there live a family with a 2-year-old son. The boy is a good friend of my 17-month-old son. And sharing small things like plants and well baked cookies and chatting on the bench in front of my house with the neighbor refreshes me.</EX> A friendly neighbor enriches my life.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> a quiet and friendly neighbor is the best for me. I am planing to move again on march. I really hope that I can meet silent and friendly neighbors because they would give me comfort and enrichment of my life.</CO>
column23: There were numerous grammar and semantic issues, if those could have been fixed this would have been a very good essay.

column1: 243& People attend college or university for many different reasons (for example, new experiences, career preparation, increased knowledge). Why do you think people attend college or university? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>College or university is the place which has been a symbol of intelligence and youth. Many people can come true their dreams and also cherish hope for the future by attending school. University of Bologna in Italy is one of the oldest universities in the world. It has been said that the first purpose of the foundation was for protecting the people living in the area and enhancing their overall abilities. Nowadays, why do people want to attend college or university?</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>The first reason is</TR> that the university graduates can have many benefits in getting a job and receiving payment.</MI1> <SI1>These days, most corporations tend to prefer the university students when hiring someone because they want to employ a person equipped with sufficient knowledge, and there are differential wages between university graduates and the other ones. So, people attend university to get better jobs and salaries.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition,</TR> most people, especially not having a confident belief about future in their high school days, can make sure by attending university what to do in the future.</MI2> <SI2>To tell the truth, most of the high school students do not know exactly which subject they are truly interested in and who they are because they are still too young to know the all above things. So, probably university will help the students to find out which career is the most suitable for themselves and to become conscious of themselves.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>The final reason is</TR> that the students can accumulate their background knowledge and also understand the social phenomena more reasonably by taking many different types of classes like liberal arts in university.</MI3> <SI3><EX><TR>In my case,</TR> I did not even know fundamental knowledge before entering university because I learned many subjects just by the cramming system of education. So, I did not get any profound attainments for that reason. Therefore, I did not realize the facts of life until attending university</EX></SI3></BO3><CO>Considering all the reasons, it seems impossible to have more useful knowledge without participating in university. I think it is one of the essential elements which form our society and the reason why we attend university is there.</CO>
column23: The supporting ideas were not very strong. They could have benefitted from examples or statistics. The essay didn't really have a real thesis.

column1: 244&When famous people such as actors, athletes and rock stars give their opinions, many people listen. Do you think we should pay attention to these opinions? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>We listen often comments of famous people about various fields. Some people tend to believe easily this comment. <TS>In my view, famous people's opinions aren't reliable, since their comments can be false and are not special opinions but just comment.</TS> Through a couple of examples and explanation, I will demonstrate why I think above them.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> opinions of celebrities, such as actors, athletes and rock stars could be false.</MI1> <SI1>Although they are public people, they always do not say true thought. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> I know some famous person and he frequently said smoking not to be harm. He was not only a famous actor but also cigar advertisement of model. However, after several years, people were getting to know that smoking was harm. <TR>Moreover</TR> they became not to belief about his comment.</EX> In this manner, celebrities can convey false belief to common people.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> they don't have special knowledge about various fields.</MI2> <SI2>Famous people say several parts like professional about them. However they aren't special person about them and some cases, they don't know them a little. <EX>I would watch on television that some athlete explained fat¡¯s importance. She said fat to be good. <TR>Furthermore</TR> she should encourage eating fat. <TR>However,</TR> I knew that to eat fat large amount is harm because of possibility of diseases.</EX> Accordingly, comments of them aren't reliable.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> I think that we shouldn't pay attention to opinions of famous people, because they can be false and aren't reliable. We have to have careful attention about opinions of various people and can discriminate true opinions.</CO>
column23: Some grammar and formatting issues, but otherwise this was a good essay.

column1: 245&Some people pay money for the things they want or need. Other people trade products or goods for what they need. Compare the advantages of these two ways of obtaining things. Which way do you prefer? Explain why.
column3: <IN><TS>People have several ways for the things they want or need. Among them, to pay money and to trade products are very common ways. Each of them has advantages, such as time saving, point of convenient and effective using of resources. In my view, I prefer a way to pay money because of time sharing and being easy on using.</TS> Through a couple of examples and explanation, I will demonstrate why I think above them.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> the way to pay money makes it possible for me to save time and to use handy.</MI1> <SI1>I need not to convey heavy products, instead only to take money. It gives me to sharing time. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> I enjoy going to market. In this area, I can buy various materials. I only go to get money without other things. Moreover, when I go to theatre, I need money in my pocket.</EX> In this manner, I think that the method paying money for the things I want or need is needed for using easily this way and saving time.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> to trade products or goods for what people need can give them to save resources.</MI2> <SI2>They give products of goods that they don't need and take what they need. This way prevents from proliferate natural resources and make materials be saved. <EX>My grandmother said that she should take products for buy what she needed, and then, in her house, products or good not to be need were getting short and like this time, house didn't complex.</EX> Accordingly, trading products contributes saving natural resources.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> two ways for the thing people want or need have several advantages. Among them I prefer the method to pay money, since this way give me to several benefits, such as saving time, using easily. I will spend the way for my prosperous life.</CO>
column23: Because the essay was contrasting two different things in each paragraph, "First of all" and "Second" are probably not the best transitions. Because of all the grammar errors there were parts of this essay that were difficult to understand.

column1: 246&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? People are never satisfied with what they have; they always want something more or something different. Use specific reasons to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>I completely agree with the statement, ¡°People are never satisfied with what they have¡± because of imagination and comparision of human.</TS> How many people are satisfying what they have? Personally, I am never like to satisfy my possession.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> imagining a better situation get people to be dissatisfied.</MI1> <SI1>If I got more money, if I was a better beautiful girl, If I met rich parents, and so on. <EX><TR>For an example,</TR> my husband recently deals in stocks. He always said if his stock¡¯s price rises , he will sell. But he couldn¡¯t sell his stocks, because of optimistic imagination. <TR>In other example,</TR> my sister had plastic operation. She always didn¡¯t satisfy her nose, so she determined plastic operation. <TR>However,</TR> today, she wants to operate her chin for better beauty.</EX> Humanity rarely satisfies one¡¯s possession.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> comparision make people to be dissatisfied.</MI2> <SI2>Greed is the instinct of the all species. Human beings are habituated to compare other people. <EX><TR>For instance,</TR> I bought a T-shirt in the Lotte department with perfect satisfaction. I saw more pretty shirts on the way to came down the first floor and then I rightly regretted my choice. Comparision bring me to dissatisfy.</EX></SI2><CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> I am in favor of the opinion People are never satisfied with what they have. But dissatisfaction always is not bad. Advanced civilization comes from dissatisfaction, because human made better goods for their better life. If they want to satisfy what they have, they have to thank for their possession.</CO>
column23: The second supporting idea could have been developed more thoroughly but otherwise this was a good essay.

column1: 247&A person you know is planning to move to your town or city. What do you think this person would like and dislike about living in your town or city? Why? Use specific reasons and details to develop your essay.
column3: <IN>One of my friends is going to move to my town. Someone may worry about that he might dislike to live my town, since my town is located at the borderline of city and lack of interesting facilities. <TS>Even though that, I beleive that he will be very pleased to live my city.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> the public transportation sytem of my town is very convenient compared to other town.</MI1> <SI1>Subway station is very near to my town. In korea, the distance to subway station is very important criterion to determine a town wherther it's transportation is convenient or not. Actually, if someone is living in Seoul,where my town is located, and his house is near to a subway station, he feel no dificulties to go to any other place in Seoul.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> my town is near to a famous beautiful mountain which is declared as a national park.</MI2> <SI2>Many people, whoever live far from my town or not, come to that mountain to climb. Living in a big city is sometime terrible thing, since the man who live there have to suffer from the air polution, for example. What a wonderful thing if a nice mountain like the one my town has is near and climb to that in every weekends to relax and refresh!</SI2></BO2><CO>From that reasons, I feel no hesitation to say that he will like to live in my town. It is very convenient for him to go elesewhere like his office or department stors. There are also a nice moutain to have a good time to enjoy the nature. What else is needed more to make my town even better for him to live?</CO>
column23: A lot of grammar and semantic errors. The essay didn't quite follow the topic; the topic was to discuss and contrast the good and bad of where you live, but this essay only discussed the good.

column1: 248&It has recently been announced that a large shopping center may be built in your neighborhood. Do you support or oppose this plan? Why? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN>A large shopping center could give some benefits. At the same time it could give us disadvantages. Some people would be favor of building a large shopping center in their community for more chances of convenient shopping while other people would be against the plan because of harmful effect such as air pollution. <TS>In my case, I oppose the plan that large shopping center may be built in my neighborhood, because it could ruin natural environment and could cause traffic congestion.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> a large shopping center would ruin beautiful natural environment of my town.</MI1> <SI1>I live in a small rural town, and there are more mountains, trees, and animals than buildings, people, and cars. It has beautiful scenery. I don't want lose these beautiful nature of my town. If a large shopping center were built in my town, it would dig up mountains, and devastate nature and rob the habitats of many animals. <TR>Moreover,</TR> if its construction were completed, many people would come to my town to buy a many things. These people would throw out an amount of trash. Then, my town would suffer from destruction of natural environment. In this respect, I oppose building a large shopping center for saving my neighborhood¡¯s natural environment.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> a large shopping center would cause severe traffic jams.</MI2> <SI2>My town is small and there are no enough well paved road, and enough parking place. A large shopping center would attract many people from all over the places. So many cars would come to my town. <TR>However,</TR> there are sufficient traffic system, such as traffic lights, large roads and parking lots, many cars would cause severe traffic congestion. <TR>Therefore,</TR> Not only do many shopper suffer from this traffic jams, my but also town's neighbor would have trouble. In this respect, I oppose building a large shopping because of high possibility of traffic congestion of my town.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> I am against the plan to build a large shopping center in my neighborhood because of spoiling natural environment and traffic congestion of my town. What my neighborhood really want now is keeping the nature rather than developing of my town.</CO>
column23: Some grammar and semantic issues, but otherwise this was a good essay.

column1: 249&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>A word, "Teacher", has a lot of meanings. In a aspect of strict meaning of the word, some people may imagine only a man who teaches some educational courses. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I agree with the idea that parents are the best teachers in some reasons: devotion to children and their experiences or lessons acquired from life.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> parents generally have devotion and love to teach their children.</MI1> <SI1>In some times, children may not able to understand what they are taught. <TR>However,</TR> parents would eagerly teach them until they understand. Detailed lessons with adequate difficulty would be provided and such an effort would be helpful. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> I know a mother and her son, who is rather less intelligent than ordinary boys, but his mother has taught him patiently and he finally become able to do most things that he could not do.</EX> In this manner, parents could be thought as the best teachers with devotion.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> they have enough experiences and lessons to teach their children.</MI2> <SI2>They must have spent time thinking many things in every respect, and have experienced and done many activities. Lessons and experiences from past time may be inherited to their children and they will do less trials and errors. <EX><TR>To illustrate,</TR> two years ago, my father suggested me to buy a home for investment, and that suggestion was from his experiences. Now it proved to be a very profitable one.</EX> As stated above, experiences and lessons from parents are important.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> devotion, experiences and lessons from parents are primary factors that make parents the best teachers. Children would be more thoughtful and wise with teachings from parents as well as teachers in school.</CO>
column23: The ideas were communicated well, but the supporting ideas could have been developed further. Specifically, though it showed the things can parents can teach their kids, there was nothing that really showed that parents would teach those things better than other teachers.

column1: 250&Would you prefer to live in a traditional house or in a modern apartment building? Use specific reasons and details to support your choice.
column3: <IN>People have their own preferences for their habitat. Some may prefer a traditional house while others like a modern apartment building. In my case, <TS>I would choose an apartment building for convenience and security.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> an apartment building is more convenient than a traditional house.</MI1> <SI1><EX>In the latter, generally bathrooms and restrooms are apart from the other rooms. In night or cold weather, one should go out of main building and go across the yard, and it would be a trouble; however, in case of the former, these facilities are all integrated and close to the other rooms. Additionally, there is a janitor who can get parcels when we are out and give us when back.</EX> For these conveniences, I prefer an modern apartment.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> security problem should be solved to choose a traditional house.</MI2> <SI2>It is much hard to protect intruders from the house. Although there is a wall around the house, and even some additional obstacles, it is rather easy to rob the house than an apartment. In an apartment, there are ordinarily security guards who watch out in 24 hours. To attain the same level of security in traditional house, people should pay more money and attention. This is another reason that I want to live in an apartment.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> an modern apartment building would be a better choice to me because it is more convenient for living, and there is less security problem than a traditional house. The number of people who prefer an apartment will increase more and more.</CO>
column23: Some grammar and semantic errors, but otherwise this was a good essay.

column1: 251&The 21st century has begun. What changes do you think this new century will bring? Use examples and details in your answer.
column3: <IN>The 21st century has begun. Like a 20th century, there would be a great change in our lives in 21st century. Some people say that the world would be better for living, and others say that there would be a great disaster in 21st century. <TS>Among the changes brought in 21st century, I think globalization and digitalization would be most influencial to our lives.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> globalization would occur more and more in 21st century.</MI1> <SI1>The world has been globalized in 20th century, but it will be accelerated in 21st century. <TS>Internet which became famous in the late 20th century, would make the world to be one more rapidly. nowadays, through internet we can read and see what is going on the other side of the world. And new trasport system will make the each country more close. Zet airplane and the other inventions would make it possible that going the other side of the world in a few hours.</TS> These changes make the world globalized in 21st century.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> digitalization would be done in 21st century.</MI2> <SI2>The more digitalized our life, the more our lives would be rapid and accurate. In this reason, everything would be digitalized to be control easily. <EX><TR>For examples,</TR> digital TV which is better than analog TV will be common. And in shopping center, we can pay without any cash or card in our hand.</EX> These digitalization would occur to bring our life easier and more convenient.</SI2></BO2><CO>There must be a great change in 21st century. Many thing would be changed. I think globalization and digitalization would be one of them. The life itself would be more broad and easier than it has been. If there is any changes, we should prepare it to survive.</CO>
column23: Numerous grammar, semantic, and spelling errors, but overall this was a good essay.

column1: 252&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Universities should give the same amount of money to their students¡¯ sports activities as they give to their university libraries. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
