column3: <IN><TS>Some people say that universities should give more money to their university libraries than students¡¯ sports activities while other people argue that universities should give the same amount of money to their students¡¯ sports activities as they give to their university libraries. In my opinion, I agree with the former statement because the library of the university is the more important than anything else and it is also possible to participate in sports activities in local sports center.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> library is the center of the university.</MI1> <SI1>Most library have to buy more books for students to refer year by year. <EX>In really, when I was university student, there was insufficient books to refer in many fields because of financial reasons in my university. In addition, most students complained about old environment of library because of fast current change of education in many field.</EX> Therefore, university must invest more money to buy books and improve educational environment in library.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> most students can have sport activities in other place than university.</MI2> <SI2><EX><TR>For example,</TR> national sports center and local sports center is also good place to have sports activities. They are open to residents for participating in various activities.</EX> </SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> It is more helpful to student to give library of university more money than students¡¯ sports activities. If a person asks me what is the best important thing to invest money, I don¡¯t hesitate to answer that it is the very library of university.</CO>
column23: The second body paragraph needed to be better developed.

column1: 253&Neighbors are the people who live near to us what are the qualities of a good neighbor?
column3: <IN>Many people live in apartment or houses. They have many neighbors. Aneighbor is the improtnat one because they are also component like co-worker.<TS>I think that a good neighbor quality don't make a noise and should help when emergency situation occured.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR>a good neighbor don't make a noise .</MI1> <SI1><EX>When I was a language student,i lived a dormitoary.Ihad neighbors who make a noise when they had a party.I was veryangry.Icouldn't study.sleep,watch TV,and read a book. I was becoming a crazy man.Not me but the other housemate said it is a terrible house ,kbut it was not a terrible house.Mydorm environment was very natural and no traffic.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second ,</TR>when emergency situation is comming,they should help me like calling police or a fireman.</MI2> <SI2>Recent societydoesn't care about the other people.It is a correct,but if emergency is comming,we should help each other. <EX>If I were old and had a heart attack,Some neighbors should help me.if they didn't ,I would die.</EX>Myapartment can be a terrible place whic cannot come anypeople.</SI2></BO2><CO>As a result,neighbors are one family or co-worker,If I and my neighbors could't match each other, our lives were getting bored and could't have a good relationship</CO>
column23: There were numerous grammar, semantic, spelling, and formatting errors which made the essay difficult to understand.

column1: 254&People do differnt ways of escaping the stress and difficulties of modern life. Some read; some exercise; others work in their gardens. What do you think are the best ways of reducing stress? Use specific details and examples in your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>Most People have some stress from their routine days: in the school, in the work place or even at home. Some people play exercise, or just walk around the park to reduce their stress. However, in my case, I go to the movies with my friends and talk the problems I have got.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> when I come to feel heavy stress, I go to the movies with my friends.</MI1> <SI1>Movies give people new, excitement experience. Developed techniques of today¡¯s movies can show viewers various images such as aliens living in distant galaxy or prince and princess who might come from Disney¡¯s stories. By looking at the characters that I cannot contact in real world, I can get out of stressful hours. Moreover, during taking movies, I can have relaxing hours. Because I need do anything with watching movies during this time, I can have a rest time. Splendid images and pleasant sound in the movies allow me even not to think. I might be just all right if I can breath in and out.</SI1> </BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Next,</TR> after watching movies, I chat my associates about my problems.</MI2> <SI2>Talking to someone is very helpful to getting rid of stress. I can feel the stress becoming half of it when counseling my problems with someone. Although my friends just listen to my troubles without careful considering, I can sometimes find out solving spot from our talking. <EX><TR>To illustrate,</TR> when I have been thinking seriously about transferring major, I talked to my friends about the best I can do. That time, one of my friends talked a sample of her brother¡¯s case, who transferred to another university only to be failed. I could totally understand his case and it gived me benefitful second hand experience.</EX> In this manner, I can relax my stress from counseling from my friends.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> when I want to escape stress and difficulties of modern life, I usually look at the movies. It help me recover from problems through providing unrealistic images and rest without any activities</CO>
column23: The transitions "To begin with," and "Next" usually denote describing things in chronological order. So if the essay was describing the movies and conversations as happening in the same night, that is fine. But if it was meant to be explained as two separate options for relieving stress, then those were not good transitions.

column1: 255&Study alone or study in a group. Which do you prefer?
column3: <IN><TS>One of the most important things to get the most out of study concerns not only the quantity, but also the method. About the method, We can consider largely in two ways; that is, studying alone or studying in a group. Certainly, there are so many diverse pros and corns about this matter, but I do personally prefer the latter one.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Fist of all,</TR> the most note-worthy advantage of a group study is that it helps us to study regularly in a daily schedule.</MI1> <SI1>Although studying alone seems to allow more flexibility on learing lever or progress by personal situation, there is always a possibility that one can be lazy or put off everyday's task as time goes by. <TR>However,</TR> in a group study, there are many people around, watching you and studying hard and so on. Being stimulated is one little factor that forms desirable studying environment.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> the group study has its own value in varieties.</MI2> <SI2>Even though studying alone is more likely to offer an intensive concentration which is very important for studying, we can not still ignore the synerge effect that is shared in a group; not only we get vast informations and ideas from diverse background, but also we learn to coorperate, discuss and integrate those into a common target the group pursues.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> I am strongly on the side of studying in a group in that it allows well-planned studying rootin and proper competition between members along with the synerge effect. However, in my opinion, it would be wiser to choose the method which suits better to the sorts of study or the given situation than to stick to one kind only.</CO>
column23: The support ideas would have benefitted from examples or data.

column1: 256&People learn in different ways. Some people learn by doing things; other people learn by reading about things; others learn by listening to people talk about things. Which of these methods of learning is best for you? Use specific examples to support your choice.
column3: <IN><TS>While some people learn by doing something, listening to other people talk about things , I learn reading about things.</TS> Reading some materials serves as enlarging my knowledge that is unknown, giving a solution about my trouble.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> reading about things allows me to enlarge my knowledge.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>For example,</TR> through the reading materials such as newspapers and science journals , it is enable me to learn lots of things that I hardly learn from school or do by myself.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> reading about things gives me a solution about having trouble.</MI2> <SI2><EX><TR>In my experience,</TR> I've suffered from the conflict with a friend of mine. I could not find out the solution to apologize and to recover our relationships. When I was reading the book named "Friend is the best ", I could see the method to compensate our relationships , and learn how I can recover the friendship that is damaged not to harm his or her privacy.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In summary,</TR> I've learned lots of things by reading some materials. It establishes em to enlarge my knowledge that is unknown and give a solution about my trouble.</CO>
column23: The first body paragraph was not very strong, especially with the support idea. In the second body paragraph, the support idea was pretty much just the example. It would have benefitted from more sentences that explained the example.

column1: 257&Some people think that children should begin their formal education at a very early age and should spend most of their time on school studies. Others believe that young children should spend most of their time playing. Compare these two views. Which view do you agree with? Why?
column3: <IN>My country children should study various fields. It is a disputable problem whether children should begin their formal education at a very early age or spend most of their time playing. <TS>Although these two ways have respectively several traits, I think that children should spend more time playing since childhood is important period for development of children.</TS> Through a couple of examples and explanations, I will demonstrate why I think above them.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> that children begin formal education at a early age contributes intellectual growth of children.</MI1> <SI1>They can search their qualities at early age. This fact helps them get job or plan future life. <EX>One of my friends studied various subject such as math, English and reading or writing at six years old. She became aware her trait and now is a doctor.</EX> In this manner, early formal education gives chance to discover our qualities.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>However,</TR> intellectual ability is very limited.</MI2> <SI2>Actually, children, for their whole life, need various settings such as emotional and social aspect. Playing can give these to children at early age. <EX><TR>For examples,</TR> I remember playing with my friends. We played football that needed cooperation and were dolls playing that allowed emotional opulence. Each playing needs many abilities not just memory.</EX> Then these are essential for children's whole life.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> to study hard or play at early age give children several ability. I think that abilities that playing allow are more important to children. If children spend more time playing, they will be people who are healthy in emotional, physical, social fields.</CO>
column23: There were numerous grammar and semantic issues, as well as some formatting issues, but otherwise this was a fine essay.

column1: 258&It has been said, "Not everything that is learned is contained in books." Compare and contrast knowledge gained from experience with knowledge gained from books. In your opinion, which source is more important? Why?
column3: <IN>Some says that books are less valuable than direct experience. <TS>Certainly experience is very important because it is direct and it has more strong impact on people's lives. However books have so much more information available and people can have acess to them more easily.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>For instance,</TR> all the students learned by books in school.</MI1> <SI1>Without books, they cannot study about special fields and even general common sense. Beside education in school, so much can be learnd from books. <EX><TR>In my experience,</TR> I could get a lot of things by reading legends, fables, and fictions during childhood. Probably these could not be learn by any others.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> people get knowledge from book more easily than from experience.</MI2> <SI2>Although experience is probably the best teacher, most peoples would have a difficult time trying to experience as many situation as can be read about in books.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> books are more efficient than experience. People can acess to various experience through books, and the way getting knowledge from them is more convenient.</CO>
column23: The body paragraphs were not very well developed. The second paragraph in particular really needed more information to solidify its ideas.

column1: 259&Employees of businesses should be hired for their whole lives when they get jobs. Do you think that policy is justified, or not? Use specific examples and reasons to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>Traditionally, employees were hired for their entire lives, especially in Korea and Japan. However, modern companies do not want to hire them for such a long time. <TS>In my case, I agree with the idea of these companies, which oppose hiring laborers for whole lives, for reasons of efficient management and self-development of employees.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> to manage a company efficiently, the owner or the manager of the company inevitably should lay off unnecessary and inadequate employees, and hire other, properly educated people.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>For example,</TR> my company does not hire employees for their whole lives. Structural engineers are generally fired in middle age, during their 40s; however, I think that this is a crucial process for running the company efficiently.</EX> As stated above, for this reason, laborers could not be hired for their entire lives.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> development of employees themselves could be achieved.</MI2> <SI2>Thinking of being hired regardless of their ability is apt to make people somewhat lazy and loose. However, if people think that they cannot work in a company forever, they would exert themselves to be competitive. <EX><TR>To illustrate,</TR> one of my teammates takes courses and wants to get a certification as a structural engineer, and this would help him to be hired longer.</EX> In this manner, not hiring employees could motivate them to develop themselves.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To conclude,</TR> employees could not be hired on a lifetime basis to manage a company successfully, and for their development. Employment on a limited term basis would be a better choice to get a prosperous company and advance its employees.</CO>
column23: Some grammar and semantic issues, but otherwise this was a good essay.

column1: 260&some people prefer to live in a small town others prefer to live in a big city. which place would you prefer to live in? use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Choosing which one is better for you to live in a small town or to live in a big city is an interesting issue among people. <TS>I always think about this issue because i dissatisfy the life of a big city in seoul. so these following reasons are my maiN ones that i want to live in a small town.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>In the first place,</TR> i want to study for myself such things as philosophy.</MI1> <SI1>this kind of study is not for others but for myself. if i show that i am very strong men among my rivals, i have to live in the city to compete with them. however, due to the fact that my study is for only myself, i want to live in the place where no one can touch me. the town that i want to live in is the place that there is only 50 people or more. in that place, i can do everything that i want to study.</SI1></Bo1><BO2><MI2><TR>In the second place,</TR> the mood in the small town helps me to improve my health.</MI2> <SI2>in the city, many disadvantages - the toxic gas that generated by many cars, the noise that occurred in the city - made my health exagerate to the worst condition. <EX>a few months ago during my summer vacation, i went to meet and see my grandfather lived in the small town for 1 month. during this period, i can improve the condition of my heath.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO><TR>Finally,</TR> i prefer living in a small town to living in a big city in that living in a country gives me the chance to study something that i want to investigate and gives my heath improve to the better condition. for these reasons, it is reasonable to say that as for me living in the coutry give me more advantages than living in the city.</CO>
column23: Grammar and capitalization problems plagued this essay.

column1: 261&Decisions can be made quickly, or they can be made after careful thought. Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? The decisions that people make quickly are always wrong. Use reasons and specific examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>While living, we have to make many decisions, and these decisions could decide our whole life. Some people maintain quick decisions are always wrong while others argue quick decisions could be right. <TS>In my opinion, I disagree with the statement that the decisions that people make quickly are always wrong, because some situations need quick decisions and professionals' quick decisions often turn out to be right.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> there are some situations we need make decision without delay.</MI1> <SI1>In urgent situations such as fire, flood, and car accident, we should make quick decisions, or we could lose a lot of things even life. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> when I was 16 years old, I had a car accident. My injury was severe. Some people carried me to the nearest hospital's emergency room. No sooner did the physician who worked there check out my condition, then he operated a surgery. Fortunately, because I went through a surgery without delay, I could save my life. The physician said, if my surgery were to be delayed, I might not have survived.</EX> As seen above the example, a quick decision could be a right decision.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> professionals could make right decisions quickly in their works.</MI2> <SI2>They have abundant experience in their area, and without time-consuming consideration, they have ability to make right decisions. <EX><TR>For instance,</TR> my mother is a counselor for people who have mental problems. She worked in the field for 20 years. When my mother talks with a person, my mother can find out the person's problem instantly. Therefore, my mother can take care of the person with the method that best suit the person, and the person can recover from his/her problem quickly.</EX> In this respect, professionals' quick decision could be the best decision.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> I am against the opinion that quick decisions are always wrong. That's because there are often urgent situations that we need to make decisions quickly, and experts could make right decisions with their intuitions. These quick decisions could save our time, money, energy, and life.</CO>
column23: Some grammar and semantic issues, but otherwise this was a good essay.

column1: 262&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? People are never satisfied with what they have; they always want something more or something different. Use specific reasons to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Generally, people want to have what they do not have now, and to have more. Although some monks or missionaries seem to do not want any more, in a respect, they also want. <TS>Therefore, I agree with the idea that people want something more or something different, for reasons of getting other kind of things and achievement.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> people usually want to get other kinds of things.</MI1> <SI1>A variety of things that people could possess exist and they want to get one after another. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> there is an owner of big company and politician, Mr. Jung in Korea. At first, he wanted to earn more money and to run a business successfully. After the first goal was achieved, he wanted to be a statesman, and finally he is. It means that he wanted different thing, political power.</EX> In this manner, different kinds of things are apt to attract people, and this is why people want more or different things.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Additionally,</TR> having more or something different comes along achievements.</MI2> <SI2>People should try diligently for their goals, and they also could have a sense of achievement. <TR>Therefore,</TR> I think that people generally want more and different things not only for the things themselves but also for mental satisfaction. In a sense, it can also be assumed that invisible, mental achievements are what monks and missionaries what more. Therefore, to get a sense of achievement, people are never satisfied with what they have.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> I agree that people are never satisfied with what they have, because they want a sense of achievement as well as various, different kinds of things. Unless they are too greedy, efforts to get things would enrich people's lives materially and mentally.</CO>
column23: The second support idea would have benefitted from researched data or an example.

column1: 263&What are some important qualities of a good supervisor (boss)? Use specific details and examples to explain why these qualities are important.
column3: <IN>When I was a high school student, I worked for a part time job at the stationery store. And now I am working at the computer software company. The supervisor of the stationery was a man and present supervisor is a woman. However, this is not the only thing to make them different. <TS>I think the present supervisor is more qualified than the past supervisor because she has a sense of the leadership and the responsibility.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>I think the leadership, the spirit to lead the members up to the goal, is the most important sense for the supervisor.</MI1> <SI1><EX>My present supervisor is the very woman to have a sense of the leadership. Few years ago, we were developing the new software. However, the result we conducted was always something wrong and seemed to fail to make the software due to the date we planned. As time went on, we, employees, were depressed. Then, our supervisor told us that we could do it and we were almost there. She never gave up and always encouraged us to continue it. Finally, we achieved success to develop the new software. I believe that we could hardly attain our goal if our supervisor had not led us.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In my opinion, another qulity for the supervisor is</TR> the responsibility.</MI2> <SI2><EX>As I mentioned, I think the past supervisor was not a good supervisor because he didn¡¯t have the sense of the responsibility. He was very young and liked to get along with his friends. Sometimes he didn¡¯t come to the work because he drank until so late. Even though the sales performance of the stationery was not good, he didn¡¯t fele the responsibility and, on the contrary, laid the responsibility on me. At this situation, I didn¡¯t feel the need to do my best on the job and just kept my desk. However, at my computer company, I changed my attitude toward the job. Although it was we that worked the detail things, my supervisor controlled and managed all things we did. And no matter the results, they acted on her responsibility. Under her protection, we became to dedicate to out tasks and make an effort.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO>The more qualified supervisor is, the more successful the company becomes. Now I am an employee but, in the future, I wish to have my own business. If I become a boss, I will lead my employees towards the goal and have the responsibility about all tasks to let my employees believe me.</CO>
column23: The supporting ideas were pretty much examples. More explanation of the lessons found in the examples would have helped.

column1: 264&When famous people such as actors, athletes and rock stars give their opinions, many people listen. Do you think we should pay attention to these opinions? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>Generally, it seems that famous people have an great influence on over lives. Some people eagerly listen to what they say, while others do not follow their opinions. In my case, I think that we should not pay attention to their opinions, for these reasons; we should think and decide according to our own situations, and they are not as intelligent or wise as we are.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> situations we face are different from those of entertainers.</MI1> <SI1>Moreover, we should judge things ourselves, since things that we decide would raise different results. Fundamental difference of our property from their wealth would make much opinion not suitable to our lives. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> it could be assumed that a famous French singer, Cellin dion, would not know how to drive well or how to keep our house securely; because they probably have a driver and security guards.</EX> In this manner, their lives and opinions are not alike to ours; therefore, we should not listen to their opinion to decide properly.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> entertainers are not good at other fields than they are in.</MI2> <SI2>Although they try diligently and eagerly to attain their goals and to be the best in each field, they do not know as well as we do in our fields. They are just ordinary people in usual life, thus we cannot rely on their comments for our living. In addition, they may be short of common sense, for their assistants. It would be helpful only if we choose or think things of their specialty. Thus, we should make our own decision.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> as stated above, people should suggest and follow their own opinion rather than famous people's opinion. With proper adaptation of their opinion in particular fields, decisions and following results by ourselves would make our lives more fruitful and meaningful.</CO>
column23: The essay was fine for what it was, however the main and support ideas really assumed a lot. For example saying that Celine Dion (who's Canadian, by the way) is probably not good at driving is a large assumption. Examples and support ideas really should use provable facts, and that took a lot away from the strength of the essay.

column1: 265&Many people have a close relationship with their pets. These people treat their birds, cat, or other animals as members of their family. In your opinion, are such relationships good? Why or why not? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>What is to close pet is both positive and negative. People think to close pet is not good due to transmit pathogen through pets, while others grow up pets to maintain relationship. <TS>In my opinion, to close pet is good because pets give alone person pleasure and people learn how to take care of love and value of life through pets.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> to close pet could give lonely person pleasure and the person could relieve solitude.</MI1> <SI1>Modern society increases people who live in alone more than ago. Therefore, The people grow up a variety of pets and spend many time with them. The pets could be becoming friend and family and alleviate their solitude. <EX>A person I knew is very busy and he can't meet many people. So, he grows up cat and he spends most of time the cat when he takes a rest in home. He said that the cat is the best friend.</EX> In this manner, to close pet is to people to alleviate loneliness.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second of all,</TR> It is good for people to close pets that teach how to take care of love and value of life.</MI2> <SI2>To grow up pets request much care and love. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> when I was child, I grew up cat. I had much time to look after and gave affection, I could feel happy due to give affection and realize the value of life.</EX> That is good aspect of relationship with pet.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> although pets have a possibility to transmit many diseases to people, pets have many advantages. Pets are becoming friend and family to a person who live in alone and share pleasure and grief. Also, people could learn bestowing love and life' s preciousness through relationship with pets. Thus, to grow up pets is better for people.</CO>
column23: Overall this was a good essay. But the transitions could have been stronger and the second body paragraph could have been longer and more developed.

column1: 266& In your country, is there more need for land to be left in its natural condition or is there more need for land to be developed for housing and industry? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Since the Korean War, my country have developed many our country regions. Some people insist that development should be stopped while others think more improving. <TS>In my view, my country needs to be developed because we have relatively small amount houses and specifically a rural area should be improved.</TS> Through a couple of examples and explanation, I will demonstrate why I think above them.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> I think more development to be needed, since half of my country people don't have my house.</MI1> <SI1>Territory of my country is remained for preventing from environment spoilage. However, my country people who don't have house should move several times a year. They always concern about house rate and problem of transfer. <EX>When I was young man, my family should transfer frequently. <TR>Moreover,</TR> I should move my school and disperse my friends.</EX> In this manner, my country needs development for more making house.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> rural regions of my country are under-developing statue.</MI2> <SI2>They who live in rural area have low income. Moreover, most of them are farmers who often must have debt for low product amount. According to the korean news, farmers of my country relatively tend not to improve theirs life state. So young men left on rural and old age people remain at there. This fact says that government has to develop rural region. Accordingly, improvement of my country needs for rural area.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> I think that development of my county should be made because of solving house problems and improving rural regions. If this developing will be made, we should do with harmony between our life and environment.</CO>
column23: The example of the first body paragraph should have been developed further. More information about the family situation to tie it to the main idea would have helped.

column1: 267&Some people trust their first impressions about a person's character because they believe these judgments are generally correct. Other people do not judge a person's character quickly because they believe first impressions are often wrong. Compare these two attitudes. Which attitude do you agree with? Support your choice with specific examples.
column3: <IN>In general, while some people assess a person with first impression that is always correct to his other character, other people think that ths first impression is incorrect to that. <TS>In my point of view is that the first impression is independent the personal character because most people are too shy in front of unknown people and people tend to hide their real character in the modern society.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1></TR>One the one hand,</TR> if A meets a unfamiliar man who wears a dirty sweater and puts on rusty shoes then A thinks that the man's character is lazy.</MI1> <SI1>One the other hand, If B is given to the above same chance, B talks to the man somethings then B believes that the man is tied up with his work, therefore he does not have a time to wash his cloths.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>I ponder that judging the first impression does not decide a person's character.</MI2> <SI2>Some people are so shy in front of unknown people that they do not show their real personality quickly. <EX><TR>In my experience,</TR> I met a person in the Mgnetic conference, he kept a quite attitude and did'nt talk to other people. I thnik he is very calm and moderate, however after meeting him repeatedly, he showed that he had opened mind and a leadership. My judgement turned out wrong.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> there are some people assess a person with first impression that is always correct to his ot her character, other people think that ths first impression is incorrect to that. I'm in favor of he first impression is independent the personal character because most people are too shy in front of unknown people and people tend to hide their real character in the modern society.</CO>
column23: The essay structure was confusing. The first body paragraph was really just examples for a point. The second body paragraph seemed to just repeat what the first paragraph said.

column1: 268&The twentieth century saw great change. In your opinion, what is one change that should be remembered about the twentieth century? Use specific reasons and details to explain your choice.
column3: <IN>During the twentieth century, there have been a great number of events, whether it was formidable, tragic or pleasant. Among them, some people regard the trip to the moon as the most unforgettable change in the 20th century, whereas others choose the World War II. <TS>In my opinion, however, the advent of the Internet might be thought the most considerable occurrence in this epoch.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>In general, most revolutionary changes affect only a limited, specific portion of the world; spacecrafts for military and astronomical purposes or robots for industrial uses. <TR>However,</TR> the Internet has changed almost all range of fields---military, scientific, industrial, agricultural, and even political categories---within such a short time.</MI1> <SI1>Now it can be impossible to imagine the world without the Internet. Thus, regarding the Internet's far-reaching effect on earth, it is natural to place this network world first.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition,</TR> the introduction of the Internet makes people closer and friendlier.</MI2> <SI2>In this new and magical world void of any physical barrier such as regional, ethnic, or religious one, we can meet and communicate with other people all over the world in real time. <EX>Sitting in front of the monitor in my room, I frequently talk to a friend living in the opposite side of Korea. We do not think each as a foreigner but just a close friend like neighbors.</EX> Who can imagine it unless the Internet comes up?</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>Consequently,</TR> the great surge of innovation started from the Internet in the 20th century has not only extended our physical and mental area, but it also accelerated globalization. However, this is not the end and no one can predict further development in this 21st century brought by the Internet.</CO>
column23: The supporting idea for the first body paragraph needed much more information. More elaboration on the point as well as examples would have made it much stronger.

column1: 269&Some people prefer to spend time with one or two close friends. Others choose to spend time with a large number of friends. Compare the advantages of each choice. Which of these two ways of spending time do you prefer? Use specific to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>Everyone has friends who can help you through your life. Some people have many friends but others might have only a few friends who can share the secrets. Both having many friends and a few friends have advantages and disadvantages.</TS> Let¡¯s talk about having many friends first.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> the advantage of having many friends is that you can get help from many people and you wouldn¡¯t feel lonely no matter what you do or where you go.</MI1> <SI1>Having many friends means you¡¯re friendly so even if you go to new places you will make friends before long. The disadvantage of having many friends is that you might be interrupted to do your job because of invitations from your friends. Then you will forget about your duty and finally your life could not be successful.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> having a few friends.</MI2> <SI2>I usually don¡¯t make many friends. It doesn¡¯t mean I am neglected among the people but it means that I have two best confidants and other friends who don¡¯t talk much. During the life, it is hard to have even one confidant because everybody has different characteristics, but if you get one or two, you will find advantages easily. No fighting and no conflict happen no matter what we do together and they consider my problem as theirs. I mean they care a lot of me. The disadvantage of having a few friends is that once you move to other places you will be lonely and take a long time to find another best friend.</SI2></BO2><CO>I prefer to have a few best friends even if I could be lonely in a new place. Having lots of friends might be worse than having none, because those friends would interrupt your purpose and would always ask your help. Finally they will turn their back easily because there are no strong bases between you and many of your friends unless you spend most of your time with them.</CO>
column23: The last sentence of the introductory paragraph really could/should have been the main idea of the first body paragraph. I think each body paragraph tried to cover too many topics without really going into enough detail about any of them, so while the essay did fill a lot of space, it didn't really seem to communicate a whole lot. It needed to be better organized.

column1: 270&Many people think learning to do arithmetic is obsolete since calculators are ubiquitous. Do you agree or disagree?
column3: <IN>Now days our lives are changing quickly day by day because of modern technologies. These technologies are made to help our lives in many ways and in real life they are helpful, the internet. On the other hand, there are also disadvantages coming after these modern machines such as pollution. <TS>Many people these days are using the calculator which is easier and faster to solve problems so they think they don¡¯t need to study details about arithmetic, but there are advantages and disadvantages to learning mathematics.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> the advantage to using a calculator is that we can solve problems easier, faster and without making mistakes.</MI1> <SI1>We also don¡¯t need to memorize all the formulas that we use to answer questions. So we can work on more questions at the same time. This would probably save our time.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>The disadvantage is that we lose chances to use our brains.</MI2> <SI2>As you know if we don¡¯t use our brains, they won¡¯t work well. So you might not solve any problems well without calculators. It means that you are controlled by the machine called a calculator. It will happen in not only math but also in other aspects then your brain will be getting smaller and smaller. Imagine that you started to use the calculators when you were a child and got used to them then you became an adult. Guess what? You won¡¯t even be able to calculate change when you go shopping because you won¡¯t have a calculator with you when you go shopping. <EX><TR>For example, I used to live in Korea, and in Korea no students use calculators until they graduate from high school except unique cases. I also did all the calculations with my hand and brain. Then I came to Canada last year and all the students use their calculators in math class. The Canadian student couldn¡¯t calculate well without calculators. Even though I wasn¡¯t using a calculator while others were using them those students were not much faster than me. Sometimes they were even slower than me.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> there are both advantages and disadvantages to using calculators, but I prefer to learn arithmetic skills in school. So we can use our brains in as many ways as we can. Personally I don¡¯t want to be controlled by machines even though they are sort of useful. Especially I don¡¯t want to take may calculator shopping.</CO>
column23: The question was really to take a side on the issue, not so much to compare and contrast. The first body paragraph really didn't say a whole lot.

column1: 271&People work because they nee money to live. What are some other reasons that people work? Discuss one or more of these reasons. Use specific examples and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Usually people in the world have their jobs, and there are many kinds of jobs. <TS>Mostly people work to make money but sometimes people work because of other reasons.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> people could feel accomplished and confident in what they do in the world.</MI1> <SI1>When do we feel accomplished and confident? We realize them more often that you think. Not only just when you get awarded but also when you finish your projects you will be happy about your achievement. If the project is big one, it also could be the happiest moment in your life.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition,</TR> when people choose their job, they consider about their hobbies and major studies in universities.</MI2> <SI2>So they could enjoy their jobs as they make money. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> my father¡¯s major was business in the university, and he has been a businessman for more than twenty years.</EX></SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Third</TR> every single person wants not only to be rich but also to be famous.</MI3> <SI3>When do you get fame? In order to get fame, everybody should do something. You won¡¯t be famous or successful if you only eat food and take a nap during the life. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> Nobel is still famous because he invented lots of things that are useful for humans.</EX></SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> I think some people just for making money, but others work for other reason; such as to feel accomplished, to enjoy, and to be famous and successful.</CO>
column23: The supporting ideas were really lacking. Further development of the ideas and examples would have helped.

column1: 272&When people need to complain about a product or poor service, some prefer to complain in writing and others prefer to complain in person. Which way do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>There are some situations that we should complain about a product or poor service. In such situations, some people may complain in writing, while some others want to complain in person. <TS>In my case, I would complain in writing, because I can summarize and write logically what I want to say and (catch)take attention more effectively.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>Most important advantage of complaining in written form is that the content of letter would be more arranged and logical.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>To illustrate,</TR> I have complaint(complained) several times about the quality of mobile phone service. Some cases were about charge, and some others were about service qualities. I could write what I wanted to complain in logic and additional information they needed to take care of the situations.</EX> In this manner, writing enables me to summarize and describe complaints more logically.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Additionally,</TR> written complaint could (draw manufacturer's attention) make manufacturers more concentrated, and the letter would be dealt by more appropriate people.</MI2> <SI2>Generally, it is supposed that manufacturers or people who work in customer service part would read (the) whole letter, whether they agree or not. Moreover, if the letter is not received by someone who is not in charge of(»ý·«), it would be passed over. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> when I was young, I bought a train toy. I broke some parts of (the) toy by mistake, and I wrote a letter to get or buy spare parts. After some day(s) elapsed, they sent me required parts for free. If I had tried to ask for them in person, I can hardly imagine that they would have listen(ed) to what a six-year-old boy said.</EX> As stated above, complaint in writing would be more effective.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> in my opinion, I prefer writing to speak(ing) in person for complaining. With logically summarized and additional information attached, much deep(er) understanding and proper measures would be attained.</CO>
column23: Some grammar and semantic issues, but otherwise this was a good essay.

column1: 273&A company has announced that it wishes to build a large factory near your community. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of this new influence on your community. Do you support or oppose the factory? Explain your position.
column3: <IN><TS>Most industries and factories bring both good and bad influences to our community. To decision to support or oppose the building of the new factory must weigh both positive and negative aspects of the factory. A large factory gives our community economic prosperity and causes destruction of our environment.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>To begin,</TR> a large factory has the advantages of economic prosperity like the employment opportunity and community growth.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>For example,</TR> car-manufacturing companies such as Chrysler and General Motors have been responsible for substantial employment in the community in which they have located factories. As a result, they have more money to spend in their community.</EX> In addition, the factory encourages people from other communities to move in, bring even more money into the community. This will allow other industries, such as retailed shops, real estate companies and restaurants to flourish as well.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>On the other hand,</TR> founding the factory has the disadvantages of damaging to the environment like traffic problems, air and water pollution.</MI2> <SI2><EX><TR>For instance,</TR> if the factory builds near our community, many people will move to our community with many cars. Undoubtedly, Not only will it bring traffic problems that jeopardize safety but it will also make out peaceful community very noisy.</EX> Also, the factory will emit noxious fumes, which causes the destruction of the quality of air and water. In the long run, the environment will be hurt and people¡¯s health will be affected badly.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In summary,</TR> when new factories enter a community, they can have economic prosperity as well as damaging to our environment. However, I think the community¡¯s quality of life may be a important factor to consider when deciding on a new factory. Therefore, I would oppose the factory being built.</CO>
column23: Some grammar and semantic issues, but otherwise this was a good essay.

column1: 274&Some students prefer to study alone. Others prefer to study with a group of students. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>These days, there are developed many methods to help study such as internet, private school. Some people like to study alone with using variable tools, while others study with friend together. <TS>In my case, I prefer to study with a group of students because I can take help and encourage each other under difficult circumstance.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> the group study can take and give help of puzzling problems.</MI1> <SI1>We often face to difficult problem during studying time, and we spend much time to solve the problem. If we study with several people, we could solve the problem easier than alone. <EX><TR>For example, when I was study to GRE test, I studied people with the same purpose for getting high score. I was not good mathematics subject but good game problems. I could take help to solve mathematic problems from studying group and give method how to solve fast game problems.</EX> That is a good aspect in studying group.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> a group of study can encourage each other under difficult circumstance.</MI2> <SI2><EX>When I was study to GRE test, I sometimes felt desperate because many problems are very difficult. When I was in difficult circumstance, a member of people in group encourage and cheer up me. In this manner, group studying provides members with courage.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> If I choose method of study, I will study people gather for the same purpose. Because a group of study can help according to give and take much information to solve problems and each other can give courage to achieve goal. I would like to study a group of people owing to the above reasons rather than study alone.</CO>
column23: The first body paragraph was fine, but the second one was not as well-developed. Plus it was similar conceptually to the first one, so more information to differentiate the two would have helped.

column1: 275&It is better for children to grow up in the country-side than in an big city. Do you agree or disagree ? Use specific reasons and examples to develop your essay.
column3: <IN>Some people think that it is good for children to be raised in the country-side. <TS>But In my point of view, to grow in a big city is better for children than to live in a small town.</TS> Although country-side is clean and not polluted, they can get better education, and they can meet many kind of people in a big city.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> they can get more advanced education in big cities.</MI1> <SI1><EX>There are many facilities, like museums and libraries which can help our study. It is hard to understand about the 18th arts by the article from their books. But if they can see them in the art museums, it will really help them. They can find lots of information in the library, too. They can join many church programs in a big city. They can have more chances to see good movies and concerts.</EX> These experiences will help children develop their emotions.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition,</TR> they can meet variety of people in a city.</MI2> <SI2>In the classroom, library of the other places. There are usually more students in a city than in a small town. That means that they can learn how to work together as a team. Also, through talking to various people, we can have indirection experiences, they can understand many people who are different from them.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> I think that living in a big city is better for children than live in a country-side. Although they will have less chances to feel the nature. But it can't be a problem at all. they can visit countryside, and they can know how valuable the nature is. But the experiences which they can get from city, are not able to learn in few months. That I think living in a big city is better for children.</CO>
column23: The second body paragraph could have benefitted from an example or data. But otherwise this was a good essay.

column1: 276&Some people say that advertising encourages us to buy things that we really do not need. Others say that advertisements tell us about new products that may improve our lives. which viewpoint do you agree with? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Most major companys frequently advertise their product throuth mass medias such as tv, radio. Also they want their product to be shown as products that has more advantage than do the other ones. but we, the consumers buying that products, can`t easily find which one is better or not. <TS>I strongly think that advertisement makes us to buy things that we really do not want for following two reasons.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>In the first place,</TR> my main reason is that the company show their product to the consumers exagerately.</MI1> <SI1>if one company makes a good product, the other company makes the counter product as soon as possible. so the company that makes one earlier advertises their product, showing that we are different from other company for many reasons. In this way, many company advertises its product exagerately. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> one food company in korea(haiti) advertise their food throuth media. But afer a few days, some newspaper say that they exagerately adress their product quality as a false way.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In the second place,</TR> some companys use a false method when adverting.</MI2> <SI2>they think that if they use the terms related with science, the consumer will not find whether the terms are correct or not. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> the company that sells water says in the ad that our water can be found in the mountain where no one ever have lived and the environment near mountain has been preserved naturally. So many people believing that ad bought that water from the company. But after the public institution investigated the water, the profit of the company fell down.</EX> </SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> i can say that advertising make us buy things that we don`t want for these reasons. When we have to buy a product, we should not depend on only ad. But once you can use the internet, you will find the product of more good quality by comparing the product quality in the internet.</CO>
column23: Some grammar errors, capitalization issues, but otherwise this was a good essay.

column1: 277&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? People are never satisfied with what they have ; they always want something more or something different. Use specific reasons to support your answer.
column3: <IN>It is accepted publicly that there are no limits in human-being¡¯s satisfaction. <TS>When a person has something that he or she has wanted, he or she will want the other thing which is located higher.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>Human has always lived watching higher stages.</MI1> <SI1>They struggle to catch up with their purposes, and when they obtained that, they are satisfied for a while. But soon they begin to stare further higher point. That is to say, intension to go up is human-being¡¯s instinct.<EX><TR>For example,</TR> If human has been satisfied with what they have, human¡¯s history couldn¡¯t have taken away from self-support to barter system or, we couldn¡¯t have benefited from substances which we can see and use everywhere in these days.</EX></SI1></BO1><CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> Human can¡¯t be satisfied with what they have. Because of their unsatisfactory instinct, they have to find another new goal after completing their present goal. It is the fact how human-being can be developed.</CO>
column23: Structure was really lacking. There was really only one point made, and then an example for that point in a separate paragraph. The ideas were not very well-developed at all. There was no real thesis; as the question was asking to take a side.

column1: 278&Which transportation would you use if you have to travel 40 miles?
column3: <IN>In modern sociaty, there are various kinds of transportations, such as the plane, train, automobile, bicycle, bus. When people plan own travel, they can choose one among them in individual favority and distance of travel and economic situation. Some would choose the plane due to it's speed while other people prefer the train because it provide beautiful and leisure landscape. <TS>Both are reasonable : however, in my case, I would choose the automobile because it is the most convenient and the freest transportation.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> the automobile is the most convenient traffic means to individual.</MI1> <SI1>If I consider characters of several transportations, soon I could notice that the plane and train require the reservation of ticket and going to airport or train station at on time, and the bicycle would let exhaust my energy because I should put it's pedals in long hours. On the contrary, the automobile not requires such things, and only needs the key, and some money which will be expended in the gas station, and my driving license. Therefore, when compared with other means, the automobile is very convenient transportation.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> the automobile is the freest traffic means.</MI2> <SI2>The other means, such as the plane, train, bus, are somewhat not free from other people. That is, because these are public transportation, I should keep the manner to other people and bear many inconveniences caused from sharing with other people. However, traveling with the automobile is individual and free from other people. If I travel with the automobile, I could loudly hear my favorite music in my space and eat arbitrally something when I am hungry. Such freedom would give great enjoyness to my travel, thus, automobile could become good transportation in terms of providing of freedom.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> if someone asks to me what is method of travel I would choose, I would anwer that it is the automobile because it very convenient traffic means in terms of no requiring reservation or exhausting of energy and very free traffic means in that I am not bothring from other people, and I don't bother to others, too. In every travel, the convenience and freedom are very important factors, so, I sure that my choice is superior.</CO>
column23: Some grammar and semantic issues, but otherwise this was a good essay.

column1: 279&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Playing games teaches us about life. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Many people spend time on playing games to relieve stress and just play. <TS>Some people say that playing games isn't good, but in my view, it has a value that playing games gives our directions about our life.</TS> Through a couple of examples and explanation, I will demonstrate why I think above them.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> I think games provide ways we make victory.</MI1> <SI1>We should make plans and do them for winning. It needs many processes and trials. <EX>If I play chess game, I should exercise several times and have methods to apply to various settings. Then I play chess game and I may be win or lose. I will be taught by the game since, I become aware a way of life and myself.</EX> In this manner, playing game gives knowledge of life.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> playing games teaches us about life by rules.</MI2> <SI2>Rules are important elements for games. Qualities of them are to lasting games and to give rationales to players. Moreover, they are similar to rules of our life. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> I like card game and often play it with my friends. My friend and I know that we must keep the game's rules. So we don't complain a result of the game.</EX> This point teaches that I should keep the rules of life.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> playing games teaches us about life in terms of playing processes and keeping rules. I think that I continue playing games for improving my life quality.</CO>
column23: Support ideas were a little short and underdeveloped, but all the points were made and everything made sense, so it was a fine essay.

column1: 280&A person you know is planning to move to your town or city. What do you think this person would like and dislike about living in your town or city? Why? Use specific reasons and details to develop your essay.
column3: <IN>According to the invention and development of transportation methods, it became usual thing to move from one place to another. <TS>It depends on each individual who move to my town whether the person would like the town or not; however, I think that the person would be satisfied with my city, for some reasons; a convenient transportation system and various sports facilities.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>The most important factor that people consider to move is that the place where they want to move have convenient transportation methods, especially for mass transportation.</MI1> <SI1>People would have many chances to visit other places while living. In my town, two subway stations exist. Subway would probably be one of the most efficient and economical methods. Additionally, people can use not only several bus lines but also drive their cars through semi-expressway called "Olympics way" which runs along with the Han river. As I mentioned above, there are many convenient methods to go other places in my town, and this is why the person would like.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover,</TR> there are several sports centers, a running course, parks near the town.</MI2> <SI2>People in modern city are apt to lack of exercises; however, these sites would help to maintain and improve health. <EX>Sports centers include swimming pools, health centers, tennis courts, and so forth. Han park and Yoido park are within 10 minute distance by bus, and even people could reach there on foot; on the road, people can run, ride a bicycle, rollderblade. What is much better is the fares for the sites are almost free.</EX> With these great surroundings, people could keep their health sound.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In the conclusion,</TR> I am certainly sure that anyone who moves to my town will like the city. The convenient transportations and the facilities useful for health would enrich his/her life. Additionally, the chances to become more intimate with my acquaintance would increase, and that would make me happy.</CO>
column23: Transitions could have been stronger, but otherwise this was a good essay.

column1: 281& Imagine that you have received some land to use as you wish. How would you use this land? Use specific details to explain your answer.
column3: <IN>People think they have some land or money to use. <TS>Some people want to have houses or cars, in my view, if I have received some land, I will build a sports center since it can provide a place for pastime and health improvement.</TS> Through a couple of examples and explanation, I will demonstrate why I think above them.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> I think the sports center become a facility for recreation.</MI1> <SI1>They will include a swimming pool, several courts, and so on. There can be use by spending time when people need some pastime or recreation. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> I often go to a swimming pool when I want to change my life, and after swimming, I feel more fresh and clear mental state.</EX> In this manner, to build a health sports center contributes to spend resting time of users.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> the sports center has a purpose to improve health.</MI2> <SI2>We know that we have to exercise for our healthy life. It is dangerous that we have time to maintain health when we are old. So we should exercise for health at early age. <EX>When I was young, I would set my chair for long time without some kinds of exercises and then I was sick for back pain. Since the day, I have exercised at a sports center for my health.</EX> I think a sports center has a role to improve health.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To sum up,</TR> If a person gives me some land, I will build a sports center, because it make it possible for people to spend pastime and promote health. Also I think that I will continue more exercise time for my healthy life.</CO>
column23: Support ideas were a little short and underdeveloped, but all the points were made and everything made sense, so it was a fine essay.

column1: 282&Would you prefer to live in a traditional house or in a modern apartment building? Use specific reasons and details to support your choice.
column3: <IN>Some prefer to live ia a traditional house. Others believe a modern apartment is more comfortable to live in. <TS>However I prefer to live in a modern apartment building than to live in a traditional house.</TS> There are many reasons.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly,</TR> It is practical to live in a modern apartment building than to live in a traditional house.</MI1> <SI1>In an apartment complex have many kinds of facilities such as swimming pool, gym, book store, many shopping mall and so on. Usually, they locate nearby our residents. Therefore people can easily prepare to their commodities. People can also flourish their life time easily.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly,</TR> It is safer to live in a modern apartment building than to live in a traditonal house.</MI2> <SI2>In a traditional house, it is diffecult to secure from burglars. That is because walls around the house. Usually, walls tend to lower than a house's height. Burglars can easily break into the house. On the other hand if we are live in an mordern apartment building, problems can solove easily. We have just lock the door and windows. And then security guard will take care of the rest.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Finally,</TR> To live in an modern apartment building is easy to available transfortations such as subway, taxi, bus. <EX>As for me, Imun-dong, the place where I live in. Roads are complicated which locate nearby traditional houses. On the other hand , roads are not complicated nearby the apartment complex where I live in. I live in a modern apartment house. Therefore I can easily drive a car. Because I go to school by car.</EX> For this reason, I satisfy with my house.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In short,</TR> people may have different prefrence to where they live in. The choice defend strictly on personal taste. However I think to live in a mordern apartment building more practical than to live in a traditional house. An apartment building also safer than a tradition house. For these reasons, I rather live in a modern apartment building than to live in a traditional house.</CO>
column23: Support ideas were a little short and underdeveloped, but all the points were made and everything made sense, so it was a fine essay.

column1: 283&Some people pay money for the things they want or need. Other people trade products or goods for what they need. Compare the advantages of these two ways of obtaining things. Which way do you prefer? Explain why.
column3: <IN>Today, especially in the urban areas, we can hardly find those who trade products or goods for what they need. Most urban people, including me, pay money when there are things in need. But in the rural areas, to trade goods is still accepted as a way of obtaining things.</IN><BO1><MI1>Through money-paying method, we can get stuffs we need whenever we want to, just buy paying money.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Moreover,</TR> we have many choices. While the advantage of trading process is that we can both get things and clean up stuffs at the same time, only if we could find the right person.</SI1></BO1><CO>For me, I prefer paying money for things I want, because I don't believe I'd be able to find the person who has a thing that I want and and also wants the thing I have. In this modern world, the standard of value is money, and the money is the form that trading is modernized and developed.</CO>
column23: There wasn't much structure to this essay. There was no real thesis and only one body paragraph, and the conclusion wasn't very strong.

column1: 284&If a large factory is about to be built in your town, Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of having large factory in your town.
column3: <IN><TS>In this essay, I will discuss the advantages and disadvantages of influences of a large factory on my community, and oppose the factory near my village with several reasons.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with,</TR> concerning advantages which a large factory may give our community, we can think of that it will create many jobs, and also will make local economy expand.</MI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Nontheless,</TR> we can have various disadvantages from a new factory, such as pollution problems, increase of crime and accident, and so on.</MI2> <SI2>A new factory may use much more water than any other person, so it will discharge a lot of used water. also, many people from a distant area will gether to search for their jobs. This increase of population means the increase of crime and accident.</SI2></BO2><CO>As for our community, I will oppose the construction of a new factory. Because my community is rural and natural area in which most of the residents have been familiar with agricultural activities and are commonly in elderly ages, the new factory can not recruit competive labors as well as can not grow up. <TR>In summary,</TR> a new factory benifit our community with many jobs and economical helps. But, my community is not proper for the construction of a new factory. So, I oppose that a new factory will be constructed.</CO>
column23: The structure of this essay was weak. The first body paragraph made a single statement without any kind of support ideas. The last two paragraphs really should have been a single conclusion paragraph.

column1: 285&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? People behave differently when they wear different cloths. Do you agree that different cloths influence the way pelple behave? Use specific examples to supports your answer.
column3: <IN>Clothes are very influential to recognize a person. Clothes can indicate a person¡¯s status, job , level of property, personal preference and where he or she came from. <TS>Even often clothes limit a person¡¯s behavior.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First,</TR> clothes are matched differently by their usage.</MI1> <SI1>Clothes usage is quite related to the influence thet people can be received. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> if a man have a presentation in front of his department fellows with wearing swim –suit or swim in a swimming pool with wearing formaldress, it will not be a good looking.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second,</TR> clothes limits people¡¯s behavior by its image.</MI2> <SI2><EX><TR>For instance,</TR> if there is a woman who wears gorgeous dress, she will intent to act gracely and walk slow with high-hills. But the next day, when she weawrs sportswear, she will walk faster and little bit more tough than walking slow and gracely.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO><TR>Therefore,</TR> By what kind of clothes they wear, people¡¯s behaviors are limited and influenced to act. Because behaving appropriate to the clothes they wear is balanced and natural.</CO>
column23: In the first body paragraph, the example is more of an example of the circumstances dictating clothing, not clothing dictating behavior. The support ideas as a whole were not very well developed and needed stronger arguments. Thesis lacked punch.

column1: 286&A person you know is planning to move to your town or city. What do you think this person would like and dislike about living in your town or city? Why? Use specific reasons and details to develop your essay.
column3: <IN>I live in Seoul, the biggest city in Korea. More than 10 million peoples are living here, in Seoul. Because it is a big city, many peoples move into Seoul and out of Seoul everyday. <TS>If somebody who I know is planning to move to my city, there are a lot of thing to please to live here but also there are many things that they don't like to stay. Public trasportation and lots of entertaining places would make them happy to live here, but heavy traffic and air pollution would let them regret, I think.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>Public transportation and many entertaining places make the people want to live in Seoul.</MI1> <SI1>Because it is a big city, we have very good public transportation system. Buses, Subways, and taxies are always available in my city and the fares of these are quite inexpensive. Even after midnight, I can easily catch the taxies in my city. <TR>Moreover,</TR> about entertaining places, there are many theater in my city which have new movies, concerts, and plays. We can have great time in Seoul easily.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>On the other hand,</TR> heavy traffic and air pollution are though to disadvantages to live in seoul.</MI2> <SI2>There is traffic jam almost every where in seoul, especially in traffic hour. In addition, air pollution is very serious in seoul. If someone stand in center of Seoul, the white shirts would become gray in 30 minuites.</SI2></BO2><CO>Where I live, Seoul, is a big city. There are good things to live like comfortable public transportation and entertaining places, but there are also bad things to stay like heavy traffic and air pollution. If someone ask me that I like to live Seoul forever, I would answer yes because this is my hometown.</CO>
column23: Each of the body paragraphs really had two points covered. But because of that, the second ideas in each were not very well-developed. It probably could have been better as four separate paragraphs with more information in each.

column1: 287&Think of the most interesting class you have ever taken. Why did you enjoy this class so much? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>The most interesting class I have taken is art.</TS> I enjoy this class purely because of the freedom of choices one can make. The teacher, nor the work, are pressuring. The atmosphere of the classroom is extremely friendly and relaxing. Art class relieves the stress of the more rigorous courses I attend. There is an incredible variety of medias to chose from and one can develop a sense of independence. I enjoy this class particularly because I understand the subject of art.</IN><BO1><MI1>Art class gives a person the opportunity to explore within the realm of one's imagination.</MI1> <SI1>There does not seem to be a barrier for the ideas one wishes to create. The class is filled with pleasures because there is no stress nor worries. Art also helps one go through logical stages of development. Firstly, one makes a rough sketch of the final project and imagines different styles in which it could be done. Secondly, the actual thought process and the creating of the project develops. And lastly, the project is complete and ready for interpretation and viewing.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>I greatly believe that one is able to express through pictures and images when the can not explain in words.</MI2> <SI2>The inner thoughts of a person come directly through the canvas. The beauty of art is that it can be interpreted in many different ways by the viewer. I adore this subject because of the freedom of expression and the unlimited interpretation.</SI2></BO2><CO>I have learned a great deal being an art student. I have matured and gained independence while listening to criticism as well. The critcism only helps one expand their thoughts and acknowlegde other's style of thinking. I enjoy this class also because of the relaxed environment, a contrast to the rest of the academic classes. The freedom of choice is wonderfully appealing in my point of view.</CO>
column23: The second main point was really an extension of the first. There wasn't enough of a difference between the two ideas to warrant two separate paragraphs.

column1: 288&Think of the most interesting class you have ever taken. Why did you enjoy this class so much? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>The most interesting class I have ever taken was microeconomics class, the first course to be taken as a beginning of the economics study.</TS> It is remembered so vividly because, above all, I was under tremendous pressure when I was taking the course as most of my classmates were. None of us were accepted to the economics major yet, and the grade we got on this course will play a crucial part in admission process.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>However,</TR> the fundamental reason that I enjoyed it so much was that after a month or so, I was able to read and understand financial newspaper such as Wall Street Journal.</MI1> <SI1>Sometimes, I was absorbed in what was happening in the real world so much that I neglected to study textbooks carefully.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>I also had a pleasure of having the best TA (teaching assistant) I had ever had.</MI2> <SI2>University of California is a huge school and there are just too many students in each class. As undergraduate students, we don't have chance to see the professor in person very often. TA's are the ones who directly influence our progresses in class. My TA in that class was no less clear in explaining the class material than the professor, and he inspired us to have interests in economic interpretations of real world.</SI2></BO2><CO>Not everyone get to have the previlege of knowing exactly what to do with their lives. The fun of understanding economics and business made me sure that I would have my career in that field and get MBA degree.</CO>
column23: The first two paragraphs really should have been one paragraph as one long intro. Because of that, the first transition of "However" was probably not the best choice. The supporting ideas were lacking and could have used more information.

column1: 289&Think of the most interesting class you have ever taken. Why did you enjoy this class so much? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>The most interesting class I have ever taken was my Art Value class this year.</TS> I believe so due to the following reasons.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> art is the subject I love.</MI1> <SI1>If I could, I would spend my entire life just drawing, and I defenitely won't be bored. Unfortunetely, I did not have a chance to study art before, therefore taking this class was a great deal of interest and challenge to me. Being in this class I have found out so many new things about art, such as its history, techniques, types of materials that are used, and so on. I have discovered many secret talents in myself, which helped me to improve my self-esteme. Due to the things I have learned in this class I participated in several art contest and was really successful.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>I think that my that art class won't be as intersting without my teacher.</MI2> <SI2>She has invented different games to help us remember important events in the art history and understand how the art techiques and various types of paint work. She was, without a doubt, the most understanding, intesting, and challenging teacher I have ever had.</SI2></BO2><CO>Taking this class I have learned new things and have found out more about myself. Having such a great teacher helped me to succeed in art contests and to find my way in life. Now I know what I want to be.</CO>
column23: The support ideas really needed examples to flesh out the ideas.

column1: 290&If you have to complain about something, Which method would you prefer to use? Complainning in person or writing email?
column3: <IN>These days, we are facing with many problems while living in our society.
