People in less developed countries also live longer than their parents and grandparents used to live 50 or 100 years ago. <TS>There are some reasons for this phenomenon.</TS> Improved medical care and higher standard of living and economic development are major reasons for this.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, improved medical skills and treatment have made it possible to control many fatal diseases such as smallpox, tuberculosis which a lot of people died from in eighteenth and nineteenth century.</MI1><SI1> Now we can go and see a doctor relatively easily and get regular health exam or medicine. People get more educated and have better knowledge about health problems and diseases. <TR>In addition</TR>, modern governments spend much more money for health care thus an ordinary person can easily get an opportunity to get medical care and to prevent from potential diseases or infections.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Higher standard of living also led to longer life.</MI2><SI2> We no longer work 14 hours a day, 6 days a week in an overcrowded and dirty factory where people used to work a few decades ago. We work in better condition and live in better houses.</SI1> We don¡¯t suffer from hardship of labor anymore and enjoy our lives doing various kinds of extra activities like playing tennis, watching a movie, going to a concert during spare time.</BO2><BO3><MI3>As economy and international trading have developed, we have no serious problem resulted from malnutrition and food shortage anymore even though there are many countries that still have famine and starvation problem.</MI3><SI3> Through exports and imports, we can eat every kind of vegetable, meat, grain, fruit that are not produced at home country meeting necessary nutritional needs.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, people tend to live longer now than before thanks to improved health care and standard of living and economic development.</CO>
column23: Overal a nice essay. The thesis was very weak and didn't contain any real information. Most of the details were separate from the main thesis statement. The essay was on topic through and had some good ideas.

column1: 401&In general people are living longer now. Discuss the causes of this phenomenon. Use specific reasons and examples to develop your essay.
column3: <IN><TS>I firmly believe that the reasons why people are living longer now are the development of medicine, the change of thinking, and the improvement of quality of life.</TS> Let me explain the details one by one.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, the development of medicine encouraged people to live longer now. </MI1><SI1>Before the medicine was not fully developed, many people died of various sickness.for example, the people who contracts TB can survive thanks to the development of medicine.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>,the change of thinking of health caused people to have longer life. </MI2><SI2><TR>Nowadays</TR> the importance of health is emphasized increasingly.people ,accordingly,tend to protect their body from polluted materials. they try to eat more healthy food and exercise regularly.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Third</TR>, the improvement of quality of life enabled people to have longer life.</MI3><SI3> About twe decades , people tends to concern only money. At that time they concentrate their life on surviving ,but they care to concern their health in reacent days as the quality of life was improved.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, the reasons above can explain my opinion about having longer life. The survey shows that more than 70% people hope to live longer than now. Thanks to the reasons I stated , people have longer life than now.</CO>
column23: This essay was written very well. There is a strong thesis with main points included in it. The essay really builds itself to the conclusion. Some additional examples would have been good.

column1: 402&People attend college or university for many different reasons (for example, new experiences, career preparation, increased knowledge). Why do you think people attend college or university? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN></TR>Nowadays</TR> more and more people attend university than in the past. The more our society becomes modernized, the more knowledge is required. Because especially society is full of invisible competitions from which more knowledge ensures the victory, many people exerts themselves to obtain information. This tendency naturally results in going to university. <TS>We have many reasons to attend university; we can prepare for the activities of society, and learn much knowledge.</TR> In this essay, I will think about these reasons. </IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, we can be eligible persons who can meet the need of our society. </MI1><SI1><TR>Namely</TR>, we can learn lots of skills that our society demand. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, university can give us method to overcome the obstacles , which is essential for surviving in the future society. </EX>Another skill is to cope with competitions. We should take exams and get a better mark than our friends. Other activities such as participating in sports or getting scholarship can teach us how to deal with competitions.</SI1> I think this competition that results from university is the starting point of that of society.</BO1><BO2><MI2>The most important factor is that we can learn knowledge from university.</MI2><SI2> In modern society, sources of knowledge that originate from all over the world are waiting for us, and the rate at which the amount of knowledge accumulates is above our imagination. From learning knowledge we can improve our abilities and become specialists. <TR>In addition</TR>, modern universities co-work with the universities from other countries because the world is getting so closer and smaller that in order to survive we should know the knowledge of other countries. These cooperations are very good chance in which we can have a broad outlook.</SI2> University can yield many specialists who have their own majors, and these persons at last contribute to the development of the world.</BO2><CO><TR>So far</TR>, I have explained detailed reasons for what we should attend university. Other reasons also exist such as improving our characteristics with the help of team activities, having a chance to meet potential spouse, and so forth. <TR>Therefore</TR> I think we should attend university or college. University is essential for us and our society, ultimately for the world. If we would make the best of the programs with which university provide for us, we could be well-rounded persons and conduce to the welfare of human beings. Students who are now in university should do their utmost!</CO>
column23: This essay was written very well. There is a strong thesis with main points included in it. The essay really builds itself to the conclusion. There are good points and good supporting evidences given with examples.

column1: 403&It is sometimes said that borrowing money from a friend can harm or damage the friendship. Do you agree? Why or why not? Use reasons and specific examples to explain your answer.
column3: <IN>At least once in a life time, one might come into a situation in which he or she must borrow some money from a friend. <TR<By the way</TR> it is generally noticed that borrowing money from friends sometimes harm or even break up the good relation between friends. But I don't agree with the above statement in these following reasons. By helping with each other in case one of the friends is in trouble, friendship can grow stronger. <TR>Moreover</TR>, if I helped some of my friends, he or she might help me when I need sudden money in return. <TS>I'll explain more specific examples in the following paragraph.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, if I give some of my friends certain amount of money they need and the friend can get out of a trouble he or she had before, he or she will be grateful to me and our friendship can be more stronger than ever. </MI1><SI1>Friendship is based on trustworthy. And if there's no trust between friends, we can say that it's a real friendship. There is a chance that we can get a loss by lending money to friends. But if the friendship is true, he or she may pay for it even if it is after a long time. What are friends for? Friends are for helping each other when they have a difficulty in something.</SI1> <TR>By doing so</TR>, we learn to trust with each other and friendship can last forever.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, by helping some of my friends, I can get a help when I need them urgently.</MI2> <SI2>If the friendship is true, friends who have given a help from me before will give me a hand when I'm in trouble in return.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I think that money is nothing more than the friendship. If the friendship is true, nothing cannot break it up. By borrowing money to a friend, the friendship will be firm and I can get a help when I need money or something by the friend whom I gave him or her a hand before. Friends are supposed to be there through the good and the bad.</CO>
column23: This is a full essay that begins rather strong but ends weak. The thesis statement did not give any real statement on what the paper would be about. It was more of an introduction. The first body paragraph had a lot of information, but the second body paragraph was really basic and had no real information or points made.

column1: 404&Do you agree or disagree with the following statememt? All students should be required to study art and music in secondary school. Use specific reasons to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Though art and music are known widely and lots of people prefer appreciate them as a their entertainment, there are few chance to learn lightly or deeply after school hood. Some people agree that students are required to study art and music in secondary school while others are against to learning them in secondary school. <TS>I think that it is reasonable that secondary school makes student study music and art. </TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, art and music enable for people to enjoy their past time. </MI1><SI1>Sometimes though people allow to take a rest from their boss , we can see they have no idea how to spent their golden- time. If they have a kind of hobby related in art such going to gallery, appreciating music, reading a tragedy , making a sculpture and so on , they are able to spend their past time profitably. <TR>In addition</TR>, it is helpful for people to relieve the stress and to restore energy for the next day's schedule.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Also</TR>, the education of music and art at the early age is greatly beneficial for chidren's mental development.</MI2><SI2> It is the same reason why those who are in pregnance listen to the music for their babies. <EX><TR>As shown in lots of research</TR>, music and art are very crucial for development people's emotion and building their characters for most of art pieces express the motion of human being. For example, the people listening to the crashing-sound music are more tough than the people listening to the calm and slow tempo music.</EX></SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3>The last reason why people have to learn art and music in the secondary school is that it's the very time when people can learn the fastest.</MI3><SI3> As my major is performing violin, I've experienced to teach violin a few students who are in different age group as a part time job. <TR>Not to speak of</TR>, children are taught much faster than adults though they practice as much as twice or three times than secondary school students.</SI3> I think that there is the appropriate time in everything and learning is not exception.</BO3><CO>Art and music should be taught in secondary school because it's not only a good hobby but also make a good personality and learned the fastest in that time. <TR>Personally</TR>, I am greatly thankful to my parents that they make my life abundant by making a friend with music in my childhood.</CO>
column23: This was a well written essay. The thesis statement was the weakest part of this essay. It was on topic but it did not include any information as to how it would answer the topic. The supporting ideas were structured and included examples. The text was measured and efficient. It was a nice essay.

column1: 405&If you could change one important thing about your hometown, what would you change? Use reason and specefic examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>I suppose there can be varied ideas about a important thing about my home town. <TS><TR>Im my opinion</TR>, If I could change one important thing about my home town, I would make a sports complex.</TS> It makes people be healthy and gives a community to people.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, A sports complex make people be healthy. </MI1><SI1>People are healthy through exercising. A sports complex gives people a chance to exercise. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, My hometown have no sports complex. People in my hometown have no chance to exercise. They want to play swimming and tabletennis but cann't play because there is no sports complex.</EX><TR> In this maner</TR>, A sports complex should be considered to make people be healthy.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, A sports complex gives people a community.</MI2><SI2> Community is very important in hometown. Peolple meet and share imformation at a community. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, Many hometowns have no a communuty like a sports complex. If people have a community such as a sports complex, people would often meet each other , , share imformations and have a good relationships. </EX><TR>Similarly</TR>, A sports complex as a communty play a important role in developing people' relationships.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, different people have different attitudes regarding a important thing in respective hometowns. <TR>Im my view</TR>, I suggest that a sports complex be made to give a good place for people's health and as a community for people' good relationships.</CO>
column23: This was a fairly well written essay. The language was clear and the grammar was clean. The thesis should have included just a mention of how the author would defend the argument.

column1: 406&People should never live at home with their parents after the age of twenty five.
column3: <IN>In many Western countries, the young who graduate from high school tend to be indnpendent from their parents and live alone. <TR>These days</TR>, in spite of the fact that other countries, including Korea, follow this western trend, it is still unusual for our youngers be independent from their parents.</IN><BO1><MI1>I agree that it hs many merits to be independent from one's parents in two ways. </MI1><SI1><TR>Firstly</TR> the young who lead their life for themselves learn responsibility for their lives.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, they learn the way of spending money. </MI2><SI2>But in contrast Western, our society treat family as one of the most important thing. If the young live without thier family in early age, the family - centered social system will be destroyed. Because our society has weak social structure for youngers to earn their livings. </SI2>So they may not conduct their role like students to earn money.</BO2><CO>I believe, in the future, we must be also independent from our parents. But immediately to carry on this is somewhat difficult. The point of view about this subject is different according to individual, but I insist that it is so early in Korea to leave home and live independent after the age of 25.</CO>
column23: This was a rather poorly written essay. The grammar and language were actually good. The thesis was, however, non-existent. The remaining language did not properly address the given topic in a clear fashion.

column1: 407&Which would you choose: a high-paying job with long hours that would give you little time with family and friends or a lower-paying job with shorter hours that would give you more time with family and friends? Explain your choice, using specific reasons and details.
column3: <IN>When people choose their jobs, most of them do not decide what jobs they should take. Especially they hesitate between a high-paying job and a low-paying job. I would choose a low-paying job for five or six years in my youth until I can establish a foundation in my life. <TS><TR>After years</TR>, I would change my job to a high-paying one which gives me freedom and much time to enjoy my life.</TS> <TR> In this essay</TR>, I will explain detailed reasons on my viewpoint. </IN><BO1><MI1>Let's think about a high-paying job. </MI1><SI1>I think it is a natural tendency that human beings should exert themselves to use their talents in youth. Because we invest much time in working, we can achieve many results and gain praises from other people. Plenty of money and esteem is a natural result from our efforts. With money we can be married or build the house we would live our whole lives. But a high-paying job has disadvantages. It gives us little time to enhance the relationships between our family members or friends.</SI1> It is also difficult to keep us healthy in that work gives us lots of stress.</BO1><BO2><MI2>A low-paying job has also advantages and disadvantages.</MI2><SI2> It provides for us with much time to do other things such as participating in sports and hobby, and make our health strong. Using these activities, we can kick stress away, and improve our physical and mental health. But it takes many years to set our lives up because we do not have enough money.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Therefore</TR>, I would rather choose a high-paying job when young.</MI3><SI3><TR> However</TR>, if I would be ready to support my family from money resulted from hardworking, I would choose a low-paying job which gives me and my family much time to enjoy our lives.</SI3></BO3><CO>Every person has his own sense of value. I think that I would live my life in freedom which might be deprived of by overwork rather than in stress from heavy works. But since to live a comfortable life requires some money, when young I will spend my life in working hard to earn much money and social status enough to prepare for the rest of my life. For real happiness does not lie in saving or spending money but in living a life unbridled from circumstances.</CO>
column23: This was a rather poorly written essay. The style was a bit too conversational in tone. This informalness is not proper in an essay. The essay needed to give more of a direction to the paper and a reason for the direction taken. The main body paragraph ideas were also too vague.

column1: 408&Compare the advantage of living in dormitory with in apartment, and give reasons for the preference.
column3: <IN><TS>When I have studied the course for master, I should choose my housing for the last semester because I desperately occupied enough time for studying.</TS> To select housing made me nervous. There are lots of housing types, and they have many advantages and disadvantages. <TR>Finally</TR> I remained two choices; university dormitory and apartment.</IN><BO1><MI1>The dormitory has a strong advantage. </MI1><SI1>The university housing is generally cheap. The expense is really important point.</SI1> Students have little money because they have no time to invest to earn the money and they must use their time to examine something.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Also</TR> the dormitory has another good point. It has a lot of convenient facilities.</MI2><SI2> There are dining room, laundry, gymnasium, seminar room, etc in whole building. </SI2>The convenience for studying and for living at the same time is wonderful advantage.</BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>The other side</TR>, the apartment has a big advantage too.</MI3><SI3><TR> In my opinion</TR>, the best point of apartment is independent space. We don't have to have a roommate and to be supervised by university's rule in the apartment. To have my own room is so attractive point. Is there any thing to exchange with freedom? Another advantage is stability. We usually move our room by semester in the dormitory. It is really irritating and weary job. But in the apartment we don't have to move our habitat. </SI3>The stable nest is sweetest place in the world.</BO3><CO>In preceding passages, I compared the advantages of dormitory with of apartment. In two type of housing, to choose the only one is really difficult because the advantages are critical all. But if I would choose to prefer one, I will point the dormitory. There are many important factors to select the housing, but to economize the expense is essential to student. I have already spent a huge money for studying and will do also. I should save the money from the housing, and then use it valuably to study more.</CO>
column23: This essay was of medium quality. The thesis statement was not in line with the topic. The thesis makes clear that the author had the experience of a choice. There is no question posed except in implication. That was not clear or strongly presented. The main ideas which should have also had some impact and force were also weakly made.

column1: 409&Some people believe that university students should be required to attend classes. Others believe that going to classes should be optional for students. Which point of view do you agree with? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
column3: <IN>People generally have different opinions about attitudes of university students to attend classes. Some people believe that students should be required to attend calssed, while others believe that attendance calsses should be optional for students. <TS><TR>Personally</TR>, I agree to the former, because it allows students to make efficient and healthful study and campus life.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>In general</TR>, a regulation attneding classes make feel students responsibilities of campus life and steps of study.</MI1> <SI1> So they will know the way to design study plans efficiently, and it help them to live healthful campus life. <EX><TR>For example</TR> my case, when a freshman, I had the freedom to deign my study plan and attend classes of myself as common university students. But I tend to inefficiently use that, often absented my major classes. <TR>As a result</TR>, I couldn't understand well the context, and I had to use other tiems and schedules in university to overcom lack study.</EX></SI1> <TR>Through these experience</TR>, I can feel the importance of classes for efficient and healthful university life.</BO1><CO>So I come to the conclusion that university students should be required to present classes.</CO>
column23: It was really difficult to understand what the author was trying to say at crucial parts of this essay. The thesis statement only pointed to another sentence to lay out the main points. The thesis should combine and present all pertinent information in one sentence.

column1: 410&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Only people who earn a lot of money are successful. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Money is a crucial thing for we can buy many things which sustain our lives such as foods, clothes and so on and even make our dream realized. <TR>Thus</TR>, most of people make efforts to earn lots of money as much as possible or have jobs. <TS><TR>However</TR>, I don't think that only people who earn a lot of money are succeesful. </TS></IN><BO1><MI1>There are a few standard evaluating whether one success or not except money as a reputation and authority.</MI1> <SI1><TR>For instance</TR>, we can say that the preist who are famous for a warm character and a speech moving people's mind have lived successfully though he isn't in wealth. The case of some novelist who failed to sell his story much to make little profit, but is granted by the novel prize commitee also demonstrates that more valuable things exist than money.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>We can not buy everything with money though nobody disagree that more money we have, more we get.</MI2> <SI2><TR>Not to speak of</TR>, money enable us to make us live wealthy and convinient. It's true that those who have more money live more stable and enjoyable than not. <TR>However</TR>, something which can not be seen as dream, health, heart, love, happineess can't be calculated by money. If I were a millionarie without a truly friend and people camouflage their intend to approah me due to my money, I would never feel happy inspite of wearing a diamond neclekss.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>As stated above</TR>, that only people who make the great deal of money are successful is not reasonable considering the other values being more precious than money and a few things that we are not able to get with money. Money is only the means to reach the succesful lives. Whether one has a succeful live or not depends on his own mind.</CO>
column23: This was a relatively well written essay. The thesis could have included a few proofs in summary to show the direction of the paper. Just having the main argument makes it more of an introduction rather than a thesis statement. The main ideas were very good. There were some problems with spelling and grammar.

column1: 411&Some famous athletes and entertainers earn millions of dollars every year. Do you think these people deserve such high salaries? Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>In our society, there are a great variety of people who have their own jobs such as scientist, professor, entrepreneur, athlete, entertainer, and so forth. Especially athletes or entertainers earn much money from their jobs. I think such high salaries are exorbitant because although they have great influence on our society, other jobs are also important. <TS><TR>In this essay</TR>, I will think about the reasons for what I think high salaries of them are not proper.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, let's think about the reason why entertainers or athletes earn much money.</MI1> <SI1>The most reliable one is that they reveal what they are to the public directly, so that they have great impact on our society. <TR>As a result</TR>, the entertainment world revolves around them. <TR>That is</TR>, they are the center of media. Because much money is concentrated on massmedia and entertainers or athletes are the means to maximize the effect on the public, it is natural consequence that they are hired at large salaries.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Even though they have reasons for high salaries, I cannot dismiss the thought that their salaries are excessive.</MI2> <SI2>Our society has other jobs that strongly contribute to society such as engineers or scientists. I think without these people our society would fall into ruins after years because they are the people who establish the foundation of our society. </SI2>In spite of their hardworking they do not earn much money because of the reasons we cannot see their faces on TV.</BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Therefore</TR>, I think we should invest money in the frameworks on which our society bases.</MI3><SI3><TR>First</TR> we should curtail the salaries of entertainers or athletes. With money from them we had better make salaries of other people more high.</SI3> This method could strengthen the groundwork of our society.</BO3><CO><TR>As I have previously stated</TR>, entertainers or athletes have their own reasons for high salaries. But we cannot conclude they deserve such high salaries. We should keep in mind that the collapse of the foundation means the breakdown of entire society. <TR>Therefore</TR>, we should reduce the salaries of entertainers. This way can make our society achieve equality and help to make our society bright.</CO>
column23: This was a fairly well written essay. It was easy to follow and red. The wording and grammar was also fairly good. One issue is that the the author rarely spells out that the topic is the athlete or entertainer. Clarification on this in each paragraph would add to clarity.

column1: 412&It has been said, ¡°Not everything that is learned is contained in books.¡± Compare and contrast knowledge gained from experience with knowledge gained from books. In your opinion, which source is more important? Why?
column3: <IN>People achieve information and knowledge from many sources. <TR>Moreover</TR>, there are each own advantages and disadvantages between having knowledge from books and experiences. <TS><TR>Personally</TR>, I think that books is more important; I can solve the problem well, enjoy my time, and get much more knowledge. </TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, I would attain the solution about any problems from books. </MI1><SI1>Most people study their major with books; <TR>furthermore</TR>, when I study and don¡¯t know about any subject, I may be able to find the solution in the books. <TR>In addition</TR>, I would read comic books and magazine when I am depressed or take a rest in free time. Books give to me not only information but also pleasure. <TR>In fact</TR>, in the worlds, there are colossal books. <TR>Also</TR>, experience is limited. I can have knowledge in the books which do not get from experience. <SI1><TR>However</TR>, by reading the books I may not deal with every situation.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Next</TR>, I would have real and live answer from experience.</MI2> <SI2>When I played the piano on the stage, I would feel fear and be afraid of people. It is key that I experience and practice more and more. <TR>In other words</TR>, even though, other people say control my mind and I read books, I can manage my situation deeply and specifically by experience. <TR>However</TR>, experience is narrow. <TR>Consequently</TR>, I can not get much information.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In summary</TR>, modern society is period of information. I can earn knowledge through books, the Internet, other people, and experience. <TR>However</TR>, I support that books can give me resolution, joyfulness, and much knowledge.</CO>
column23: This was a fairly well written essay. The thesis is well structured and allows the reader to see what the essay will cover just from reading the one statement. There is some issue with clarity and word choice. It is sometimes difficult to follow the wording and logic of paragrphs.

column1: 413& It has been said, Not everything that is learned is contained in books. Compare and contrast knowledge gained from experience with knowledge gained from books. In your opinion, which source is more important? Why?
column3: <IN>When it comes to acquiring knowledge, there are several ways to achieve it. And the most commonly used forms are knowledge which was gained from various experience during lifetime and knowledge which was gained from books. <TR>That is</TR>, we learn a lot of things both by reading books and by various experiences. Both of these types have their own advantages. <TS><TR>But in my view point</TR>, it is more effective method to learn about something by reading books rather than by having numerable experiences. </TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Of course</TR>, knowledge by experience is more vivid than the knowledge by books and thus, knowledge by experience is a way more likely to be remembered longer than the knowledge by books.</MI1><SI1>And while reading books to gain certain knowledge may be very boring to some people, having a lot of experience is unpredictable and fun to common people.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>But there are some problems in this aspect.</MI2><SI2> Although having a lot of experience to get some knowledge can bring us a great deal of joy and pleasure, there can be some mistakes during the process of experience, and therefore no one can be so sure about that the knowledge gained by experience is correct. <TR>However</TR>, books are the accumulation of previous experience. There are proofed knowledge in those books, so they bring us more commonly accepted knowledge, that is, more correct knowledge than experience.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, knowledge by experience can give us vividness, joyfulness, and longer remembrance while knowledge by experience can give us more commonly accepted and correct information. I think that the advantages of the latter one is superior to that of the former one. <TR>Therefore</TR>I maintain that knowledge gained from books is more important source than that gained from experience.</CO>
column23: This was a fairly well written essay. The thesis is well structured and clear. The body of the essay is also well laid out. Some additional transitions would have helped in the flow of the essay as would have some examples.

column1: 414&Some people think that governments should spend as much money as possible on developing or buying computer technology. Other people disagree and think that this money should be spent on more basic needs. Which one of these opinions do you agree with? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN>The foundation of our society has their bases on lots of factors. These are not only frameworks such as transportations or computer technology but also basic needs of common people. We should not neglect both. But it is difficult for government to meet all these needs because the amount of money is limited. <TS><TR>Thus</TR>, I think it is the best way that first of all we should take the basic lives of people into account, then invest money in high technology.</TS> <TR>In this essay</TR>, I will give a detailed explanation of my viewpoint. </IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, let's think about the reasons why we should first fill up the basic needs of common people.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Nowadays</TR> computer technology with the help of an internet have great influences on unifying cultures. And it is not an exaggeration that the level of computer technology is the standard of living of one country. <TR>However</TR>, many countries that are located in Asia or Africa do not utilize high technology because their level of basic lives is excessively low. <TR>Thus</TR>, high technology that does not entail the meeting of basic need is useless.</SI1> It is an inevitable conclusion that high technology must follow the investment in the basic needs of common people.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>After the basic needs that are essential to develop an industry are satisfied</TR>, government should spend much money on buying computer technology.</MI2> <SI2>The world is linked by computer technology. And even universities co-work with those of other countries and share their knowledge. All of these activities cannot be executed without the help of computer technology. The world revolves around the country with a high computer technology. <TR>Hence</TR>, without the investment in computer technology, our country would at last fall into ruins in the future.</SI2> The more one country develop, the higher technologies are demanded.</BO2><CO>Two factors are also important because of the reasons I have previously stated. But government should bear in mind that our goals do not lie in the happiness of a few people, but in that of all the people. We should run to the development which requires high technology. But it is more urgent to meet the basic need. <TR>Thus</TR>, government should first spend much money on answering more basic needs, then on buying computer technology. For society cannot stand firm if the lives of common people totally collape.</CO>
column23: This a very nice essay. The thesis was severly lacking in content and support. That content was included elsewhere in the introduction. The transitions were well utilized and not too many to hurt the flow of the essay. Some additional examples would have helped some.

column1: 415&When people succeed, it is because of hard work. Luck has nothing to do with success." Do you agree or disagree with the quotation above? Use specific reasons and examples to explain your position.
column3: <IN>All of us want to succeed in our life. To succeed, it is said that we need hard work. <TR>Additionally</TR>, some people say we also need luck; while, other people say luck has nothing to do with success. <TS><TR>As far as I'm concerned</TR>, however, I do not agree with the quotation above that luck has nothing to do with success because lucky people have more desirable character to succeed and get more chances to get high quality education.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>In the first place</TR>, lucky people have more desirable character to succeed.</MI1><SI1> <TR>Basically</TR>, we agree with that our success in life is related to gene and environment; that is, our fate is determined by our natural characteristic and acquired effort. <TR>About this</TR>, we can never ignore the former, our nature. Lucky people have more aggressive and positive personality, which are very helpful for tiding over many hardships we face. <TR>On the contrary</TR>, unlucky people have negative and inactive personality, which prevent them from getting many opportunities to succeed. <TR>Therefore</TR>, genetic luck is very significant in our life.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In the second place<TR>, lucky people have more chances to succeed in life.</MI2> <SI2>If born in wealthy home, children can have more high quality education. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, from early childhood, they can learn various things such as piano, taekwondo, and computer skill. It would be helpful for them to grow up versatile; and it, <TR>in addition</TR>, makes them find their aptitude early and practice their skills. <TR>However</TR>, in poor home, parents cannot afford to have children get various education. <TR>Consequently</TR>, children cannot have opportunities to find their aptitude early and has less chances to practice their potential.</EX> <TR>Therefore</TR>, luckily grown children in affluent home have more chances to succeed.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To summarize</TR>, luck have much to do with people's success on the ground that lucky people have more desirable character to succeed and get more opportunities to breed their ability. With positive personality and more chances to practice their potential, we are likely to succeed more.</CO>
column23: This was an excellent essay. The thesis statement was complete and strong. Transitions were well utilized and spaced to effect. Examples were also used to help the author prove the points. Some word choice could have been improved. Well done.

column1: 416&Some people prefer to live in a small town. Others prefer to live in a big city. Which place would you prefer to live in? Use specific reasons and details to suppor your answer.
column3: <IN>Today the number of people who live in a big city is more than that in a small town. <TS>But It's not for every citizen to live in a city because they want to live in a big city.</TS> So am I, either.</IN><BO1><MI1>Rural life has three benefits.</MI1> <SI1>A first thing is clean air. A human being can't live without air even in a minute. But most big cities' air is getting dirtier because of cars, factories and heating etc. A second thing is fellowship of neighborhood. The people take an interest in their neighbor. So they give a help each other in need. A third thing is a educating children in the nature. the children can learn many things from the nature and be strong by running on wild fields.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>However</TR> living in a small town isn't always good.</MI2> <SI2>There are few cultural facilities such as libraries, schools, hospitals, and theatres, etc. And it is difficult to get a job in a small town.</BO2><CO>Living in a small town, even though, has some disadvantages, it's better than living in dirty smog, in a traffic jam, and with next door man whom I never talk to.</CO>
column23: The author doesn't know what position fits their desires and so does little to answer the question with any convicton. It is a week essay that introduces general concepts around the topic but does nothing to actually answer anything or make any points.

column1: 417&Some people say that advertising encourages us to buy things we really do not need. Others say that advertisements tell us about new products that may improve our lives. Which viewpoint do you agree with? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TR>Nowadays</TR>, we see commercial advertisement every day. Whether we read newspaper or watch television, we cannot help seeing commercial. <TR>About this</TR>, some people say that they are against commercial seeing that it makes us buy things we really do not need. <TS><TR>However</TR>, as far as I'm concerned, I'm in favor of the positive opinion that advertisements tell us about new products that may improve our lives because advertisements allows us to know useful information about new goods and heightens the quality of our life.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>In the first place</TR>, advertisements allows us to know useful information about new goods.</MI1> <SI1>The higher our level of technology becomes, the more various merchandise we can use. In this situation, we can get fruitful information such as designn and usefulness from advertisement. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, when we need computer, we can have more chances to select better one considering its quality and price by seeing the advertisement. Without advertisement, we would be a little confused of what computer to choose.</EX></SI1> <TR>Thus</TR>, advertisement is helpful for selecting better commodity.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In the second place</TR>, advertisements heightens the quality of life.</MI2> <SI2>A bout two years ago, in our country, cellular phone was not so general but beeper was our main way of communication. <TR>Still</TR>, the force of advertisement was strong enough to change the culture of whole country. In just two years, about half of people in our country have their own cellular phone whether they are old or young. <Tr>Consequently</TR>, our life became so convenient. Anywhere, any time, we can communicate with our friends, family and other people when needed. It would be impossible without advertisements.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To summarize</TR>, advertisements are desirable in that they enable us to know fruitful information about merchandise and heighten the quality of life.</CO>
column23: This was a fairly well written essay. It does not seem to address the topic perfectly, but it is close enough to seem so. Everything seems close enough. The transitions, however, seemed perfect. There were excellent examples to fit the main points as well.

column1: 418&What are some of the qualities of a good parent? Use specific details and examples to explain your answer.
column3: <IN>It is very difficult and critical things to select a couple of qualities of a good parent. <TS><TR>However</TR>, I am sure that the two most essential qualities of a good parent are that one is that parents encourage their children to find their talents and the other is that parents need to blame their children to fix their faults.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, I would like to mention something about children¡¯s future. </MI1> <SI1>To arrive at their dreams in the future, children need to find their own talents or abilities to do something. Although teachers sometimes find out students¡¯ abilities while their class, because they cannot concentrate on one student, parents should observe their children and find out their talents. <EX><TR>As you know</TR>, Seri Park, a famous golfer found her significant ability by her father¡¯s effort when she was ten years old. If her father did not look for her own talent, she could not be a best golfer in the world.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, let us think about what will help children get good characteristics.</MI2><SI2> I know that both of praise and blame of a parent are important for children to make up their features, but I am convinced that occasionally blame is more needed for children than praise. <EX><TR>According to the statistics from the Children Research Center</TR>, over sixty percent of parents of a city of Seoul agreed that the blame of parents is more effective for children¡¯s education than praise.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I assert that the radical needs for children during their growing are that they have to find their talents and they have to know how to fix their bad habits. <TR>Therefore</TR>, parents have to help their children look for their talents and recognize their faults and these are the qualities of a good parent.</CO>
column23: This essay has a nice thesis statemetn that sets the structure for the entire essay. This transitioned well into the body paragraphs, but those paragraphs had very weak main ideas. A shortfall in this essay is the conversational and informal tone of it.

column1: 419&What are some of the qualities of a good parent? Use specific details and examples to explain your answer.
column3: <IN>Absolute and unlimited love is a symbol of parents. They raise their children with love and want to be a good parents. <TS>To be a good parents, one should understand, praise and sometimes scold his/her children.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>Perhaps the most important quality of a good parent is understanding his/her children well.</MI1> <SI1>Whatever children do, a good parent try to understand children in their shoes. Then children can talk to their parent frankly and can also solve children's problem together.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, praise is a second quality of a good parent.</MI2> <SI2>My parents praised me when I did well at school. They pated me on my back even though my grade was not good. They always believe in me, and it encouraged and motivated me to do everything harder.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3>Another important quality of a good parent is scolding.</MI3> <SI3>If parents spoil their children with praise only, children can not distinguish wrong behavior from right one. When I told them a lie or quarreled with my brother, my parents scold me severly. </SI3>Scolding lead children to a right way.</BO3><CO><TR>In brief</TR>, these qualities are what a gool parent is all about. To be a good parent, always understand your children, praise them when they do a good job and scold them when they act wrong.</CO>
column23: Except for the shortness of this essay, there are many great things about this essay. The thesis was concise yet contined all the information it needed. The main ideas were also satisfactary in setting the foundation for the individual paragraphs. A little more length in the body paragraphs would have provided for more specific examples.

column1: 420&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? People are never satisfied with what they have; they always want something more or something different. Use specific reasons to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Many of people eager to change thier position and to realize their dream. Not to speak of me, though being satisfied almost in my environment, I am all the time dreaming better lives and to make efforts my dreams to come true. <TS><TR>Howevery</TR>, I don't think that people are never satisfied with what they have. </TS></IN><BO1><MI1>There are lots of people sticking their own willing such a religious people.</MI1> <SI1><TR>For example</TR>, the way of the religious people like nuns, priests and so on are required to live ascetic lives.. It is forbidden to enjoy theri live mentally or physically such from drinking, eating the meats to even getting a marriage though it makes our lives stable and happy. <TR>However</TR>, despite a number of hardships, the reason they keep up with them is not that they don't know or feel the pleasure or that they are satisfied with theri lives but have the firm willing and belief for the god.. </SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Also</TR>, we can find the volunteer easily to give aids to the poor or handicapped peoples without salary.</MI2><SI2><TR> Of course</TR>, not all of those who helping others are in abundant lives or stable. <TR>However</TR>, many stories about warm-hearted volunteers who are in poor position is widely known through the newspaper or television documentary program. As they know the situations and feeling when they are in the problem, they would help the poor or the old even in case they could not be paid what they've done and nobody knows about their goods.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>As stated above</TR>, every people don't want something more and differnt not because of those who don't try to change something are satisfied with their situation because they have a firm belief and mind considering others first.</CO>
column23: The quality of this essay was mixed. The thesis made clear the convicton of the author but not the points that would be used to prove the argument. It was also difficult to see what the main points were ctually implying or what use they had in the essay. The rest of the essay was very well written and in ways ade up for the shortfalls.

column1: 421&Some people choose friends who are different from themselves. Others choose friends who are similar to themselves. Compared the advantages of having friends who are different form you with the advantages of having friends who are similar to you. Which kind of friend do you prefer for yourself? Why?
column3: <IN>People have various criteria to choose friends. Some people like to have friends who have similar background, hobby, personality while others prefer to have friends who are quite different. <TS>I prefer to have friends with different experience and personality from me. </TS></IN><BO1><MI1>If you have friends who are similar to you, you feel very comfortable when you are with them.</MI1> <SI1>You can share common ideas and interests and rely on them for their advice about your problems. Your friend is more likely to understand you better and confirm your self-concept than others. <TR>However</TR>, as time goes by, you may find out that there is nothing new or interesting to attract your attention.</SI1> You might feel monotonous in the friendship.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, when you have friends with totally different background, preference and character, they meet your needs that you have never experienced.</MI2> <SI2>Thus you can get a lot of new knowledge and experience through them, which helps you to understand what others think and get out of your own world. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, suppose that you are just a highly-motivated student spending most of your time studying and do not know anything about sports. If your friend is an excellent sports player, you would learn how to enjoy sports activity through associating with your friend. <TR>However</TR>, there is always some possibility to have conflicts between you and your friend arising from those differences.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO><TR>As mentioned above</TR>, I prefer to choose friends who are very different from me because I can learn and experience new things that stimulate me.</CO>
column23: This essay flows well and seems very clean. There are very few grammatical or word choice errors. The thesis does a great job intruducing the thought of the author but not the reasons for it. That should be lengthened and improved.

column1: 422&Schools should ask students to evaluate their teachers. Do you agree or disagree? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>When I attended university, evaluating professors was a course in the end of term. Some professors prepared for their own evaluation paper for themselves because they thought it helped them review their teaching method and attitude for students. I think evaluating teachers is useful not only for teachers but also for students; it improves teaching method and facillitates communication between teachers and students. <TR>Also</TR>, we can use the result of it as a standard for teacher promotion. <TS><TR>Thus</TR>, I agree school should ask students to evaluate their teachers. </TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, teachers can know what their students need.</MI1> <SI1>When we take a part in a class as students, we may have difficult understanding study due to teachers' teaching method; they speak too fast or students don't have enough time to ask questions. <TR>However</TR>, if teachers have an open-minded attitude, they would positively adopt such basic needs and try to cope with such problems next time. </SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, once teachers and students evaluate each other, they can communicate more easily.</MI2> <SI2>The relation between teachers and students is unilateral; people only think of a teacher as a instructor and a student as a learner. Such definition sometimes disturbs natural communication among them. <TR>However</TR>, reciprocal evaluation opens a door for them to communicate more actively because such course helps them correct their flaw and adapt others' opinion.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Finally</TR>, we can reflect the result of evaluation on promotion.</MI3> <SI3>If a teacher is evaluated well, it means that he is welcomed by his students and his teaching method is effective. School can know his abiltity and attitude for class through students' evaluation. <TR>Hence</TR>, it is useful method, which school can indirectly rate teachers' qualities.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>As I have stated above</TR>, we can get positive results from students' evaluation for teachers. Teachers will listen more carefully to their students and try to find out effective teaching method. <TR>On the other thing</TR>, students can convey their opinion to their teachers more efficiently through reciprocal evaluation. <TR>Also</TR>, school can know teachers' qualites. <TR>As a result</TR>, it incites teachers to improve class mood. <TR>Thus</TR>, I think school's request is reasonable and good idea.</CO>
column23: The author does a wonderful job writing an essay that flows well and is pleasing to read. A major error is that the author always assumes that the reader knows the evidence and proof behind each of the points. This is a fatal flaw tht affects nearly every section of the essay.

column1: 423&"People attend college or university for many different reasons (for example, new experiences, career preparation,increased knowledge). Why do you think people attend college or university? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer."
column3: <IN>The most of people want to go college. <TS>They have a lot of personal reason but I think there are two specific reasons.</TS> It is for job and personal dream.</IN><BO1><MI1>Some students's purpose of enrolling college is so that get a good job when they graduate the college because student's major subject is very important point that get a better job.</MI1> Usually someone who graduated good college is paid more much and responsibilities at the work is more easier.</BO1><BO2><MI2>Accomplishment of own dream is also why students want to go college.</MI2> <SI2>The most of people want to have accomplished their dream. The College teaches many kind of subject. It gives opportunity for students and teaches students how to accomplish their own dream.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>Of course</TR>, There are many personal reasons but i think getting a good job and accomplishment of personal dream is major reason of students.</CO>
column23: The essay is not really much of an essay. The thesis begins by not even making a full and complete sentence. The rest of the essay is filled with incomplete thoughts and fragments.

column1: 424&Imagine that you are preparing for a trip. You plan to be away from your home for a year. In addition to clothing and personal care items, you can take one additional thing. What would you take and why? Use specific reasons and details to support your choice.
column3: <IN>If I have a chance to live the other place, I will accept that happily. <TR>However</TR>, as surrounding around me is different from now, I should prepare lots of things to adapt to the lives in a new place. <TS>If I am allowed to take one more thing except clothing and personal care items, I would like to take my mobile phone. </TS></IN><BO1><MI1>The mobile phone can be the only means connecting the people whom I love such my family, friends with me.</MI1> <SI1>When I have been to a few countries for a trip in this winter, I had to go around to find the public phone to call to my parents who are waiting for my call every night. Because didn't not only know how to get the public phone box but also communicate the people in each country, I spent a long time and was exhausted totally. <TR>Moreover</TR>, I was so confused with the differen systems in each city. My parents had to just wait for my phone due to my flexible schedule. The telephone is one of my routine and I really miss my close people when being apart from them. One of my friends studying in abroad said that it takes a few weeks to set the telephone line in a new house. </SI1><TR>Considering this</TR>, I will take my mobile phone to give and take call with my around.</BO1><BO2><MI2>As technique is developing steeply, a mobile phone is including a number of pivotal functions.</MI2><SI2> <TR>For example</TR>, we can check our mail box, get the information through the mobile phone which are able to play the same role with internet and keep a number of memories such the telephone numbers or my schedule.</SI2> <TR>Especially</TR>, because the technique of my country in the conducting the mobilephone is the most famous in the world, I really would take my mobile phone.</BO2><CO><TR>As stated above</TR>, my mobile phone is greatly necessary for me as a means which enable for me to realte others wherever I am and a convenient equipment despite of its expensive price. <TR>However</TR>, I will get along comfortably with that in case I am in some problem for it's extremely useful for me solve the problem.</CO>
column23: This was an above average quality essay that had some word choice issues. The topic presented is clear that the scenario is hypothetical, but the author uses the word 'will' rather than 'would'. This changes to an extent the implications in the essay,

column1: 425&The expression `never, never give up` means to keep trying and never stop working for your goals. Do you agree or disagree with this statement? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>While we live in this world, we usually experience not only the gladness of life but also severe suffering. Especially suffering makes us so exhausted that we come to hesitate whether to go on toward goals or to give up. But, there are voices from family members or friends that 'you should never give up' or 'you can do because you are worthy of success'. <TS>I think that when we have a goal in life we should not give up until we achieve it.</TS> <TR>In this essay</TR>, I will give a detailed explanation of my viewpoint.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, I think that the purpose of our predicament is 'test' or 'discipline' from Divine Power.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Especially</TR> it is to strengthen our abilities to overcome lots of obstacles. Even though we cannot determine where to go since suffering covers our eyes into the blind, we should do our best. It is very important not to throw up the belief that in the future the path we could walk along will be revealed because it is possible that somebody or some situations may show up to help us. If we do give up, we will be deprived of these miracles. </SI1><TR>Therefore</TR>, we should not give up until we attain our goals.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Additionally</TR>, we can create or learn the abilities to cope with bitterness while we are suffering.</MI2> <SI2>These abilities can enlarge our outlook, so that we will be persons who have better skills to communicate with other people, and will realize the truth that society is merciless. If we have a goal and keep working, although we might not reach the very goal, we could be near it. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, let's suppose that I have the dream to be a president of my country. Maybe I will make every effort, so that although I might not become a president, I could be the prime minister or a person who is just like a president.</EX></SI2> <TR>Thus</TR>, we should keep on working toward a goal.</BO2><CO>I have stated the reasons why we should not give up our goals. <TR>As the proverb says</TR>, God helps those who help themselves. I absolutely agree with it. Only those who take great pains which keep pace with firm faith deserve to succeed in life. We should keep in mind that hardship is merely the test to check whether we are big figures or small fries. Social status or fortune does not be granted to an idle one who is very weak to abandon their goals.</CO>
column23: This was a rather well written essay. The thesis is strong and clear as well as the body of the essay. There are many good poitns and examples given. It is easy to follow the conclusions of the essay to the end.

column1: 426&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Universities should give the same amount of money to their students sports activities as they give to their university libraries. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>The role of the university to the students will determine their future. Some people prefer to play their sports activites, others prefer to have affluent libraries. <TS>I prefer that Universities should give the amount of money to their university libraries, because broad libraries give the students the much chance to study and improve the competetion of university.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, flood libraries offer the students various environment to study effectly.</MI1> <SI1>To students, the life of libraries is very important. They study several projects and study group in there. But many universities in Korea don't have the need space of libraries because of the lack of fund. In my case, my school have small library, but the number of student was big. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I allways suffered to keep my seat in the library.</SI1> I sometimes thought that the accommodating space will need to my shcool. </BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Socondly</TR>, extending libraries will develope the competetion of university.</MI2><SI2> The one of the basic of universtiy evaluation is the ability of libraries. The technological system and computerizing impormation of them get good gread in university evaluation. <TR>Therefore</TR>, most universities plan the invest in libray field. It is the most good method to improve the value of the university.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, the facility investment to the university library give the student to the chance to study in the convenient mood and develope the competetion ability of the university. When university offer the amount fund to library, the policy will save both the students and the universty. The future of the university is bright.</CO>
column23: This essay was complete and easy to follow and understand. The thesis is strong except that it doesn't say as opposed to what department it would rather have money dedicated. This makes the essay potentially unclear in some spots as the author makes assumptions that the reader continues to remember the subject of the anti-thesis.

column1: 427&Holidays honor people or events. If you could create a new holiday, what person or event would it honor and how would you want people to celebrate it?
column3: <IN>There are many holidays to honor people or events in my country. <TS>If I could create a new holiday, I would like to create the day of ¡°King of Sejong.¡±</TS> King of Sejong is a historical person who made Korean language hundreds of years ago. Most people as well as I really honor the king of Sejong. I also want people to use Korean language correctly during the day to appreciate king of Sejong to make our language.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, there were many respectable kings in my country since Korean history started.</MI1> <SI1>I am sure that one of the most adored kings is the king of Sejong who made Korean language. Before king of Sejong made Korean language, Korean people had to use Chinese language. Korea was not a completely independent country, because Korean used Chinese language. <TR>In brief</TR>, our language has the very important meaning in my country, so I want to honor the person who made Korean.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>To celebrate the day of ¡°King of Sejong¡±, I want people to use Korean correctly.</MI2> <SI2><TR>As you know</TR>, language has changed while people use the language for a long time. Korean language is not exception. Young people make Korean be simple, of course it is not correct, and they make lots of slang nowadays while they use the internet chatting system. <TR>As a result</TR>, many young people do not know what are correct words and correct usage. <TR>Therefore</TR>, we have to teach people how to use Korean correctly even just the day of ¡°King of Sejong.¡±</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I assert that because a language is the most important thing for an independent country, we have to honor the person, who made the language, and create the day to thank him. <TR>Although there is the day which we celebrate the day of Korean language</TR>, we do not have the day of king of Sejong. <TR>Therefore</TR>, if I could create a new holiday, I would create the day of ¡°King of Sejong¡±.</CO>
column23: The structure of this essay is really great. It is easy to follow the steps that the author makes to come to the conclusions given. The thesis, however, is very weak. It does almost nothing to set the stage for the essay. It is just sentence in the middle of the introduction. The many transitions help the essay flow and keeps the conclusions rolling up into each other as they combine to make one final point that works in favor of what would have been a thesis statement.

column1: 428& It has recently been announced that a large shopping center may be built in your neighborhood. Do you support or oppose this plan? Why? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Some people support the plan that a large shopping center may be built in their neighborhood because of their convenient day life and new employment opportunity. Others oppose the plan of building a large department store because it brings traffic, air pollution, and increase of rent problem. <TR>Recently</TR>, a large shopping center was built In my neighborhood. We have many problems such as traffic jam and increase of rent. <TS>I disagree with the plan.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, if a large shopping mall appear in my country, many people who live in near my country come to the mall by driving their own car.</MI1> <SI1>We don't have subway in our neighborhood. I am very worrying about the heavy traffic problem.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Although building a mall brings new employment opportunity</TR>, new jobs will bring another problem.</MI2> <SI2>Many people who want to work at a shipping mall. They will rush into the country. They have to look for their housing. <TR>If so</TR>, current rent price will be increased. I don't want to pay more rent because of new employers of the mall in my neighborhood.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>All things considered</TR>, I oppose to the plan of building a lrge department store. I am sure that a lot of problems will happen such as heavy traffic problem, increase of rent price, and water and air pollution. My country already have a large sized shopping mall. My neighborhood don't want to additional mall.</CO>
column23: This essay's quality is below average. The thesis is absolutely pointless in setting the structure for the essay. The main ideas are also more of an introduction into the respective paragraphs rather than main points or argued points. There is little for this essay to make a strong opinion on when everything is so weak.

column1: 429&Some people say that physical exercise should be a required part of every school day. Other people believe that students should spend the whole school day on academic studies. Which opinion do you agree with? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN>As increasing concerns about education in modern society, there are various kinds of opinions about requiring of physical exercise. Some believe that physical exercise is important to students while others insist that only academic studies should be required to students in their every school day. <TS>Both are reasonable ; however, in my opinion, I think that the former is more right than the latter because physical exercise could increase students's health and help develop students's emotion and sociability.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, physical exercise could increase students's health.</MI1> <SI1>Students always have to study in the class room and such limited lifestyle would be harmful at students's physical development. <TR>So</TR>, even if the time is short, that physical exercise is regularly held is very helpful at students's healthy life. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, our country's secondary students are always exhausted by study for entering university from the early morning to midnight. If there aren't physical exercise subject in their every school day, our country's students couldn't sustain their exausted bodies.</EX> <TR>Similarly</TR>, physical exercise is essential for students's health.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, physical exercise could help develop students's emotion and sociability.</MI2> <SI2>Through activities in outdoors, students could have more positive mind about their situation, and they develop sociability as playing with many friends. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, when I was secondary student, I was always looking for the time of physical exercise because I felt a feeling of liberty from repeated study at the time and could establish a relationship with various kinds of friends through playing. In the time, I acquired a precious friend who played basketball game with me and the friend is the most intimate friend to me on today. <TR>As seen the example</TR>, physical exercise be able to develop students's emotion and sociability.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In short</TR>, physical exercise should be required on educational schedule of students because it conducts important role in students's several development, such as health, emotion, and sociability. When considering that students of modern society are somewhat weak on physical and emotional aspects, I'm sure that my opinion is very reasonable.</CO>
column23: This is a very good essay that is full and covers almost every area well. The thesis is very vague and does not clearly address any subject. That should be fixed. The main ideas are excellent, however, in forming the conclusions later on. The examples are also consistently well placed and tied to the rest of the essay.

column1: 430&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Attending a live performance is more enjoyable than watching the same event on television. Use specifin reasomns and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>People can have two ways to enjoy performance. Some people like attending live performance. <TR>However</TR>, others like watching on television. <TS>I prefer watching on television in that it allows to me to make feel comfort, to listen to various explanations about performer.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, watching on television more comfortable than attending live performance.</MI1> <SI1><TR>That is</TR>, in order to enjoy a performance, we should buy a ticket, which spends much time forming a queue because many people want to keep a good seat so they keep waiting for 3ix or seven hours on the outside of theater. <EX><TR>In my experience</TR>, I also waste all daytime to buy a ticket for a concert finishing only two hours. <TR>In addition</TR>, I can not see the face of artists in detail. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I was thoroughly absent-minded.</EX> <TR>Besides</TR>, people can enjoy the performance without others interference. They can eat a meal and have other activities with watching television. I often watched performances with doing my homework.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Also</TR>, Various explanations on television make people understand more easily about performers.</MI2> <SI2>Television can help people understand performers¡¯ personal information, their works and lyrics. I can not always memorize all words of my favorite singer, Britney spears, so I used to sing songs to the caption on television. <TR>Besides</TR>, if people would not see their live performance, they can see rebroadcast through television.</SI2> Because most performances perform office hour, I cannot see the performance at the time and I would record it and see at evening with eating meal.</BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, although some people think that attending live performance can make them more enjoyable and entertaining, I agree that watching on television make people become more comfortable and understand more about performers. If you want to know about performers¡¯ various aspects and enjoy comfortable conditions, you would like to watch television.</CO>
column23: This average quality essay does not have a thesis that completely addresses the topic provided. It is not clear what TV is preferred to in the eyes of the reader. Reading the whole essay is required to get an understanding of the pieces. This should be unnecessary. The examples in the supporting ideas are well placed.

column1: 431&Imagine that you are preparing for a trip. You plan to be away from your home for a year. In addition to clothing and personal care items, you can take one additional thing. What would you take and why? Use specific reasons and details to support your choice.
column3: <IN>Preparing for a long trip, there are several items we should take. Some people think that they should take a pet dog to alleviate their loneness while others prefer to bring a camera due to take beautiful scenery. <TS>If I have a chance to choose the only one additional thing, I would like to take my notebook computer due to write an email to my family and gain useful information concerning the trip.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, using a notebook is a very convenient way to write a letter.</MI1> <SI1><TR>According to develop internet and notebook in modern society</TR>, almost all countries have facility to use internet. <TR>As a result</TR>, we can send my family a letter fast and exactly. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, if we tried to send a letter using plane and ship, our exited emotion in spectacle scenery could not transfer my wife and baby fast. <TR>Sometimes</TR>, I found the letter after arriving from a long trip. Reading the letter, I regret the experience is not shared with my family simultaneously. <TR>In this manner</TR>, it is inevitable for us to take notebook during a long trip to feel the impressive emotion together my family.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second of all</TR>, it is possible to get useful information in strange country using a notebook.</MI2> <SI2>For a year, we have a chance to meet some strange situations that we did not expect during preparing a trip. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, let's suppose that we cannot understand their language and lose our way. Notebook would solve the all problems. <TR>That is</TR>, a new updated notebook contains a translator and a detailed map covering all area of world. <TR>As a result</TR>, we do not need to worry the strange situation due to containing much information in notebook.</BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, even though there are several advantage when taking a pet dog and camera, I would like to take a notebook for a long trip on account of sending a letter fast and getting information in dangerous situation. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I think a notebook will be indispensable thing for tourist preparing for a long trip.</CO>
column23: This full but average quality essy has a thesis that does not explain why the situation would have been entered in the first place. There are many transitions, but there are almost too many for the length of the essay. Having too many creates a diminishing return. The examples were really nice, however.

column1: 432&Some high schools require all students to wear school uniforms. Other high schools permit students to decide what to wear to school. Which of these two school policies do you think is better? Use reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN><TS>I think the mandatory wearing of high school uniforms is a positive policy.</TS> The uniform serves many important functions for the student and the school. They allow students to appear equal and ready for work. These factors can help produce a school environment more conducive to work and parents less burdened by additional expenses beyond tuition, books, supplies and transportation.</IN><BO1><MI1>A school uniform can aid in dispelling any doubt concerning the purpose of high school.</MI1> <SI1>The uniform directly assists in preparing students for work as an outward symbol of purpose. It also identifies the students who belong in the school and reduces the risk of undetected intruders there. It can be a signal to all that this young person is a legitimate student and perhaps entitled to discounts on public transportation, at bookstores, cinemas, etc.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Another benefit to the entire student body is the social safety provided by uniforms.</MI2> <SI2>One cannot identify a poor or rich student. Removing worries about fashion frees students from meaning competition so they can concentrate on studies. Schools don¡¯t become the scene of demonstrations of wealth, style and fashion.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3>Parents have many responsibilities concerning a child¡¯s education.</MI3> <SI3>Many parents struggle financially to provide tuition, books and supplies. The only relief they may find is in school uniforms. Instead of buying multiple outfits, parents can buy a single uniform and save money.</SI3></BO3><CO>A basic high school uniform guarantees students to be dressed for work and their behavior reflects this. The economic status of students is indistinguishable and they are free from participation in a daily fashion show. Parents save money and everyone wins when high school uniforms are required.</CO>
column23: This was a well written essay. The thesis statement could have been stronger if it had not been placed so early in the introduction. It behaves like an introduction rather than a statement laying out a case to be won. More transitions would have helped the flow of the essay.

column1: 433&It has recently been announced that a large shopping center may be built in your neighborhood. Do you support or oppose this plan? Why? Use a specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN>There are many shopping centers in my country. Some people like that it locates their own village. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, other people dislike that. <TS><TR>In my opinion</TR>, I agree that shopping center is built in my neighborhood because of convenience and increasing opportunity of engagement.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, people in my town could feel convenient when a shopping center is built.</MI1> <SI1>Most people need something that is demanded in order to live.
