Shopping center includes all kinds of this. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, in my town, before shopping center was established, my town¡¯s neighbors should go to many shops. <TR>However</TR>, after shopping center was built, they didn¡¯t need to go many shops because shopping center is very convenient to our neighbors. <TR>Similarly</TR>, shopping center makes people feel convenient.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second of all</TR>, many people are engaged because of shopping center.</MI2> <SI2>There are many people who don¡¯t have jobs in my village. They could obtain jobs when shopping center is built. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, my friend didn¡¯t have a job in last year and she was very depressed. She could gain a job, however, because shopping center needed many employers. <TR>After getting a job</TR>, my friend could find the meaning of life.</EX></SI2> <TR>Therefore</TR>, people can get a job when shopping center is built.</BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I think that when shopping center may be built in my neighborhood, it has many good parts because it gives people convenience and many people can get jobs. <TR>So</TR>, I have a positive thinking about establishing a shopping center in my town.</CO>
column23: This is well wrtten essay that primarly has isses in word choice and spelling. The errors hurt the statements in the essay by making some key words unclear to the reader.

column1: 434&Imagine that you have received some land to use as you wish. How would you use this land? Use specific details to explain your answer.
column3: <IN>Suppose that my father passed away leaving a great amount of money and very large land. If I could do everything as I wish, I would use this land to establish a university for especially poor people. I have a firm belief that knowledge and wisdom are the starting points of all things under the sun. But many people cannot afford to obtain knowledge, so that they right now live imperfect lives. <TS><TR>Thus</TR> I want to help these people study as much as possible, and become global leaders.</TS> <TR>In this essay</TR>, I will give a detailed explanation of my viewpoint.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>The first reason why I want to build a university</TR> is that it can provide for the poor with a chance to learn.</MI1> <SI1>All over the world, there are a lot of people who want to study but cannot. Poverty hinders them from running toward the goals because study or research requires much money. I think the deprivation of chances results in enlargement of the gap of wealth and knowledge, in disbelief between people, which will ultimately cause the loss of national strength.</SI1> <TR>Thus</TR>, I will establish a university to make all the people study as they like.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Additionally</TR>, I want to produce many learned persons from my university who could be global leaders.</MI2> <SI2><TR>As I have previously stated</TR>, globalization starts from knowledge. Without it, we could not turn our eyes to the world. <TR>Nowadays</TR> the world is getting smaller with the help of high technology, so that universities share their knowledge with those of other countries. My university can be the foundation on which many people bases their achieving goal and jumping to the world. I will raise students up to become specialists who can adjust themselves to any circumstances, and exhibit their talents and knowledge wherever they may be in the future.</SI2> I have the dream that people from my university will be heroes whom the world rotates around.</BO2><CO>Everyone can use his land as they like. But I think that the most important thing is whether I can contribute to my country and other people or not. I chose a university, which supplies chances for the poor, which at last helps their dreams come true. I think that human being is the most precious creature of all. If I improved the value of only one person, I might be able to conclude that I did all that I should do.</CO>
column23: This is a fairly well written essay. The thesis seemed to be quite detached from the essay. It is definitely not clear from the thesis that the essay is talking about the subject of land use. It seemed that the the author could have used more examples in the essay. There are many words but not enough efficiency of their use.

column1: 435&In your opinion, what is the most important characteristic (for example, honesty, intelligence, a sense of humor) that a person can have to be successful in life? Use specific reasons and examples from your experience to explain your answer. When you write your answer, you are not limited to the examples listed in the question.
column3: <IN>Human being has a tendency to give others good impression of himself. There are lots of important characteristics which can ultimately results in success in life. <TS>Among the important characteristics such as honesty, intelligence, and a sense of humor, I want to choose honesty, intelligence, and diligence as the most crucial factors.</TS> <TR>In this essay</TR>, I will give a detailed explanation of my viewpoint.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, honesty or faithfulness is important.</MI1> <SI1>People at first belittle the honest people because they do not seem to be sociable. But gradually people come to appreciate them because they give confidence to others. <TR>At last</TR>, honest person attracts many people who are the bases for someone to succeed in life.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Additionally</TR>, I think that intelligence is essential.</MI2> <SI2><TR>Although we are honest and faithful</TR>, we ultimately would be a means which other people use for their survival if we were not intelligent. We had better be somewhat shrewd. Success demands information and knowledge from which we obtain the abilities of application, and skills to deal with other people or money.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Finally</TR>, the most important factor is diligence.</MI3> <SI3>Even though we have other characteristics such as honesty and intelligence, we cannot succeed without diligence. We should make every effort to achieve our goals. <TR>As the proverb says</TR>, God helps those who help themselves. If we are not diligent, miracles or serendipities do not take place. The disadvantages such as the shortage of intelligence can be compensated for by efforts.</SI3></BO3><CO>To succeed in life, the factors I have previously stated should be in harmony. Our society requires the person with all of these aspects, that is to say, a well-rounded person. Imbalance causes it hard to succeed in life. As a university student, I should begin to improve these characteristics as well as knowledge because a learned person who has much knowledge without these factors cannot adjust himself to the society which requires multifarious talents.</CO>
column23: This is a fairly well written. Nothing really stands out in it. It is sufficient but not outstanding. There are a few transitons, general statements, and no real examples. It is an essy with mixed qualities.

column1: 436&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Playing games teaches us about life. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>For our life, we enjoy various kinds of games, and they are very important to modern people's life. About this, some people say that playing games teaches us about life while others believe it is just for enjoying or funny. <TS>Both are reasonable based on each other opinions ; however, in my opinion, I think that we could obtain many instructions through playing games, such as how establish strategies of our life and comply with rules of our society.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, playing games teaches us the way about establishment of strategies of our life.</MI1> <SI1>When we are playing any game, we plan some strategies for winning of the game, and such trained skills could exercise in real life. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, I like computer games, especially the 'Star-Craft' by bllizard co., requiring smart strategies, so I have learned how establilish specific strategy in diverse situations, and such training is very helpful in my every parts of life.</EX><TR>Similarly</TR>, through playing games, people could train the skill which organize some strategies and exercise it in their real life.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second of all</TR>, playing games teaches us that we should comply with rules of our society.</MI2> <SI2>In playing some games, there are many rules which player have to conform for fair play, and people learn a spirit of observance of rule through it. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, when I was children, I always played various kinds of games with some friends in outdoors. There are many rules that are made by me and friends, and we should conform them because if someone not conform them, the rest of children not acknowledge the children's winning. <TR>Similarly</TR>, in conformity of trial rules, I realized that rules are important in everywhere, and this spirit is able to live me some big troubles in society.</EX> <TR>As seen an example</TR>, through playing games, we learn that we should obey the rule in our real life.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I think that we could have good instruction about our life due to play games. <TR>That is</TR>, as playing games, we exercise establishment of strategy for our real life and learn compliance of rule for harmony of our society. When considering with these advantages, playing games is conducting a significant role in our life as well as it give entertainments to us.</CO>
column23: This is a full and well written essay. It has a fairly strong thesis statement. The main points clearly point to the content of the body paragrphs and point to the final conclusion as well. There are plenty of good examples. Some word choice and grammar rule errors are evident, but they are satisfactory.

column1: 437&Many students have to live with roommates while going to school or university. What are some of the important qualities of a good roommate? Use specific reasons and examples to explain why these qualities are important.
column3: <IN>When I was a high school student, I lived with a roommate. He was a classmate with me. He and I were quite different in many aspects. But our efforts to esteem each other were effective. The life with roommate affected on my school life. <TS>From the experiences of my high school life, I have concluded that the most important qualities of roommates are that he or she must live a regular life, and be an open-minded person.</TS> <TR>In this essay</TR>, I will give a detailed explanation of my viewpoint.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, I think that roommate should live an orderly life.</MI1> <SI1>Because I like my life also to be regular, roommate who has a regular life style would go with me well. My roommate of high school did not keep promise, had a lot of schedules improvised, so that even my life also became jumbled up. The rhythm of my life became so disordered that I was always tired. We could not have meals at a particular time.</SI1> <TR>Therefore</TR>, I urge that roommate should have a tendency to live a regular life.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, I also think that open-mindedness is very crucial.</MI2> <SI2>Everyone has his or her own temperament and tendency. Some aspects could make others perplexed or angry. For the first time when two persons meet, it is natural not to be in harmony with each other because of many differences. But if two persons, or at least only one person were open-minded and willing to listen to the other one, their relationship would be improved. <TR>Thus</TR>, roommate should not be obstinate. He or she must have ears to listen, and courage to practice advices roommate gives. The Important thing is not whether roommate is very clean, punctual, regular person, but whether roommate and I are open-minded persons.</SI2> <TR>Therefore</TR>, open-mindedness is the most important factor roommate should have.</BO2><CO><TR>As I have previously stated</TR>, there are some qualities of a good roommate; he or she should live a regular life, and be an open-minded person. <TR>However</TR>, the more we expect from our roommates, the more seriously we come to realize that we ourselves first should be good persons. If we did not have any qualities, how could we urge that roommate should be a person who has this or that qualities? It is impossible. <TR>Thus</TR> we ourselves should take pains to be well-rounded persons first.</CO>
column23: This essay is written with mixed quality. The thesis is very strong and clear in its following of the topic. Few more transitions would have helped tht flow. There are some word choice issues throughout. There are also some grammatical issues that distract or distort the flow of the essay.

column1: 438&Imagine that you are preparing for a trip. You plan to be away from your home for a year. In addition to clothing and personal care items, you can take one additional thing. What would you take and why? Use specific reasons and details to support your choice.
column3: <IN>In 1997, I went to the U.S. especially to many universities such as Stanford University and Michigan State University. Whenever I recollect the trip, I always become excited. It is my hobby to see a photo album if I want to retrospect on the past. Photograph can revive the past experience exactly. <TS><TR>Thus</TR>, if I could go to a one-year trip, I would take a camera.</TS> <TR>In this essay</TR, I will give a detailed explanation of my viewpoint.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, picture does not lie.</MI1> <SI1><TR>In other words</TR>, it can remember the past exactly. When I went to Stanford University, I went to the department of chemical engineering, that is, my major. I had a chance to have a conversation with the professor of chemical engineering. I wrote about the memory of the day. But the more important event was that the professor and I took a picture together. It was the best gift that the trip gave to me. <TR>Of course</TR>, I can recollect the past with the help of my memory and memorandums. But picture always gives us very vivid images of the past. It has a power to revive and reconstruct the forgotten events.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, picture lasts long.</MI2> <SI2>Maybe, we all have a memory that we, seeing the picture of the past, had a desire to go back to the past. Our memory or impression has a short lifespan. Only a few events that were very surprising remain in our brain. <TR>But</TR>, pictures retain the events unchanged even though we cannot even remember. We can see the houses, trees, mountains, and faces of 30 years ago. Picture has an ability to make our old memories return to lives.</SI2> <TR>To sum up</TR>, the picture is the documentary itself that could tell about the events as they are.</BO2><CO><TR>As I have previously stated</TR>, camera is essential to the trip because a picture is a graphic description of the past, and can be kept for a long time. <TR>Although it cost quite much money to take the picture printed</TR>, we can say without exaggeration that picture is the most precious gift the trip can give. The thicker our photo album are getting, the more memories are accumulated.</CO>
column23: This essay was written very well. The thesis should have provided some proofs as to why the author made such a claim. The main ides, however, do that job in the body paragraphs.

column1: 439& Holidays honor people or events. If you could create a new holiday, what person or event would it honor and how would you want people to celebrate it? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN>When we look back on our history, there were lots of events and great persons. Among them, I think that Sejong is the greatest person. He was the 4th king of the Yi dynasty, and the greatest contribution of him was the creation of Korean language. <TS><TR>Therefore</TR>, if I could create a new holiday, I would honor Sejong.</TS> The name of holiday would be 'Hangul Nal'(Hangul means Korean language; and Nal, day). In this essay, I will give a detailed explanation of my viewpoint.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, let's think about reasons why Sejong is the greatest person.</MI1> <SI1>Before him, we used Chinese. Our spoken language did not match with the written language. Because we, above all, can say that one language is the reflection of one culture, we were under the control by Chinese culture. So the creation of Korean language was a starting point for us to be independent of China. Korean language, Hangul, has been evaluated as the most scientific one, so that in Korea there are few people who are illiterate.</SI1> <TR>Therefore</TR>, it is natural that we should honor him.</BO1><BO2><MI2>It's time to devise lots of events or methods in which we celebrate Hangul Nal.</MI2> <SI2><TR>First</TR>, I want to conduct the campaign for the purpose that Korean should love Hangul more than in the past, and use it exactly. <TR>Second</TR>, we should make use of the day as a chance to recollect our history especially the days when Korean language was created. The situation was unfavorable because of the disturbance by China. <TR>Third</TR>, on the day, we should enhance education because the students of nowadays do not know how Korean was created, or how difficult the creation was.</SI2> These events could make us more patriotic.</BO2><CO>The reason that I want to make a holiday does not lie only in personal one that I respect Sejong. <TR>Rather</TR>, the most important one is that all the people who live in Korea could be patriots with the the good use of Hangul Nal. This day could give great impressions on our hearts. And we could have a new chance to know who we are, and to run toward the world. Hangul Nal would be the most meaningful day of all.</CO>
column23: This is a fairly well written essay even though it is a little off topic. The author makes a good case that there should be a holiday made for a certain person because of a certain reason. But that case does not include how exactly the holiday would be observed. It is lacking in details there.

column1: 440&Some people think that Television has destoryed communication among friends and family.However, I disagree because TV helps to shorten the generation gap and provide talking materials.
column3: <BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, TV helps to shorten the generation gap.</MI1> <SI1><TR>In general</TR>, old people don't know youths' thoughts and young people don't know the thoughts of old men. But old people and young people can understand what they thinks each other.</SI1> So TV helps to shorten the generation gap. </IN><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, TV provides talking materials .</MI1> <SI1>Without the common interest, there would be no communication among friends and family. But TV give us the materials which we have interest in.</SI2> <TR>Therefore</TR> we can convers and exchange thoughts about the common talking materials.</BO1><CO><TR>In this respect</TR>, TV helps to communicate among friends and family by shortening the generation gap and providing talking materials.</CO>
column23: This is not really an proper essay because there is no introduction or thesis. It goes straight into the main points. There are also no real examples included. The main ideas are good and the grammar and word choice are also good.

column1: 441&Some people say that physical exercise should be a required part of every school day. Other people believe that students should spend the whole school day on academic studies. Which opinion do you agree with? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Some people believe that students should only study during the school day. <TR>However</TR>, school is different from academic institution where only teaches knowledge. <TS><TR>In this respect</TR>, physical exercise in school is necessary, for it helps students physically, mentally and socially.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, physical exercise keeps students healthy.</MI1> <SI1>They can't go on studying if they are physically weak. Regular exercise improves their stamina, so that they can study better. <TR>Also</TR>, physical exercise is helpful to the development of body in their growth periods. They are able to be in good shape as a result of physical exercise.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Besides physical healthy</TR>, physical exercise is necessary for mental healthy.</MI2> <SI2>If students had to spend the whole school day on academic studying, they would be sick and tired of books. No wonder that it is not efficient and they would become more stressful. Physical exercise is a good way to relieve stress and fatigue.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Finally</TR>, physical exercise improves students' sociality.</MI3> <SI3>They can develop their cooperative, outgoing and active characteristics through team sports such as soccer, basketball, etc. Because making students social beings is one of the aims of schooling, physical exercise is an important activity in school.</S3></BO3><CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, physical exercise is a vital factor in schooling in that it improves students' physical and mental health and sociality. Just as man shall not live by bread alone, students should not grow up only by academic studying.</CO>
column23: This was a fairly well written essay. It was easy to follow and read. Because of the many main points, there was a relative lack of supporting ideas and example evidence. The style could have also been a bit less conversational.

column1: 442&People recognize a difference between children and adults. What events (experiences or ceremonies) make a person an adult? Use specific reasons and examples to explain your answer.
column3: <IN>I don't believe that just age is enough to define an adult. Being an adult also requires to be mentally mature. <TS><TR>In this respect</TR>, what makes a person an adult is traveling alone and experiencing a funeral.</TS> </IN><BO1><MI1>Perhaps traveling alone is one of the most important events that make people adults.</MI1> <SI1>It helps people improve the spirit of independence. It gives them chances not only to deliberate about themselves, but also to enhance their spirit of independence with which they can solve a lot of problems for themselves. <EX>When I took a trip alone to Europe as a freshman, I couldn't express myself at first because of a language barrier. Through trial and error, however, I gain confidence in myself, which maybe a factor of being an adult.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Besides traveling alone, the funeral ceremonies cause people to be adults.</MI2> <SI2>Accepting death of a person, they might reflect their lives and begin to think of their lives seriously. <EX>When my father died three years ago, I felt responsibility to lead my family instead of my father and thought that I should not be no linger a child.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, it is traveling alone and experiencing the funeral that makes a person an adult. <TR>Of course</TR>, it is based on my experience, but who could say it's not true?</CO>
column23: This is a fairly average quality essay. It was a very interesting essay and was fairly unique in the way it addressed the topic. The thesis probably would be better without a transition as it forces the reader to look elsewhere for clarificationi rather than being the statement that lays down the foundation of the paper at once. The supporting ideas were excellent but could have been a bit more developed.

column1: 443&Some young children spend a great amount of their time practicing sports. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of this. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Young children like to practice sports, such as soccer, basketball, baseball, etc. with their friends. Sometimes they spend the whole day playing sports. <TS>As all things might be, practicing sorts for many hours has both advantages and disadvantages.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>Practicing sports is beneficial to young children in two ways.</MI1> <SI1><TR>First</TR>, sports make them healthy. They eat their meal without complaining about dishes because practicing sports stimulates their appetite. <TR>Also</TR>, their metabolism is promoted to keep them in good shape. <TR>Second</TR>, they can make new friends through team sports. As a child, I used to play baseball with unfamiliar boys, who became intimate friends of mine soon. <TR>Likewise</TR>, practicing sports helps young children get along with other children.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, practicing sports also has the other side of the coin.</MI2> <SI2>Spending too much time practicing sports prevents young children from participating in other activities such as reading books, playing the piano or violin, visiting the museum, etc. They may also lose their interests in studying.</SI2> These flaws are not desirable because the childhood needs various experiences.</BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, practicing sports not only is helpful for young children to maintain good health and improve their social characteristics, but also would deprive them of the chances to experience many other things if they are absorbed in sports exceedingly. <TR>Therefore</TR>, it is required to balance the time that young children would spend in sports and other activities.</CO>
column23: This was a very nice essay. The thesis provided a structure for the essay and there were many mini-examples in the body paragraphs to help create a confident answer to the topic question. There are some word choice issues, however, which make it a little difficult to understand some key points of the essay and also hurt the flow of the essay.

column1: 444&Which would you prefer to live in a small town or a big city?
column3: <IN>I think that a mouse living in the country and a mouse living in a city experience opposite places to live in. I now live in a big city, but l lived in a small town a few years ago. <TS>Each place has attraction to me, but If I choose only one place, I would like to live a bug city.</TS> That's why I can not only get a variety of jobs easily, but also go to exciting places, such as sports facilities, ride and stuff, shopping centers and so on. <TR>Furthermore</TR>, I really love to communicate new people and feel new fashion or new technology.</IN><BO1><MI1>A city makes me very convenient and happy.</MI1> <SI1>I am able to get a part time job in a big city. Students going to university usually work part time to travel here and there and pay tuition fees. As there are a diversity of jobs in a city, I can choose according to my tastes. In case that I like to work lively, I can work as a reporter at a broadcasting station. Also I can do my job at fast food stands. If you like to teach somebody, you may become a tutor.</SI1> Because of these jobs, many people as well as prefer living in a big city.</BO1><BO2><MI2>Do you like to enjoy yourself?</MI2> <SI2>I also like to play with my friends. A part of the excitement of city living is the variety of cultural activities amiable. There is a wide assortment of theater, music, and dance performances available in big cities. It is very funny that I examine a concert date when my favorite singer hold an concert, and I can go to movie and go to ride and stuff.</SI2> <TR>Moreover</TR>, many girls can go shopping since lage cities have colossal, impressive shopping centers.</BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Also</TR> I can meet new situations in large cities in which many things change every day.</MI3> <SI3>There are new goods in the stores and I am attracted by the latest fashions. In a city, I can see buildings to use a original technology, a new PDA, and a beautiful designed car. The final thing I like about large cities is the diversity of the people. In the country you rarely meet new people, but In huge cities, you may meet strange people and become friends with them.</SI3>These things give me enormous happiness.</BO3><CO>While I lived in a small town, I could see many animals and plants. Also I became familiar with neighbors. <TR>For those reasons</TR>, I like to live in a town, but when I take into account regarding advantages of a big city, the place provide me with more possibility to developed me. So I recommend the young to live in a big city, and I like to see these people grow mature.</CO>
column23: This was an average quality essay. The thesis provided a subject but not introduction of evidences to back up the argument. Ther were many mini-examples in the body paragraphs to help create a confident answer to the topic question. There are some word choice issues, however, which make it a little difficult to understand some key points of the essay and also hurt the flow of the essay. The essay is also too conversational and informal.

column1: 445&You have enough money to purchase either a house or a business. Which would you choose to buy? Give specific reasons to explain your choice.
column3: <IN>Most of people wish to enough money to do or buy something that they want. Some people prefer to buy something that they can improve more convenient in their life such as car, computer and so on, others want to invest the money for the future. <TS>In my cases, if I have a chance to choose either a house or a business, I would like to buy a house.</TS> The reason is that I want to move more convenient and large house and the other reason is a house which is to the purpose of investment for the future.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, I prefer buying house to doing business.</MI1> <SI1>A house is basic necessity and people get to take a rest in there. <EX><TR>For my example</TR>, we consist of large family but our house is very small. I want to have my room that spent time alone in house because I shared room with my sister now and also our living room is small to gather family. </EX><TR>As seen above reason</TR>, I wish buy a house to bring more convenient and space.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR> to, buying house is the purpose of investment for the future.</MI2><SI2> In our country, many people buy a house to the preparation of future because interest in bank is less high than the rising cost of estate. I know I have no ability to manage my business rather than I may fit to be employed certain company.</SI2> <TR>In this manner</TR>, I prefer to buy a house.</BO2><CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, although doing a business have an influence to improve my social position, I had better to buy a house. The reason is that a house is one of the important necessities to bring more convenient lives and the goal of investment for future. I believe that people can get life energy according to take a rest in house. <TR>Therefore</TR>, house is basic necessity.</CO>
column23: This essay was very well organized and written. The thesis statement only introduced the topic, but would have been complete if it had been merged with the sentence immediately following it. The main ideas were great and so were the examples. There were some word choice errors.

column1: 446&People recognize a different between children and adults. What events (experiences or ceremonies) make a person an adult? Use specific reasons and examples to explain your answer.
column3: <IN>To tell the truth, it is very difficulty to divide between children and adults. <TR>Thus</TR>, most of people discriminate ages both children and adults. <TS>I think that events making a person adults are to get a marriage and to earn money through getting a job.</TS> The reason is that people have a responsibility to support their family through marriage and earning money make possible for independent existence from parent.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, marriage makes it possible to have a responsibility to support their family.</MI1> <SI1>In our country, elder people said that you know parent's mind after getting a marriage. I think the sentence means people are to be real adult after marriage because the marriage asks people to have more responsible. I could find easily friends who change their life and the way of think after marriage.</SI1> <TR>As seen above statement</TR>, marriage is one of important event to be an adult.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second of all</TR>, earning money make possible for independent life from parent the aspect of material life and bring a chance to be adult.</MI2> <SI2>When student, I received money to buy book and enjoy entertainment. <TR>However</TR>, from getting a job after graduate I have to be independent the aspect of substance, and I give parent private money because they retired. <TR>Thus</TR>, I feel more responsible and have a position independent person in society and family.</SI2> Earning money is a event to be the way of think ago as dependent on parent.</BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, if I choose event that make a person an adult, in my case the event is marriage and earning money according to getting a job. Two experience people bring to more responsible and independent from parent or society. I believe that among many a important quality of an adult is responsibility.</CO>
column23: It was really difficult to understand what the author was trying to say at crucial parts of this essay. The thesis statement only pointed to another sentence to lay out the main points. The thesis should combine and present all pertinent information in it.

column1: 447&Do you agree or disagree with the followign statement? It is better for children to grow up in the countrysid than in a big city. Use specific reasons and examples to develop your essay.
column3: <IN>In our every day's lives we are face with so diverse culures and environments. Some people want to bring up their children in urban area which has recent trends. They think that the most important thing of education is the recent imformation and being lectured in a famous school located in a big city. <TR>Unfortunately</TR>, they reglect some more pluses to growing his or her children in rural city close to the nature. <TS>There are two adventages of spending a childhood in a rural area.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>More than ever before</TR>, nature is the one of the best environments which decide children's characteristic of their emotional aspects.</MI1> <SI1>Statistics from several education firms show that the children who are brought up in the countryside are more active and easy to make their freinds than in a big city. <TR>In addition</TR>, the statistics also show that a person who was lived in countrysid during his or her childhood can be more imagenary than a person who wasn't.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, living in a rural area which provides clean air and enough places to run is very helpful for children's health.</MI2> <SI2>The children who live in a countryside have more chances to run in large feilds, swim in the river and climb up trees breathing up clean air as well. Many physicians emphasize that exercise is the most important thing that keep the health not only for adults but also for children.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In fact</TR>, one of the most important effective things for children is the environment. <TR>Therefore</TR>, children's growing in nature means that they can be more imaginary, active and healthy rather than in a big city. Through spending their childhood </in nature, your children can find their life more enjoyable.</CO>
column23: This is an average quality essay. The thesis statement does not make any real claims and just states that there is a subject and some evidences but do real details. The body is fairly straighforward and simplistic as well.

column1: 448&Would you prefer to live alone or with a roommate? Use specific reasons and details to support your choice.
column3: <IN>A friend of mine has lived with a roommate since university. He told me that there are some advantages because his roommate was a big help and had close relationship with him. but I think that living with someone needs some reponsibilities and rules between members of the room and it causes a lot of problems from serious one to trivial one. Because each member has a different lifestyle. <TS><TR>Actually</TR>, when you live alone, you are able to be free from these cocerns and do your jobs you want more easily.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, you don't have to be careful of noise you make.</MI1> <SI1>If someone being with you in a room is studing, you can't turn up the audio loudly. and you may even talk quietly to your friend on the phone if he is sensitive about small noise. </SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, you can put your belongings anywhere you want.</MI2> <SI2>When you live with a roommate, you have to take care of the places used by both you and your roommate. When you are alone, however, you are free from cleanning the places after using. <TR>Moreover</TR>, you can decorate your room with all things you want.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>As the last advantage</TR>, you can have privacy.</MI3> <SI3>I think it's very important. When you live alone, no one will interfere your affairs and not steal a glance at your secret letters and important documents. you can also enjoy alone your own time without any interruption and don't have to hide anything.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I conveyed three points how living alone is better than doing with a roommate. There are several benefits when you live togather, but when you live alone, you have a lot of benefits comes from freedom. <TR>Therefore</TR> I recommend living alone to anyone who read this writing. You will find your life more enjoyable.</CO>
column23: There really isn't much of a thesis statement that clearly lays out the structure and direction of the essay. The existing statement is just a bullet point introduction to one of the points that will be developed. The main ideas were okay, but there were almost no developed examples included to detail the claims.

column1: 449&People attend college or university for many different reasons. (For example, new experiences, career preparation, increased knowledge) Why do you think people attend college or university? Use specific reasons and example to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Different people go to college or university for different reasons. Some people attend college or university to study more and some other people go there maybe because they need some university diplomas for their future career.</IN><BO1><MI1>Among other things, I think people go to university for academic purposes.</MI1> <SI1>The education from elementary to high school is not enough to satisfy a student¡¯s intellectual expectation because the subjects offered by those schools are not really specific to individual interest. A student finds which subject suits him through the curriculum of all the years at school before college. <TR>Then</TR>, once the student is in university, he can choose his major according to his own ability and interest. He can learn more specifically about his favorite subject and apply his knowledge in his own way.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Some people go to university to get diplomas for their future career.</MI2> <SI2>When you are looking for a job, whether you are certified for the job or not is usually important. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, if someone wants to be a high school teacher, he certainly has to prove that he is specialized in education and his diploma in education shows that. Not every job requires a diploma.</SI2> <TR>However</TR>, there are certain careers that demand the relevant certificates or diplomas.</BO2><BO3><MI3>People go to university to be involved in and helped by some associations or communities with the university name.</MI3> <SI3></TR>For example</TR>, my school is famous for its art department. This means a lot of professors and alumni are supposedly famous and prominent artists. In this case, the university environment provides advantages for students who want to be artists. There are many chances to join their associations and hold some art shows under the title of the school. Having exhibitions with them helps new and young artists to build up their career as artists.</SI3> <TR>So</TR>, many students want to get into a certain universities to make the right connections.</BO3><CO>There are many reasons why people continue their study by attending university or college. <TR>According to my own experiences and general ideas I have</TR>, I think people go to university or college for those three reasons.</CO>
column23: This was a fairly decent essay. There really wasn't an introduction and there was no thesis statement. After the terrible introduction paragraph, the essay was very nice, structured, and full. The author made good points and carried through to the conclusion.

column1: 450&Imagine that you are preparing for a trip. You plan to be away form your home for a year. In addition to clothing and personal care items, you can take one additional thing. What would you take and why? Use specific reasons and details to support your choice.
column3: <IN>Because there are required many items when a person travels in some other place for a year, when people prepare for a trip, they carefully think what are the most necessary things. <TS>About this, excepting essential items, some people might take notebook-computer in order to communicate with family and friends while others say that there could be more important things for their trip ; however, <TR>in my case</TR>, I would take camera for my trip for a year because it would be able to leave my precious memories to me and share the memories with family and friends after travel.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, camara could help leave my precious memories in mind.</MI1> <SI1>For travelling, I would have the number of strange experiences in strange place. Because a year is pretty long period, I would probablly forget many parts of these experiences, <TR>thus</TR>, as taking many pictures in many situations, I could preserve the precious memories in my mind. In that reason, I would prepare camera before departure to trevel.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second of all</TR>, camera could help get my memories about the trip together with family and friends.</MI2> <SI2>After I travel in alone, I would like to share with my familiar people, and since I lively transmit many experiences to them, pictures are necessary. Through these sharing, I could recollect the past experiences again, and my family or friends could indirectly feel about that.</SI2> <TR>In that reason</TR>, I would take camera in preparing for my trip.</BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, if someone asks to me what would you take one item excepting essential things for your trip, my answer is 'camera' in that I could constantly remember many good experiences about the trip and have the memories together with my intimate people- family and friends through taking picture with it.</CO>
column23: This was an average quality essay. The thesis statement was much too long and carried on for more than three quarters of a decently long introduction. It should have been split up a little bit. Some additional supporting examples would have been good.

column1: 451&Imagine that you are preparing for a trip. You plan to be away form your home for a year. In addition to clothing and personal care items, you can take one additional thing. What would you take and why? Use specific reasons and details to support your choice.
column3: <IN>A trip for a year is a long period and it is a plenty time to get something what we need that have never known before. <TS>though it depends on where they choice a place as their destination, <TR>in my case</TR> I would like to add translator to my packages because there are innumerable languages and nations in the world.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>firstly</TR>, a highly efficiency translator makes trip more comportable.</MI1> <SI1>to traveler, translator is very importance. it can help them from a situation that they never imagine before. <TR>of course</TR> it's not give travelers help as we think such as preventing from cold, animals. but suppose they lost route for their destination and there is no one can speak in enlgish, translator will be the most helpful equipment.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>secondly</TR>, translator help traveler to get much imformation.</MI2> <SI2>there are many languages, cultures and people in the world. each race have their own life style and culture.</SI2> if traveler meet someone fortunately who can enlgish freely, there will be a limit to know and to share.</BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, if I have a travel away from my home for a year, I would like to take a translator, I think that the translator can help my trip more comfortable and make me to experience and to share the culture of various nations in the world.</CO>
column23: This was an average essay that did not have very developed supporting evidences or examples. There were also many grammatical and word choice errors. They were not so much that they hurt the flow of the paper, but they still existed.

column1: 452& What are some important qualities of a good supervisor (boss)? Use specific details and examples to explain why these qualities are important.
column3: <IN>I suppose can be varied ideas about qualities, which are essential in good supervisor or boss. <TS><TR>As a matter of fact</TR>, I believe that a good supervisor needs to know and focus on the core competencies of people and organization.</TS> And I think that a good supervisor should plan a nice strategy for their organization and have a good leadership and relationship with their employee..</IN><BO1><MI1>A good supervisor should know the core competencies of both of the employee and the organization.</MI1> <SI1>When they make a goal and objectives, they should get knowledge about the competencies of the organization and with this information. </SI1>Then they can set appropriate goals for their organization.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, a nice supervisor should set clear strategic goals and objective for your organization.</MI2> <SI2>Every organization has more than one goal. Without this goal and strategy, the organization would conflict other goals of others.</SI2> If supervisor didn¡¯t have good jugement and strategy, their employee can¡¯t work with effectively and successful.</BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>The last</TR>, a good boss has been generally considered qualities: having a good leadership and relationship.</MI3> <SI3><TR>That is to say</TR> : making every effort to treat employees impartially and using positive incentives rather than negative ones and leading to work iat ease.. </SI3>So Every one would like to work harder without a complaint.</BO3><CO>For the above-mentioned reasons, in my view, the qualities of good supervisor or boss are that knowing and focusing on the core competencies of people and organization and having a good relationship and leadership. And I belive that a smoothly and effectively working need for a good supervisor at modern times.</CO>
column23: This essay is well written. The thesis should have included a structure and introduction to the ideas that would have been presented and there should have been a few more examples. The transitions were good though. The essay flowed well to the conclusion. It was very easy to see what the conclusion was and how the author built to that in the end.

column1: 453&What are some important qualities of a good supervisor (boss)? Use specific details and examples to explain why these qualities are important.
column3: <IN>No matter where we work, you cannot help belonging to an organization and coworking with a boss who lead you. Whether you meet a good leader or not is very important problem for live a enjoyable life. This is more true in recent days because the more developed the society , the more increased the poeple who have his or her own job. It is better for you to know some necessary elements of a respectful boss if you want to prove your worthiness in your company. <TS>There are some necessity of being a good superviser such as being specialized, knowing how to compose team, and communicating with others.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, you must have an ability to lead a team which consists of some people.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Therefore</TR>, you have to be specialized in specific field of your job if you want your team member to follow your decision when you need to be assertive. When I worked in a design company, my boss knows everything about web design and he taught me how to be a good designer.</SI1> I really respected him therefore, I couldn't disagree with him when we needed to make a decision.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, to be a good superviser, you have to know how to make positions of your team member according to their capability and interesting.</MI2> <SI2>An effective composition of team which is even a small team can achieve more easily its purpose, even if an elusive goal.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3>It is very important to be a good leader, but it is more important to have a good relationship with your colleagues.</MI3><SI3>Your good communication skills can bring good relationships with others. <TR>In addition</TR>, good relationships with your team member make it easy to know your memebers' abilities and their interests. An ability of effective managing of your team can come only with good relationshps with poeple who you work together.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, the most three important qualities of a good superviser are an extraordinary ability from diverse experiences, an insight of making an powerful team, and most importantly, good relationship and truth between your team members.</CO>
column23: This was an average quality essay. The thesis was actually very good. The essay would have been improved with some examples and more content for the supporting ideas. There were also some major word choice issues.

column1: 454&Some movies are serious, designed to make the audience think. Other movies are designed primarily to amuse and entertain. Which type of movie do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>As our society is getting more complex, many people seek mediums through which they can make their minds comfortable. <TR>Among them</TR>, movies are always the most favorite. All the people have their own reasons for what they go to the movies. <TR>As for me</TR>, I go there for relaxation and amusement. <TS>In this essay, I will give a detailed explanation of my viewpoint.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, let's think about when many people go to a theater.</MI1> <SI1><TR> Generally</TR>, they use movies as a means to take their affairs off and relax. <TR>In other works</TR>, to reduce their stress which is from a business or the conflicts. People only want to forget everything and concentrate on movies while they watch movies.</SI1> If even movies would provide me with a serious topic to think and make my head a mess, I would stand up and go out from a theater.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, with whom do we go to the theater?</MI2> <SI2>Maybe, most of us go there with our family members, friends, and sweethearts. Especially a theater is the most popular place many couples gather to enjoy their dates. I think that a conversation topic on the story of the movies is efficient to improve the relationships. And movie is the major provider of the conversation topics.</SI2> <TR>Thus</TR>, I like the movie that is designed to make us amuse or entertain.</BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Finally</TR>, we can encounter the serious topics in many other places such as newspapers, and lectures of our classes.</MI3> <SI3>And main issues with which the TV deals are topics such as political, and economical problems. I think it is not necessary that even movies make us contemplate.</SI3> <TR>Therefore</TR>, the movies that give us only serious topics already lost the reason of their existence.</BO3><CO><TR>Of course</TR>, I also agree that the movies that can make us become sincere persons also contribute to the development of our society. <TR>However</TR>. We should not forget that in the 1930s, movies were designed by Nazi to make people alienated from political issues. As I have previously stated, it is more desirable that movie can provide refreshment for the common people who are suffering from stress. If the movies which are not deprived of serious topics also could make us entertain, there would be nothing more advisable than these.</CO>
column23: This was a rather poorly written essay. The thesis promises that something will be written but makes no attempt to structure it or even introduce it properly. The main points included a question, and the topic of the essay wandered far from the guidelines.

column1: 455&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? It is more important for students to study history and literature than it is for them to study science and mathematics. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>Students can obtain useful and important knowledge by studying many subjects. Both studying history and literature or working at science and mathmatics help students to improve their knowledge. <TS><TR>Among many spheres of knowledge, I think that science and mathematics are more important than others like science and mathematics in that they make us think logically, and they give ys useful information.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, students can increse the way of thinking logically.</MI1> <SI1>I major at mathmatics in the University in Seoul, Korea. Mathmatics reqire accurate procedures as well as solutions when I solve the mathmatical problems. Because of this rezurement, I should meditate how to approach the problems and why the solutions are correct.</SI1> By this way I has been familier with logical thinking not only during solving my mathmatical problems but also in my lifelihood.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition to logical thinking</TR>, science and mathmatics give us practical information.</MI2> <SI2>This can be illustrated by earth science which give one knowldege about the earth, the place where people live. It give us the information about our earth such as animals, stars, weather and soils. When I took a trip with my college peers two years ago, the air is so fresh, thus we could see many stars in the sky at night.</SI2> <TR>At that time</TR>, due to our knowledge about asterism, we could have vert interesting time.</BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, science and mathmatics offer us the mode of dialetic thinking and utilitarian information. science and mathmatics, therefore, could be the most important subject of many fields.</CO>
column23: This was a wonderfully written essay if it were just about math and science. There should have been some reference to history and literature in the body of the essay so that they could be refuted as 'good' subjects.

column1: 456&A company has announced that it wishes to build a large factory near your community. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of this new influence on your community. Do you support or oppose the factory? Explain your position.
column3: <IN>A company has announced that is wishes to build a large factory near my community. <TR>Of course</TR>, there can be many advantages and disavantages to having this new influence. <TS>After thinking about good and bad effects forward and backward, I believe that building a large factory around my region is good for my community's development.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>Here is my negative points for building the factory.</MI1> <SI1>If a factory near my area is set up, a few problems would be where to build the factory, how to solve the noise during the construction and operation and how to deal with a lot of pollutions from the factory. But I think that there would be more useful things than harmful things. Here is my positive points for building a factory. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, if a factory near my community is set up, first because the reputation around my city will become more popular and many stores and buildings would be constructed, economy there will be grown.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, because the factory will need people to run and operate it and a plenty of people who need jobs will be hired, so unemployment rate is on the rise.</MI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, even though there are many disadvantages to having factories, only if the side of the factory can assure neighboors that they can reduce negative problems about building a factory, I think that it does not matter with building the factory around my place.</CO>
column23: This was an average quality essay. There were some good points. The thesis could have been just a little stronger if it had included some reference to the main points that would be made. The first body paragraph was excellent but the second body paragraph was just a main point with no supporting evidence whatsoever.

column1: 457&What are some important qualities of a good boss?
column3: <IN><TS>The one word which represents the first condition to be a good boss is "reliability",and the reliable boss has " responsibility" and "judgment".</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>About personality,responsibility is very important to be a believable boss.</MI1> <SI1>There are so many obstacles to manage the company,and the boss has to go through them constantly,not to give up. <TR>Also</TR>,the boss has to be honest to the company's profit and loss,and if the boss is responsible,he would be honest to this point.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Realistically</TR>,a boss's ability is directly connected to the survival of the company.</MI2> <SI2>A boss have to be possible to have a perspective on the economic environment which can influence to the company ,and after that, he or she has to make a comprehensive decision.<TR>Also</TR>,a boss has to arrange the employee to the appropriate posotion .</SI2> The resolution is following to the judgment.</BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>In addition</TR>,to be a good boss,it is necessary to have a good assistant.</MI3> <SI3>The boss can not control everything,and ,many part of the work will be operated by the assistant.</SI3> A good assitants who have the realistic knowledge is a crutial elements to a good boss.</BO3><CO><TR>Responsibility</TR>,judgment and good assitants are the critical elements of a good boss and also they cover most kinds of good qualities of a successful person.As much as that ,it is difficult to be a good boss,and it indicates the importance of boss's role.It is because the one boss's decision influences to many other's life.</CO>
column23: This was a below average quality essay. There was really no introductioni and there was just the bare minimum to create an essay. It was more of an outline format with the points written down with no meat holding the parts together.

column1: 458&Do you agree or disagree that television has destroyed communication among friends and family use specific reasons and example to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>As time has gone by, economy has developed. As economy has developed, the replenishment rate of television has increased. <TR>Nowadays</TR>, most households have one or more televisions in their homes. Although many americans spend their time during free, watching a square box. <TS>I don't believe that television has destroyed communication among people.</TS> It is just a tool with no move and it is just a tool allowing to see and hear news and events outside world.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, imagine a family get together at home in the evening under a premise that there is kind of an awkward mood.</MI1> <SI1>While a family is watching a screen on the television, as long as we just try to talk to each other, we can have great communications. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, we can argue a program that we are now watching and express our minds about stars who are now appearing in the television. It would be excellent for them to loose some tense between parents and children or among brothers.</EX></SI1> <TR>Plus</TR>, it would be better than talking about something uncomfortable such as kids' future, grades and friendship.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, television is a wonderful media to bring us the merit that we can watch, learn and have many kinds of conversations at the same time.</MI2> <SI2>Watching some documentary programs, we can learn a lot of information we have not known and watching some political discussion programs, we can dispute with each other so that we can share other people's thoughts about these issues.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>Ultimately</TR>, I can say it again TV is a tool. Television can not control people. The most important thing is simply how human uses appropriately that tool. I mean that whether the television is good or harmful to us depends on human's hands</CO>
column23: This was a well written and organized essay. The thesis should have included an introduction to some the points that would have been made. There were excellent main points and examples included to make the conclusion easy to come to.

column1: 459&You have enough money to purchase either a house or a business. Which would you choose to buy? Give specific reasons to explain your choice.
column3: <IN>Most of people wish to enough money to do or buy something that they want. Some people prefer to buy something that they can improve more convenient in their life such as car, computer and so on, others want to invest the money for the future. <TS><TR>In my cases</TR>, if I have a chance to choose either a house or a business, I would like to buy a house.</TS> The reason is that I want to move more convenient and large house and the other reason is a house which is to the purpose of investment for the future.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, I prefer buying house to doing business.</MI1> <SI1>A house is basic necessity and people get to take a rest in there. <EX><TR>For my example</TR>, we consist of large family but our house is very small. I want to have my room that spent time alone in house because I shared room with my sister now and also our living room is small to gather family.</SI1> <TR>As seen above reason</TR>, I wish buy a house to bring more convenient and space.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition to</TR>, buying house is the purpose of investment for the future.</MI2> <SI2>In our country, many people buy a house to the preparation of future because interest in bank is less high than the rising cost of estate. I know I have no ability to manage my business rather than I may fit to be employed certain company.</SI2> <TR>In this manner</TR>, I prefer to buy a house.</BO2><CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, although doing a business have an influence to improve my social position, I had better to buy a house. The reason is that a house is one of the important necessities to bring more convenient lives and the goal of investment for future. I believe that people can get life energy according to take a rest in house. <TR>Therefore</TR>, house is basic necessity.</CO>
column23: This is a fairly nice essay. The thesis statement should have been extended to include the sentence immediately following it. The main ideas were just sufficient and not outstanding. The supporing points, however, included great examples.

column1: 460& Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Children should be required to help with household tasks as soon as they are able to do so. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>People have their own way to raise their children. Getting their children help with household tasks is an important matter to them. Some people don¡¯t let their children do household chores to protect them, while other people think that it can be nice education. <TS><TR>In my opinion</TR>, I agree the statement that children should be required to help with household tasks as soon as they are able to do so because it can improve the children¡¯s responsibility as well as provide time to talk with family members.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, children could be responsible for themselves by helping with household tasks.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Nowadays</TR>, many children are becoming dependent more and more due to over-protection. For these children, household tasks can be wonderful prescriptions. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, if a dependent child should do household chores like feeding a dog, washing dishes, although bothered by them at first, they could overcome the problem at last similarly, house task are needed to children to raise their responsibility.</EX><SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, children can have time to be with family members through household tasks.</MI2> <SI2>In this dehumanized society, no wander that children don¡¯t have time to be with family members. <TR>However</TR>, household task can afford children time to talk with their parents. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, it¡¯s reported by ABC Research that children¡¯s average time to talk with their parent a week is just only forty-seven minutes.</EX></SI2> <TR>Therefore</TR>, household tasks are needed to children to let them communicate with their family members.</BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I think that helping with household task have wonderful influences on children, such as giving responsibility and providing family time. For our children, we should give them the opportunities to participate in household tasks.</CO>
column23: This was a very nice essay. The thesis provided a structure for the essay and there were many mini-examples in the body paragraphs to help create a confident answer to the topic question. There were no major issues.

column1: 461&You need to travel from your home to a place 40 miles (64 kilometers) away. Compare the different kinds of transportation you could use. Tell which method of travel you would choose. Give specific reasons for your choice.
column3: <IN>A few centuries ago, vehicles were not common things for traveling, most people had to walk to their destinations, and sometimes only few persons could ride a horse. <TR>At present</TR>, the kind of transportation has become diverse such as car, bus, airplane, and train. <TR>Now</TR>, we should decide that which is the best choice. <TS>If a goal is somewhat short distance away just like 40 miles, I can usually use a car or a bus, both of which have own merits respectively.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>In case of car</TR>, one merit is that I can adjust departure time.</MI1> <SI1>If I suddenly get an urgent problem, I can postpone the time to leave for several hours. Another one is the convenience of movement. When I have heavy luggage, I can carry it easily from one place to another.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Bus has also two merits.</MI2> <SI2>The one is that bus makes a comfortable travel. During the travel, I am able to enjoy the landscape passing in the windows, have time to read a book, and listen to the music. The other is its low price. Bus is the cheapest transportation in our country. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, it cost 12 dollars from Seoul to Won-ju by car, but 5 dollars by bus.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO>If I have to travel to a place 40 miles away, I will take a car because I usually have to move with luggage. When I made a trip to mount O-dae, in Korea to collect specimens of insects, I took a bus. <TR>Unfortunately</TR>, it was a very hard trip because I had to move with my heavy equipments from the bus station to collecting point, which was 6km away. <TR>After then</TR>, I burrowed my professor¡¯s car, whenever I take a field trip.</CO>
column23: This was a very nice essay. The thesis provided a structure for the essay and there were many mini-examples in the body paragraphs to help create a confident answer to the topic question. The supporting evidence could have been a little more developed. These had great examples but still seemed basic and stunted.

column1: 462&Some items (such as clothes or furniture) can be made by hand or by machine. Which do you prefer? Items made by hand or items made by machine? Use reasons and specific examples to explain your choice.
column3: <IN>The way of manufacturing goods can be various. Especially there are two methods which are used generally: making by hand and manufacturing by machine. Some people like buying hand-made goods, others are fond of purchasing machine-made items. <TS><TR>In my case</TR>, I prefer to have objects made by hand in that they could satisfy person's tastes and they have unique properties.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, people could get contentment when they buy hand-made goods. </MI1><SI1>When I entered the university, I bought a formal dress. At the store, a clerk measured my size and I could choose the color of texture which I like. The cloth was made for my own size and own preference, therefore, it was very suitable and became me.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Another advantage of items made by hand is their uniqueness.</MI2><SI2> A good illustration of this is the chocolates which made by hand. On last Valentine's Day, I went to the department store to buy some chocolates for my boy friend. <TR>At that time</TR>, I found one bakery where two experts were making chocolates by hand. That chocolates have special shapes, size and material when compared to other mass-produced goods. </SI2>Because of their special characteristic, many people purchased those and so did I.</BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, hand-made items have several good marks. They give person contentment and they have individual traits. <TR>As a result of these aspects</TR> I prefer hand-made goods to machine-made ones.</CO>
column23: This is an above average qulity essay. The thesis provided an introduction to the main points as well as the subject matter. That ws very good. There was a shortage of transitions, but the main ideas and examples were very efficient at moving the reader to an understanding of the conclusion.

column1: 463&Some people choose friends who are different from themselves. Others choose friends who are similar to themselves. Compare the advantages of having friends who are different from you with the advantages of having friends who are similar to you. Which kind of friend do you prefer for yourself? Why?
column3: <IN>Each person has his or her own criteria for choosing friends. Some choose friends who are similar to them, while others like to make friends with those who are different from them. In my case, I prefer the latter. <TS><TR>Now</TR>, I will compare the advantages of the two cases, and show why I prefer the different friends.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>People feel comfortable if they meet friends of theirs.</MI1> <SI1>They can talk openly with their friends because they understand each other quite well. If they get stressful due to their boss, they can relieve their stress by expressing their mind frankly to friends. <TR>Also</TR>, people are likely to have the same hobbies as those of their similar friends. <TR>In such cases</TR>, they can enjoy their hobbies together. They will go to the movies, play basketball or attend concerts in free time.</SI1> These are why people become at ease with similar friends.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, people who have different friends can experience things that otherwise they could not do.</MI2><SI2> Different friends would show their friends various aspects of life. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, if some laconic people met a humorous friend, the laconic people would feel pleased and recover energy of life. <TR>Moreover</TR>, meeting friends with different characteristic, people can develop their personality.</EX></SI2> If a person with quiet and passive characteristic meets a friend who likes sports or traveling, that person will be more active or outgoing.</BO2><CO>It is both beneficial whether people choose similar or different friends. When it comes to me, however, it seems to me more fascinating that meet friends whose characteristic is different from me. Whenever I meet such friends, I can get out of daily routine and be invigorated. When I met a friend who liked dancing a few days ago, we went dancing though I was bad at dancing. That was kind of unusual event, but I relieved the tension through moving my body freely.<TR>In short</TR>, I prefer having different friends because they activate me.</CO>
column23: This is an above average qulity essay. The thesis was lacking any real substance and needed to be improved. There were sufficient transitions, and the main ideas and examples were very efficient at moving the reader to an understanding of the conclusion.

column1: 464&Why do you think some people are attracted to dangerous sports or other dangerous activities? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>In modern society, many people are engaged in more complex jobs than in the past. Complex jobs usually bring about great stress. <TR>Thus</TR>, they want to find their own ways in which they relieve their stress. Especially some people do while enjoying dangerous sports or other dangerous activities. <TS><TR>In this essay</TR>, I will think about the reasons why many people are attracted to these activities or sports.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, I think human beings have a natural tendency to excite or thrill themselves.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Generally</TR>, they seem to be reluctant to face horror. But if safe equipments are ready to protect them, they willingly throw themselves below a cliff, or out of an airplane that is flying. Dangerous sports and activities usually require complicated equipment, so that in the past to enjoy these activities was impossible.</SI1> But nowadays people can equip themselves with anything necessary.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, to live in a modern society gives rise to stress that is quite serious.</MI2><SI2> The more the depth of stress is getting, the more dangerous activities human beings try to relieve it. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, a large percentage of people such as doctors, scientists, and fund managers participate in dangerous activities, because they have more stress than those who have other jobs.</EX></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Finally</TR>, the places where dangerous activities are conducted are in general located in the suburbs such as mountains, and rivers.</MI3> <SI3>These activities can give us a chance to escape from tedious daily lives.</SI3> <TR>Therefore</TR>, many people are gathering around these places to enjoy trill.</BO3><CO><TR>According to the reasons I have previously stated</TR>, more and more people will enjoy dangerous sports or activities in the future. These activities can provide us with relief. But we should keep in mind that although these activities can contribute to our mental health, they also have enormous danger that could cause catastrophe. While enjoying trill, we should always be careful not to fall into a bottomless fit.</CO>
column23: This was a fairly decent essay. The thesis introduced the essay and the topics and moved the reader through the content. There were ample transitions though the supporting ideas could have been a bit more developed.

column1: 465&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? It is more important for students to study history and literature than it is for them to study science and mathematics. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN><TR>Basically</TR>, I disagree with the position that it is more important for studens to study history and literature than it is for them to study science and mathematics. <TS><TR>As a matter of fact</TR>, I believe that science and mathemaitcs are of the best importance to study in class.</TS> There are two reasons to support this perspective. They will become the ladder to developed country and background of creative thinking. Here are some detailed examples.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, it is more important for students to study science and mathematics than history and literature because they have founded on the developed country.</MI1> <SI1>A fundarmental knowledge, science and mathematics, plays an important part in high growth of economy. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, Samsung Electronic Company known as IT industry's mecca has performed his researchs such as applied science and mathematics. The research promoted own industrial development.</EX><SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second of all</TR>, studying science and mathematics could be useful to creative and logical thinking.</MI2> <SI2>These knowledge provides the foundation for understanding how the natural world works. <TR>Also</TR>, more and more companies are requiring such thinkings of their employees to perform hard works effectively.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>As stated above</TR>, it is reasonable that science and mathematics are more important than history and literature for students. There are two reasons for this: background of creative thinking and the ladder to developed country. <TR>Therefore</TR>, it is impossible to overstate the importance of history and literature.</CO>
column23: This was a slightly above average quality essay. The thesis statement should have included portions of the information that was included in the three sentences following it. The introduction before it should have been expanded. The main ideas were great but the second body paragraph was a bit short.

column1: 466&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>Most heroins in Korean history were the mothers of great people.</TS> One of the reasons was because there was little chance for woman to have social jobs but that shows conspicuouly the rightness of the statement, "Parents are the best teachers."</IN><BO1><MI1>Before growing to adolescents, children spend most of their time with their parents and they think of their parents as gods.</MI1> <SI1>So if their parents tell them to do something, they think that's the truth itself. And the parents' behaviors, speaking habits, values of life and etc. inevitably affect their children's behavior without filtering. </SI1>So we can easily look at the criminals who has been living under the violence of their parents and the great people educated from very honorable parents.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, as for selecting jobs, one seems to be affected by his/her parents.</MI2> <SI2>It's not difficult to find those who have the same jobs as ther parents, such as George W. Bush, the president of the United States of America.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>So I think no one can deny the role of parents as their children's teacher. But whether they would be the best teachers or the worst teachers is up to the parents themselves.</CO>
column23: This was a below average quality essay. There was really no introductioni and there was just the bare minimum to create an essay. It was more of an outline format with the points written down with no meat holding the parts together.

column1: 467&Some people believe that a college or university education should be available to all students. Other believe that higher education should be available only to good students. Discuss these views. Which view do you agree with? Explain why.
column3: <IN>Education should be available to all people. Higher education should also be available, but only to those who meet certain qualifications.
