The basic mission of higher education requires students with at least the potential to succeed and possibly excel. Without this standard the university would be forced to lower its expectations of the ability and scope of students¡¯ work or be prepared to have many students fail. </IN><BO1><MI1>If a school enrolls unqualified students, the level of education would naturally decline.</MI1><SI1>The instructors would be forced to lower the standards of their courses or lessen the demands placed on students so the less promising students could also achieve a passing grade. Is that the purpose of college? Well prepared students help create an academically challenging classroom environment which encourages the students to greater accomplishments.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Many attend colleges to maximize the career opportunities that will be available to them after graduation.</MI2> <SI2>The schools promote this positive outcome of education. The students invest their time and money to attend a school with a good reputation, which can assist them in attaining a good job. In order to maintain that reputation, the university must continue to admit and graduate only the best students.</SI2></BO2><CO>When colleges and universities make higher education available to all, they diminish the special role they have played in society. We believe they take able students and through a demanding educational process produce graduates who embody society¡¯s hope for the future. The realities of life teach us that only the best athletes should compete at the Olympics or play professionally and only the best students should attend college.</CO>
column23: This is an average quality essay. There was no thesis statement in an otherwise great introduction. There was balance all the way through the essay, and it was structured well. The main points were very nice, but there was a relative absence of of supporting examples.

column1: 468&You have the opportunity to visit a foreign country for two weeks. Which country would you like to visit? Use specific reasons and details to explain your choice.
column3: <IN>It might be needless to say that visiting a foreign country is such a good experience. <TR>However</TR>, two weeks of time is not long enough to experience one whole country. <TR>In this case</TR>, a small country or one area of a country which have various things to see would be a wise choice. <TS>If I have that opportunity, I would choose Singapore to visit.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Actually</TR>, I have sent to Singapore for a business training last spring for a week. </MI1><SI1>Since it was for a business training, I hardly had a chance to look around the country and had to work and be trained in the office most of the time. I only had a glance at how the country is amazing. Singapore is well-known for its diversity and centralness for its size.</SI1> And it is proven by my bare eyes.</BO1><BO2><MI2>The First reason that Singapore is attractive is its diversity.</MI2> <SI2>I was surprised at its small size knowing that I have seen the country through for just one day from the airport to the company I was trained at. <TR>However</TR>, I also could see such a various people from all different countries. In downtown, I saw a lot of chinese who are the major race in there, Indian, Malaysian, American and Europian. Even in my company all of those different people were working together. Since I live in Korea where not many immigrants have settled yet, it was very exotic for me.</SI2> I am so willing to know many different people.</BO2><BO3><MI2>The second reason to choose Singapore is that it is so small but centralised country.</MI3> <SI3><TR>Thus</TR> I could experience enough things for two weeks without spending time to move around from site to site. Although I am very fond of traveling, searching for the place to sleep every time I move to other area is a great pain. In Singapore, I wouldn't need to move around for two weeks. <TR>In addition</TR>, I could see many things in one area since it is very centralized.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>Following these reason above stated</TR>, a visit to Singapore for two weeks would be a great choice for me. I will use this opportunity meeting various people and enjoying in one location with no rush or hurry moving around.</CO>
column23: This was a below average quality essay. The thesis did not really provide an adequate structure for the essay. The topic was good, but the main points carried no weight and just stated a personal fact that did not answer the question of 'why' the conclusion was being made.

column1: 469&Some people think governments should spend as much money as possible exploring outer space (for example, traveling to the Moon and to other planets). Other people disagree and think governments should spend this money for our basic needs in Earth. Which of these two opinions do you agree with? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN>There are arguments about whether governments should spend as much money as possible exploring outer space or our basic needs on Earth. Exploring outer space is important in that we can frontier the unknown world, <TS><TR>however in my opinion</TR>, it is more valuable for governments to spend money solving the problems we have now in Earth.</TS> This is because we still have pressing problems such as environmental pollution and famine.</IN><BO1><MI1>Perhaps the most serious problem we are facing is environmental pollution.</MI1> <SI1>Although we can't live even a day without air, water or food, ever since industrialization, we have harmed much of our environment. The air is no longer fresh, water isn't as clean as used to be and the soil came to contain lots of harmful elements. If this situation goes on, we may not survive any more.</SI1> <TR>Therefore</TR>, governments should spend money purifying the pollutants and developing methods that don't deteriorate the nature.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, thousands of children are dying due to famine.</MI2> <SI2>In some regions, people live luxurious lives; while in other regions, people can't take even one meal a day. <TR>In other words</TR>, economic inequality threatens the lives of many children who are not guilt. It should be taken into consideration that they all are the same human beings as we are and that they have the right to live without hunger. </SI2>Governments, reasonable entities, should help them, for it's a desirable way that all of us live in Earth.</BO2><CO><TR>In short</TR>, solving our fundamental and serious problem should be followed by our curiosity to the outer space. To make Earth clean and to eradicate the starvation, it is necessary that governments spend as much money as possible solving these crucial problems.</CO>
column23: This was an average quality essy. The thesis should have included the points in the sentence immediately following it. The main points were sufficient. The supporting evidence ws full and complete.

column1: 470&You have been told that dormitory rooms at your university must be shared by two students. Would you rather have the university assign a student to share a room with you, or would you rather choose your own roommate? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
column3: <IN>In our society, a number of university students live in university dormitories and most of them share a room with an another student. <TR>So</TR>, roommate is an important person to each other, and there are two diffrent opinions about the way of choosing him or her which university should assign a student and students should choose each of roommate. <TS>Both are reasonable ; however, in my opinion, I think that I should choose my own roommate in that the way enable me to live with a friend that is familiar and has the same life-style and studies the same major with me.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, I could choose the most intimate friend with me for my own roommate.</MI1> <SI1>In order to share a room with me and live without any serious trouble, intimacy between two friends who live together is a crucially important factor. lf the two friends are unfamiliar with each other, they should consume many times for knowing about each other and there are many problems in the period.</SI1> <TR>For that reason</TR>, I would choose my own roommate.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, I could choose a friend who has the same life-style with me for my own roommate.</MI2> <SI2>When two persons live together, one of the most significant factors is 'harmony', thus, for this, they should live with a common life-style. <EX><TR>To illlustrate</TR>, I live with my roommate in my university dormitory. <TR>Fortunally</TR>, we live without any big trouble or inconvenience because we have the similar life-style in terms of sleeping and studying in the similar time ; however, a intimate friend who live in the next door always has many complaints with her roommate because her roommate always studies in the time that she should go to bed and even loudly listen to the rock music. </EX>Seeing difficulty of the friend, I realize that having the same life-style is very important for living together,</SI2> <TR>therefore</TR>, I think I should choose my own roommate.</BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Third</TR>, I could choose a friend who has the same major with me for my own roommate.</MI3> <SI3>Since most of my times is to study, roommate of the same major is very helpful to me, and also we could become more familiar friends because we can get many times together. <TR>Similarly</TR>, that I choose my own roommate is proper in that I could live a friend of the same major.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In short</TR>, I would choose my own roommate because I could choose a good friend who is intimate with me, and has the same way of life and the same major with me. These factors are very useful for living together without many difficulties, therefore, I'm sure that my opinion is very reasonable.</CO>
column23: This was an excellent essay. The thesis statement was complete and strong. Transitions were well utilized and spaced to effect. Examples were also used to help the author prove the points. Some word choice could have been improved. Well done.

column1: 471&You have the opportunity to visit a foreign country for two weeks. Which country would you like to visit? Use specific reasons and details to explain your choice.
column3: <IN>I suppose there can be varied ideas about the country I want to visit for two weeks, which are essential in the place to give me an abundant experiences. <TS><TR>As a matter of fact</TR>, I believe that the Netherlands is an important place for me. I am an architecture major. <TR>So</TR>, there are two reasons for this selection: good situations for architecture and a famous architect, Rem Koolhaas. Here are some detailed explanations.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, the Netherlands has affluent conditions operating architecture.</MI1> <SI1>The nation is known as experimental fields of architecture. For two weeks, I will experience a great number of buildings and feel a spacial inspiration in experimental place and buildings.Experience is the mother of science.</SI1> Maybe it could help me study my major.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second of all</TR>, I want to visit the OMA, Rem koolhaas's office.</MI2> <SI2>Rem koolhaas is a famous architect in modern architecture. I would talk with him about avantgarde architects. He will initiate me in the mysterious and vision of architecture. His perspective will provides me with developed thinkings.</SI2> After coming back my country, I will carry out my project through its experience.</BO2><CO><TR>Generally</TR>, many people have various attitudes regarding the country they want to visit. In my perspective, however, choosing a foreign country has been personally considered as the most important for these reasons: particular situations for architecture and a famous architect, Rem koolhaas, because of my major. <TR>Therefore</TR>, this is why I chose the country.</CO>
column23: This was a fairly well written essay. The thesis is well structured and allows the reader to see what the essay will cover just from reading the one statement. There is some issue with clarity and word choice. It is sometimes difficult to follow the wording and logic of paragrphs.

column1: 472&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Playing games teaches us about life. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>People are often enthusiastic over sports and, in contrast, frustrated through sports. Only watching sports can give us these complex sentiments. <TR>Moreover</TR> when we ourselves do sports, we can more feel the sport spirit more directly. <TR>Accordingly</TR> some people say playing games teach us about life. <TS>I agree with this statement because sport is a small life. Here are some specific reasons why people say like this.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, as I said above, playing game reflects the ways of actual living.</MI1> <SI1>It is common sense that the more we try, the better results we will get. This rules is applied to games exactly. Although there are some exceptions who are very lucky, but most the winner and good player have tried very much. Sport is naive; it does not tell a lie. If someone endeavors as much as he or she can, the result would compensate eventually. We often hear some player's hard story that they have trained over 15 hours a day to be a champion at the Olympic games.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Second feature which makes a sport life-like is that it has a rule all the players should obey.</MI2> <SI2>We have many rules such as law, ethics, custom. When we break one of these rules, we have to submit others¡¯ reproach. It is also same to playing games. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, in soccer games, players who broke the rule, or behave against sportsmanship, he or she would get yellow card; sometimes a judgment throw the player out of the game.</EX></SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Lastly</TR>, one of the most important factors which makes a good result is planning suitable strategies or tactics as well as managing players' physical power.</MI3> <SI3>In modern society, life is full of various competitions either directly or indirectly. <TR>Similarly</TR>, when someone wants to win in any kinds of competitions, it is essential to prepare enough. Two teams having comparable ability meet at a game, the crucial factor is strategy or tactic. <TR>Moreover</TR>, to get attraction and love from somebody, we should try to give good impression to the target using effective strategy.</SI3></BO3><CO>Sport is a small life. While playing game, we should compete with sportsmanship obeying the rule. <TR>In addition</TR>, to get a satisfaction after playing game, we should try as much as possible. <TR>Also</TR> strategies and tactics should be planned well. <TR>According to these aspects of playing game</TR>, I insist that we can learn about the life through sports.</CO>
column23: This was a fairly decent essay. The thesis was too dependent on the rest of the introduction. The supporting ides had great supporting exmples.

column1: 473&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Universities should give the same amount of money to their students¡¯ sports activities as they give to their university libraries. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>Universities should provide various opportunities to their students to learn many kinds of parts. I couldnot strongly say,students' sports activities are more important than their studies. <TS><TR>However</TR>, I am sure that student's sports activities are greatly influenced with their school lives.</TS> There are some specific reasons why I support that Universities should give the same amount of money to their student' sports activities as they give to their university libraries.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, the students couldnot study well without the health.</MI1> <SI1>When we have some tests like mid-term or final exam, we need a huge energy and power for preparing our tests. Without physical power, it is so hard to study for preparing exams. <TR>Consequently</TR>, we need to excerise almost of our spare time. <TR>But</TR> if there is nothing places and coditions to exerise in our schools, we couldnot do that.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Add to this is the reason that we can destory our stressess by sports activities.</MI2> <SI2>As people know very well, the stress is really harmful to our health and lives. <TR>Addition to</TR>, school have to provide the chances to get rid of their stressess for the students.</SI2> Through sports activities in the school, the students can destory their stressess.</BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Yet another point</TR> is the reason that the students can get the chances to meet many friends.</MI3><SI3> The friends are very important to our school lives. we can get their hands when we are in danger and something like that. <TR>Morever</TR>, we could experience how to live together. </SI3>This is absolutely important to prepare to step in cool society.</BO3><CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, Universities should give the same amount of money to their students¡¯ sports activities as they give to their university libraries. Because there are a lot of educations which cannot be learn on a study on the desk.</CO>
column23: This was a fairly decent essay. The thesis was too dependent on the rest of the introduction. There were ample transitions to improve the flow of the essay to the conclusion.

column1: 474&Some people enjoy change, and they look forward to new experiences. Others like their lives to stay the same, and they do not change their usual habits. Compare these two approaches to life. Which approach to you prefer? Explain why.
column3: <IN>There are those who usually like to enjoy new experience, while there are others who want to live to stay the same. <TS>My preference is to pursuit new experiences because they allow me to have the chance of improvement.</TS</IN><BO1><MI1>Although, to pursuit new experiences is much higher probabilities of failure than to stay the same, they give me a variety of chances to improve.</MI1> <SI1><TR>For my example</TR>, I quit my job in spit of my parent's object. Although prior job that many friends envy was very high salary and large company, I wish to try new something in various field because I was accustomed to my work and the work didn't give me more interesting. Now I work hard in new field which I get much more various knowledge and experience.</SI1> If I wouldn¡¯t quit the prior job, I couldn¡¯t get diverse experiences.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>On the one hand</TR> new challenge is but giving novel opportunities not stable.</MI2> <SI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, staying the same is very stable and safe but not progressive. Many people stick to their life. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, the experts who make traditional musical instrument such as kayagum stick to old methods despite appearing new convenient methods. They said that the sticking method produce so stable and safe that they can produce a great work.</EX></SI2> <TR>In this manner</TR>, staying the same in life contribute to safety and stability.</BO2><CO><TR>As seen the above statement</TR>, there are both advantage and disadvantage whether try to change or not. If I choose a way to lives, I would like to enjoy change. The reason is that people who stay their usual habits are not improvement. Even though there are high probabilities of failure, I think new challenge provide our success.</CO>
column23: This was an above average quality essay that had some word choice issues. There were ample transitions as well as exmples. There was good flow to the essay as a whole.

column1: 475&Some people say that the Internet provides people with a lot of valuable information. Others think access to so much information creates problems. Which view do you agree with? Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>In a modern society, our lives are full of information with the help of media such as TV, computers, and so forth. <TR>Among them</TR>, the computer technology using the internet has changed our lives greatly. It is not an exaggeration that we are now living in the world made by the internet. <TS>I think that although the internet gives rise to problems, we can obtain lots of valuable things.</TS> In this essay, I will give a detailed explanation of my viewpoint. </IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, owing to the internet the world is getting smaller and smaller.</MI1> <SI1>Knowledge, information, and broadcasting are globalized nowadays. Universities co-work with those of other countries and share their knowledge. Without the internet, all of these globalization could be impossible.</SI1> The internet contributes to obtaining valuable knowledge of other countries.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, we can spare time and money using the internet.</MI2> <SI2>In the past, we should go to a bank, and a shopping center. But nowadays we can purchase goods only clicking the button of a computer. We can find useful information about lots of merchandise on a computer monitor.</SI2> <TR>Therefore</TR>, on account of the internet, we need not waste time, money, and energy.</BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Finally</TR>, the internet can improve a communication.</MI3> <SI3>In the past, a telephone or letter is the only tool to make contact with friends or relatives who lives in other countries. But nowadays in a cyberspace, we can make friends indirectly, found an imaginary community to enhance a relationship, and have a chat with someone. The internet also has shortcomings. If we are not familiar with the ways of using the internet, it takes much more time to search what we want because the internet has enormous information. <TR>Nowadays</TR>, lots of porno sites or spam mails are prevalent, and have bed effects on our children.</SI3> <TR>Therefore</TR>, we should have skills to single out necessary information.</BO3><CO><TR>So far</TR>, I said about many aspects of the internet. It has the merits or demerits as I have previously stated. It is true that the internet brings about many problems. <TR>However</TR>, it has much more advantages such as making our world smaller, saving time or money, and improve the relationship. I think the most essential factor is that because the internet became an indispensable tool to live in a modern society, we should have the wisdom to choose the best information that is necessary to us.</CO>
column23: This is an above average quality essay. The thesis was sufficient as were the quality of transitions and main ideas. The essay was fairly satisfactory.

column1: 476&You have the opportunity to visit a foreign country for two weeks. Which country would you like to visit? Use specific reasons and details to explain your choice.
column3: <IN>I went to Las-vegas,Nevada in USA two years ago. When I arrived there, i felt very fantastic and excited to see the night view of Las-vegas. I believe, this experience will not be forgotten to me. However, at that time, I didnot have enough time to look around in Las-vegas. That is why I didnot see some special places which i want to see.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, i want to see famous hotels of Las-vegas.</MI1> <SI1>As people know, there are a lot of famous and beautiful hotels in Las-vegas. Each hotels has something special places and buildings. Those things are enough to attract visitors. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, the performance of the fountain is really huge and gorgeous.</EX></SI1> This is the first reason why i want to go to Las-vegas again.</BO1><BO2><MI2>Add to this is the reason that I can meet various people who come from different countries and experience many kinds of cultures like Japan, Mexico, South Africa.</MI2> <SI2>Because different of races visit this gorgeous city. I like to watch people who from different countries.</SI2> These sorts of experiences could make me feel happy and interested.</BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Yet another point</TR> is the reason that I want to go to Grand cayon.</MI3> As i visited in Las-vegas 2 years ago, this was my schudle to go to Grand cayon. <TR>However</TR>, unfortunately, i couldnot go to Grand cayon because of much snow. <TR>Thus</TR>, if i have one more chance to visit Las-vegas, hopely, i want to see Grand cayon. That is my wish.</BO3><CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, i look forward to seeing many kinds of beautiful hotels with their special performances, i want to meet various of races and feel their own cultures and i really want to go to Grand cayon. These reasons allow me will go to Las-vegas in USA.</CO>
column23: This was a rather poor quality essay. There was no real thesis. I don't know what the author was trying to convey other than the fact that a trip was taken. The points are weak and don't make any points, just experiential facts.

column1: 477&It is sometimes said that borrowing money from a friend can harm or damage the friendship. Do you agree? Why or why not? Use reasons and specific examples to explain your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>I strongly agree with this statement,because I have somewhat these kinds of people besides me.</TS> Not only does it break friendship, but also makes us feel sad after broken friendship. Not borrowing, on the one hand,provides people with no regret, but on the other hand, it gives people with long relationship among friends.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, Borrowing money really needs a royalty; however,sometimes people just rent their money to their friends without the serious promise for paying back.</MI1> <SI1><TR>For instance</TR>, this is about my friend's story. He rented his money to his friend, and few days later he asked him to give back the money. But he couldn't get the money back, the reason for this is that his friend forgot borrowing money from his friends.</SI1> How ever rich my friends may be, we can't just do like this.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Next</TR>, To do not borrow money from friends teaches us that if money is not urgently necessary for our friends, not to borrow is the intellegent idea.</MI2> <SI2>People see many situation that is relating about broken friendship due to money. There's old saying that"Do not do business in partnership with frineds." this teaches us that relation among frineds can be broken when money relates.</SI2> <TR>Nowadays</TR>, most people know about this well-known fact probably.</BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>,as mentioned above, Not borrowing money can have us do not worry until no matter when we're able to pay back or not,later; <TR>However</TR>, we have to realize and make sure if we are really urgent in need of money or not. <TR>Moreover</TR>, we can prevent bad news among friends by not borrowing money, also no regret. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I really suggest an idea that people do not borrow money from friends.</CO>
column23: This was an average quality essay. The thesis was a bit premature and was too dependent on the rest of the introduction. There were great and ample transitions to help the flow of the essay.

column1: 478&Is the ability to read and write more important today than in the past? Why or why not? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>In a modern society, the world is full of information. Because of the growth of the population, people should compete to have jobs. To survive in the complex society, we should have abilities such as reading, speaking, or writing skills. <TS><TR>Especially</TR>, I think that reading and writing skills are the most important factors.</TS> In this essay, I will give a detailed explanations of my viewpoint.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, we have much more knowledge today than in the past.</MI1> <SI1>The computer technologies with the help of internet make the world smaller. We share knowledge with the people who live in other countries. Universities, companies, and laboratories co-work with those of other countries. So much knowledge is always near us that if we do not have skills to choose the best one that is crucial for us, we would obtain the result of going against the times. In a short time we should read an article, and find an answer or create another knowledge. </SI1><TR>Therefore</TR>, the ability to single out knowledge, that is, the skill of reading fast is very important.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, the ability to make ourselves understood is critical.</MI2> <SI2>The society is getting more complex, and the competition more severe. We should get a job, and introduce ourselves to others. To make a resume, and a letter of recommendation requires the skills to express ourselves more accurately. <TR>Therefore</TR>, the writing skills are essential to make ourselves pronounced. <TR>Moreover</TR>, to produce a good result we should have more information about companies and our rivals, which also calls for the reading skills.</SI2> <TR>Thus</TR>, the ability to read and write is more important today than in the past.</BO2><BO3><MI3>We should remember the fact that other people estimate us by means of our ability of expression.</MI3> <SI3>If we have much knowledge but lack the useful techniques to make ourselves and our knowledge that is in a brain known, all the information or knowledge is useless. And even knowledge in our brain could not be obtained without the help of the reading skills.</SI3> <TR>Therefore</TR>, we should improve the ability to read and write.</BO3><CO><TR>So far</TR>, I have explained about why we should uplift the ability to read and write. <TR>As I have previously stated</TR>, we cannot get along without this ability. It is prerequisite for us to survive in a modernized society. <TR>Therefore</TR>, we always exert our energy to enhance the skills such as making ourselves known effectively, and get information without wasting time. If we could equip ourselves with these skills, we would be well-rounded global leaders.</CO>
column23: This was a nice essay. The thesis statement should have included the informaton included in the sentence immediately following it. The body paragraphs were full and complete.

column1: 479&Some people believe that the best way of learning about life is by listening to the advice of family and friends. Other people believe that the best way of learning about life is through personal experience. Compare the advantages of these two different ways of learning about life. Which do you think is preferable? Use specific examples to support your preference.
column3: <IN>People can learn their life in various ways. <TS>Some people think that learning through experience of family and friends are good, while, others argue that learning individual life is more valuable.</TS> There are several advantages about both indirect experience and direct one.</IN><BO1><MI1>The advantage of stories of other people is that they help people avoid failure.</MI1> <SI1><TR>As an illustration</TR>, I could obtain important information from my seniors. When I was a freshman, I should select several course works for that semester. At that time, I have no idea about lectures: which is crucial for my major and which is interesting and informative. Due to these difficulties, I asked to my elders about courses and professors, and they told me their classes that they had taken.</SI1> By their advices, I could avoid failure about selection of my classes.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, when people go through directly, they can have unforgettable memory.</MI2> <SI2>When I was a high school girl, I liked a singer, Seung-Hawn. My friends who went to his concert talked me about that. I, therefore, could know much about his concert such as how many people were there and how amusing his songs was. <TR>However</TR>, when I saw his performance directly, I could have much impression.</SI2><TR>As a result</TR>, I can remember that concert lively till now.</BO2><CO>Even though the experience of others can make people avoid failure, that of one' own give them strong memory. <TR>Therefore</TR>, in my opinion, direct experiece is more valuable way to learn our life.</CO>
column23: This was a nice essay. The thesis was actually just an introductary statement with generalizations and no real points The body paragraphs were full and complete.

column1: 480&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents or other adult relatives should make important decisions for their older (15 to 18 year-old) teenage children. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>when I was a late teenage student my parents let me make a decision whatever I do instead of following their direction. I thought that they effort to raise me to know what is responsibility. so I can spend my time without limit. <TS>but I think student at the age 15~18 need some dicision, rule which can restrict them from their parents or other adults. </TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>to begin with</TR>, most old teenage children used to say they are not child then parents including other adults not ought to intervenate to their life.</MI1><SI1> they sometimes want to be treated as an adult and do like grown up person. <TR>however</TR> though they pretend to be adult, the world which they could experient is pretty limited so they will be confused what to do. </SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>moreover </TR>in modern society ,a help of developing of technology, we get some advantage but our lives are opended to various types of risks at the same time such as a illegal internet site representively, poisoning.</MI2><SI2> the period of adolescense is filled up with curious about.some of students were seduced on poisoning and it derive them to ruin. most of them seems to turn faulty to their parents because they couldn't get their parents' attention I think unfortunately it's true. </SI2></BO2><CO><TR>in conclution</TR>; I agree that older childeren needs some decision in that they are exposured so many danger. so their life sometimes is invaded by parents to stand certain standard.</CO>

column1: 481&"Playing games teaches us about life" Do you agree or disagree with the idea?
column3: <IN>Almost everyone, from little children to adults, love games. While people have fun by playing a game with others, naturally they know of the rules of the game and form close relationship with them. <TS><TR>In my opinion</TR>, playing games is both fun and useful, because games teach us the skills we need in life. We learn how to understand others and also, we know there are rules in society as games have certain rules.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, playing games teaches us the way of understanding others.</MI1> <SI1><TR>for example</TR>, soccer requires eleven members to play a game and also it is the sport that one another need to be cooperative. <TR>So</TR>, eleven members need to adjust to each other so that they raise teamworks. <TR>For this,</TR>, each person considers how other members' emotion is, what they really need, and so on. Since they spend much time on practicing soccer, they sometimes encounter a diversity of difficult situations related to members. once someone feel tired, so he want to stop the practice, but others want to continue the game, they may quarrel due to different opinions. <TR>However</TR>, through this process, they think once more another's reasons and reconcile inconsistent views. <TR>At the end</TR>, when one tries to pass a ball to someone, the person who will receive the ball has feeling that the man who has the ball will give the ball to him.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, we suit ourselves to follow certain social rules as we learn about rules of games and play games in accordance with required rules.</MI2> <SI2><TR>In addition to athletic sports</TR>, all games, like computer games or chess, have each rule. We find out if we want to reach a goal, we need to know the rules, like to be honest, and not to use wrong ways. Also games require us to follow those. We'll be thrown out or the games before we achieve something if we do not observe the rules. The way of living in society is the same as games. <TR>Fundamentally</TR>, we have not to use trick to other people and cheat others out of a thing. If we didn't observe these basic requirement, this society would get out of shape.</SI2><TR>Therefore</TR> that we play games according to requisite rules applies to our real lives.</BO2><CO>There is an old saying that "all work and no play make Jack a dull boy.". this saying mean that we can learn many things at play. <TR>As above</TR>, I believe that people pontaneously learn skills, like ability to understand others and learn rules to need in life as games. These are just "killing two birds with one stone"</CO>
column23: This is an above average quality essay. The thesis was sufficient as were the quality of transitions and main ideas. The essay was fairly satisfactory.

column1: 482&Some people prefer to work for a large company. Others prefer to work for a small company. Which would you prefer? Use specific reasons and detail to support your choice.
column3: <IN>Most people need to work for a living unless they were millionaires. In this situation, some people prefer to work for a large company; other people want to get their jobs in a small company. <TR>As for me</TR>, I would take the former side. <TS>I want stability, many opportunities, and a good career.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>In a large company, I can receive regular paychecks and vacations.</MI1> <SI1>It has usually better financial conditions than a small company's. <TR>Also</TR>, even in crisis, it can get aids from its government or banks more easily. A small company, on the other hand, is often affected by a large company's conditions. I may have no work and wages during strikes in a large company, or sometimes have to work overtime without vacations. Even if a large company doing business with it suddenly reduced the scale according to the change of circumstances, the small company might go bankrupt.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>In a large company, there are a variety of opportunities.</MI2> <SI2>I can get chances to participate in socially influential projects, and learn good knowledge from my colleagues passing fierce competitions for joining the company. <TR>Furthermore</TR>, large companies generally have many training programs for their employees. I can develop myself through such courses; language training program, management training program and so on. <TR>However</TR>, in the case of a small company, there are only few such chances.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Finally</TR>, I can achieve a good career in a large company.</MI3> <SI3>After getting much experience, I may sometimes want to change my company for better conditions. In that case, I can be head-hunted by a rival company in better paychecks and treatments. Or in job interviews may personnel managers be more interested in my career.</SI3> If I worked for a small company, I would always have to explain what the company did.</BO3><CO><TR>In short</TR>, I can enjoy stable conditions, get many opportunities, and an advantageous career in a large company. Aren't there any reasons not to prefer it?</CO>
column23: This was an average quality essay. The thesis was very weak and hardly even touched the subject while not even discussing the points. The body paragraphs were full and complete.

column1: 483&A company has announced that it wishes to build a large factory near your community. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of this new influence on your community. Do you support or oppose the factory? Explain your position.
column3: <IN>With the development of the industry, building a variety of factories around our surroundings is becoming a familiar phenomenon. While in some areas, the ¡°NIMBY¡± slogan was prevailed against construction of factories, in other destitute areas, building industrial facilities could be beneficial to the improvement of their lives. <TS><TR>However</TR>, I oppose the factory since the side-effects are prodigious. </TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, ere cting factories could create a huge number of employments and bring the economic boost of community in many ways.</MI1><SI1> As the factory is being built, the influx of population is anticipated. <TR>Also</TR>, with the increase of population to find jobs, residential are will expand. <TR>Therefore</TR>, commercial area would be spread to suffice the dwellers¡¯ needs. </SI1><TR>As a result</TR>, the life in the community will be more convenient than ever before. </BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, the building of factories near my community could ruin some parts of my life.</MI2><SI2> Industrial facilities not only do contaminate the air, but also destroy the whole environment. <TR>Accordingly</TR>, our health will get worse on account of the pollution of the water and air. <TR>Moreover</TR>, our ordinary lives would be disturbed remarkedly by the din from the factories. <TR>Besides</TR>, traffic jam resulted from expansion of a city could influence on our daily lives in a negative way. </SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I¡¯m inclined to oppose a scheme of building a factory near my habitat since my community has developed to some extent. What I think as a priority is not for quality of life to be threatened but the maintenance of my health and incessant improvement of quality of life.</CO>
column23: This was a well written essay. The thesis was a bit short and to the point, but it presents the problem as well as a directional to the points that will be presented. The main ideas were strong. The supporting ideas had excellent points even without their structure explicitly pointing out examples.

column1: 484&We all work or will work in our jobs with many different kinds of people. In your opinion, what are some important characteristics of a co-worker (someone you work closely with)? Use reasons and specific examples to explain why these characteristics are important.
column3: <IN>Most people work with their co-workers. Some people think that co-workers should have some properties such as honest and competence. <TS><TR>In my opinion</TR>, the most important characteristics are responsibility and cooperation in some reasons.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, co-workers should have responsibility.</MI1> <SI1>In most case, people work together, therefore, the lack of one peer's responsibility affects the whole members' job. <EX><TR>As an example</TR>, I worked at a research company as a part-time worker for two years. At that time, one of my team members used to delay his job. Because of him, my team could not often turn in our project results on time.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Another important quality of co-worker is cooperative spirit.</MI2> <SI2>Cooperation helps people have more good outputs than doing alone. <EX>A good illustration of this is the working way of Mckinsey, one of the famous consulting companies. In Mckinsey, when people have projects, to perform them they always make teams at first. They say that doing by with team member, they could obtain various information then effectively analyze them.</EX></SI2> The more people cooperate, the more they can obscure valuable results.</BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, if co-workers have some good traits such as responsibility and cooperation spirit, they will be a helpful members. As a result of this benefits, people should strive to be a good co-workers.</CO>
column23: This was a nice essay. The author is very efficient with words and doesn't write that much. The thesis was a bit too short and left out the subject matter though there were introductions to the main points. The main and supporting ideas were well developed with examples.

column1: 485&You have been told that dormitory rooms at your university must be shared by two students. Would you rather have the university assign a student to share a room with you, or would you rather choose your own roommate? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
column3: <IN>I would prefer to have the university assign a student to share a room with me if I lived in a dormitory. <TR>Of course</TR>, there may be more difficulty in getting close to the new roommate than in living with a friend whom I choose as a roommate. <TS><TR>However</TR>, I believe that the advantages of living with an unfamiliar roommate outweigh those of living with a familiar friend.</TS> For one thing I can make a new friend, and then I can improve my personality.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, there is a chance to meet a new friend in sharing room with an unfamiliar student.</MI1> <SI1>I believe it important to broaden interpersonal relationship in university. Though meeting a friend whose major is different from mine is difficult in my university, sharing my room with an unknown friend gives me a chance to meet diverse kind of person. <EX>When I was a freshman, I lived with the student who the university assigned. He was different from me in major, hometown, characteristic, tastes, etc. Although it didn't seem that I was able to get along with him, we became friends soon and he is one of my intimate friends now.</EX</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, it is possible to develop my personality through living with an unfamiliar friend.</MI2> <SI2>If a close friend, he could not observe my merits and drawbacks objectively. <TR>However</TR>, an unfamiliar person can point out the pros and cons of my characteristic. <EX>As a freshman, I was originally a introverted person. After I met my roommate that I mentioned above, he often took me out playing basketball together and drinking liquor. <TR>Eventually</TR>, I became more social and outgoing. He helped me improve my personality.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO>The point is that sharing a room with an unfamiliar student whom the university assigns is more advantageous than with a familiar friend that I choose. This is because I can make a new friend and develop my personality. Although I live with my family now, I would live with a new friend if I had an opportunity to live in a dormitory.</CO>
column23: This was a nice essay. The author is very efficient with words and doesn't write that much. The thesis was a bit too short and left out the subject matter though there were introductions to the main points. The main and supporting ideas were well developed with examples.

column1: 486&You have enough money to purchase either a house or a businessWhich would you choose to buy? Give specific reasons to explain your choice.
column3: <IN>everybody used to imagine what they be a richer like the other man wtching on the magazine. money could give us some satisfation and comfort. <TR>therfore</TR> in these day many people are attracted easily to bridle and reinstate. <TS>if I have enough maney to purchase either a house or a business, I would buy my own car.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>I have suffered from crowded bus to go to school from elementary school to university.</MI1> <SI1>Bus services are limited. because student to go to their school on time, I always had to run to take a bus. <TR>therefore</TR> my own car is the most wanted goods for me.</SI1> If I have my own car, I could save the morning time wasted for waiting bus. using that time, I could prepare for my class and could talk about my family more.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR> I am a teacher of my church.</MI2> <SI2>I have some children some of them often absent from church. there are various reason why they absent from the church most common reason is that they are wake up so late in the morning. watching tv they forget the time to go. when they recognize, time is already over.</SI2> if I have a car, I could bring them on time to chuch though they wake in the morning late.</BO2><CO><TR>in conclusion</TR>, if I could have enough money to purchase something what I need, I would buy the car. it give me more free time in the morning and help me to do well as a teacher at the church.</CO>
column23: This was a below average quality essay. The thesis did not really provide an adequate structure for the essay. column1: 487&somepeople think that children should begin their formal education at a very early age and should spend most of their time on school studies. others believe that young children chiould spend most of their time playing. compare these two views. which view do you agree with? why?
column3: <IN>Some people say that children had better begin their formal education at a very early age. Other people say that children had better spend most of their time playing. Both of these types have their own advantages. <TS>In my opinion, that children spend most of their time playing is more attractive for several reasons.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>On the one hand</TR>, if children spend most of their time on school studies, children will acquire knowledge fast.</MI1> <SI1>In Korea, according to a survey, children can obtain knowledge more fast than adults can. <TR>Therefore</TR>, if children spend their time on school studies, they can acquire knowledge efficiently. There, however, are some disadvantage. one of the important disadvantages is that children can easily lose interest in their studies because they can concentrate for a long time.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, if children spend most of their time playing, they can improve their physical health.</MI2> <SI2><TR>Also</TR>, if children play a team game with their friend, they can learn to obey some rules and cooperate each other.</SI2> In their life, they can apply the strategy to use in game.</BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, if I choose that children should spend most of their time between on school studies and playing, I would like to choose that children spend most of their time playing because childhood is an physically grown period. <TR>Therefore</TR>, they need many exercises. <TR>Also</TR>, if children spend most of their time on school studies, they can lose interest in their studies.</CO>
column23: This was an average quality essay. There were some good points. The thesis could have been just a little stronger if it had included some reference to the main points that would be made. The first body paragraph was excellent but the second body paragraph was a bit stunted.

column1: 488&Many people visit museums when they travel to new places. Why do you think people visit museums? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>To travel somewhere gives us lots of things and there are many ways to travel. Museum is one of the most popular of our destination. <TS>I think the reasons people visit museums are those following thins; we can see the history of the place, and also it is good place to teach children as a educational way. </TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, we can see the history of the place we visit.</MI1> <SI1>We don't need to look up the history book and we can get more knowledge about the place. Whenever I traveled overseas, there was no time to see all of things I wanted. <TR>Thus</TR>,I prefered to go musemum because it gave many informations satisfiying me. <TR>Also</TR>, we can imagine about the place. In the ago saying, people say that history is always circulating. It is also one of the benefits of museums.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, museums are best place to educate our children.</MI2> <SI2>There are many illustrations and pictures which shows us about the place. <TR>Actually</TR>, whenever we go out somewhere, we can't teach our children because there are lact of knowledge and instruments and so on. Museums give us educations knowledge easily.</SI2> We can give our children educational knowledges and even we can learn about the place. </BO2><CO>Museums give us either historical informations or educational knowledge. <TR>Nowadays</TR> there are many places to travel,but there is no time to see around all of thins and also it is hard to get good expression about the place if we couldn't get affections of the place. I think as museums give us those things very easily, conveniently, people usually visit there.</CO>
column23: This was a nice essay. The thesis statement as well as the main points were very strong and clear. A few more transitions could have been added to improve the flow. The supporting examples were nice, but the assignment demanded examples which were not included.

column1: 489&somepeople think that children should begin their formal education at a very early age and should spend most of their time on school studies. others believe that young children chiould spend most of their time playing. compare these two views. u agree with? why?
column3: <IN>I think people who think that children should begin their formal education at a very early age and should spend most of their time on school studies are obsessed with elitism. They consider very smart children as the best. I ,however, am not in favor of this kinds of way of thinking. The reason why I disagree with is that the elitism is not all. There are more valuable things in the world than these people think. <TS>In this concept, I totally agree that young children should spend most of their time playing.</TS> Let me allow you to know the reasons.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, the children can learn sociality through playing.</MI1> <SI1>They can make friends with each other and have realationship through playing.</SI1> I think playing plays vital roles in improving sociality.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>,the children can obtain the improvement of physical ability from spending much time playing.</MI2> <SI2>They , for example, can obtain strong leg muscles by attemting to play soccer.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>For the reasons above</TR>, I agree with the vital roles of playing. The good effect of playing on the children can not be ignored.</CO>
column23: This was a below average quality essay. The thesis did not really provide an adequate structure for the essay. The supporting ideas were far too short and didn't include examples. There were many obvious grammatical and word choice errors.

There, however, are some disadvantage. one of the important disadvantages is that children can easily lose interest in their studies because they can concentrate for a long time.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, if children spend most of their time playing, they can improve their physical health.</MI2> <SI2>Also</TR>, if children play a team game with their friend, they can learn to obey some rules and cooperate each other.</SI2>In their life, they can apply the strategy to use in game.</BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, if I choose that children should spend most of their time between on school studies and playing, I would like to choose that children spend most of their time playing because childhood is an physically grown period. <TR>Therefore</TR>, they need many exercises. <TR>Also</TR>, if children spend most of their time on school studies, they can lose interest in their studies.</CO>
column23: This was a nice essay. The author is very efficient with words and doesn't write that much. The thesis was a bit too short and left out the subject matter though there were introductions to the main points. The main and supporting ideas were well developed with examples.

column3: <IN>To elevate the quality, we have to be estimated in any ways. column23: This was a below average quality essay. The thesis did not really provide an adequate structure for the essay. The topic was good, but the main points carried no weight. column1: 493&Holidays honor people or event. If you could creat new holiday, what person or event would you honor and how would you want people to celebrate it? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN>It's wonderful to have holidays that we can honor and celebrate. <TS>If i'm a person who can make one holiday for people, I would make a holiday called day of apology because it can rejubinate our relationships and remind to people to apologize with many ways such as phonecalls, cards, and having dinner togather.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, Day of apology can make human relationships stronger.</MI1> <SI1>Acknowledging of one's falut is first step for rebuilding broken relationships and saying it is its second steps. These are called as apology. <TR>So</TR>, everybody who gets phonecalls or present with apology letter would be happy enough to open their heart to the person who showed their thuth.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, Day of apology allow people to rember the values of apology.</MI2> <SI2>Every time, the Day of apology comes, people would remember the people they got back again thru apology last years and think how worthy apology is.</SI2> <TR>Moreover</TR>, they would take better care for their relationships and thank for people they have around them.</BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Third</TR>, people can celebrate and enjoy the day doing actual apology.</MI3> <SI3>By sending cards ,make phone calls, or arrange for dinner in nice restautant, they can find thier own appotunity to apology.</SI3> Doing something late is always better than doing nothing.</BO3><CO><TR>In sum</TR>, I really want to creat the Day of apology for rebuilding our relationships and reminding apology's value it self making a lot of effort with many ways to show their thruth for the people they have done something wrong in the past such as talking, writing and inviting them. Then world that we are living, will be much brighter and warmer with refound love.</CO>
column23: This was a very good essay. The thesis was perfect in addressing the issue as well as the points of the main ideas to come. There was a good flow in the the essay as the points built on each other to answer the question at hand. The introduction should have been a bit more devleopled and there were several grammatical and word choice errors.

column1: 494&Nowadays, food has become easier to prepare. Has this change improved the way people live? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Just few decades ago preparing food is very difficult, however these days It is much easier to prepare and it influences people's life in various way : increasing health, comfort and status of women.</IN><BO1><MI1>It was too difficult for people to get fish,weed or alage becaus of difficulty of restoring and carrying to inside country.</MI1> <SI1>Only the people who lived close to sea were able to enjoy seafood like those. As development of the refrigerator and transport it became possilbe for anyone to can eat flash food. It brought people resaonable diet and health.</SI2></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Morever</TR>, in very complex modern society ease with preparation of food made it possible for people to get comfort.</MI2> <SI2><TR>Especailly</TR>, in the morring people should hurry because they have to go to work or school. As they eat serials of frozen food they can have comfortable and relax time.</BO2><BO3><MI3>The most important influece is that a woman's housechores decreased and that brought a chance to join work to women, consequently status of women can be increased.</MI3> <SI3><TR>For instance</TR>, in the pass time cooking was the one of the most important work for women.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, ease with preparing food make many benefits to our life and morever that made it possible for women enjoy their work and lifetime. I belive that it will bring people more comfortable and convenient life.</CO>
column23: This was a fairly decent essay if the topic had been about an example of how housekeeping women's lives had improved. But the essay has to do with the general improvement of people, men and women, because of technological improvents in food preparation.

column1: 495&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Reading fiction (such as novels and short stories) is more enjoyable than watching movies. Use specific reasons and examples to explain your position.
column3: <IN>In modern society, the entertainment becomes a essential thing in human life because modern people are interested in the leisure than people of the past. There are many kinds of entertainment in our society, and the most popular things are fictions and movies. <TR>About these</TR>, some say that reading fiction is more enjoyable while others say that watching movies is more exciting because of the enjoyment by visible effects. <TS><TR>In my opinion</TR>, I agree with the opinion that reading fiction is more enjoyable because it gives the tremendous enjoyment by infinite imagination and lively expressions without any limitation.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, reading fiction enable me to enjoy through exerting of infinite imagination.</MI1> <SI1>When a reader read a fiction, he or she would specify every scene as real situation by imagination of themselves, and feel more interesting about that. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, I like science fictions very much, and when I read those, I always imagine a feeling of vast universe and apperance of aliens appearing in fictions.</EX> <TR>In this course</TR>, I feel as if I become a character in the fictions, <TR>therefore</TR>, I believe that reading fiction is more exciting than directly watching the scenes in movies.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second of all</TR>, through reading fiction, I can meet various expressions without any limitation.</MI2> <SI2>In movies, there are many fators which are impossible to express in the screen ; however, contrasting with that, fiction is only by description of the writer without any needs for visible expression. <TR>Accordingly</TR>, it can provide every scene that writer want to depict to readers. <EX><TR>To illustrate</TR>, the fiction of England "Harry Porter" is made movies in some time ago, and althogh it has been very popular over the world, I was not satisfied with that because it was couldn't express efficiently comparing with the fiction. </EX></SI2>Based on an example in above, I'm sure that fiction can give bigger joy than movies to us.</BO2><CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, I think that reading fiction is more amusing comparing with watching movies in that it provides unlimited amusement to readers through encouraging imaginative power of readers, and can express everything which is intended by writer unrestrictely.</CO>
column23: This was a very nice essay. The structure and balance of the essay are perfect as well as the points presented.

column3: <IN>Somebody said that teachers have to be paid although they do not have enough to teach their students. <TS><TR>However</TR> I think if teachers do not have quallity to teach their students they should be paid according to how much their students get the knowledge.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>In my country, Korea, high school teachers emphasize to memorize their students whole metarials what they learned.</MI1> <SI1><TR>However</TR> in my case, I forgot whaen I learned at high school. The problem is not only Korean high shools but almost Aisan hihg schools. The reason why many Asian high school teachers can teach their students when they become 65 years old.</SI1> <TR>Thus</TR> they do not have enthusiasm. they are garanteed by their government.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, United States' education system is different from Asian countries' education system.</MI2> <SI2>Their education system do not emphasize to memorize to their students.</SI2> The point is why i would like to study in Unites states. column1: 497&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Universities should give the same amount of money to their students¡¯ sports activities as they give to their university libraries. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>In my position, university is not a place solely for studying, but a place that should provide various opportunities to improve students¡¯ knowledge and enhance their interest. <TS><TR>Therefore</TR>, I agree with this statement since for universities to give the same amount of money to their students sports activities as they do to their university libraries would be helpful in the aspect of students and in terms of universities themselves.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>The most important reason for my position is that expanding sports facilities could bring about positive effects to students.</MI1> <SI1> <TR>Above all</TR>, improvement of efficiency in studying can be anticipated since adequate stamina obtained from sports activities is the vital factor in maintaining constant studying. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, in my high school days¡¯ experience, after keeping working out, I got to concentrate much better on my studying than when I didn¡¯t. <TR>Moreover</TR>, students can form various relationships with others through a variety of sports activities.</EX><SI1>Rather than just having a relationship with their seniors or juniors in major, as making new acquaintances of other majors, students can widen their human relations and broaden their horizons.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, in a point of universities¡¯ view, they can expect to earn more reputations through expanding their students¡¯ sports activities.</MI2> <SI2>In my case, despite the fact that I didn¡¯t know any name of American universities, after watching NBA draft every year, I got to memorize some universities¡¯ names automatically. <TR>In other words</TR>, with the nurture of good players due to increase in investment on students¡¯ sports activities, universities not only do make good results at sports competition, but also enhance their popularity all over the country, even all over the world.</SI2> <TR>Accordingly</TR>, much more students could be attracted to those universities.</BO2><CO>I¡¯m definitely inclined to the idea that universities should invest on expanding their sports activities. Regarding the compound influence of improvement of students¡¯ physical strength and indirect publicity effect through sports teams, development of universities would be explosive.</CO>

column1: 499&Some people believe that the best way of learning about life is by listening to the advice of family and friends. Other people believe that the best way of learning about life is through personal experience. Compare the advantages of these two different ways of learning about life. Which do you think is preferable? Use specific examples to support your preference.
column3: <IN>Life is always mystery to all of us, and we have to try to learn about life ceaselessly. <TS>There are two common ways to learn about life; from our family and friends and by oneself. Both ways have their own good aspect.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all<TR>, I think that learning about life from our friends and family is most basic method and important way of learning life.</MI1> <SI1>They are know very well about me and they think and care me from their heart. <TR>Thus</TR>, they can advice more better way, and they could tell their experience truly more than anyone else. Whatever I do, first they try to think about my situation and they tell me a good way because they love me. To learn life is hard and difficult if there is no other's advice and care.</SI1> They are good teacher for me to learn life.</BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, learning about life through personal experience is hard but it is worth because it gives us more practical importations about life.</MI2> <SI2>Whenever we travel somewhere or do something new by ourselves, even it takes lots of times, we never forget the feeling and memory about that.</SI2> If we learn more and more about life by this way, we'll Know how to do something new without hesitating and it makes our life more better than before and also it gives us confident.</BO2><CO>Learning about life is really important all of us. I think to children, learning life from family and friends is good for them because it is safe and to young person, learning life by themselves is more better because they are able to figure out what is good for them.</CO>
column23: This was a nice essay. The author is very efficient with words and doesn't write that much. The thesis was a bit too short and left out the subject matter though there were introductions to the main points. The main and supporting ideas were well developed with examples.

column1: 500&You have decided to give several hours of your time each month to improve the community where you live. What is one thing you will do to improve your community? Why? Use specific reasons and details to explain your choice.
column3: <IN>As welfare system develops, a community needs more help from the community members. So there are many opportunities for people to serve for a community. <TR>For example</TR>, river-cleaning movement and other environment protecting business require citizens' attention and voluntary involvement. Also, nowadays there are many programs which are offered by a community. They include continuing education program or programs for teenagers' aptitude development. <TS>If I should give some hours of mine each month for my community, I would like to be included in these kinds of programs, especially as a computer teacher for elderly people.</TS> Here are several reasons why I would like to do this activity.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, I think that any services should be done voluntarily.</MI1> <SI1>If anybody should do some service activities reluctantly without his or her own will, It will not be true services. <EX>When I went to middle school, I was compelled to attend a river-cleaning program hold by city. Because I did not want to go there truly, I could not serve sincerely</EX>. <TR>In contrast</TR>, teaching is one of my favorite activities. <TR>Therefore</TR>, if I were asked to be a teacher for community, I would readily consent it.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Another reason why I want to be a teacher especially for old people is that this job is suitable for me.</MI2> <SI2> That is, I have confidence to do that job. Since 2 years ago, I have taught my mother how to use computer and internet. Middle-aged people are not usually accustomed to using computers. <TR>However</TR>, my mother came to be a friend with a computer as she took my lessons. <TR>In this respect</TR>, I believe that I also will do teach old people well. <TR>Moreover</TR>, people feel themselves worthy when they do service which they can do best.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Lastly</TR>, if service activity can help the server's development, this will be more profitable both the donator and receivers.</MI3> <SI3>Actually I have a dream to be a teacher of computer-related subject. <TR>Therefore,</TR> experiences teaching elderly people how to use computer and internet can be a good support to myself, too.</SI3></BO3> <CO>There are many chances in which I can do service to improve my community. <TR>Among them</TR>, If I should decide to give several hours of my time each month, I would like to spend my time for old people's learning how to use computer. That is because I will do that job with much pleasure, and I am good at teaching. <TR>In addition</TR>, it will be helpful not only to the elderly citizens but also to me.</CO>
column23: Your essay is pretty good, but you need to strengthen your thesis statement by just stating your point ("If I gave my time, I would teach the elderly"). I suggest you delete your first main paragraph, as it is doesn't really address the question. Finally, middle age is not the same as elderly - middle age means 30s-50s, and elderly is older than that.

column1: 501&Many people have a close relationship with their pets. These people treat their birds, cats, or other animals as members of their family. In your opinion, are such relationships good? Why or why not? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>As a human beings, having good relationship with our pets is so valuable because it allows us to understand other species better and is helpful for children to learn how to love.</TS> Through several examples and reasons, I will demonstrate why I believe having a close relationship with our pets is good.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, having a close relationship with our pets allows us to understand other species better.</MI1><SI1> Animals such as birds, cats, and dogs have their own spirit and they are our friends in that they live with us in the earth. Even though we can see the animals in our daily life, we hardly know how they live, <TR>for example</TR>, how to communicate between them, or how to breed their offsprings. Still, if we have a familiar relationship with the animals, we can comprehend their life style better, consequently having wider insight about the life of other species.</SI1> </BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second of all</TR>, treating the pets as our family is helpful for children to learn how to love.</MI2> <SI2>During our childhood, we have a tendency only to be given love from our parents, not having chances to give love to other people. <TR>However,</TR> if we have pets such as dogs or rabbits, we can treat meals or water to them. <TR>In addition</TR>, when it rains a lot, we can protect them, which dislike water very much, from heavy rain by locating its cage in the home. In this process, we can learn how to love in our childhood; <TR>consequently</TR>, it would be a fruitful experience to improve our consideration for other people.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, having a close relationship with pets is priceless seeing that it enables us to comprehend other species better and helps children to learn how to love. Not only widening our insight for other species but also giving children chances to breed something, having a familiar relationship with pets provides us with invaluable experience.</CO>
column23: A very good essay! Your example about the cage confused me a little, but your general point is good.
