Motly they said the problem is wrong; <TR>furthermore</TR>, they told me wrong answers, sometimes. <TR>However </TR>if their pays are differentiated depending on how successfully their students learn, those happening would not occur anymore.</SI2></BO2><CO>Recently there are a lot of irrespomsible teachers in Korea. They are not interested in students and even don't have enough abilities to teach students. I think that is because of the concept, which is, teacher is not risky to be fired at all, in other words teahers is not evaluated by the students. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I think we really need some ways to test teachers, and it is the very method to differ their pays depending on how successfully their students learn.</CO>
column23: It seems you have forgotten to support your argument in the first main paragraph. You can't say "teachers are indifferent" without giving some proof. Your second main paragraph is all right, but you could use some solid proof for that, too. We can't go on your word alone. Finally, your conclusion sounds more like a complaint than anything else. If you feel so strongly about this argument, you need to show the reader why with facts and examples, not just your opinion.

column1: 503&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Children should be required to help with household tasks as soon as they are able to do so. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>People have their own way to raise their children. Getting their children help with household tasks is an important matter to them. Some people don¡¯t let their children do household chores to protect them, while other people think that it can be nice education. <TS>In my opinion, I agree the statement that children should be required to help with household tasks as soon as they are able to do so because it can improve the children¡¯s responsibility as well as provide time to talk with family members.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, children could be responsible for themselves by helping with household tasks.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Nowadays,</TR> many children are becoming dependent more and more due to over-protection. For these children, household tasks can be wonderful prescriptions.<TR> For example</TR>, if a dependent child should do household chores like feeding a dog, washing dishes, although bothered by them at first, they could overcome the problem at last similarly, house task are needed to children to raise their responsibility.</SI1> </BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, children can have time to be with family members through household tasks.</MI2> <SI2>In this dehumanized society, no wander that children don¡¯t have time to be with family members. <TR>However</TR>, household task can afford children time to talk with their parents. <TR>For instance</TR>, it¡¯s reported by ABC Research that children¡¯s average time to talk with their parent a week is just only forty-seven minutes. <TR>Therefore</TR>, household tasks are needed to children to let them communicate with their family members.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I think that helping with household task have wonderful influences on children, such as giving responsibility and providing family time. For our children, we should give them the opportunities to participate in household tasks.</CO>
column23: This is a great essay! You rely a little too much on transitions in your second main paragraph - try to take a few out. As a rule, if you have a transition in three sentences in a row, that is too many.

column1: 504&Do you agree or dis agree with following statement? Attending a live performance is more enjoyable than watching the same event on television.
column3: <IN>Many people believe that attending a live performance is more enjoyable than watching the same event on television. This is a myth that many generations like to hold. This common belief, however, has several critical flaws. <TS><TR>Thus</TR> I disagree with that statement because watching TV is more convenient and economical.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, watching a live performance on TV is more convenient than attending a live performance.</MI1><SI1> In most case, a live performance is held at remote place from home. To see a performance, we take a bus or subway for long time. If we drive a car, we must spend much time searching for parking lot. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, recently, I went to see a Korean musical- Pansori -. We have hard time in parking. So my husband said ¡° next time we watch TV at home¡±.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, watching a live performance on TV is more cost-saving than attending a live performance.</MI2> <SI2>In most case, a live performance requires much money. <TR>For example</TR>, a Korean musical – Pansori – cost $ 70 per adult person. If Three people go to a live event, they spend $ 210. That is too big. With that money, we can eat something delicious while watching the same event on TV.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, watching TV is more easy and cost-saving way for us to experience a performance. <TR>Thus</TR> I like to spending some time in watching the big event on TV with my family. I recommend that everybody have a good time with family while watching a fun event at home.</CO>
column23: You did a really good job with this essay! The only thing I suggest is to say what the statement is that you disagree with in your thesis statement. It will make it stronger.

column1: 505&People recognize a difference between children and adults. What events (experiences or ceremonies) make a person an adult? Use specific reasons and examples to explain your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>We become an adult symbolically and practically through wedding ceremony or by entering university.</TS> With several examples and reasons, I will demonstrate why I think these two events make us an adult.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>In the first place</TR>, having a wedding ceremony makes us an adult.</MI1><SI1> Marriage is an important standard through which our life changes a lot. That is, after marriage, we come to have responsibility for our own family, our spouse and children. By becoming parents, we should support our family members in the aspect of money and love for them as well. We no longer depend on our parents but our children do on us. <TR>Therefore</TR>, we have a chance to be reliable for other people.</SI2></BO1><BO2><MI2>,TR>In the second place</TR>, entering university is a stage to become an adult.</MI2> <SI2>What is an adult? It means we should be responsible for ourselves; nobody can substitute our lives for theirs. Even though parents have provided us with economic and mental help, once entering university, we should manage our life for our own. It is neither impossible nor desirable only to rely on our parents. When attending university, we are not only supposed to manage our schedule for our study and lecture but also meet other people according to our own plan; by managing independent life, we can learn how to cruise the long life.</SI2></BO2><CO>By above-mentioned reasons and examples, I strongly believe that we can be an adult through a wedding ceremony and entering university. Making us have responsibility for our own family and ourselves, marriage and entering university makes us more mature and reliable adult.</CO>
column23: A very good essay! I would suggest putting the university paragraph before the marriage paragraph, simply because university usually comes before marriage in a person's life.

column1: 506&Teachers' pay should depend on how successfully their students learn. Do you agree with that view, or not? Use specific examples and reasons to explain your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>I agree with the idea that teacher¡¯s pay should be determined by how successfully their students learn.</TS> Because teachers don¡¯t pay attentions to their students without the increase of their pay and by giving more pay , we can expect teachers to instruct students more efficiently. Let me allow to inform you of more specific examples and reasons.</IN> <BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, I think teachers are more enersized if teacher¡¯s pay is determined by how excellently their students carried out .</MI1> <SI1><TR>in fact</TR>, korea government don¡¯t much pay to teachers and so teachers don¡¯t care to instruct their students. To improve the ability of our students, the system that Teachers' pay should depend on how successfully their students learn is needed.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second of all</TR>, the instruction to this system can expect teachers to instruct students more efficiently.</MI2><SI2> If this system is applied to education, teachers will compete with other teachers. Naturally students will have good quality of education.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>For this reasons</TR>, I am in favor of this system. For the good quality of our education, this system is required.</CO>
column23: This essay is quite short. Where are all the examples and reasons? You need to support this argument better.

column1: 507&A gift (such as a camera, a soccer ball, or an animal) can contribute to a child's development. What gift would you give to help a child develop? Why? Use reasons and specific examples to support your choice.
column3: <IN>when I was a young child my parents give a various kind of gifts to find out my own talent such as a volley ball, a book which was consist of puzzle collection, and a dog. though those are not help in that draw some talent from me, those gifts left unforgetable memory.<TS> if I could give a special gift for child, I would like to give a book.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>as computer technology has development, people spend many time in front of computer because computer offers us much entertainment.</MI1> <SI1>we sometimes find the same feeling talking about some people through using internet. but people not ought to acknowldge some disadvantage coming from using comuter. children including some adult do not read a any sort of book any more camparing with that of computer. so their emotion is like the desert and experient their laguage abilty is gradually declined.</SI1></BO1> <BO2><MI2>a suitable book for children, which makes children to meet opend world. by reading a book they could increase thier own imagination.</MI2><SI2><EX> I spent most of the my child time at rural. so I could not found something made me absorb in. by reading a book help me to take off from such monotonous life.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO><TR>in conclusion</TR>, if I could give a children some gift, I would like to give them a book. there are two reasons. in modern society, most children don't approch a book comparing with the past and a suitable book help children to increase their own emotion like a cup of water to wanderer on the desert.</CO>
column23: Where is the content in this essay? Your first main paragraph has nothing to do with your argument. Your second main paragraph has a main idea and one example. Where is the other proof? You need to add a lot more to this essay. Also, it is very important to capitalize the first letter of every sentence. This is a basic rule in English, and if you don't do it it will make even the best essay seem poorly written.

column1: 508&Teachers should make learning enjoyable and fun for their students.
column3: <IN>It is known to be true that interests are one of the most important things when people learn something. <TS><TR>Therefore</TR>, I agree that the teacher should teach their students as interesting as possible.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, not all students are interested in study, so teacher have to try to make the students who don't like study not to lose their interests in the class.</MI1><SI1> Especially, in elementary school, teachers should make their class enjoyable because if the students lose their interests about study when they are young, they can not recover it easily.</SI1> </BO1> <BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, It is easier to remember or learn something not by general study but by interesting experience.</MI2> <SI2>People recall interesting books easily but they usually forget the contents in the textbooks. That's why teacher should teach their students with fun. Without any excitement they will forget what they learned in class soon.</BO2><BO3><MI3>When I first stated to study English, I learned it from games.</MI3> <SI2><EX>I went to an institute, but I didn't study English focusing on such boring things like grammar, reading etc. I used to play word games or making sentence games with teacher and friends. If someone win the game, they got some prizes such as candies, fancies etc. I was happy whenever I get the prizes so that made me like English and since then, I enjoy studing English.</EX></SI2></BO3><CO><TR>I conclusion</TR>, I think teacher should teach their students with interesting skills.</CO>
column23: This is a good essay! I would suggest combining your second and third paragraphs since they are talking about the same thing.

column1: 509&A company has announced that it wished to build a large factory near your community. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of this new influence on your community : Do you support or oppose the factory? Explain your position.
column3: <IN>Everyone has different preferences when it comes to build a large factory near their community. <TR>In general</TR>, <TR>however</TR>, it is possible to distinguish two major kinds: advantages and disadvantages of establishing a large factory near our town. <TR>In other words</TR>, the former extends employment opportunities and developes the local economy. However, the latter induces the traffic jams and changes our curcumstances.</IN><BO1><MI1>One of the advantages to establishing a lare factory near our town is an increase in employment opportunities.</MI1><SI1><TR> For exemple,</TR> a large factory would need many workers who work in various fields, such as custodians, cleaning men, business men, of course the construction worker who must build all the buildings in the first place. A large factory could offer many jobs. Then, our town where the unemployment rate is quite low could obviously obtain great benefit. Another advantage to having a large foctory is the local economic development. To accommodate more workers, more homes and stores will be establihed. <TR>Also</TR>, The large factory's payroll will be huge, and this amount of cash will be a real boon to our economy.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, the large factory would have several disadvantages.</MI2> <SI2><TR>First</TR>, smog and sewage that the large factory discharge will destroy our town's environment. My town has many lakes and streams. These could be polluted by waste water of the factory. Another problem is that such a numer of workers will probably mean a tremendous increse in automobile traffic. Our town has fairly small streets, and more cars could lead to traffic jams.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>Generally</TR>, people show different attitudes toward establishing a large factory in their community. There are both advantages and disadvantages in this issue. In my opinion, <TS>I believe the disadvantages outweige the advantages. This is because a large factory can cause a pullotion of air and water of our town and lead to traffic jams.</TS> I think most people, including me, will hope that their communities is clean, peaceful, quiet.</CO>
column23: You have written a very good essay. Make sure you put your thesis statement in the introduction and not in the conclusion! Your introduction needs a little reworking - you are saying a lot of things that don't need to be said.

column1: 510&A company has announced that it wished to build a large factory near your community. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of this new influence on your community : Do you support or oppose the factory? Explain your position.
column3: <IN>If building in our community, a large factory can have a new influence on our community. Let me discuss the advantages and disadvantages of this new influence on our community.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, we can expect our community to have robust economic foundation as advantage.</MI1> <SI1>Our community will have a good chance of new employment. <TR>Accordingly</TR>, people in our community will be given an opportunity of making a large amount of money.</SI1></BO1> <BO2><MI2><TR>Second of all</TR>, our community may be seriously polluted due to a large factory.</MI2> <SI2><TR>Thus</TR>, I¡¯d like to discuss ¡®environmental pollution¡¯ as disadvantage. We can not have a good life due to air pollution and polluted water.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, <TS>I oppose the factory. Because I am an environmentalist.</TS> I always think that our community have to be protected from any kinds of pollution. Disadvantages outweight advantages. So I hope that a factory is not built in our community.</CO>
column23: Surely there are more advantages and disadvantages to having a factory in your neighborhood than just two. What other advantages and disadvantages can you think of? Add them to your essay, and give examples! Look for research! In other words, put a little more effort into this essay. Also, you need to put a thesis statement in your introduction. I have indicated a good one in your conclusion.

column1: 511&What are some of the qualities of a good parent?
column3: <IN>People say that the most difficult thing in the world is to be a good parent. Since I know my parent had hard time to raise me well, I definitely agree with that in spite of not having thought about even my marriage or pregnant. Because of its hardness and importance, people always wonder about qualities of good parents and have their opinion about that. <TS><TR>In my view</TR>, to become a good parent needs to have some attributes such as patience, trust and unconditioned love.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>Every good parent has great patience to one¡¯s child.</MI1> <SI1>In general since child need much time to learn something, parent should be patient and repeat the same thing over and over again. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, I started to learn how to use chopsticks, the Asian traditional device used to eat dishes, at three years old, and ended it perfectly at five years old. It means I took many mistakes almost every meal time for two years, and my parents taught me the way to use chopsticks repeatedly over a thousand time.</EX> This kind of things requires endurance a great deal. Personally I think it¡¯s the hardest qualities that I can attain.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Furthermore a good parent must trust in one¡¯s child.</MI2><SI2> Imagine the parents who always have a doubt about their own child and check every routine. Their child can¡¯t stand it, and eventually want to escape from one¡¯s parents. It is reported that most of children do the right thing to please their parents if they are fully trusted. It means I do not have to worry about what if my child behaves badly, but have to encourage and give confidence to my child.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3>The most significant factor of a good parent is unconditioned love.</MI3> <SI3>Of course most parents love their child. However some parents love their child on condition of doing something they expect. <TR>For instance</TR>, my uncle doesn¡¯t even meet his daughter now because she married to a guy he hate. <TR>In my opinion</TR> he isn¡¯t good father though he raise her hardly and gave her good education. A nice parent loves one¡¯s child always, and don¡¯t expect the child only to do things they can be proud of.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In short</TR>, I represent three attributes of a good parent. You need to be patient no matter how irritated you are, trust your child even if you are a litter doubtful, and love him or her always no matter what happens. I know these are very hard to practice. <TR>However </TR>if you want to become a nice parent, you always bear these in mind. I¡¯m sure these are worth to challenge.</CO>
column23: A perfect essay! Great work!

column1: 512&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Playing games teaches us about life. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Yes, playing games teaches us about life. Some people say it is just for fun, not helpful for learning some tips about our life. <TS><TR>However</TR>, I strongly believe playing games is invaluable because it allows us to practice to make strategy for our purpose and we can learn the soul of cooperation by enjoying it.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, playing games allows us to practice to make strategy for our purpose.</MI1> <SI1>During our life, it is desirable to make a plan for some goals. If it were not for plan or goal, we would be likely to spend our time for nothing. <EX></TR>In fact,</TR> after entering university, I did not do a good job in my study, not only major but also liberal arts on the ground that I did not have special dream just waiting until I graduate from university. <TR>Still</TR>, a year ago, I began to study my subjects well because I decided to become a physician at that time.</EX> When we play games, we are supposed to make blueprint to win the game. Expecting what will happen soon, we sometimes change our strategy or make plan to win the game. <TR>Therefore</TR>, playing games provides us exercise to make plan to win our life.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second of all</TR>, we can learn the soul of cooperation by enjoying games.</MI2> <SI2>When we play games, we usually make a team. Belonged to one group, we have to cooperate with our group members to win the game. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, when I participated in a soccer game a few days ago, I tried to explain how to kick the ball well to my friend and heard about my faults from my colleague; it was for strengthening the capacity of our team. During this process, we became more systemic and could win the game.</EX> <TR>Thus</TR>, playing games is priceless enough to spend some time in our life.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, playing games makes us learn good tips; on one hand, it enables us to practice to make a strategy, on the other hand, we can learn the soul of cooperation. How fruitful it is!</CO>
column23: This is a very good essay! My only complaint is that your first example is off-topic. Can you think of a better example?

column1: 513&Many pepole have a close relationship with their pets. These people treat their birds,cats, or other animals as members of their family. In your opinion, are such relationships good? Why or why not? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <BO1><MI1>Some pets usually communicate with people, especially children.</MI1> <SI1>In modern society, many parents, both father and mother, have their own job. In consequence of their overloaded work, they easily set aside their children. So many children leave alone their home. In this situation, pets will replace their parent¡¯s role. <TR>Additionally</TR>, pets can be their friends. A lot of studies supported the function of pet¡¯s psychological remedy. Children who spend their time home need a friend who listens to their story. It considerably helps children¡¯s emotional recovery.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In another case</TR>, pets executed multilateral parts for who can not see.</MI2> <SI2>These people need someone to substitute for their eye¡¯s role. But no one aids them throughout their whole life. <TR>However</TR>, some pets can do it, such as cats or dogs. They help the blinds in many ways. They can find or some places that the blind need to go to. So pets make the qualities of people¡¯s life more valuable.</SI2></BO2><CO>According to these results, the relationship with pets is crucial to us. It¡¯s obvious that pets re one of family. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I repeatedly insist that pets give us good affections.</CO>
column23: This is a great essay except that there is no introduction or thesis statement. Was this a copy-and-paste mistake? Also, try rewording your second main point - it is not very clear.

column1: 514&A company has announced that it wishes to build a large factory near your community. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of this new influence on your community. Do you support or oppose the factory? Explain your position.
column3: <IN>With the development of the industry, building a variety of factories around our surroundings is becoming a familiar phenomenon. While in some areas, the ¡°NIMBY¡± slogan was prevailed against construction of factories, in other destitute areas, building industrial facilities could be beneficial to the improvement of their lives. <TS><TR>However,</TR> I oppose the factory since the side-effects are prodigious.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, erecting factories could create a huge number of employments and bring the economic boost of community in many ways.</MI1><SI1> As the factory is being built, the influx of population is anticipated. <TR>Also</TR>, with the increase of population to find jobs, residential area will expand. <TR>Therefore,</TR> commercial area would be spread to suffice the dwellers¡¯ needs. <TR>As a result</TR>, the life in the community will be more convenient than ever before.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, the building of factories near my community could ruin some parts of my life.</MI2> <SI2>Industrial facilities not only do contaminate the air, but also destroy the whole environment. <TR>Accordingly</TR>, our health will get worse on account of the pollution of the water and air. <TR>Moreover,</TR> our ordinary lives would be disturbed remarkedly by the din from the factories. <TR>Besides</TR>, traffic jam resulted from expansion of a city could influence on our daily lives in a negative way.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I¡¯m inclined to oppose a scheme of building a factory near my habitat since my community has developed to some extent. What I think as a priority is not for quality of life to be threatened but the maintenance of my health and incessant improvement of quality of life.</CO>
column23: This is a pretty good essay, but you are using too many transitions. As a rule, if you use a transition in 3 sentences in a row, that is too many. Take a few out. Also, be very certain that the vocabulary you're using is being used correctly. It is better to be clear than clever.

column1: 515&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Universities should give the same amount of money to their students¡¯ sports activities as they give to their university libraries. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN><TR>In my position</TR>, university is not a place solely for studying, but a place that should provide various opportunities to improve students¡¯ knowledge and enhance their interest. <TS><TR>Therefore</TR>, I agree with this statement since for universities to give the same amount of money to their students sports activities as they do to their university libraries would be helpful in the aspect of students and in terms of universities themselves.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>The most important reason for my position is that expanding sports facilities could bring about positive effects to students.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Above all</TR>, improvement of efficiency in studying can be anticipated since adequate stamina obtained from sports activities is the vital factor in maintaining constant studying. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> in my high school days¡¯ experience, after keeping working out, I got to concentrate much better on my studying than when I didn¡¯t.</EX> <TR>Moreover</TR>, students can form various relationships with others through a variety of sports activities. Rather than just having a relationship with their seniors or juniors in major, as making new acquaintances of other majors, students can widen their human relations and broaden their horizons.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, in a point of universities¡¯ view, they can expect to earn more reputations through expanding their students¡¯ sports activities.</MI2> <SI2><EX><TR>In my case</TR>, despite the fact that I didn¡¯t know any name of American universities, after watching NBA draft every year, I got to memorize some universities¡¯ names automatically.</EX><TR> In other words</TR>, with the nurture of good players due to increase in investment on students¡¯ sports activities, universities not only do make good results at sports competition, but also enhance their popularity all over the country, even all over the world. <TR>Accordingly</TR>, much more students could be attracted to those universities.</SI2></BO2><CO>I¡¯m definitely inclined to the idea that universities should invest on expanding their sports activities. Regarding the compound influence of improvement of students¡¯ physical strength and indirect publicity effect through sports teams, development of universities would be explosive.</CO>
column23: This is a very good essay, but try to use fewer transitions. As a rule, if you use a transition in 3 sentences in a row, that is too many.

column1: 516&It is sometimes said that borrowing money from a friend can harm or damage the friendship. Do you agree? Why or why not? Use reasons and specific examples to explain your answer.
column3: <IN>We often see money and friendship don't go together. Friendship is involved with sincerity and fidelity. However, money is rather businesslike.<TS>Friendship involved in money is easy to be broken.</TS> Here are some reasons.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, money is rather businesslike. On the other hand, friendship is more about personal faith between friends.</MI1><SI1> No matter how scanty amount of money you ask of your friend to lend you, it is easy to bring some trouble to the friendship of yours. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, when I forgot the fact that I'd borrowed some money from one of my best friends, my friend was really upset. She couldn't ask me to give the money back because she didn't want to be cheap to me. She told that to another friend of mine and I heard that from her. I was pretty cross with the fact that she¡¯d told someone else rather than me directly though I acknowledged that I had and felt sorry to her. We didn't talk to each other for a while and never asked for money again.</EX></SI1><BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Sometimes</TR>, borrowing money from your friend can cause him to get in serious financial problem.</MI2> <SI2>When your friend is afflicted by a serious money problem, you can easily get sympathetic to your friend and try to find out the way to help him. <EX>A friend of mine got on a serious credit card debt because her friend. My friend was still a student and supported by her parents. Her friend didn't even have any place to stay nor money because she lost everything when her father's company went under during the Korean economy crisis. My friend was sorry about that and she started to lend money to her. First time, it didn't seem a lot but she found that she had used her card too much after her friend vanished. My friend was almost dying.Finally, her father got to know that and he solved the problem, but now she hates even thinking about her because she thinks she was exploited by her own friend.</EX></SI2><CO>Money is what we should be most careful of when involved in friendship. To keep your precious friendship, you need to be clear about money with your friends, otherwise you'd better relinquish the money you lent to your friends if the friendship is so important to you.</CO>
column23: This is a very good essay! The last sentence of your second main paragraph is in your conclusion, but I assume that is an editing error. Make sure to look over your essay before you submit it!

column1: 517&What do you want most in a friend-someone who is intelligent, or someone who has a sense of humor, or someone who is reliable? Which one of these characteristics is most important to you? Use reasons and specific examples to explain your choice.
column3: <IN>It is known to be true that each people has a different characteristic; <TR>however</TR>, you give a priority on some character when you make a friend. Some people want a friend who is smart while others need a freind who is responsible. <TS>In my case, I would like to have a reliable freind because of privacy and cooperation.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, reliability is important for me to keep a secret.</MI1> <SI1>None of us can tell their clandestine to the person who is not trustful. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, I have a old friend whom I tell the story of my trivial. I have believed he doesn't say anything connected my things to others. I notice , <TR>however</TR> , the fact that he have been revealing them to a number of his friends; so I am really disappointed with him.</EX> <TR>Therefore</TR>, I desperately need a reliable friend keeping my secrets.</SI1> </BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second of all</TR>, it is reliability that I can cooperate with my colleague in a working place.</MI2> <SI2>Not can we work with people who are untrustful. <TR>For instance</TR>, I have been working as a team maneager in KTF since 2000. So, I have dealt with a lot of things with my team members. If I can't believe the members, I can't succeed many team projects for 3 years. <TR>Similarly</TR>, it is crucial for me to have a reliable friend.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I think having a reliable friend is the most meaningful thing because of two reasons: first, privacy ; second, cooperation. If I have an opportunity to make a friend I will not hesitate to choose one whose character is trustworthy.</CO>
column23: This is a pretty good essay! I think you could add a little more to your main paragraphs, but you have done well.

column1: 518&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Television has destroyed communication among friends and family. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN><TS>I completely agree the statement that television has destroyed communication among friends and family.</TS> Some people might think television might don¡¯t harm to communicate. In my opinion, TV deprives people of time to talk because people would like to spend most their time watching TV.<TR> Moreover,</TR> TV could limit their interests. Through the use of a couple of example and specific explanation, I will show you why I think like that.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, Television deprives family of their time to talk each other.</MI1> <SI1>When we watch television, we only focus on TV and don¡¯t want to be disturbed by anyone. <TR>Usually</TR>, persons who like to watch television, turn on the TV when they have time unconsciously.<EX> I couldn¡¯t talk a lot with my father because he always faced on TV when he had time.</EX> Television takes away the time we can share with family and friends.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, television confines our talk to the programs we like.</MI2> <SI2>People who like watching TV always talk about same topics with related to the program. <TR>Moreover</TR>, they don¡¯t want to take care of other subjects and matters such as playing sports, reading books and so on. <EX>When I was young, one of my friends didn¡¯t want to talk with me because I didn¡¯t know her favorite TV program. She always talked about same topic with friends.</EX> Television makes people¡¯s interests limited.</SI2></BO2><CO>Based on the above mentioned statements, it can be concluded that television destroy communication among family and friends. We could get some advantage from watching TV but we should consider the disadvantage at first. Television destroys our time to talk with family and in addition it confines our concerns to the limited subject.</CO>
column23: An excellent essay! Good work!

column1: 520&You have been told that dormitory rooms at your university must be shared by two students. Would you rather have the university assign a student to share a room with you, or would you rather choose your own roommate? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
column3: <IN>Considering a choice of a dormitory roommate, some people say that they would rather choose their roommate, while others take reverse positions and prefer not to select a roommate themselves. To be assigned or to choose a roommate has its own advantages and disadvantages. <TS><TR>However</TR>, I prefer to be assigned because I believe that the advantages surpass the disadvantages.</TS> At a glance, the disadvantages such as possibility of personal conflict from difference is really discouraging. But I still want to abandon my chance to choose my roommate, because selecting is difficult, I can learn something new, and I can have a chance to broaden my interpersonal relationship.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, selecting process is not so easy.</MI1> <SI1>There are so many students in dorm, maybe. Only a few of them can we know precisely, so it is impossible to make a best decision without detail information about all of them. <TR>Moreover</TR>, if I can choose my roommate, other students should be allowed to do in the same way. In this situation, even though I make a decision to share a room with one student, there is possibility that she wants other than me. Maybe it will be extremely difficult to satisfy preferences of all students.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Next</TR>, we can learn something new from a roommate who is quite different from us.</MI2> <SI2>We are likely to choose one who is same as us in many aspects if we have a right to decide. <TR>However</TR>, we can learn more from one who is different than one who is similar to us. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> when I was in dorm as a freshman, my roommate was neat and tidy person unlike me. After I share the room with her, I changed my lazy habit and clean and trim my room everyday.</EX></SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Finally</TR>, we can broaden our personal relationship.</MI2> <SI2>Though it would be uneasy and uncomfortable to live with stranger, after break the ice, you will have another good friend. <EX>In my case,<TR> for instance,</TR> I went to China last summer for volunteer work and I couldn't choose my room and roommates.<TR> At first</TR>, I didn't like the alloted results and my roommates, and it was not easy to get along with them. <TR>However</TR>, working and living together, my three roommates and I became very good friends and keep in touch after comeback to homeland.</EX></SI2></BO3><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I prefer not to choose my roommate because of difficulty in selecting process, opportunity to learn new things, and chance to make more new friends. <TR>In my opinion,</TR> freedom is not always good and random selecting sometimes can make a great influential event to our life.</CO>
column23: This is a great essay! Excellent work! You start to use a few too many transitions toward the end, but otherwise you have done a really great job.

column1: 521&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Television has destroyed communication among friends and family. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>Basically I disagree with the position that television has destroyed communication among friends and family.<TR> As a matter of fact</TR>, <TS>I believe that television promote our communication with friends or family.</TS> There are two reasons to support this perspective. TV, one of the mass media, provides us with many conversational sources and bridges the generation gap between parents and chilren. Here are some detailed examples.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, TV couldn't interrupt communication among friends and family because, in its characteristic, it provides us not with a sense of alienation but with conversational sources.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Nowadays</TR>, television programs are various in several subjects such as political issues, economic problems and ordinaries. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, when economic depression occurred in my country, I had seriously talked with my family and friends about my job. They advised me to work harder than before. As this occation, TV provide us with a various conversational sources.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second of all</TR>, television education programs could bridge or reduce the generation gap between parents and children.</MI2> <SI2><TR>For example,</TR> if parents would watch sex education program with their own children, they could share with each other's thought and their fixed ideas could throw away and then their gap is able to reduce more and more. Finally they would be offered a chance talking with each other.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>As stated above</TR>, I hold the opinion that it is unreasonable that television has interrupted communication among family and friends. There are two reasons for this: conversational sources and reduction of the generation gap. <TR>Therefore</TR>, this is why I disagree with the above statement.</CO>
column23: A very good essay! Nice work!

column1: 522& Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? People behave differently when they wear different clothes. Do you agree that different clothes influence the way people behave? Use specific examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>There are various opinions whether people behave differently when they put on different clothes. Some people say that clothes have a effect on people's behavior while others argue that clothes is not related to the way people behavior. <TR>In my opinion</TR>, <TS>I hold the opinion that the people's behavior can be changed according to their clothes because of its mental and physical aspects.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, people's metal attitude could be changed by different clothes.</MI1> <SI1><TR>For example</TR>, adolescence is exposed on many attractiveness that make a difficulty to study with tenacity. However if we impose them to put on school uniform, they is able to avoid attactiveness. Accoding to statistical research, the juvenile delinquency of student without uniform is twice higher that that of student with uniformity. In this manner, I agree the argument that people's metal attitude influences their behavior makes it pausible.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, people's physical attitude could be changed according to clothes.</MI2> <SI2><TR>For example,</TR> people with more expensive clothes shows careful behavior. Manufacture producing expensive clothes argue that their clothes have longer lifetime compared with cheap clothes. <EX>Recently, by credible researching company, this advertizing reveals true fact.</EX> <TR>In this respect</TR>, I agree clothes can also influence their physical attitude.</BO2><CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, I agree the argument that people can differently behave when they wear different clothes because people shows different behavior in aspects of physical and mental as seen above exaples. Therefore I think the clothes can use to control human behavior.</CO>
column23: Your essay is good, but not great. Your second example is not worth putting in. Who are the reliable resources? We can't just take your word for it. Your points are good enough, but you need to add more support to make them better. Also, I have indicated what your thesis statement SHOULD be. Take out the transition in front of it - you don't have to say you have an opinion twice in a row.

column1: 523&Some students prefer to study alone. Others prefer to study with a group of students. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>These days, many students have to study much more than ever before. And these students hope that they could finish quickly a lot of study, homework, lab report in an effective method. <TR>Therefore</TR>, whether study with a group of students or study alone is an important issue among students. Some students prefer to study with a group of students because of discussing each other and collecting many opinions. But, unfortunately, they miss more pluses to study alone. <TS>So, I think that study alone is better than study with a group of students in two reasons that promote the power of concentration on study and make it possible to memorize something for a long time that already studied.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, study alone is good for heightening the power of concentration on study.</MI1> <SI1>If some students study with a group of students, they might be talked with each other and decreased definitely the efficiency of study. <TR>Moreover,</TR> AC Nielsen, one of the famous research companies, reported recently that self-studies more helpful to promote the efficiency of concentration than group studies. <EX><TR>Indeed</TR>, I had experience that we studied with a group of 5 students in our mid-term exam periods. I think it was very funny and helpful to prepare the exams in that time but actually we could not much attention on our works and failed the exams. Then, I prepared the next exams alone and got better degrees.</EX> So, from my point of view study alone is truly the best study method.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, another attractive point of studying alone is that it should be best method to memorize something such as study subject, contents etc.</MI2> <SI2>The only students had been stayed up late studying alone, just say that completing the study thoroughly in their hearts. <EX>In my cases, my friend and me prepared the math test last years and we solved math problems in turns. That was very fast method to complete the math study and we satisfied with our group study method. But, actually, I finished the math exams, then I found that the degree of math was so terrible. Because I could not remember that my friend solved.</EX> If somebody helps with your study, you do not study yet.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, studying alone is best for me such as heightening the power of concentration on study and remembering longer that you studied already. Moreover students could collect many students¡¯ opinions through the internet, which is advantage of group study. <TR>As shown above</TR>, I prefer to study alone and I think it is best way.</CO>
column23: A perfect essay! Great work!

column1: 524&It has recently been announced that a new high school may be built in your community. Do you support or oppose this plan? Why? Use specific reasons and details in your answer.
column3: <IN>Issues that concern about education are very difficult and important, thus people have always think about these problems. <TS>If a high school would be built in my community, I would not hesitate to say that I support this announcement in that a high school help our community's chileren have good minds and help the community's economic developments.</TS></IN> <BO1><MI1>The first reason for this is that children would grow up with positive thoughts.</MI1> <SI1>Our children will always see high school students and teachers and learn their activities. At the school zone, the students and teachers take care of their behavior. <TR>In this manner,</TR> our children would affect with positive mind from the high school's people.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, Building a high school could help our community's economic developments.</MI2><SI2> Maybe, poeple will also build fast food restarants, office supply stores, libraries for students. Then our community's economy will activate and cour town's people will gain more income and this help them live better lives.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I support this plan building a new school for community's children and economy. Schools not only foster safe enviroments but also help to create better economic society.</CO>
column23: Your essay is all right, but it is a little weak in some places. Your first paragraph is weak all around. Your main point is sort of flowery, and your support is idealized. Your second main point is better, but your support of it is again wishful thinking. Maybe someone will build more shops around the high school, but there's no guarantee that will happen. The high school itself can help economically - can you explain how?

column1: 525&Some people prefer to live in a small town. Others prefer to live in a big city. Which place would you prefer to live in? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Whether living in a small town or a big town sometimes becomes an interesting issue among people. The choice could be made in diverse ways. <TS><TR>As for me</TR>, I am of the opinion that a big city is more useful than a small town.</TS> There are two reasons that make my view convincing. This is because a big city endlessly involves a great of cultural events and also is furnished with a convenient transportation system. Here are some detailed examples.</IN> <BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, in the capacity, a big city is better than a small town and it has a various cultural events and is full up with inquisitive adventures.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Otherwise</TR>, a small town is very boresome. I enjoy seeing a wonderful masterpieces. Maybe such things sequently tend to be exhibited at a big town than a small town. <TR>For that reason</TR>, I want to live in a big city.</MI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second of all</TR>, a big city had a convenient transportation system and its system has been built from center to edge in the city.</MI2> <SI2>So if I live in a small town and want to visit other towns, I must go to other towns via a big city. It's so terrible. Oppositely if I live in a big town, I would be able to trip anywhere. So I obsolutely want to dwell in a big city for a long time</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>As shown above,</TR> I prefer to live in a big town than a small town. There are two reasons for this: the container of both cultural events and transportation system. This is why I prefer to live in there.</CO>
column23: Your essay is all right, but you rely a lot on your own opinion rather than a good logical argument. I know that this is supposed to be an opinion essay, but that doesn't mean you can just say "living in a small town in boring" without giving evidence. You are trying to convince the reader that your opinion is the best one through a logical argument.

column1: 526&Do you agree or disagree with following statement? All students should be required to study art and music in high school. Give specific reasons to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>In Korea, most of high school students do not spend their time for studying music and art, because they should take a certain test, which does not include music and art, to go to universities or colleges. This test is one of the most important purposes for students to study in their high school. <TR>However</TR>, considering many other respects, I think it is very disadvantageous for them.</IN><BO1><MI1>During high school student, people learn not only knowledge to improve their intellectual abilities, but also a lot of things very important for enhancing their personalities.</MI1> <SI1>I think students can increase emotional power from art and music classes. Nowadays, EQ is regarded as one of crucial factors to evaluate people. This shows that this society needs people who have good personalities, not a super computer: a man who has only smart brain is not better than a super computer.</SI1></BO1><BO2><SI2><EX><TR>In addition</TR>, when I was a high school student, I was a member of an art circle. Before participating in the circle, I was a very capricious and nitpick person. During drawing pictures, I could pacify my mind and control myself. <TR>As a result,</TR> I became a mild and temperate woman.</EX> I think music has very similar effect, because many people can feel comfortable when they hear melodious music.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3>The period of high school is very important for every people, since they can improve their social personalities and intellectual abilities.</MI3> Of course I understand that many student want to go to university and they should concentrate on the study, especially mathematics, English, physics and so on, for getting good score on the test. However I wish they recognize that the test is not all for themselves. There are more important things for strengthen their personalities and emotional power.</BO3><CO><TR>In conclusion<TR>, I think student can get a lot of advantages from music and art classes. <TR>Therefore</TR> I strongly believe that they should study both of them, and I encourage they do not study and just enjoy music and art classes.</CO>
column23: Your essay is good, but it needs some restructuring. First of all, your third main paragraph reads like a second introduction. Either make it your introduction or take it out - you are not making a debatable point, you are just giving your opinion. Next, your second main paragraph needs a main idea. While your supporting ideas are good, you can make them better. Can you find any evidence to back up your claims?

column1: 527&Neighbors are the people who live near us. In your opinion, what are the qualities of a good neighbor? Use specific details and examples in your answer.
column3: <IN>There are various opinions what are important qualities of a good neighbor. Some poeple say that neighbor should keep other neighbor's privacy while others argue that they should have a spirit of cooperation with other neighbor. <TS><TR>In my opinion</TR>, the quality of a good neighbor should be evaluated with two aspects of their sociability and considering neighbors with difficult situation.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>The first of all</TR>, a good neighbor should have a sociability because we have an advantage of learning various experiences through the neighbor. </MI1> <SI1><TR>Generally</TR>, the neighbor with a sociability has many kinds of friends, and can introduce me their's friends. <TR>In fact</TR>, my sociability has been cultivated by the friends. <TR>Forthermore</TR>, I am continuously expandind the range of my life with their interpersonal relationship. <TR>In this manner</TR>, I prefer to choose the neighbor with a sociability.</SI1> </BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>The second of all</TR>, a good neighbor could consider other neighbors with difficult situation.</MI2> <SI2><EX><TR>For example,</TR> when my father was dead 5 years ago due to car accident, it is very difficult to prepare funeral ceremony because I have not a relative. However my good neighbors cordially help me, as a result, I could finish the all ceremonies very well.</EX> <TR>Thereafter</TR>, I convince that one of the most important conditions of a good neighbor is heart of considering neighbor with trouble situation. </SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, if I have a chance to choose the conditions of a good neighbor, I do not hesitate to choose neighbors with sociability and heart of considering other neighbors with difficult situation as shown examples.</CO>
column23: This is a very well-written essay, except for one thing: in your first main paragraph, you use too many transitions. As a rule, if you have a transition in three sentences in a row, you are using too many.

column1: 528&It has recently been announced that a new high school may be built in your community. Do you support or oppose this plan? Why? Use specific reasons and details in your answer.
column3: <IN>Issues that concern about education are very difficult and important, thus people have always think about these problems. <TS>If a high school would be built in my community, I would not hesitate to say that I support this announcement in that a high school help our community's chileren have good minds and help the community's economic developments.</TS></IN> <BO1><MI1>The first reason for this is that children would grow up with positive thoughts.</MI1> Our children will always see high school students and teachers and learn their activities. At the school zone, the students and teachers take care of their behavior. <TR>In this manner,</TR> our children would affect with positive mind from the high school's people.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, Building a high school could help our community's economic developments.</MI2><SI2> Maybe, poeple will also build fast food restarants, office supply stores, libraries for students. Then our community's economy will activate and cour town's people will gain more income and this help them live better lives.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I support this plan building a new school for community's children and economy. Schools not only foster safe enviroments but also help to create better economic society.</CO>
column23: Your essay is all right, but it is a little weak in some places. Your first paragraph is weak all around. Your main point is sort of flowery, and your support is idealized. Your second main point is better, but your support of it is again wishful thinking. Maybe someone will build more shops around the high school, but there's no guarantee that will happen. The high school itself can help economically - can you explain how?

column1: 529&You have received a gift of money. The money is enough to buy either a piece of jewelry you like or tickets to a concert you want to attend. Which would you buy? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Each person may have many ways to take pleasure in something. When a man, who likes to eating, enter the restaurant, he feel happy. A woman, who is interested in taking a photographs, will be enjoy traveling a place of scenic beauty. According to the individual view of value, man's joy and the way of taking it are vary. <TS>If I have received a gift of money that is enough to buy either a piece of jewelry or tickets to a concert, then I will choose concert ticket.</TS></IN><BO1>As you may know, each person have difference vision of value. So jewelry-loving person may choose jewelry. <MI1><TR>In my case</TR>, I shall select concert ticket because I prefer spiritual and long lasting happiness.</MI1> <SI1>The reason why I choose concert ticket is following. <TR>First of all</TR>, the concert that I want to attend is not given every time.<TR> For example</TR>, the concert 'Micheal Jackson And Friends' was held in 1999. My country was suffered very hard financial difficulties at that time. So many people blamed that magnificent and high-priced concert. <TR>Moreover,</TR> I failed in that year's college entrance exams and was preparing for the next chance personally. Thus I couldn't go the concert for this and that reason.</SI1></BO1> <BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, the concert have more attractive than jewelry in aspect of impressionable durability.</MI2> <SI2>Of course, famous jewelry company Debeers advertise their catchphrase "Diamonds is forever". But I think it is not always effective. No matter how beauty a diamond may be, it is very difficult to feel happy whenever a person see his diamond. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, the pleasure by the great concert is perpetually recollect ,but nevertheless it is just once. we call that experience memories.</SI2></BO2><CO>I couldn't attend Micheal jackson's concert in 1999. But my favorite guitarist "Yngwie Malmsteen" will come and hold the concert in 2003. No one could guarantee his concert will be again in the Korea someday. And the excitement through his playing will be long lasting remembrance to me. Perhaps some day, someone will be generous enough to give me a gift of money so that I may buy the concert tickets of my dreams.</CO>
column23: Most of your essay is very good, but your first main paragraph is weak. I really had to search for your main point. There isn't much that is relevant to the subject in that first paragraph. Try to go off of your main point - why is going to a concert longer-lasting than a piece of jewelry? Stick to the subject.

column1: 530&In general, people are living longer now. Discuss the causes of this phenomenon. Use specific reasons and details to develop your essay.
column3: <IN>In Korea, people customarily have celebrated a person's 60th birthday to congratulate his or her longevity since a long time ago. Although the custom exists now, its meaning about longevity changed as a standard of human being's life span became longer. <TS>Why people are living longer than before? I believe that is a result of medical development, better nutrition, and cleaner living condition.</TS><IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, development of medical technology makes people live longer.</MI1> <SI1>I watched the medical drama, <TR>for example</TR>, which described the life and career of a famous Korean doctor who lived 150 years ago. Not only was the medical skill undeveloped, but also there were few doctors in his time. In this circumstance, it was no wonder that people easily died of what today's people think trivial diseases. In today, <TR>however,</TR> with remarkable progress in medical science, people can live with less terror about disease.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Next</TR>, better nutrition helps people's longevity.</MI2> <SI2>According to the survey that was conducted in Social Welfare Department, Seoul University, the third cause of people's death in the 1600's was starvation, following the age and disease. Today's society, <TR>however,</TR> can provide people more and better provision and nutrition, so there are fewer people who die because there is nothing to eat.</SI2></BO2><BO3><BO3><TR>Finally</TR>, cleaner living condition works for people's longer life duration.</MI3> <SI3>In middle ages, for instance, the public health and hygiene was so bad that there was the Black Death, which is a lethal disease. In modern times, <TR>however</TR>, the living condition is improved more than before, so there are fewer diseases that outbreak due to bad hygiene condition.</SI3></BO3> <CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, life expectation is getting longer, because of the improvement in medical science, better nutrition, and clean living condition. The more civilization progresses, the longer we will be able to live, I think.</CO>
column23: You have written an excellent essay! Good work!

column1: 531&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? It is better for children to grow up in the countryside than in a big city. Use specific reasons and examples to develop your essay.
column3: <IN>In the process of social and economic development, many people want to live in urban and big city more than in the countryside. I think the one of the reason is the well-developed education and environment for their children. <TS><TR>In my opinion,</TR> <TR>however</TR>, children raised in the countryside have another benefits because of natural and stable environment there.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, children in the countryside can be familiar with nature more than those in a big city.</MI1> <SI1>I¡¯ve heard there were some students in Seoul, the capital of Korea, who confused grains with trees. Those who are in a big city sometimes have to experience nature of many kinds through only picture or TV. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, you can see and feel a variety of the features of nature in the countryside and know about the mystery of nature more.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, children in the country are likely to grow up to be mild and humble people.</MI2> <SI2>Children who are exposed to nature learn about the rules of it and these things remind them of his limitations and make them polite more. <TR>Actually</TR>, we often realize our weakness through nature. The Korean proverb says that the more grain grows, the more it bends.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I surveyed two advantages that children who are in nature can enjoy. The children in the city are likely to experience only artificial things such as building, TV, road and computer and there are not various chances to have contact with nature. Man, <TR>however,</TR> absolutely turn back to nature after death. I think that knowing nature is the essential process of our children¡¯s life and make our children¡¯s lives more plentiful.</CO>
column23: I liked your essay, but I think you need to add a little more to it. Your first and second main paragraphs sound like you could put them together - "Children learn about nature and thus become more mild and humble people." This is a good point, so I suggest you combine them and come up with a new second main paragraph. There are a lot of reasons you can choose from. The one I hear the most is that the environment is cleaner. One more thing: take out ONE of the transitions in your thesis statement. Both together are unnecessary.

column1: 532&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? It is better to make the wrong decision than to make no decision at all. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>We are faced with a variety of choices and sometimes make a wrong decision. Some people are afraid of it, which don¡¯t make any decision because many people regard it as a failure. <TS><TR>In my opinion</TR>, <TR>however</TR>, when you try to make some decisions-even if it may be wrong-you will know that there are some benefits come from it.</TS> </IN><BO1><MI1>More than ever before, you can make a further decision in the same situation next time because you have already experienced it.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>For example</TR>, a brother of mine who is a manager of a company have made a false decision, due to the result of this, he and all employees suffered trials of many kinds. They, however, tried to overcome the situation and find out why this caused problems. They finally escaped from the crisis and after that, never made a mistake in the same situation. A brother of mine said to me that through the process of trial and error, you are able to make an appropriate decision. </EX>Korean proverb says that failure is a mother of success.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, you can learn a lot of things through previous experiences.</MI2> <SI2>You will know something new you have never knew before. In my view, when makes a wrong decision, one can always learn a variety of things and the knowledge will be a big help in various situations when one try to accomplish something.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Lastly</TR>, you can learn how to make a quick and shrewd decision.</MI3> <SI3>We are living in the world which requires speed and accuracy. These days when the internet is growing rapidly, making no decision means wasting of time. We need to develop our insight and speed through challenging against various choices so that we may survive in the competition of many kinds.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, were it not for any failure, I think it is impossible to always make a perfect decision. Although we make a wrong decision, through the result and the experience, we can have benefits and more careful about the same problem and our insight and speed of making a decision will be increased. I suggest you have many chances to make a decision and try it without fear of failure so that you may succeed to make the same decision next time. Then, I think you will be more mature than when you don't make any decision.</CO>
column23: This is a good essay. Take one of the transitions out of your thesis statement - you don't need both. Your first and second main paragraphs seem like they are too similar to be separated. Can you combine them?

column1: 533&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? A person's childhood years (the time from birth to twelve years of age) are the most important years of a person's life. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Yes, I really agree that a person¡¯s childhood years are the most important years of a person¡¯s life. Some people say childhood is just their memories. These people believe that their childhood years do not have a lot of meanings through their whole life. Unfortunately, they miss many advantages, which have many meaningful aspects in people¡¯s life. <TS><TR>Therefore</TR> I strongly agreed this opinion because people¡¯s personality was formed, and a vocational attitude is developed during this period.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, I think most people¡¯s personality is formed during their childhood.</MI1> <SI1>It¡¯s known to be true it is impossible to change his or her characteristic when he or she already grown up. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, my friend is a very taciturn person since I met him 20 years ago. He tried to change his characteristic and had a lot of efforts for a long time. But he still can¡¯t improve the bad side of his personality then just say to me ¡°I can¡¯t change my weakness because my characteristic has been stuck to like this from my childhood years!¡± </EX>It is true that people¡¯s personality was already formed in their childhood life.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Next</TR>, people¡¯s vocational attitude is determined by their childhood.</MI2> <SI2>Young people have a lot of dreams what he or she will when he or she is young. A famous research company Recently reports that most people would decide their job from 5 to 10 year old. It really has very important meaning and based on this report I agreed this opinion.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, most people had experienced in forming their personality and increasing a professional ability when they were young. All things above reason, I strongly agree with these opinions that a person¡¯s childhood years are the most important years of a person¡¯s life. Indeed, the memory of childhood years is most valuable memory of all memories.</CO>
column23: This is a good essay. Your second main paragraph needs some more explanation, though. Continue from the research with examples.

column1: 534&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? It is better to make the wrong decision than to make no decision at all. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>There are several ways to make a decision. Let'us suppose that we are wondering to way in the humble wood without any food. There are only two roads to escape from this danger. which is better choice? <TS>I agree it is better to make no decision at all than to make the wrong decision.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, if we make the wrong decision in one side, it is very difficult to change the direction toward right road.</MI1> <SI1>To rectify the wrong decision, we must pay too much time in terms of opportunity cost. Someone usually says "time is money". That is why to insist worning beginning to wrong decision.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, as soon as we start to wrong way. It is needless to says that there could be unexpected situation.</MI2> In deplating food or water, wild animals may attack out team who were very harsh.</BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Thirdly</TR>, to make no decision at all means to have various probability case by case.</MI3> <SI3>The more probabilty can finally give the better choice to make a right decision.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, it would be wiser choice to make no decision at all rather than wrong decision. From wrong ways, we can enough guess the exhaustion of cost and trial to encounter to worse situation. <TR>In addition</TR>, nothing to make decision may be beinfit. Because many other solutions may appear to help right decision. It is more harmful to make a decision at first. Among Korean maxim, "knock a stone bridge before starting" , so we can infer it is more useful to be cautious than to start in advance.</CO>
column23: Your essay is good and has the potential to be very strong. There are a few things that need fixing. First, your thesis statement is misleading. Change "agree" to "believe" and it will be better. The first sentence of your conclusion would also make a good thesis statement. Next, you need to defend your main points a little more, especially your second one. The sentence that follows your second main point has nothing to do with the general argument; you need to follow with three or four sentences of good, solid evidence. Otherwise, this essay looks very good.

column1: 535&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? It is better to make the wrong decision than to make no decision at all. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>We make a decision every moment in our life. Sometimes, the decision we made may have a significant influences on our future. <TS>because I think the decisions we make every day is the most important things in our life, I disagree that It is better to make the wrong decision than to make no decision at all.</TS> Let me explain the specific reasons and examples.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, the wrong decision can cause terrible results that can not be repeated.</MI1> <SI1><EX>My brother, <TR>for example</TR>, decided to have drugs in his high school days. Although my father scolded him very severely, he didn¡¯t follow my father¡¯s advice. Recently he regret that he had drug. He frequently undergoes hardships such as hallucinations.</EX> The wrong decision lead to terrible results</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, the reserved decision frequently become unexpected fotune called serendipity.</MI2> <SI2>I reserved my decision to buy a expensive jacket last year. a while later, the price of the jacket dropped steeply due to deflation, so I made a lot profits.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, because the beneficial effects of reserving decisions on our life can not be ignored, I am not in favor of the wrong decision than no decision.</CO>
column23: Your essay is pretty good. I'm afraid the wording of your main points is a little confusing. Your first main paragraph is quite good, but your second one isn't convincing. Sure, maybe something will happen, but that's not a good enough reason not to make a decision. Can you think of a stronger reason why a bad decision is worse than no decision at all?

column1: 536&Some people prefer to eat at food stands or restaurants. Other people prefer to prepare and eat food at home. Which do you prefer?
column3: <IN><TS>Although many people prefer to cook at home, I prefer to eat ou. Eating out allows me to spend time and effort on my academic studies instead of in the kitchen.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, I don't know how to cook.</MI1> <SI1>When you don't know how to cook, there is a good chance that what you cook will not be worth of eating. This results in a waste of food, as well as a waste of money and effot. </SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Also</TR>, cooking takes a lot of time.</MI2> <SI2>While the food might not actually be on the stove for very long, you also have to consider the time that is spent shopping for food, cleaning and chopping it, and cleaning up the kitchen after it is cooked.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Finally,</TR> eating out is surprisingly economical.</MI3> <SI2>Of course going to elegant restaurants is expensive, but there are other ways to eat out. Food stands and some small, casual restaurant provides plenty of good food for very little cost. Many places of this type are located near the university and are very convenient for students.</SI3></BO3><CO>As my life changes, my preferences about where to eat may change, too. For the life of a student, eating out is the only practical choice.</CO>
column23: This is a humorous and honest essay. Nice work! Add a little more to your conclusion and a few examples and it will be even better.

column1: 537&Some people prefer to live in a small town. Others prefer to live in a big city. Which place would you prefer to live in? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Some want to live in a small town, while others stay in a big city. <TS>I prefer to live in a big city for the following reasons; the city enables us to have a cultural life, moreover, it gives us many chances such as education, job, etc., finally, it make us get more information easily.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, we can enjoy participating in cultural performances such as movie, opera, concert, and so on.</MI1><SI1><EX> I, <TR>for example</TR>, live in Seoul, capital in South Korea, while my uncle in a countryside. Thanks to the location, I can enjoy many cultural things such as movie, play, etc., although my uncle can not.</EX> </SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore</TR>, the city gives us many kinds of chances of education, job, hobby, etc.</MI2> <SI2><TR>For example</TR>, many people of South Korea want to come to Seoul to go to universities in Seoul, that is, big city. Becaues most of top schools in Korea are located in Seoul, and everyone knows the being situated in Seoul gives many advantages.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Moreover</TR>, the big city let us get much information easily.</MI3><SI3> There are many kinds of organizations and ficilities that give informatoin, which can be pretty important to someone, in a big city. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, when I was freshman, I wanted to have information about the food of France. <TR>Fortunately</TR>, thanks to the french cultural center located in Seoul, I could have the information I needed.</EX></SI3></BO3><CO><TR>Therefore</TR>, I would like to live in a big cities, since we can enjoy our cultural life in a big city, since it gives us many kinds of chances of education, job, hobby, etc., and since the big city makes us have much inforamtion, which we need, more easily comparing a small town. So I would like to say that a big city has much more merits than a small town so that it could be better to live in a big city.</CO>
column23: A very good essay! Try to shorten your thesis statement a little bit.

column1: 538&Some people prefer to eat at food stands or restaurants. Other people prefer to prepare and eat food at home. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Some people prefer to eat at restaurants while others take an opposite position saying eating at home is better. Each maintains has its own advantages and disadvantage. I prefer, <TR>however</TR>, to eat in restaurants because the advantages surpass the disadvantages. <TS>Although the economic aspect can be somewhat burdensome, I still believe eating out is better because it is delicious, time sparing, and refreshing.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, it is more delicious to eat at restaurants.</MI1> <SI1>Many people who are not a good cook can also have good meals at food stores. Because foods served at stores are made by professional cooks, <TR>moreover</TR>, anyone who is good at cooking can't make better dishes. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, a friend of mine has eaten at her favorite restaurant every Saturday for a 3 years. When asked the reason, she said she couldn't make such delicious dishes despite of her good skill in cooking.</EX> As seen in this example, we can eat good foods of professionals just at the expenses of some payments.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Next</R>, eating out saves time to prepare foods.</MI2> <SI2>A recent survey, <TR>for example</TR>, shows that the frequency at which people eat out has increased gradually for past 20 years, especially in cities.
