According to a researcher, who studies modern food business, today's people more and more eat at restaurant than at home, because they are too busy to prepare foods themselves.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Finally</TR>, it can be an event or refreshment.</MI3> <SI3>Eating something special at somewhere different from routine activities is surely refreshing. <EX>In my case, <TR>for example</TR>, I sometimes go to my favorite pizza place when I am sick of repeating daily activities and fed up with home-made dishes. After eating there, I become recharging and feel better. As we can see in my case, eating out contributes even to our minds.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I prefer to eat out because we can eat more delicious dishes, save time to prepare, and feel refreshing. Of course, its advantages can be fully enjoyed when we can afford to do.</CO>
column23: An excellent essay! Good work!

column1: 539&When people need to complain about a product or poor service, some prefer to complain in writing and others prefer to complain in person. Which way do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>What do you do when you have to say the dissatisfaction about something? Some people want to complain by a written method while others prefer to use a verbal method. <TS><TR>In my opinion</TR>, I would like to complain about a product or poor service in person because it provides a swift response and notices precise details.</TS></IN> <BO1><MI1>More than anything else, complaining in person allows us to achieve a swift response.</MI1> <SI1>When you have trouble in using some products, it is better to say the supplier immediately. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, my sister bought a computer which was the-state-of-the-art at that time 2 years ago. <TR>However,</TR> she found out that the computer had some problems in CD-ROM, which didn't work. So, she showed her complaint in letter and got a response one month later. Had it not been for writing letter, she would have had her computer fixed early.</EX> As seen above this example, you would know complaining in person is important.</SI1></BO1> <BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, complaining in person enables us to express our discontentment accurately.</MI2> <SI2>If you explains your thought personally, you could tell what is a delicate problem. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, my mother purchased a furniture which was guaranteed to have a warranty service in 2 years. A year later, she noticed that some part of the furniture's color turned black. Furthermore, there are some fractions around the rim of the furniture. So, she gave the supplier the letter that was described what was needed, but he didn't understand exactly. Then, She called him and showed what she wanted to repair.</EX> In this manner, you could convey your thought effectively by saying directly.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To conclude</TR>, I am in favor of the opinion that saying personally is the best way to complain. That's because it produces two important things: first, quick handling; second, exact expression. You could gain these advantages if you do as I mentioned before.</CO>
column23: A very good essay! Nice work!

column1: 540&Some people believe that the best way of learning about life is by listening to the advice of family and friends. Other people believe that the best way of learning about life is through personal experience. Compare the advantages of these two different ways of learning about life. Which do you think is preferable? Use specific examples to support your preference.
column3: <IN><TS>I think learning through personal experience is better way rather than learning by listening to the advice of family and friends.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>Surely there are many merits in learning by listening to the advice of family and friends.</MI1> <SI1><TR>For example</TR>, I can save a lot of time and energy when I choose to learn from them. They may know better than I on many fields. So they can teach me the shortcut to the success without useless failure. It is very efficient way to accomplish my goal in my life, especially on the beginning stage.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>But learning by listening is much different from learning by experiencing.</MI2> <SI2>If I want to do something, learning by doing is more useful than only learning by listening.<TR> For example</TR>, I have to practice in the real fields if I play baseball as a member. I cannot but to admit learning by listening is helpful but that is not enough for playing baseball.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Furthermore</TR> I cannot depend on their advice on every issue through the whole life.</MI3> <SI3>I have to make a decision on many different situations that they have never experienced and that they don't know what to do. At that time I am only able to rely on my experience. So I had better training myself by diversified personal experience.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, learning about life by listening to the advice is significant help onto strange area to me. But as I grow up, I need to learn more through my personal experience.</CO>
column23: This essay is all right. I would completely remove your first main paragraph, since it is opposing the argument you want to make. Add some more evidence to your main paragraphs.

column1: 541&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? People behave differently when they wear different clothes. Do you agree that different clothes influence the way people behave? Use specific examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>I wholly agree with the opinion that people behave differently when they wear different clothes and different clothes influence the way people behave. The reasons are both because they have changed their behaviors and because other people's reaction to them have changed.</TS></IN><BO1><SI1><EX.I, a central banker of Korea, wear the very formal clothes on my working place because I need to give the faith to the public. But after the work, I change my clothes to casual ones because I would like to feel free from work and enjoy my private life.</EX></BO1><BO2><TR>Second</TR>, <MI1>police people and soldiers wear the uniform while they are on duty. Wearing the uniform, they act as the public servers.</MI1><SI1> They deeply feel the companionship each other and the loyalty to the nation. <EX>During my military service, I act with more discipline and follow the order without hesitation. But after the service period, I think freely on a variety of issues and try to perform my work more creative.</EX> I believe what I wear influences my thought and the way I behave.</SI1></BO2><BO3><MI2><TR>Finally</TR>, when I wear like a bum, people who don't know me treat me as a bum.</MI2> <SI2>In that case I may change my behavior a little When I wear the tie and shirt, they unconsciously treat me more politely. So I am likely to behave more politely and kindly. Other people's reaction to us influence our behaviors.</SI2></BO3><CO><TR>To summarise,</TR> we behave differently when we wear different clothes in different situations. We don't go classic music concert wearing jeans, and we don't go library with formal clothes. As a social being, because we are influenced by what we wear, we try to wear appropriately and behave properly on a variety of situations.</CO>
column23: Your organization needs some work. Your first main paragraph isn't a paragraph at all. You should add it to the second main paragraph, as they are talking about the same thing. Your second main paragraph is ok, but do you really dress like a bum? You need to add a little more evidence to the second main paragraph.

column1: 542&People learn in different ways. Some people learn by doing things; other people learn by reading about things; others learn by listening to people talk about things. Which of these methods of learning is best for you? Use specific examples to support your choice.
column3: <IN>There are many ways to learn, such as learning by doing, reading, listening to and talking with others. <TS>Among these ways, I think that learning by doing and listening to others are both the best for me. This is because practicing helps one to improve skills, and listening to what other people are saying teaches one to be smart about cases that are too dangerous for him.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, most of the academic subjects require skills.</MI1> <SI1>When we learn art, music, science and even mathematics, we need to practice. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, when I was having a print making class at school, listening to the instruction was not enough to let me understand all the complicated process. After trying to carve a copper plate and using a press machine, I could understand what dry point and etching prints were like. </EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Also</TR>, I've figured out that learning by listening to others is helpful.</MI2> <SI2>There are things that we don't necessarily want to take the risk to try. <TR>For instance</TR>, to learn how bad taking drugs and smoking cigarettes are, by doing is too dangerous. By the time we know what they are like, we are already addicted to those vicious things. We can learn how bad they are by listening carefully to why people think they're harmful and what kind of bad influence on people they have.</SI2> </BO2><CO><TR>To conclude</TR>, all the ways that help people to learn are useful. <TR>However</TR>, I presume that learning by doing is helpful for one to improve his intellectual ability and technical skills, and listening to others is a good way as well because it teaches one that sometimes, he doesn't need to take the risk to try to do in order to learn.</CO>
column23: This is a good essay! It will be even better if you add more to your main paragraphs.

column1: 543&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Television has destroyed communication among friends and family. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>I disagree with this statement. <TS>By watching television with friends or family, we can solve the problems related with friends or family, develope the relationship, and have a chance to exchange our opinions.</TS></IN><BO1><SI1>It is easy to find the same interests in television programme each other, and as the scholars say, human beings tend to close to someone who has the same hobby or interests with his/hers.</SI1> <MI1> Watching TV with friend/family allow them to solve the problems between each other by the process of talking freely.</MI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>When people sit surrounding turned-on TV, they hear naturally the sounds from the TV speaker.</MI2> <SI2>From this, they feel like talking something, and soon, the mood is changed into bright and vivid. Whatever they see the TV programme or not, the voice from the TV must be very efficient to develope the relationship among them.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3>We can also exchange our opinion freely while wachting the TV.</MI3> <SI3>When seeing the programme with serious topic, we can make it ease to talk about it. Whether it is for fun or not, exchanging each thought and opinion is such a pleasant and good thing to improve their cummunication.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, television is not a thing disturbing one's relationship with people at all, but it is just required that one should not to be absorbed in it.</CO>
column23: This essay is ok, but you need to add more support to your argument. I'm not convinced. Has any research been done? Do you have any examples? Sure the family talks about what's on TV, but do they talk about anything that concerns them?

column1: 544&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? One should never judge a person by external appearances. Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN>It is true that many people often judge others by their appearances. One's appearance is important, in a way, because it is the main factor that gives others an impression at first sight. <TR>However</TR>,<TS> it is rather unfair to judge people by their appearances because one's humanity and maturity are not achieved by how he looks like. What's worse, judging by appearances can cause one to overlook a person¡¯s true character.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>Appearance is not the only criterion to evaluate a person¡¯s quality.</MI1> <SI1>One's good and pleasant appearance works sometimes, but personality and intelligence should be the priority. <EX>Doctor Steven Hawking is a good example. He is disabled but he is one of the most important scientists of this century. If he had been neglected just because his looks make us feel uncomfortable, it wouldn't have been possible for us to know about the black hole theory.</EX></SI1></BO1> <BO2><MI2>That people judge by appearances can make everybody want to look the same.</MI2> <SI2>There is a model of beauty in every society. These days, being sexy like Britney Spears is what everybody wishes for. But, what if everybody underwent plastic surgery because they believed that they would have some advantages if they all looked like the sexy pop queen? Of course, having a good appearance can be advantageous, but if society encourages people to judge others by their appearances, especially about whether they are good looking or not, it can discourage individuality.</SI2></BO2><CO>With this in mind, we shouldn't judge someone by his appearances because how he looks like doesn't tell much about him. Besides, the more we encourage people to judge by appearance, the more people end up conforming to the same standard of beauty and all look the same.</CO>
column23: An excellent and illustrative essay! Good work!

column1: 545&Many people have a close relationship with their pets. These people treat their birds, cats, or other animals as members of their family. In your opinion, are such relationships good? Why or why not? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>These days, so many people breed their pet indeed. Some people dislike having a close relationship with their pets. However, others say pets is closest friend among people in the world. As a matter of fact, this question only can be answered that depends on one¡¯s individual viewpoint. <TR>Nevertheless</TR>, <TR>in my case</TR>, <TS>I think that close relationships between people and their pets are good because of lessening people¡¯s loneliness and teaching children the dignity of life through relationships.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, treating their pets as members of their family could lessen people¡¯s loneliness.</MI1> <SI1>Some pets have a role, which become a friend with lonely people such as living alone, old person, patient, etc. Those people strongly think their pets are members of their family.<EX><TR> For examples</TR>, my grandmother started to breed a dog, after dying her husband. Some day, I visited my grandmother¡¯ house that I found this dog looks like my grandfather! Grandmother talked to her dog and It seems to be her best family. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I think pets really help lonely people.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, breeding their pets teach children the dignity of life.</MI2> <SI2>Most children don¡¯t know yet the meaning of death and life. Breeding pets give a opportunity, which teaching the dignity of living things to children. <EX>In my childhood, I always played with my cat on the roof. Someday, I thrown away the cats accidentally and then died. However i could not accept the death of my cat. I asked my family ¡°What¡¯s wrong with my cat, kuku?¡± for a long time and then, my father taught me the meaning of death. Therefore I knew the dignity of living things.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I think having a good relationship, like their family, with their pets is a good for people. Those relationships help solitary people who live alone and teach children the meaning of death and life. <TR>As a matter of fact</TR>, many people think more their pets as member of family than the past.</CO>
column23: A very good essay. Take the transitions in your introduction out, it will be stronger without them.

column1: 546&People attend college or university for many different reasons. Why do you think people attend college or university?
column3: <IN>Most people say attending college is required for the better life or the successful life. In modern society, there is full of information. To get lots of knowledge we should attend university or college. In this essay, I will give the detailed explanations for reasons why we attend the college.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, we should attend university for getting the special knowledge.</MI1> <SI1>The knowledge form the high school education is too basic to get speciallized jobs. In most countries, there are no special subjets such as the computer engineering, the chemical engineering, and so on in high shool curriculum. There are, <TR>however,</TR> lots of specialized courses in most universities The university provides the special knowledge to students looking forward them.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2></TR>Secondly</TR>, we can make friends who are from lots of countries</MI2> <SI2>In my cases, when attending university I get friends from Japan and United States. Those friends now keeping in touch with me are helpful to me for learning their languages in that time. I think that we can extend the human relationship in university for some purposes.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Lastly</TR>, people graduating university are get the higher pay than those who did not attend university.</MI3> <SI3>The more getting the special knowledge, the more the pay in our complex society.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>So far</TR>, I have explained about why we should attend university or college. <TR>As I have previous stated</TR>, attending unversity is needed for the better life. <TR>Generally speaking</TR>, high educations are guaranteed the successful life. <TR>In my viewpoint</TR>, people should attend university to get the special knowledge, to make various friends and to get a good job.</CO>
column23: Your essay needs a thesis statement. You also need to add a little to your main paragraphs. Finally, you are using too many transitions in your conclusion!

column1: 547&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Technology has made the world a better place to live. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>We can hear some old people say the previous time, which had not the development of technology, was better than nowadays. At a glance, their maintain seems to be right regarding the disadvantages of technology such as pollution. <TS>I believe, <TR>however,</TR> technology has made the world better than before because, with technology, we can live a lot healthier, more convenient, and more abundant life.</TS></IN> <BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, technology helps us live a healthy life.</MI1> <SI1>Before medical science developed, people easily died of diseases, some of which can be regarded as trivial ones to modern people. <TR>For example</TR>, the Black Death out broke in the Middle Ages, and a number of people died. In today, <TR>however</TR>, the disease doesn't occur any longer with the progress of medical technology.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Next</TR>, technology gives convenience to our lives.</TR> Not only does technology make it possible to light the dark of night, but also it helps us to reach anywhere in the world by the internet. Imagine, without technology, we can't even imagine to go abroad flying over the sea, but, since the advent of airplane, we can go everywhere all over the world.</SI2></BO2> <BO3><MI3><TR>Finally</TR>, technology presents us more abundant life.</MI3> <SI3><TR>For example</TR>, even 100 years ago, the third reason of death was the starvation, following the ages and diseases, according to Sociology Department in Seoul University, and it was no wonder in those days. <TR>However,</TR> with the development of agricultural techniques, there are fewer people who die because there is nothing to eat.</SI3><BO3><CO>In conclusion, I insist that technology is the precious present to us making our lives healthier, more convenient, and more abundant. Although there are a few disadvantages of technology like pollution, they will also be solved by the power of technology, I think.</CO>
column23: A very good essay! Nice job.

column1: 548&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? It is better to make the wrong decision than to make no decision at all. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>We are faced with a variety of choices and sometimes make a wrong decision. Some people are afraid of it, which don¡¯t make any decision because many people regard it as a failure. <TS><TR>In my opinion</TR>, <TR>however</TR>, when you try to make some decisions-even if it may be wrong-you will know that there are some benefits come from it.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>More than ever before, you can make a further decision in the same situation next time because you have already experienced it.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>For example</TR>, a brother of mine who is a manager of a company have made a false decision, due to the result of this, he and all employees suffered trials of many kinds. They, however, tried to overcome the situation and find out why this caused problems. They finally escaped from the crisis and after that, never made a mistake in the same situation. A brother of mine said to me that through the process of trial and error, you are able to make an appropriate decision. </EX>Korean proverb says that failure is a mother of success.</SI1> </BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, you can learn a lot of things through previous experiences.</MI2> <SI2>You will know something new you have never knew before. In my view, when makes a wrong decision, one can always learn a variety of things and the knowledge will be a big help in various situations when one try to accomplish something.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Lastly</TR>, you can learn how to make a quick and shrewd decision.</MI3> <SI3>We are living in the world which requires speed and accuracy. These days when the internet is growing rapidly, making no decision means wasting of time. We need to develop our insight and speed through challenging against various choices so that we may survive in the competition of many kinds.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, were it not for any failure, I think it is impossible to always make a perfect decision. Although we make a wrong decision, through the result and the experience, we can have benefits and more careful about the same problem and our insight and speed of making a decision will be increased. I suggest you have many chances to make a decision and try it without fear of failure so that you may succeed to make the same decision next time. Then, I think you will be more mature than when you don't make any decision.</CO>
column23: This is a good essay. Take one of the transitions out of your thesis statement - you don't need both. Your first and second main paragraphs seem like they are too similar to be separated. Can you combine them?

column1: 549&Do you think we should pay attention to these opinions? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>There are many opportunities for us to listen to the opinions of famous people such as actor, athletes and rock stars through TV, internet, radio and so on. I think we can obtain a lot of information and humors from their i158 When famous people such as actors, athletes and rock stars give their opinions, many people listen. nterview. In this concept, I¡¯d like to maintain we should pay attention to their opinions. Let me explain specific reasons and examples.<IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, we can obtain lots of information from their opinions Because they are experts in their fields.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>For example</TR>, My favorite actor Han suk-kyu always explains how to acts excellently through his interview. thus I can understand the details of his performance.</EX></SI1></BO1> <BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, when we are in a stressful situation, we can obtain relaxations and humors from celebrity¡¯s funny remarks.</MI2> <SI2><EX><TR>For example</TR>,Yesterday I was very tired of accumulated fatigue. <TR>However</TR> I can relax my stressful situation after listening to the famous comedian¡¯s funny remarks</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I think we should pay attention to celebrity¡¯s opinions in terms of information and relaxations from stressful situation.</CO>
column23: Your essay is pretty good, but it seems like you aren't very interested in it. Your first main point is all right, but when I read this question I thought it meant listening to celebrity opinions about things other than acting, where they aren't experts, ex. political or social views. Your examples are ok, but they aren't great. Can you find some more information to back up your ideas? Also, you need to have a thesis statement in your introduction. It should state your opinion and why you feel that way.

column1: 550&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement. With the help of technology, students nowadays can learn more information and learn it more quickly. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answers.
column3: <IN><TS><TR>Personally</TR>, I agree that students ability to reach information have increased due to the development of technology.</TS> Recently Korean high school students took nation-wide college entrance exams and the whole country was focused on it. The media was busy talking about which universities to apply with certain score ranges while at the same time reporting tragic deaths of test-takers who killed themselves because they had gotten a lower score than expected. As we can see from these examples the passion and desire of getting into a prestigious university has reached it's highest peak. Followed by this phenomenon the desire for more information among students have increased also. At this point, technology has helped these young students greatly in satisfying their needs.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, the internet is the most common and wide-ranged source of information as we can see from the coinage called the "Information Highway".</MI1> <SI1>Thanks to the Korean Government's 'Info Society' policy the most intricate internet network in the world was built in all over the small peninsula.This made it easy for everyone including students to have access to necessary information.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Also</TR>, CD-roms and many other softwares that offer accurate information are widely distributed and used,</MI2> <SI2><TR>For example</TR>, the CD-rom encyclopedia or stimulated TOEFL test softwares provide precise and up-to date information for the users. Students in Korea are required to do research work related to the work at school. In these situations, easy-to-use softwares are great resources.</SI2></BO2> <BO3><MI3><TR>Lastly</TR>,through the development of science , medicine and technology, devices to enhance the brain's functions using brain waves, such as MC square were invented.</MI3> <SI3>These devices are designed to help students relax and concentrate and devote themselves to a certain activity, thus maximizing the efficiency of what is learned.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, cutting edge technology has made the existence of information sources such as the internet, PC softwares and study-helping devices possible. We have seen evident proof of information which is originated from hi-technology. I believe it is our generations duty to show our efforts in continuing and enhancing the technology we have now and inherit it to our next generations so that they can obtain more enriched and prosperous lives.</CO>
column23: A few comments. First, I think you need to explain HOW the internet helps students rather than just saying how far-reaching it is. Also, what is MC? You can't expect your reader to know, so you must explain it. Finally, the example in your introduction is certainly shocking, but it is a little too off topic to be useful. The rest of your essay is very good, although I would encourage you to add more information to your main paragraphs!

column1: 551&Some students prefer to study alone. Others prefer to study with a group of students. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>How can we study most effectively? Probably the answer of this question is all the students want to know. Some people make a group to expand the effects of study, while others enjoy studying alone. <TS>Even though, through study groups, I can absorb different points of view, I myself prefer studying alone.</TS> Here are some reasons why studying alone is better to me.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, I think the most important thing in studying is concentrating on what you are studying.</MI1> <SI1>We can find some students, who apparently seem not to study much, have good marks on some exams. They answer to the question how they did such a good accomplishment is like this; they concentrate on only the subject as much as possible. <EX>In my case, when I study with friends, I cannot easily fall into studying. <TR>Moreover,</TR> I like to talk with friends, so I avoid being with friends when I need to study hard.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, study group is effective only if all the members have similar ability.</MI2> <SI2><EX><TR>For example</TR>, when I was preparing GRE, I had made up a study group. We could check our process, but studying with group did not help me much. The main reason was that each team member has different level of ability.</EX> To find suitable study-mates with my own ability is so hard that I prefer to study alone with my own schedule.</SI2> </BO2><BO3><MI3>Final reason why I prefer studying alone is the flexibility of schedule.</MI3> <SI3>As I said before, studying with a group can help you not become lazy. <TR>By contrast</TR>, I cannot change the schedule according to my own situation. Sometimes I need to study special parts deeply than others, but it is not easy to make extra time for deeper study as a group member. <TR>Thus</TR>, to adjust the plan a group set before, I cannot help skipping studying more.</SI3></BO3> <CO>When people prepare some special exams, studying with a group can be a good solution to share information. <TR>However</TR>, I do not like some disadvantages of studying with a group such as difficulty of finding appropriate mates and changing plans. <TR>In addition</TR>, the effects of study depend mainly on concentration. According to these reasons, I prefer to study alone.</CO>
column23: A very good essay! I would take out the part in your third paragraph about how group study keeps you from getting lazy - it doesn't really help the argument.

column1: 552&In your country, is there more need for land to be left in its natural condition or is there more need for land to be developed for housing and industry? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>I think there is more need for land to be left in its natural condition in my country.</TS> the reasons why I am in favor of natural condition are that developing more housing and industry can cause serious environmental problems. I also believe my country doesn¡¯t have to be developed any more. Let me explain more specifie reasons and examples in the following paragraphs.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, recently the environmental problems are getting more and more serious.</MI1> <SI1>Developing housing, factory, and various facilities can results in significant environmental pollutions. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, Han river in Korea has been polluted seriously since many of factories was built. </EX>I believe we should protect our country from any kinds of pollutions.</SI2> </BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, there are too many buildings and factories relating to industry.</MI2> <SI2><TR>Thus</TR> I think of the development of more industry-relating facilities as uselessness. Because they are full. There is no need to build any kinds of building. In stead of building, lefting will be more valuable thing.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, in terms of protection of environment and value, I think there is more need to be left in its natural condition. There is no positive effect of developing a variety of buildings on our lives. For better future life, non-polluted areas are needed.</CO>
column23: Your essay is all right, but you need to add a lot more information to your main points. Can you describe how the Han River has been polluted and what the result has been? How could an area that is left to nature be beneficial for the people in the community? Give examples and cite research sources. Spend a little more time on this essay.

column1: 553&You need to travel from your home to a place 40 miles (64 kilometers) away. Compare the different kinds of transportation you could use. Tell which method of travel you would choose. Give specific reasons for your choice.
column3: <IN>I think that choosing transportation is an important factor to travel somewhere because it may make a trip either pleasant or awful. Here, there are three options to go destination 40 miles away: a car, a bus, and a train.</IN><BO1><MI1>The first way I choose is to drive my own car.</MI1><SI1> With a car, I do not have to make a reservation which sometimes makes me feel scary in case of "no seat available" for me. <TR>In addition</TR>, If I drive a car, nobody can bother me during a trip. <TR>Second</TR>, I can enjoy riding a bus to arrive my destination. <TR>Above all</TR>, Taking a bus is the cheapest method, and at the same time it is the slowest in my three options. The last method which I can select is taking a train. According to convenience and the quality of seat, I can get the diverse choices about where I sit. <TR>Moreover,</TR> I can enjoy seeing a beautiful scene during a trip because few railroads are in the boring places.</BO1><BO2>Well, I have talked about three kinds of transportation, and I decide to go my destination 40 miles away driving a car because I want to make my trip with my own plan. <TR>In other words</TR>, with public transportation, I should only sit for a long time until arrive. <TR>However</TR>, if I drive a car, I can find a beautiful place and take a rest there, and also can manage my tour schedule enough to enjoy a trip.</BO2><CO><TR>Consequently</TR>, I think that flexibly managing tour plan depending on diverse situation without any bothering factors makes my travel the most pleasant. That is why I choose to travel with driving a car.</CO>
column23: Your essay is a bit jumbled up. It's a little hard to follow. Try to organize your ideas a little better. Also, you need a thesis statement!

column1: 554&It has been said, ¡°Not everything that is learned is contained in books.¡± Compare and contrast knowledge gained from experience with knowledge gained from books. In your opinion, which source is more important? Why?
column3: <IN>In broad point of view, people get knowledge from two sources; one is direct experience and the other is experiencing from books. Some people say that only through direct experiences, people can absorb vivid information and knowledge. <TR>In contrast</TR>, others maintain that there is nothing we cannot obtain from books. In this article, I will compare and contrast two kinds of knowledge from direct experience and books.</IN><BO1><MI1>The relationship of two sources of knowledge is not opposite.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Rather</TR>, when knowledge from both sources is combined well, true knowledge and wisdom can be formed. <TR>For example,</TR> if someone wants to gain some knowledge about painting, he or she should know how to draw first; that means direct experience. <TR>However</TR>, knowing only painting skills cannot make a perfect knowledge. That is, we must know about the history of art and some theories about color and structure.</SI2></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>By contrast</TR>, each knowledge domain has its own proper knowledge source.</MI2> <SI2>Here are some examples. We cannot do any experiment about philosophy or religion. In other worlds, we should gain knowledge from books mainly when we study somewhat theoretical and abstract fields. When we come to think about engineering or music, <TR>however</TR>, the suitable source of knowledge is different. To know the rules of nature that can be applied to engineering, we must understand the basic theory from experiment. For another reason, when we learn about a song, we should sing for ourselves to know the song.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3>If I should select which source is better to me, I would choose the direct experience.</MI3> <SI3>That is because my major is design. Design is considerably practical field. Even though I must know some theory about art and structure, the best way to design well is to do it for myself. In my case, I like to obtain some basic information from books, and then I practice actually with some tools.</SI3></BO3><CO>Books cannot tell you everything. Although books can give us diverse knowledge from many fields we cannot contact directly, direct experience can provide more vivid and memorable knowledge. Especially, for someone like me who study design, practical knowledge from experience is more important.</CO>
column23: Your writing voice is great, but your style is a little disorganized. While you are making interesting points and saying interesting things, you aren't following one line of though. It seems more like you are saying whatever you know about the subject. I suggest stating your preference from the beginning in your thesis statement (which should be in your introduction) and then defending why you choose that opinion in the next two paragraphs, talking about both options. Your writing is very readable, so congratulations for that, because often that is the hardest part to achieve! Organization can be fixed easily. :)

column1: 555&Decisions can be made quickly, or they can be made after careful thought. Read and think about the following statement: The decisions that people make quickly are always wrong. Do you agree or disagree with the statement? Use reason and examples to support your opinion. (T-1)
column3: <IN>When People need to be in discreet decision, they are likely to be serious and careful.<TR> However</TR>, not all decisions require long preparing paths to achieve great solutions. <TS>Sometimes, the great decisions are gained in a second, rather than in a week, a month, or a year.</TS></IN><BO1><M1>With a faithful preparation, such as opinion or consulting from exports, one has more chance to get the right or the best decisions.</MI1> <SI1>Like this case, it will take long for one to decide, and it wouldn¡¯t be called ¡°the decisions that people make quickly¡±. This type of decision- making processes would be safe and non- riskier act than quick decision.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>However</TR>, all the situations in the real world can people be allowed to decide what we wanted.</MI2> <SI2>Sometimes our competitors can make quick opinion changes before we even start to change, or after we¡¯ve get our new decision, the decision turns out to be useless. There need to be a quick solution sometimes.</BO2><BO3>When a basketball player decides to offense, for instance, the time to be allowed is just 24 seconds. No more than that, no less than that. He just finds the best decision for his team in time. Sometimes the decision turned out to be wrong, and, when he thinks about it again and again after the game finished, it¡¯s possible, he would get the better decisions. </TR>Nonetheless, it¡¯s a useless decision off the time, and he would get the exactly the same decisions after the game that he did in game.</SI2></BO3><CO>Not for the just sports games, such as in Business areas and the international relationship, the quick decisions are frequently required. Sometimes, when the one who are charged in that decisions would get the wrong answer, and people could tell, it was the wrong decisions. <TR>However</TR>, even though there are risks, when people are implementing quick decisions, the quick decisions are suitable in a real world, and would bring us more chances to better results than we just let it go away. With this reason, I prefer to choose the quick decision than the opposite opinion decision processing to adjusting in the real world.</CO>
column23: I found this essay very confusing. It seems that your first main paragraph is talking about the benefits and shortcomings of long term consideration, and the rest is talking about the benefits of quick decisions. However, some of the wording (I couldn't understand the main idea of your second paragraph at all) and the spacing (your second, third and fourth paragraphs all seem to talk about the same thing, but they are separated and there is no conclusion?) really confused me. Work on your organization.

column1: 556&Do you agree or disagree with following statement? All students should be required to study art and music in high school. Give specific reasons to support your opinion. (T-1)
column3: <IN>High school is the fundamental education institute which goals to deliver broad and essential knowledge rather than specified and professional ones. With this concept of views,<TS> I support the opinion that High school curriculum should include music and art subjects.</TS> </IN><BO1><MI1>University, after the high school steps, allows the students to choose their subjects depending on what the students desire to take or are good at.</MI1> <SI1>This freedom of choice in studying area sometimes leads the students to avoid their non -interested subjects such as arts or music. <TR>For instance</TR>, one student is crazy about Math and Science, and don¡¯t posses even commonsense about music and arts, he would posses a crippling knowledge away from the whole knowledge-possessed person that university educations are aiming at.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>School, formal education institute, should help students to step forward to the next step, and high school, maybe the last formal education institute for many students should help the students to be right knowledge-possessed person.</MI2><SI2> After their graduation, the students would study with self- intends, but they won¡¯t study the basic knowledge they aren¡¯t interested in with self- intends later.</SI2></BO2><CO><EX>When I was in a high school I hated to study arts and music. I haven¡¯t taken any single music or arts related classes, and I had never thought importance of those classes that I used to hate. <TR>However,</TR> when I went to famous art museum during summer trip, what I realized was how important broad education is in high school. With learning the subjects what you like, you will get good grade, easy to get a job and live, <TR>however,</TR> as the frog in a water bottle just think what he can see is the whole sky itself, one will live in a narrow and wrong viewpoint for the world like the frog in a water bottle did.</EX></CO>
column23: Your writing is very readable, but unfortunately your essay says very little about the topic. Your first two main paragraphs have nothing to do with the topic, and your third one is simply an example with no main idea and no other support. You have no conclusion. When you write an essay for a test, you need to have 1. an introduction with a thesis statement, 2. two or more main paragraphs with a main idea and supporting ideas (usually not more than 4 paragraphs, and each paragraph should be at least 4-5 full sentences), and 3. a conclusion summarizing your view.

column1: 557&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? It is more important for students to study history and literature than it is for them to study science and mathematics. Use specific reasons and example to support your opinion
column3: <IN>Most education institutes, for instance, high school, university, there usually have required subjects except one¡¯s major classes. Those required classes are the essential courses are intending let students have broad and basic knowledge, not just their major. In this sense, the issues what are more important areas to study whether history and literature or science and mathematics would be an out of questions.</IN><BO1><MI1>Human beings have developed knowledge and have cumulated past achievements by cumulating current achievements.</MI1> <SI1>History and literature, and science and mathematics, there are no exceptions; human beings have already known importance of those areas, and have realized among them no priorities to learn. In past history, there were the cases some studying areas are treated to be prestigious study and the others are treated to be poor. <TR>However,</TR> that historical truth means happened just for a while, and that was caused because certain study area had just fit into the then circumstances practically or politically.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Studying, <TR>especially for students not for scholars</TR>, is like a building a house.</MI2> <SI2>If a house has a strong and safety window and weak doors, we can hardly consider that house is safe enough. It can be adjusting to students studying, if one student just studies hard math and science and don¡¯t have any elementary knowledge in history and literature. Nobody can tell he¡¯s smart. He would just have special area knowledge, just like the unbalanced house.<SI2></BO2><CO><TS>Studying at school, which subjects are more important to study is not the right question because History and literature, and science and mathematics, they are the different areas to be compared and they are having different characters. </TS>Also, comparing the importance of knowledge wouldn¡¯t happen within different areas; science and mathematics would be more practical studies than others, and History and literature are non-practical studies. <TS>Therefore</TS>, my answer for that question is studying History and literature, and science and mathematics, both of them are important studies, and to build knowledge bases for them students should study not just certain areas but wide study areas.</CO>
column23: I don't know what to do with this essay. Your writing style is excellent, but your thesis doesn't show up until your conclusion and there are no definite main ideas to draw from. I want to give you a good grade, but you really need to make an attempt to conform to the structural rules of a test essay - Introduction with thesis statement, body of essay (at least 2 paragraphs with 2 main points and supporting points, each paragraph at least 4-5 sentences) and a conclusion. If you can write within these rules you will get beautiful scores on your test essays.

column1: 558&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>I agree with the statement, ¡°Parents are the best teachers.¡± </TS>There are several reasons why I think that way. <TR>First of all</TR>, the majority of children spend most of the time with their parents. <TR>Also</TR>, young children tend to mimic their parents¡¯ actions. <TR>Lastly</TR>, parents are the one who know best about the children. <TR>Therefore</TR> parents should set good models for children as teachers.</IN><BO1><MI1>During the children¡¯s childhood, they spend most of their time with their parents.</MI1> <SI1>Most of the time, it is the parents who provide the basic foundation of learning for the children. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, my dad used to read me a story every night before I slept. <TR>As a result</TR>, I still like reading books. Also it was my mom who first taught me the alphabets of Korean. Not only do parents affect children¡¯s learning ability, but they also influence their emotional and social abilities. <TR>For example</TR>, it was studied that children who are were raised in peaceful and happy families tend to have less emotional or social problems.</BO1> <BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, young children usually mimic what they see.</MI2> <SI2>Young children don¡¯t have an ability to define what is wrong and what is right yet. <TR>However,</TR> many of them consider the actions their parents take are right. Often times, they learn manners and politeness by imitating their parents. In our culture, people bow their heads as greeting and children learn to do so by mimicking what their parents are doing.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Lastly</TR>, parents are ones who bore and watched children growing.</MI3> <SI3> Not a single teacher would know better about each individual child than parents would. Parents know things their children are good and things they are interested in. Historically, there are many parents who influenced a lot on their children¡¯s successes. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, the mother of Edison encouraged him even though he was expelled from the school. It was mainly because she knew Edison¡¯s talents.</EX> Also, parents possess love that no other teachers can possess.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I agree with the statement ¡°Parents are the best teachers.¡± Children spend most of their time with their parents and mimic their actions. Lastly, parents know best about their children. Maybe parents wouldn¡¯t be as good teacher in teaching academic materials as schoolteachers are. <TR>However,</TR> they make foundation for academic skills and play great role in improving children¡¯s emotional skills and social skills. Parents are the best teacher children can ever get.</CO>
column23: A very good essay! Be careful with your transitions - your introduction has a few too many.

column1: 559&It has been said, ¡°Not everything that is learned is contained in books¡± Compare and contrast knowledge gained from experience with knowledge gained from books. In your opinion, which source is more important? Why?
column3: <IN>It has been said, ¡°Not everything that is learned is contained in books.¡± It is true because people can get knowledge from experiences as well. Getting knowledge from book and getting knowledge from experiences both have some advantages and disadvantages. <TS><TR>However</TR>, <TR>in my opinion</TR>, knowledge gained from experience has more effects and is more important. It is more unforgettable and most of people learn it by instincts, therefore increasing the efficiency of the knowledge.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>I think knowledge gained by experience is more important because there are more advantages.</MI1> <SI1>People learn knowledge from experience by actually going through the situation. <TR>Therefore</TR>, people usually don¡¯t forget knowledge they gain from the experiences. Also since you learn it by your actual instincts, it has more effects than gaining knowledge from books. <TR>Lastly</TR>, most people understand knowledge gained by experience better than they understand knowledge gained from books. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, I went to the United States for the first time during my 3rd grade vacation. At that time, I learned the importance of English because I had very hard time communicating with other friends. My parents constantly explained the importance of English, but I never stood until I actually went through harsh experience in the U.S. I still remember the vacation because it¡¯s just unforgettable. A lot of times, I assume that I would never studied English like I am doing right now, if I hadn¡¯t gone to the U.S.</EX> <TR>However</TR>, it is true that you can¡¯t experience every historical or scientific event you learn in the classes. The experience you can go through is limited.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, knowledge you gain from books is not as limited as knowledge you can gain from experience is.</MI2> <SI2>There are varieties of books you get read or study. <TR>However,</TR> people usually forget what they from books. They don¡¯t learn it by their instincts. <TR>For instance</TR>, I always forget what I learned after I take tests. <TR>Also,</TR> many people don¡¯t prefer getting knowledge from books. <TR>Therefore</TR>, it doesn¡¯t have as many effects as getting knowledge from experience does.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I personally think knowledge people gain from experience is more efficient and important. <TR>First of all</TR>, many people remember what they learned by experiences. <TR>Also</TR>, people understand it better. <TR>However,</TR> it is true that people can get variety of information from books. Also the statement, ¡°Not everything that is learned is contained in books¡± because many people get knowledge from experience as well.</CO>
column23: This essay is mostly very good. You go a little crazy with transitions in some places, so please take a few out. The last two sentences in your first main paragraph don't support your argument, so take them out too. The support in your second main paragraph is pretty weak. It just seems like you are throwing anything in there that might be relevant. Take your time and think of some good things to say.

column1: 560&It has recently been announced that a new restaurant may be built in your neighberhood. Do you support or oppose this plan? why?
column3: <IN>When a special event comes up, people would prefer dine out rather than eat at home. Especially, when I want to spend a special evening with my family, I would propose my family to go a nice restaurant. <TS>I support this plan that a new restaurant is going to be built in my neighbor since it make me enable to have more places to go and I can save my time and money.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, I can have more choices for the restaurants to choose.</MI1> <SI1><EX>When I was young, my family always went to chinese resraurant whenever special event comes. Unlike these days, my town had just one nice restaurant about 10 years ago, which was the chinese restuarant. But now I have several kinds of restaurant in my neighbor, so that I can enjoy variousl kinds of food at the several restaurants.</EX> <TR>Thus</TR>, the more restaurant, the more choice.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, It help me save my time and money.</MI2> <SI2><EX><TR>Actually,</TR> my town is small and located in suburban area of the city, so I have to go to the center of the city no matter when I have a plan with my friends. It takes about 2 hours to get me the hurb of city. I usually spend my time to have a dinner and hang out at the coffe house, while I am with my friends. <TR>Therefore</TR>, once I have a new, nice restaurant in my town, I would suggest that they come to my town. If they would like to come to my town, then I can spare my time and bus fare.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In summary</TR>, I welcome a new restaurant built in my neighborhood for the reasons I mentioned above. Enjoying a pleasant time at the resraurant on a special day would be a very valuable memory. <TR>Moreover,</TR> if the restaurant we visited is excellent, we can memorize the moment we enjoyed, more preciously.</CO>
column23: A very good essay! Nice work!

column1: 561&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Universities should give the same amount of money to their students' sports activities as they give to their university libraries. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>People think that universities should give the same amount of money to their students' sports activities as they give to their university libraries because they believe students sports activities help students health and also bring other effect such as organized life style and healthy mind. <TR>However</TR>, I oppose that statement because of those reasons I will show from now on.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, university libraries are utilized by most of students in university.</MI1> <SI1>Facilities for sports activities are limited by people who are interested in sports. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, last year, my university had a plan to reconstruct the gym in department of physics or the library, but the university decided to rebuild the gym due to practical and immense use of the gym. The plan was failed because just students majored in physics used the equipment in the gym all the time, on the contrary, many students had to suffer shortage of seats in the library.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, university should keep on improving of library's circumstance for their students to study.</MI2> <SI2>There have to furnish sufficient books and fresh information in the library. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, my university is noted for investment in sports activities, so there are lots of famous players in physics department. <TR>However</TR>, when I had an assignment in marketing class, I tried to find books related to my intention at library in my university, but there were just old and useless books. I went to my friend's university which was famous for ceaseless investment in education expecially environment in studies and I could find books what I needed and got more information.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, <TS>I advocate universities have to pay more money to their libraries than their students' activities because usefulness and convenience to their students.</TS> <TR>Moreover</TR>, university should invest in education without stint.</CO>
column23: This essay is excellent! You need to put a thesis statement in the introduction - I have indicated the perfect statement in your conclusion.

column1: 562&It has been said, ¡°Not everything that is learned is contained in books.¡± Compare and contrast knowledge gained from experience with knowledge gained from books. In your opinion, which source is more important? Why?
column3: <IN>I believe that the knowledge gained from experience is more important when you live common life. We often see that many people who rarely read books but have a variety of experience in society live rich and happy life. I can say experience has more important value than reading books but if you want to have knowledge a lot and deeply, you will need the knowledge from the book.</IN><BO1><MI1>There are a lot of examples that those who didn¡¯t finish MBA and even graduate from university succeeded in business as a CEO.</MI1> <SI1>Not learning from books, they gathered the knowledge from experience and used them wisely. That¡¯s why they were successful. There is another case that many economists are not good at investment in stock. They teach various subjects about economics including stock market but they can¡¯t actually benefit from stock themselves expect a few people.</SI1></BO1> <BO2><MI2><TR>However</TR>, we can¡¯t say book is useless and waste of paper.</MI2> <SI2>It is commonly said that now is postindustrial society, in other words: information society. Information and knowledge have been becoming the most important value. It is impossible that we take all the information and knowledge from experience. <TR>Therefore,</TR> the book that contains a lot of experience has been used more usefully for people than before.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, Knowledge from experience is more important in daily life as it provides us with direct and real situations but we can¡¯t take all the knowledge from the experience. <TR>In addition</TR>, information society¡¯s demand for knowledge and information is increasing. <TR>Therefore</TR>, <TS>knowledge from books is also needed as much as experience in modern society.</TS></CO>
column23: This is a very good essay, however you need to put a thesis statement of some kind in your introduction. I have indicated an excellent one in your conclusion. Also, watch your transitions - there are a few too many in the conclusion. As a rule, if you have three sentences in a row with a transition, take one out. Otherwise, good job!

column1: 563&"When people succeed, it is because of hard work. Luck has nothing to do with success." Do you agree or disagree with the quotation above? Use specific reasons and examples to explain your position.
column3: <IN>Many people seem to believe that, when someone achieves success, he or she must have had a great luck with the work. <TR>However</TR>, <TR>in my opinion</TR>, this is a myth that many of our generation are inclined to hold. <TS>I believe that people's success is due to his or her hard work.</TS> That's because all achievements are result of effort and there is no pure luck. <TR>Moreover</TR>, the success comes after repeated trials and errors.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all,</TR> all things have their causes and effects.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Similarly</TR>, success is a product of effort and hard labor, of course. As an old proverb says, there is no gain without pain. <TR>For instance</TR>, if you got a good grade in exam, it is because you prepared for the test and studied hard, not because you are just luckier than others, obviously.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Next</TR>, only those who are prepared can make luck their own chance.</MI2> <SI2>As we heard frequently, heaven helps those who help themselves. Although it is true that some people seem to have better luck than others, in many cases, they could grab their chance to succeed because they prepared to challenge to given opportunity and to reach their goal. <EX><TR>In my case</TR>, <TR>for example</TR>, I was proposed to go abroad and study when I was a freshman. It was a very good suggestion, but I couldn¡¯t make it because I didn¡¯t have as much English ability as a given standard. As we can see in my case, even though you have a good luck, it can¡¯t be a real success without your previous endeavor.</EX></SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Finally</TR>, success is not made in a single day, but it is a result of many trails and fails.</MI3> <SI3>People are likely to see just a shown outcome, but there are so many effort and fails behind the splendid achievement. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, Hwang-sun Hong, who became a big soccer star in 2002 World Cup, had so harsh times in his career that many people wanted him to retire in the field. Now, with today's success, people easily think he could be a big star because he had a good luck to take part in World Cup, but he attained his fame and glory after countless fails and bitter times.</EX></SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I agree the statement that luck doesn't have anything to do with one's success. All things are in their cause and effect cycle, and there is no 'just luck' because one can take a luck as a chance only when prepared. <TR>Moreover</TR>, success is made just after numerous trials and errors. <TR>Thus</TR>, I believe that people should make more effort , if they want to succeed , instead of hoping to have a better luck or blaming their luck with fails.</CO>
column23: An excellent essay! Watch your transitions - you rely on them a little too much. Rarely do you need to put two transitions together. Choose one or the other. Otherwise, great job!

column1: 564&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? High schools should allow students to study the courses that students want to study. Use specific resons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>There are official textbook in every high school. All students are studying with them whether these subject are adaptive for them or not. Some people say that textbooks are prerequisite for them to achieve basic intelligence,while others say high school allow students to choose their preference about "what they really want to study". <TS><TR>Personally</TR>, I suggest that high school ought to permit student to study what they really want.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, It can be useless and wasteful to study unfavorite subjects.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>For instance</TR>, when I was a high school student, I was reluctant to join German language class. Naturally I didn't concentrate this bullshit subject causing me to spend one and half years in vein. Now I don't know anything of Germany despite learning it during the time.</EX> In my view, learning unfavorites can be easily volatile from the brain.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, Concentrating on the study students really want would bring on a wonderful result.</MI2> <SI2><EX>Take for an instance. I was fond of studying Japanese when in the university. <TR>However</TR>, I had never learned it by two years before. <TR>Nevertheless</TR>, my ability in Japanese has considerablly improved in comparision to the effort. I took over a good grade in JPT in six months I studied. Through the experience, I have the feeling that we should learn what we like to follow.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO><TR>As I stated above</TR>, studying according to their preference can have many beneficial in many ways. Of course, I have a vivid experience about this question. So, I would say free textbooks adaptive for each student are much better than official textbooks.</CO>
column23: This is a good essay, except for one word: "bullshit". Never never never use a curse word in a test for an essay! Find a different word to say what you mean.

column1: 565&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Television has destroyed communication among friends and family. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN><TS>I don¡¯t agree that television has diminished communication among friends and family. <TR>In my opinion</TR>, TV provides a lot of communication topics and it helps to unify them.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, TV is a good commnication topic provider.</MI1> <SI1>It has many interesting programs and shows a variety of stories about a wide range of human¡¯s life. When we talk with friends or family, sometimes we will have a diffuculty in keeping conversation. At that time, a lot of TV program¡¯s contents are very good topics which are appropriate to talk or discuss. So, it is storage of a wide range of topics.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, TV unifies friends and family.</MI2> <SI2>We often see an interesting sports like worldcup-soccer-games on television with them. We can understand better through cheering the same team, talking about lots of thing, enjoying together. So, it is a good method of decreasing a gap among us.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, television provides many useful communication topics and helps to unify friends and family. It has not destroyed but developed our communication. <TR>Thus</TR>, we should learn how to use it effectively and how to select a good program .</CO>
column23: This is a good essay, and it could only be better if you add more to it. Can you put in examples or research for your main points? Your thesis statement is good, but you need to add more to your introduction.

column1: 566& Some people think that the automobile has improved modern life. Others think that the automobile has caused serious problems. What is your opinion? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>There are many invention changing people's lifestyle: Computer, T.V, and so on. Mostly, These inventions have both convenience and harm for people's society. <TS><TR>In my opinion</TR>, I think the appearance of the automobiles make our life more convenient and it has several advantages for people's society : It's speed , the method of carrying</TS><IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, Because In these days 'Speed' become important for people's life more and more, the automobile has many advantages for our society.</MI1> <SI1><TR>For example</TR>, it can help the business man who has many travel for his or her work not to waste his or her precious time. and now we can eat a extremely fresh fish caught in sea by using the automobile. If someone injured really need help, the automobile can carry his or her on time. since the automobile has those convenience for people, I think the automobile has developed modern life.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, If There are many heavy burdens people don't carry, the automobile may give great help.</MI2> <SI2><TR>For example,</TR> If people want to build a house, they need a component for house : wood, stone, and so on.</BO2><BO3><MI3>These materials mostly can't be carried by humans's hand only. so, people use the automobile as the method of carrying.</MI3> so many of building including my house could be built. besides, not only materials but also many goods produced in factory can be moved by the automobile, so that helped our industry sell goods quickly and grow effectively. Surely, the automobile has several problems today : air pollution, making a noise, and so on. <TR>However,</TR> the automobile has more advantages than harm for society. people can't ignore this fact. those are other reasons why I think the automobile has many advantages for society.</SI2></BO3><CO><TR>In conclude</TR>, the automobile has both advantage and harm today. <TR>However,</TR> I believed if people use this attractive machine wisely, at least some problems could be solved. <TR>Therefor</TR> I think the auto mobile has improved our life greatly.</CO>
column23: This is a pretty good essay. Your second main paragraph seems to be split up, and some of your conclusion seems to be in your second main paragraph. Clean this up a bit.

column1: 567&Learning about the past has no value for those of us living in the present. Do you agree or disagree? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>I do not agree with the position that learning about the past has no value for those of us living in the present.</TS> <TR>As a matter of fact</TR>, learning about past give people alot of information. There are two reasons for this. Past can show us what kind of fault what people made and we can learn some of remarkable cultures.</IN><BO1><MI1>After people make several mistakes, they recognize how to manage the similar problems.</MI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>As people learn about history, they will be ready to solve any similar problem.</MI2> <SI2><EX><TR> For example</TR>, long time ago, Koreans did not want to attain the culture of southern country. <TR>As a result</TR>, we were too late to get on the board of advanced culture. Now, we know the importance of acceptance of new culture and try to be developed.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3>There are so many great cultures that we need to study and follow.</MI3> <SI3><EX><TR>For example</TR>, Korean ancesters had wonderful things what we should learn and research. By the studying of history, Koreans know what their forefather invented. And today, they try to make those again.</EX> <TR>Also</TR>, <TR>through the past</TR>, people know how to get along with other people. In the past, people usually gave foods, which they made on special day, to their neighbors. That kind of habits made people so warm and I believe people should learn that kind of wisdoms from past, and do it in presents.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>As I stated above</TR>, It is sure that, past have much value for that we can get alot of information and wisdom. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I do not agree with the perspective that past is not important.</CO>
column23: Your introduction starts out so well, but then your essay falls to pieces. Stick to your two main points. Make sure you make a main statement for each point and use examples and research to back up your ideas. The first "paragraph" is just a sentence, the second paragraph makes no reference to history at all, and the third paragraph finally does talk about history, but it doesn't match with your main idea. Organize your thoughts a little better and try again.

column1: 568&Some people choose friends who are different from themselves. Others choose friends who are similar to themselves. Compare the advantages of having friends who are different from you with the advantages of having friends who are similar to you. Which kind of friend do you prefer for yourself? Why?
column3: <IN>Considering making friends, some people prefer to have a one who is similar to them, while others think having a companion a little bit different from them is a better choice. <TS>Although both argues make sense, I would like to make a peer who is not same as me. I think it'll be better in that I can learn something new from he or she, and we can supplement characteristic weakness of each other.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>On the one hand</TR>, having a similar friend has some advantages in that I can feel comfortable because we may have same attitude about many things and feel similarly in a given situation.</MI1><SI1><TR> Moreover</TR>, because of our analogy, we can understand each other better and easily. <TR>However,</TR> it could be somewhat boring because two of us are too similar to have something new or to learn from each other.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, when I have a friend who think and behave differently from me, I can learn what I couldn't realize before or hadn't have a chance to do.</MI2> <SI2>Not only can I learn from he or she, but also I can be a good influence or teacher to he or she, of course. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, my best friend Eun-jin and I have so different attitude and aptitude to many things. <TR>However</TR>, I could have an interest in computer under her influence and help, while I was her tutor in her worst subject, English.</EX></SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Moreover</TR>, we can change and supplement faults in our characteristics by making relationship with those who have opposite characters.</MI3> <SI3>If you are so timid, you can't overcome your shortcoming just with a friend who are also coy. You can have a occasion to make yourself more confident with a social and gregarious friend's help. <EX><TR>In my case</TR>, <TR>for example</TR>, I was so indiscreet and heedful, before I met my friend Su-jin. <TR>However</TR>, seeing the way she think and behave, I did realize that I was too careless to be a dependable person, and I have made a special effort to be more careful and considerate since then.</EX></SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, a relationship between those who are different can lead both to a better result in that we can have an opportunity to learn something novel and unfamiliar. <TR>In addition</TR>, we can make ourselves better person by changing defects under influence of each other.</CO>
column23: A very good essay! Nice work! Pay close attention to your transitions - you are in danger of using too many in your writing.

column1: 569&Some people say that advertising encourages us to buy things we really do not need. Others say that advertisements tell us about new products that may improve our lives. Which viewpoint do you agree with? use specific reasons and examples to supprot your answer.
column3: <IN>There are plenty of advertisement. Almost all of the fields have their characteristic advertisements. It is expressed by advertisements in TV, radio or newspaper. <TR>However,</TR> it has a conflict between the people who say that advertisements really senseless and other people who think it is necessary for our lives. <TS><TR>In my opinion</TR>, advertisements are really needed for our lives due to the way of getting information, introducing new products, getting fun through the contents of advertisement.</TR></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, advertisements give us information.</MI1> <SI1>Most people watch TV, read newpaper, listen to radio. They can be an intermediater between people and businessmen. If a person need to buy a car, they have to find the information about cars. In this case, the person can easily get some information through advertisements about cars in media. Like this, advertisements inform their characteristic advantages without our efforts.</SI1></BO1></BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, advertisements inform us about new products.</MI2> <SI2>Without advertisements, we cannot easily know about new products which can improve our lives more comfortable. We do not need to find new products' information by ourselves. Advertisements introduce the character about new products.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Third</TR>, advertisements give us fun.</MI3> <SI3>Advertisements often made interesting, becasue they have to be focused on themselves by people. It is the object of all of the advertisements. <TR>Thus</TR>, they are usually made funny.<TR> For example</TR>, I felt fun very much due to the ridiculous macdonalds' advertisement. In this manner, I think advertisement entertain people using their characteristic contents.</SI3></BO3> <CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I think advertisements gives us so many advantages than disadvantages. We can get more opportunites to know about information, new products. Besides we feel fun through funny advertisements. Advertisement can improve our lives.</CO>
column23: This essay is all right. I think you could put your first and second main essays together, because I can't think of any instances where advertisements give us information about anything other than new products. The support for your second paragraph is quite weak and needs your first one to help it. Your third main paragraph doesn't convince me. It sounds like they make you laugh so that you will feel more inclined to their product and buy something you don't need. There is manipulation there. Maybe it would be more convincing if you added more support and examples. For instance, what happened in the McDonald's commercial that made you so happy?

column1: 570&You have received a gift of money. The money is enough to buy either a piece of jewelry you like or tickets to a concert you want to attend. Which would you buy? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN>When people have a chance to receive a gift of money, they worry about what they buy. People must consider their interests to spend the money effectively. <TS>If I have an opportunity to receive a gift of money and have to choose one of the two, a piece of jewelry I like or tickets to a concert I want to attend, I would choose to buy a piece of jewelry. Because jewelry is permanent and we can exchange it for dollars.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, Jewelry is permanent.</MI1> <SI1>For a long time, jewelry is preserved intact, and special memory about its jewelry is also preserved. In Korea, for its permanence, there is the custom to exchange a ring each other in a wedding ceremony. I will also buy a jewelry with the money and have my own special memory. <TR>Thus</TR>, jewelry is very valuable for its permanence of the special memory as well as the appearance.</SI1></BO1> <BO2><MI2></TR>Next</TR>, we can exchange jewelry for money.</MI2> <SI2>While tickets to a concert cannot exchange it money when the concert is over, we can exchange jewelry for money whenever we want. Especially, we realize its importance in an emergency situation. <EX>About two years ago, my mother had a traffic accident. We needed a cash for an emergency treatment but it was not easy to make money quickly, but my father came up with the jewelry and I exchanged it for money.</EX> <TR>Therefore</TR>, we can prepare for the unexpected situations with jewelry.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, if I have to choose one of the two, a piece of jewelry or tickets to a concert, I certainly would choose a piece of jewelry. Because the jewelry is preserved intact for a long time and we can exchange it for money when unexpected situations happen.
