We have to decide what to buy with the money after pondering our situation carefully.</CO>
column23: A very good essay! Nice work!

column1: 571&Would you prefer to be outside or would you prefer to be inside for your leisure activities?
column3: <IN>Each person has his/her own interest other than job and wants to enjoy and develop it by giving their extra time in doing a variety of indoor or outdoor activities. <TS>As for me, I prefer to be outside for my leisure activities because it keeps us healthy and relieves our stress.</TS></IN> <BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, outdoor activities keep us healthy.</MI1> <SI1>All of us living in a busy city life have lack of exercise, and outdoor activities such as hiking in the mountains and playing soccer and baseball games will be of great help. <TR>Furthermore</TR>, according to psychological journal, the more you get a chance to take in some sunshine, the more you will be happy. When you go out, it will be good for your mental health by taking in some sunshine. <TR>Similarly</TR>, being outside for leisure activities influences either in a physical or mental health.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, outdoor activities relieve our stress.</MI2> <SI2>Activities such as shopping, going to museum, and hiking can give us pleasure, fresh air and beautiful scenery. This helps us relieve stress from study and work in that we get a chance to meet many things, which allow us to be happy. Things different lead us to forget all the previous problems and stress and feel freely the new changes exposed to us. In this manner, outdoor activities ease us of care and suffering.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, I can not help emphasizing the importance of outdoor activities as a tool of using free time for the good effects on health and relieving stress. People can never be satisfied only with boring daily routine without giving some time outdoor activities.</CO>
column23: Good job on your essay!

column1: 572&What are some important qualities of a good supervisor (boss)? Use specific details and examples to explain why these qualities are important
column3: <IN>No wonder that there should be a good leader for a group to be successful. In many cases, there must be good bosses behind the successful groups. <TS>Then, what crucial aspects the good boss should has? I believe that they are leadership, keen insight and consideration, hard work and diligence.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, and most importantly, a person who lead the group should have a proper leadership.</MI1> <SI1><EX>In recently, <TR>for example</TR>, Korea has an election for a new president and a politician No-mu hyun defeated his competitor. The reason he had such many supports, according to many gallop companies, was his outstanding leadership.</EX> Many Korean people think that good president as leader of a nation should have a remarkable ability to lead and direct people appropriately and efficiently.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Next</TR>, sharp insight and deep consideration is required to be a good leader.</MI2> <SI2><EX>Hiddink, who was a leader of Korean soccer team in 2002 World Cup, made such a splendid achievement because of his insightful ability to judge a player's strength and weakness. Not only did his such keenness and consideration make an individual player stronger, but also contributed to a glorious victory of Korean team, which made an unprecedented record.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO><MI3><TR>Finally</TR>, a leader should work harder and make more effort than any one in his or her group.</MI3> <SI3>According to James Peterson, whose book "The Secret of Successful CEO" is widely read, leaders should make more effort than any other member of his or her group. Being a supervisor doesn't mean that he or she need to just direct and organize, but means that he or she should be a most diligent and hard-working person in the group.</SI3></CO> <CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I think that a good boss is a person who has a mind as a leader and deep insight or speculation. <TR>In addition</TR>, they should be willing to devote himself or herself for his or her group or work. As old Korean proverb goes, to have a wonderful leader is to have a half of victory. <TR>Therefore</TR>, you should check these aspects that I mentioned above, when you choose a person who will lead your group or community.</CO>
column23: This is a pretty good essay. Since your entire point is that bosses should have good leadership and your first paragraph seems to be the weakest, I would take it out and just focus on the second and third main paragraphs.

column1: 573&Afriend of yours has received some money and plans to use all of it either to go on a vacation to buy a car. Your friend has asked you for advice. Compare your frined's two choices and explain which one you think your friend should choose. Use specific reasons and details to support your choice.
column3: <IN>If a friends of mine ask an advise about plans between to go on a vacation and to buy a car, I will consider them and discuss the advantages each other. If he go on a trip, he will get a new pleasure through it, but it is the only one time to enjoy. Meanwhile, if he buy a car, he will feel convenient in his life, but need more extra money. <TS><TR>In these case,</TR> I will prefer go on a trip rather than buy a car.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>One hand/TR>, people can get a new pleasure through the travel.</MI1> <SI1>People living in these days distressed to their tasks, jobs or their studies. They used to exhasuted their energy. <TR>Moreover,</TR> their life cycle is almost same. It make them hateful. <TR>Thus</TR>, they lost their pleasure easily in their lives. I think travel is the one of the best way to heal their energy which lost from their job. We can get a pastime, enjoy new lievs. Besides, we can learn a new things through the vacation.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, we can feel comfortable through buying a car.</MI2> <SI2>We are usually feel uncomfortable by using public transportations, because they are slow and have to wait to ride. It need more time than using their own car. If we have a car, we can do our job for late without worring about the way going home. We can use anytime if we want to use it. Besides, it can help someone who need to go hospital fast. I have an experience about that case. <EX>My brother was so sick suddenly that our family have to take them hospital immediately. We would not take him as fast as we can if my father do not have a car.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In these case</TR>, two choices have advantages respectively. </TR>However</TR>, I think that to go on a vacation is more good to my friend because he can enjoy his life more happily. Traveling is really good to get much pleasure. If he buy a car, he will have to worry about using extra money to maintain a car such as oil fare, washing fare. There I prefer go on a trip. He can escape their boring life through travel.</CO>
column23: Your essay is pretty good, but you are only talking about the positive sides of each thing. It would be easier to understand your conclusion if you talk a little more about the negative side of having a car in the second main paragraph rather than in the conclusion.

column1: 574&Some people think attending events in person is better than watching those events on television at home. Do you agree or disagree with taat view.
column3: <IN>Recently, many people attend a live performance. Live performances have some advantages over televised performance. It is more interactive. <TR>However</TR>, If we watch a televised program in home, we don't need any ticket and we can save time and efforts. <TS>Through the use of a couple of examples and specific explanation, I will demonstrate why I prefer televised program.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>More than anything else, televised program is free.</MI1> <SI1>If you want to attend an orchestra 's concert, you need money to enter the concert hall. On TV, <TR>by contrast</TR>, you don't need money. If you subscribe a cable TV or satellite TV, you can choose and enjoy many programs such as concert, movie, sports game. It is more economical than buy a ticket.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, watching TV is easier than going to the live performance.</MI2> <SI2>To attend a live performance, you may waste a time to buy a ticket in queue and you have to travel to a hall or stadium. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, last week I went to the theater to watch a movie that is a famous one, Herry Porter. I waited two hours in queue to get a ticket. <TR>Finally</TR>, I got a ticket, but I was exhausted. I thought, next time, I will lent videotape and watch the tape at home.</EX></SI2></BO2> <CO>To make long story short, some people prefer to attend a live performance, others prefer to watch a movie or play at home. In my opinion, watching TV saves money and time and convenient.</CO>
column23: A very clear, succinct essay. Nice job!

column1: 575&Some people think governments should spend as much money as possible exploring outer space (for example, traveling to the Moon and to other planets). Other people disagree and think governments should spend this money for our basic needs on Earth.
column3: <IN>Nowadays, many countries set aside much money for improving field realted with exploring outer space.Indeed some people agree with this policy, but in my opinion, the country should spend their money, supposed to be consumed to make rocket go to outerspace, for our basic needs on earth because solving imment problems of what earth is faced with should be preceeded.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, to solve the problem of earth concernig pollution which needs a lot of money and causes direct harm to human is more important matter than exploration of outer space.</MI1> <SI1>Over the world, although so many places are now contaminated by noxious substances these places are not cleaned because of lack of fund.<TR>As a matter of fact</TR>, the nation which has pollute areas cannot remove contamination because of lack of fund.<TR>Therefore</TR> it is reasonable to apportion money for treating that kind of matter rather than spending for exploring outer space.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR., low development nations which have people who suffer from starving need fund for their endeavors for resolving their infancy, and we can spend money not for exploring outerspace, but for helping their efforts.</MI2> <SI2>So many people who is troubled by infancy wait our help heartly, and this is what we should treat above all. <TR>In this reason</TR>, i wholeheartedly insist we should spend our money for basic matters we are faced with.After resolving these problems, we might consider exploring outerspace.</SI2></BO2>
column23: I can tell you have a lot of good things to say, but your writing is a bit unclear, and I found it difficult to understand your main points. The point you are making in your introduction is good, and it seems like it WANTS to have a thesis statement but doesn't quite form one. I think your main paragraphs' ideas are good ones, but perhaps you need to find a simpler way to say what you want to say. Finally, make sure you add a conclusion.

column1: 576&Some people believe that university students should be required to attend classes. Others believe that going to classes should be optional for students. Which point of view do you agree with? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
column3: <IN>There are many opions about the problem of the university students' the attending classes. Some people say that university students should be required to attend classes. Others do not. What is the answer for this problem?</IN><BO1><MI1>I think that classes are essential. Because university students are not matured, they need classes which lead to good ways and control them.</MI1> <SI1>If Classes are not compulsory,easily, they may be resulted in adversity. <TR>Also</TR>, they don't experience many things of what they need to decorate the their life. Classes provide easily many useful skills to adorn the life with them. Then, they can do experience hard matters without failure of his life.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>If classes is not compulsory, they are more free and relaxy. But this easily make them to go the bad way.</MI2> <SI2>Because they are not matured, Justiny do not develop up to the level of ability to choose what is good and what is bad. <TR>Also</TR>, however the outsides of classes are tools to learn the important things, there are many bad effects for the university students. <TR>Therefore</TR>,if classes are optioal, it causes almost endless lists of social problem.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In short</TR>, the classes has effects not only on the knowledge of students but also on the habit of students. <TR>Accordingly</TR>, classes must be essential and necessary for the university studensts.<TR> therefore</TR>, I thinks that classes must be compulsory for them.</CO>
column23: This essay is all right, but is a little hard to follow. I think I understood the main points of your essay, and they are strong. You really need to add a thesis statement to your introduction. In one sentence, write what you think and why. Also, watch your transitions - you are close to using too many.

column1: 577&Do you agree or disagree that people should read only those books that are about real event, and established facts.
column3: <IN>We touch many books, to be sure involve both fiction liters and non-fiction one, in our lives. <TS>Fiction books help our learning grow whereas non- fiction books make our feeling abundant.</TS> If we had one of them, we have to live by people who are unbalance between learning and feeling.</IN><BO1><MI1>Although we engage a special job which needs a special knowledge, we need knowledge of a feeling realm.</MI1><SI1> If we have one side of them, it can cause serious problems. <TR>For example</TR>, If there is a scientist who is inventing a new weapon but he has much knowledge of himself filed, he has no idea about effect to society and another people. Because of, he can not invest a useful and good weapon.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, If we read only non-fiction books, we do not have knowledges which come from basic of real event and established facts.</MI2><SI2> <TR>Consequently</TR> we can not develop our society. we do not have convenient life, neither. After all, who among us would argue that Shakespeare's "Romeo and Juliet" is less important a biography of Albert Einstein because all of them offer a essential information for rather a good life to us.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>Ultimately</TR>, it is personal tastes to chose books of fiction or non-fiction. It is a important point that we must know that we need both fiction books and non-fiction one.</CO>
column23: First, you have mixed up fiction and non-fiction. Fiction is made up stories, like Peter Pan and Romeo and Juliet; non-fiction is real-life writing, like history and science. Second, you need to knit your paragraphs together. They should not be spaced like they are. You make good points but I think you could say even more. Your writing for this essay is a little bit confusing, but I think I understood the main bits of it. Your point about the biography of Einstein vs. Romeo and Juliet is a strong one, good job.

column1: 578&What are some important qualities of a good supervisor (boss)? Use specific details and examples to explain why these qualities are important.
column3: <IN>All the organizations consist of general members, assistants, executives, and supervisor. Among them, a supervisor should do a good job for the successful organization. Now there are two important qualities of a good supervisor or boss.</IN> <BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, a supervisor should become an expert about his organization.</MI1> <SI1>This is a basic quality to do anything. <TR>For example</TR>, to manage an electronic company, a supervisor or boss has the intelligent knowledge about electronics. Of course in other fields, you need the suitable understanding about the company.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, leadership is an important quality.</MI2> <SI2>Leadership is to treat people at the right way, and encourage their abilities maximally. Although there are a lot of clever members in the organization, it would have an unexpected bad consequence if a boss leads them awkwardly.</SI2></BO2><CO>Some day you would have a chance to be a supervisor or boss in any group. When the chance comes to you, don¡¯t hesitate to be a chief. Certainly,if you have both specialty and leadership, you¡¯ll be an excellent supervisor.</CO>
column23: This essay is quite good, but there needs to be more of it. What else can you say to defend your main ideas? Also, you need to put a thesis statement in your introduction declaring what you think the attributes of a good boss are.

column1: 579&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? High schools should allow students to study the courses that students want to study. Use specific resons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>There are official textbook in every high school. All students are studying with them whether these subject are adaptive for them or not. Some people say that textbooks are prerequisite for them to achieve basic intelligence,while others say high school allow students to choose their preference about "what they really want to study". <TS><TR>Personally</TR>, I suggest that high school ought to permit student to study what they really want.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, It can be useless and wasteful to study unfavorite subjects.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR> For instance</TR>, when I was a high school student, I was reluctant to join German language class. Naturally I didn't concentrate this bullshit subject causing me to spend one and half years in vein. Now I don't know anything of Germany despite learning it during the time.</EX> In my view, learning unfavorites can be easily volatile from the brain.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, Concentrating on the study students really want would bring on a wonderful result.</MI2> <SI2><EX>Take for an instance. I was fond of studying Japanese when in the university. <TR>However</TR>, I had never learned it by two years before. <TR>Nevertheless</TR>, my ability in Japanese has considerablly improved in comparision to the effort. I took over a good grade in JPT in six months I studied. Through the experience, I have the feeling that we should learn what we like to follow.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO><TR>As I stated above</TR>, studying according to their preference can have many beneficial in many ways. Of course, I have a vivid experience about this question. So, I would say free textbooks adaptive for each student are much better than official textbooks.</CO>
column23: This is a good essay, except for one word: "bullshit". Never never never use a curse word in a test for an essay! Find a different word to say what you mean.

column1: 580&Some people prefer to live in a small town. Others prefer to live in a big city. Which place would you prefer to live in? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Some people think that living in a small town is better. <TS>Although this life style has its own merits and demerits, I would like to live in a big city.</TS> This is why I can get information more easily and convenient benefits through living in a big city.</IN><BO1><MI1>The first reason for this is that living in a city help us gain good information easily.</MI1> <SI1>With living, People need much information which is concerned with business, education, etc.. In a big city, we can see public media such as a paper, a broadcast and a internet system easily. This media give us useful information.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Futhermore</TR>, people live more conveniently with living in a big city.</MI2> <SI2>Let me give you an example. <EX>I live in Seoul, the capital of South Korea. I can go wherever I want to go in Seoul because there are very good traffic systems. There are such many goods that I can buy whatever I want if I have enough money.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I prefer to live in a city in that It give me more information and convenience. If people think much thought to the positive effects of living in a big city, most people agree with my view.</CO>
column23: Your essay is pretty good, but your first main point is weak. These days access to information is pretty good in the country. Access to museums, concerts and goods is more difficult. I think you can find a stronger point to make. Also, your essay is quite short. There is a lot that can be said about this topic, so try to find some more examples and support to back up your main ideas.

column1: 581&Some students prefer to study alone. Others prefer to study with a group of students. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Some people would like to study alone. <TS>Although this attitude has its own merits and demerits, I prefer to study together.</TS> This is why studying together is more effective for me and help us ask to each other easily.</IN><BO1><MI1>The first reason for this is that studying with a group of students let me work harder.</MI1> <SI1>If I study alone, my study progress is very slow because my will is weak. Let en give you an example. <EX>My major is Material Science and Engineering, which has many, difficult subjects. When I was freshman, I had a lot of difficulty with studying alone. So I entered a study group having a tight plan. The group let me strengthen my weak will and my grad have increased.</EX><SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Futhermore</TR>, I can solve difficult problems with members of the group.</MI2> </SI2>Sometimes I could not gain a good answer, though I had efforted hard for a long time. <TR>At that time</TR>, I could solve the problem with asking to the group's seniors or friends. <TR>In this manner</TR>, studying together bring more opportunity of asking problems each other.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To make a long story short</TR>, I would like to study with a group in that I can study with efficient plan and think about hard problems together. Had it not been for my major study group, I would not have had good grades.</CO>
column23: I think your main points are strong, but you need to add more support to them.

column1: 582&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use specific reason and example to support your answer. (T-1)
column3: <IN>One endlessly learn from his/her neighbor, or group until he/she would die. That means everybody around you can be a teacher of yourself regardless of the age,sex, and degree of education. <TS>Among the many teachers of one¡¯s life, I believe, parents will be the best teachers.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Generally</TR>, parents are the first person of your life when you are born, and the most closest people of your life.</MI1> <SI1>They are just showing consistent and unconditioned love for you. With this love, they truly wish their offspring to be growing as a right person. I think ,nobody can love you much more than your parents do. When you are doing something wrong, you can be taught by anyone who are around you; anybody can be your teacher. <TR>However</TR>, even though one is trying to teach you with a sincere intention if one talk about too private life or sensitive things, it won¡¯t work. In this serious problem, family, especially parents would be a best counselor who can talk about your private life.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Also</TR>, when one is giving you an advice, there would be some beneficial intention of advisor; everyone is selfish.</MI2> <SI2>Parents, they are the only person who thinks and consider about you more than even you do. Father and mother can give you a true advice for you.</SI2></BO2> <CO>In my country, there is an old saying, the affection for their child of parents is like the consistent sea of the world. It means, parents are the best people who love you most, who are interested in you, and probably who objectively know you most . They will devote you on yourself, and teach you with knowledge not only from the book but also not from the book, from the practical life. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I think, the parents are the best teacher of one¡¯s life.</CO>
column23: Most of your essay is strong, but your first main paragraph is weak. You use a lot of words about love without saying very much about parents as teachers. I would suggest you rework this part. Your second main paragraph is great, but there needs to be more of it! It is an intriguing idea you are considering, so add more examples and support to it.

column1: 583&Effective advertising sells products. Describes an advertisement and explain why it is effective. Use specific details to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Now days, advertising is tool for the increasing of comsuption of products. So, many companies are using advertisings. <TR>therefore</TR>, effective advertising must be needed to increasing the sell of their products.</IN><BO1><MI1>Advertising is a method that informs a information of their products.</MI1> <SI1>Because the many companies use unique ad for their products, there are a number of types of advertisings. If they sell more products. advertising must be effective.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Also, there are many ways advertising would be effective.</MI2> <SI2>First, they employ famous people. Then, their products were consider to be famous. If they see the famous people use the products, then consumers are eager to buy the product. The image of famous people reveals to products. Second, they use unusual situations. It helps people remember their product for the long time. Both can help people sell products.</SI2></BO2><CO>In conclusion, the more competive is society, the more effective is advertise for selling their products. Effective advertising help their product be more attractive to people selling their products. Therefore, many company must make effective advertising for the selling of their products.</CO>
column23: You have not answered the question, despite your thoughtful essay. The prompt asks you to CHOOSE an advertisement and explain why it is effective. Read the question very carefully before you write the essay when you are taking a real test.

column1: 584&You have the opportunity to visit a foreign country for two weeks. Which country would you like to visit? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
column3: <IN>There are so many places which is proud of their sceneries. <TR>Among these places,</TR> <TS>if I get a chance to go a place for two weeks, I will go Los Angeles, California, because it has a very popular place, Disney Land, and I can also enjoy very beautiful beaches in there.</TS></IN> <BO1><MI1>One reason I want to go LA is show around the Disney Land.</MI1> <SI1>I used to hear about the Disney Land through some movies or TV, and then I was always surprised the enormous size and variable things to enjoy. <TR>Moreover,</TR> when a friend of mine who had lived in LA for a while said to me that how the place is exciting and spectacle, I really could not desire not to go there. <TR>However</TR>, I do not have much money, so I have to give up going there. <TR>Thus</TR>, I really want to go LA to feel how the Disney Land is interesting.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>The other reason I hope to take a trip to LA is watching beautiful beaches in there.</MI2> <SI2>I often saw very beautiful beaches of LA in cinema. It looked like a heaven to me. <TR>Furthermore</TR>, I like swimming very much, so I usually enjoy swimming in swimming pool near my house, in summer case, in beaches of my country. Since I saw a beautiful beaces in LA in movies, I always have been dreaming to enjoy watching the beautiful beaches - specially I like dusky time in that places, swimming under the hot sea. That is because why I really desire to go LA. </SI2></BO2><CO>As seen these two reason, I really want to go LA if I have opportunity to go on a trip. I may go to the Disney land to enjoy majestic things. I also may go to the famous beaches, and enjoy watching the places and swiming. I would be happy if my hope come true.</CO>
column23: This is a pretty good essay! Take the transition out from the front of your thesis statement and it will be perfect.

column1: 585&some people prefer to live in a small town. Others prefer to live in a big city. Which place would you prefer to live in? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Some people say that living in a small town is better and others take an opposit position and say that living in a big city is better. Living in a small town or living in a big city has its own advantages and disadvantages. <TS>But I prefer to live in a big city. because I believe that the advantages outweigh the disadvantages.</TS> At a glance, though, the disadvantages such as traffic jam, environmental pollution, and dense population are really discouraging. But many people still convenient lives and not a few people like to live in a big city. What are the reason?</IN><BO1><MI1>More than anything else, entertainment is often better in a big city than in a small town.</MI1> <SI1><TR> for example</TR>, big cities have a large number of movie theaters. You can choose to see almost all kinds of movies you want. Small towns usually only have one or two movies. In addition, big cities have lots of different kinds of department stores. In one day, you can go to an clothes department store, and go to an shooses depart ment store. Small towns often don't have any department store at all.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, in a big city, you can do many things day or night.</MI2> <SI2>You can go out to eat at two o'clock in the morning or two o'clock in the afternoon. nightclub often stay open all night. Even supermarkets are often open 24 hours, so you can go shopping at your convenience. In a small town, store and restaurants are usually open for limited hours.</SI2></BO2><CO>Through some people prefer to live in a small town. I think living in a big city is better. You have better entertainment and more flexible hours in a big city and you can find privacy that you can't find in a small town. If I had to choose between the two, I would definitely choose a big city.</CO>
column23: This is a very good essay! Take the "But" out of your thesis statement to make it stronger.

column1: 586&Some people think governments should spend as much money as possible exploring outer space (for example, traveling to the Moon and to other planets). Other people disagree and think governments should spend this money for our basic needs on Earth.
column3: <IN>Many countries are spending as much money as possibly exploring outer space these days because Earth is contaminated by wastes of our houses and many factories so we should find other planets for our Earth to live. <TS><TR>However</TR> we must conscience serious problems which is faced us now in that governments should spend much money to solve problems which is faced us now frist</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>For example</TR>, there are too many people for us to support feed in Earth.</MI1> <SI1>Most of all of people who can not offered meal of day can not have composure of thinking about other planets because they are hungry right now. they need some food to have a full stomach instead of puzzle about other planets. <TR>However</TR> their government should solve a problem of a famine. Naturally government should invest mush money.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Another example</TR>, we are exhausting a resource used after evolution of industry.</MI2> <SI2>If we can not develop alternative energy resources, we will face a serious problem. The easiest example is that we can not drive a car and can not run factories. <TR>Consequently</TR> governments have to invest much money to develop alternative energy resources.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>However,</TR> governments should try to explore outer space steadily because space is too wide to explore.</MI3> <SI3>We do not know a limit of capacity of Earth in that we should prepare our another Earth. This is the vest way our offspring when they must depart on Earth in the future.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, outer space and discovery of what our universe contains fascinates us but now is not time to do it. After solving things of our basic needs on Earth, governments should spend much money to explore outer space. Then we might have further abundance life in Earth as preparing our future.</CO>
column23: This is a good essay with strong main points. However, I would completely remove the third main paragraph because it opposes your argument, and it makes it too confusing.

column1: 587&How do movies or television influence people's behavior? Use reasons and specific examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Movies or television is very popular throughout the world. <TS>Many people can shape their behavior according to what they see in movies or television. Especially movies or television can infulence two parts : people's action and people's fashion choices. </TS>Through the use of several examples, I will demonstrate how movies or television influence people's behavior.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, movies or television affects people's action.</MI1> <SI1>Do you remember the case of murder in Mississipi? One woman continued to kill people without any reasons. Many people said that she shaped her behavior according to the movie 'killer'. But movies or television also has positive effect. <TR>For instance</TR>, many people became relized the importance of helping others after they watched the movie 'pay it forward'. Thus people's behavior is influenced by watching movie or television.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, movies or television influences people's fashion choices.</MI2> <SI2>In the 1980's, every young girl wanted to cut her hair like Farrah Faweett's after she became popular on the television show. As a similiar example, Jennifer Aniston's hair style became very popular after people saw her character, Rachel's hairstyle, on the television show 'friends'.</SI2></BO2> <BO3><TR>Futhermore</TR>, people watch the award ceremony on television because they want to see the fashions that celibrities choose to wear. As seen above these examples, poeple try to mimic fashion of the movie star or cerebrities.</SI2></BO3><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, movies or television influence people's behavior. Movies or television sometimes made people violent or good and many people mimic fashions of the movie star. This is one of the reasons why film or televison show makers should pay attention to the messages that they send through their products.</CO>
column23: This is a very good essay! You just need to clean up your thesis statement a little bit and put your second and third body paragraphs together. Good job!

column1: 588&It has been said ¡°Not everything that is learned is contained in books.¡± Compare and contrast knowledge gained from experience with knowledge from books. In your opinion, which source is more important? Why?
column3: <IN>We get many kinds of knowledge by books and by experiences through our life. And there are many opinions about which is more important knowledge gained from books or from experiences. <TS>In my view, knowledge from experience is more important .</TS> There are two main reasons about my opinion.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, knowledge from experience is more realistic than knowledge from books.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>For example</TR>, if a car broken in the road, he or she can easily fix it, if he or she once experience it, but he or she saw it at fix book, they might fall in trouble because they don¡¯t know the actual fix methods.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, knowledge from experience remains long in your head.</MI2> <SI2>To get knowledge from experience, you use your eyes, hands, foots, and many things those are available. But to get knowledge from books, you use only your eyes. Because knowledge from experience is given by using your body and experience yourself, it can remains your head long.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, knowledge from experience is more actual and last longer than knowledge from books. <TR>Therefore</TR> people try to get knowledge from many experience through their life.</CO>
column23: A good essay!

column1: 589&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Reading fiction (such as novels and short stories) is more enjoyable than watching movies. Use specific reasons and examples to explain your position.
column3: <IN>There is a controversy among people whether reading fiction is more enjoyable than watching movies. <TS>Although it is quite true that reading fiction develops our imagination and comprehension ability, I disagree with that opinion because watching movie enables people to enjoy their leisure time without much effort, and because movie in the present usually shows a story in more realistic and spectacle way than reading fiction does.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, watching movie needs less effort and time than reading fiction does.</MI1> <SI1>What I mean by this is that, to most people, reading a book is somewhat annoying and burdensome rather than enjoyable because it requires much endurance and time to finish. <TR>In contrast</TR>, watching movie is very easygoing and amusing activity.<TR> Furthermore</TR>, people are able to share common experience with their friends or family at the same time by watching movie. I don't really think reading fiction can do this function since it is a kind of lonely behavior.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2></TR>Moreover,</TR> watching movie is more enjoyable because it shows people a story in more realistic and spectacle way than reading fiction does.</MI2> <SI2>That is, people can use more of their senses such as insight, hearing so that they can enjoy a story better than reading fiction. A couple of days ago, I had a chance to watch 'Lord of the Rings' in a theater that I had already read through a book. <TR>However</TR>, the feeling was different compared to that when I had felt through the book; a spectacular scene and sound overwhelmed me, thus I could enjoy the story much more.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, watching movie is more enjoyable than reading fiction not only because it is more convenient and needs less effort, it tells about a story to us in more realistic and interesting ways. <TR>Therefore</TR>, if you want to enjoy a time, I would like to recommend watching movie.</CO>
column23: A very good essay! Your thesis statement is a bit long, but it does say everything you need to say!

column1: 590&Many people visit museums when they travel to new places. Why do you think people visit museums? Use specific reasoms and examples to supply your answer.
column3: <IN>Many major cities have an intellectual center filled with galleries, national park, and museums. Museums are popular points of interest for many tourists to the city. I consider that people enjoy visiting musuems when they travel those cities. Some of the reason are because you can learn new things, see interesting exhibits and learn about other cultures.</IN> <BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, people can learn new things through visiting musuems.</MI1> <SI1>When we go to animal musuem, animal exhibits give information about the lives and habits of the animals. Military exhibits provide information about wars as we go to military musuem. Art musuems give information about the artist.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, people can see interesting things.</MI2> <SI2>Musuems often house items that you cannot see anywhere else, <TR>for example</TR>, dinosaurs and very old relics and famous paintings like the Mona Lisa.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Lastly</TR>, people can learn about other cultures.</MI3> <SI3>In historical musuems, people can learn about people from other generations. People can learn about how others lived and worked and also figure out what they looked like.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, musuems provide with a view of life they can't find in their own environment. <TR>In addition</TR>, we can learn new things and other cultures, and also see interesting things. Eventually, people have to travel many new places because museum provides both entertainment and education.</CO>
column23: This is a good essay! Your introduction ALMOST has a thesis statement, but falls short. Combine your last two sentences and that should work. Also, your second main paragraph needs some more support.

column1: 591&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Children should be required to help with household tasks as soon as they are able to do so. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Household tasks are usually in charge of families' mothers. <TR>However</TR>, it is impossible for them to work the all tasks such as cleaning house, make a cook, washing dishes, buying staples. <TR>Therefore</TR>, that works have to be divided effieciently. Among them, I think children can help those of tasks although it is minor things. <TS><TR>Therefore</TR>, I think children have to help household tasks for raising their helping ability and making responsibility.</TS></IN> <BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, children can learn how they can help their family by helping household tasks.</MI1> <SI1>Although their helping cannot useful for handling the works, they can learn what they have to do for theiry family. It can help children learn the ability of contribution. <EX>In my case, my mother have made me clean my house since I was seven years old. I didn't like the job, but I could not help cleaning my house because my mother always said if I did not help my family, our family could not know how to work together. <TR>Therfore</TR>, I have been cleaning my house nowadays. I think my mother's opinion is absolutely right, and I think I learned how to coutirbute my family.</EX> <TR>Therefore</TR>, I think it is important for children to help their family's task.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, helping household tasks can improve their responsibility.</MI2> <SI2>Children do not know what is responsibility because they did not learn about that. <TR>However,</TR> they cannot know it whether they learned it or not. The reason is that it is abstract. They cannot see the concept. Therefore, they have to do something for understanding the concept. I think helping household is very good picture for them to understand it. If they do not the tasks, anyone is hurt. They can learn the fact through the works.</SI2></BO2><CO>As indicated these case, I think children are required to help with household tasks becasue of those two reasons: raising theiry abiility of helping, learning about the responsibility. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I believe household tasks can help their children more mature persons than any other work.</CO>
column23: An excellent essay! Good work!

column1: 592&In some countries people are no longer allowed to smoke in many public places and office buildings. Do you think it is a good law or a bad law? Use specific reasons and examples to support your position.
column3: <IN>There is an argument about whether the law to forbidden smoking in public places and office buildings is reasonable or not. <TS>Although this law is open to the refutation that this is nothing but the permission of infringing on the smoker¡¯s right, from my point of view, this act is desirable for public health, considering both the non-smokers and smokers.</TS> In this essay, I¡¯ll present two reasons about why this law is not to repeal.</IN><BO1><MI1></TR>First</TR>, not to allow smoking in public places is the least means to protect non-smokers out of the danger of indirect smoking.</MI1> <SI1><TR>In other words</TR>, because smoking do harm to both the non-smokers and smokers, emitting the detrimental fumes, this act can safeguard the health of non-smokers. According to many researches about the cigarette smoking, the smoke not passed through the filter of tobacco that non-smokers inhale is more injurious to health than the smoke passed through it. <TR>In this regard</TR>, smokers do serious harm to their fellows and strangers, smoking in the public place, even if they didnt have any intention to do so. <TR>For this reason</TR>, the act is good enough to apply to more public places and office buildings.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, executing and making propaganda for the law, there are some accompanying effects for promoting smoker¡¯s health.</MI2> <SI2>Thorough the publicity activities for the act, smokers can realize why they should give up smoking as well as the reason that they should not smoke in public places. This is because that almost the publicity is composed of the information explaining the danger of smoking. <TR>Moreover</TR>, the law can be the most effective antismoking campaign, because this act offers the little mandatory opportunity to experience practicing to abstain smoking. In this respect, this law can bring us the advance of public health, producing more number of people who have quit smoking.</SI2></BO2> <CO>To summarize what I mentioned above, the act to prohibit smoking in the public places and official buildings is desirable and reasonable law, because this can be the shortcut to promote public health, decreasing the damage of non-smokers from indirect smoking and the number of the smokers. I sincerely recommend that the government consider how to cope with the danger of smoking and take many measures to do, like this law.</CO>
column23: A thoughtful, perfect essay! Great job!

column1: 593&Neighbors are the people who live near us. In your opinion, what are the qualities of a good neighbor? Use specific details and examples in your answer.
column3: <IN>Neighbors are the people who are closest to us in the meaning of distance. <TR>However</TR>, <TR>strictly speaking</TR>, it cannot be said that they are our closest (intimate) people. I think that the word, neighborhood is bifocal; neighbors can be our friends or helpers who share in our lives in the community to which we together belong, but they also have to keep certain line, propriety, because they live in very close distance. <TS><TR>For this reason</TR>, the qualities that a good neighbor should have are consideration and friendliness.</TS> In this essay, I¡¯ll illustrate these two qualities in detail.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, we should have mutual respect of other people's lives.</MI1> <SI1><TR>In other words<TR>, the consideration of other people's private lives is needed to be a good neighbor. <EX><TR>For example,</TR> we often meet the chances to hear noise or sound from our neighbor's house and to see some scene, which lead us to have some interest about our neighbors' privacy. <TR>However</TR> curious the case may be, there is some line not to cross, because too much interest can be evil to our neighbors, which interrupts their lives.</EX> Also we should give a considerate generosity to the indispensable hinder such as the sound the neighbor pianist makes to practice playing the piano. <TR>Moreover</TR>, not to bother our neighbors by making noise can be the least etiquette to be considerate neighbors. This consideration can be the means of keeping manners and ultimately their freedom to live, as they want.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, good neighbors should have friendliness.</MI2> <SI2>This is because together with our neighbors, we constitute our community and the better community life is the shortcut to enrich our lives. As I mentioned forward, too much interest about our neighbors should be avoided, but the lack of interest of our neighbors can be the serious problem of our community. Newspapers sometimes report the case like that there are old and lonely people who may be founded in death after long time has passed since their death, if we don't have any interest or warm heart to help them. Perhaps, only the warm smile and proper interest about our neighbors can be the key of being a good neighbor and making our lives more meaningful.</SI2></BO2><CO>Although people living modern society may not like to be the part of neighbors' lives, we already occupy the portion of their lives; this relationship is more or less inevitable. According to our behavior, we can be the really closest persons or friends to our neighbors. My suggestion to be a good neighbor is that we become the friends with a kind concern while respect private lives of our neighbors'. I convince that this relationship can be the way to make our community happier and better to live for our neighbors and us.</CO>
column23: A very good essay! Take the transition out of your thesis statement to make it stronger. In fact, watch your transitions - you are close to overusing them.

column1: 594&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? People behave differently when they wear different clothes. Do you agree that different clothes influence the way people behave? Use specific reason and example to support your answer. (T-1)
column3: <IN>From few decades ago, in my country, many of public education institutes such as middle school and high school have started let the students wear the uniform. These current changes are purposed on strict students¡¯ school life; based on the hypothesis, ¡°Students will behave more obedient than when they don¡¯t wear the uniform¡±. <TS>If one asks me whether ¡°Different clothes can help people behave different?¡±, I will definitely say, ¡°I agree with that¡±.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>People will act differently when they wear different clothes; there are physiological, and psychological reasons.</MI1> <SI1>Physiologically, certain clothes can prevent one running or dancing. When one wear different clothes, he/she would feel how people expect his/her act should be or shouldn¡¯t be ;</SI1><SI2> psychological reasons.</BO1><BO2>When people wear classic clothes, for the case of the man, he will wear a suit with tie, and dress shoes. If he usually wears casual clothes; t-shirts with snickers, he will soon realize how his body is uncomfortable now. He won¡¯t run as fast as he did before, and he would feel his neck becoming awkward more and more. <MI2>In this situation, when one feel his physical condition is different from the before, he would act not the same way. He would walk rather conscious, careful than before.</MI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Also</TR>, when one wear differently than before, he would act differently because of psychological reason; the expected act suited for the clothes.</MI3> <SI3><EX>When many public schools in my country embarked school uniform, probably they expect this effect.</EX> When students wear school uniform, they naturally realize who they are. Students don¡¯t have to remind where they should do or go with school uniform; they won¡¯t think they are going bar for drinking when they wear school uniform. Also, female students with skirt uniform will not trying to soccer or basketball, as they used to do with casual pants.</SI3></BO3><CO>People wear different clothes depends on own preferences or special occasion. <TR>However</TR>, different clothes what they wear can make them behave differently. Last year, a prominent newspaper reported to show the result of the school uniform, the crime frequencies students have declined for past 3 years. To tell a long story short, I believe, different clothes can make people behave differently.</CO>
column23: Your essay makes good points, but it is so disorganized that it is hard to put them together. You need to organize your ideas well.

column1: 595&You have received a gift of money. The money is enough to buy either a piece of jewelry you like or tickets to a concert you want to attend. Which would you buy? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN>When people receive money as a gift, they encounter a variety of choices to use money. Some people say that the jewelry is good for its beauty while others insist that a concert ticket is wonderful for its catharsis. <TS><TR>In my opinion,</TR> I will buy a piece of jewelry because of its fashionable value and its permanent cash value.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, jewelry is very fashionable.</MI1> <SI1>It can be an excellent point of fashion. <TR>To illustrate</TR>, when I wear the black trousers and the black shirt, the white and shiny diamond necklace makes my fashion perfect. <TR>In addition</TR>, it can be used from time to time unlike most of other fashion items.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, jewelry has the unchangeable cash value.</MI2> <SI2><TR>In fact,</TR> the value of money changes while jewelry is not. <TR>For example</TR>, when I buy a diamond ring with $1,000 and the inflation of 10% happens, the ring¡¯s value will not be changed. <TR>Meanwhile</TR>, if I have the cash of $1,000, its purchasing value will turn into $900. </TR>Therefore</TR>, I will choose to buy some of jewelry.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, jewelry is a nice selection for money of a present because of its fashion value and its everlasting cash value. When we use the jewelry well like the above statements, the person who gave us money will be satisfied with our choice, jewelry.</CO>
column23: This is a good essay, but be careful of using too many transitions. As a rule, if you have three sentences in a row with transitions, take one out.

column1: 596&some people think that children should begin their formal education at a very early age and should spend most of their time on school studies. Others believe that young children should spend most of their time playing. Compare these two views. Which view do you agree with? why?
column3: <IN>Some people think that children should begin their formal education at a very early age and should spend most of their time on school studies. Others believe that young children should spend most of their time playing. <TS>I think that young children should spend most of their time playing.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, young chilren can make good memories.</MI1> <SI1>I think that playing is good experience to young children. Memories of people's childhood effect people's life. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, when i was a little girl, i liked to go outside and play with my friend. Now, i grow up and i like to meet new people and become a outgoing person.</EX> The young children do not want to study. They want to play. If the chilren do what they do not want to do, it can make them to have mental problems. Chilren can study when they are older than that that age.</SI1><BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, that young children play at thier early age is a good chance to people.</MI2> <SI2>When children grow up, they do not have many chances to play. They will be busy. The children who go to junior high school and high school are also busy because of school work. When the children are young, they go to play with their friend and hang out with them, because the children have time to play. If the chilren are busy, they cannot play. People can study and work, when they grow up. Studying and working is not necessary to young children. Children, spend your time to play.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion,</TR> young children should play because they can have good memories and experince and this it really good chance to young children. I think when children are young, they should spend their time to play than they spend their time on school studies.</CO>
column23: Your essay is good, except I don't understand what the second main idea is. If you are saying that it is a good time to be social, your first example should go in the second paragraph instead of the first one.

column1: 597&How do movies or television influence people's behavior? Use reasons and specific examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>In modern life, television and movies are inevitable. We are influenced largely by them wheather we know the fact or not. <TS>And although there are some bad effects, I think that it influences in good ways to us.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, from TV and movies, we can contact with the whole world.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Of coase</TR>, there might be some bad programs or movies, but in general cases, we can meet many facts that we can't see in our real life. And people get knowledges of the new world. It's very good for our life because we can make our lives better ones through adapting the facts that we obtained from the massmedia.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, television and movies can help reducing the stresses.</MI2> <SI2>In our daily life, we get lots of stresses and we have a few means to eliminate these. Even though stress can be wiped up through singing, driving a car, an so on, watching television and going for a cinema is the most comfortable and safest way. While watching some programs or movies, we can escape from the all daily routines. This effect is very important for the people in nowadays, because lots of people are suffering from the stresses.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>And third</TR>, some television programs or a part of movie can be the standard of our life.</MI3> <SI3><TR>For example</TR>, ther might be two people in a particular soft drama. One is very nice, clement, and diligent, and the other is the opposite. Then the drama ends up with the former succeeding and the later failing. In that case, many people might think that to live in a nice posture is better for their lives. So, from watching the drama, one can improve his or her good position in the life.</SI3></BO3><CO>Because of these reasons and others as well, we can obtain lots of good things from television and movies. Also, these massmedias can open the new world for the people who have some inabilities. Although they can't go out to meet the whole would, TV and movies can introduce them a lot of new experiences. So, I think that the effect of TV and movies are good for our lives.</CO>
column23: A good essay!

column1: 598& People have different ways of escaping the stress and different modern life. What do you thing are the best ways of reducing stress?
column3: <IN><TS>I think that the best ways of reducing stress is a exercise.</TS> Stress is the source of a disease. It confuse our spirit and stiffen our muscle so can obstruct our a affaire in that we should reduce stress as soon as possible. Of course, there are other good ways of reducing stress but for the following reasons, a exercise is the best ways of reducing stress.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, from our spirit point of view, a body stimulate our brain by a fresh shock while exercising; <TR>however,</TR> our brain can overcome stress because by exercising.</MI1> <SI1>Such as a jogging which we can do everywhere and everytime is a simple exercise. Men of today is too busy to do something complex os simple exercises can help us to keep our health of spirit by reducing stress.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>secondly</TR>, from our body point of view, a exercise can relax our muscle which is stiffened by stress.</MI2> <SI2>If I am stressed out after work, I sometime take a long time run. After the run, my muscle which is stiffened by stress can relax and my stress level has usually decreased.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, a exercise helps us to decrease my stress level. As the years move on, I am sure I will find different methods for coping with the stress I feel. For now, a exercise is the best ways of reducing stress.</CO>
column23: I found your writing a little bit confusing, but your general idea is clear.

column1: 599&In some countries, people are no longer allowed to smoke in many public places and office buildings. Do you think this is a good rule or a bad rule? Use specific reasons and details to support your position.
column3: <IN>There is quite a controversy about whether smoking in many public places and office buildings is restricted or not. <TS>Although there is some truth in smoke addicted persons' contention, curbing smoke is obscene and perverse, I think that banning to smoke in public places is right because of these reasons: second-smoke has a negative health effect on non-smokers and banning to smoke can reduce smoking population.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>Smoking in public places and office buildings should be banned because it harms non-smokes health through the second-hand smoke.</MI1> <SI1>There are many studies shown that second-hand smoke is very dangerous, especially to pregnant women and asthma patients. If these persons are exposed to smoking environment, they will probably have very serious health problem. Besides that, second-hand smoke can create cancer in respiratory organism. <TR>Therefore,</TR> smoking in public places should be restricted.</SI1></BO1> <BO2><MI1><TR>In addition</TR>, banning smoke in public places is able to reduce smoke population.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Recently</TR>, many countries have passed laws to ban smoking in public places because it has so many negative effects such as health problem, contaminating nearby environments, and a main source of firing. If these laws are enacted, many smokers may feel it difficult to live with smoking habit, and they are likely to quit to smoke.</SI1></BO2><CO>As I said above, it should be restricted to smoke in public places and office buildings in order to prevent non-smokers' health from dangerous environment and reduce smoke population. It is obvious that smoking do harm rather that do good. <TR>Therefore</TR>, there should be various activities to ban to smoke, and I think, restricting to smoke in public places and office buildings can be one effective solution.</CO>
column23: Your thesis statement is a little long, but otherwise your essay is excellent!

column1: 600&When you have to decide on a place to reside, what features do you take into account most: neighborhood, location, transportation, style, size, number of rooms, types of rooms, facilities, or other aspects? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>There are several factors that people have value on their place to reside, such as, neighborhood, location, transportation, facilities, size, etc. They are all the important factors, so it¡¯s hard to choose one feature that I consider the most important feature. Although most of features mentioned above are important, I would choose facilities. If facilities of my place to reside are good, it¡¯s possible to have more valuable leisure time, and the quality of my life goes up. <TR>Therefore</TR>, facilities are the most important features that should be considered first when people decide on a place to live.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>If there are a lot of facilities in our city, our leisure time would be more enjoyable.</MI1> <SI1>Facilities, such as theater, stadium, shopping mall, park, make our leisure times more valuable. If I have spare time to use, I usually go theater or shopping mall with my friends. <EX><TR>For instance</TR>, in my city, there are big shopping mall and theaters called ¡°Lafesta¡±. Spending a time in Lafesta with my friends is very interesting and enjoyable.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Facilities like hospitals, schools, kindergartens, city hall are essential for our life, additionally, it should be placed in a convenient place for people to use them.</MI2> <SI2>A few days ago, I heard one news that one boy had cut his one leg because of accident. It was not a incredibly serious accident, but there were no available hospitals in the near place. Curing was delayed because of distance to hospital. It shows that good facilities are very important factor.</SI2></BO2><CO>For these reasons that I mentioned above, I think facilities should be firstly considered and the most important features when people choose a place to live. People, who think facilities are the most important features to decide on a place to reside, would be able to live upgraded, and more valuable life.</CO>
column23: This is a good essay. Take "therefore" out of the introduction and instead say something like "I believe". It will make your thesis statement stronger.

column1: 601&Decisions can be made quickly, or they can be made after careful thought. Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? The decisions that people make quickly are always wrong. Use reasons and specific examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>Our life is a series of decisions. At every blinks, we confront the problems to be solved by our own decision. <TS>Everyone has his own way to address the problems. It can be said that how to deal with these problems will determine our life. Some people say that the decision should be made after careful thought. It can be one way we can choose to work out the troubles. But, I disagree that making a decision without long thought is always wrong. <TR>Furthermore</TR>, I think that careful thought cannot guarantee the rightness of the decisions, although it is a very good way to achieve what we want. I will show you several specific reasons to support my belief.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>In some cases</TR>, quick decision is everything.</MI1> <SI1> As a project manager working with a cosmetic company, I always have to make a ¡®go/stop¡¯ decision when new kinds of products are proposed. Whenever I have to decide, I push the backs of my colleagues to get more information, such as other companies¡¯ new products, production costs, market conditions, preliminary customers¡¯ responses, etc. <TR>Sometimes</TR>, I would spend several months to make a perfect decision. But, I have ever had an experience to get into trouble because other competitive company released the same product to the market before I did.Although the products turned out to be very popular, our company lost a chance to get an advantageous position by delaying the product release. <TR>In this case</TR>, I realized that quick decision is very important as much as thoughtful decision.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>This world is full of unknown things. We cannot even expect our own life of tomorrow.</MI2> <SI2>This is true for decision-making. Sometimes, impulsive decision turns out to be the best one. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, I like to mention an experienced team leader in my company. He dares to say that his decision depends on his own intuition much more than on objective data.</EX> Without thoughtful consideration, he often chooses the product for commercialization and has very high successful results.</SI2></BO2><CO>In summary, good decision can be affected by many factors which cannot be expected by our own thoughtful consideration. External environments, personal experiences or intuition, and accidents can also affect the rightness of our decision. <TR>Therefore</TR>, quick decisions can be right in some cases.</CO>
column23: This is an average quality essay. It was very long and complete but it did not really have the depth that it should have. It didn't really structurally make clear divisions in the paragraphs as they should have.

column1: 602&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Only people who earn a lot of money are successful. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>Recently we often estimate for a success man who get a how much money and how much richer than others. Through this situation bring out economy fist policy. But I think that success get a many meaning as a respect and knowledge. Using two examples, I will describe why I disagree that people gain a lot of money are successful.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>Before everything, most important success means respect from co-workers, employees and friends.</MI1> <SI1> <EX><TR>For example</TR>, we don¡¯t think a miser is a successful man.</EX> Because we can guess that he extorted using a other effort and idea for a money and good chance for success.I think successful life is naturally gain from others. When he act and serve for a weak person and weak things.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, to estimate for success, knowledge is also need to person who want to be a successful man.</MI2> <SI2>Most scholar in history who are nor richer, because they don¡¯t need much money and controlled themselves. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, Socrates who always poor and need to something for a life. But we think he was a success even without a lot of money.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO>Through a lot of money, only people lives more comfortable. It¡¯s not a measurement to success or not. Beyond the money, people¡¯s life get a important things like a respect and knowledge for success. When we think of history, only few people simply rich. Most people who were success did something for their society during their life. So I think money is not only source for success.</CO>
column23: This is an average quality essay though there is some variety per area. The thesis did a good job taking a position but was not very clear as to the the points that would be given. The main and supporting points were excellent. The essay could have used better word choice.

column1: 603&It has been said, "Not everything that is learned is contained in books." Compare and contrast knowledge gained from experience with knowledge gained from books. In your opinion, which source is more important? Why?
column3: <IN><TS>In this information-oriented age, we have to gain much knowledge to meet the demand of the time. Both experience and books are equally important sources of knowledge.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Admittedly</TR>, books are indispensable to efficiently gain immense knowledge of our age.</MI1> <SI1>We are living in the flood of information in this era. Books save us much time in gaining more knowledge in that they are the essence of accumulation of knowledge for a long time. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, science textbook is an accumulation of theories that have found for quite a long time.</EX> It took a scientist much more time to find a theory than it takes us to learn it from a book. It owes to books that just for school years can we learn scientific knowledge that has been accumulated for more than 5000 years.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>However</TR>, we can't get vivid and concrete knowledge without learning from experience.</MI2> <SI2> To illustrate, it is necessary to do experiments to observe natural phenomena that scientific theories describe in addition to learning it from textbooks. This is because without learning from experience, we can't understand what the theory or knowledge means completely.<TR>In this respect</TR>, learning from experience is also integral process to gaining knowledge.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, learning both from experience and from books are equally important. Without experience, nobody can understand the real meaning of knowledge that he or she reads from books. Without reading books, we can't learn much knowledge efficiently in our limited lifetime. <TR>Therefore</TR>, we should strike a balance by learning through both sources of knowledge.</CO>
column23: This was an average quality essay. The introduction and thesis were too weak and short. The rest of the essay was very nice and had good points.

column1: 604&When famous people such as actors, athletes, and rock stars give their opinions, many people listen. Do you think we should pay attention to these opinions? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>Everyday people listen to the opinions of famous peoples like actors, athletes, and pop stars. <TS>Celebrities¡¯ each word has very powerful effects on their listeners. People can easily remember what they said, and sometimes, it can also change the thoughts and behaviors of the people. But is it really valuable or important for us? I don¡¯t think so. Of course if what they said is believable and responsible, there is no problems for us to accept it. But the problem is that their words are not always true. I am not going to say that ¡°Don¡¯t believe whatever they say¡±, but ¡°Don¡¯t accept all the words they saying.¡± They are sometimes very wrong because they are not experts in those areas. A famous athlete can be expert in sports but not in other fields otherwise he or she is very interested in that area and studied it. And, even so, they cannot be true experts. Because it will need lots of practices and studies to become a true experts.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>Every people can be wrong. Celebrities cannot be exceptions. It is very natural for human beings to think wrong and make mistakes. Even experts can be wrong.</MI1> <SI1>Celebrities are also human. They are not gods. Do not accept everything they saying.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>And</TR>, to use their powerful effects on their fans, people who have money and power can use them on their purpose of gain popular support.</MI2> <SI2> It is true that many celebrities support specific people on public places. And we can infer that some of them might be bribed to powerful people like politicians and directors of many companies.But their followers (who are enthusiastic over them) will believe whatever they said. It is wrong for people who have mightful power and money to bribe them in that way to deceive their fans and listeners.</SI2></BO2><CO>Famous people can be wrong. Because they are not experts in other areas, they are also human, and they can make mistake and say the facts that are not true. <TR>Also</TR>, I hate to say this, but they can bribed to riches and power holders and try to make us to support those people. We don¡¯t have to accept all they saying. We should have our own identities to judge what is true and what is wrong.</CO>
column23: This is a poor quality essay. The author should not have put information in parenthesis. The essay seems very informal and conversational and fragmented.

column1: 605&If you asked to send one thing representing your country to an international exhibition, what would you choose? Why? Use specific reasons and details to explain you choice.
column3: <IN>I think that choosing one thing expressing our country well is not simple problem. because it must represent our character, culture and personality and so on. <TS><TR>However</TR>, if I have to send one thing representing our country to an international exhibition, I would recommend the Korean traditional cloth, Hanbok. <TR>In my view</TR>, there are two things making Hanbok valuable: symbol and beauty.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, Hanbok is the most representive one of the traditional products in Korea. Altough many traditions were disappeared in our current life.</MI1> <SI1>the majority of Hanbok are very conservative and a lot of people in our country still wear Hanbok for important ocassions and events.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore</TR>, its design and color are very beautiful and diverse. especially, I think simple and strong colors express our personality-mild, but strong-very well and its special designs which consist of different layers and materials have been complimented many times by the foreigners at fahion shows and exhibitions. </MI2></BO2><CO>Though there are various things express our country well, Hanbok have been known for our representive thing being still using in these days. Therefore it can be an excellent object to reflect our history and personality. Moreover if foreigners look at its design and color at the exibition, they may be likely to be impressed like other foreigner did.</CO>
column23: This was a below average quality essay. The thesis was excellent and included a preview of points as well as the position of the author. Problem areas included sentences that were too short or too choppy as well as word choice.

column1: 606& When people need to complain about a product or poor service, some prefer to complain in writing and others prefer to complain in person. Which way do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>What do you do when you have to say the dissatisfaction about something? Some people want to complain by a written method while others prefer to use a verbal method. <TS><TR>In my opinion</TR>, I would like to complain about a product or poor service in person because it provides a swift response and notices precise details.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>More than anything else, complaining in person allows us to achieve a swift response.</MI1> <SI1>When you have trouble in using some products, it is better to say the supplier immediately. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, my sister bought a computer which was the-state-of-the-art at that time 2 years ago. However, she found out that the computer had some problems in CD-ROM, which didn't work. So, she showed her complaint in letter and got a response one month later. Had it not been for writing letter, she would have had her computer fixed early.</EX> <TR>As seen above this example</TR>, you would know complaining in person is important.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, complaining in person enables us to express our discontentment accurately.</MI2> <SI2> If you explains your thought personally, you could tell what is a delicate problem. <TR>For instance</TR>, my mother purchased a furniture which was guaranteed to have a warranty service in 2 years. A year later, she noticed that some part of the furniture's color turned black. <TR>Furthermore</TR>, there are some fractions around the rim of the furniture. So, she gave the supplier the letter that was described what was needed, but he didn't understand exactly. <TR>Then</TR>, She called him and showed what she wanted to repair.<TR>In this manner</TR>, you could convey your thought effectively by saying directly.</SI2></BO2><CO>To conclude, I am in favor of the opinion that saying personally is the best way to complain. That's because it produces two important things: first, quick handling; second, exact expression. You could gain these advantages if you do as I mentioned above.</CO>
column23: This was a fairly good essay. The thesi was really weak and didn't really feel like it was taking a position.

column1: 607&A company has announced that it wishes to build a large factory near your community. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of this new influence on your community. Do you support or oppose the factory? Explain your position.
column3: <IN><TS>Considering to build a new factory in their neighborhood, some people say that it would be great with its economical advantages, while others have opposite opinion saying there are more harmful effects.
