column1: 660&What do you consider to be the most important room in a house? Why is this room more important to you than any other room? Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN><TS>The rooms that our house has are classified as various kinds and thus named by its functions. Among those rooms some people consider bedroom to be the most important room. <TR>However</TR>, in my opinion, the living room is the precious one in that our family gather gather there to communicate and it shows the image of my house to the visitor.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, living room is the place where my family members gather and talk every day.</MI1> <SI1> Here in living room, our family members sit on the sofa or floor and talk each other in the evening after work. By looking other's face and exchanging each member's opinion we can get to know each other and understand well. Sometimes we can watch the television together and laugh loudly.All these things enforce the membership of our family and the living room is the best place to play this function.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, it represent the image of my house to other people who visit my house.</MI2> <SI2> When someone come to my house, he usually is lead to the living room and accordingly he come to see it first. <TR>Therefore</TR> he is apt to judge about my house by the condition of the living room. If the living room is clean, he would suppose my family members are good and if it is confusing, his image about me and my family is bad.<TR>Therefore</TR> the living room plays key role to give others good impression about my house and even family.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To conclude</TR>, I belive that the living room is the most important room in my house in that it provides us the place to gather and talk and shows my house image to visitors. <TR>Oviously</TR>, there are other precious rooms and some people would think bedroom is important because it determines the quality of rest and sleeping. However when it comes to the relationship among the family members and the image to the visitors, a majority of people would agree to my above opinion.</CO>
column23: This is a very good and comprehensive essay that has great main and supporting points .It may be too long in some parts however as the body paragraphs overshadow the introduction and conclusions.

column1: 661&In your opinion, what is the most important characteristic (for example, honesty, intelligence, a sense of humor) that a person can have to be successful in life? Use specific reasons and examples from your experience to explain your answer. When you write your answer, you are not limited to the examples listed in the question.
column3: <IN><TS>There are many factors which are very important to a person's success. How to develop these elements plays a key role to his/her success in the society. <TR>Among others</TR>, I think concentration and a sense of humor are the most important factor in social success.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>More than anything else</TR>, concentration increases a person's work efficiency and saves working time.</MI1> <SI1> There are some people who always do two or more than two tasks together. <TR>Generally</TR>, these people could not gain good results from both works and the working time can not be short.<TR>One of my friend</TR>, who always listen to music while he is studying does not get good grades at exams.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, a sense of humor is very important to friends and coworkers.</MI2> <SI2> No one denies that a humorous person can reduce the strain in the work and make a great mood. <TR>Besides</TR>, having a good relationship with companions is indispensible factor in social success.A friend of my father, who usually make a good mood by telling funny jokes to his comrades, were successful both at work and at out-of-work because everyone feel comfortable with him and try to help him if there is a problem with him. I think it is a power of humor.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To conclude</TR>, among many important factors which affect a person's success in society, I think concentration and a sense of humor are the most important things. Concentration increases work efficiency and a sense of humor is very helpful to the relationship with companions. <TR>Therefore</TR>, if a person develops these elements, he/she can easily achieve his/her goal.</CO>
column23: This is a very good and comprehensive essay that has great main and supporting points .It may be too long in some parts however as the body paragraphs overshadow the introduction and conclusions.

column1: 662& Decisions can be made quickly, or they can be made after careful thought. Read and think about the following statement : The decisions that people make quickly are always wrong. Do you agree or disagree with the statement? Use reason and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN><TS>Some people say that the decisions making quickly are always wrong. They believe that most decisions that can be made after careful thought are right. <TR>However</TR>, I don¡¯t think so. The reasons are as following why I disagree their opinions.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, there exist many decisions in our life time that must be make quickly.</MI1> <SI1 Stock investment can be a good example. Stock process are very often changed. <TR>In this case</TR>, if someone made a careful thought, they spend much of their time. In this result, they lost their chance.><TR>Therefore</TR>, decisions can be make quickly in these situations.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, we have lived competitive social environment.</MI2> <SI2> We sometimes or often face with very important decision-making that connect with our jobs or works. <TR>In this point</TR>, if we spend a few times, we may not only lost our chances but lose to our competitors.Because of these social environment, modern era is called the speedy era or period.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>Of course</TR>, careful thought may have better probability than quick decision-making. But there be many situations that lost their value as time goes by. As the above reasons and examples, I disagree most decisions that can be made after careful thought are right. So, I agree the opinion that decisions can be make quickly in almost all of the cases ion our modern social life.</CO>

column1: 663&Films can tell us a lot about the country where they were made. What have you learned about a country from watching its movies? Use specific examples and details to support your response.
column3: <IN><TS>As the world gets international, people need to understand and know about other countries today. As far as cultural and living conditions are concerned, movies reflect efficiently these factors through vivid pictures. No wonder people can learn about a country through the film which is made in the country. In my case, I have learned about foods and thoughts of the other country through the movies. </TS><IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Above all</TR>, I have understanded about chinese foods through the chinese movie.</MI1> <SI1>I think food is the representative item of the country. <TR>Moreover</TR>, it is common sense that chinese food is various and unique. I have watched 'Gumjiockyup', which means an invaluable child in a family, when I was a middle school student. It is about making food and competing with other cooks. Naturally, there are a lot of chinese food such as Mandoo and Jajangmyun in the movie. <TR>Even more</TR>, there is a very exotic food used the brain of the monkey! The movie not only made me curious and interested about chinese foods but also taught me various types of food in China. <TR>Actually</TR>, the film showed ingredients of the food as well as process of making a variety of food. <TR>Thus</TR>, I have learned a lot about chinese food.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>In addition to the food of the country, thoughts of the country are able to known by movies made in the country.</MI2> <SI2><TR>In fact</TR>, ideas and thoughts of the movie easily come to people's mind who watch the movie. <EX><TR>To illustrate</TR>, I was able to know about ideas and thoughts of the Americans about sex and sexuality through the movie, 'American Pie'. the story is about high school students who are highly interested in sexuality. In that movie, I was surprised that adults and parents in America are generous to teenager's behavior related to sex and sexuality.</EX> When it comes to sexual interest, it is prohibited for Korean students by their parents and adults. <TR>In contrast</TR>, seeing the scene of a father who is down stairs when he know his son is with his girl friend, I have noticed that thoughts about sex and sexuality of American adults are different from those of Korean adults.</SI2></BO2><CO>Although there are numberous factors that films gives about the country they were made, what I have learned through the movies is food and thinking of the country the films were made.</CO>
column23: A very good essay! Your thesis statement could be a little stronger. Try to combine the sentence that is marked with the last sentence in your introduction. Also, watch your transitions. You are relying on them too much!

column1: 664& Imagine that you have received some land to use as you wish. How would you use this land? Use specific details to explain your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>Having some land to use as I wish will be a great luck. Some people want to build their own house in the land and some other people would found a park. <TR>Among others</TR>, I prefer to build a library.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>More than anything else</TR>, a library is a good source of plenty of information and especially detail information about specific fields.</MI1> <SI1> I can read a variety of books whenever I want, and I can use computer systems if I need. <TR>Actually</TR>, there is no library near my house, therefore I sometimes go long distance to find some information which only exist in the library. If I build a library, if will be helpful to me and people who live near the site. <TR>In addition</TR>, a library contributes a lot to the environment and mood near there. <TR>Usually</TR>, in Seoul, there is a fine place near a library.I will also locate a small park which surrounds the library and the park and the library will be a nice place for people. Jung Dok library which is located in the center of Seoul has a nice park near there and it is regarded as a great place for meeting, reading books and doing many cultural behavior. I especially like that kind of environment.</SI1></BO1><CO><TR>To conclude</TR>, I will establish a library if I have received some land to use as I wish. It will gives much information to me and people who live near the site and a library and a small park will be a refreshing site to many people. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I prefer building a library which is indispensible for cultural life.</CO>

column1: 665&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? A zoo has no useful purpose. Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>I disagree that Zoo has no useful purpose . Some kinds of animals are in danger of extermination because careless hunting diminishs the amount of animals. Zoo can save and breed these animals. So I think that zoo has useful purpose. Well, I will demonstrate why I think so.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>Zoo can protect the animals which are about to eradicating in nature.</MI1> <SI1> For example, we can see the 'White Tiger' only in the 'Zoo'. This tiger is not observed any longer in nature, but, by nourishing and caring artificially in the zoo, the 'White Tiger' isn't liminated.<TR>Nowadays</TR>, thanks to the 'Zoo', we can meet the 'White Tiger' in the world</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Also</TR>, animals which are very rare can give birth to their babies and they are raised more safe than nature by the breeders in zoo.</MI2> <SI2> 'White Tiger' is so shrewd that sometimes they kill their babies. In nature this is uncontrollable. If babies are delivered in zoo, this is prevented by the breeders who nourish and care the babies, After babies are delivered, breeders raise them at the clean and safe place. Many risks ,which is happened in the nature, can't menace them, too.<TR>Like this</TR>, zoo can help propagation of rare animals.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>Recently</TR>, many kinds of animals are in trouble related to their existence. Many human's activities, Destruction of environment, careless hunting and so on, cause a decrease of some kinds of animals. Zoo can serve them by protecting, nourishing and caring. So I think that Zoo has useful purpose.</CO>

column1: 666&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Television has destroyed communication among friends and family. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>Throughout our entire life, televisions often bring many advantages to our community, such as taking a rest and providing information. Some people agree with the idea about the benefits of televisions: others may argue that televisions give us to waste time and separate from their friends. <TS><TR>However</TR>, fundamentally I oppose the opinion that televisions destroy communication among friends and family. They offer many common topics about the social life and the time to sit with their family. This is the reason why the television is important in our communication. Through the use of a couple of examples and specific explanation, I will demonstrate why I think it like that.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>More than anything else</TR>, they grant many chance to us to talk with our friends.</MI1> <SI1> It is very important thing in communication to have public titles when someone talks with a person. As an example of this, when I was young, I was too timid to converse with my friends. <TR>However</TR>, the animation program from the television changed me.Because I wanted to talk about the animation, I could approach the neighbor children. Television program contribute to my life.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, people could get the moment to be with their family.</MI2> <SI2> In modern city life people could not have many times to do something together. <TR>For instance</TR>, I know a woman, So-Hyun, who liked to play outside. It seemed that she would not tend to use her time with their parent.<TR>However</TR> after she began to watch the television program, Ina-Lady, she spent the weekend in her house. I¡¯m sure that televisions are good tools in family communication.</SI2></BO2><CO>To make a long story short, no one denies the fact that the television may give special function to the family conversation. They provide us a general dialogue topic and time to see some program with their family. If people give much thought to positive effects of the television, most people would agree with my opinion.</CO>

column1: 667&It is better for children to grow in the countryside than in a big city. DO you agree or disagree? Use specific reasons and examples to develop your essay.
column3: <IN>Most people live in two kinds of regions: countryside or cities. They have both advantages in living. In education some people like to grow their children in the countryside. <TR>However in my case</TR>,<TS> I disagree. Growing children in big cities is beneficial because big cities have more kinds of education facilities and because children can get more cultural benefits.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>In big cities, children can take various education courses.</MI1> <SI1>Each child has different curiosity and talents. For them children have to select the right education facility for developing themselves. In countryside most situations are like that they have only one or two schools or education centers or even not. In big cities, however, there live millions of persons, so there are a lot of schools and also specialized academics for children. It is easier to find the right facility for a child in cities and develop the child. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, I live in Seoul, the capital of Korea, and here are hundreds of elementary schools, thousands of kindergartens and also a lot of academies for music, ballet, and art. My nephew who lived in countryside want to learn a guitar but in his hometown it was too difficult to find a school or academy.</EX> So he came to me and learned it during the summer vacation. Like this, the cities have many facilities for children, so it is better to grow children in big cities.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, big cities have lots of cultural equipments.</MI2> <SI2> Children are learning much during growing. With learning they would have to search or see about historical or artistic inheritance. Although it can be do by countryside but in big cities there are many museums and galleries open for children. Also the transportation is more comfortable because they have a lot of bus lines and subways.<TR>Therefore</TR> it is easier to visit a museum here in a big city. Another example is my nephew, when he came foe the guitar lesson, and I travel trough the museums and galleries because he rarely had chance for see or visit them. For him, the summer vacation was very interested and he wished to come back here the next vacation. For these benefits, growing in big cities is a very charming proposal for parents.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, big cities has various educational activities and also many cultural benefits so that for children there are better to live in. Although country sides have benefits such as clean environments and relax, children need the facilities from big cities, because nowadays the society needs people who had more talents and more special skills. Now I am not married, but in the future when I am married and have children I would live in big cities for my children.</CO>
column23: This is a very good and comprehensive essay that has great main and supporting points .It may be too long in some parts however as the body paragraphs overshadow the introduction and conclusions.

column1: 668&Businesses should hire employees for their entire lives. Do you agree or disagree? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>In modern city life businesses bring many advantages to our community, such as the improvement of capitalistic economy and the increase of hiring the employees. Some people agree with the idea that hiring employees for their entire lives gives us many disadvantages: others may argue that the corporation should employ them until they retire. <TS><TR>However</TR>, fundamentally I oppose the plan to take workers during their entire life. If the companies hire people for life, the eagerness and initiative idea would be reduced. This is the reason why I object to employ people for long time. Through the use of a couple of examples and specific explanation, I will demonstrate why I think it like that.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>More than anything else</TR>, people who continually have worked in one company may not have the passion and motive.</MI1> <SI1> Because the businesses want to get big profit, these things are very important to them. As an example of this when I was young, there was a restaurant, So-Hyun, selling Korean food. It seemed that the old waiter in there had no enthusiasm to his work.Because of his attitude without eagerness I did not want to go to the restaurant. Even though the restaurant is smaller than the company, I think it is similar to the case. The conduct in passion gives big gains to the corporation</SI1></BO1>. BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, businesses should make newly designed and formed products to increase their benefit.</MI2> <SI2> <TR>However</TR>, an aged man is not creative. I know the old woman, Shin-So, who worked in the company for long time.Although gaining much money from the company, she could not offer a new model to her company any longer except one that was invented by her before 20 years ago. Businesses can be developed by the original thinking</SI2></BO2>. <CO>To make a long story short, no one denies the fact that to hire labors for entire life may give special advantages to us. <TR>Nevertheless</TR>, I strongly oppose a plan to keep on hiring old man. They are not ardent and creative. If people give much thought to negative effects of hiring an aged man, most people would agree with my opinion.</CO>

column1: 669&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Television has destroyed communication among friends and family. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>I disagree with the statment that television has destroyed communication among friends and family because I think that programs on television offer us useful information and interesting stories which can be discussed with friends and family. Using the following statements, I will explain why I think so more effectively.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>As I said</TR>, programs on television have good information that becomes subjects to talk with my close people.</MI1> <SI1> For exmaple, last June our country and Japan jointly hold a great world festival, World Cup. <TR>At that time</TR>, but for television, my friends and I could not talked about that . Almost every time some public events occured not only in nation but also through the world, television granted news about the events.<TR>So</TR>, I think that television is a good implement for getting public news to talk with my friends.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Furthermore</TR>, television has a lot of programs which become good topics that make me talk with my family.</MI2> <SI2> <TR>For instance</TR>, when I was a highschool student, all members of my family came home and watch the historical dramatic series, Wang-gun which became the common interest of our family. I remember that time was rare to my family because there was seldom time that all members of my family came together in the house. More thanks to that program, I became to find out the common interests of my own family and my family still enjoy programs of historical dramatic series.From thosedays, I thought that television offers common interests of a family.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In the past</TR>, some people would have insisted that television is just a foolish box to kill time. <TR>However</TR>, television is not a thing for killing time any more because television grants a lot of information and topics to share and talk with other people thesedays. To make a long story short, I think that television has been used as the way of accumulating information and sharing common intersts from the beginning the use of that and it will always be a useful Mass Media.</CO>
column23: This is a very good and comprehensive essay that has great main and supporting points .It may be too long in some parts however as the body paragraphs overshadow the introduction and conclusions.

column1: 670&Holidays honor people or events. If you could create a new holiday, what person or event would it honor and how would you want people to celebrate it? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>There exist many kinds of holidays, from national holiday to traditional holiday, in our life. People honor and celebrate them with various formations and events.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>Although there are many kinds of holidays, I suppose the following holiday. Its name is ¡® the day of mountains¡¯.</MI1> <SI1><TR>At the day</TR>, people go to the mountains and climb tham.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>I suppose the day at second weekend of May of every year.</MI2> <SI2> The reason that I decided that day is weather. Spring of Korea is so warm.So, people want to active at outdoor, especially in mountains.<.SI2></BO2> <BO3><mI3>In Korea, there are many beautiful mountains.</MI3> <SI3>We can see the mountains in any places. <TR>But</TR>, more and more people don¡¯t go and care the mountains. <TR>Therefore</TR>, as creating this kind of holiday, people will have more concerning than they ever do.</SI3></BO3><BO4><MI4><TR>At that day</TR>, people enjoy a holiday with various events.</MI4> <SI4>They will go to the mountains with their family, friends, or colleagues. They have much happy times. And, they will also have the time that they will think about the environment. People will decide the protection of environment throughout a holiday. They will remove wastes in the mountains. </SI4></BO4><CO>A holiday, the day of mountains, gives people mind that protect and love our mountains. Through many events at that time, people enjoy a holiday with their family, friends, or colleagues.</CO>

column1: 671&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? People should read only those books that are about real events, real people, and established facts. Use specific reasons and details to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>There are many kinds of books in the world and they are playing a key role in our lives. Among those books, some people think that only those books written about reality are useful while others disagree with them. <TS><TR>In my opinion</TR>, we should read not only the books about real things but also the books about imaginary or unreal things because the latter gives us inspirations to envolve the society and enables us to prepare for the unexpected situations.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>More than anything else</TR>, by reading the books written about unreal events and people, we can enlarge our imaginative power.</MI1> <SI1> When we read the books just about the established facts, we just take the content of the book as a given fact to us. <TR>Thus</TR> we just end up understandgind it.<TR>However</TR> when we read the books about unreal thing, we usually imagine the events and creatures written on the books and furthermore come to think of the other unreal things. These opportunities to imagine about unreal things drives us to think of the better future of our world.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, we can grow our power to confront with the unexpected problem by reading the books about unreal thing.</MI2> <SI2> There could be many kinds of dangerous situations that we have never experienced.When we read the books about unrestablished facts, we can think of the danger that might threathen our future life and the solution to the problems. Therefore it is very important to read those kinds of books to our future.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In short</TR>, I disagree that people should read only those books that are about real events, real people, and established facts in that it could limit our imagination and the power to be ready for an expected danger. Obviouly reading the books about the real things is also important and the priority should not be disregarded because those books teach us about the world well. Even so, if we think of our future, many people would agree with my opinion that reading the books about unreal things is also needed.</CO>

column1: 672&People have different ways of escaping the stress and difficulties of modern life. Some read; some exercise; others work in their gardens. What do you think are the best ways of reducing stress? Use specific details and examples in your answer
column3: <IN><TS>People have their own ways to relieve the stress and to escape the difficulties of their life : reading, exercising, playing computer games, and so forth. Of these I usually read to relieve my stress from working or studying whenever I have free time. Reading gives me a relaxation and it can allow me to think in a positive way even though I have much stress.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>While I am reading any kind of books like novel, poetry or historical publications</TR>, I can feel relaxed.</MI1> <SI1>No one hinders me during that time and I can enter the enjoyable world of the book. While reading, I do not need to worry about the job or work. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, when I read the novel, ¡°The father¡± by a famous writer in Korea, which is about trying to sell his organ father to get his daughter¡¯s hospital fee, I can be with the main character for couples of hours and it enables me not to think about jobs or work.</EX> Thus I can relieve my stress through reading because reading gives me great relaxation.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, I can also learn something about relieving stress.</MI2> <SI2><TR>In other words</TR>, reading a book gives me lessons I need for escaping the stress. That could be ultimate solution of escaping the stress. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, when I had trouble with relationship with my friend due to lending money to him, I got much stress from that.</EX> For couples of days I could not get the money back, but I could not tell him frankly about that issue because I did not want to hurt friendship because of money. <TR>Then</TR>, one book, which is about friendship, could give me a hint for that problem and I could tell my friend frankly, relieving my stress.</SI2></BO2> <CO>Although there are many ways to escape the stress and difficulties of modern life, I love to read when I got stressed. Reading is so precious to me that it can give me great relaxation and teach me important lessons. I believe that stress can not be eradicated forever, but I have the powerful weapon to escape the stress and I can use it whenever I got stressed.</CO>

column1: 673&Some people think governments should spend as much money as possible exploring outer space (for example, traveling to the Moon and to other planets). Other people disagree and think governments should spend this money for our basic needs on Earth. Which of these two opinions do you agree with? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>As science and technology develop, many countries spend their money to explore outer space. Many people agree with this policy. <TR>However</TR>, there are some people do not agree this policy and argue that they should spend the money for our basic needs on Earth. Even though both have advantages and disadvantages, I totally agree that government should spend as much money as possible exploring outer space.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>More than anything else</TR>, exploring outer space presents us a new hope.</MI1> <SI1> No one denies that Earth's resources decline rapidly and we may seek for a new suitable planet someday. The exploring process will be helpful for it. In "Cosmos", the book written by a famous American physicist, it is said that at least 10 earth-like planet would exist in the universe.<TR>Therefore</TR>, outer space expedition do has possibility and if we find a planet that can replace Earth, it will be a great achivement and very useful for the future.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, it will greatly affect almost all fields of science.</MI2> <SI2> If a spacecraft discovers new planet and finds information about the planet - soil, atmosphere, rocks and so on, it will be great source for research in many fields of science. Physicists will research the new planet's gravitational field and compare it to earth's, chemists will analyze the component of its soil, and biologists will try to find the possibility of existence of live objects by analyzing the information.<TR>Thus</TR>, exploring outer space will develop all fields of science and eventually, it will be very useful to people who live in Earth.</SI2></BO2> <CO>To conclude, exploring outer space presents us a new hope and possibility and it will develop our science and technology. <TR>Therefore</TR>, governments should spend as much money as possible for the expedition to universe. Expedition to universe will be a important and indispensible step for both us and our descendants.</CO>
column23: This is an great essay that is comprehensive in amy ways. Even so, it could be improved by inclreasing the number of transitions and by incorporating in a clear fashion some examples that stand out to the reader in a quick and easy way.

column3: <IN>I think that many people attend college or university for many purposes. <TS><TR>First</TR>, people want to get only knowledge. <TR>Second</TR> another people acquires good job. Third the others are forced by parents.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, they feel like studding special knowledge.</MI1> <SI1>Dislike learning society life, they gather professional knowledges about a field in a college or university.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Second in korea specially they attend a college or university to take a better job.</MI2> <SI2> because many company executive want to an academic clique and academics level.they try to go a good school like Myonggi University.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3>Third many parents want their children to go to university because they consider going a college or university as a shortcut of success</MI3>. <SI3>After all they are forced to go a college or university by parents.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, Although there are many reason why the attend a college or university, I insist that purpose which attend a college or university should come not to be compelled by parents and gain a success but research the field which they want to study.</CO>

It's difficult to give a priortity. But I claims that the best way is the construction of school's infrastructure.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>The construction of school's infrastructure is to built a equipment to help activity in school.</MI1> <SI1>It includes gymnasium, library, park and anothers. It gives not only school's people but also peoplel living near school motivation to concentrate in their life.while other ways except the construction of school's infrastructure such as a scholarship for students, welfare for school's staff just only apply for the school's people.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>The more specified, the construction of gymnasium gives the chane for people livint near school to utilize the gymnasium facilities.</MI2> <SI2> Also, the constrution of library gives for people living near school to read the book cheaper and more convenient than ever.<TR>Moreover</TR> the constrution of park gives them the place to take a break.</SI2></BO2><CO>In short, the construction of a school's infrastructure spends a gift of money increasing a quality of school's people as well as people living near school. column1: 676&Neighbors are the people who live near us. In your opinion, what are the qualities of a good neighbor? Use specific details and examples in your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>Neighbor affects us a lot. We are apt to forget the importance of this relationship, but bad neighbor may make us very uncomfortable. I think two criteria are essential for good neighbor. One is the friendliness and the other is a common sense.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, good neighbor is friendly.</MI1> <SI1> All relationship begins at the friendliness. I think the smile is a good tool to express one¡¯s own friendliness. If you see a bright and shining smile of your neighbor in the morning, it is certain that you will try to be a friend with the neighbor.Although you encounter some trouble with neighbor, this friendliness makes your relationship last long.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, good neighbor has a common sense.</MI2> <SI2>A common sense build a stable relationship. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, if your neighbor is a teenager rocker who never listens to someone, you must endure a striking noise everyday.</MI2> <SI2>If he has a common sense, however, he will try to go to a concert hall or practice only during a day.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>Finally</TR>, I think the neighbor related to us. We need a good neighbor and the criteria are whether he could be a friend and whether he has a common sense. If we has this good neighbor, at least, our lives would be full of fun a little bit more.</CO>

column1: 677&It has been said,"Not everything that is learned is contained in books." Compare and contrast knowledge gained form experience with knowledge gained from books, which source is more important? Why?
column3: <IN><TS>I think that both knowledge gained from books and knoeledge gained from experience are important ,and also they have good points and short points.</TS></IN> <BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, good points of knowledge gained from books get to experience many informations without much efforts</MI1>, <SI1><EX>For example one never have gone to America and he don't spend time and money on traveling America. but books give us many experience without many efforts </EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>But short points of knowledge gained from books are alittle superficial. books provide not first hand experience but second hand experience to us.</MI2> <SI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, we can't get an deep impression in books. column1: 678&Some people work more effectively during the day, while other people work much more effectively at night. Discuss which type of person you are. Give reasons and examples to support your response.
column3: <IN>There are certain types of working conditions people like. Some want to work at day at which energetic condition is available, while others like to work at night, the time that quieter condition is available. <TS><TR>In my opinion</TR>, I prefer working at night. There are certain reasons which I listed in following paragraphs.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, I like quiet condition because I can focus on my work.</MI1> <SI1>One has to focus on one's work, so that he/she can finish it faster and work effectively, and night is just perfect for it. I'm not an adult, so I don't have an occupation.<TR>However</TR>, I know the condition at night is better than at day, because when I tried to memorize some English words, I could memorize it better at night.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, there are almost no interferences at night.</MI2> <SI2> Almost all people go to sleep at night. Then it becomes so peaceful to work on. No one bothers you, so you can save some time by working at night than at day, the time that most people are active.<TR>Moreover</TR>, you may be "tempted" to be idle or have conversations with your co-workers or friends. <TR>Hence</TR>, you may be taken some time at the expanse of doodling over your work at day.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>However</TR>, there are certain disadvantages for night-working.</MI3> <SI3>One of them is an eye problem. Doctors say working or reading at night may make your eyes lose sight, and this can be hazardous. The other problem is exhaustion. You may be really wearysome after finishing work.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, I'm a night-type person for working for I can focus on working my own better than working at day. <TR>However</TR>, I suggest I be more aware of certain disadvantages I have to overcome.</CO>

column1: 679&Some people think that the family is the most important influence on young adults. Other people think that friends are the most important influence on young adults. Which view do you agree with? Use examples to support your position.
column3: <IN>Adolescence is important because most people decide their major and establish their value. <TS>Some people say family is more important than their friends in this period while others opposite that opinion. I think family is more important than friends for two reason; first, family can give crucial advice for choosing their major; second, they influence on establishing their right value.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, family can give a crucial advice to young adults for choosing their major.</MI1> <SI1> Young adults usually think their major and worried. They often talk to their friends, but they cannot get a good advice because their friends have same situation.<TR>However</TR>, family such as parents has so many experiences more than their friends that they can help them to choose their major more particularly.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, family influence on young adults to establish their right value.</MI2> <SI2>If they are talking with their friends, they usually say about studies, their job or schools. Their conversations are limited. However, if they say their families, they can not only get some information but also right values. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, my mother usually say that we have to help poor people, because it is our duty.</EX> Like that, young people can get an important values from their parents.</SI2></BO2><CO>In short, I prefer family's influence than that of friends. Family lead young adults to right major, and help them to establish their own right values. <TR>Therefore</TR>, family can be an important adviser about their young period more than friends.</CO>
column23: This was an above average quality essay. The thesis was excellently written. There could have been a few more transitions to match its length. It was overall a very nice attempt, however.

column1: 680&People attend college or university for many different reasons (for example, new experiences, career preparation, increased knowledge). Why do you think people attend college or university? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>Most of people go to a college or a university after graduate from a high school because they want to get new experience, career preparation and increased knowledge. <TR>However</TR>, I think why people attend college or university is to get a variety of experiences and knowledge. I will demonstrate why I think like that.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, we can learn various knowledge in university.</MI1> <SI1> In a high school, every student had to study all the same subjects even though they were not interested them. We can take classes, however, whatever I want to get lectures in university. <TR>For instance</TR>, I was curious about the investment in stocks, but I didn't even know about the stocks.<TR>Fortunately</TR>, at that semester, a new lecture STOCKS was just begun. I could take the class and in addition I made money from the investments in stocks.</SI2></BO2><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, people usually go to university or college because to get new experience.</MI2> <SI2>Of course there are lots of chances to go through for our lives, but they are needed a plenty of money and time. However in university, you can experience without regard to cost and time.</MI2> <EX><TR>For example</TR>, when I was a high school student, I wanted to play music instruments especially drums.</EX> I did have no time and money to spare the same as other students, though. When I enter a university, however, I join a circle, FREE, one of music bands in my university, and I could play the drums whenever I wanted to play without any payment. </SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, people attend university or college in various reasons. I think that people go to university because of various experience and knowledge.</CO>
column23: This is an excellent essay except for the conclusion which does not tie anything together. Othern than that, there were great transitions and supporting examples.

column1: 681&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? boys and girls should attend separate schools.
column3: <IN><TS>There was a period that boys and girls usually be separated in school. In fact, That question : 'Is Separating boys and girls really effective their education?' has been discussed for ages. Usually most adult (including our parents) is likely to agree that because they believe in that as a saying. <TR>However</TR>, I think that separating boys and girls in school may affect their social skill and communication negatively and make a false fantasy to each other.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, Separating boys and girls may give to them the wrong fantasy about gender relationship and finally cause social problems.</MI1> <SI2>All male and all female in this society is most likely to dream about eachother because they are not familiar to talk with diffrent gender frankly since when they were students in school. <TR>As a result</TR>, many wifes and husbands broken their conflict because of their wrong concept about each other. I think that old-fashioned education is very harm to develope social skill and right concept about each gender for juveniles</SI2></BO2><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, sending boys and girls to separate school does not allow children to develop appropriate cross-gender communication skills.</MI2> <SI2> as the society become big and complicated and women's roles in society become larger, The communication skills about each gender become one of the most important skills for people.<TR>In this situation</TR>, Separating is not a effective way to develop children's ability for their future.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Surely</TR>, Do not separate boys and girls in school may affect their study negatively, and may waste their precious time.</MI3> <SI3><TR>However</TR>, now in this informative and free society I think only to press and control isn't the best way to educate children.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I think sending boys and girls to separate school is a ancient way to educate them for several reasons : make a false fantasy, descend communication skill. So, I disagree with boys and girls must attend separate schools.</CO>
column23: This is a top heavy essay that starts out great and gets lazier and shorter towards the end. Even at the begin, however, there is a mass of words that don't actually do much of anything to improve the structure or the flow of the essay.

column1: 682&The government has announced that it plans to build a new university. Some people think that your community would be a good place to locate the university. Compare the advantages and disadvantages of establishing a new university in your community. Use specific details in your discussion.
column3: <IN><TS>If our community would be a good place to locate the university, there exist some advantages and disadvantages. <TR>Therefore</TR>, someone will agree the plan and others will have the opposite opinion. The advantages and disadvantages are as followings.<TS></IN> <BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, it is the traffic issue.</MI1> <SI1> If the university will be located in our community, it will occur the traffic jam in rush hours.<TR>Therefore</TR>, many people who lived in our town will do not feel satisfaction of their movements.</SI1></BO1> <BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, the issue is businesses.</MI1> <SI1>If the university will be located in our town, it will become to occur many kinds of business. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, they are food stores, book stores, and fashion stores etc.</EX> <TR>Therefore</TR>, the construction of the university will contribute our town to grow in effect of businesses.</SI1></BO1><BO3><MI3><TR>Finally</TR>, children or students who have lived in our town will need not go university of other cities any more.</MI3> <SI3>They could go the university constructed in our town. <TR>Therefore</TR>, they will keep in touch with their family and neighbors everyday. <TR>In Korea</TR>, some people think about the closed relationship between oneself and family or neighbors very importantly.</SI3></BO3><CO>In short, there exist some advantages and disadvantages about the issue that the university will be constructed in our community. <TR>Therefore</Tr>, if decision maker decide this kind of problem, he or she think various factors having many times and information.</CO>
column23: This is an extremely balanced essay, which is pleasing to the eyes of the reader. It seams that the author was concerned about meeting all of the required structural points of writing an essay exactly once. More transitions, more examples, and more content would be good.

column1: 683&People have different ways of escaping the stress and difficulties of modern life. Some read ; some exercise ; others work in their gardens, What do you think are the best ways of reducing stress? Use specific details and examples in your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>People who lived in modern society have many stresses and have different ways of escaping the stress. Some read books, some exercise in gym, and others work in their gardens. <TR>In my case</TR>, if I feel the stress, I always go to the movie theater. The reason that I go to the movie theater whenever I feel the stress are as following.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>Seeing movies, I can forget the stressful situations.</MI1> <SI1> Though many kinds of movies, I sometimes smile with loud noisy and have the sorrow emotion.These emotions that I have in the movie let me forget the stress.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>I always go to the movie theater with my girlfriend whenever going there.</MI2> <SI2> I talk about my stress to my girl friend. She hear the story and assist me with lovely saying. Then, I become happily and disappear the stress in nature. I think it is important that someone talk about their stress with their family, friends, or other people in order to remove their stress. Seeing the movie, I think about my stress and its causes.A movie theater is a dark place. Although a movie theater is not calm, I enjoy thinking about myself and cases of stress in this kind of a place.</SI2></BO2><CO>People have different methods of reducing their stress. Each way depends on each person¡¯s individual characters. In my case, seeing movies, I think about myself and causes of the stress and escape it.</CO>
column23: This is an average quality essay that has a proper, complete, and clear thesis but does not carry it through to the rest of the essay due to the shortfalls in word chice and grammar. The ideas and throughts behind the essay, however, seem adequate should the other skills improve.

column1: 684&Some people prefer to live in a small town. Others prefer to live in a big city. Which place would you prefer to live in? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>Most people live in a big city because of education, transportation, and such other convenience facilities as theaters, good restaurants and so on. Other people prefer to live in a small town on account of fresh air and good-hearted people. I prefer live in a country side to live in urban communities because of those reasons I will show from now on.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, a rural neighbor is more friendly and sincere than urban people.</MI1> <SI1>People live in a city do not have time to spare and do not concern about other people. However in a country side, people make a present every morning, and inqure after a person even though they meet before the day. Moreover they worry about a neighbor truly if the neighbor has big troubles. <EX> For example, last year, my father had a car accident and had to be hospitalized for 1 week. Even though he was just a bruised, fortunately, quite a lot of villagers visit to my father.</EX> They seemed to worry about my father truly, and wish my father's complete recovery. If I live in a city and have a same situation, only a few people visit my father as matter of courtesy.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, if I live in a small town, I can keep my body in good health. I live in a quiet and clean small town. There are lots of trees in each house and I can climb a mountain near my town once a month. I can play with my three dogs in my big garden. Also, few automobiles and pollution help my health.<MI2> <SI2><TR>In a city</TR>, however, parents always worry about their children because of many cars and contaminated air. <TR>Therefore</TR>, the parents make the children not to go out and just stay in a house, but it is not good for children's health because in their age they should play and enjoy with their generation.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, as time goes by, people get out from their home town and look for a big city. <TR>However</TR>, I prefer live in a small town to live in a big city because I learn true love and concern from my neighbors and keep my body in good health.</CO>
column23: This is an extremely bloated essay in the middle. It looks like the author was focused on a point, unloaded on that one point and then backed off for the remainder of the essay. Balance is a requirement of good essay writing.

column1: 685&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN>When I ask someone that parents affect on their child most, so to speak parents are the best teachers, people's answers are very diverse. Some people believe that parents are the best masters for their child because they spend most of their time with their children. <TS>Others argue that parents are not the best educators for their son and daughters because they can not estimate and look their children objectively. <TR>In contrast</TR>, It is well known that parents are the best instructors for their children because they are the only people who support and encourage unconditioally.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, I agree that parents are the best teachers for their children because children have most of their time with their parents, so they would resemble their parents most.</MI1> <SI1> <TR>In general</TR>, parents are very prudent before their decendants also they avoid to show their misconducting, such as fighting, slangs. The reason that they are attentive is their children are not matured that they could follow what parents did. For example, there is an acquaintance who lives in my town. He was an alcholholic, also his wife want to divorce that he have to sign the divorcing contract. Also he has a son, but many people believe that he is not following his father¡¯s step because he has the will that is different from his father.<TR>Eventually</TR>, he could not live successful life because he is hard to control his feeling, mind control, which is the most crucial problem for his father. In this regard, it is well known that parents influence their child most.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, I maintain that parents are the best instructors for their young sons and daughters because they can support their children unconditionally, so to speak they are the only people that can always encourage and wait for their baby.</MI2> <SI2> <EX><TR>For example</TR>, Jack Welch, the man who is the CEO of General Electronic ETC mentioned in his autobiography that he is very graceful for his parents.</EX> Because no one except parents gives him an enormous love as much as that they received from their parents.<TR>Also</TR>, in confucianism, they always emphasize the parents love. <TR>In this regard</TR>, parents are enough to be the best instructor for their children because of their love.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, parents give us an unqualified love and the model of their children. The more we have time with our parents, the more we could feel why parents are the best teacher for their children.</CO>
column23: This is a very good and comprehensive essay that has great main and supporting points .It may be too long in some parts however as the body paragraphs overshadow the introduction and conclusions.

column1: 686& Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? All students should be required to study art and music in secondary school. Use specific reasons to support your answer.
column3: <IN>These days, many secondary schools compel their students to study art and music. <TS><TR>However</TR>, there are other schools in which whether study art and music or not depend on their students' selection. Both policies have advantages and disadvantages. But I prefer that all students should be required to study art and music in secondary school; they deeply affect student's future occupations and they revitalize students.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>More than anything else, most secondary school students, in the age of 14 to 16 in Korea, do not decide their major and what they want to be yet.</MI1> <SI1> <TR>Thus</TR>, by instructing art and music, schools can present students a variety of candidates for their future works.My cousin who is a modern painter told me that he determined what he was going to be during secondary school days. He also said the fine art class contributes a lot to his decision. Like this, art and music classes in secondary school really affect students future occupations.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, art and music classes revitalize the students.</MI2> <SI2> If students only take the classes which is directly related to their major, they can be easily stressful and tiresome. Art and music classes will be great chances for them to relax. When I was in Secondary school, I usually get rid of my stress fine art class which always go out, see the fine view and sketch it.<TR>Also</TR>, music class was a chance to be revitalized. Hence, art and music classes are really helpful to get rid of a student's stress make him/her energetic.</SI2></BO2><CO>To conclude, I think studying art and music in secondary school is indispensible. It affects a student's future occupation and it gives a stuent a chance to be revitalized. <TR>Therefore</TR>, if a secondary school really consider students' conditions in school and their future, teaching art and music would be necessary step.</CO>
column23: This is a fairly balance essay and hits the points in all areas. There aer great main and supporting points which stem from a great thesis. Great job!

column1: 687&It has been said,"Not everything that is learned is contained in books." Compare and contrast knowledge gained form experience with knowledge gained from books, which source is more important? Why?
column3: <IN><TS>I think that both knowledge gained from books and knoeledge gained from experience are important ,and also they have good points and short points.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, good points of knowledge gained from books get to experience many informations without much efforts</MI1>, <SI1><EX>For example one never have gone to America and he don't spend time and money on traveling America. but books give us many experience without many efforts</EX></SI1></BO1> <BO2><MI2>But short points of knowledge gained from books are a little superficial. books provide not first hand experience but second hand experience to us.</MI2> <SI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, we can't get an deep impression in books. Also writer's experience always don't equal th our experience so it unfit for us.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Second</TR>, good points of knowledge gained from experience can experience first hand</MI3>.<SI3><TR>In other word</TR>, it is knowledge which your circumstance is siutable and we can understand information easily.</SI3></BO3><TR>But short points of knowledge gained from experience are that we can't get many knowledge because thme is limitary. no one can experience all over the world.</TR><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, like above sentances, we can gain knowledge in many ways. I am not sure whether knowledge gained from books is important or not knowledge gained from experience. But I can firmly speak that it is the best important to make constant efforts for learning knowledge.</CO>
column23: This essay is lacking in paragraph content. It looks more like an outline than an essay.

column1: 688&Some high schools require all students to wear school uniforms. Other high schools permit students to decide what to wear to school. Which of these two school policies do you think is better? Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN><TS>Schools uniforms are popular in our country. Some people say that they are necessary for students while others say they do not need. I think that wearing uniforms have more disadvantages than some advantages for students. <TR>Because</TR>, they are usually made so rigorously, and they cannot respect students' own character.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>Almost all school uniforms are made rigorously, because shools emphasize their appearence.</MI1> <SI1> That could be good to see students for other people; however, students who wear those of uniforms would not be comfortable.They would think uniforms are not practical. If students do not wear them, they can wear very convenient clothes like casual suits. Students do not need to wear rigid suit.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Morerover</TR>, school uniforms cannot respect their own character.</MI2> <SI2> All students wearing uniforms are the same as any other student appearently. <TR>However</TR>, they are all different. They have their own character. It is most important par not only just for students but all of the people.School uniforms can remove it. it means shool uniforms can hurt students' own right to express their individual character.</SI2></BO2><CO>In short, school uniforms do not need because of both practical part and individual part. School uniforms have some advantages of course, however, there are more advantages for students to select their own clothes than wear the uniforms.</CO>

column1: 689&People attend college or university for many different reasons (for example, new experiences, career preparation, increased knowledge). Why do you think people attend college or university? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>The reasons for people to attend college or university should be various, but I think those can be roughly classified into two reasons: to achieve academic goal and to prepare career.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, lots of students attend their college or university to achieve their academic desire.</MI1> <SI1> Because, basically, college or university is the place where advanced studies of many different fields are unceasingly maintained. In fact, that's why college or university exists. <TR>In that place</TR>, students can concentrate on the subject which they want to study. Faculties and facilities help them to accomplish their specific researches.<TR>Moreover</TR> there are many friends with similar interest, that stimulates students to work hard.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Seconds</TR>, career preparation is another major reason to attend college or university.</MI2> <SI2> <TR>Generally</TR>, college or university graduates can have opportunities to get more preferred jobs.Major companies request college or university diplomas from applicants and there are some jobs only university graduate can have such as doctors, professors, and so on.</SI2></BO2><CO>By attending college or university, one can study deeply on specific subject to achieve one's academic goal, and can have more job opportunities. I think these two are major reasons to attend college or university.</CO>
column23: This was an above average quality essay. The thesis was excellently written. There could have been a few more transitions to match its length. It was overall a very nice attempt, however.

column1: 690&What do you consider to be the most important room in a house? Why is this room more important to you than any other room? Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN><TS><TR>In a house</TR>, all of the rooms are important because they can let us rest and study. Some people say they think the kitchen is the most important while others argue the most considerable is the restroom. Both opinions are reasonable. <TR>In my case, however,<TR>I believe the living room is the most important room in a house because we can have a events and it shows people family's and house's image.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, in living room, it let us have a enjoyable time with family members.</MI1> <SI1>The living room is usually larger than any other room, so it can provide us with a place in which we can talk about and play something . <EX><TR>For example</TR>, when our family had a party cellebrating on my brother's succeed in a test, all of my relatives got together and enjoyed lovely time in living room because the room is the largest room in my house. Unless we have the living room which was large enough, we should scattered into other rooms or couldn't have that party in our house.</EX> <TR>Thus</TR>, living room is the most considerable space because of giving us enough space to have events and enjoying that in our house.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, living room is the most important in terms of showing house's image.</MI2> <SI2> Most of people decorate their living room with family portraits or cellebrating photos on the walls or shelves, so if some people visit their friend's house, they will have a time in a living room, and at that time I'm sure that they will see them. It is doubtless that they give the visitors the house's and family's image.<TR>About two weeks ago</TR>, I read in a newspaper that some interior designer said that he always consider the design of the living room most because the structure and mood of the room decide all of things in a house. As seen the above example, since the image of living room can influence the other things in a house, it is the most important room paid attetion to.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, as shown above, I think the living room is the most important room in terms of the place of party and getting the power of chaging a house's image. If we have a living room being spacious enough and having good decorations, the relation between family members will be more firmly and we can give an unforgettable impression to visitors.</CO>
column23: This was an above average quality essay. The thesis was excellently written. There were excellent transitions thathelped move the essay to the final conclusion.

column3: <IN><TS>In these day, capitalism made several big cities which are quite different from small towns. Some people say that a small town is good to live others say it is so inconvenient than living in a big city. <TR>In my opinion</TR>, a small town is more good to live because of having beautiful places and clean environment.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>A small town have so many beautiful places that we can return to nature. Small towns beautiful places give us emotional stability. It is unartificial, so we can intimate with an environment.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>For example</TR>, I have once lived a small town where it was near the East sea. column1: 692&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>I agree with the statement, ¡°Parents are the best teachers.¡± There are several reasons why I think that way. <TS><TR>First of all</TR>, the majority of children spend most of the time with their parents. <TR>Also</TR>, young children tend to mimic their parents¡¯ actions. <TR>Lastly</TR>, parents are the one who know best about the children. <TR>Therefore</TR> parents should set good models for children as teachers.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>During the children¡¯s childhood, they spend most of their time with their parents. <TR>Most of the time</TR>, it is the parents who provide the basic foundation of learning for the children</MI1>. <SI1><EX> For example, my dad used to read me a story every night before I slept.</EX> <TR>As a result</TR>, I still like reading books. Also it was my mom who first taught me the alphabets of Korean. Not only do parents affect children¡¯s learning ability, but they also influence their emotional and social abilities</SI1>. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, it was studied that children who are were raised in peaceful and happy families tend to have less emotional or social problems.</EX></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, young children usually mimic what they see.</MI2> <SI2> Young children don¡¯t have an ability to define what is wrong and what is right yet. <TR>However</TR>, many of them consider the actions their parents take are right.<TR>Often times</TR>, they learn manners and politeness by imitating their parents. <TR>In our culture</TR>, people bow their heads as greeting and children learn to do so by mimicking what their parents are doing.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Lastly</TR>, parents are ones who bore and watched children growing.</MI3> <SI3>Not a single teacher would know better about each individual child than parents would. Parents know things their children are good and things they are interested in. <TR>Historically</TR>, there are many parents who influenced a lot on their children¡¯s successes. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, the mother of Edison encouraged him even though he was expelled from the school. It was mainly because she knew Edison¡¯s talents.</EX> <TR>Also</TR>, parents possess love that no other teachers can possess.</SI3></BO3><CO>I agree with the statement ¡°Parents are the best teachers.¡± Children spend most of their time with their parents and mimic their actions. <TR>Lastly</TR>, parents know best about their children. Maybe parents wouldn¡¯t be as good teacher in teaching academic materials as schoolteachers are. <TR>However</TR>, they make foundation for academic skills and play great role in improving children¡¯s emotional skills and social skills. Parents are the best teacher children can ever get.</CO>
column23: This essay has great structure and content but mainly has an issue with the thesis statement which is fragmented and spread throughout the introduction rather than being presented clearly, comprehensively in on short statement.

column1: 693&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? A person¡¯s childhood years (the time from birth to 12 years of age) are the most important years of a person¡¯s life. Use specific reason and example to support your answer. (T-1)
column3: <IN><TS><TR>Basically</TR>, I agree with the position that the time from birth to 12 years of age may be important in many ways. I, however, believe that the years between birth and age 12 – that is, childhood- are not the most important years of a person¡¯s life.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>There are many periods in life as important as childhood.</MI1> <SI1> <TR>Indeed</TR>, Many researchers argue that the years between 12 and 18- that is, adolescence- will actually determine, in large measure, what the adult will become. This is when the mind fed with intermediate and higher education.The adolescence finds out their interests and aptitudes and makes the plan for the future.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Rodin, one of the greatest painters in the nineteenth century, discovered his talents in painting and determined to be painter at the age of fourteen.</MI2> <SI3>When is the most important in Rodin¡¯s life? Childhood? or Adolescence when he met with painting?<SI3></BO3><<CO>I agree with the time from birth to 12 years of age may be important, but there is no reason to think they are necessarily the most important part of life. There are many important periods in life such as childhood, adolescence, adulthood. Each period has its own function. All these functions are important and essential. <TR>Thus<TR>, it is unreasonable to say one period in life is the most important.</CO>

column1: 694&The government has announced that it plans to build a new university. Some people think that your community would be a good place to locate the university. Compare the advantages and disadvantages of establishing a new university in your community. Use specific details in your discussion.
column3: <IN><TS>Locating a new university in my community has some advantages but also has some disadvantages. People in my community can use the university's new institution such as a gym and by locating a university, my community can be prospered. <TR>Otherwise</TR>, the traffic jam can occur and it may cause a great noise.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>More than anything else</TR>, the most significant advantage through locating a new university is that people in my community are able to use its new institutions such as gyms and swimming pools. It will give the people great convenience.</MI1> <SI1> <TR>As an illustration of this</TR>, Myung-Ji University, located in my community opens its gym every weekend to public people.<TR>Therefore</TR>, every weekend I am able to play basketball with my friends there. I think it is the greatest merit of locating a university in my community.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, if a new university is located in my community, my community will prosper.</MI2> <SI2> It is true that there are many restaurants and bookstores near a university. Bong-chun dong, where Seoul National University is located, has countless cafes and bookstores. It will be greatly useful for people in my community.<TR>Furthermore</TR, the value of the land will go up.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>However</TR>, there can be disadvantages if a new university is located in my community.</MI3> <SI3><TR>First of all</TR>, it will cause a terrible traffic jam. Every morning, not only people who live there but also many university students are on the road. <TR>Thus</TR>, the roads will be filled with cars. <TR>For instance</TR>, every morning I see a terrible traffic jam near Myung-Ji University.</SI3></BO3><BO4><MI4><TR>Secondly</TR>, people who live in my community will experience a great noise.</MI4> <SI4>They have to suffer a great car noise in every morning. Moreover, at night, the site must be very noisy because many restaurants and bars are located near the university and there are probably many people. One of my friend who lives in Bong-chun dong, once said to me that there are hundreds people in Bong-chun dong even at midnight. <TR>Furthermore</TR>, they make a great noise. I think this is the greatest disadvantage of locating a university. </SI4></BO4><CO>To conclude, locating a new university have some advantages but it also have some drawbacks. I think people in my community should decide after deeply considering and debating the subject a lot.</CO>
