column1: 696&Some people believe that university students should be required to attend classes. Others believe that going to classes should be optional for students. Which point of view do you agree with? Use specific reasons and details to explain your answer.
column3: <IN> <TS>Many people in their twenties attend universities. Some like to hear splendid lessons by professors, while others find some lessons tiresome and unuseful. Even some complain that universities should give students freedoms of taking classes. I agree with the opinion that students ought to have the choices to attend classes.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, learning by themselves is the "true learning".</MI1> <SI1>What I mean is that universities should give students rights to do self-research of self-projects. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, in Korea, most teachers just "preach" students and seldom instruct experiments. However, some well-known educators say that learning by themselves and doing self-researches should be called the "true learning".</EX> <TR>Thus</TR>, in order to "truly learn", students must have some time that are able to be taken from attending unimportant classes.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, taking lessons which is about something students already know is just wasting time.</MI2> <SI2> Instead of enforcing them to attend such lessons.universities have to encourage students either to go to library or to attend more lessons that are concerned with students' majors.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>However</TR>, in spite of giving students freedoms of taking lessons, there are certain problems that follow after that. One of them is the lack of instructions</MI3>. <SI3>Students should learn the knowledge by themselves, but without instructions, which are given from the lessons, they will hardly infer the main ideas of lessons or experiments. They will even don't know how-to.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I suggest universities give the rights for attending classes, because students would have more time, so that they can learn what they like or save time to do other things they need. <TR>However</TR>, I'm worried with that without attending lessons, they will achieve the "true learning" with difficulties.</CO>
column23: This is an extremely balanced and complete essay except for body paragraph two. It is very nice to read and has many great main and supporting points throughout. It is a great essay.

column1: 697&A person you know is planning to move to your town or city. What do you think this person would like and dislike about living in your town or city? Why? Use specific reasons and details to develop your essay.
column3: <IN><TS>My city whose name is Cheong-ju is not big city. Its size is medium and population is also appropriate to live. If my friend or intimate person move to my city, he or she will feel two apparent good point: one is clean environment, the other is convenient traffic system. He also can know one bad point: there is not enough a cultural exchange to enjoy his life.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>One merit what Cheong-ju has is clean.</MI1> <SI1> If one comes from big city like Seoul or Pusan, one will be surprised how the city can such a clean. Moreover, there are many clean places to enjoy taking a walk or jogging.The city is not polluted seriously and the number of cars is not many in comparison with big cities, so the air is very clean.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>The other merit is good transportation system.</MI2> <SI2> Cheong-ju is not so far from Seoul which is a capital of my country. Highways are well developed, so we need just one and half ours to move. <TR>Besides</TR>, Tai-jon which is another metropolis is very close to my city; we need just forty minutes to go there.<TR>Moreover</TR>, the roads in city are also cleanly arranged and transportations are very convenient. No one will not feel inconvenient about transportation.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Of course</TR>, my city has some bad point.</MI3> <SI3>The worsen is lack of cultural places. Population of my city is not high, so the demand of cultural is poor. Public performances are not usually held in this city such as dramatic performaces or musicals. We can easily see movies in theater, but hardly see concerts or orchestras.</SI3></BO3><CO>In these ways, my city has some advantages and some disadvantages. It may not same respectively what the person feels. <TR>However</TR>, it will be a good choice living my city if a person really likes its advantages.</CO>
column23: This is a very good and comprehensive essay that has great main and supporting points .It may be too long in some parts however as the body paragraphs overshadow the introduction and conclusions.

column1: 698&You have received a money. The money is enough to buy either a piece of jewelry you like or tickets to a concert you want to attend. Which would you buy? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>When I received a gift of money. I'd rather buy a concert tickets than jewelry. Certainly it depends on one's mind, however, A short impression cannnot replace the pleasure of life. <TR>In my case</TR>, attending a concert of my favorite singer will be a best present in my life. </TS><IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, a concert can give you the long-lasting impression.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>For example</TR>, I went to the concert last year with my friend. The singer was whom I desired to see, and concert was filled with crowds head-banging, dancing and yelling.</EX> Even though I experienced it last year. It still remains a special gift in my life. <TR>So</TR>, I think its value is above that of jewelry.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Next</TR>, a concert relieves me from stress in my life.</MI2> <SI2><TR>For example</TR>, attending a rock concert, It is natural for me head-banging and dancing in the place. Shaking head and sweating delete high tense in my nerve and help me go back to the society where I came from.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>However</TR>, I jewerly's alluring appearance is attracting and alluring.</MI3> <SI3>A gorgeous jewerly of one's hand makes that person noble and sophisticated. But, I don't think it is important to consider others view, especially in expenditure. To make myself ultimatly happy, It is critical to have my own happiness, an emotion from myself.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In short</TR>, probably the choice is depends on one's point of view, however, A in depth pleasure of a concert would certainly prevail a happiness from jewerly, which cover you to be seen more attractive. Remember, It is crucial to find one's happiness from inside of oneself, not the outside of oneself.</CO>
column23: This essay is all right. Your thesis statement is good, but your introduction needs to stay focused on the concert. The same goes for your body paragraphs. Take out the third one about jewelry completely. It doesn't help your argument.

column1: 699& A company has announced that it wishes to build a large factory near your community. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of this new influence on your community. Do you support or oppose the factory? Explain your position.
column3: <IN><TS>If a large factory build in our community, some residents in our community may oppose the factory because it may cause a pollution of environment like air pollution, water pollution. But, it's okay if a large factory has the facility that purify the materials of pollution. In my opinion, building a large factory near our community has more advantages than disadvantages.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, a large factory can offer a lot of jobs for our community's unemployed people.</MI1> <SI1>They can get a job and they can earn money. Building a large company near our community means the solution of unemployment problem in our community.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, our community can get some compensation money.</MI2> <SI2>As I above-mentioned, building a large company near our community cause the air pollution, water pollution and so on. A company that wishes build a large company near our community also knows that, so we can get some compensation money from the company. We can use the money for the community development-fund.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Finally</TR>, our community can prosper due to increasing of the population.</MI3> <SI3>If a large company build near our community, other communities' residents may migrate to our community acquire a job in the factory. As the population increases, our community may prosper.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I support that a large company build near our community for above-mentioned reasons, it can offer jobs, compensation money and prosperity in our community.</CO>
column23: You have a good essay here, but it needs much more in the body. Add examples, research, and more speculation. What would your community do with the compensation money? How would a larger population impact your community? Is unemployment a big problem where you live?

column1: 700&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Playing games teaches us about life. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>I think that playing games gives us a lot of things about life. In our life, we have some regulations that have to observe, like law, and playing games also has rules that players have to oblige during game period. <TS><TR>In other points of view</TR>, in games, players cooperate each other to fulfill the winning, and in life, we must help each other to establish our goal of life and be happy. <TR>Then</TR>, I will explain why I think so.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, like our life, playing games have rules that we have to observe.</MI1> <SI1>In life, we have a low that, in everyday life, we must regulate to prevent criminals. <TR>In games</TR>, players have regulations too. They have to oblige these to prevent accidents during games.</SI1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, in our life, we have to cooperate each other like playing games.<MI2> <SI2> In games, players must cooperate each other to achieve team's winning. If each player does his own game, this team never wins in games. Similarly, in life, people must help each other to improve our life, ultimately to achieve their goals in life, and by cooperating each other people can feel that they are alive.Aristotle said that 'human is social animal'. In games and life, by cooperating, people can be a social existence.</SI2></BO2><CO>In games, people can feel rapture, sadness, frustration, and so on. In life, we can feel these things, too. Playing games is one kind of life. Everything what has life has games. So, I agree that playing games teaches us about life</CO>
column23: This is a below average quality esssay. The thesis is fairly weak as it doesn't give a great preview of the main points that will be given. This is reflected in the rest of the essay as the main and supporting points are weak and without substance.

column1: 701&What are some of the qualities of a good parent? Use specific details and examples to explain your answer.
column3: <IN>People say that the most difficult thing in the world is to be a good parent. <TS>Because of its hardness and importance, people always wonder about qualities of good parents and have their opinion about that. <TR>In my view</TR> to become a good parent needs to have some attributes such as trust and unconditioned love</TS></IN>. <BO1><MI1>The first quality for this is trust about their child.</MI1> <SI1>Let's say that there are parents who always have a doubt about their child and check every routine. Maybe the child can¡¯t stand it, and eventually want to escape from one¡¯s parents. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, if they are fully trusted by their parents, most children grow well.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>What is more, the significant factor of good parents is unconditioned love.</MI2> <SI2> although most parents love their child, some parents love their child on condition of doing something they expect. <TR>For instance</TR>, my uncle does not even meet his daughter now because she married to a guy he hate.<TR>In my opinion</TR>, though he raise her hardly and gave her good education, he is not a good father. Nice parents always love one¡¯s child, and don¡¯t expect the child only to do things that they hope.</SI2></BO2><CO>As stated above, good parents need to trust their child no matter who he/she is and always love his/her no matter what happens. If people give much thought to positive aspects of trust and unconditioned love, most people would agree with my view.</CO>
column23: This is a below average quality essay. There is some structure to the essay, and the thesis is quite good. A few of the paragraphs could have been longer, it would have been better with more transitions to help the flow of the essay.

column1: 702&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? People behave differently when they wear different clothes. Do you agree that different clothes influence the way people behave? Use specific examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Most Korean high school students wear their school uniform, and they are well known for their sincerity to their learining and desirable behavior in school life. Many people say that their uniform would influence their behavior. <TS>I also agree the insistence. <TR>In other words</TR>, different clothes influence the way people behave in that people work harder in the uniform of their job and the type of clothes could make people more active or less active.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, when people wear their community uniform, they would try their best.</MI1> <SI1><TR>For instance</TR>, a cook usually wears a white jacket and white hat. This symbolize the clearliness of his food and he try to make more fresh and more delicious food when he is in his uniform. Another example is policeman who wear the uniform. I never have heard that policeman in their uniform commited a crime. They also do their best for their commision. <TR>Thus</TR>, the uniform of the job would help people do their best.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, people could be more active or less active according to their clothes.</MI2> <SI2><EX><TR>For example</TR>, people who wear jean and training clothes could enjoy sports and dancing in club</EX>. <TR>On contrary</TR>, people who wear suit are more careful of their behavior. They try not to wrinkle it and not to get it dirty. <TR>In addition</TR>, it is very difficult to play sports when they wear the suit. <TR>Thus</TR>, I am sure that people's behavior depends on their cloth.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, people behave differently when they different clothes. People in their community uniform would work harder and people would decide to take part in some activity after consideration of their clothes. These could be the reason why many communities are careful of determining their uniform.</CO>
column23: This is an average quality essay. The thesis is nicely written though th main points are a bit weak.

column1: 703&Some people believe that it is very important to make large amounts of money. While others are satisfied to earn a comfortable living. Analize each view point and take the stand.
column3: <IN><TS>In modern society, money plays a very important role in people's life. Everyone tend to earn money for many reasons like desire to live in a better environment, instinct to show off their own richness. Based on these reasons there are two types of people: one who wants to earn money as much as they can, and the other who is content with money that satisfy comfortable life.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>Person who tend to make large amount of money affect society mainly in negative ways although there are a few merits.</MI1> <SI1>To earn much money they will do their best, and it can be helpful to development of our society. <TR>On the other hand</TR> they may persuit only money, as a result they will do anything that gives them money like drug selling, monopoly. These actions will ,at last, harm our society.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Compared to people I mentioned above, person who are satisfied to earn a comfortable living can live more happily without meaningless desire.</MI2> <SI2> They will not stick to earning money. <TR>Instead</TR>, they may find what they really like, and although that doesn't make a lot of money, they can have a fruitful life.We can easily know these things through TV because there are many news like this: While rich politicians go to jail because of their wrong way to make money, poor people help poorer people.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I think money should be regarded as a mean rather than an end. We live in a valuable society, so we had better turn around the world and look other sides besides money. Then we can make our society healthier place to live.</CO>
column23: This is an average quality essay that is help up by its great thesis statement. This is carried into the main body of the essay through the decent main body points.

column1: 704&Learning about the past has no value for those of us living in the present. Do you agree or disagree? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>I do not agree with the position that learning about the past has no value for those of us living in the present. <TR>As a matter of fact</TR>, learning about past give people alot of information. There are two reasons for this. Past can show us what kind of fault what people made and we can learn some of remarkable cultures. After people make several mistakes, they recognize how to manage the similar problems.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>As people learn about history, they will be ready to solve any similar problem.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>For example</TR>, long time ago, Koreans did not want to attain the culture of southern country</EX>. <TR>As a result</TR>, we were too late to get on the board of advanced culture. Now, we know the importance of acceptance of new culture and try to be developed.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>There are so many great cultures that we need to study and follow.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>For example</TR>, Korean ancesters had wonderful things what we should learn and research</EX>. By the studying of history, Koreans know what their forefather invented. <TR>And today</TR>, they try to make those again. <TR>Also</TR>, through the past, people know how to get along with other people. <TR>In the past</TR>, people usually gave foods, which they made on special day, to their neighbors. That kind of habits made people so warm and I believe people should learn that kind of wisdoms from past, and do it in presents.</SI2></BO2><CO>As I stated above, It is sure that, past have much value for that we can get alot of information and wisdom. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I do not agree with the perspective that past is not important.</CO>
column23: This is an above average quality essay. The thesis statement is a little weak because it does not probably introduce the topics that will be taken by the essay. It does however have great supporting points.

column1: 705&A company has announced that it wishes to build a large factory near your community. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of this new influence on your community. Do you support or oppose the factory? Explain your position.
column3: <IN><TS>I do not want a company to build a large factory near my home.It is true that the factory may bring many jobs and can develope our home town, however, it also may bring several disadvantages to my hometown.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, a large factory could harm the beautiful scenic of my hometown.</MI1> <SI1>My community has been famous for great natural view, lakes, mountains and valleys. Many tourists have visited my hometown to enjoy those beautiful scenic. If a large factory is built in my hometown, the beautiful scenic can be disappeared because of the pollution that may be caused by the factory. The number of tourists to visit my hometown will be decreased dramatically. And it also induces to build many related buildings near factory. These buildings can block the great scenic of my town when it becomes impossible to see that scenic in town because of high buildings.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, a large factory may bring lots of people into my hometown.<MI2> <SI2>It means many people cause many problems, that is, they bring lots of cars and make noise. <EX> For example, the roads near town would be compacted because of rapidly gatherd cars<EX>. <TR>Needless to say</TR>, it causes lots of car accidents and makes noise sound. And it also brings lots of buglars and crimminals. The native people who have lived long ago and have not had to be careful their belong before the built of a factory should prepare some protections in case of robber.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, a large factory could cause lots of problems. It might harm the beautiful scenic of my hometown ,bring accidents, robberies and buglars and make noise. From the above reasons, I oppose a large factory to be built near my community.</CO>
column23: This is an average quality essay. The introduction is a bit too short and doesn't include a thesis satement that guideds the essay very well. Most of the points are made by just staying with the main points and not by the taking of risks in creativity.

column1: 706&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Reading fiction(such as novels and short stories) is more enjoyable than watching movies. Use specific reasons and examples to explain your position.
column3: <IN><TS>Film maker used to make a film with a fiction written some author. Many people enjoy to see the movie and especially, people who read the fiction want to see the movie. This is because watching movie is more interesting than reading a fiction. In other words, seeing movie is more enjoyalble than reading fiction in that I can use various senses and recent movie technology stimulate my imagination.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, when I see a movie, I use various senses.</MI1> <SI1>When I watch a movie, I enjoy images through a big screen and I heard the sound touching with my mind. <TR>Two years ago</TR>, I read the fiction 'To Kill a Mockingbird' and also watched the movie. Although the fiction was very interesting, the movie was more exciting. I saw the little southern houses and heard interesting southern accent of children. <TR>Thus</TR>, I enjoy seeing a movie because of using of various senses.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, recent movie technology stimulate my imagination.</MI2> <SI2> They show me unexpected scenes. <TR>For instance</TR>, the movie 'Terminater' was very popular and it is well known for its advanced movie technology. I saw the scenes which is not written by words and I was excited with the world of imagination. These made me laugh and relieve my stress.<TR>Therefore</TR>, the movie is more interesting because it take me the world of imagination through the recent technology.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, seeing a movie is more enjoyable than reading fiction. I is moved the movie by using ear and eye and is excited with wonderful scenes using recent technology. These could be reasons why film maker make the popular fiction the movie.</CO>
column23: This is an average quality essay. There is a nice thesis statement given, but it would have been nice if the author had used the structure of the paragraphs to bring out the examples given.

column1: 707&You need to travel from your home to a place 40 miles (64 kilometers) away. Compare the different kinds of transportation you could use. Tell which method of travel you would choose. Give specific reason for your choice.
column3: <IN><TS>There are many kinds of transportation to travel from my home to a place 40 miles away. Some possibilities are walking, driving, or using a taxi, bus, or train. Which transportation I choose depends on their cost, my taste, and reality etc.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, I would be able to travel by car.</MI1> <SI1>The car reduces a travel time to minimal, with only the cost of gasoline. <TR>However</TR>, I don¡¯t have driver¡¯s license. <TR>For I choose this option</TR>, I have to take a driver¡¯s license and buy a private car. Even hiring the representative as driver or shared taxi is expensive to me. Public transportation such as a bus, subway train, or train is affordable form. I live in rural area, where there are few buses and train to ride and no subway trains. One of these wouldn¡¯t be my choice.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>The most economical choice is walking. It cost nothing, is healthful even though it needs much time.</MI2> <SI2> I love to hiking, so this trip would be a great journey. While I walking along a river, I can enjoy fresh air and chattering birds. <TR>Of course</TR>, I would probably have to spend the night somewhere along the way. And, it would take at least 10 hours to get there. Irrespective of how much time it takes, I will go for a walk during the trip. Walking, as you all know, is very helpful to our health.<TR>As much as possible</TR>, I would like to go on a trip with my friends. Whenever I exhausted, I could not only talk with him but also have lunch together. <TR>Also</TR>, we can be more familiar with each other than before we take a trip.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, I will choose transportation depends on how much money I have and what I want to in the journey. I f I take time into consideration, I can¡¯t choose hiking. <TR>Personally</TR>, I¡¯ve believed that the course of trip could be deserved to remember in my mind and as much important as arriving at destination. In addition, I would like to get experienced from the special choice.</CO>
column23: This is an above quality essay. The thesis is well written and gives reasons behind the position of the essay. The structure is also very nice.

column1: 708&What are some important qualities of a good supervisor (boss)? Use specific details and examples to ex-plain why these qualities are important.
column3: <IN>In spite of the fact that there are a wide variety of jobs that are different from on another, there are qualities that are common to all the supervisors. <TS><TR>As far as I am concerned</TR>, I would pick up leadership, ability to coagulate team members, fair treatment and objective evaluation of employees as the most sig-nificant qualities for a good boss.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, a good supervisor must be equipped with excellent leadership.</MI1> <SI1>He or she should be capable of setting up and organizing the task at hand, keeping his or her employees understand what to be done at each instant. He or she also needs to be good at delegating authorities to his or her employees so that he or she may keep an eye on the big picture of the task while detailed ones are effectively carried out by the employees. <TR>In addition</TR>, he or she must be able to put continuous thrust to the task to finish it successfully.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>A good boss should also possess the ability to make all of the team members to cooperate with each other.<MI2> <SI2><TR>that is</TR>, he or she must be able to fuse the specific abilities of the individuals to achieve the ultimate goal of the team and to prevent possible conflict among the team members.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Besides</TR>, a good boss should not discriminate his or her employees, that is, he or she must not single out a certain employee for better or worse treatment.</MI3> <SI3><TR>Similarly</TR>, he or she must avoid evaluating the employees based on his or her personal feeling. The evaluation should be accomplished by a set of rea-sonable criteria.</SI3></BO3><CO>Summarizing, to be a good supervisor, I strongly recommend that one should be equipped with leadership to successfully achieve the goal, ability to lead the employees to collaborate each other as well as impartiality in treating and evaluating the employees. <TR>Furthermore</TR>, it may be more desirable if he or she is able to show the employees his or her standard for a good boss by his or her own behavior.</CO>
column23: This is a below average quality esssay. The thesis is fairly weak as it doesn't give a great preview of the main points that will be given. This is reflected in the rest of the essay as the main and supporting points are weak and without substance.

column1: 709&If you were asked to send one things representing your country to an international exhibition, what would you choose? Why? Use specific reason and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>Exhibition is the place we represent our characteristic. <TS><TR>Especially</TR> in international exhibition case, we have to send one thing advertising our country carefully. We notice what our country is through this exhibition. I¡¯d like to send "HUN MIN JEONG EUM", KOEAM letter. The reasons are it is unique language of KOREA and easy to learn it.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>HUM MIN JEONG EUM is Korea¡¯s own charter.</MI1><SI1> It has been over 500 years old since it wad invented. So far, we can not find similar to this letter in the world. Also linguist recognized its originality. There is difference between HUN MIM JEOG HUM and English. English has 5 vowels, but we have 11 vowels. Its symbol and sound correlation are closer than English. <TR>Like this</TR>, special character stands for KOREA and intrigue world¡¯s people.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, it is easy to learn.</MI2> <SI2> When King CHE JONG, inventor HUM MIN JEONG EUM, created it, he consider communication among all classes of people. It means that he made as easy alphabet as the lowest class learn it. Symbol and sound correlation helps people learn it without difficulty.<TR>Now</TR>, almost everyone can read and write, because of high education as well as easy letter.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>As I mentioned</TR>, The HUM MIN JEONG EUM displays KOREA well, because of a great originality and facility to understand it. It must be popular among others in the exhibition.</CO>

column1: 710&What are some important qualities of a good supervisor (boss)? Use specific details and examples to ex-plain why these qualities are important.
column3: <IN>There are some valuable personalities of a good supervisor. <TS>To become a good supervisor, he/she should try to be a good leader and have generous mind to his/her employees. I will show why to be a good leader and have generous mind are so important to become a good boss.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, a boss who has great leadership can lead his/her team to emerge from a difficult situation.</MI1> <SI1><EX><TR>For example</TR>, when the company is in a financial crisis, so mamy employees are wondering about what they should do for the company, a boss with great leadership can lead them proficiently and get out of the crisis quickly</EX>. And another example can be found in a meeting of the marketing company. When two employees are arguing about the way of advertisement, their boss have to make a decision without hurting a eager of work. It is only possible when a boss has great leadership because employees believe their boss.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, to be familiar with his/her employees, a boss should have generous mind. In case of a small accident in a company, a boss has to try to accept the mistake of his/her employee and that induces more creative work to the employee who did a mistake.</MI2> <SI2><TR>That is to say</TR>, if all employees think their boss as their old senior or old neighbor, of coursely, the environment of that company will be full of cheers.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I think important quantitied of a good boss are largely two things, to have a great leadership and generous mind. <TR>As I stated before</TR>, great leadership can be a guideline when the company is in trouble and generous mind leads to a very cheeful company.</CO>
column23: This is a below average quality essay. There is some structure to the essay, but the thesis is quite weak. The main and supporting points are therefore not very strong and the essay suffers clarity and focus despite the length.

column1: 711&In general, people are living longer now. Discuss the causes of this phenomenon. Use specific reasons and details to develop your essay.
column3: <IN><TS>People are living longer now than before. <TR>Of course</TR>, a great number of factors may influence this phenomenon, but in my opinion, the most significant causes are better nutrition, popularization of medical care, and advances in biology and science.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>With the development of agricultural technology, we are provided with plenty of food, which was not the case even 100 years ago: people at that time suffered from lack of things to eat.</MI1> <SI1>A lot of people died from hunger. Nowadays it¡¯s hard to imagine that kind of starvation-induced death. In addition to the quantity of available food, progress of agricultural technology has also resulted in the increased variety of food. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, we enjoy nearly every kind of vegetables and fruits all around the year</EX>. <TR>Altogether</TR>, agricultural developments have yielded our better nutrition.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Popularization of medical care has contributed to lengthen our life span, too.</MI2> <SI2> <TR>Previously</TR>, it was not so easy for ordinary people to get medical care: hospitals were not common as well as their costs were extremely expensive for mediocre people to get medical treatment.<TR>In contrast</TR>, there are many doc-tors and hospitals everywhere, and everyone can get elementary medical examination and treatment at reasonable cost, which also enables us to live longer than before.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3>Another important cause for extended life span is development of biology and science. With the advance of biology, people today know a lot more about our body and diseases than ever before, which helps to immunize and deal with many of the diseases that could not be treated previously</MI3>. <SI3><TR>Besides</TR>, scien-tific advances such as engineering development provided us with a variety of useful machineries to be applied to the area of medical care such as investigation and surgery.</SI3></BO3><CO>All in all, such causes as better nutrition induced by agricultural advances, popularization of medical care accompanied by increased number of doctors and hospitals as well as reduced cost for medi-cal care, and ceaseless accretion of knowledge about our body and diseases by developments in biology and science has considerably affected our longer life span than before. Now we ought to exert ourselves to let everybody rejoice the aforementioned benefits to live as long as they want.</CO>
column23: This is an above quality essay. The thesis is well written and gives reasons behind the position of the essay. The structure is also very nice. The good ideas in the introduction don't seem to make it out in the context of the essay, however. The main ideas and supporting ideas there are a long but disorganized.

column1: 712&A company announced that it wishes to build a large factory near your community. Discuss the advantage and disadvantages of this new influence in your community. Do you support or oppose the factory? Explain your position.
column3: <IN><TS>We can easily see the factory near community. Factories can¡¯t stand it alone, it maybe stand near the community because it needs manpower. And people can show their own opinion about the factory near their community. People can opposite because it makes nature polluted. And people can approve this because it makes labor.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, factories can make nature polluted.<MI1> <SI1> People have right to breathe clean air, drink clean water. If a factory is found near the community, it pollutes the air and water. But modern environmental engineering has very developed.<TR>Therefore</TR> concerned about nature pollution problem could be solved.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, factory can make labor.</MI2> <SI2>If a factory is built near your community, they will collect labors in your community first. It can prevent loss-work problem. And the economy of the community will be actual because funds are exchanged busily.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, if a factory is built near my community, it can pollute nature of our community.But it can prevent by modern environmental engineering. Nevertheless factory will be prevented from loss-work problem and economy of our community will be more actual.</CO>

column1: 713&Some people believe that a college or university education should be available to all students. Others believe that higher education should be available only to good students. Discuss there views which view do you agree with? Explain why.
column3: <IN>Everyone has different preferences when it comes to choosing who need to be available for college or university education. <TS><TR>In general</TR>, however, it is possible to distinguish two major kinds: available to all students and available only to good students. <TR>In other words<TR>, the former makes many educated people who have different characteristics. <TR>However</TR> the latter stimulate students to study hard.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>All people has different environment. Different parents, friends, home, etc.</MI1> <SI1><TR>According to that fact</TR>, there is no one who think in same way. <TR>In this society</TR>, people need a lot of new ideas. <TR>As a results</TR>, students who learned from colleges will be helpful, in that, they will provide a lot of fascinating ideas.<TR>In my church</TR>, I was one of the faculties of students leader gruop. We had a discussion every week. Sometimes, there were lots of people and sometimes only a few of us had to hold a discussion. I felt that more people we had, more ideas we suggested. <TR>Therefore</TR>, providing college or university education to everybody will be good for the future.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, providing college or university education to good students stimulate students who do not study hard.<MI2> <SI2><TR>In these days</TR>, many students do not prepare their own future. And even though there are a few students who study very hard, they will not fill competing each others that much. In addition, students' study skill will be reduced. And this situation will provide slower development. But, educating student who are good will give a tension to students. In Korea, admitting good colleges is very difficult.<TR>For that</TR>, students study so hard to be accepted from those colleges. So, it is sure that educating just good students in college or university give some tension to students.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>Generally</TR>, peolple show different attitudes toward choosing who need to be given college or university education. <TR>In my opinion</TR>, I choose that all students have to be educated in college or university. This is because our society needs various people who have many ideas because everything is changing. Priority should be given to providing college or university education to all students.</CO>

column1: 714& Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Watching television is bad for children. Use specific details and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>I do not think watching television is always bad for children. As the coin has two sides, watching television has both good and bad effects. Let me talk about bad effects first.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>If children spend too much time on watching television, it is likely that they have a risk of being a couch potato.</MI1> <SI1>They will spend less time on exercise and weaken their physical strength and eyesight. <TR>Furthermore</TR>, since children are not mature enough to accept ideas from outside critically, they could soak up what television shows to the letter. As a passive watcher of the same thing as other children, they might lose creativity which should be developed when they are young and sensitive.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, watching television has some good effects.</MI2> <SI2> As long as used rightly, television serves as an easy way for children to learn. From the TV programs such as ¡°Sesame Street,¡± they can learn alphabets with fun and ease. Another substantial effect on children¡¯s education comes from documentary programs like ¡°Kingdom of Animals.¡± Without going to the zoo, mountains, seas, they can meet wild lives easily and broaden their knowledge on the nature and the earth.No wonder TV is such an effective tool to provide children with useful and educational information.</SI2></BO2><CO>What matters is not just whether children watch television or not. <TR>Rather</TR>, how long and which programs they watch should be concerned. If parents restrict watching time and select good programs, watching television will be a good helper with children¡¯s education.</CO>
column23: This is a below average quality esssay. The thesis is fairly weak as it doesn't give a great preview of the main points that will be given. This is reflected in the rest of the essay as the main and supporting points are weak and without substance.

column1: 715&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? People are never satisfied with what they have; they always something more or something different. Use specific reasons to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>Some people agree that people want to get something more and new, while other people disagree with the opinion. <TR>Generally</TR>,people tend to desire to gain and experience someting more and diffent. I agree with the opinion that people are never satisfied with what they have. There are two reasons that show my opinion.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, eagering to procure something different is a part of human nature.</MI1> <SI1>Most of the people would like to get something better than what they have.It is not related with age and sex. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, my little cousin, who is 6 years old, really likes a toy to play with(to play with a toy). Althoug many such playthings as a princess doll, a animaldoll are already stocked in her room corner, he alway ask his mother to buy a different toy</EX>. <TR>In the same case</TR>, I also want to buy a better computer system, a nicer dress, and a more honorable job. My parents pursue more spacious, beautiful house for living.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, people would like to go travel.</MI2> <SI2> Most of the people do a rutine work all days, all weeks, eve all monthes. It make their life so tedious. My hobby is traveling other cities.I could deviate from boring my life though a travel.I could learned diffent culture, and I could have new experiences, information. I think most people prefer active life to boring work.</SI2></BO2><CO>consequently, I agree this attitude that people are never satisfied with what they have because of human nature as well as the tendency to persue something different. Who can deny that people have these desire?</CO>

column1: 716&Do you agree or not? Teacher should be paid according to how much their students learn.
column3: <IN><TR>Basically</TR>, I disagree with the position that teachers should be paid according to how much their students learn. <TS><TR>As a matter of fact</TR>, I believe that teachers' salary should be fixed, not according to student's grade. There are two reasons to support this perspective. Being almost impossible to measure how much students learn and teachers teach not only academic knowledge but also they teach many skills.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Above all</TR>, it is not acceptable since there is no way to evaluate precisely how much students learn.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Generally speaking</TR>, people think that who have high grade are smarter and have more knowledge than who do not. <TR>However</TR>, there are many people who success with low grade. It means that who have high grades are always smarter and have more knowledge. <EX>One of my friends, whose grade was very low, entered a very famous university in Korea. Although his school grade was so low, he had more knowledge than any other student in our high school.</EX><SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>What's more, students learn not only academic knowledge but also many skills and wisdom needing to live in society from their teachers.</MI2> <SI2>To live with others people need to learn many skills such as understanding others, making friends, how to do work with other persons, or etc. These skills sometimes are more important than knowledge from books. <TR>Furthermore</TR>, these cannot be measured. When I was in middle school, I was so shy that I couldn't make many friends. However, my teacher often asked me to do something important thing in front of class. <TR>Then</TR>, I could have more confident so that I was able to escape from shyness and made many good friends. Were not for my teacher, I still should be shy boy.</SI2></BO2><CO>As stated above, it is unreasonable that teachers' salary should to be changeable according to student's grade. Because it is almost impossible to evaluate students' learning precisely and teachers teach not only knowledge from textbooks but also they teach social skills and wisdom. <TR>Therefore</TR>, it is impossible to pay teachers as how much students learn.</CO>

column1: 717&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Watching television is bad for children. Use specific details and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>It is true that there are some benefits and some negative points through watching television. <TR>However</TR>, especially for children, television influences negatively more than gives benefits. <TS>Children believe and imitate what they see in a television because they cannot judge between the true or thje false. I will describe why a televison is bad for children with presenting reasons and examples.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, there are a lot of abscene programs in television broadcasting that can influence badly the mental world of children. I heard a news that a child killed his younger brother with imitating a movie from a television which is about a famous killer. That is done because children like to imitate a character of a movie</MI1>. <EX>Another example can be easily found in a phycological hospital</EX>. <SI1>There are always many children who see lots of illusion because of watching televison too long.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, during the time when children should have fun outside with playing physical activity, a television catch them inside without any physical activity but watching television.</MI2> <EX><TR>For example</TR>, children more like to watch television than play outside because they want to see famous movie star and singer like Britny spears in the television</EX>. <SI2>Even though in physical classes, children do not want play soccer, basketball and so forth because they enjoy talking with classmates about television show.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, television has influenced more negatively than positively. That is, television has brought some phycological ailment to children, which are to imitate without judgement and to have illusion. <TR>Furthermore</TR>, a television has been a major factor of what children do not want play physical activities. Thus, I agree with that a television is bad for children.</CO>
column23: This is an above average quality statement. The thesis statement is a little weak, but the main points improve into example led supporting elements that are really well done.

column1: 718&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? There is nothing that young people can teach older people. Use specific reasons and examples to support your position.
column3: <IN><TS>As people grow, their experience and wisdom deepen. So, some people say that there is nothing that young peple can teach older people because of the lack of experience and wisdom. In my opinion, the young can teach the old how to use the e-mail and the carmera.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, young people can tell how to email.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Nowadays</TR>, many people become busy and they have no time to receive a phone call. <TR>For them</TR>, the call used to be an annoying thing even from the father to the son. <TR>At this case</TR>, the e-mail can be a good alternative, but most of the old don't know how to use the e-mail while most of the young know. <TR>To illustrate</TR>, if my grandmother want to talk to me and one young relative tells her how to email, she can send me an e-mail and I can read it whenever I'm free.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, another thing that young people can teach older people is how to use a carmera.</MI2> <SI2> A carmera can enrich the life of older people. For example, they often suffer from the emptiness because they think they can not do anything valueable anymore. <TR>However</TR>, if they learn how to use a carmera by a young person, they will take a picuture of their lovable grandchildren and their favorite scenary just for hobby.<TR>Therefore</TR>, learning taking picutres with a carmera by young people will make the life of older people active.</SI2></BO2><CO>In summary, young people can teach older people how to send an e-mail and how to use a carmera. These will make the old's life better.</CO>
column23: This is an average quality essay that is lacking much of an introduction or conclusion. The thesis is very well developed and so are the supporting elements. The main point is a little weak in comparison.

column1: 719&Do you agree or disagree the statement that playing a game is fun only when you win?
column3: <IN><TS>I like omok, a game of paduk with five checkers placed in a row. I am not such an every-time winner. <TR>However,</TR> I really enjoy playing omok. I would like to say playing a game is fun not only when you win, but also when you lose. ,BO1><MI1>I think to myself, ¡°Am I actually excited from winning whenever I play a game?¡± The answer is no.</MI1> <SI1>Surely, an all-the-time winner will never feel the true thrill from winning. No pains, no gains? No losing, no thrills! Losing is not just something that makes a loser depressed, upset, but that bring him more glory when he wins next time. I will take myself for example. I am not that best omok player and I do not always win. I am not saying I do not care whether to win. I do! If nobody beats me, <TR>however</TR>, I would not feel like playing it any more. <TR>Once I have lost</TR>, I play it with more enthusiasm to do better next time. The game without a defeater will not attract me.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Let¡¯s assume that you continue to win.</MI2> <SI2>Then, it is likely that you will not enjoy playing a game but play it just for winning! The purpose for your playing a game may be for fun or relaxing.<TR>However</TR>, a game for winning would render you stressed out. It is nothing but putting the cart without the horse.</SI2></BO2> <CO>Winning is a good thing and makes you feel proud and fulfilled. This is true because you lose sometimes. Then, now you know that winning is precious and losing makes it so.</CO>

column1: 720&Do you agree or not? Teacher should be paid according to how much their students learn.
column3: <IN><TS>I think it is nonsense that the pay of teachers is decided by how much students learn. I know that it is important to teach well for students so as to learn more, however, it might cause some problems to school. I will deploy this essay why teacher should not be judged and decided their salary by how much stedents learn.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Most of all</TR>, a teacher should help student to learn more and also give the way of living their lives honestly.</MI1> <SI1>If the pay of teacher is decideb by amount of giving imformation to students, teachers do not try to give and advise about the imformation of the positive way of living. And it goes without saying that the mental part of education will be valueless any more.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Another reason is that there would be a kind of competitive mood among teachers.</MI2> <SI2><TR>For instance</TR>, a well known mathmatic teacher from whom students get a lot of imformation might feel confident to other mathematic teachers and that causes the uncomfortable relations between them. <TR>That is</TR>, the other teachers might envy him. And it also can be shown negatively to students.</SI2></BO2><CO>To sum up with my opinion, the policy that gives pay according to the ability of teachers might cause several problems. It might cause that students cannot get any advice from their teacher and it also make the bad mood among teachers and disbelief between teacher and students. <TR>Thus</TR>, I do not agree with that teacher should be paid by amount of giving imformation to students.</CO>

column1: 721&"When people succeed, it is because of hard work. Luck has nothing to do with success.¡± Do you agree or disagree with the quotation above? Use specific reasons and examples to explain your position
column3: <IN><TS><TR>Basically</TR>, I agree with the position that hard working makes success possible. <TR>As a matter of fact</TR>, I believe that people who do not work hard never be able to success. There are two reasons to support this perspective. Only hard working makes dream come true and without endeavor, one cannot make many opportunity.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Above all</TR>, even though one has luck, he or she cannot use it without endeavor.</MI1> <SI1>We may say that luck is like a good tool. If someone has a good tool, he can do work easier. However, it will be useless if the one don¡¯t like to work with the tool. I know someone whose father was very wealthy. He could success rapider and easier. Believing only his father¡¯s wealth, he didn¡¯t like to try hard. He just wasted time playing with many friends. <TR>Then</TR>, most of his father¡¯s entire wealth has gone, and he is living very poor life. Both a good tool and luck makes work better only when there are hard working.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, only hard workers can have luck.</MI2> <SI2> There is a saying that ¡®Heaven helps a person who helps oneself.¡¯ It means that as people strive, they can have more luck. Luck may be opportunities, other¡¯s help, or money. These things could be obtained only when people show diligence and sincerity to others. Nobody can trust in whom do not work hard.<TR>Last year</TR>, I studied very hard, and get honor ship from school. If I didn¡¯t study hard, I might never be able to get honor ship.</SI2></BO2><CO>As stated above, I agree with those who claim that hard working makes people success. There are two reasons for this: without endeavor luck is useless and only hard workers can have more luck. <TR>Therefore</TR>, it is impossible to overstate the importance of hardworking</CO>

column1: 724&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? People are never satisfied with what they have; they always want something more or something different. Use specific reasons to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>I agree that people are never satisfied with what they have. Since there is no limit to man's greed, people always want something more or something different from what belongs to them.  Some people say that one who grasps at much loses all. <TR>However</TR>, I think if it were not for human's desire, there would be no progress.</TS><IN><BO1><MI1>Avarice knows no bounds.</MI1> <SI1><TR>For instance</TR>, most women always want to have more beautiful proportions. Though they are slim, they shape up and diet to have a nice figure. In another case, some men are crazy about new electrical goods. Whenever a state-of-the-art product is out on the market, they buy it. From my childhood experience, I used to complain that my cake was smaller than my sister's.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>The history of human progress proves the fact that we are never satisfied with what is ours.</MI2> <SI2>By striving for a higher position, a bigger house to live, and more expensive clothes, we could improve quality of our life. If we didn't want to have more things for better life, we would make efforts. <TR>For these reasons</TR>, I agree with the above statement.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, we could be encouraged to endeavor through dissatisfaction. We should find that happiness lies in contentment, though.</CO>
column23: You can do better than this. You are making big statements that can't be proven and then supporting them with your opinion and other things that can't be proven. If you want your essay to be taken seriously, you need to give facts and examples. Look up a study! Do some research!

column1: 725&A person you know is planning to move to your town or city. What do you think this person would like or dislike about living in your town or city? Why? Use specific reasons and details to develop your essay.
column3: <IN><TS>My city, Seoul is capital of the Republic of Korea, one of most crowd spots. Some of my neighbors say that they want to leave this city because of its environments. <TR>Nevertheless</TR>, I think this city is good place to live conveniently for many developed facilities. <TR>For these reasons</TR>, I often recommend my friends, living other areas, to move in to Seoul.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, as a student, there is a lot of place to study in my town.</MI1><SI1> An academy, so-called Hakwon, offer many advantages to study and help make a good score in the school. This is also the best reason which people hope to live in our town.</SI1></BO1> <BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, Seoul perform main function in commercial system, administration organization in Korea.</MI2> <SI2> <TR>Therefore</TR>, if you want to get something, you can get that easily. There are so various shops that you can reach in little minutes.Traffic system is also developed than any other counties in Korea, this help get things.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3>There are many drawbacks in Seoul, such as polluted air, high population, too many cars, and so on. for these bad points, citizens of Seoul have started to organize many associations to purify the environments of Seoul</MI3>. <SI3>In the present state of things, Seoul will be clean city in a few years.</SI3></BO3> <CO><TR>Moreover</TR>, cultural opportunities that Seoul can give us are excellent, people have good manners. If you want to have more convenient, more affluent life, Seoul probably will be the best place to live. As a Seoul citizen, I can say confidently that Seoul deserves to live, because there are more good points such as educational opportunities, developed system, and so on </CO>

column1: 726&Should a city try to preserve its old, historic buildings or destroy them and replace them with modern buildings? Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN><TS><TR>Nowaday</TR>, the national culture is being more and more important. <TR>Usually</TR>, the national culture based on old, historical buildings. On the other hand, a number of people have just begun to assume that the historical structure must be preserved. <TR>In this situation</TR>, as one who love the culture of my country, the korea, I want to associate with them.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>One advantage preserving historical buildings is that they offer a beauty, whereas modern one doesn't</MI1>. <SI1><EX><TR>For example</TR>, the stone wall of Gyung-bokgung, palace of korea in the past, is still the best date place for its beauty</EX>. <TR>In addition</TR>, it also makes us to feel pride of korea, to think about our country as well as history.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In contrast</TR>, modern buildings doesn't serve such things.</MI2> <SI2> There are a lot of skyscrapers in almost all parts of the country. Most of them perform the business, are the same appearance, so make people feel appressed.<TR>In addition</TR>, there are already too many modern buildings. And people can build moderns newly as much they want whereas the number of historic building is a few, there's no thing to replace the their functions.</SI2></BO2><CO>This is not to say all old buildings have to be preserved. Some of them are not important, beautiful. What I want to say is really important historical buildings to us, offering a rest place, making feel relaxed for its beauty must be under the protection.</CO>
column23: This is a below average cost essay. There is a nice balance to this essay. The author needed to pay more attention to capitalization rules and other grammatical rules.

column1: 727&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>There are a various types of parents in teaching their children. As there are teachers who have good influence on children and bad on, there are also parents who cannot be a good role model to their children.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>According to recent status</TR>, the number of the parents who make children alone while working is increasing.</MI1> <SI1>This status say the role model children have to imitate is on the decreased. <TR>Moreover</TR>, when these parents come back home from the work, they easy to avoid to have enough time with their children because of tiredness. The children who see their parents image are getting no knowledge as well as lessons.</SI1></BO1> <BO2><MI2><EX><TR>For example</TR>, my neighbor, the 8-year-boy, Jun-hee, is spoken ill of other neighborhoods for his rudeness</MI2>. <SI2>People say the parents of him cause his rude behavior. Junhee's parents are running a great food restaurant. The time they come home is almost 12'o clock a.m. They have no holiday, thus they will give money to Junhee instead of having a time together. The money make Junhee to become a spoilt child. As many people who speak ill about him, I also think because of his parents, Junhee is going worse.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO>There are also the parents who teach dangerous things to their children. The children who learn to hate different races may become a very dangerous member in the society. Not all the parents lead their children to beneficial ways. <TR>Therefore</TR>, we shouldn't think parents are always the best teachers. In some cases, the parents are the worst teachers.</CO>

column1: 728&Some people prefer to live in big cities, whereas other people enjoy living in small towns. In which place would you prefer to live? Use specific examples and reasons to explain your answer
column3: <IN><TS>Life in big cities may be valuable as much as life in small towns. But I prefer to living in small towns. Because I want to live in a peaceful and calm life, fresh environment and I prefer to living in a large house there.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, I hate to live in troubling with many people. In a big city, when I take a subway to go to work or buy something in department store, I am afflicted with so many people</MI1>. <SI1>The life that I dream is something quiet to do a great deal of thinking.</SI1></BO1> <BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, I have suffered from bronchial trouble and living in a big city is harmful to health.</MI2> <SI2>I think, a fresh air in small town can help me to avoid diseases I may meet in a big city..</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Third</TR>, I always hoped to live in a large house with many rooms and large living room</MI3>. <SI3><TR>But</TR>, it¡¯s not easy to live in such a large house in Seoul, the capital of Korea it maybe take me a decade or more to buy it ,so I¡¯ll choose my urban life without any hesitation.</SI3></BO3><CO>In short, if someone ask me in which city I prefer to live, I will answer ¡° small town¡± Small town can provide me with many rests without any interruptions.</CO>

column1: 729&How do movies or television influence people's behavior? Use reasons and specific examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>People always watch television and movies. While watching them, we may be influenced. Our's behavior is affected by movies or television because visual images remain our brain and we may know a lot of things through them.</TS></IN><,BO1> <MI1>When we watch television and movies, visual images stay our brain.</MI1> <SI1><TR>In fact</TR>, these images would be our unconscious. It implies that we may conduct the same thing which actors performed in a movie or a drama. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, when one watches that a hero kills someone in movie, the image remain his unconsciousness and he feel an impulse to murder someone</EX>. If he is very angered by someone, he may kill someone as a actor.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Watching television and movies, we can learn a lot of things.</MI2> <SI2> <TR>Especially</TR>, we can know a way of others' conduct.<TR>For instance</TR>, one who is not active and has not any friend can learn the way to make friends and win his companions' love if he watches movies that show a way to make friends.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, movies and television influence our acting now that visual images stay our unconsciousness and we learn many things through them. <TR>Therefore</TR>, movies and television occupy a very important part of people's behavior.</CO>

column1: 730&Some people prefer to live in a small town. Others prefer to live in a big city. Which place would you prefer to live in?
column3: <IN><TS>Perhaps some people would maintain that living in a small town is uncomfortable and tedious but I think that a small town is a very quite place and gives people happiness. I prefer to live in a small town because there is hardly crime and people who live in a small town can have ties with their neighborhoods.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>When people live in a small town, they don't have to worry about local crime.</MI1> <SI1>In contrast with living in a small village, there are a lot of crimes in a big city such as New York. In a big city, people can not wander from place to place at night and have to alert others who approach them. But people in a small town can walk around a park at night and chat someone in a street because there isn't danger and crime.</SI1><BO2><MI2>People in a small village can have ties with their neighborhood, while people in a big city can't bonds with their neighborhood.</MI2> <SI2> While living in a small town, people can know their neighbor with communicating. These communication will accumulate mutual trust and form ties with each other.<TR>On the other hand</TR>, people in a big city can't spend a lot of time talking their neighbor because they are very busy. The lack of communication between each other will cause people to be selfish and feel alienation.</SI2></BO2><CO>In spite of the fact that a small town dose not have convenience, I prefer to live in a small town because people can take a lot of advantages there such as ties with others and safety.</CO>

column1: 731&You have enough money to purchase either a house or a business. Which would you choose to buy? Give specific reasons to explain your choice.
column3: <IN><TS><TR>In general</TR>, people encounter a lot of choices. Since people's life could be changed by a certain choice, clever choices are important for everyone. When people have enough money to purchase, some people will purchase a house, others will buy a business. If I have chance to choice them, I will choose house for the following two reasons.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, purchasing a house is desirable for me, because I do not have the ability to run a business. It is necessary to get the knowledge about management to run a business effectively</MI1>. <SI1><EX><TR>For example</TR>, my uncle became to manage a company last year. He tried to make a profit</EX>. <TR>However</TR>, He broke out because he was not a well-informed man in that business. I want to live stable life rather than live in risks.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Next</TR>, when considering rents, I prefer to buy a house.</MI2> <SI2> If I choose a house, our family can live conveniently. According to the newspaper, the first thing that people wanted is a house. As this survey shows, to have a comfortable house is a essential hope for most people.<TR>Now</TR>, our family should give rents, however, there is no need to give rent, when I have a house.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I can get the two advantages by buying a house in considering my business ability and house rents. Those advantages would make our life more comfortable. The more people realize the pluses of buying a house, the more people wish to purchase it.</CO>

column1: 732&When people move to another country, some of then decide to follow the customs of the new country. Others prefer to keep their own customs. Compare these two choices. Which one you prefer? Support your answer with specific details.
column3: <IN>When people move to another country, they face with many different customs because each country have their own ones. Some of them prefer to keep their own customs, and can't adapt themselves to the new circumstance, while others accommodate well. <TS>The former are almost old people, and the later almost young. <TR>Personally</TR>, I prefer to follow the new customs in respect of one's ability.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>My 3rd aunt who emigrated to Australia many years ago have said yet about hardship of life from being unable to adapt there.</MI1> <SI1>According to her saying, korean living in Australia still have korean customs. They still enjoy the Korean holiday, such as chou-suk, Seul-nal, with some korean folk plays.If they have to follow new ones, throwing away korean tradition, they will be stressed.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>However</TR>, my cousin, the aunt's son, says 2nd generation like him would not like to follow Korean customs.<MI2> <SI2>Following his words, they would rather try to learn Australian customs than to follow korean. Unlike 1st generation, They are always more flexible to new things.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3>I think this phenomena are natural.</MI3> <SI3>1st emigrant probably more familiar with Korean custom than Australian, whereas 2nd feel no friendly emotion. 1st are too old to absorb new ones because their own old sense of values. 2nd have no need to keep korean customs, because their scope of activity in their future is probably Australia, Korea.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, because whether people follow the new customs depends on their flexibility of thinking, and what the most important problem is how to adapt to new country, if the new customs is not contrary to one's sense of value, it would be desirable to follow the new customs.</CO>
column23: This is an above average quality essay. The thesis is connected to the main points which are then again tied to the supporting points in the essay.

column1: 733&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement:Children should be required to help with house hold tasks as soon as they are able to do so. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Living in the house with family requires many tasks to do and mothers were thought to be responsible for those things such as dish-washing, cleaning the house, especially in korea. <TS><TR>However</TR> thesedays most people think that house hold tasks should be done by all family members. But there's a debate about children's role. Some people think children should help with house hold tasks while others disagree with that. <TR>In my opinion</TR> children don't have to help house hold tasks based on following reasons.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, If children do the house work, it will take more time than adults do and they can also damage house hold goods.</MI1> <SI1>Generally children are not accustomed to house hold tasks so they may be confused at first. It can be illustrated by dish- washing. Imagine that a mother ordered her child to wash the dishes. The children will not know what to do and try in an inefficient way. <TR>Moreover</TR>, doing this they can drop the dishes and break them. If a mother did the same thing it must have finished faster without any loss. So I think letting children help house work is wasteful.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Another reason is the fact that there's many difficult tasks in the house.</MI2> <SI2> Works such as moving a piano, or fixing the computer are not suitable for children. They have less strength than adults and they are not familiar with the inside of TV,computer etc.So It dosen't make sense that children should help house hold tasks, samething as adults do.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Moreover</TR>, there are a lot of dangerous factors to make children help house hold tasks. About 4years ago, my brother tried to make some food by himself not to bother my mother. He was 7years old so he could not treat knife well of course. During mother was sleeping he cut his fingers after all. Our family was really shocked, and from that time my brother is not allowed to enter teh kichen</MI3>. <SI3>There always exist these danger so children is not proper to help.</SI3></BO3> <CO><TR>Consequently</TR>, to stay away from house hold tasks is better than reducing efficiency, meeting difficulty,and danger. I think parents should get a help from them after they grow up. At that time may be their help will be more practical.</CO>

column1: 734&What do you consider to be the most important room in a house? Why is this room more important to you than any other room? Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>Nothing is as important as house. The house offer inhabitant shelter, rest, and community hall. <TS>Some people believe that private room in a house is most important because of their own space. In my case, the living room is most valuable for me in that this place allows me to take a break and have a good time with family.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>I release stress in a living room, while watching movie and listening to music.</MI1> <SI1>There are a video tape recorder and a cd-player in the living room. With drinking beer, I enjoy watching a movie at night. I feel that living room is better than a theater at this moment because nobody interrupts me at night and I control sound and do have beer at my convenience. <TR>In addition</TR>, another my hobby is to listen to music in the living room. The cd-player in the living room is the best player in my house. I am absorbed in music with excellent player. It is a living room where I watch a movie and listen to music very comfortably so that I feel better.</SI1></BO1> <BO2><MI2>Family, even relatives, shares a good time in the living room.</MI2> <SI2> The living room is enough place to stay whole family at the same time. <TR>After supper</TR>, our family usually sits around each other, then talk one another about common interest. We sometimes invite relatives to party.<TR>Like this</TR>, the more we spend time with family, the deeper our love become. It is a living room where whole family spends time together.</SI2></BO2><CO>As I mentioned, I believe that the living room is the most important room in the house because of above two reasons: a Paradise for me and a space to keep memory for family. These benefits from a living room are priceless.</CO>

column1: 735&Some people prefer to eat at food stands or restaurants. Other people prefer to prepare and eat food at home. Which do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer?
column3: <IN>People have to eat food everyday, and where they eat is the matter of personal choice. <TS>I am a person who likes to prepare and eat food at home rather than at food stands or restaurants. There are two reasons. First of all food which is made at home is clean and safe. <TR>Second</TR>, home-made food is cheaper.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>Food which is cooked at home is cleaner and safer than other food. It is certain that the cook will be a member of one's family, and they are more likely to careful of the food. This is because the food will be eaten by their family</MI1>. <SI1><EX><TR>For example</TR>, the cook will try to use good indigrents and avoid using harmful chemicals</EX>. There have been many examples about using low (or bad) guality indigrients such as McDonard,KFC etc. If you cook your food at home,you do not have to worry about this.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Home-made food is cheaper than other food .</MI2> <SI2>This is because you do not need to pay a lot of charges for such as service,hydro,rent,franchise..etc. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, if you cook food at home,you do not have to pay those kinds of charges. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, if you eat some food at a luxury restaurant, you will pay at least over $50</EX>. <TR.However</TR>, if you cook the food which is the exactly same thing, the price will be much lower than that.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I am a person who enjoys eating food at home. This is because food cooked at home is safe and clean due to the fact that the cook will be dedicated to the food, and we are able to enjoy food at a low price.</CO>

column1: 736&Would you prefer to live alone or with a roommate? Use specific reasons and details to support your choice.
column3: <IN><TS><TR>As you have grown</TR>, you should live apart from your family. <TR>In particular</TR>, in college you live alone or with a roommate. Each way has advantages, but living alone have more merits than living with a roommate.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</MI1>, living alone may enable you not to be interfered.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Namely</TR>, you have the freedom of behavior for everything. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, you can eat at time you want and we can stay up watching T.V.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, living with someone may discourge you to protect your own life.</MI2> <SI2> <TR>To illustrate</TR>, you can speak by telephone about your private life.No one read your private messages and mails.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, living alone enables us to be free from any inteference and keep the private life. Like divorced couples, living with someone,however well you know him, is difficult. If you want to keep a good friendship with someone, you never live together.</CO>

column1: 737&Do you agree with euthanasia?
column3: <IN><TS>I extremely agree with euthanasia with following many reasons.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, we have to respect the terminally ill man as like human even though a terminal illness cannot be cured, and causes death.</MI1> <SI1><TR>In other world</TR>, they are human beings even as we are. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, a person in a vegetative state can think their own thought even as we think, however, they cannot control their body because their nerve cell is died by accident.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, euthanasia is beyond human¡¯s power.</MI2> <SI2>It is humanly impossible that a person kill a terminal illness man.
