column1: 782&You have received a gift of money. The money is enough to buy either a piece of jewelry you like or tickets to a concert you want to attend. Which would you buy? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS><TR>Nowadays</TR>, money is being regarded more crucial than old days. It is because we can do almost everything we want and we can get almost everything we want to purchase by spending money. If I luckily received a gift of money, I would use it in buying tickets to a concert rather than in buying a piece of jewlry, because it can give me good relaxation and I can enjoy my free time appreciating favorite music together with people attending the concert show.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, it will release me of stress and pressure that I have been feeling to attend a concert.</MI1> <SI1>The more complicated society, the more stressful our lives. I feel as if I am carrying a burden while working and I always have to concern about something. To take part in a concert will give me a good opportunity to find free time to listen to music and I will be able to enjoy myself in the middle of busy life. Our good memory and fragrant experience are priceless for us, so I definitely have the opinion that I would rather choose to go to a concert than buy a piece of jewlry. <SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, I can spend time with other people.</MI2> <SI2>Since we are living in modern age, we tend to consume our time alone. To tell the truth, some think it is of no use to go outside in order to meet a friend because computers and televisions are like their friends. My case is almost the same. I spend nearly all day by myself. We strongly need to enjoy our free time with others, because we lack meeting people face to face. Joining a concert will be a perfect solution to this problem because it allows us to assemble. It enables us to listen to music, see the musicians, and meet others at the same time. <EX>From my experience, I could score concert tickets for two people for free, and I decided to give a call to my old friend to suggest to her going there together</EX>. It was several years after we last met that we got together again. We really had a nice time with great music.</SI2></BO2><CO>In short, I certainly hold the opinion that it would be the better choice to buy concert tickets of the two, since it allows us to relax and bring us together. How perfect would be if I got a gift of money and used it in the way I mentioned before!</CO>

column3: <IN><TS>When people spend their time, some people prefer to spend most of their time alone while others prefer to spend their time with friends. Both of these types have their own advantages. <TR>In my view point</TR>, spend most of my time with friends is more attractive for two distinct reasons.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, spend my time with friends can be a good opportunity to gain useful advise or idea.</MI1> <SI1>Friends have various kinds of knowledge and experience that are different from mine. <TR>For instance</TR>, when I was ten years old, I was faced with the problem related to my study. I always get ¡°c¡± in my exam. So my parents always scolded me. One day my friend asked me ¡°what¡¯s wrong with you¡± and I answered, ¡°I have a problem with my study¡±. Then, he showed me a solution of a problem. He pointed out my fault of way to study. Through his advise, I got an ¡°A¡± for the first time in my final exam. In this manner, spend time with friends is very helpful and useful to me in many ways,</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, spend time with friends can be a good way to broaden my horizon.</MI2> <SI2>People who have narrow horizon can¡¯t be a good member of society. We can experience many things through friends; I thought that friends can be a good teacher of my life. <EX>As a good example of this, I was a person whose mental vision is very narrow. But these defects are overcame through talking with my friends</EX>. A friend of mine was a person with broad outlook on life. By my friends influence, my negative characteristic is reformed very much. <TR>Thus</TR>, spend time with friends has many positive aspects in term of my life.</SI2></BO2> <CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, Friends can be a good adviser and also can be a good teacher. column1: 786&Is the ability to read and write more important today than in the past? Why or why not? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS><TR>As we all know</TR>, the world is changing steadily. And the abilities thought important are also changing. One of those abilities is to read and write. I could state several factores which defend the statement the ability to read and write is more important today.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>In the past the majority of people did agriculture for their livelihood, which doesn¡¯t ask skills to read and write that much.</MI1> <SI1>around that time, no other skill is comparable to farming skill in the aspect of practical use. <TR>Furthermore</TR> generally they learn how to farm well from their parents or relatives etc, in other words, they learn that from teachers¡¯ doing. What they should do to study was just to follow and memorize and make themselves to adjust to do that.</SI1></BO1> <BO2><MI2><TR>However</TR>, today is ¡°Information age¡±, which Knowledge and Information are valued more than ever before. Companies compete to get more sharp idea. And most basic information are obtained from printed-paper.</MI2> <SI2><EX>Here is a good example. when someone try to cook something new, he/she usually look recipe printed or to manage a new machine such as microwave or washing machine, he/she generally look manual to know how to make it work. Another good example is just internet. Internet is very common all over the world</EX>. We can get huge information from web surfing, also can send a e-mail to someone you like. But in order to do these, we should know how to read and write.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, in the past the ability to read and write wasn¡¯t required that much but these days, almost all should have to learn how to read and write basically for live comfortable.</CO>

column1: 787&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? High schools should allow students to study the courses that students want to study. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN><TS><TR>In this world</TR>, there are so many things to learn. We must learn something in all our lives, and schools play a important role. Especially learning in highshool affects our lives in society as adults. Above importance of highschool learning there are two opposite ideas about student's freedom of choosing courses. I think students should have a choice to learn what they want to know for the several reasons.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Most of all</TR>, students would be more motivated in the courses.</MI1> <SI1>When students learn what they are interested in , they will consentrate on and courses will be more effective. I hate mathematics so much in my highschool ,so I always spent time sleeping, cheating . It was really wasteful and math became more difficult subject to me than before.<TR>However</TR>, In society class, we could choose what we want to learn among politics, geology, history, etc. I chose history class because I wanted to know about European history. <TR>During the semester</TR>, I enjoyed the course reading related novel, discussing with teacher.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Second reason is that students can have good grades on the courses.</MI2> <SI2><TR>As I mentioned above</TR>, if they are motivated ,they will not only understand easier but also study hard. This will result in good grades in those courses. If they are not allowed to choose the courses, they will lose interest, get bad grades, and then finally lose thier confidence.So schools should give them free choice to let them study hard and be a eminent student.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3>One more reason I want to say is that society requires specialized person.</MI3> <SI3>Highschool is an imporatant place because students have to decide their major after graduation. As society becomes more and more complex, a person who has a specialized knowledge or ability in one area is needed.If students can choose the courses by themselves, they will have an opportunity to found what they really like. <TR>As a result</TR>, they can study the course they chose hard, and it will be helpful to speciallize one's ability.</SI3></BO3><CO>Because of those reasons I think students should have rights to decide their courses,and highshools have to alloe them to do. It can make a class more effective,and give lots of advantages to the society</CO>

column1: 788&Should government spend as much money as possible on developing or buying computer technology?
column3: <IN><TS><TR>Today</TR>, we can not live without Internet, the storage of everything in the world. Not only internet, but also computers has become one of the necessities of our daily lives. Those facts tell us how the computer scinece is important now. In this situation, government should spend more money in computer science for some reasons. Let's see what those reasons are.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, computer technology is the most competitive part in every nations' economy.</MI1> <SI1>As the significance of computer science is growing, many countries try to develope their computer technology. Nowdays we can see a lot of countries, such as Korea, US, Japan and Taiwan, struggling in computer techonology fields. To take a large stake in competitve situations, we can't avoid appropriating more money on computer technology. <TR>Therefore</TR>, government should consider to assign more budgets on computer science.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, computer technology is worth of investing a lot of money.</MI2> <SI2>Samsung, one of Korean companies, has been using a lot of money on computer technology. <Tr>Consequently</TR>, Samsung is the number one country that produces 90% of computer memory chipsets.<TR>As a result</TR>, Samsung's effort enable Korea to have increased gross income. <TR>Therefore</TR>, government should use more money to irrigate computer technology fields.</SI2></BO2><CO>To summerize, computer technology is getting competive and has potential profit that a county can get. Thus, government should be spending lots of money on computer technology.</CO>

column1: 789&Some people believe that students should be given one long vacation each year. Others believe that students should have several short vacations throughout the year. Which view do you agree with? Use specific reasons and examples to support your choice.
column3: <IN><TS>During semester, students expect vacation to come earlier. They decide what they will do during vacation:some of them plan to trip to abroad and others have determined to read many books. There are two types of vacation , one long vacation and several short vacation. I prefer one long vacation for the several reasons.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Most of all</TR>, by using long period of vacation, students can undergo experience which they can't do during semester.</MI1> <SI1>It can be illustrated by learning language, getting driver's license etc. <TR>In my case</TR>, I visited United States during winter vacation last winter. And I got an opportunity to join ESL course at George town university. But I had only 7week , so I was sorry not to stay longer and learn English. Athough it was short experience, I made lots of friends who came from different parts of the world and understood American culture. If vacation term were longer, I could stay more in US, and have a good time there.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Second reason is that during one long vacation, students can go to trip to abroad.</MI2> <SI2> If they have several short vacations, there will not be enough time to visit foreign contries. <TR>However</TR> in a long vacation students can enjoy traveling oversees. Many university studentsin Korea, for example, are likely to go to Europe during vacation.<Tr>To do this</TR>, they need much time to get an information about Europe , buy tickets,and make reservations etc. I think these trip to abroad can be helpful to students by experiencing different culture so I suggest enough time to trip abroad should be given to students.</SI2></BO2><CO>Consequently, in my opinion, having one long vacation is better than several short vacations because students can get many advatages fron new experuence, and have opportunity to visit other countries. So I suggest that students should plan to use long vacation time efficiently.</CO>
column23: This is an above quality essay. The thesis is well written and gives reasons behind the position of the essay. The structure is also very nice. column1: 790&In some countries, teenagers have jobs while they are still students. Do you think this is a good idea? Support your opinion by using specific reasons and details.
column3: <IN><TS>I am convinced that it is a good idea for teenagers to have jobs. Some people say that the most important thing for students is studying hard, and having jobs can interrupt their studying. <TR>However</TR>, students can learn how to handle the money and have a lot of valuable experience through their jobs. <TR>For these reasons</TR>, I am in favor of above statement.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Largely</TR>, students tend to receive some money from their parents for buying something and playing with their friends.</MI1> <SI1>In this case, they are hard to understand the worth of money, and they can easily spend a lot of money. But if they have jobs, they can find out how difficult to earn the money. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, when I was 16 years old, I had part time job in a restaurant</EX>. <TR>At that time</TR>, I washed more than one hundred of dishes in a day. It is a very tough experience to me. <TR>However</TR>, through this experience, I could learn the worth of money and I did not spend much money for buying something or playing any more.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Another advantage of having jobs for students is that they can get a various experience.</MI2> <SI2>While they worked in some places, they met many people of different ages and locations.During passing away time with these people, students could get many kinds of experience which is hard to get in their school life.</SI2></BO2><CO>For the above-mentioned reasons, even though they are students, I recommend that they have a part time job. Studying hard is very important, but it is not everything to their life. I think, the more important thing is that they try to do lots of experience, and through these activities they can learn great valuable things. <TR>Furthermore</TR>, it will be very helpful to their life.</CO>

column1: 791&You need to travel from your home to a place 40 miles (64 kilometers) away. Compare the different kinds of transportation you could use. Tell which method of travel you would choose. Give specific reasons for your choice.
column3: <IN><TS>As technology has developed, there has appeared countless sorts of transportations compared to ancient times. People use cars, buses, subways, trains, air planes in their daily lives and now, we can get anywhere we want if we make the best of transportations available. If I were asked to go to a place 40 miles away, I would consider two means ; either a bus or a subway. I will compare getting on a bus with a taking subway.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>For one thing</TR>, I can think about going there by bus.</MI1> <SI1>There are even more bus stops around my town than subway stations, so it is easier to use a bus line. <TR>Thus</TR>, I can save on my time because it takes relatively less time to get to the nearest bus stop than the closest subway station</SI1></BO1>. <BO2><MI2><TR>Next</TR>, I can also consider taking a subway.</MI2> <SI2>In contrast to a bus, it has no risk of heavy traffic. I usually do not choose to take a bus to commute my school in a rush hour, because it is inexorable to get stuck in traffic jam. I got fed up with being stuck in heavy traffic, and rarely could I be on time for my morning class this semester. <TR>Also</TR>, it is not harmful when it comes to air polution.<TR>As a matter of fact</TR>, it is air contamination that my city has as one of the most serious problems. By using an electricity-based transportation, I can help my city lessen the problem.<SI2></BO2> <CO>In a nutshell, if I needed to travel to a place 40 miles away, I would absolutely choose using a subway by reason of its safety, and harmlessness regarding air polution. Since it does not emit less deleterious substance such as gases which is the main factor of pollution, I will positively think about using a subway. <TR>Also</TR>, I do not have to risk wasting my priceless time on a bumper-to-bumper road if I take a subway instead of a bus ; it is safer for me as a student who must be punctual.</CO>
column23: This is a very balanced essay that does not have a great number of examples to give any conviction to the reader that the author has come up with a great essay.

column1: 792&Some people prefer to live in big cities, whereas other people enjoy living in small towns. In which place would you prefer to live? Use specific examples and reasons to explain your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>The surroundings where we live significantaly affect our lives. The place where someone lives varies person to person. Some people live in big cities, while others live in the countryside. I was born in the counryside and I was grown up there, but now, I live in an urban area. From my experience, I think both of them have their own advantages. <TR>However</TR>, I prefer to live in a big city due to its convenience and its variety in population.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>In the first step</TR>, it is better to live in a big city because we can live conveniently.</MI1> <SI1><TR>In general</TR>, it is far easier to get information and utilize state-of-the-art facilities in a big city than in the countryside. Because there are innumerable people in big cities, a lot of government buildings and headquarters of companies tend to be located in big cities. <TR>Also</TR>, I can go anywhere in my city making the best of public transportations. If lived in the countryside, I could not help but stand all difficulties caused by inconvenience.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second of all</TR>, we can meet a wide variety of people while living in a big city.</MI2> <SI2> When I was young, living in the countryside where most of residents were farmers, I could not meet other kinds of people besides people who are concerned about farming. Because children are like sponge, they absorb in what they see, what they hear, and what they experience. <TR>However</TR>, seldom could I get to know about other sorts of people, as I I was brought about in a small village which is surrounded by only mountains and fields.<TR>In contrast to my childhood</TR>, I have a good chance to meet numerous kinds of people who have different jobs and interests. This is the second advantage of living in a big city.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I am in favor of the idea that it is better to live in a big city than in the countryside because we can live without much difficulty and also, we can meet diverse kinds of people near our neighborhood. Although I was born in the countryside, I definitely prefer to live in a big city, since it has a lot of advantages that I have mentioned above.</CO>
column23: This is a very comprehensive essay that covers all sections of a written essay. It would have been nice if the thesis had included a preview of the points that were going to be taken.

column1: 793&It has recently been announced that a new restaurant may be built in your neighborhood. Do you support or oppose this plan?
column3: <IN><TS>There is no restaurant in my neighborhood. A recent announcement that a new restaurant may be built in our neighborhood could be highly welcomed because it is very convenient to use and will help my hometown to be developed. With a couple of examples and explanations, I will demonstrate why I support this plan.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, if a new restaurant would be built in my neighborhood, I can use it easily.</MI1> <SI1>When I have no materials to cook in my kitchen, I can go out and take a meal there; I would not suffer from hunger. When there is no time to prepare a meal, a new restaurant could help me to have a meal. It might make my life better.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, a new restaurant may help my hometown to be developed.</MI2> <SI2>There are commercial or public institutes in my neighborhood; only residences are there.Building a new restaurant would make others be built and eventually, my hometown would be a developed town.</SI2></BO2><CO>As I mentioned before, if a new restaurant is built in my hometown, I can use it whenever I want to and my hometown would be developed. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I completely support this plan and I want to invest in it if I could.</CO>

column1: 794&Do you agree or disagree with following statement? A person's childhood years (the time from birth to twelve years of age) are the most important years of a person's life. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>Childhood has various meanings in one's life. Some people think this age is not important as their future, while others think childhood years deserve to be estimated most important ages. Both case have their own bases, <TR>however</TR>, I think childhood is the most important ages in one's life in several aspects.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>One reason that I assert the childhood is such significant is that in this ages, person learn the social role.</MI1> <SI1>The roles followed by position, sex, and so on are obtained in this time.In one research about a 10year-old girl sho was brought by wolves, it is proofed that human can learn about the basic role and rule of society only until seven to eight years old.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, I think one's childhood is the time to prepare the one's entire life.</MI2> <SI2><TR>As preparing</TR>, one's entire life is decided. My parents often says If they had their childhood more diligently, they could have more pleasant time now.<TR>According to their words</TR>, because they have poor time when they are young, they couldn't prepare the their future successfully, so they wanted to give richness to me in my childhood.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, childhood have great significant effect on one's life. Whether one's life is successful or not depends on whether the one have successful life in one's childhood. For this reason, I think the childhood is the most important time in one's life. <TR>However</TR>, while one's childhood, he or she cannot recognize its significance. So, the important thing in the childhood is to spend time sincerely.</CO>
column23: This is an above quality essay that is mainly missing a quality thesis to bind everything together and provide the framework for the essay.

column1: 795&Decisions can be made quickly, or they can be made after careful thought. Read and think about the following statement: The decisions that people make quickly are always worn. Do you agree or disagree with the statement? Use reasons and examples to support tour opinion.
column3: <IN><TS>There are two types in making decisions, turtle type and rabbit type. Because slow but wise turtle never mistakes, turtle typed people have been estimated the great model in the society as seen in a fable about the race between turtle and rabbit. Age is changing, however, I think the rabbit typed people are better type in this age.</TS></IN> <BO1><MI1><TR>As age is changing</TR>, the speed becomes more and more important.</MI1> <SI1>The swiftness is the best value when people not only choose the service, but also choose the new member in their company. <EX> For example, the most popular internet network service in Korea is decided by their velocity of connection, and also swiftness becomes important in the exam such as CBT</EX>. <TR>Now</TR>, nobody wants slow person in their speedy social life, however wise the person may be.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI1><TR>Moreover</TR>, the turtle typed people have the limit to adapt theirselves on the various circumstance whereas rabbit typed not.<MI1> <SI1> The adaptation to changed situation is as significant as speed in this period.<TR>Nowadays</TR>, in Korea, the comedian are more and more popular as the emcee of the entertainment program than specialized emcee. The reason that this phenomenon appeared is the comedian is humorous as well as flexibility to various situation.</SI1></BO1><CO><TR>To sum up</TR>, this time require the quickness, appropriate adaptation to circumstance. It is not to say that the person who think carefully is always inferior to the person quickly. The turtle typed people can be more good friend than rabbit typed. But in this information oriented society, I think the rabbit typed people are more needed. And, it may be the best way to think quickly and wisely.</CO>
column23: This is an above average quality essay. The thesis is connected to the main points which are then again tied to the supporting points in the essay.

column1: 796&"When people succeed, it is because of hard work. Luck has nothing to do with success." Do you agree or disagree with the quotation above? Use specific reasons and examples to explain your position.
column3: <IN><TS>I agree that hard work is essential in order for people to succeed, for hard work can help people to overcome their trouble but fortune can not help people to do. I think effort can only make people possible to succeed.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>As we look the example of a lottery, we can know that luck has nothing to do with success.</MI1> <SI1><TR>In general</TR>, people regard that winning in a lottery will give them a fortune. <TR>Therefore</TR>, many people buy a lottery ticket in order to succeed without hard work. But a lottery don't bestow success on people. Because it is almost impossible to win in a lottery, many people may buy lottery tickets for decades. <TR>Also</TR>, even if someone wins in a lottery, he who has not experienced hard work can't overcome his trouble and will soon go bankrupt. As a result, luck dosen't help people to succeed.</SI1></BO1><CO>Hard work can help people to overcome their trouble. There are many people who can succeed with their effort. For example, Beethoven, an great composer, made efforts to succeed as a composer despite his hardship. <TR>Thanks to his effort</TR>, he could overcome his hardship and compose outstanding symphonies. If there wasn't his effort, he couldn't get over deafness and would become frustrated. <TR>As the case of Beethoven</TR>, hard work can help us to overcome our trouble and succeed in life. It is dull idea that luck will give success. Only effort is necessary to succeed.</CO>

column1: 797&Some high schools require all students to wear school uniforms. Other high schools permit students to decide what to wear to school. Which of these two school policies do you think is better? Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN><TS><TR>Nowadays</TR>, most schools are different from some educational discipline or teaching method in comparison with the past. Especially some schools have a tendency to wear school uniform and others school would consider this decision. I recommend to wear uniform because students may stand for identity such as age, school's name, status, and self image as well as prevent from criminal act or dangerous behavior and save your cost in spending clothing.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>Firstly, we may often obseve that students smoke in a back street or buy alcohol in the market.</MI1> we regard that the action is not appropriate behavior as student. <SI1><EX><TR>For example</TR>, without wearing uniform, students who having well-growing appearence are not distinguish from adult</EX>. They have an more opportunity to seek for bad behavior such as drinking, smoking, and violence than students that put on uniform.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, most students have curiosity new fashions such as clothing, accessories and hair style.</MI2> <SI2>As following fashionable trend, our students will spend most time shopping and selling without studing for their ambition or his own dream. To wear uniform, some people might talk about a few disadvantage that keep from liberal of expression.But it is more important that save burden of family than will bring about excessive control .</SI2></BO2><CO>To conclusion, I think that students are good to wear uniform during their teenager in that represent themselves indentity in hamful social environment and economical factor as keep from over spending. We have responsibility to care students through further interests and consideration. <TR>By doing so</TR>, we can improve the quality of our life.</CO>

column1: 798&Some people think that governments should spend as much money as possible on developing or buying computer technology. Other people disagree and think that this money should be spent on more basic needs. Which one of these opinions do you agree with? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>Some think that goverments should assgin much money to develop computer technology and some think governments should spend more money to support basic necessities. Buying necessities, governments might help people who do not have enough necessities for living in short term. <TR>However</TR>, through investing money to computer technology, governments could develop the economy of whole nations and help people who are in difficult situation from the shortage of basic needs more than we expect right now. <TR>Moreover</TR>, we cannot live without using computer so it is necessary to learn computer technology.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, nowadays, the computer industry is the main business of the world.</MI1> <SI1>It is possible to gain lots of profit from the world computer maket, if government invest much money to develop computer technology. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, if a scientist who is very good at computer and graduate college with doctor degree thanks to government's support makes an brilliant computer software like the Windows, it will bring lots of profit to his company and his country. Another example can be found in a semiconductor market</EX>. My country Korea, there is a semiconductor company, Sam-Sung, which has gained billions of money by selling semiconductors. And thanks to the donation of Sam-Sung, Korean governments can help lots of weak people in financially.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, it is difficult to live without using computer especially in young generations.</MI2> <SI2>The computer makes possible to study and work by ourselves and easier to work and study. <EX><TR>For example</TR>, I can contact with American buyer with email and it enables to send a contraction paper immediately</EX>. <TR>Furthermore</TR>, it is very easier to write in typing than write by hand.</SI2></BO2><CO>In short, the introduction of developed world in computer technology, the computer technology might make possible to gain lots of profit. It makes to develop government in many ways and enables to help people who are in difficult situation. And above all, it is almost impossible to work and do bussiness without computer.</CO>

column1: 799&It has recently veen announced that a new movie theater may be built in your neughborhood. Do you support or oppose this plan? Why? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>People may have various opinions about building a new movie theater. Some people oppose the plan, because the theater will make their community noisy and dirty. Although I understand their view, I agree constructing a new movie theater, because of people's convenience and commercial opportunities.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>More than anything else, a new movie theater will allow people in my community to enjoy easily movies.</MI1> <SI1>It is generally agreed that people have a good time at a theater. <TR>In my case</TR>, a theater was built in my neighborhood at last year. <TR>Before constructing a theater</TR>, I could not watch a movie easily. <TR>However</TR>, I can go to a theater conveniently, after building it. A new movie theater will be a comfortable place for my neighbors.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition to convenience</TR>, a new movie theater will bring my community to new business opportunities.<MI2> <SI2>It is a common held belief that many kinds of facilities were built around a theater. A new theater may be jammed by people.That will help my community to have new business opportunities. Neighbors can operate a snack bar, or parking lot. <TR>By managing many facilities</TR>, my community can earn profits.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, a new movie theater will give us many advantages. We can feel deep movies' impressions easily and take advantages by constructing a new movie theater. Because of these, I strongly state the view of agreement about building a new movie theater.</CO>
column23: The is a below average quality essay that is a bit short in the introduction and conclusion paragraphs. The resulting fragmented thesis does not lead well into the main points and non-existent examples.

column1: 800&It has recently been announced that a new high school may be built in your community. Do you support or oppose this plan? Why? Use specific reasons and details in your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>It has been reported that schools have to be moved to suberb in the cho-sun newspaper. The reporter said that the reason is they are harmful to community near them. Although they have advantages such as use of gymnasium and opportunity of education, they have more disadvatages. I also oppose to built a new high school in my community. The reason is that it brings noise and heavy traffic.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, building of a new high school in my community could bring noise pollution. Most high schools often have a concert and sports games and they bring a lot of noise. <TR>Additionally</TR>, many cafeterias would be sprung up according to the building of the high school. They could be another reason that brings a noise. I have ever lived near Kang-nam high school in Seoul</MI1>. <SI1>The value of our village was dropped and people in my community began to move to another village because of the noise. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I disagree to build a new high school in my community for its noise.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, building of a new high school in my community could bring heavy traffic. Because there are about two thousand people in one high school, the street in my village would be busy when students go to school and come back home. <TR>For instance</TR>, I have ever lived in Suwon. I usually went to my company by bus taking about thirty minutes</MI2>. <SI2><TR>However</TR>, it took more than one hour to go to there after Jang-an high school was built in Suwon. <TR>Thus</TR>, building a new high school could make me disconvenient for heavy traffic.</SI2></BO2> <CO>In conclusion, I oppose to build a new high school in my community. Sports games and concerts in the high school could make noise. There would be heavy traffic because of many students who go to school. Although there are advantages, these could not cover disadvantages. High school have to be built in suberban area rather than in a community that have a lot of people.</CO>
column23: This is a well written essay. The thesis statement is a bit short nd weak. It states the author's direction but does not include an introduction to the points. It should be combined with the sentence immediately following the thesis statement. The main ideas were reealy strong and to the point. I felt the supporting ideas had great personal examples, and they helped the author make the final conclusion. This is a well written essay.

column1: 801&In general, people are living longer now. Discuss the causes of this phenomenon. Use specific reasons and details to develop your essay.
column3: <IN><TS><TR>Nowadays</TR>, People¡¯s lifespan is longer than the past. There are many reasons can explain this phenomenon. I think that the development of medical science and improved eating habits have contributed to lengthen people¡¯s life spans</TS>.<TR> In this essay</TR>, I will demonstrate my assertion and following reason to support the answer.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, through development of medical science, people can make a direct diagnosis of their diseases. <TR>A few years ago</TR>, many new born infants died because of their illness such as jaundice. <TR>But now</TR>, the death rates of babies are considerably decreased. <TR>Furthermore</TR>, people¡¯s can easily found their diseases through the development of endoscope</MI1>. <SI1><TR>Also</TR>, extremely hard-to-cure disease, the cancer is almost conquered by highly sophisticated medical technology. These factors that I mentioned above are contributed largely to increasing people¡¯s lifespan.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, improved eating habits of people can also explain this phenomenon. Through the development of economy, people have more opportunity to intake nutritious food such as high -protein food or high-vitamin food. <TR>In the past</TR>, there were many people who died from hunger and eating infected food</MI2>.<SI2> <TR>But now</TR>, modern society, there is few people who died from that reason. This is mainly because people have more immunity from diseases by eating nutritious food.</SI2><CO>In conclusion, the development of medical science and improved eating habits of people are main factors of people¡¯s long lifespan. If we have more concerned with our health and make every effort to develope technology, I am sure that people can live longer than now.</CO>
column23: This is an average quality essay. The actual thesis only states that an argument will be made. It doesn't take sides as it should. It is very weak. The main ideas weren't clearly tied to the subject, and a lack of personal examples hurt the conclusion.

column1: 802&Nowadays, food has become easier to prepare. Has this change improved the way people live? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>Convenience of cooking makes our life rich, I believe. <TR>Especially for women</TR>, it can be called the innovation to prepare food only in a few minutes. Here are the reasons.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, people can give more devotion to outdoor activities than before. We can go camping or fishing without worry for food</MI1>. <SI1>All we have to do is buying instant food, some chips and beers. It doesn't take 10 minutes.</SI1></BO1> <BO2><MI2>My second point is that women can enjoy their own life more than when it took several hours a day to prepare meals for their family</MI2>. <SI2><TR>Nowadays</TR>, mothers can spend much more time on their own entertainment like swimming, golf, Judo and so on.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Finally</TR>, easy cooking gives us a great pleasure that everyone can be a good chef. Children are able to make popcorn by microwave. Fathers can make delicious dinner for their family by buying source and meat. I know the fact that meal from natural food and recipe is the most delicious and best food</MI3>. <SI3><TR>I also know, however</TR>, there are a lot of people who give up cooking for their precious people because of difficulties in cooking.</SI3></BO3><CO>Cooking is the present of God for human beings and easy cooking is the present of technology for ourselves, I think. Simple preparation of food promotes our mobility, women's right and happiness. These are why I think food technology improves our lives.</CO>
column23: This is a poor quality essay. It is difficult to say how this essay matches with the topic. The thesis doesn't really exist. There are a bunch of fragments put together for the introductary paragraph. The body paragraphs talk about outdoor activities such as camping and the next one talks about the pleasures of being a chef. These are hard to understand in the context of this paper. There are also many grammaticl and word choice mistakes.

To exercise body for long-term , they seek for pleasure or interaction each other through exciting game including winer and looser. They could interact with friends those who have diverse age, language, culture. Sports game include these common sense.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, excessive paraticing often may bring about disadvantages as reluctant attitude to learning or curiosity of knowledge. During sprots, we sweat from body and easily tired of some business in accordance with overburden exercising</MI2>. <SI2><TR>Also</TR>, chidren want to go out to the outward for baseball or basketball than keep in desk. <TR>Therefore</TR>, children exposed to their excessive sports will underestimate intellectual advancement.</SI2></BO2><CO>In conclusion, I think that children help keep their mentally and physically conditions through exercising sports to enhance good personality such as familiar feeling or compassion.But to hard exercising, it may interupt to acquire knowledge. <TR>However</TR>,we have to choose proper method through full consideration of advantage and advantage for practicing sports.</CO>

column3: <IN><TS>Most people are not satisfied with overall their self-image and general identification such as talent, job, intellectual ability, appearence, or so far as name. Two common factors, people seek for something that make affort to gain more affordable and comfortable living in comparison with other people in that human being are social animal and anyone have a tendency toward competitive needs of inherence</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, people cannot alone and have to interact with friends, family, and peer group in our community. Individuals are different from ability, age, language and culture, which they sometimes eager to favorite ability and rich that he are not own something</MI1>. <SI1><EX>For example, the best of a class is always the best in society and he may not have special sensitivity of artistic or inventive, spititual ablility. column23: This was an average quality essay. The Thesis was broken up into an entire introductary paragraph. It would have been more proper and efficient to make a real thesis statement. The structure of this essay suffered. The wording was choppy as well.

column1: 806&You need to travel from your home to a place 40 miles (64 kilometers) away. Compare the different kinds of transportation you could use. Tell which method of travel you would choose. Give specific reasons for your choice.
column3: <IN><TS>To move to 40miles away place, we can use a bus, a train and our own cars. It is important to choose one of transportaion that we will use, because it would make comportable and easy to take a rest. <TR>Actually</TR>, the differences among by bus, train or own cars would let people have difficulty to choose due to the different prefernce of people.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, we do not have to worry about to go restroom during the travel time through by train or by own cars. We can go restroom in a train and stop any rest area if we go with our cars</MI1>. <SI1><TR>Otherwise</TR>, if we want to go restroom in a bus, we should wait until arrive at the assigned rest area.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, we can take a rest during the trip either by bus or by train</MI2>. <SI2>Even though we are very sleepy, we cannot sleep during the driving. To travel by own car is not welcome to people who want to sleep durng the travel.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Third</TR>, we can enjoy the scenic of outside of the windows by bus, train or own cars</MI3>. <SI3>It is possible to enjoy the scenic among three of options, but we can stop and take a picture and breathe fresh air through driving by ourselves.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In short</TR>, by bus, by train or own cars have differndt benefits and downsides. It is needed to consider all of facts about these transportations before trip. <TR>However</TR>, as I like to enjoy to take a picture and do not want sleep during the trip, I would like choose to travel by my car. It would make possible to enjoy beautiful directly and comfortable because I do not have to worry about to go restroom.</CO>
column23: This was a below average essay. The author didn't really take a position until the last sentence of the essay when it was clear that the essay was supposed to be about the choice, not just the pros and cons of the options. The author's grammar and word choice, however, were well written.

column1: 807&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Playing games teaches us about life. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>We play games for many reasons such as having fun, killing time, making body shaped, and so on. <TS>Playing games sometimes gives lessons to us about life. Games can be a life as we compare life to marathon. I will demonstrate why playing games teaches us about life.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>We can learn there are rules in life as game has rules. We must keep rules in games if we want to enjoy games well. Games can be chaos Unless we don't keep rules of games. <TR>From this experience</TR>, we learn we must observe rules in life</MI1>. <SI1><TR>For instance</TR>, we can teach our child the fact that we need rules in life comparing life with sports games.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Playing games teaches us co-operation. Some games such as basketball and soccer need many players, and some strategies. We should help each other for trying to win games<MI2>. <SI2>When we play basketball, we need to pass ball each other, and assist chance for other people. These experiences teach us the fact that we can not live alone.</SI2></BO2><CO>Experience of playing games gives some tips of what we need to live a life. We try to win the game, think how to win games. From these thought we can learn some lessons about life. For my case I learn I need self-confidence for accomplishing tasks well from playing basketball. Life is similar to game and we can learn lessons about life from playing games. We learn need of rules in life, co-operation, and tips of how to live.</CO>
column23: This was an above average quality essay. The introduction was fairly weak. The thesis statement was spread over three sentences when it should have been combined into one. The focus on the topic was very nice. There should have been a few more transitions.

column1: 808&Some people think governments should spend as much money as possible exploring outer space (for example, traveling to the Moon and to other planets). Other people disagree and think governments should spend this money for our basic needs on Earth. Which of these two opinions do you agree with? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>Some people think governments should spend much money exploring outer space. The reasons are that it could satisfy curiosity of people and develop science technology through finding new resources. Others think governments should spend this money for that after spending it for our basic needs on Earth. I also agree spending this money for our basic needs. The reasons is that there are much probability of failure in its plan exploring outer space and there are a lot of people suffering poverty.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, governments could waste money because there are much probability of failure in the plan exploring outer space. Scientists just plan this exploring on their supposition finding new resources and there are high probability of failure. Do you remember Shuttle Columbia Disaster in January sixteenth? It was begun on the supposition making sure of success and was invested a lot of money</MI1>. <SI1><TR>However</TR>, it was exploded and many people was killed. <TR>Thus</TR>, investment about exploring outer space would waste money for high probability of failure.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, governments should spend money for people suffering for poverty at first. Until now, a lot of people have difficulty to have no place to live and nothing to eat in Africa. It was reported that thousands of people were death by starvation in a day in CNN news</MI2>. <SI2><TR>Therefore</TR>, government have to spend money the plan exploring outer space after they spend it for people with starvation. </SI2></BO2><CO>In conclusion, I disagree that governments spend as much money as possible exploring outer space. The reason is that governments could waste money because of much probability of failure about their plan and people suffering poverty need this money for their lives. The investment have to be tried after satisfaction of our basic needs.</CO>
column23: This was a slightly above average quality essay. The thesis sentence should have included the main points found in the sentence following it. The main points were very nice as were the supporting ideas and examples.

column1: 809& It has recently been announced that a new high school may be built in your community. Do you support or oppose this plan? Why? Use specific reasons and details in your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>I do strongly support the idea of plans to build a new high school in my community, for a new high school can assist a community to be vivid and provide students with better educational environment</TS>. <TR>Therefore</TR>, some people may be opposed to building a new high school in their village, but I support the plan because of those reasons. <BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, a new high school can help a community to be vivid. Once a new school is built in my community, it provides local residents with diverse facilities such as library, sports, and so on.</MI1> <SI1>These facilities will make it possible for local residents to spend freely their spare time and to meet their neighbors. In these course, they can form ties of neighborhoods, so it is possible for my community to be vivid.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, a new high school can offer students better educational environment. In stead of old schools, if a new high school is built , then it will give student much benefit</MI2>. <EX>For example, students will are provided clear classes and libraries. <TR>Also</TR>, they will use the latest computers in a high school</EX>. <SI2> Above all, because the number of high schools will increase in a community, the number of students per class will reduce.</SI2></BO2><CO>From what has been discussed above, I can draw the conclusion that the plan to build a new high school in my community will benefit both local residents and students. In other words, a new high school does good to the whole town.</CO>
column23: This was an above average essay. The thesis didn't quite give a preview o the points hat would be made, but there was still a position taken as to the direction of the essay. There were sufficient transitions as well as supporting evidences. These were the bare minimum to complete the essay.

column23: This was a below average quality essay. The thesis was minimally weak and didn't even start the essay in the right topic. The essay should have been about the author's actions, not general people. There were good transitions, but there were no personal examples as supporting evidence.

column1: 811&When people move to another country, some of them decide to follow the customs of the new country. Others prefer to keep their own customs. Compare these two choices. Which one do you prefer? Support your answer with specific details
column3: <IN>Although there are many different customs over the world, some people adapt quickly to the custom of a new country but others are not. <TS>The adaptative power of individuals differ from conditions. even though there are many factors which affect to observe their own customs or to follow the new customs, I think that the age and language of people are the most influential factors.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, younger people can quickly adapt to a new country. Because younger people have not fully accustomed to their own customs yet, they can easy to alter their own customs to the customs of a new country But older people have not only rooted in their own customs but also have more convenient to their own customs than those of other countries</MI1>. <SI1>My cousin's family emigrated from KOREA into U.S.A in 1988. I showed that sons of my cousin quickly more adapt than my cousin to the customs of a new country.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, the children's have often chance to learn language in a new country. Children have many chances for learning language of a new country</MI2>. <EX>For example, school, language center, talking to many friends. But adults have no chance to learn language. Adults must have job and work hard to support living and have limited time for practicing language</EX>. <SI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, the research proved that because the brain of adults has less the learning ability of language than that of children, children can easily adapt to the customs of a new country</SI2></BO2>. <CO>In conclusion, I believe that people who want to make their home in a new country need to find a balance. They should keep the best of their native culture and adopt the good things that they find in their new country.</CO>
column23: This is an above average quality essay. The thesis statement was perfect in its content. The introduction and conclusion could have been a little more developed. The body paragraphs were very well developed, structured, and full.

column1: 812&A company has announced that it wishes to build a large factory near your community. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of this new influence on your community. Do you support or oppose the factory? Explain your position.
column3: <IN><TS>If a factory is located close to the residence area, there are some advantages and disadvantages. In some aspects, it depends on the type of factory. Even some advantages exist like economic benefit and population growth, all the factory, however, have bad effects like land devaluation and pollution. So I definitely oppose the plan to build a factory near my house.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, A factory cuts off the land and house price no matter what type of factory will be built. People don't want to live next to a factory even if that factory doesn't have any danger. Once a shoe company announced that they had a plan to make a factory near my community, all the people in my hometown opposed that plan and marched the street with the picket because that factory would lower the price of their real estate</MI1>. <SI1>As soon as construction began regardless of residents' opinion, my house' value went down to the ground.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, There is no factory without pollution. It is reported that all kind of pollution can be a serious danger to our health</MI2>. <EX>For example, much more dusts flew in the air in my community than when the shoe-making factory didn't exist</EX>. <SI2><TR>After construction</TR>, many people suffered from throat-ache and children couldn't play outside at all. Even housekeepers hardly dried the clothes in the garden after laundry.</SI2></BO2><CO>No one wants to devaluate their own properties and to be threatened by poisonous toxicants because of a factory. People oppose the construction of factory strongly because they know there will be bad effects on their every day lives. <TR>A factory, therefore</TR>, should be built in the suburban area which is far from dense residence area, I think.</CO>
column23: This is an average quality essay. The thesis statement should have included not just the points but also the conclusion that the author would make. Here, they are separated. There was a general lack of transitions in this essay and only one example for two points. The focus on the topic was okay as well as the word choice and grammar.

column1: 813&It has recently been announced that a new restaurant may be built in your neighborhood. Do you support or oppose this plan?
column3: <IN><TS>I heard from the local newspaper that a new fancy restaurant would be built in my neighborhood. My neighbors are worried about that for some reasons, but I don't oppose this plan</TS>. <TR>Rather</TR>, nowadays I am very curious about what kind of restaurant it is and which food it buys.</IN><BO1><MI1>The point of mu neighbors' opposition is that a new restaurant will make our environment be polluted. They say that it's evident there will be much noise while it is being built. And after building it, there will be many problems such as the traffic jam and water pollution</MI1>, <SI1>They even say that because of the new restaurant, our area will be commercialized badly. <TR>At the end</TR>, we will lose the peaceful atmosphere as the living area.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>But I am sure that the things related with building a new restaurant will not be serious like our neighbors' worry. <TR>Nowadays</TR> the government commands the owner of the building to set up purification system to prevent the environment pollution such as water pollution which is caused by using a great deal of chemical detergent in the restaurant to wash the dishes. <TR>Therefore</TR> we don't have to be worried about that our area will be contaminated by the new restaurant. <TR>Moreover</TR>, one of the condition a new restaurant can be built is that they should prepare enough parking lot and should be located on comparably broad street. So it will not happen that the customers of that restaurant would park their cars in our neighborhood parking lot or there were heavy traffic jam. <TR>At the end</TR>, some people are afraid of the noise<MI2>. <SI2><TR>But in my opinion</TR>, it is absolutely not the problem. Although they make some noise, it is just small portion compared with the economic benefit we can get, because by building it, our local economy can be vitalized. We can expect the owner will hire the employee of the people who live in our area.</SI2></BO2><CO>In short, it will bring us much helpful effect than the side effect to build a new restaurant in my neighborhood. Even if some expected problems such as the traffic jam, noise and water pollution will be questioned, we can overcome these problems by making strict regulation concerning environment protection and keeping it.</CO>
column23: This was a below average quality essay. The thesis was just okay if it is combined but still fairly weak. IT was difficult to follow the logic and meaning of this essay. The essay seemed more like a very long introduction rather than one making a point.

column1: 814&A company has announced that it wishes to build a large factory near your community. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of this new influence on your community. Do you support or oppose the factory? Explain your position.
column3: <IN>As agriculture society exchanges into industry society, the number of factory is increasing gradually. <TS>If asked that a large factory is built close to our community, we might have a lot of benefits including the increasing of employ, the developing of transportation, and so on. <TR>However</TR>, when asked, I strongly oppose to build a factory. There are a couple of reasons for this.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, as the factory is built, we would have trouble moving into other country because of traffic jam.</MI1> <SI1>That is to say, as employees and employer commute every day and trucks transport source needed to produce, we may be interfered with traffic jam.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, building a factory could cause our country to be polluted. Gas generating when chemicals burn could pollute air of our county as well as is harmful to our body.</MI2> <SI2><TR>Also</TR>, the increasing of transportation is one of factors speeding up pollution</SI2></BO2>. <CO><TR>In summary</TR>, I am not in favor of building a large factory near our town. It would cause much better disadvantages than advantages such as pollution and traffic jam. If we have these many merits, it is not worth building a large fact no matter how many to obtain advantages.</CO>
column23: This is an average quality essay that is very mixed in what it does well. Elements of a proper thesis statement are spread out throughout the introduction. The transitions are very nice and the main ideas are satisfactory. The supporting ideas, however, are very poor and only repeat the main idea without adding anything new.

column3: <IN><TS>people say that it is important for children to gain knowledge from many different sources. It is opinion that parents are the best teachers for their children because parents are their children's best supporter and model of role.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, parents are the best supporter because we maintain a relationship with them throughout our lives</MI1>. <SI1><EX>An example of that is Edison story. His school valued about that his studying ability was low, but his mother found his merit and supported him. so, he was a great inventor.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, parents are a model of role. In Herald, an education expert wrote that children followed their parents actions from infant to school age<MI2>. <SI2><TR>so</TR>, if parents role is a model, children will be good person.</SI2></BO2> <CO>I n conclusion, I am in favor of the opinion parents are the best teachers for their children. because parents are their children's best supporter and model of role.</CO>
column23: This was an average quality essay. The thesis was not properly written and was a bit vague as to how it would solve the problem. The overall issue was development and length.

column1: 816&It is better for children to grow up in the countryside than in a big city. Do you agree or disagree? Use specific reasons and examples to develop your essay.
column3: <IN>Many families who have children tend to move to a big city while some people go to countryside for living there. Although both of them has their own reason, <TS>I think it is better for child to grow up in a big city rather than the countryside. I prefer living in a city because of several advantages:many social interaction,easier accesibility.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>One reason I support a big city is that children can make more social interaction than countryside. <TR>In contryside</TR>, children can make only one or two friends near their house while children in a big city can meet many friends their own age. <TR>In my childhood</TR>, I was always surrounded by many friends, and I learned how to understand other person, how to manage different situation like different religion, thought etc</MI1>. <SI1><TR>However</TR> children who live in the countryside may not have chance to such various person so I think living in a big city gives advantage to children by teaching them how to interact a number of people when they grow up.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Another reason for my preference children's living in a big city is to have easier accesibility to many things such as museum, theater, restuarant. chidren living in the countryside will have diffeculty in going to museum and ordering foods that they want to eat. <TR>On the contrary</TR>, children who live in a big city can easily get an information from museum and study what he or she is really interested in. They can also get a job easier than children in the countryside</MI2>. <SI2>If there's a child living in a countryside who wants to learn karate, they may not do that becuase there's no studio to exercise and teachers in the countryside. <TR>As a result</TR>, I think children in a city have an advatage of accessing easier to many thing</SI2></BO2>. <CO>To conclude, It is better for children to live in a big city rather than countryside because they will have some benefits like more social reaction and accessibility by living in a city. It will help children to adapt society well when they become adults.</CO>
column23: This was an average quality essay. The thesis statement was complete and fairly well written. The main topics were strong and had several supporting examples.

column1: 817&Are parents the best teacher?
column3: <IN><TS>Parents can be good teachers because they have observed their children for a long time. This would help them to understand their children¡¯s individual features. <TR>In my opinion, however</TR>, they cannot be the best teachers despite of this merit.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>It is necessary several factors and skills in education. <TR>First</TR>, there are many study fields to be taught to children. It is why a school needs each teacher for each subject</MI1>. <SI1>Only one or two people cannot cover all study fields. If they try to do that, then their effort will stay only on surfaces.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, professional educators developed many methods how to teach children more easily. Ordinary parents who are not majored in education do not know these skills<MI2>. <SI2>Without these skills should they face many trial errors and difficulties when they teach their children.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>As I mentioned before</TR>, parents have some merit to understand their children. Understanding, however is different from teaching. Teaching includes more professional factors. Some parents may obtain these skills, but all parents do not. Parents can be good teachers, but they are not the best in education.</CO>
column23: This is a below average quality essay. There are very few transitoins and supporting. Some additional details would have been beneficial to this essay.

column1: 818&Business should hire employees for their entire lives. Do you agree or disagree? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Not many years ago, most of public and private organizations had lifetime-hiring system.<TS><TR> However</TR>, most organizations don¡¯t need maintain it, because it is not helpful for both businesses and workers. It is rather better to pursue the effectiveness of organization and person by means of free lay-off and hiring system.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, the destruction of lifetime-hiring systems helps business increase their effectiveness and productivity. The development of new technology is diminishing the people¡¯s works. The O/A machines like computer and fax have made the speed faster and a amount of works less than before</MI1>. <SI1><TR>Therefore</TR>, businesses can accomplish their goal, with fewer workers than before. With the spread of new technology, organizations should dismiss the unnecessary workers. Lay-off can improve the productivity of various companies.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Next</TR>, lay-off can improve employee¡¯s competition. As the technology about employee¡¯s affairs is changing very fast, workers must always practice how to use the new technologies. The restructuring like lay-off makes employees practice the new technologies and improve the abilities carrying out their works, not to be dismissed in their workplaces</MI2>. <SI2><TR>As a result</TR>, they can have the chance to get a better job, if they are fired out of their job or if not, improve the skills of their works.</SI2></BO2><CO>In conclusion, business should not hire employees for their entire lives. The reason is that free layoff-system can help a business and a worker increase its productivity and improve his competition. Although lay-off causes employees to feel uneasy about their jobs, it has a lot of advantages. <TR>Therefore</TR>, businesses and employees should make an effort to improve the effectiveness of organization and person through the human-resource management system like lay-off .</CO>
column23: This is an average quality essay. The thesis satteement does a satisfactory job laying the foundation for the essay. There are excellent main points that lead to a logical conclusion. It would have been nice to have a few more examples.

column1: 819&Groups or organizations are an important part of some people's lives. Why are groups or organizations important to people? Use specific reasons and examples to explain your answer.
column3: <IN>Human beings , in nature, cannot live alone. Most of people live with their families. <TS><TR>Also</TR>, in some cases, groups or organizations are an important part of some people's lives. There maybe some reasons on why groups or organizations are an important to some people.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, groups or organizations help people achieve goals. There are some groups which aims to lose weights. Some people may think that it will be much easier to lose weight by joining the group than by doing some diets by themselves</MI1>. <SI1>People who have same goal can get together and help each other to achieve the goal. This will be also applied to the most of companies that people work together to achieve the same goal - create value and profits.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, people who have similar age group, gender or social backgrounds may get together as a group</MI2>. <SI2><EX>For example, in a church, middle school students may have their own meetings to do their own activities</EX>. Their way of thinking and preference may be far different from those of mid 40's.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Third</TR>, some people may join some groups to show off their abilities. There may be a group that only millionaires can join. Some people may want to join the group to show off their wealth</MI3>. <SI3><TR>Also</TR>, there are some groups that only very smart people(high IQ) can join. We may understand that all the people in that group may have very high IQ.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>Nowadays</TR>, with the development of internet services, we can easily access to information on groups or organizations. <TR>Also</TR>, joining a group is as easy as clicking a button through the net. <TR>Therefore</TR> I expect groups or organizations may be getting more important than before to our lives.</CO>
column23: This was a below quality essay. There was no clear thesis statement given in the introduction. It was very vague. Perhaps this is what caused the essay to vear off topic and to be so disorganized. There were great examples and some supporting points, but it wasn't clear what the main idea was and how that was to make a final point.

column1: 820&When people move to another country, some of them decide to follow the customs of the new country. Others prefer to keep their own customs. Compare these two choices. Which one do you prefer? Support your answer with specifi details.
column3: <IN>Some think that when epople move to another country, they have to keep their own custom. <TS>The reason is that their own custom remind them their own country and it can be a good opportunity trasfering their customs. <TR>However</TR>, ohters say they will follow the customs of the new country. I prefer to follow the customs because I can be familiar with a new neighborhood more easily and learn new customs.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First<TR>, there are people keeping their own customs when they move to another country. It can be helpful for me to remind my country and my home, and can make a good oppotunity to teach my new neighborhood my own customs. <TR>For instance</TR>, I can teach my children my country's language and I can make a traditional cooking</MI1>. <SI1><TR>Then</TR>, my children will realize that they are Korean and remember the country and home. <TR>Additionally</TR>, I can explain my neighborhood who are interested in my customs my own customs. <TR>Thus</TR>, keeping my own customs can help me to remind my country and make a good opportunity to teach my neighborhood it.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Seconly</TR>, I can be familiar with new neighborhood more easily when I follow the customs of the new country. <TR>Also</TR>, I can learn the customs faster than other people who keep their own customs</MI2>. <EX>For example, my new friend and I can shape more meaningful relationship by enjoying some food together in his house</EX>. <SI2><TR>Furthermore</TR>, we can be familiar with each other when I learn his favorite sports. I can learn new customs through these oppotunities. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I will follow new customs because I can make new friends more easily and I can double my cultural experiences.</SI2></BO2><CO>In conclusion, when I move to another country, keeping my own customs can remind my coundtry and home, and can show my valuable customs to my neighborhood. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, I adapt a new community more easily by following new customs and I can have a good opportunity to learn new customs. I prefer to follow new customs for making new friends more easily and new cultural experiences. <TR>As an old saying</TR>, visiting Rome, you have to do as do Romans. It is important that I have to adapt a new community and learn new things step by step rather than I keep my own things when I move to another country.</CO>
column23: This was an above average essay. The thesis could only have been improved by being clear as to which customs were being referenced. There were many great points and examples given. This was an excellent essay.

column1: 821&How do movies or television influence people's behavior? Use reasons and specific examples to explain your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>Modern life cannot be imagined without TV and movies. It is reported that people usually spend 3 hours a day in watching TV. <TR>Thus</TR> it is inevitable that TV influences the way people do. There are two ways TV or movie affect people's behavior. One is the fact that people imitate a famous actor or actress, and the other is that watchers were shocked by serious scene.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, people walk, say and do like movie heroes or heroines unconsciously. Usually, big movie star acts a role who is rich, intelligent, kind and adorable. Richard Gere was always kind, attractive, and rich guy in his movies. When 'The Pretty Woman' was played in Korea, revenue of a luxury department store increased abruptly. Richard Gere made men buy jewelry and clothes for their lovers. A star even could motivate the consumers' buying power.</MI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, Important and serious TV scenes can change the way people behave. <TR>Especially</TR>, people are affected by terrible TV scene like starving children in Africa. Two years ago, national broadcasting company (KBS) showed TV documentary film about Africa</MI2>. <SI2>It became a big social issue and I made up my mind to eat up meals and I naturally had a thankful mind what I could eat enough food everyday. The screen of very skinny children in Africa was a great shock to me and it changed my attitude to food.</SI2></BO2><CO>To conclude, movies or TV make people's behavior be changed by big stars' acts and by specific scene like hungry people. Many people watch TV several hours a day and go to the theater with their lovers and friends from time to time. So there are always a lot of influences from TV or movie that have good and bad aspects according to situation. We cannot, however, help effect from TV and movie.</CO>
column23: This was a below average quality essay. There is some flow to the thoughts in this essay, but the fragmented sentences and choppy wording were a major issue. The author also didn't make any real strong case in the essay. It was very weak and generalized.

column3: <IN><TS>Some people think that childern should begin their formal education in the young age, but some people think that young children should play in their young age. I believe that children should play in their young age. because of stress and firend problems.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR<Firstly</TR>, if children study in early age, thay may have fatal stress</MI1>. <SI1>children who have a faith to study do not matter, otherwise if not they have any purporses of doing study, it can make them nervous people. anyone who does something which is unpleasing.</SI1></BO1> <BO2><MI2><TR>Secoundly</TR>, if children study in the young age, they can't make a firends and don't know how to make a friends. it is sure that childrens have no time to make a friends because they must study only and their parents want to study</MI2>. <SI2><TR>on the contrary</TR>, childern who take much time to play can make a friends and how to make their. furthermore, childern can learn a relationship btween their friends.</SI2</BO2><CO>In summary, there are many opinions about how to raise kids, but i think making a child to play is better than making a child to study when they are in young. because thay would be able to learn how to make a friend and free from fatal stress.</CO>

column1: 824&Films can tell us a lot about the country where they were made. What have you learned about a country from watching its movies? Use specific examples and details to support your answer.

Because all pictures we can see through films are mainly composed of people's activisies. Such unique living simply divides clothes, food and house.</TS></IN> <BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, clothes that appears in the films is certainly strange to us. Clothes is specialized by county's climate</MI1>. <SI1><TR>For instance</TR>, if the county where films are made is near the North pole, clothes is modelized for warmth. we learn it through films.</SI1></BO1> <BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, food what person eat in the region has also specific prorperty.
