column1: 892&"Advertising can tell us a lot about a country. Do you agree or disagree with the statement?"
column3: <IN>In these days, people can easily approach other countrys' advertising from many things such as TV, newspapers, and the Internet. <TS>Some people say that advertising is just advertising not more than itself while others argue that advertising is more than itself. Both opinions are reasonable, <TR>However</TR>,<TR> in my opinion</TR>, I agree with the statement that advertising can tell us a lot about a country because it includes the natural environment in a country and information about the products which we want to buy. </TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Most of all</TR>, we can enjoy the natural environment in a country. Most advertising has the nature where the advertising is made such as a moutain, river, and lake</MI1>. <SI1><EX>For example, a week ago, I watched a TV advertisement about a SONY's casette player, made in Japan</EX>. <TR>In the advertisment</TR>, I could see Mt. Fuji, the symbol of Japan, behind the casette player. It was very beutiful, so I thoutht I should visit there once in my life. <TR>Thus</TR>, we can have more opportunities to see the beautiful nature in a country. </SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Additionally</TR>, advertising gives us a lot of information about the product that we want to buy.</MI2> <SI2>Whenever we have the chance to travel abroad, we want to buy some products representing the country. At that time advertising enables us to know the products well. <TR>To illustrate</TR>, before my brother visited China last year, he could get some information about many inexpensive electonic equipment from the China Economy, a noticeable newspaper in the country. <TR>Therefore</TR>, advertising is useful because it provides us with a lot of information about products made in the country.</SI2></BO2><CO>In conclusion, I think that advertising can tell us a lot about a country on account of offering us the beautiful natural scenery in a country and giving us a lot of information about goods made in the country.</CO>
column23: This is an above average quality essay. The thesis statement was develeped and complete. There were many transitions, though there could have been a few more. The main and supporting points were excellent. The essay could have had some improvement with a more develped conclusion.

column1: 893&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Television has destroyed communication among friends and family. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN><TS>Issues concerned with communication are so important that many people have much interest about this problem. (Although the attitude that television has hindered communication among friends and family has its own merits and demerits, I do not think so.) It is because television help people gather together and give subjects of talk.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>The first reason for this is that people often come together though television.</MI1> <SI1>Let me give you an example. In Korea and Japan the 2002 World Cup was held. <TR>At that time</TR>, the Korean team reached a semifinal as well as a final sixteen. <TR>So</TR>, a number of Korean get together to cheer the Korean soccer team in front of television. In this manner, television's important programs such as sports, events, news let people gather.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>What is more, television give materials of communication.</MI2> <SI2>Television has a lot of programs related to sports, musics, dramas and so on. (These subjects are things that many people have interest and fun.)<TR>In other words</TR>, people often gain subjects of talk from these programs.</SI2></BO2><CO>To make a long story short, I do not think that television has interfered with people's dialog in that it provide not only the chance of gathering people but also subject of talk. If people give much thought to positive effects of television, many people would agree with my view.</CO>
column23: This is a below average quality essay. The introduction was filled with a a section in parenthesis, whatever that was for. There are very few transitoins and supporting. Some additional details would have been beneficial to this essay. The main ideas are very weak.

column1: 894&A company has announced that it wished to build a large factory near your community. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of this new influence on your community : Do you support or oppose the factory? Explain your position
column3: <IN><TS>If a company has announced that it wished to build a large factory near your community, it would be a important issue to our community. Whether I will support or oppose will be dependant on the kind of factory. Building a large factory have many influences on my community. Some effects are good but others are bad. </TS></IN><BO1><MI1>According to building a large factory, First advantage is an increase of jobs. Many people will come to get jobs and such a income of people will give our community a great wealth</MI1>. <SI1><TR>And secondly</TR>, there will be a lot of investment to make a road or railload so our lives may be more convenient than the past. </SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>But there will exist some disadvantages too. The biggest problem is polluton of air, water and land. If the factory is specially a chemical mill which will use toxin materials, almost people of our community would oppose the factory. If our community is placed in rural region, the factory</MI2>. <SI2>Although it will not be harmful to environment, will not be difficult to be accepted by us.</SI2></BO2><CO>If we oppose the factory because of its disadvantages, someone may call us NIMBY which is short word of NOT IN MY BACKYARD. In order words, If we support the factory because of its advantages, others may call us PIMBY which is short word of PLEASE IN MY FRONTYARD. but human beings have a right to live a good life. In conclusion, whether I support or oppose the factory depends on a kinds and influences of the factory.</CO>
column23: This was a below quality essay. There was no clear thesis statement given in the introduction. It was very vague. There was an immaturity that stood out in this essay. An author should not use all caps, ever.

column1: 895&Some people prefer to eat at food stands or restaurnats. Other people prefer to prepare and eat food at home. Which do you prefer? Use specific erasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>These days, there are so many kinds of restauant. My mother always says that eating food at home is better than doing others. But I have another opinion. I prefer to eat at restaurants for following reasons.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Most of all</TR>, we can save time and endeaver when we eat something outside.</MI1> <SI1>If we try to make food, we have to spend so many times. <TR>First</TR>, we should select today's menu and decides the categories to buy at the market. And then we need to drop the market and buy. And finally we cook them. There are so many sequences and we spend our valuable times and trials to do that. <TR>But</TR>, If we eat food at the restaurant, all of these process that I said can be ignored. We just order something and enjoy it. </SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, there's another merit to eat at the restaurant.</MI2> <SI2>There's lots of kinds of restaurants and each of them has their own character. We can eat other things every time. Chinese restaurants have oriental decorations and serve rice and noodles and so on. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, Italiian restaurants show Pizza and spagethy and so on. Each of them has different sorts of food and veriety moods</SI2></BO2>. <BO3><MI3><TR>Except these reasons</TR>, there are lots of others that I prefer to eat outside.</MI3> <SI3>Their foods are made by professionals. So, their food is not only delicious but also good looking. <TR>Furthermore</TR>, we can eat some food which we can't make. and last, we can enjoy their special mood .</SI3></BO3><CO>Therefore, eating at a restaurant is easier and more convenient than doing at home. But we are care of going to the fast food restarant so often. Because that could give us many kinds of healthy problems.</CO>
column23: This was a below average quality essay. The introduction and conclusion paragraphs were not very well developed and there was no structure to any of the points given.

column1: 896& You have the opportunity to visit a foreign country for two weeks. Which country would you like to visit? Use specific reasons and details to explain your choice.
column3: <IN>There are many exciting things in each country. Some people may want to visit China for watching cultural assets such as old graves and enormous castles or others may like to visit Hawaii because it is warm and peaceful. <TS><TR>In my case</TR>, if I have the opportunity to visit a foreign country for two weeks, I will visit U.S.A, for I want to watch N.B.A games and see my grandparents in L.A.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, if I have the chance to visit U.S.A, I will watch a N.B.A game directly.</MI1> <SI1>I¡¯ve watched N.B.A games and outstanding players like Michael Jordan and Kobe Bryant on television since ever I was children. I have been charmed by their beautiful skills and dunking, and they have become my heroes. <TR>However</TR>, I have not directly watched the games in a stadium. So I hope to travel to America and watch the N.B.A games.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, if I visit U.S.A for two weeks, I will go to the my grandparents¡¯ house in Miami.</MI2> <SI2>Although I was born in L.A, I moved to Korea when very young because of father¡¯s business and I have lived in Korea. So I can not often have met grandparents. If I travel to America for two weeks, I will visit my grandparents¡¯ house in Korean town, talk to them for long time, and entertain them with singing a song and dancing.</SI2></BO2> <CO>In conclusion, I want to visit America because I wish to watch a N.B.A game and meet my grandparents in L.A. There are fascinating places around the world, but I think America is the best places to excite me.</CO>
column23: This is a average quality essay. The thesis is very strong but the author has many grammatical issues and word choice errors. These two thing being fixed, this would have been a great essay.

column1: 897&When people need to complain about a product or poor service, some prefer to complain in writing and others prefer to complain in person. Which way do you prefer? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>A complaint is one of the effective ways to improve the quality of a product or service. <TS><TR>Therefore</TR>, it is important that people make a complaint in right ways. Some people prefer to complain in writing, while others prefer to complain in person. In my opinion, complaining in writing is much better than in person, because it is more effective and polite.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>By complaining in writing, we can effectively express our opinion about a product or poor service.</MI1> <SI1>When people were on a tiptoe of exicitement, they could not properly explain what they want. However, during writing about a complaint of the product or service, people could rearrange their thoughts. <TR>As a result</TR>, they can effectively express their opinion without logical errors.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Moreover</TR>, by complaining in writing, we can say more politely as facing each other.</MI2> <SI2>When people was angry about poor service, they would be make an impulsive remark to the host or hostess. This situation maybe just hurt their feelings each other. <TR>In contrast</TR>, we can get a affirmative answer by the host or hostess, through complaining in writing that include polite expressions. </SI2></BO2><CO>People have rights to make a complaint about bad products and services. <TR>Thus</TR>, how to complain is very important. With all these benefits, I strongly agree that complaining in person is less effective and courteous than in writing. <TR>By these ways</TR>, we can expect higher qualities of products and services.</CO>
column23: This is an average quality essay. There are not many issues with it except that it does not stand out in any way. It doesn't really stir the reader and it has no real strenghs. It is sufficient for just being what it is.

column1: 898&It has recently been announced that a movie theater may be built in your neighborhood. Do you support or oppose this plan? why? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Living nearby movie theater sounds great and will affect the community in many ways both for better and for worse. It will raise real estate price and give easy access to the new facility.<TS> I am convinced, however, that it would be much better not to build movie theater beside my community because of following reasons; heavy traffic, unfavorable living condition especially noises and increasing crime rate.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, movie theaters will attract many people with many cars.</MI1> <SI1>There is no way to avoid traffic jam and noisy sound . A new movie theater, for example, was builted nearby the place I used to live and with no doubt , most dwellers complained about the heavy traffic. Besides heavy traffic, it was more hard to tolerate noisy sound when I am supposed to go to bed at 11o'clock in the night</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, it goes without saying that the more people gather, the more crimes occur.</MI2> <SI2>In other words, there has to be much argument when many people gather. An authorized survey showed that the crime rates of the urban area is 30 times higher than those of rural area on average.</SI2></BO2><CO>To sum up, if there are on-going plan which a movie theater is planned to built in our community I definitely oppose the plan with the reasons I mentioned above. Living in a good environment should be first concerns in spite of having additional benifits</CO>
column23: This is an excellent essay. The thesis statement was develeped and complete. There were many transitions, though there could have been a few more. The main and supporting points were excellent.

column1: 899&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Childhood is very important period for people to form their own personality. To be well-educated or well-raised one, children need good teachers. Some say that parents are the best teachers for their children. <TS><TR>Nevertheless</TR>, I¡¯m not of opinion that parents are the best teachers because of three reasons. <TR>Usually</TR>, parents expect too much from their children. Even though enough expectation helps children to get a right way and can be good motivation for children¡¯s effort, whether or not it is for, usually the expectation of parents to their own children is likely to be burdensome. <TR>As a result<TR>, this burden causes stress so that children may be disturbed to have a good personality.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>In addition</TR>, parents do not know everything their children want to know.</MI1> <SI1>Childhood is the period filled with so much curiosity. It is impossible that all parents are specialized in what children want to know, thus their little knowledge is often not helpful for children¡¯s curiosity. <TR>In this situation</TR>, children need someone who has more wide or specific knowledge than their parents have.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>The last one I want to say is children are apt to imitate parents¡¯ bad habit.</MI2> <SI2>It has been announced that children of smoker have high possibility to be smoker when they become adult, and children raised by overweight parents are likely to be fat in the future. These are mostly caused from parents¡¯ bad life style or habits. <TR>Moreover</TR>, children tend to imitate bad things than good things.</SI2></BO2><CO>In conclusion, due to three reasons that I mentioned above, too much expectation, little knowledge and children¡¯s high possibility to imitate bad habit, I disagree that parents are the best teachers.</CO>
column23: This is an above average quality essay. The thesis statement was develeped and complete. There were many transitions, though there could have been a few more. The main and supporting points were excellent. The essay could have had some improvement with a more develped conclusion.

column1: 900&Some items (such as clothes or furniture) can be made by hand or machine. Which do you prefer – items made by hand or items made by machine? Use reasons and specific examples to explain your choice.
column3: <IN><TS>I like items which are made by hand. I think that items that are made by machine don't have maker's endeavor and soul. They are just objects which are made for enough supply and producer's interest. <TR>But</TR>, in case of items which are made by hand, they have something about maker mind, effort and spirit</TS>. Then I will show you why I think so.</IN><BO1> <MI1><TR>First</TR>, items made by hand represent maker's effort.</MI1> <SI1>People who make the items spend long time to complete his project. Sometimes it spends several months or years. Through the making process, maker shows great ability as a one man and this ability is accomplished by great effort of maker. So I think that items have maker's effort.</SI1></BO1><BO2> <MI2><TR>Second</TR>, items made by hand have maker's spirit.</MI2> In the previous paragraph, I refer to maker's effort for making items. <SI2>This effort also includes maker's mind that shows maker's faith and spirit. I can feel maker's soul through the items because they are representative of maker's mind. So I think that they display his life and soul as a item maker.</SI2></BO2><CO>Items made by hand have something about maker and I can feel this through items. Items which are made by machine can't have this. So I prefer items which are made by hand.</CO>
column23: This is an above average quality essay. The thesis is perfect and includes both a hypothesis and an introduction to two main points. The body paragraphs are also nice though they could have used more transitions and examples. The conclusion was a bit short.

column1: 901&People have different ways of escaping the stress and difficulties in modern life. Some read; some exercise; others work in their gardens. What do you think are the best ways of reducing stress? Use specific details and examples in your answer.
column3: <IN> <TS><TR>In modern society</TR>, people have lots of distress related their hard work or relationship of other peole. <TR>For escaping from the distress</TR>, most peope have effort to go out of distress by exercising or reading and each has a their own method</TS>. I recommend one of my the best of reducing of distress is a spititual experience.</IN> <BO1> <MI1>I have been to suffer from headache for a long time and I had treated from hospital But medical doctor said that the headache was caused by distress.</MI1> <SI1>I aware that the distress result in my mind. <TR>Then</TR>, I prayed to god for my own hope and help in one church. <TR>And then</TR>, the headache gradually become reduced. Meditation enable me to encourage in solving some hard work or complain by reducing distress. I have a confident and have more energetic and dynamic life before. Spitituality allowed me new awareness and perception.</SI1></BO1><BO2> <MI2><TR>Also</TR>, workship or pray give me a method of stability.</MI2> <SI2>These trial also can interact with people included in religious community. They make an effort to help other people and seem to pure mind without ego-centered thinking. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I can improve my own feeling or needs. Spititual ritual such as worship or pray help me stable and joyful.</SI2></BO2> <CO>In conclusion, people would like to go out of difficlulities of daily and try to improve distree through their own each method. One of the best of own methods is spiritual training as worship or pray. The meditation enable me stable or pleasure. <TR>By doing so</TR>, I have a good feel or confident about my daliy life.</CO>
column23: This was a below average quality essay. The structure of this essay didn't quite match the thesis. The thesis only had one main point though there are two in the essay's body paragraphs. The first body paragraph is actually an introduction. The main points are also actually introductions and not main points at all.

column1: 902&Some people prefer to live in a small town. Others prefer to live in a big city. Which place would you prefer to live in? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>More people usually live in a big city than in a small town. Some people in a country want to move to a big city because it offers more opportunities like jobs, educations, and entertainments than a small town does, while others prefer living in the country because there are fresh air and foods. Although there are advantages of living in a small town, I want to live in a big city that gives me a lot of opportunities of education and entertainments.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, people can use many education institutes and schools.</MI1> <SI1>There are many educational institutes in a big city, like English conversation institutes, management schools, and so on. People in countryside hardly attend those institutes. <TR>However</TR>, I can attend the English conversation institute every morning before my work starts. It is very close to my office. <TR>If I work in suburbs</TR>, I never think of it. The bigger a city size is, the more opportunities it offers, I think.</SI2> <BO2> <MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, entertainments are very important to our lives.</MI2> <SI2>People want to go to entertainment facilities like theaters, parks and stadiums. It is true that there are more entertainments in a big city than in a small town. Seoul, where I live in, has hundreds of theaters, parks, museums and other joyful places. Whenever I left Seoul, the biggest city in Korea, I felt inconvenience because I cannot easily go to movies or stadium. <TR>In short</TR>, a big city can give people a great deal of entertainments.</SI2></BO2><CO>To conclude, a big city has more education and entertainment opportunities than a small town. A number of people work, study, enjoy and sleep in a metropolis and that fact shows the advantages of a big city. <TR>Thus</TR>, I prefer a big city to a small town because I can more easily access many education institutes and entertainment places.</CO>
column23: This is an average quality essay. The thesis is excellently written. The main points are decent and the supporting points are perfect in content and length. The main issues with this essay were the grammatical and word choice errors.

column1: 903&Films can tell us a lot about the country where they were made. What have you learned about a country from watching its movie? Use specific examples and details to support your response.
column3: <IN> <TR>In the modern society</TR>, all of country make films whether the style is comic or not. <TR>In that case</TR>, I expect that the movie must reflect the parts of my country. <TS>When I watch a movie which is made my country or other country, I think, I can learn the life style , economy, language of the country.</TS></IN> <BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, I surely can learn about the lift style of the nation.</MI1> <SI1>Most of film makers already know that the strange movie cannot earn money. <TR>Thus</TR> they try to make a similar style movie to the people. <EX>For example, when I must choose only one movie, I surely go to korean movie, because I'm a korean and korean movie is familar to me</EX>. <TR>So</TR>, film makers think that movie must have a mirror which reflect their nation. <TR>In this reason</TR>, when I watch a film, I surely obtain the life style from the movie. In a survey, I can see the fact that many foreigners who are lived in korea usually go to theater to understand korean.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, I can learn about the economy from watching a film.</MI2> <SI2>In korean saying, before you go abroad, you must read the book which is written about the economy. Films always depends on the economy. In wealthy country, the movie have a good quality. <TR>In poor country</TR>, the movie have not. When I see a movie, I can define the quality of movie, although I am not a expert.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Third</TR>, I can surely learn the language from the movie.</MI3> <SI3>Actors usually speak their own language. In my case, frankly speaking many students do like me , I sometimes watch a foreign movie, because I want to improve my foreign language. My mother language is korean.<TR> In other words</TR>. the ability of speaking foreign language ,such as english, japanese and so forth, is limited. When I watch a film, I can hear the actor's voice which is foreign language.</SI3></BO3><CO>In summary, when I watch a movie, I can learn about life style, economy, and language. It is very useful to me. When I go abroad, I can talk with somebody easily , if I already know about the country from watching films.<TR> In addition to</TR> , I can communicate freely because of the knowledge about the economy. But I think such merits that shopping buildings have isn't more than harms that they have.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, I don't agree this plan for traffical problem.</MI1> <SI1>Someone insist that this plan help my neighborhood's traffical state improved. Even if the region's roads are widen, but more people come and go through this area, so that road will be full of people and cars</SI1></BO1>. <BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, I disagree this plan for noisy problem.</MI2> <SI2>Even though only one shopping mall is built in my neighborhood, for all day, specially for evening we will experience very loudly noise. column1: 905& Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Television has destroyed communication among friends and family. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN> <TR>At first</TR>, broadcasting industry got started from public purposes. <TS><TR>Nowadays</TR>, as to the influences of television, some people say that television offer relaxing time and useful information to us while others argue that television always does not have a good effect on us because of its hindrance to communication among people. <TR>In my opinion</TR>, television provides us with rich topics to talk about and a chance to get together with each other, so I am against to the opinion that television has destroyed communication.</TS><BO1><MI1><TR>Most of all</TR>, television helps us communicate with others because it gives us rich topics to talk about.</MI1> <SI1>We watch television almost every evening with our family. <EX>For example, my father and I enjoy watching news or knowledge-based documentary programs. Watching these programs we sometimes discuss current affairs such as Presidential election or economic problems. <TR>Likewise</TR>, hot issues on television like news or trendy drama are the most common topics among my colleagues in my company. If some of them who didn't watch television at the previous night they cannot even take part in the discussion because they don't know about the previous day¡¯s events or incidents. <TR>In this manner</TR>, since television provides us with various topics related to our lives, it helps us form our sense of intimacy with family or friends.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Next</TR>, television promotes our communication because it offers a chance to get together with families or friends.</MI2> <SI2><TR>Nowadays</TR>, most people are so busy that they cannot have much time to spend their time with family and friends.<TR> However</TR>, through TV programs, we can have a chance to get along with them. <TR>For instance</TR>, during the 2002 world cup, many people had a great time with their family or friends. To watch soccer games, we gathered in front of TV with friends or family who we were alienated from for a long time. <TR>Consequently</TR>, such TV programs help us build closer human relationships among people. <TR>Thus</TR>, I think television plays an important role in promoting communication with family or friends.</SI2></BO2><CO>In conclsusion, since television offers diverse topics to talk about and opportunities to get together with others, I disagree that television has destroyed communication with families or friends.<TR> In my opinion</TR>, it is more reasonable that television has just changed the way of communication rather than it has destroyed communication among people,</CO>

column1: 907&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? A person¡¯s childhood years are the most important years of a person¡¯s life. Use specific reasons and examples to support you answer.

It is because they don¡¯t realize that such activities could disturb other people.</SI2></BO2><CO>In conclusion I support that childhood is very important in a person¡¯s life as shown in the preceding descriptions; <TR>moreover</TR>, children have numerous possibilities about their future.</CO>

column1: 908&Some people believe that the best way of learning about life is by listening to the advice of family and friends. Other people believe that the best way of learning about life is through personal experience. Compare the advantages of these two different ways of learning about life. Which do you think is preferable? Use specific examples to support your preference.
column3: <IN><TS>There are two representative ways of learning about life. One is by listening to the advice of my family and friends. The other one is by having personal experience. Both indirect and direct ways of learning have their own advantages.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, learning through other¡¯s advices doesn¡¯t need much time and effort.</MI1> <TR>Therefore</TR>, people can get a variety of knowledge about something in short time. <SI1><EX>For example, a few months ago, I bought a new car after asking my family and friends who have had their own cars. As they have used different cars and known good or bad points of certain cars, I could get diverse information about different cars. Their advices were very helpful for choosing my car</EX>. Had the advices not been for, I might have gone through difficulty in deciding the car to use.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, what I learn from my experience has more powerful effect.</MI2> <SI2>There is a saying, ¡°Seeing is believing.¡± That stresses the importance of experiencing something directly. <TR>For instance</TR>, I had always heard that I should study hard not to regret and not to have difficulty in entering a university in higher rank. <TR>Of course</TR>, I knew studying hard was important, but that was all. <TR>However</TR>, now I regret that I didn¡¯t do my best in my school years. I do realize how crucial my schoolwork in my teens after I experiencing it directly. <TR>If given the chance again</TR>, I would never let the same thing happen.</SI2></BO2><CO>As I have said above, each way of learning has its own advantage: the former one is efficient when it comes to time and variety. The latter one has strong impact. If I had to choose one, I would learn by experiencing something because the person who know myself best and which life is apt to me is myself not others.</CO>

column1: 909&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? It is more important for students to study history and literature than it is for them to study science and mathematics. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN><TS>As many subjects are in school, there are different preferences among students. It is the ancient belief that studying history and literature is more important than studying mathmatics and science, whereas others think the opposite for following reasons: wisdoms from our ancestors, being proud of their own root, and expression of individuality.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>The most important aspect from studying history is learning the life skills from our forefathers.</MI1> <SI1>Even if modern people have more convenient skills invented through science, the more useful skills exist in the ancient time. <EX>For example, there are many pills maded through the ancient ways</EX>. <TR>Especially</TR>, in Korea, many doctors use some plants for the ingredients of pills, as our ancestors have.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Next</TR>, knowing their origins well makes people be proud of themselves.</MI2> <SI2>As they atudy history and its literature, they can be taught what people before them have done for them; it makes them to feel thankful for their ancestors and look up for the people ahead. <TRAfterall</TR>, they feel how proud they feel about what they are.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>lastly</TR>, through the literature, people can reveal their expressions.</MI3> <SI3>Sonce long, if a country rules other countries, they tried to steal thier language and literature, which forms most of a culture. <TR>That is</TR>, the literature reveals individualities and thoughts so that the subordinate countries can think of the rebels less without their culture. <TR>Therefore</TR>, learning literature helps people show their own personal values and feelings.</SI3></BO3><CO> <TR>As stated above</TR>, knowledges of living methods, self-proudness from one's origin, and individualities are gained by studying history and literature. <TR>As a matter of fact</TR>, you can find out more advantages about the learning these domian than the field of science or mathmetics. <TR>Thus</TR>, people should value more in learning history and literature than in sciense and mathematics, and try to gain such benefits though the study.</CO>

column1: 910& Do Movies or Television influence people's behavior?
column3: <IN>Is it influential to people's behavior to watch movies or TV? Obviously it is. <TS><TR>There are, howerver</TR>, two oppostie point of view when it comes to how do they effect us; badly or in a good way. I will present how TV or moives affect our behavior.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>On the one hand</TR>, Watching TV or movies severely affect our behavior, espacially when we watch very violent and sensual contents.</MI1> <SI1>Despite all the effort to expel the bad contents such as killing, drug, sensual scene, that kind of stuff are still dominant in TV or movie-making industry because TV or movie are very commercial, not but educational. <TR>Under this bad influence,</TR> many teenagers even mimic the crime which has been depicted as cool and nice in a movie. School violence is another consequence.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, TV or movies is a good way to acquire invaluable information or experience.</MI2> <SI2><TR>In daily life</TR>, we usually restrict ourself into our culture and experience. Through TV or movies, we can experience other's culure or share the other's experience whcih help us understanding each other. <EX>For example, someone can experience indirectly the horrible atmosphere of World War II when he or she see the movie "Shyindler List"</EX>. Then he might realize the importance of peace and tried to become peacekeeper. <TR>In this way</TR>, watching TV or moive enable us to enlare our narrow understanding of the world and hava a heart on each other's needs.</SI2></BO2><CO>In conclusion, it is hard to determine whether watching TV or moive have an influence upon human behavior in a good way or not. In the sence that their influence depend on the response of watcher, we need to develop our ability to discern what is good influence and what is not.</CO>

column1: 912&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Universities should give the same amount of money to their students' sports activities as they give to their university libraries. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN> <TS>Some universities are very famous for their sports activities while others are known for academic achievements. Sports are important activities of universities. <TR>However</TR>, pursuit of truth is the ultimate purpose of them. <TR>Therefore</TR>, universities should concentrate on offering the advanced education and sports are only additional activities for students</TS>. So I strongly insist that more budgets should be used for their libraries than for sports. <BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, students usually go to universities for their academic or career achievements although the tuition is expensive.</MI1> <SI1>Universities are basically founded for advanced education. Universities cover a great number of fields of study. So students can choose the departments on their own and spend much money for achievements in their studies. They expect the money they pay is used for better lectures and libraries. In short, students want to learn the advanced knowledge in their universities.</SI1></BO1><BO2> <MI2> <TR>Secondly,/TR>, sports are additional activities that give us joy, unity, and physical improvement.</MI2> <SI2>Although students can feel the sense of unity, joy of victory, and improvement in physical status through sports activities, those are not main objectives of universities but sub-activities. Students are not likely to expect that their tuitions be used for sports activities more.<TR> Thus</TR>, there can be universities without sports but cannot be universities without libraries, I think.</SI2</MI2><CO>To conclude, universities should give more money to their libraries because people want to accomplish academic or career results in universities and sports is only additional activities of them. Universities are originally founded for further studies hundreds of years ago in Europe. The purpose of them is not changed today. If there are sports activities, they can enjoy them for a change. <TR>However</TR>, students basically expect more specific studies in universities.</CO>

So I can catch the standard English and meet many good expressions that actual speakers usually use in their everyday life</MI2>. <SI2>These expressions are very helpful when I am faced with the situation in which I should use English. </SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Third</TR>, the main medium of expression in this movie is not showing spectacular scene but talking to each other.</MI3> <SI3>The theme of this conversation is basically about love, sex, and marriage. 4 women are very frank characters so they say about their opinion without concealing. This gives me another enjoyment that I can have an idea about the point of view of some Americans and their mental world.</SI3></BO3><CO>To conclude, whenever I see the foreign movies, I can get lots of information related to the life of the foreigners such as their fashion, culture, life style, the way of thought and even their language. column3: <IN><TS><TR>Our country</TR>, South Korea, has 5000 year history. We have a lot of holidays to celebrate many events occurred in long history, I, <TR>however</TR>, would like to honor this special event. </TS></IN><BO1><MI1>Hangul is our language in South Korea. It was made long ago by king Sejong. A few years ago we had special day for celebrating Hangul, but since we had too many holidays, we extract this day from holiday.</MI1><SI1> <TR>Before using Hangu</TR>l, we had used the Chinese language. Many people except for scholar had difficulties in using the language; as a result, king sejong made the Korean language, Hangul, for those people. It is very scientific language. Everything which we pronunciation can be made by Hangul.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In this holiday</TR>, I, as our country does in holiday, will hoist our national flag outside each house.</MI2> <SI2>And I want to make competition to write poem or prose. <TR>Third</TR>, as s result of increasing of using foreign language instead of Hangul, I¡¯d like to conduct a campaign to promote using Hangul. <TR>Last</TR>, in succession this campaign, I want to drive to recollect the foreign language to Korea language, Hangul.</SI2></BO2><CO>The reason I want to choose this event as s holiday is Hangul contain our national spirit. While other languages are getting banished, Hangul stands for our nation. By celebration this special day, we will become love our language, hangul.</CO>

column1: 920&When people succed, it is because of hard work. Luck has nothing to do with success." Do you agree or disagree with the quotation above?

column1: 923&Is it better to learn about life through your own experience, or through advice from friends and family? Compare the advantages of these two options, and which would you prefer? Use specific examples and reasons to explain your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>people usually experience various events through all their lives, and through these experiences we can learn about lives. There are various ways to have experiences and learn about lives - advice form friends and family, and through my own experience, and so on. Of course, each method has own good and bad sides</TS>. <TR>In my opinion</TR>, out of them, it is better to experience many things by myself. </IN><BO1><MI1>Whether I learn about life through my own experience or I get some information about life by using advice from friends and family, both are very good for me</MI1>. <SI1><TR>In our lives</TR>, experiences are very important, because they provide us some useful wisdom how to solve problems which happen to us.</SI1></BO1> <BO2><MI2>We cannot experience all events which occur in our society.</MI2> <SI2><TR>So</TR>, if I face a problem which I cannot solve, my friends and family could help me solve the problem. <TR>In contrast</TR>, if my friend have an event which she cannot solve, I could give an advice about it through my experience. <TR>That is</TR>, own experience and advice from friends can compensate each side. </SI2></BO2><CO>I prefer to learn about life through my own experience, but there are many ways which I can learn about life, and they are very useful.</CO>
column23: This is an average quality essay. The thesis is fairly weak as it only gives a hypothesis but no evidence behind it in the thesis statement. Both should be included. column1: 924&Some people think that governments should spend as much money as possible on developing or buying computer technology. Other people disagree and think that this money should be spent on more basic needs. Which one of these opinions do you agree with? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>I think governments should spend money on basic needs rather than on computer technology. Why would computer technology matter when thousands of people die of hunger every day? <TR>Also</TR>, I think developing or buying computer technology can wait. We are now living in an advanced world. In my opinion, getting basic needs are more urgent. <TR>Most importantly</TR>, governments are to represent all citizen. It is governments' duty to help people who don't have basic needs.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>Many people don't have houses to live, food to eat, or clothes to wear.</MI1> <SI1><TR>To them</TR>, the advanced computer technology wouldn't matter. <TR>Also</TR> many people don't have access to computers. It is not yet widely accepted than basic needs are. Government should spend money on things that are really necessary and required.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>There is a plenty of time to develop or buy computer technology.</MI2> <SI2>It is not that it is essential in our lives. <TR>However</TR>, people can't live without food, houses, and clothes. Developing computer technology can be done after more people find better lives. I think it is selfish to just neglect people without basic needs and try to find more ways to make their lives better by computer technology.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Lastly</TR>, providing basic needs for people are a part of the governments' duty.</MI3> <SI3>Governments are to provide better lives for people. They wouldn't be doing their jobs if they just neglect people who need help desperately</SI3></BO3>. <CO>Governments should spend as much money as possible on providing basic needs for people who need them. Basic needs are required and necessary while computer technology isn't. <TR>Also</TR> more people need basic needs than computer technology. <TR>Also</TR>, developing computer technology can be done later. <TR>Lastly</TR>, it is part of governments' job to provide basic needs for people.</CO>
column23: This was a fairly good essay. The introduction and conclusion paragraphs were very well written. The body paragraph supporting ideas were a bit weak. The min ideas were great.

Because we can eliminate stress that we have got presently through that directly activity and we hold our health through it. </TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, we can remove stress or gloomy feelings through attending that performance. I think to eat food at home is better than to do at food stands or restaurants.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>As above metioned</TR>, the purpose of eating is to give our body some necessary materials.</MI1> But now eating do more than its essential purpose. <SI><EX>For example, during the meal, we can make a good reationship among people who are attending the meal and it is also used for just relation.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>First</TR>, the benefit of eating at stands or restaurants comes from its convenience.<MI2> <SI2>If we go to restaurants, we don't need prepare the material for meal and cook the meal. Just after booking the restaurants, we can go and eat. <TR>Moreover</TR> if we want to eat speicail food, which is difficult to cook by ourselves, we had better go to restaurants. But It have some disadvantages. One of them is concerned with its high price. Usually to eat at restaurants are more expensive than to do at home. And we should maintain manners at restaurants. Sometimes it will disturb us.</SI2></BO2> <BO3><MI3><TR>Second</TR>, the eating at home have many advantages too<MI3>. <SI3>During preparation the meal, we can cook the food by using materials which we want to eat and according to our aptitudes, we can control food appreciately, and it looks like more friendly than to eat at restaurants.</SI3></BO3><CO>In conclution, we can say that to eat at home have more advantage than to eat at restaurants. The more our society develop, the more we want to be convenient. But there exist much more important things than convenience.<TR> In advance</TR>, we should think of what those are.</CO>

column1: 935&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? People are never satisfied with what they have; they always want something more or something different. Use specific reasons to support your answer.
column3: <IN> <TS>Society have been developed with many invetions. People invented electricity ,automile as well as social system. These progress is outcomes of endless desire of mankind</TS>. Since people are never satisfied with what they have.</IN> <BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, in history, many countries tried to expand their land. In korean history, when three countries,kokurye ,baekjae and silla, coexisted in korean pennisula, these three countries always fighted for their lands</MI1>. <SI1>Many soldiers died in war. But the three kings too greedy to stop wars.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, human's desire for money is endless.</MI2> <SI2>The more we have, the more we want. Once the most richest man in Korea, Jun joo-young never satisfied with what he had. He expanded his business and invested more money for more profit. This clearly illustrates this situation.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Moreover</TR>, human's curiosity toward nature is tremendous.</MI3> <SI3><EX>For example, these days, most physical phenomenons happening around us can be explained with traditional Newton's mechanics</EX>. <TR>But</TR>, physicist have developed quantum mechanis to explain metriculous particles, such as quarks.</SI3></BO3><CO>People are hardly satisfied with what they have. In a simple example, student struggle for better score and salary men work hard for higher payment. <TR>Of course</TR>, controlling desire is very difficult. But it should be pointed out that excessive desire can cause serious problems.</CO>

column1: 936&Holidays honor people or events. If you could create a new holiday, what person or event would it honor and how would you want people to celebrate it? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>Our country, South Korea, has 5000 year history. We have a lot of holidays to celebrate many events occurred in long history, I, <TR>however</TR>, would like to honor this special event. </TS></IN><BO1><MI1>Hangul is our language in South Korea. It was made long ago by king Sejong.</MI1> <SI1>A few years ago we had special day for celebrating Hangul, but since we had too many holidays, we extract this day from holiday. Before using Hangul, we had used the Chinese language. Many people except for scholar had difficulties in using the language; as a result, king sejong made the Korean language, Hangul, for those people. It is very scientific language. Everything which we pronunciation can be made by Hangul.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In this holiday</TR>, I, as our country does in holiday, will hoist our national flag outside each house</MI2>. <SI2>And I want to make competition to write poem or prose.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Third</TR>, as s result of increasing of using foreign language instead of Hangul, I¡¯d like to conduct a campaign to promote using Hangul</MI3>. <SI3><TR>Last</TR>, in succession this campaign, I want to drive to recollect the foreign language to Korea language, Hangul.</SI3></BO3><CO>The reason I want to choose this event as s holiday is Hangul contain our national spirit. While other languages are getting banished, Hangul stands for our nation. By celebration this special day, we will become love our language, hangul.</CO>

column1: 937& Is it better to learn about life through your own experience, or through advice from friends and family? Compare the advantages of these two options, and which would you prefer? Use specific examples and reasons to explain your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>When people learn about life, they experience their own or gain advices or information from friends and family. These ways have advantages each other. <TR>Of these two ways</TR>, I prefer to learn through advice from friends and family, because they help me to see a various opinions about life.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>On the one hand</TR>, I think getting some advices or gaining another values from other persons give me various opinions.</MI1> <SI1>They have another opinion or values about life, so they give me other points of view. <EX>For example, when I was high school students, I thought most traditional practices are bad, because it is not useful and not practical; however, my best friend, kevin had another opinion. He thought most traditional practices are good for our lives because it reflect their wise experiences during their lives. I did not agree his whole opinion, but it influenced on me about my opinion dealing with traditional practices and I can see another point of view</EX>. <TR>As seen in the above example</TR>, I think advice from friends or family gives me diverse opinions about values of life.</SI1><BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, learning about life through my own experience strengthen my own values.</MI2> <SI2><TR>Sometimes</TR>, leanring my own is more helpful for me because, too much advices make me confusing. If I heard all of the opinions, I would not decide what is right or not. <TR>However</TR>, if I learn by myself about my life, I would be obstinate about my values.</SI2></BO2><CO>As indicated by these things, two opinions give me merits repectively; however, if I have to choose the one thing I prefer, I would select receiving advices from friends or family about learning my life. That's because they give me a variety of other values or opinions structuring my own values.</CO>
column23: This was an excellent essay. The thesis was developed and clear. The transitions were nice and flowed directly into some great main and supporting evidence. The examples were well thought out, and the delivery was well done.

column1: 938&When people need to complain about a product or poor service, some prefer to complain in writing and others prefer to complain in person. Which way do you prefer? Use specific and examples to support.
column3: <IN><TS>If you bought low qualitative products or experience poor service, you will express your complaint such as writing a letter and complaining personally. I¡¯d like to choose to write a letter because it has many advantages like more persuasive; preserving for a long time. <TR>In this essay</TR>, I will demonstrate why writing a letter is my preference.</TS></IN> <BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR> writing a letter is more persuasive than expressing in person.</MI1> <SI1>If you experienced poor service in a departmentstore, you would feel like complaining about it at once. <TR>However</TR>, if you want to consider one more time about it, you go back home and will write a letter in order to recount about poor service experienced in the departmentstore. When a supervisor who works at the place sees your letter, he will recognize such complaint you experienced. So he will try not to take place the similar case.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR> the letter which you write can be preserved for a long period.</MI2> <SI2>So the letter will be a good sample for solving a bad product or service. It has as influence on others¡¯ activities or choices. <TR>As a result</TR> if you choose to write a letter you can give others the information about a product or service. <TR>Furthermore</TR> the record of your letter could be used as the specimen for more service.</SI2></BO2><CO>In conclusion if you were taken a bad product or service you would choose to write a letter as I¡¯m shown in the preceding explanations. I believe that writing letter has several benefits. Although complaining in person can get rid of stress, the activities could keep bad relationship with the other. So I¡¯d like to recommend writing a letter as the method of expressing my complaint.</CO>

column1: 939&Groups or organizations are an important part of some people¡¯s lives. Why are groups or organizations important to people? Use specific reasons and examples to explain your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>Human, as social animal, has been living in groups. We also live in groups dividing each other¡¯s work</TS>. But why we have been living in groups or organizations since people live in earth? There are some reasons.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, we can¡¯t satisfy what we need by ourselves. It would be possible to live alone in primitive society</MI1>. <SI1><TR>Nowadays</TR>, <TR>however</TR>, as the world is getting bigger and complicated, we rely on other people for what we can¡¯t meet ourselves such as computers, food, house and so on. We even can¡¯t make a car by ourselves!</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Another reason for importance of groups or organization is that human recognize and develop themselves only in society.</MI2> <SI2>When we are in society, we meet many people, and experience a lot of things. During these activities we will be aware of ourselves. Besides while we compete with other people, we will be able to extend our view of society.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>In addition</TR>, as soon as we are born, we belong to family, that is, a group.</MI3> <SI3>Many families become group. Many groups become society. <TR>In conclusion</TR>, we can¡¯t live without society.</SI3></BO3> <CO><TR>So far</TR>, I explained three views on necessary of groups and organization. These have several advantages like opportunity to develop and to recognize ourselves. Life without belonging society is nothing to us.</CO>

column1: 940&You need to travel from your home to a place 40 miles away, compare the different kinds of transportation you could use. Tell which of travel you would choose. Give specific reasons for your choice.
column3: <IN><TS>Modern society is rapidly advancing through the course of time; moreover, many transportations is made by scientific technology. If I travel from my home to a place 40 miles away, I have many ways such as taking a bicycle; motorcycle; train; bus; car; subway train etc. <TR>In this essay</TR> I would like to demonstrate advantages and disadvantages of the transportation and then explain why I choose a car.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>The other transportations except a car have limitation like weather and schedule.</MI1> <SI1>A bicycle is easily operated and can pass a narrow road and alley. A motorcycle have also such a merit. <TR>However</TR>, they have an influence on weather. <TR>For instance</TR>, when you ride a bicycle or motorcycle in the rain, your will be wet and you need to change the clothes.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>A train</TR>, bus, and subway train have the confinement of their time and schedule.</MI2> <SI2>If you take a train, bus, and subway train you must wait in one place until they arrive, and walk for reaching your destination. <TR>In the case of the bus</TR>, if traffic jams take place you would spend a plenty of time than ever before.</SI2></BO2> <BO3><MI3><TR>On the other hand</TR>, a car can be used regardless of weather and schedule when you want.</MI3> <SI3><TR>Unlike a bus</TR>, the car can avoid a place where traffic congestion is happened. <TR>For instance</TR> while you drive your car you can listen to events about traffic jams or accidents through the radio and then select shortcuts. <TR>Furthermore</TR> you can choose the time as well as the destination you want. <TR>As a result</TR> the car have a number of choices and manners.</SI3></BO3><CO>In conclusion, if I want to travel a place away from 40 miles, I would like to select a car as shown in the preceding explanations and examples. Although the others have benefits such as convenience when I take a subway train or bus, a car can go several sites where I want to travel, therefore I would like to choose a car.</CO>

column1: 941&Is it better to learn about life through your own experience, or through advice from friends and family? Compare the advantages of these two opinions, and which would you prefer? Use specific example and reasons to explain your answer.
column3: <IN>Which do you prefer to learn about life through your own experience or through advice from your friends and family?<TS><TR> In some sense, we should pay attention to other people's advice to get dome information which is helpful for our life, because our life is not long enough to have all experiences that we should do. <TR>However</TR>. indirect experience we get from other people is not vivid and we can't internalize the advice into our own experience</TS>. And so, how should we learn about our life?</IN><BO1><MI1>Usually I like to listen my to my grandmother.</MI1> <SI1>Although she just graduated from elementary school, her long life made her a wise woman. and she has a lot of knowledge related to our everyday life. Whenever I had in trouble, I used to visit her and asked her my problem. Then my problem was always in the range of her own experience. and I could get a key to solve my problem. <TR>Like this</TR>, I can go to the right way without making mistake by receiving a wise man's advice.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>However</TR>, when I don't realize any problem, the advice from other people is sometimes useless.</MI2> <SI2><TR>In my childhood</TR>, I liked to swim in the sea near my house. My father was always worried about me and told me not to go to the deep part of the sea. But I didn't think my father's advice seriously. In that time, I thought and danger which might happen in the sea would not be my business. <TR>One day</TR>, I went to the sea and swam without reminding my father's advice. I went to the deep part of the sea, and I knew that my feet could not touch the bottom of the sea. <TR>At the end</TR>, I was saved by my father, after coming near drowning. <TR>Through this experience</TR>, I could realize the importance of keeping the rule in the sea.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In short</TR>, our experience is too limited to apply to all of the situations we will confront to, so we should listen carefully to other people's advice. At the same time, there are some disadvantages in learn about life from other people's good words. Although it is a very good advice, it would be abstract unless we do not consider it seriously or we think that it is not connected with our own problem. In this case, only our own experience can give us practical help.</CO>

column1: 942&A good supervisor or boss certain qualities. What important qualities or traits do you think a good supervisor needs to have? Explain your answer with specific details and reasons.

I believe they might have significant qualities or features to lead others.<TR> In this essay</TR>, I would like to explain why they might need leadership, truth, and dedication.</TS> </IN><BO1><MI1>First of all supervisors are required to have leadership in order to control the activities of his employees.</MI1> <SI1>Leadership is refered to the power to change somebody¡¯s heart to guide another person¡¯s mind and actions. If you are the president of a company, you need many people to administer the corporation well, and if you didn¡¯t have a good leadership ability that your company would be difficult to manage.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR> it is necessary for a good boss to be truthful when he contacts his workers.</MI2> <SI2>If you are honest, your employees will regard you as a wonderful person and will work harder as a result, and the harder they work the more successful your company will become.Therefore truthfulness allows people to trust someone.</SI2></BO2> <BO3><MI3><Lastly dedication also has an influence on others¡¯ activities.</MI3> <SI3><TR>As long as you have dedication</TR>, your companions and peers think of you as a respectable person. Becoming a good supervisor requires obtaining recognition by others, thus he has to be careful of his own activities.</SI3></BO3><CO>In conclusion a good supervisor or boss needs to have to preceding traits or qualifies. <TR>Of course</TR>, there are several things required to become a wonderful supervisor. I would like to insist that it is really difficult to have such traits. Ordinary people as well as unusal people can become good supervisors if they try to gain the qualities of leadership, truth, and dedication through self-discipline.</CO>

column1: 943&Do you agree or disagree with the following statment? Sometimes it is better not to tell the truth.

There are many reasons about why we should tell a truth.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, one lie brings up another lie.</MI1> <SI1>If we tell a lie just for avoiding any situation. we should tell another lie to cover the lie. <TR>Therefore</TR>, regardress of our intension, we tell a lie continuously. But eventually everyone will know the truth, then they are not apt to believing me. It is a sad story.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Next</TR>, If we tell a lie everytime, we can have self-confidence in every situation.</MI2> <SI2>Our speech or acvities are not limited so we can maintain a good relationship among our friends or neighborhood. Naturally people who are beside us will trust us.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Of course</TR>, there exist a situation that to tell a lie brings a misleading.</MI3> <SI3>If we encounter such a situation, it is natural for us to hesitate. But to tell a lie is not a solution. Throughout the truth, we can take over that situation. Though someone first mislead me, soon he will know us well and understand our situation.</SI3><CO>In conclusion, we encounter many various situation and people. But If we want to maintain our pride or honor, we should make an effort to tell a truth everytime. The truth can be a best solution.</CO>

column1: 944&Students at universities often have a choice of places to live. They may choose to live in university dormitories, or they may choose to live in apartments in the community. Compare the advantages of living in university housing with the advantages of living in an apartment in the community. Where would you prefer to live? Give reasons for your preference.
column3: <IN> <TS>It is important for university students to decide the place where they live. Each has a lot of advantages. Some people say living in university housing is better while others say living in an apartment in the community is better. <TR>However, in my opinion</TR>, I prefer to live in a university dormitory because I can establish a well-rounded human relationship and share information about the exam with classmates.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>On the one hand</TR>, living in university housing, I can establish a well-rounded human relationship and share information with classmates.</MI1> <SI1>There are many different kinds of students in university dormitories. Each has own background, race, religion, and so on. It is a very good chance to understand other people and respect for them. <TR>In addition</TR>, in a dormitory, I can easily get information about the exam or class materials and discuss it with many classmates. <EX>As an example of this, when I was a freshman, I lived in a university dormitory for a year. I could experience many different kinds of people and discuss math problems with my roommates</EX>.<TR>Similarly</TR>, there are many positive aspects, living in a university dormitory.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, living in an apartment in the community, I would not need to be bothered by others and pay less money than living in a university dormitory.</MI2> <SI2>If I live in my apartment alone, I can spend my private time. <TR>In addition</TR>, I can pay less money. A payment of apartment is usually cheaper than that of university housing in Korea. <EX>For example, one of my friends lived in his apartment while I lived in a university dormitory. He could take his time every day and save a lot of money because of cheap payment</EX>. <TR>In this manner</TR>, there are also many advantages, living in an apartment in the community.</SI2></BO2><CO>To sum up, if I choose between living in university housing and living in an apartment in the community, I would choose living in university housing. That¡¯s because, living in dormitories, I can establish a well-rounded human relationship and share information with roommates. I have every confidence living in dormitories is good for students.</CO>

column1: 949& Imagine that you are preparing for a trip. You plan to be away from your home for a year. In addition to clothing and personal care items, you can take one additional thing. What would you take and why? Use specific reasons and details to support your choice.
column3: <IN> <TS>If I plan to travel, I will have to prepare several equipment for more useful trip. <TR>First</TR>, I think that clothing and personal care items are indispensable for their trip. <TR>Next</TR>, noteboook computer is considered to be very important to me. I will write my story about my life during the trip and also will search for information needed through the internet.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, I will writer my story during the trip in my noteboook computer.</MI1> <SI1><TR>For instance<TR>, whenever I see a beautiful scenary and whenever I have a difficulty in dangerous situations, I will left the happening on my computer. I can write my story more easily when I use an word file. <TR>Additionally</TR>, I do not have to worry about deleting the writing since notebook computer saves it safer. <TR>After trip</TR>, I can recall my significant experiences reading my writing. I can keep my experiences forever. <TR>Thus</TR>, notebook computer is very useful saving my writing during my trip.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, I can find an important information faster and more easily on line.</MI2> <SI2>While I travel here and there, I can be lost or have difficulty to communicate with foreigners. Then, I will search for the proper map. <TR>Also</TR>, I can try to talk with foreigners through the translater on line. It is very helpful to find information because I can save time. If I try to find my way without information through the internet, I mighy waste time because of trial and error. <TR>Therefore</TR>, notebook computer is very helpful to me because I can find importnat information more easily.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In conclusion</TR>, I will take notebook computer as well as clothing and personal care items. I can leave my interesting story on word file. <TR>Additionally</TR>, searching information more easily can be very helpful to me. By using notebook computer, I will recall my significant happening and will save time to find the way.</CO>

column1: 950&It has recently been announced that a large shopping center may be built in your neighborhood. Do you support or oppose this plan? Why? Use specific reasons and details to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>If it has recently been announced that a large shopping center may be built in my neighborhood, I will oppose that plan immediately. Though large shopping center may have some posive effects on my neighborhood, the negative effects, such as noise, bad air condition, waste problem, traffic problem and so on, will be more effective than its posive effects.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First because of a new shopping center, traffic problem will be serious.</MI1> <SI1>Espeicially in the weekends or on holyday, Traffic jam will be terrible. So our neighborhood people including me will have to waste much time in road. Noise like horn will distrub us so it will be difficult to concentrate on our work.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Of course</TR> there exist some advatages of a large shopping center.</MI3> <SI3>From a shopping center, we can expect some extra employements and It will contribute to increase our local economic ability.And If we want to buy somthing to need, It will be convenient because of its short distance. <TR>But</TR>, in spite of some advantages, A shopping center is not helpful to us.</SI3></BO3><CO>In conclution, as i said first, if it has been announced that a large shopping center may be built in my neighborhood, I will oppose that plan immediately. column1: 951&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Universities should give the same amount of money to their surdents' sports activities as they give to their university libraries. Use specific reasons and examlples to support your opiion.
column3: <IN><TS>In the University, we participate in many activities including studying and to playing sports and so on. So, the University has to divide its budget effectively into many parts of students' school activities. <TR>And in this division of budget</TR>, more expensive money required and the main purpose of the University can be traced to the ideas that University should invest more money to the library than to the sports facilities.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, the library needs so many money to maintain its facilities.</MI1> <SI1>There are lots of expensive facilities that students require for their studying such as, computers and microfiches. Students want to get these things to get their information. And library also needs other kinds of facilities to make good condition for students' studying. <EX>For example, air conditioner in summer and heating system in winter</EX>. But these machines are so expensive that library needs a lot of money to keep thier better environment.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Another reason is the main purpose of the University.</MI2> <SI2>University is the place to study ones major specially specifically. And students want sports activities and other kinds of things to support their study. <TR>But</TR>, the University has not forget its main purpose. Students give thier money to study more efficiently, not to play sports game. So, the budget of university should go to the library at the more rate than the sports activities.</SI2></BO2><CO>To be sure, university give their money to the students' sports activities, too because considering students' health is needed. But, I think that the University should give more money to the library than the sports activities for the two reasons which are the needs more expensive money to support it and the main purpose of the university.</CO>

Through the use of a few of example and specific explanation, I will demonstrate my opinion.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, art and music class make my emotion comfortable.</MI1> <SI1>While middle school students study for long times, they may be tired and deppressed. The emotions prevent students not only to study hard in the school, but also to rest in the night. So they may be sick, they go to the hospital. If they can get a chance to study music or art, they will make their life easefull while they are in the school. <TR>As a result</TR>, they don't have gloomy day.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, the class related with are and music are necessary for their effect to right-brain</MI2>. <SI2>A human's brain divided roughly two parts. They are called left-brain and right-brain.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3>Expert say that right-brain control calculating function, and left-brain control emotional function.</MI3> <SI3><TR>Of course</TR>, a human must have two operations related to brain, while humans are liveing. <TR>Otherwise</TR> a human is a human and isn't human. Students can improve this capacity of emotional right-brain and of claculating left-brain, when they study art and music subjects.</SI3></BO3><CO>In conclusion, art and music class are not a trivial classes. column1: 953&You have enough money to purchase either a house or a business. Which would you choose to buy? Give specific reasons to explain your choice.
column3: <IN><TS>People who want to go an easy way might prefer to buy a house. Those who are of an ambitious type, however, would argue that if they start a business, they can purchase a house with profit from the business as well. As a risk-averse economic agent, I would like to own a house instead of launching a business because a house seems to be a safer way to invest and serves as a shelter for family.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>A house has been believed to be one of the safest investment projects, especially in Korea.</MI1> <SI1>My country, Korea, is a nation with quite a small territory and thus the value of land and a house has been costly. You might have seen no times in Korean history without speculation in real estate. <TR>Still</TR>, the nation observes the price of real estate costs high and a house is not risky investment guaranteeing a good and stable rate of return.</SI1><BO1><BO2><MI2>Compared with a house, running a business is pretty adventurous.</MI2> <SI2>Returns from a business fluctuate with the economic situation. <TR>Furthermore</TR>, high returns take not only favorable economic conditions but also an entrepreneur¡¯s expertise. Although you expect some profit from your business, nobody knows how it would turn out to be tomorrow. Considering today¡¯s economic downturn caused by threats of Iraq and North Korea¡¯s nuclear weapons, it is not high time to enter into business.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3>Another merit from possessing a house is that it provides family with a place to rest and shelter.</MI3> <SI3>A house is where family members get together, relax themselves, and have an open-hearted conversation. It also protects them from rain, cold wind, and snow. You might remember the old saying, ¡°There is no place like home.¡± It is a house that is necessary for you to have a sweet home. This single factor will be even sufficient to choose a house over a business for those who believe that happiness of family overweighs plenty of money.</SI3></BO3><CO>As an almost riskless way to invest and a restful nest for family, a house is an attractive alternative to a business whose uncertainty takes runners much luck, effort, and shrewd skills. I am sure that most people who do not desperately desire to make a fortune at a stroke would feel the same way as me.</CO>

column1: 955&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>It is necessary for children to learn many things with the best teachers. Some people argue that children need a professional teacher to accumulate a store of knowledge about various fields instead of parents. <TR>However, in my case</TR>, I agree that parents are the best teachers because they can be supporters for their children and teach them with concern and love.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, as parents are sponsors for their children, they can become the best teachers.</MI1> <SI1>In contrast with a professional teacher in a school, parents make it possible for their children to have self – confidence and behave with it. For example, when I was 10 years old, I moved to Seoul, a big city, from a country. I didn¡¯t adapt myself to new school and circumstances and could not talk to any other in my class. But my parents always advised me to adjust new environments and tried to encourage me to make a friend as my supporters. <TR>Finally</TR>, I could recover my self-confidence and become active.<TR> In this point,</TR> parents are the best teachers as sponsors.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, I think parent can become the best teachers because they have concerns and love at their children, while it is impossible for a professional teacher to give attention to every students and love them in a class. <TR>Thus</TR>, some students who get poor grades or are quite might feel alienated from a class for lack of teacher¡¯s interest and affection.</MI2> But parents don¡¯t hardly concern about their children and love them. So they are the best teachers. <SI2><TR>For instance</TR>, Edison, a honorable inventor, didn¡¯t get his teacher¡¯s interest and could not be adapted for his school. <TR>However</TR>, his mother never gave up him. She helped him to get creative notion with communication and a right sense of value. Without her communication and love, he would not become a respectable inventor.</SI2></BO2><CO>To summarize, I agree that parents can teach their children very well, because they encourage their children very much as supporters and they have concern and affection about their children. If many parents recognize themselves as good teacher for their children, many children will behave with self-confidence and be more active.</CO>
