column1: 957&If u were asked to send one thing representing your country to an international exhibition, what would you choose? Why? Use specific reasons and details to explain your choice..
column3: <IN><TS>As a matter of fact, it is very difficult to find one thing representing a country, because it should involve the ideology, peculiarity, and culture of a country. When I am asked to select one thing, I will choose a piece of ¡®Chosun Baekja¡¯, a white traditional china of Korea, since it stands for two characteristics of Korean culture; the beauty of curves, and Confucian ideas.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Firs</TR>t, as you can see, Chosun Baekja is characterized by some curves.</MI1> <SI1>They make an elegant shape, forming a circle from the bottom to the middle, and being narrow-shaped and wide-shaped again on the top. It implies the beauty of curves, which Koreans like very much. When Koreans built buildings, made clothes and other things, they considered a curved line as an important thing. <TR>Therefore</TR>, out traditional buildings and clothes are made up of beautiful curves. Chosun Baekja is as same as them. The potters making Chosun Beakja tried hard to make a beautiful form using great curves, and the beautiful curves still remains in it.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, Chosun Baekja contains the concepts of Confucianism; simplicity (or thrift), and purity.</MI2> <SI2>Confucianism has been a main ideology of Koreans for a thousand years, and those concepts were a kind of principles for Confucians. Chosun Baekja is well explaining simplicity and purity. It has no brilliant and splendid decoration. This means simplicity. In addition, it is only white-coloured, unlike the colourful ceramics of other countries. This means purity. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I can say that Chosun Baekja is an important heritage, representing simple and thrifty life our ancestors pursue.</SI2></BO2><CO>As it has no splendid and colourful ornament, many people visiting the exhibition might think that Chosun Baekja is rather humble to represent a country. However, it contains many traditional ideas of Korean people, and is also beautiful. <TR>Therefore</TR>, if you appreciate this white china with the knowledge of Korean culture mentioned above, you will feel the odd beauty of the East</CO>.

column1: 962&Some people believe that students should be given one long vacation each year. Others believe that students should have several short vacations throughout the year. Which viewpoint do you agree with? Use specific reasons and examples to support your choice.
column3: <IN><TS>Some people may argue that schools give their students to one long vacation a year. <TR>However</TR>, I hold a view that it is better that students have several short vacations each year. For one thing students may easily become lose during the semesters, and then they have difficulties with time management during the vacations.<TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>More than anything else</TR>, if there is one long vacation a year, there will be one long semester also.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Thus</TR>, students should study during the long semester, and then they will have much stress from a large amount of homework and many exams. <TR>Also</TR>, they have to attend many classes without taking a rest. <TR>Therefore</TR>, they cannot help feeling ennui. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, several short vacations can make students study more restfully and effectively without much stress.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, if students have one long vacation, they cannot manage their time effectively.</MI2> <SI2></TR>In my case</TR>, I always plan to study effectively when a vacation is started.<TR> However</TR>, I have difficulties with making the plan because I have much time. <TR>Also</TR>, I can hardly observe the plan over one month although I had passion about studying. <TR>Therefore,</TR> I prefer several vacations to one long vacation.</SI2></BO2><CO>In conclusion, I think that several short vacations is more effective policy than one long vacation because they can make students learn without ennui during the semesters, and they help students to both effectively plan, and well follow their plan.</CO>

column1: 963&Some people believe that students should be given one long vacation each year. Others believe that students should have several short vacations throughout the year. Which viewpoint do you agree with? Use specific reasons and examples to support your choice.
column3: <IN>TS>In Korea, schools have two vacations: summer vacation and winter vacation. The periods of the summer vacation and winter vacation had little differences two years ago. <TR>However</TR>, summer vacation becomes shorter while winter vacation becomes longer now. It shows us the necessity of long vacation. Students need a long vacation. <TR>Also</TR>, it would be better that only one vacation is given to students and the vacation is longer. Students will have useful time such as traveling abroad and earning registration fee through a part time job.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, students can go abroad during the vacation.<MI1> <SI1>Students have to travel for some time since traveling can give a broader point of view to students. If one studnet plan to go abroad, he will need more than two monthes. <TR>Thus</TR>, if he has short vacations, it will be impossible. <TR>For instance</TR>, one of my friends has ceased to go to school to travel for one semester because her vacations are very short. <TR>Therefore</TR>, one long vacation is important for students to travel to neighboring country.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, students can earn their school registration fee during the long vacation.<MI2> <SI2>Some studnets that are poor have to earn their registration fee for themseleves. If there is not a long vacation, they will have to work in the evening. They will have to study and work together. It is very difficult thing to students. <TR>Using a long vacation</TR>, he will earn a lot of money because they can work in one store for a long time. Thus, stdents need a long vacation to earn a school registration fee.</SI2></BO2><CO>In conclusion, one long vacation should be given to students. It can make a chance for students to go abroad. column1: 965&Would you prefer to live in a traditional house or in a modern apartment building? Use specific reasons and details to support your choice
column3: <IN><TS>There are many apartment buildings in my country. Many people prefer to live in an apartment building because they think it¡¯s better than traditional house. If I asked which one to choose in apartment and house, I will choose to live in apartment for several reasons.</TS></IN> <BO1><MI1><TR>Fist of all</TR>, there are many facilities near apartment building.</MI1> <SI1>I live in apartment, and in my apartment, there are many supermarkets, bakeries, video shops and many other facilities. Many people who live in the houses often come to my building and shop there. Because there is no shop in their neighborhood. It¡¯s more easy to access convenient facilities if one live in an apartment.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>There are many transportations near apartment.</MI1> <SI1>In my country, many people live in one apartment. So, if an apartment is built, there should be buses which go to the subway station. <TR>In this reason</TR>, it¡¯s easy to go out side if one live in the apartment. But to house residents it¡¯s not easy to go out side, if they don¡¯t have cars. Also unlike apartment, it¡¯s hard to park cars because most houses don¡¯t have garage in my country.</SI1></BO1><BO3><MI3><TR>In apartment</TR>, we don¡¯t have to care for many things.</MI3> <SI3>Most apartment have a handyman so, they can fix things when something goes wrong. And we don¡¯t have to worry about a thief because there are always some people who guard the apartment safely. Everything is automatically solved in an apartment.</SI3></BO3><CO><TR>In my opinion</TR>, apartment building is better than a traditional house to live. It is true there are many good points to live in a house. We can have a beautiful garden and we can keep our privacy. But it can not be compared to the strong points of an apartment. We can live a very convenient life at apartment</CO>.

column1: 969&People do many different things to stay healthy. What do you do for good health? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>Health is crucial element to people. In spite of being wealth, and smart, if they are not healthy, these are useless. Because of importance of health, they do many things to maintain health. I also do these things for my health. </TS></IN><BO1><MI1>One thing is an exercise. I usually play tennis for my fiscal health.</MI1> <SI1>After entering university, I wanted to something useful for my health. <TR>Before that</TR>, my parents recommended to play tennis, so I chose tennis. I play tennis three times a week. It makes me very active, and energetic. Since I play tennis I have no problem in my stamina.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>Another activity for my health is listening classic music.</MI2> <SI2>Sometimes I am very angry, tired, and annoyed. When I listen to music with my eyes close, I become calm, and peaceful. Some people listen very loud music when annoyed or angry, I, however, think it¡¯d better for their mental health to listen silent classic music.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>In addition</TR>, sometimes, weekends or holiday, I have enough sleep. Enough and sound sleep is also essential element for one¡¯s health.</MI3> <SI3>Because not have enough sleep on weekdays, I need to have a sound sleep. After having enough sleep, I become fresh like I can do everything.</SI3></BO3><CO>In conclusion, I exercise, listen to classic music, and have a sound sleep, for my health. When we healthy, we should do something useful for our health. Being healthy is the most important thing our life.</CO>

column1: 971&Students at universities often have a choice of places to live. They may choose to live in university dormitories, or they may choose to live in apartments in the community. Compare the advantages of living in university housing with the advantages of living in an apartment in the community. Where would you prefer to live? Give reasons for your preference
column3: <IN> <TS>Students attending university often have a choice of places to live. Some students prefer to live in university dormitories because of their location of near college and cheap residential fee while others prefer to live in apartments in the community because of their comfortable and quiet environment</TS>. <TR>In my case</TR>, I would like to live in an apartment because I think quiet environment more important.</IN><BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, living in university housing, we can save our time and money.</MI1> <SI1><TR>Generally</TR>, dormitories are located on the campus. So, we could spend little time on commuting. Moreover, with the financial support of university, we can reside cheaply. <EX>For example, most of universities in my country have their dormitories within 500 meters from each college and they charge just 10 dollars a month</EX></SI1></BO1>. <BO2><MI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, living in an apartment in the community, we are free to the noise of other students and we can go to the downtown quickly.</MI2> <SI2>Because just a few people live in one apartment, there is little noise and we can keep our privacy. <TR>In addition</TR>, many apartment are near the downtown, thus we can reach downtown easily. <TR>To illustrate</TR>, many friends of mine live in apartments says that it¡¯s very quite there and very convenient to go shopping.</SI2</BO2><CO>In conclusion, even though living in university housing costs little time and little money, I would want to live in an apartment because I could live without noise pollution and could reach downtown with ease.</CO>
column23: This is an above average quality essay. The thesis is actually very nice, and that helps the essay stay on topic. The main ideas as well as supporting ideas with examples are also nice. There are a few small grammatical errors.

column1: 972&Music tells us something about a culture. What does the music of your country reveal about the culture of your country? Use reasons and specific examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>TS>There are many things that can be felt in each county's own music, which tells its own culture. The reason for this seems to be that music is like an invisible bowl that can deposit emotional things. In my country, Korea, the music is oftens alalyzed to reveal intense sorrow in my country's historical background. Moreover, smiliarities, but which is apparently different from China and Japan which is reflected in Korea's culture.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>In Korean music</TR>, it is usually said that there is a deep sorrow,"Han" in Korean, which exhibits the historical culture in Korea.</MI1> <SI1>Korea is located like a bridge between China and Japan. therefore , Korea's history embraces many invasions from each nation. <TR>In that way</TR>, there is deep sorrow in our culture, that we had many hardness and had to overcome many things to protect our own country. If you listen to Korean music, there are many songs and tunes that makes the listener feel sad in the heart.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, Korean music represents some similarities but obvious differences with China and Japan, which is in Korea's culture.</MI2> <SI2><TR>As said above</TR>, Korea is access to each nation, China and Japan. <TR>Consequently</TR>, Korea has had many contacts and trades in various fields which created its own culture. Korean music might seem to be similiar from that of China and Japan, however it is very distinctive from its natural mood. Chinese music used to appear to be very loudable and joyable, <TR>on the other hand</TR>, Japanese music represents simple tunes in their music. These traits are different from those in Korean music, which appeals both sides of the two nation's musical characteristic which is like our own culture. <TR>However</TR>, it differs from the instruments and the feeling that gives the listener. The tune is more calm and elaborate than those of the others.</SI2></BO2><CO>In conclusion, as the composer reflects one's own country's emotion and culture in music, Korean music exposes deep sadness but enduring mind, and assimiliating but remarkably distinguishing atmosphere in its music as it is in the culture.</CO>
column23: This was a very well written essay. The thesis is the only real weak point. The author was so intent on the introduction that the thesis with a hypothesis and introduction of the main points was left out. Major mistake there.

column1: 973&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? A person¡¯s childhood years are the most important years of a person¡¯s life.
column3: <IN> <TS>Human development occurs in stages throughout life. It is true that every single developmental stage is critical to human growth. <TR>Among these stages</TR>, I insist on my position that a person¡¯s childhood is most crucial for its importance on his or her linguistic ability, physical and mental development.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>The earliest twelve years in life is the most efficient period in which a person learns language.</MI1> <SI1>Experts on language say that if people learn a foreign language before around the age of twelve, they can speak it as fluently as their mother tongue. <EX>For example, in Korea, a foreign language has been taught only after entering middle school up to recently. Not until they were twelve or thirteen years old, most of the college students and university graduates today did not take any English courses</EX>. Since getting a job nowadays requires high TOEIC and TOEFL scores or proficient English speech skills, they pour a tremendous amount of time, money, and effort into learning English. <TR>Still</TR>, they are afraid of foreign tourists asking them directions on the street. <TR>Surely</TR>, it is needless to say that an attempt to learn language after adolescence is not so effective as one might expect.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, an individual sees the fastest physical growth in childhood.</MI2> <SI2><TR>Amazingly</TR>, the development of an average human brain has been almost completed before the age of twelve. <TR>Also</TR>, in this period you will increase in more height than you can in the rest of your life. <TR>In other words</TR>, malnutrition in your infancy may cause you to be short and small or hamper you from becoming an honor student later in school.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Furthermore</TR>, once you get a habit in your childhood, it will stay with you nearly forever.</MI3> <SI3>As the proverb say, what is learned in the cradle is carried to the grave. </EX>In my case, I had a habit of biting my nails when young. I had struggled to quit this bad habit only to fail several times. Finally, I succeeded in getting rid of it, but it took a lot of my effort, time, and money for buying a ¡°No bite¡± and going to a nail-care shop.</EX3></SI3></BO3><BO4><MI4>The time between birth and the age of twelve also has an influence on personality formation.</MI4> <SI4>Children are sensitive and will not easily forget what they experience which affects their shaping personality. <EX>Taking one of my friends as an example, her father was overbearing when she was young. <TR>Overwhelmed by her father</TR>, she could not make herself expressed at home very well. <TR>No wonder</TR>, she became passive and shy at school, too, and still has an insecure personality.</EX></SI4></BO4><CO><TR>In summary</TR>, childhood is a crucial time because it determines who and what you will be in the future. Healthy experiences with care and affection in this period will make you the whole man.</CO>
column23: This is a very well written essay. The thesis is perfect even though it is in a fairly short introduction. There should have been a few more transitions in an essay of this length. Otherwise, this was a great essay.

column1: 975&Students at universities often have a choice of places to live. They may choose to live in university dormitories, or they may choose to live in apartments in the community. Compare the advantages of living in university housing with the advantages of living in an apartment in the community. Where would you prefer to live? Give reasons for your preference.
column3: <IN><TS>Students at colleges sometimes make a choice of places to live between university dormitories and apartments in the community. It is obvious that both of them have each advantage and disadvantage. The choice may vary according to the type of person who you are.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>Living in a university dormitory gives us lots of chances to meet many people. I was an introvert one before I entered the university.</MI1> <SI1><TR>However</TR>, throughout the dormitory life,I could easily get accustomed to the circumstances with the help of my roommates. As I met people different from me, I could have various social experiences and get strong self-respect. <TR>Moreover</TR>, we can easily solve many problems caused by living out of our own houses. We can get by living in university housing not only housing but also food. We can eat on a regular basis.</SI1></BO1> <BO2><MI2>Living in a apartment, on the other hand, gives us more freedom.</MI2> <SI2>We have to solve those problems caused by living out by ourselves. We must do the dishes, do laundry, and so on. Eventhough it must be a burden to us, we can learn independence through these works and come to know that responsibility is followed by freedom. <TR>Consequently</TR>, we can enjoy real freedom. <TR>Furthermore</TR>, we can have our own time alone. We will not be interrupted by someone and can have more time to think about ourselves. It surely makes us more moderate, reasonable, and sophiscated.</SI2></BO2><CO>It is true that living in a apartment in a community than in a university dormitory is not always the best. It may depend on who you are, what your personality is, and what you consider more. <TR>However</TR>, given a choice, I would rather choose living in a apartment for those previous reasons. Freedom followed by responsibility and making our own time will be more crucial components to get for university students.</CO>
column23: This was an average quality essay. The author should not be playing with the term obvious. Nothing should be taken for granted in an essay. The main and supporting points were nice.

column1: 976&Some young children spend a great amount of their time practicing sports. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of this. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>Most children lilke to play sports. They spend a lot of time playing sports such as baseball, basketball, soccer. It can bring disadvantages as well as advantages. When they play sports for a great amount of time, their excercising talents could be found and sports could be helpful to their good health; <TR>however</TR>, sports could prevent children to concentrate in studying and heavy sports damage children's body.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>On one hand</TR>, children could become healthy people and they could find their excercising talents through practicing sports.</MI1> <SI1>Everyone know that practicing sports is good for health. <TR>Especially</TR>, it is more important to children because their body are growing up. <TR>Also</TR>, while children spend time to pracitce sports, they could find an unexpected talents about sports. <TR>For instance</TR>, Korean national soccer player Cha Bum Gun found his talent in playing scooer in childhood. <TR>Thus</TR>, spending a lot of time to play sports is important to their good health and finding excercising talents.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, spending a great amount of time to play sports could bring disadvantage such as difficulty in concentrating in studying and damaging in their body.</MI2> <SI2>My younger brother love to play baseball and he only want to play baseball. When he had a mid-term test, he spent much time to play it and he spoiled the test. The best severe problem is that playing sports deprive the time to study from children. <TR>Furthermore</TR>, his leg has ever been injured because he has kept heavy running while he plays baseball game. <TR>Therefore</TR>, heavy sports could obstruct to study hard and excessive sports could damage in children's body.</SI2></BO2><CO>In conclusion, spending a lot of time to play sports has advantages such as improvement of children's health and finding their talents earlier. <TR>However</TR>, they can bring disadvantages such as depriving their studying time and injuring their body. <TR>Thus</TR>, children have to play sports day after day, but they must not spend most of the their time to play sports.</CO>

column1: 978&Would you prefer to live in a traditional house or in a modern apartment building?
column3: <IN><TS>Thesedays, in Korea, it is thought to be common to live in a modern apartment which has each brand name such as SamSung's e-apartment.That is because we are facing a serious problem about the lack of land, enabling to build up new accomodations.<TR>Therefore</TR> , it might be difficult to compare living in a traditional house with a modern apartment. Because we have difficultly finding a certain prototype of living in a traditional house in Korean modern society. <TR>However</TR>, I prefer to live in a traditional house for some reasons.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>To begin with</TR>, the materials usede in a traditional house are more healthful than modern apartments'.</MI1> <SI1>Such natural materials,like clay,wood and wall paper,help people to be healthy and even much better due to positive energy emitted by one of them,namely clay,which was proven by scientists. <TR>On the other hand</TR>, modern one have been built with concrete and steel,such a tangible material that could not allow natural penetration of airwave so that these elements could bring human bodies nagative effects in breathing systems.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, it is much more secure to live in a traditional house than in a modern apartment.</MI2> <SI2>The most important thing to make home secure is neighbourhood network. <TR>In modern apartments</TR>,there are just locked doors,windows and a few maintenance people.These could be believed to be enough to be secured. <TR>However</TR>, I think neighbourhood's eyes appeal much more significant to protect sweet home</SI2>.<EX>For example, fence or hedge of each house was built at the same level of eye line so that the space has been opened widely to the neighbours. If if did, it would be more tricky to access into a house than a modern apartment without neighbour's watch.</EX></BO2><CO>Overall, <TR>as far as I am concerned</TR>, there is not a certain answer to this question, but I do not think the way of view point compared with only visiable facts is positive. I do believe we have to consider circumstances between two objects,namely tradtional houses and modern apartments rather than just facilities and convenience and so on.</CO>
column23: This was an average quality essay. The entire introduction was essentially a thesis statement chopped up and split into many sentences. They should be combined. The main and supporting points were adequate.

column1: 979&Choose one of the following transportation vehicles and explain why you think it has changed people¡¯s lives. -automobiles -bicycles -airplanes
column3: <IN><TS>The world has made rapid strides through invention of an automobile over the 20th century. People may have different opinions on why the invention is so influential on humankind. My idea on this matter is that an automobile has played a significant role in terms of its impact on economy and human knowledge.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, an automobile has had a substantial economic impact on physical distribution and employment.</MI1> <SI1>Along with the improvement of the road system, an automobile has facilitated physical distribution of products by saving time for transporting them from one place to another. <TR>Today</TR>, people in the Midwest can taste fresh oranges from the state of Florida thanks to the development of an automobile; <TR>however</TR>, it was almost impossible before the advent of a car. <TR>Besides</TR>, automobile industry has contributed to decrease unemployment by providing a number of jobs for the market. You can simply observe that the industry brings a city into existence by gathering many workers seeking a job there. <TR>Needless to say</TR>, an automobile has been one of the key elements to boost the economy.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, an automobile has attributed to broaden human perspective.</MI2> <SI2>In the past with no cars, individuals might have been able to travel as far and wide as they could walk. Even if they had ridden a horse, it must have been too slow and too easily exhausted to take a long trip. <TR>On the contrary</TR>, today¡¯s car allows humans to move much further and faster than otherwise they would. Able to reach wherever they want, people have experienced what otherwise could not have met, enriching their understanding of of new culture and people. In this respect, the rise of an automobile has widened human horizon about the world.</SI2></BO2><CO>In conclusion, an automobile is breakthrough in that it has enabled us to have more vibrant economy and expand our insight into human beings. Without its emergence, we might get stuck with narrow vision in a small economy. <TR>Surely</TR>, it will continue to provide services to make human life better.</CO>
column23: This was an above average essay. The thesis could only have been improved by being clear as to which customs were being referenced. There were many great points and examples given. This was an excellent essay.

column1: 980&A company has made plans to build a large factory in the town where you live. Your community is undecided about whether they want a new factory nearby. What advantages or disadvantages might this new factory bring to your community? Would you oppose or support this proposal? Support your position with details and examples.
column3: <IN><TS>Modern society is rapidly developing through the course of time; undeveloped territories need to progress quicker than ever before. If a corporation is considering building factories in my town, I¡¯m in favor of it. I will talk about which advantages and disadvantages a new factory might bring. I would like to demonstrate why building new factories is a good idea.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>Factories create a lot of jobs in the community.</MI1> <SI1>As long as companies erect several factories, they will need to operate them, thus people who live in the town have opportunities for employment. <TR>Next</TR>, the location of the factory can make real estate value raise because of the increased demand for real estate and houses.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>On the other hand</TR>, the building of a factory has drawbacks such as environment pollution which includes air, water, and land as well as traffic jams</MI2>. <SI2>The factories create toxic things, therefore the atmosphere would become more and more polluted. The development of the community attracts more people and as a result the number of cars is increased, causing traffic congestion.</SI2></BO2><CO>In conclusion building the factory would have a host of benefits and drawbacks. I believe the harmful effects like the pollution of air, water, and land could be solved through advanced technology. It is very significant to create more occupations and make the economic better in the community; therefore I support the building of a factory.</CO>

column1: 982&When people move to another country, some of them decide to follow the customs of the new country. Others prefer to keep their own customs. Compare these two choices. Which one do you prefer? Support your answer with specific details
column3: <IN>TS>Nowadays there are lots of people who emigrate to other countries. It¡¯s is known to be true that these emigrants get hardships during the beginning of their moving. <TR>Obviously</TR>, contacting somewhat different cultures from their own one would be a main problem. Some people choose to follow the customs of the new country, on the other hand, others are inclined to still keep their own customs. <TR>Apparently</TR>, both of them have the advantages and disadvantages.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1>We may get comfort if we keep our own customs.</MI1> <SI1>We don¡¯t have to transform our lifestyles such as food, cloth, and shelter. It must be very comfortable for us if we can enjoy the food we get used to, still wear the clothes we liked, and live in a similar house we were accustomed to. As most Koreans prefer to live in an apartment, they feel comfortable if they can find an apartment that has very similar facilities. <TR>Consequently</TR>, with the help of those similar circumstances, we could get accustomed to the new country where we moved.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>However</TR>, keeping our own customs would cause many problems.</MI2> <SI2>It would lead to bad feelings to natives who has lived in the new country through their lives. If we chose our minds to follow the new country¡¯s customs, we may get along with the natives more easily and can get accustomed to the new country more thoroughly. Also we can easily understand the culture of the new one and can be the real citizen of the country. Although it must be a hard work to change our own eating habbits, clothes, and the style of our house formed throughout our last lives, we cannot ignore the importance of that.</SI2></BO2><CO>¡°when in rome, do as the romans do.¡± is an old cliché but I argue that we should follow the customs of the new country when we move to another new land. It is essential for the emigrants not only because it makes us get along with the natives, but because we can be a real national through the change of our own lifestyles</CO>
column23: This is an average quality essay. The thesis is very weak and doesn't include either a strong hypothesis or a preview of main points to come. The main points are fairly weak and only serve as an introduction. The author needs to be strong in conviction and express that in the essay.

column1: 985&When people need to complain about a product or poor service. Some prefer to compalin in writing and others prefet to cimplain in person. Which way do you prefer?
column3: <IN><TS>If I buy a product having certain problem or get a poor servce, I would complain in person immediately. Though it may look like rude or unfriendly, According to that method, i'll be able to explain a exact reason why I complain, get a immediate response from a manager and it will take less time than in writing.</TS></IN>BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, by complaining in person, we can explain exactly the situdaion that I buy a bad product or get a poor service</MI1>. <SI1><EX>For example, If i have received a bad service in the cafeteria, I would call a manager and point out a default of person who served me badly</EX>. Though sometimes it look like rude, I can prevent such a bad servece from repeating.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2>The second benifit of complaint in person is for us to save our time.</MI2> <SI2>If i do a immediate compalin, I can get a fast response. The complaint in writing takes so long time. <TR>Moreover</TR> such a method is so bothering work. to complain in writing, I should remember that situation, write on a paper and delieve a letter. Of course, the complaint in writing have some advantages. It can look like more polite than that in person. <TR>For instance</TR>, when i have guests, or it is very important time. the former can be a better method than the latter. <TR>But in most case</TR>, complaining in person have much more advantages than doing in writing.</SI2></BO2><CO>In conclusion, If I met a situation that I should make a compalin. I'll complain in person immediately. <TR>However, when I complain in person, I should remember that I must be polite and maintain a smile in mouse. Those will not hurt not only a facing man but also me</CO>

column1: 986&When people need to complain about a product or poor service. some prefer to complain in writing and others prefer to complain in person. Which way do you prefer ? Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>While people have lived in the world, you may get unconvinient matters. Someone may complain that in writing, others may complain that in person. I prefer to complain about a product or poor service in writing. Because I can not take a mistake through writing about the unconvinient things, also I can show my thought effectivly. So I think that compaining in writing is better than complaining in person.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, I think that arguing my opinion about the unconvineint works in writing is more better than in person.</MI1> <SI1>Because I can mend my errors.when I are writing about something. <TR>For instance</TR>, when I was a middle school student, I got a chance to speak my argue about some subject without papers. Then I often took a mistake, while I was speaking. After I also got a other chance to argue about some things in writing, then I can not take a mistake. Because I can repair my mistakes, while I writing about my opinion. Therefore complaining about some things in writing is better than in person.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, I think that showing my opinion about the uncomfortable matters in writing is more effecively than in person.</MI2> Because I can make my opinion arranged well. <SI2><EX>For example, I wrote on the papers for showing my opinion and send to some enterprise, when I found my work after leaving university. Then I can get a good work. Beacause I can represent my thought to my employer effectively</EX>. This effecive representation can be gotten better by writing than by speaking. in my case.</SI2></BO2><CO>In conclustion, writing for arguing is a indirect communication tool, so that has a few weak points. But it has a lot of good points, such as showing effecively and mending errors. So I prefer to complain about a comfortable product or service in writing rather than in person.</CO>

column1: 987&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Business should do anything they can to make a profit. Use specific reasons and examples to support your position.
column3: <IN><TS>From a long time ago, it was a big issue for the private company to pursue only its own profit or consider public profit. Some say business can do anything to maximize its profit while others say business should choose to do morally right thing even if it cannot make best profit. <TR>In my opinion</TR>, I disagree with the statement businesses should do anything they can to make a profit because their activities can destroy nature and make people distrust.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First</TR>, I disagree with the statement businesses should do anything they can to make a profit because their activities can destroy nature.</MI1> <SI1>Companies have done much harm to nature even though there has been law. They continue to destroy nature illegally because of their greed to make more money. <EX>For example, a famous chemical company named Sxx threw its waste away into the river while it advertised natural preservation activities in its website. I think business must be controlled unless natural surroundings are destroyed.</EX></SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, I disagree with the statement businesses should do anything they can to make a profit because their activities can make people distrust.</MI2> <SI2>Many companies advertise their products, saying theirs were the best products and sometimes exaggerate very much. <TR>However</TR>, such advertisement is mostly lie which maximizes their profits making people distrust. <EX>For example, a car company says they value customer¡¯s safety the most. <TR>However</TR> , they didn¡¯t use a high quality of materials when they produced a car. After this was revealed, people had a strong doubt of advertisement</EX>. <TR>In this manner</TR>, if business should do anything for profits, this can result in distrust.</SI2></BO2><CO>In conclusion, I am not in favor of the opinion that businesses should do anything they can to make a profit because their activities can destroy nature and make people distrust. If we think the purpose of business is for the convenience of human, harmful activities must be regulated</CO>

column1: 990&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Parents are the best teachers. Use specific reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Are parents the best teachers for their children? Even though people's opinions may differ on the statement,<TS> I strongly believe that is true. Let me demonstrate why the statement is so based on the following reasons.</TS></IN>,BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, parents spend most of their time with children.</MI1> <SI1>Starting a day with getting out of bed, children have to always be with their parents, except for their time at school and with their peers outside home, until they retire at night. <TR>Therefore</TR>, parents can teach much to their children utilizing given time to the fullest.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, parents exert influence most on every aspect of children's life by setting a role model for them to imitate.</MI2> <SI2>Let us say there is a boy who has watched his or her parents reading, and he is likely to develop a good reading habit. When I was little, I grew up watching my father read a newspaper at often times. I believe that ever since I have read a newspaper and become a man of commonsense or a walking encyclopedia. <TR>As for me</TR>, my father played a good model, and he has affected me in a good manner and formed what I am.</SI2></BO2><CO>Taking these points into consideration, I am strongly positive that parents are the best teachers. Children learn much from their parents being and spending time with them, whom children want to be like. <TR>However</TR>, whether to be the best teacher as a parent hinges on whether one shows oneself as a wholesome model for children to follow. <TR>Despite all that</TR>, wouldn't it be good to imagine a home where children read, study, and play happily with their best teachers who know the children best?</CO>

column1: 992&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? Teachers should be paid according to how much their students learn. Give specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>Among many jobs, teacher is a not only special but also important job in terms of teaching people. <TS><TR>As a working people</TR>, teachers also get a salary. <TR>However</TR>, some people say teachers should be paid depending on how much their students learn. I don¡¯t think this is good idea for some reason.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, there is no specific way to measure how much students learn in class.</MI1> <SI1>Students learn knowledge as well as goodwill, for example kindness and helping some people. Actually teachers can measure how much students learn by taking exam. <TR>They</TR>, <TR>however</TR>, can¡¯t measure how their students are kind, have good relationship with other people, and etc. <TR>To illustrate</TR>, if student don¡¯t take exam I order to help victims and low grade, should the teacher be blamed and get low salary because of student¡¯s low grade?</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, teachers may ignore students who have learning difficulty.</MI2> <SI2>If teachers get money depending on how much their pupils learn, they will prefer to teach students who have good understanding. It makes teachers ignore students who have low study skill. These students need more attention, however, if teachers don¡¯t pay attention them, after all, they will give up their study. Does such a teacher have quality to get salary as a teacher?</SI2></BO2><CO>In conclusion, because we can¡¯t measure how much students learn and there is a possibility of ignoring students having low study skill, I don¡¯t agree the idea that teachers should get money according to how much students learn. Teaching is a holt thong which can¡¯t be measured by money.</CO>

column1: 993&When you have to complain about a product, do you think it is better to write a letter of complaint, or to make your complaint in person? Use specific reasons and examples to explain your opinion.
column3: <IN>Many people have ever complained about a product or poor services. <TS><TR>In this case</TR>, how do they deal with this problem? <TR>As far as I am concerned</TR>, I prefer to visit the company directly because they could correct the problem immediately , manage it with responsibility as well as I could explain it more clearly.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, the reason why I choose visiting the company is that they could solve the problem immediately.</MI1> <SI1><TR>For instance</TR>, sending the mail about such problem. I should wait the answer for a long time. <TR>In this regard</TR>, visiting the firm is fast way to solve the problem.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Also</TR>, it enable them to manage the work with responsibility.</MI2> <SI2>When I sent mail with the defect of my computer , to illustrate, they did not any response to me. <TR>However</TR>, they fixed my computer as soon as I went and saw them. <TR>Besides</TR>, they called and apologized about the delay of service.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Finally</TR>, I could explain complain more clearly.</MI3> <SI3><TR>Sometimes</TR>, letter could cause misunderstanding. <TR>Meanwhile</TR>, complaining in person do not cause such thing.</SI3></BO3><CO>In short, I think visiting or calling there could be a good way to deal with these troubles on account of not only solving the problem fast and with responsiblity ,but also notifying my opinion exactly.</CO>
column23: This is an average quality essay. The thesis is actually very nice, and that helps the essay stay on topic. The main ideas as well as supporting ideas with examples are also nice. There are a few small grammatical errors.

column1: 994&Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? A zoo has no useful purpose. Use specific reasons and examples to explain your answer.
column3: <IN><TS>A zoo has many animals, apply to one place which people get along with family, friends, and so on. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I strongly think a zoo has useful purpose. The first reasons is that a zoo will help children's mind to make plentiful, also a zoo give many people to share their love, time, and relationships.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, when I was elementary, I went to picnic with my family.</MI1> <SI1>I remembered at that time I really felt largely happier than in these day. When I visited the Zoo, I saw monkies and many kinds of birds. All of them are very curious and stranger to me. <TR>Sometime</TR>, when I saw the tigers and lioans, I hided behind my father. <TR>However</TR>, I could think in my mind about their living and groups. <TR>After visiting that</TR>, I changed to love animals.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, my father and mother were always busy when I was young, so we didn't have time to share with family's members.</MI2> <SI2>I always wanted to have my parents love, but they were busy. <TR>Someday</TR>, my family went to a zoo, we spent during long time. I didn't often like to my parent's work because they didn't share with their time to me. <TR>However</TR>, after that day, my mind changed. It was that my parents worked for me and my family.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>Finally</TR>, many young children want to visit a zoo because there are many animals. The animals give them various experience. <TR>Therefore</TR>, I certainly affirmed that we have to a zoo for our children's spirits and our family's relationship.</CO>
column23: This was an average quality essay. The thesis was broken up into an entire introductary paragraph. It would have been more proper and efficient to make a real thesis statement. The structure of this essay suffered. The wording was choppy as well.

column1: 995&Do you agree or disagree with the following statements? People should read only those books that are about real events, real people, and established facts. Use specific reasons and details to support your opinions.
column3: <IN><TS>We can benefit from books in terms of valuable knowledge or new information. Some people claim that we should read only those books that are about real events, real people, and established facts. <TR>However</TR>, <TR>in my opinion</TR>, we should read various kinds of books as well as the ones based on real life because they provide us with a great amount of indirect experience and many kinds of emotion.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, there are a number of books stating crucial experience not based on real life.</MI1> <SI1><EX>For example, novels are totally the outcomes of writers' imagination</EX>. <TR>However</TR>, we could have a better understanding of how to buy a new house or what to prepare for visiting my grandparents. Although novels are somewhat fake, we can still catch some good point of the truth of life.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, some books contains many expressions to stimulate one's feeling.</MI2> <SI2>I strongly believe that a burst of one's mind is important because we frequently have no choice but to press those emotion in daily life. We sometimes feel sorrow, or happiness due to the characters of novel by reading it. We could get valuable assets that 'real books' might not provide from it</SI2></BO2>. <CO>To sum up, I disagree with the statement that people should read only those books about real life because we can obtain a number of indirect experience and promote many kinds of emotions from the books based on imaginary.</CO>
column23: This was an above average essay. The thesis could only have been improved by being clear as to which customs were being referenced. There were many great points and examples given.

column1: 996&a university plans to develop a new research center in your country. Some people want a center for business research. Other people want a center for research in agriculture. Which of these two kinds of research centers do you recommend for your country? Use specific reasons in your recommendation.
column3: <IN>When it comes to building a new research center, there might be two choices : a business research center and a agriculture research center. <TS><TR>In my opinion</TR>, a center for business research would be more helpful because it provides many opportunities to make money in modern society and prevents elites from outflowing.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>Firstly</TR>, a business research center would be more profitable than a agriculture research center.</MI1> <SI1>There are a great number of companies in the world, and even with a single contract with a foreign buyer, a entrepreneur could get good returns. <TR>However</TR>, agriculture is basically the industry based on man powers so that there are rarely such occasions to bring money into my country.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Secondly</TR>, we can prevent those who have superior degrees such as MBA, or Ph.D. from transfering to foreign countries by developing a new research center.</MI2> <SI2>Such competent people are high-quality and should be used to move the country to developed one. <TR>However</TR>, especially in my country, South Korea, they are usually recruited by foreign companies, once finishing their study. <TR>Moreover</TR>, some of them wishes not to come back to South Korea forever because of relatively low payment and long work time. <TR>Therefore</TR>, if a university develop a new business research center in my country, it would enhance the possibility of their staying in Korea.</SI2></BO2><CO><TR>In this manner</TR>, I strongly recommend that a new research center for business should be built in my country. With these facilities, my country could make a further step to reach a developed country.</CO>

column1: 997& Do you agree or disagree with the following statement? It is more important for students to study history and literature than it is for them to study science and mathematics. Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.
column3: <IN>Some people think that science and mathematics can be helpful more to students than history and literature: other people think that history and literature is more important. <TS><TR>In my case</TR>, I believe that history and literature is much beneficial to students. <TR>Because</TR>, history give a good model and information for future and literature give creativeness, imagination, and hope.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, history is ancient life.</MI1> <SI1>The ancient life reflect the present¡¯s life and future. We can learn good instructions by studying history. <TR>Moreover</TR>, we can predict events which will produce in the future. <TR>To illustrate</TR>, in Korea, there was an event that the Sampoong department store was destroyed by weak construction before 7years ago. <TR>These days</TR>, people have precaution and build strongly the buildings. <TR>As seen above</TR>, by studying history we can learn ancient life and live well in the future.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, literature enriches our creativeness and imagination.</MI2> <SI2><TR>By reading books</TR>, children would create special thinking and furthermore, <TR>in the future</TR> they will be able to make the invention, in art they will draw particular drawings and express high musical inspiration in music.<EX>For example, Sarah chang who is a popular young violinist said that she express feeling thinking her old writing during playing Chaconne.</EX></SI2></BO2><CO>In conclusion, science and mathematics can develop and enrich our society. <TR>However</TR>, I think history and literature is more important to students for instructions , creativeness and hope.</CO>

column1: 998&When people move to another country, some of them decide to follow the customs of the new country. Others prefer to keep their own customs. Compare these two choices. Which one do you prefer? Support your answer with specific details.
column3: <IN><TS>America is the nation of immigrants. When immigrants move from their own country to the U.S., they face two choices between following the customs of the new country and keeping their own customs. I prefer following the customs of the U.S. to adjust the new country well.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, to adjust new customs is related to learn language.</MI1> <SI1><EX>For example, the first generation of immigrants to the U.S. tends to work hard to support their children and does not have the opportunity to learn the custom of the U.S</EX>. Even if they have college degree in their country, they cannot get jobs which require high language skill.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>Second</TR>, to learn new customs give immigrants opportunity making new friends.</MI2> <SI2>When immigrants move from their country, they lose many relations with relatives, friends, and neighbors. They feel lonely, but it is hard to make new friends with knowing new customs.</SI2></BO2><BO3><MI3><TR>Last</TR>, to follow new customs can unify the immigrant family.</MI3> <SI3>The second generation of migrants could have hardships because of their identity. <TR>Through schooling</TR>, they become the citizen of America. <TR>However</TR>, their parents, the first generation of immigrants, want for their children to have the identity of their own country. <TR>In this situation</TR>, the family cannot communicate each other.</SI3></BO3><CO>I think learning new customs is helpful to learn new language, to make friends, and to unify the family. I suggest following new customs to the first generation parents specially.</CO>
column23: This is a below average quality essay. The thesis is fairly weak and doesn't include a preview of all the points that should included. The points, however, do have some continuity and final conclusion.

column1: 999&Some people like doing work by hand. Others prefer using machines. Which do you prefer? Use specifc reasons and examples to support your answer.
column3: <IN>Some people would like to do work by hand; other people want to do work by using machines.<TS><TR> If I can choose</TR>, I prefer doing work with machines. <TR>Becuase</TR>, by using machines, people can save time and effort and doing work with machines is more efficient.</TS></IN><BO1><MI1><TR>First of all</TR>, machines can help to save the time and effort.</MI1><SI1> Machines produce many same kind of products. Therefore, people don't need to effort and waste the time. <EX>For example, copy machines make hundreds of paper</EX>. If we write a lot of paper by hand, we would waste enormous time and effort. <TR>So</TR>, doing work with machines is better.</SI1></BO1><BO2><MI2><TR>In addition</TR>, using machines is more efficient than doing work by hand.</MI2> <SI2><TR>To illustrate</TR>, in construction place, it is far more helpful that using digging car is used than some people dig the hole or land. <TR>Furthermore</TR>, bank machines make us save my account money easily. <TR>As seen above</TR>, I prefer to exploit machines when I do work.</SI2></BO2><CO>In conclusion, when people work, they use various ways. <TR>Personally</TR>, I will use machines because I don't want to waste enormous time and effort and I want to work in efficient work environment.</CO>
